reviews.review: A stop over to remember. . Last year whilst in Dubai we went to the Burj for dinner, this years when visiting we decided to stop at the Berj.We were expecting luxury but we were actually blown away.Amazing suite, staff so well trained.The sun deck had just opened, this addition to the hotel is truly perfect.A great hotel ( you would expect that ) but service and staff were out of this world. Thank you

An amazing date.. We made a reservation a day before, to visit two of the 10 restaurants and bars of the Burj Al ArabThe BAB AL YAM is amazing for a breakfast it has the most amazing view, is an international buffet. The GOLD ON 27 is a bar in the 27 floor you can get a table close to the window and see the whole city, is very private.Be aware that you can only enter to the Burj Al Arab with a restaurant reservation or to have a room reservation.You can not enter with shorts or flip flops.And prepare to be amaze with the structure, the restaurants and the luxury of the hotel.

Sail Of A Ship. Burj Al Arab stands on an artificial island 280 m (920 ft) from Jumeirah beach and is connected to the mainland by a private curving bridge. The shape of the structure is designed to mimic the sail of a ship. It has a helipad near the roof at a height of 210 m (689 ft) above ground. This extraordinary investment in state-of-the-art construction technology stretches the limits of the ambitious urban imagination in an exercise that is largely due to the power of excessive wealth. Both the hotel and the city, after all, are monuments to the triumph of money over practicality. Both elevate style over substance. Emulating the quality of palatial interiors, in an expression of wealth for the mainstream, a theater of opulence is created in Burj Al Arab … The result is a baroque effect. The hotel is managed by the Jumeirah Group. Despite its size, Burj Al Arab holds only 28 double-story floors which accommodate 202 bedroom suites. The smallest suite occupies an area of 169 m2 (1,820 sq ft), the largest covers 780 m2 (8,400 sq ft). Suites feature design details that juxtapose east and west. White columns show great influence. Bathrooms are accented by mosaic tile patterns. The Royal Suite, billed at US$24,000 per night, is listed at number 12 on World's 15 most expensive hotel suites compiled by CNN Go in 2012.
Still the best. During my last visit in Dubai I visit this unbelievable hotel...oppulence,style,design...a place for billionare...
Brilliant. We walked along the beach near this spectacular building.Definitely worth going for a drive nearby so you can have a close look

Birthday celebration afternoon tea. I booked afternoon tea for myself and a friend to celebrate my 60th birthday celebration. We felt really spoiled by the attentive and friendly staff. The views from the 27th floor were amazing. Definitely a must if you want to celebrate a special occasion in Dubai.
Burj Al Arab. Only those having a reservation at the hotel are allowed on the property (guarded gate). That was disappointing, but it is beautiful to see.

Afternoon Tea . We booked for the afternoon tea for our honeymoon and we definitely were not disappointed!First of all just going into the Burj Al Arab is an experience in its self, it's absolutely beautiful inside (I wish we had booked for dinner too now aswell!).It's definitely not cheap, it's probably going to be the most expensive afternoon tea we will ever have but for a special occasion it's definitely worth it.The views from the Sky Lounge (and even the lift!) are brilliant, we were really lucky to have a table by the windows.Our waiter was very attentive and talked us through each course.You have a glass of Champagne to start (you have to pay for more), tea and coffee are unlimited.I had a gluten free afternoon tea and my husband had a normal one.I was a bit worried as to wether I'd be spending all that money for mine to be really different but I have to say everything apart from a few of the cakes were exactly the same which was great. We ended up staying for about 2 and a half hours, the time really did fly. We stayed for a little longer taking pictures of the amazing view too.Overall it's a really good experience and I'd recommend it to anyone going to celebrate an occasion.

You should see it. its nice place but you can't enter there if you don't have reservation and of course its cost lot of money around 125$ for one tea and to go up so be careful take photos from the sea and from the entrance its enough believe me .
Great hotel. . We had a fun hour in the bar at the deck. Views amazing and staff were lovely. We drank champagne and had laughs. Really worth a visit.

Luxury !. Actually burj al arab is one of the words luxurious places and if you want to stay there, it's expensive but very effective and extremely nice...If you want to see just inside of burj, then you should manage from your hotel concierge desk or reception for booking...You can choose afternoon tea or lunch or breakfast to go inside and see this luxurious and beautiful tower...
Fabulous treat. I was lucky enough to be treated to afternoon tea here, as a birthday present. Wonderful experience and views.... the food was excellent....no complaints!

Drinks at Burj Al Arab. The only way to see the inside of Burj Al Arab is to stay there or to have reservations for drinks or dinner. The inside is impressive and worth a look, and the view from the Skyview Bar on the 27th floor is stunning.

A WOW location. I knew that you cant just walk into this iconic seven star hotel to see it unless you are staying there or eating there. So I was satisfied with just parking beside it to take a picture. I had seen TV shows of how it was built.Then we met someone who worked there just by chance. She took us on a complete tour of the Burj. It was outstanding. I was amazed by the opulence and the architecture. It was really a treat!

High tea at the sky view bar, totally worth it!. We went for high tea at the sky view bar, on friends' recommendation.It is expensive with a capital E, but totally worth it. The view from the glass windows is totally worth it and the food is awesome!The prepare dishes according to your food habits, vegetarian, allergies and such. There is a welcome drink followed by a multi-course spread. Just coz its high tea, dont think you would go hungry, single servings of the food was enough to keep us more than full.There was a lady playing on the harp, live all the time. Great music, brilliant views and great food!Overall, it was an amazing place, one of the highlights of our Dubai trip.
Love it. I love the place a lot. It's really amazing. wonderful experience but a bit pricey. Defiantly will visit again. Thanks a lot for the memorable day in Dubai.

Wow, Amazing hotel. Visited Burj Al Arab, before going inside you will need to book a reservation in any restaurant if you are not staying in the hotel. The security is really good as you will get checked twice before entering. Casual smart dress. The building is beautiful and the location is amazing. If you are interested in architecture/civil engineering then this is the place you need to visit and see the amazing work and details inside.
Honeymoon. This hotel lives up to every expectation... staff very friendly.. and food is delicious!! Add this to blazing sunshine and it's a holiday you are not going to forget!!

Stunning architecture . This building is just a wonderful thing to look at. At sunset it glistens and shines. A beatification of what man can achieve in this modern world. Not cheap to stay at or have a drink at but worth it. If you are strapped for cash then go to the local water park and see it from there while on the slide!

B-day lunch!. Absolutely nice! Breathtaking view! Excellent service from the time we step in... We had lunch at the Bab Al Yam and our server name was Mano... He was great!! His Customer Service is amazing! And I noticed while he was serving others that he had the same attention!! Valuable employee!!! Again... Everyone else I dealt with!!! It was my husband's b-day so the cake and the candle was the cherry to the ice cream!!! Thanks to you we take a memorable afternoon in Dubai!!!

Tea at Burj Al Arab. Wonderful experience, a bit pricey but worth every cent. Excellent assortment of food, tea, coffee. There was no chocolate served and when I mentioned it, a piece of chocolate cake appeared. Zen our waiter was incredible, maybe the best I have ever had. Our view was incredible - get there early as they seat you upon arrival order. Incredible experience and one of the few ways to enter this spectacular 7 star hotel without a reservation!

Amazing Birthday Afternoon Tea. We booked to go to the Afternoon Tea for my birthday and we weren't disappointed. This is by no means a "cheap" afternoon tea, but what do you expect when you're in a 7* hotel!The service was amazing, greeted by my name and never left alone until we were seated.The waiters couldn't do enough to help us out. I do not eat fish, so they were ever so careful to ensure that I had my own plate of sandwiches which hadn't been near or touched any of the fish sandwiches.The best afternoon tea, no-one could do enough to help us, bringing out more sandwiches, taking photos for us. There is nothing to fault. It's just very expensive!!

Magnificent Place. Absolutely magnificent. The level of service offered by the staff here is truly amazing, you can understand why this is a 7 star hotel. Each staff member makes you feel loved and welcomed, no one is pushy and they treat you with respect and put your every need first. If there's something they can't do then they are very apologetic and not arrogant. Amazing experience in an iconic building.

Dubai2016-September. Burj Al Arab better view from the beach during the day time for pictures. Inside was ok, not as grand and open. Must have reservation to get inside or even on the property.The bars are best for daytime to see the city. At night all you see are lights.Had to take a taxi due to no close by metro and a lot of traffic.We booked on line for dinner at Bab Al Yam and it was nice selection buffet. It was not busy on a Tuesday night. It's on the ground floor and we were able to walk the ground in the back and it was nice seeing the sun set.
Looking amazing from the outside. This hotel can be seen while on the Dubai city tour. One of the tallest free standing hotels in the world.

Amazing . We could only see the Burj Al Arab from a distance but wow it was worth it. Just to see this spectacular building was such a wonderful experience. Really interesting tour to find out the amazing facts about this place well worth a look at the souk also and the beautiful water ways just outside

Good and expensive but nice view . Viewing us free, eating there is for rich people, 7* is already crazy thing but some people like, I prefer to spend the money in other things, but the view and architecture is impressive

AfternoonTea. This is a afternoontea I would do only once as a extra special treat, it was refined as youd expect, my only problem was after reading the do's and donts we dressed as it requested, but while sitting there you realise there was no need to be uncomfortable and stuffy in dressy clothes.The service is great, the food was great the place is amazing

Afternoon tea. Fantastic afternoon taking afternoon tea at the Burj. Wasn't sure what to expect, hotel is welcoming and friendly, 7 course afternoon tea was fantastic, views of city, gulf and The Palm depending where you sit, however free to wander and take in the different views from different areas. Get there early, gaze in awe, take loads of photo's and see how the other half live, forget the cost....enjoy the experience.
sail away. must be a guest...or dining to gain access. so, call ahead, order something...and go right on in. great photo ops.

Burj. I could see this from my Apartment. Great views. It changes colour at night. Perfect picture opportunities.
I did not go directly to Burj as I already have previously visited it several times.

Identity of Dubai. I saw this building from beach take pics and enjoy the architecture. its a must visit place. If you cant afford to go inside like me, than go to Jumeirah public beach and you will have burj next to your shoulder.
Quick View.. We saw the Burj Al Arab as we were passing on the metro and some great views of the hotel looked alot bigger than I had imagined.

A must see. Such an opulent hotel. We booked for cocktails with a minimum spend of around £70 per head. Cocktails were around £25 - £30 each. Fantastic views and we weren't rushed to leave despite our 2hr time slot. Loved it! Treated like VIPs by all the staff.
Huge. Only saw this from the beach , looks amazing place , but would of thought grounds would of been bigger , iconic building , but Dubai likes to do everything bigger and better

One word: FANCY. This was the highlight of our stay as we had the sky tea for AED620 pp which is around USD168. It's worth it and just do it once! There's so much food and we didn't even have dinner afterwards. Enjoy!

Afternoon tea - fabulous . Had a wonderful afternoon tea in the sky bar, nothing to fault. Service was great, food was amazing. Book for 4pm and you can watch the sunset.
Expensive but wonderful for a special occasion

Aftrenoon Tea at Burj Al Arab. As a treat my wife and I went for afternoon tea at the Burj. What an experience it was. Spectacular views overlooking the Palm watching the sunset. The food was amazing with seven courses, started off with a glass of Champagne. A very memorable, one off experience. The cost is high but it's a once in a lifetime experience so why not.
NICE PLACE TO SEE.. its located at the beach and there is a club 360 near by this location. Must see. I saw this by hiring a yacht.
Mesmerizing View!. The title says it all, it is surely mesmerizing! with a price! Everything is amazing from the seascapes to the ambience inside the hotel.

Unique. Is its architecture, so is the service at all kinds of facilities.It's fountains between ground and 1st floor immitate jumping fish following a typical Arabic Rhythm of music.It is highly recommended for non residents to visit the lobby at 1st floor at tea time: life music with excellent musicians performing Classical Arabic music apart of other classical pieces while you will be served in a very stylish way.

Must see. The Burj Al Arab beauty and location stand out by themselves. Incredible hotel. I understand each floor (27-28) are suites. You can take pictures from the beach next door. To go in you will need reservations for hotel, bar (top floor) or restaurant, but it is worth it to see this place on the inside.

The best Dubai has to offer !. Incredible hotel with everything and more that you could ever want.The detail in everything is incredible from the lobby, the bars, the rooms and restaurants just blow your mind.You won't want to leave!

Deserves to be called the best hotel. The first time I stayed in Dubai, we stayed here some days, it was an amazing experience, everything is over the top to be honest! The rooms were extremely spacious, luxurious, well equipped, nicely designed and some of the best furniture designs. The service was perfect! Staff was unbelievably friendly, and all the facilities were perfect. However, through being so perfect, it gets a touch of not being very cosy and homy, since you will have to adapt to this environment constantly while there, so dressing and behaving appropriately, which is for some people not what they are looking for on vacation, since some people want to relax during that time. But it is definitely one of the best hotels ever.

Sever Star Delight. This is a very interesting hotel. From nighttime it rotates through different attractive colors dazzling you on the inside. From the inside, you've got tanks, and fountains and stores and more! Truly a star experience. You have to have a reservation for a restaurant or a room to enter, so be mindful. I ate at the AL Muntaha restaurant. Honestly, I wasn't impressed with the food to understand why its rates seven stars. I was more impressed that I felt like I was in the Matrix going to see the Merovingian. All I needed was Neo, Trinity and Morpheus. loll

Best food I have ever eaten! . My husband took me to the Burj al Arab for my 30th birthday & we did the Culinary Flight Experience which was a course in 4 different restaurants in the hotel. The food was absolutely outstanding & without a doubt the best meal either of us have ever eaten! The staff were so courteous, kind & welcoming. We even had a chef come out & talk to us about the meal he has cooked. The staff also presented me with a birthday card, cake & flowers! It was truly a magical experience! Thank you so much to everyone who made our evening so special! Very expensive, but totally worth it!
Amazing Hotel. what a hotel this is a must to visit we had lunch here and it was just amazing the staff were so nice and helpful I would return and do lunch again if I come back

Dress code, and tour booking must be made!!. You can not enter with shorts on, even if it is below your knees. Long pants only. You cannot enter to see the beauty unless booked into a time slot. Not impressed, as I drove all the way over there from my hotel to not be able to get in! Beautiful from the outside gates.
Second in Dubai now!. Now after Khalifah, this is the second one, but still people go to visit. you can go around it and take nice pictures.

Awesome and unforgetable. This was my best daycation experience i've ever had.I was with my family, we were having a daycation at the newly opened "The Terrace"which has an infinity pool, jacuzzi and pool bar.We really enjoyed a lot.

Height of Kitch . I stayed here for 2 nights as part of a company function. Oh! My word! Each room has its owns butler. The 200sqm double story room was insane. Full complimentary bar, great 'study'/office. The mirror in the ceiling above the king size bed ensured that my hair style remained perfect the entire night. The upstairs bathroom with sunken tub and a full top of the range perfume each day was unbelievable. Look the hotel is gaudy and over the top in typical UAE style but if u are looking for something really different this is it!

Wonders of Dubai. One of the few 7 star hotels in the world . You experience starts as soon as you turn into the bridge connecting land to this beauty.Have an evening Tea at the top floor restaurant and enjoy the sunset
Wonderful. This place is amazing, as soon as you walk through the doors, the fountains, restaurants the aquariums, it was just an amazing experience.

Good place to take some pictures. We didn't went to the hotel itself (since i am not a Russian billionaire to pay for it :) ), but the souq nearby. But from there you can walk to the building, and it is a good opportunity to take interesting pictures.
wonder of Dubai. Wonderful place and hotel. It is 7 star and all first class facilities are available. Lifts are very fast there and top view of building is really fabulous.
Amazing hotel . What more is there to say about BAA that hasn't been said already. Service is amazing, you have your own butler(!), rooms are huge and well stacked with gizmos.

Wonder of Dubai. We have stayed at a local hotel but visited to the Burj Al Arab. For visit you need to book and get a voucher from your own hotel. Well its worth though. The interior of the hotel is spectacular with outlets inside having the view of fishes under water. The lift is fast and takes you to the 23 floor where you can find superb bar. Although we went at evening for cup of coffee it was worthy to have such a wonderful experience.And ofcousre the views inside the hotel are amazing and beautifully carfted.

Luxury and beauty. I was fortunate enough to spend one night at the one and only 7 star hotel Burj Al Arab. Me and my wife were celebrating our 2nd wedding anniversary and it was great. From the welcome we received to the amenities in the room to the smooth service. Only one comment i have is the service at the breakfast in the restaurant overlooking the pool and beach club. We have asked for some fruits to be sent to our room and we never received them.

Best hotel ever!! . If you like luxury, this is the place to be at; they have an excellently customer service, their restaurants are great!. This hotel is expensive but it is worth every penny, as a guest they give you access to the private beach, and also the water park, they also provide you transportation to the park and the beach.

Afternoon tea at the Skyview bar . Absolutely stunning from start to finish. The price is a lot but where else are you going to get an amazing 7 course afternoon tea, served impeccably by the most attentive waiting staff I've ever encountered whilst looking out at one of the most spectacular views in the world. Well worth a trip and another thing ticked off the old bucket list.

Ohhhh!. I was there for business event and the place looks fabulous!! It's not open fr just visitors unless you stay there or book a table at the restaurant!! Ofcourse it is expensive!!! Hotel interiors has some strong use of colors and use of gold ! SkyView bar offers super view of palm and marina! It's worth visiting!! New Terrace is open now!

Wonderful Cocktails. We were staying at a local hotel but went to the Burg Al Arab for a visit, Care; you have to book or get a voucher from your own hotel. Well worth it though. The interior is spectacular. The super fast lift takes you to the 23 floor when you are met by a superb bar. We went in the afternoon & could have had a 7 course afternoon tea but at £230 each decided just to have cocktails. The bar tender was fabulous & advised us a number of different drinks which he skilfully delivered. And of cousre the views are amazing.

Afternoon tea. Visited here for afternoon tea and wow what an experience the world's only 7 star hotel and it is certainly impressive. The glass floor and piano with a breathtaking views of the world and palm in the distance amazing. The afternoon tea was fantastic too certainly would recommend this but it's not cheap......
Jumeirah is a must see. The whole place / jumeirah is a must see in Dubai, with really nice houses, a nice Burj Al Arab skuscraper and a beautiful beach

Best Afternoon Tea. This place is WOW!! The view is amazing and the hotel and sky lounge very opulent and has a very unique style and decor.Everyone is very very friendly and make you feel welcome, our server was great and made us feel very relaxed and at ease!We had afternoon tea in the amazing sky bar and it was a 7 course feast, we couldn't eat everything and left stuffed! Food was soooo good and presented immaculately.Really recommend this experience if you enjoy afternoon tea and want to experience 7 star dining in an amazing setting. Expensive but worth every penny!!

Beautiful 7 star hotel of the world. The only 7star hotel in the world & it does live upto its expectations. If you are visiting Dubai, do pre book your breakfast or other meal options as per your budget. It is an expensive fare to enjoy a meal. one cannot simply venture inside the hotel to see it. Even the lifts and all the interiors are quite grand and beautiful.

Beautiful!. My boyfriend and I visited for afternoon tea and a private tour. The experience was truly amazing with spectacular views. The afternoon tea included unlimited tea along with 7 courses- 7 star indeed. The tour consisted of the suites and facilities. All amazing. I would definitely recommend the tea just to get a glimpse of this great hotel.

Spectacular Views for high tea ☕️🍰🍸. We went here for afternoon high tea... It was slightly over priced but the views made up for it! The food was delicious and they kept bringing extras round.. Free of charge which was a bonus... The hotel in general looked quite tacky inside considering.. Definitely worth a visit though

Worth It.. We booked afternoon tea here as we were celebrating our 30th Wedding Anniversary.We booked directly with the hotel (620 AED) and this was cheaper than through a tour company.We were able to wander through the main part of the hotel, taking photos before making our way to the reception area. All staff were so friendly and made us feel welcome.Tariq was great! He looked after us very well, explained all the different food we were presented and made our experience a memorable occasion. Tariq asked if we were there for a special occasion, and when he found out we were, he organised a beautiful red rose and cake to mark the occasion. Made us feel special.We thoroughly enjoyed our experience here and would definitely recommend this to anyone who visits Dubai.

Only saw it from a distance. Didn't realise you couldn't go anywhere near this if you don't pay. You will need to book your tour beforehand by calling or online. It looked impressive from the "open beach" area which is the only free beach access.

The only 7star in the world, a must to visit landmark hotel in Dubai. The only 7* star iconic hotel in the world wherein offering luxurios experience -a must to visit in UAE. Hospitality is true to its luxurios name as well. Thus, the place will bring you to a whole new level of superb experience, and leave an everlasting memory with you. So worth to visit!

Stay for the view....Amazing!. Went for Afternoon tea but mesmerized with the beautiful View of this gorgeous. Service is ok not much to say but prefer to sit there just for the view.
Simply Amazing Views and the decor is really nice too.

7 stars delight . Went for afternoon tea , the only way to get into the burj if you not a resident is to book a meal . Otherwise you won't get through security .Breathtaking as always starting with fresh dates as you arrive after you valet park your car , shame they didn't bring back one of the courtesy rolls royces in place of my rental car !Afternoon tea was perfect , fantastic selection of tea to go with your sandwiches and champers of course . You can't fail to be impressed with everything about the burjMind take the lift to the sky bar for a look over palm island and also view the worlds most expensive cocktail . Pleased to say as a Scotsman the ice is maid with Scottish water !!! Never mind the whisky !! If u are in Dubai book your self in here , it's a must to do on your bucket list
Total luxury. We went here for drinks and it was amazing, luxury from top t bottom with great staff. Good variety of drinks but a little expensive.

Amazing Experience. Super expensive but worth the experience. The view is absolutely gorgeous. I went to Gold on 27 bar. Definitely worth a view. Its a bit Highly priced but great hospitality and amenities.

Unparalleled luxury. I've heard about and seen many photos of the Burj Al Arab, but I had to go and see for myself what a 7-Star hotel is. I had a personal tour by Aubrey Flores from the event sales team (she's great) and all I can say is Wow! The attention to detail is amazing, the decor is opulent, yet warm. The suites are amazing (and that doesn't do them justice).They seem to have thought of everything, yet they keep thinking of more. The new deck out back and fresh and salt water pools are great (it was a little too hot for me still being the summer, but I'll be back when it's cooler).

Opulence Hotel. One of the best and unique Hotel to experience their entire hospitality, amenities, delicious food and obviously interior and outer surroundings, the total ambience was so very pleasant to conserve for lifetime memorabilia and get lucky to visit again and again perhapsMy personal impression was that this unique hotel was only for rich and famous but was wrong as we were treated extremely respectable that we felt that we are one of the top notchesSo on all above we will recommend to our world to experience this finest 7 Star HotelWe are thanking the entire staff for their courteous hospitality and wishing them our kindest wishes and God Bless
Amazing !!!!!. Don't have words to write.. need to be there to feel it .. Highly recommended for everyone to be there at least once ..

Staff are amazingly wonderful . Loved every second because of the amazing staff who my toddler loved too :) Sad to see how some of the other guests were treating the staff- seriously, money really doesn't buy manners. Thank you for our beautiful experience and I hope guests are penalised for abusing staff.

Disappointed . You can't get anywhere near here to take any decent photos.Not even a beach near by you can walk along to take photos. We originally booked a meal here but cancelled when it came to a small fortune (ie another holiday)Very overrated!!

Sadly disappointed. Booked a birthday dinner treat for my wife at the Al Matanha restaurant. We had been to the bar before but not to eat. The bar is great and has a good buzz.The restaurant food and service was more 3 star than the supposed 7!We were brought to our table from the bar and had to wait for over 10 + minutes for any one to come and take a drinks order. The wine took a further 20 minutes to arrive and we had both finished our starters. I as told that they had run out of the wine in their restaurant store and had to go elsewhere to get a bottle. The menu was limited in choice but had some interesting dishes. I chose Alaskan crab for my appetiser and a veal dish with sweetbreads and pate de foi gras. The appetiser was just three mouthfuls and totally tasteless. If I was doing a blind tasting I would have had no awareness of what I was eating. My wife had pate de foi gras and it was acceptable but nothing like the taste and quality of the STAY restaurant in the One&Only Palm hotel.When the waitress came to take my plate she asked if all was OK (nobody has asked whilst i was eating) I said that the meal was tasteless and asked this to be made know to the kitchen. No one came to discuss with me and the service from then on was decidedly cool. My main course of veal was dry and if there were sweetbreads and pate with the dish I did not recognise of taste them. Again i said I was very disappointed and again nobody cam to discuss this with me.We did not order dessert but the restaurant, who had been advised of my wife's birthday,' did present her with a nice cake which ws a nice touch but by then we just wanted to leave as our expectations had been so much higher.The cost, including two cocktails and a modest bottle of wine came to a £597.00 which, considering the poor quality of the food and service, was excessive.Need less to say we won't be returning and I think that is why the service is so poor. As so many visitors who come to Dubai want to visit and try this iconic hotel, they can behave like this as most people will only go once anyway.My advice is OK, go to the bar and enjoy the view and the opulence of the hotels interior but not having a meal and save your money to go elsewhere.

Worth The money. We had the high tea option at the sky bar, and overall, it was worth the money for the experience. The hotel is amazing, the service from the staff was fantastic. The finger food was just OK, I would say too much sweet stuff, and as much tea and coffee as required, we also had 2 glasses of nice champagne each as it was my birthday, they also give me a surprise small chocolate birthday cake which was a nice surprise. IMO, worth it for the amazing views, and because of the time, we witnessed the sun setting. I would recommend as a one off experience

Clear water and nice view. One of the best things I enjoy in my Duabi Tour is staying in the open beach of Burj Al Arab. Plenty of people swimming with bikinis and trunks. Really open beach. And I enjoy feeling under the sun with very nice view. Surely I come back here.Cheers!
Great !!!!. Great to be in seven star Hotel !! nice service . Great Beach with clear water near by !!!Better to have dinner to enjoy full !!!

Iconic tower with lots of engineering. If you know what all challenges engineers had building it probably you will enjoy this more Overall its a beautiful building with remarkable architecture. You must visit this place to observe engineering wonders.
Iconic. Burj Al Arab is a must see for all type of visitors. The building has facilitated a great start up of attraction for Dubai as a destination

Opulence at it's Finest. The only way to see the world’s only seven star hotel, the Burj Al Arab, is to book something there. Security will not allow you to access anywhere on property without verifying that you actually have a reason to be there. If you insist on going inside the hotel and are not afraid to spend a pretty penny, book high-tea, business lunch, or dinner. Be sure to check about the dress code because they won’t hesitate to call you out and turn you away if you are not dressed properly. I have experienced the business lunch in Al Muntaha and recommend only booked dining options there (high-tea is in the same area) as you are up on the 27th floor with unparalleled views of Dubai.
Burj Al Arab holiday September 2016.. We had the most wonderful time. The staff are so nice and attentive. The new terrace decking is a great addition.

Only 7 star hotel in the world. Another attraction that you just cannot miss. The hotel is simply stunning from an aesthetic point of view and rated one of the best in the world from a service point of view.
Great experience. Had dinner here on a few occasions and taken lunch also. Staff are very friendly and attentive. Worth a visit just to see the fire and waterfall display at the front of the hotel.
nice views. very expensive but worth going if you've travelled from the other side of the world. Greta views of local buildings and then just desert. Better views from Empire State building though!

Beautiful beach, great view. Very popular tourist destination. Beach is beautifully kept. Soft sand, perfectly clear water. Has some changing rooms, bathrooms, and outside shower. Sellers with water, juice, and small food items available. Bring a towel!!! No chairs available.

Iconic. It's a nice hotel with beautiful and luxurious interiors . Loved the presidential suit with mirror ceiling. Food is just like any other hotel. Being an iconic landmark makes it a must visit ....at least for a photo in background which you can take from Kite beach if not inside :)
7 stars well deserved . Anniversary meal here then onto sky bar via glass lift. From start to finish service food surroundings amazing experience. Yes expensive but thoroughly worth it.

High tea. Beautiful hotel we were treated so well made us feel very special and so welcome.Sometimes in high star rated hotels staff can come across superior not here so professional and pleasant.Food was beautifully presented and of high quality the service was explained to us in detail.If you've never had high tea before do it in style at 7 star service.

Amazing Service. Luxury hotel. I stayed for 3 nights I absolutely love it, it's a real luxury hotel, the staff are very helpful, I would like to thank all the butlers for the hospitality(Deo,Raymond,gauran), and the room attendant Chirag he also very very helpful. Everything has been great and fantastic. Thank for making my stay comfortable

Tea for two . I booked afternoon tea at the Burj al Arab and a week to Dubai as a surprise for my wife's 50th birthday. We have been to Dubai on holiday on 3 previous occasions in the last few years and always said we would treat ourselves to this, but never got round to it. The entire occasion from the initial security check to being met at the entrance and shown to the Skyview bar was first class. This isn't a cheap event but the attention to detail is the best I have experienced. Our waiter was very entertaining and extremely professional. The views of Dubai are extraordinary. The inside of the hotel surpass any pictures or tv images. If you fancy being treated like royalty for an afternoon, book this, you won't be disappointed.

Exquisite . Well this was the most amazing experience ever right from the moment you entered the door to leaving . The service impeccable the food divine and the views stunning. We were there for high tea and our waitress was just so lovely

Birthday celebrations. My friends took me to one of the restaurants within burj al Arab for my birthday. Unfortunately can't remember the name. We also went for drinks after dinner. The good was fabulous, as well as the drinks. The vibe is obviously luxurious and we made sure to dress to impress. Definitely recommended.
Beautiful view. Very cool nice place and the hotel on the other side of the ocean. It's a nice place for swimming with so many people who come for a tour.

Luxury personified!. Burj Al Arab is a luxurious, opulent hotel, and is a must for any visitor to Dubai. The exterior looks like a ship's sail. Visitors can't simply enter the hotel without an booking. If one lands up without a booking, from the security gate one has to make a reservation for the lounge, which has a cover charge that comes to about USD 100. Within this amount, one can order whatever snacks or drinks one wants at the lounge. Expensive, yes, but it's worth the experience to see the loud, colouful, opulent interior. The hotel also has a helipad at the top and an underwater restaurant but those are only accessible to hotel guests.

Burj Al Arab. The new Gold27 bar on the 27th floor is a must before enjoying a dinner at any of the restaurants within the hotel. Make sure come in from the front of the hotel to enjoy the opulence of the lobby. Don't miss the new pool deck. This is another major engineering accomplishment.

Wow!!!. Booked afternoon tea in the Burj. Now it is very, very expensive, but definitely worth it. From the minute you enter the lobby it is like a different world. The food, service, atmosphere and decor was fantastic and this was the highlight of our time in Dubai.

Went for Breakfast. This place is very very expensive for non-Dubai residents. Food and presentation was great, choices are plenty, service was awesome. Obviously there were only 4 other people other than us.

A 7 star experience for a 7 star hotel! . We booked to have afternoon tea at 4.15 at a cost of around £120 per person. It was worth every penny! The food was amazing and we were stuffed, we couldn't eat all the cakes provided in the end. Tea and coffee were plentiful, and there was a huge range to choose from. They were all included and kept coming! We were served a glass of champagne to start, followed by a parfait, a tart, a sorbet, then a huge tray of sandwiches, then a huge tray of cakes! Everything was amazing. The staff were brilliant and nothing was too much trouble. I would recommend going early to have a look round the lobby area which is stunning. The time we went was great because it allowed us to see the sun setting, and it was no problem for us to stay for a cocktail so we were there into the early evening. The cocktails were also fabulous! The staff encouraged you to take photos, and even took some for us. We truly felt special, what a wonderful afternoon and evening, I never wanted it to end! Thank you so much!
Just take photos from far away. to enter this hotel you need to book a place in their luxurious restaurant or else you have to be happy by just take photos from the beach in a distance

Nice view icon of dubai. Visited this place as this place is on of dubai iconic place. The beach is good, children can play at the beach. Water was blue. Really nice beach. Only the parking is very difficult to get in here. You should come early if you want to spent sometime in this place
Iconic. It is an iconic building nice for a memory photo but nothing really to see or to do other them having food inside.
Over rated. For what is they charge I think it is overrated there is little or no ground around the hotel the reception is very average. The suits are quite nice but no better than some other hotels

"Sensational Experience". Visiting Dubai without visiting Burj Khalifa is not complete. Different experience altogether. Being in the middle of water with some breathtaking views of Dubai. Would suggest to have lunch and dinner in Muntaha Restaurant. Top up your visit by visiting Jumeira Beach Hotel, just next door.

You can do nice pictures. It's great outside, but according to this internet inside it's greater. You can make nice photos from the beach near it. To reach it you should: go right while looking at the hotel and turn left after the Jumeirah hotel territory ends. Then go straight and you'll reach the target.

Amazing!. This magnificent hotel is the evidence of initiative and enterprise! Built on reclaimed land from the sea and standing alongside its "wave-like" hotel we were amazed at ingenuity behind the investment! If you have the money - pay a visit inside!

A VERY HIGH TEA AT AL MUNTAHA. Al Muntaha is a very exclusive restaurant on top of this amazing building. You have to book in advance and very smart dress codes apply. To drive across the bridge you have to show your reservation details.Don't attempt to cross unless you have a reservation as there is a boom gate.The building with it's beautiful Italian tiled floors, Persian carpets , fountains and fish tanks is truly breathtaking. There is a wait after you check in as they assemble people booked for the 4 pm afternoon tea session. This is very boring as the heat coming through the glass is very intense and the air conditioning cannot cope. You then go into the lift in small groups up to the restaurant.Everything is six star service. the wait staff, food , drinks as well as the stunning view. it is a wonderful experience indeed. I have no idea what it costs as I was a guest, but I'm sure it's extremely expensive.The only criticism I have is the boring wait for the lift as we had arrived on time. perhaps they had a problem and didn't want people in the restaurant, but it seemed very odd.
Nice. We'd great time there for a high tea once and for the unbelievable brunch. You just can't afford missing the high tea there.

Love this place!!. Love this hotel and the new swimming pool deck is a fantastic addition. Not sure what it would be like at the height of the season but when we went in August (v.v.hot!) it was heaven! Almost had the pools to ourselves!!

Overrated. It is good - no question about it. Is it worth a visit? That's a question - honestly - I am not sure. It looks best from outside. We went for a brunch inside a couple of years back - not impressed. Go for bette ones and for Burj al Arab - take photos from Madinat Jumeirah or Shimmers instead.

Luxury. What a place, if your a pikey forget it. its way out of your league mate, stick to Wetherspoons! If you go up to the helideck on the top floor you can hire a magic carpet and fly to the moon. Better atmosphere on the moon!

Expensive but once in a lifetime - Al Muntaha. We ate at the Al Muntaha on the top floor. Beautiful views of Dubai, food is exceptional (but you would hope so for the price, £500 for two of us in total with only one alcoholic drink each). They have a piano player which really sets the mood in the restaurant. Staff are very professional and treat you like a VIP, if you can afford to treat yourself to the price of the menu then it's definitely worth a visit.
Beautiful. Beautiful from both the outside and inside, pure luxury, we dined at the under water restaurant, hugely over priced and the food was very average at best.

Breathtaking!. My wife and I spent the day for a mutli-course meal visiting the various restaurants.The views are spectacular! The food is superb! At the end of the day, my wife was presented with a beautiful bouquet of flowers. Highly recommended!
Another Engineering Feat. Another engineering and design feat. Unfortunate that due security, they would not allow us visitors inside, but all in all a wonderful sight!

Burj Al Arab is a symbol of Dubai. For long this beautiful hotel has been the picture that identifies with Dubai. Its overlooks the Arabian Ocean and is a tourist delight. one can book an afternoon tea in advance and visit.
Must visit place. The hotel can be seen from the Jumeirah beach and and the view is amazing with the sea in the background.

Worth the admission fee. Went to the Skyview bar, the cheapest way to access the hotel. Staff were friendly and helpful. Best time to make a reservation is 4:15 pm, you will catch the sun set at the end of afternoon tea. It's about $460 CAD for 2 people and you're provided a 5 course meal and all the beverages you can drink (tea, iced coffee, fresh fruit, soft drinks). The view, experience, food and drinks are worth the price of admission. Arrive 1/2 an hour early so you can take pictures of the lobby.

Visit to Royal Suite Burj Al Arab. Dreams do come true.. The Burj Al Arab is perfection. Thank you to Melanie Birsch and Louise Brodie for helping to make our daughter and sons dream come true. Luxury and attention to detail for ALL guests is the key at this hotel. We had the honour of visiting the Royal Suite and all I can say is please please please we want to return. The courtesy we were shown during our visit was delightful. We dined at Junsui , fantastic , mouthwatering delights. We felt like superstar or royalty on our visit and would recommend a stay here is a must when visiting Dubai . Looking forward to returning as soon as possible.

Afternoon tea. We visited here for afternoon tea as a birthday treat for me and also it's the only 7* hotel in the world!!It is expensive £250 for us both so no cheap meal! We arrived at the Burj by a free buggy from our hotel which was Jumeriah Beach hotel. You drive up to the entrance and are stopped to confirm why you are visiting so just make sure you have your booking to hand. Then you are greeted as soon as you walk in the door and directed where to go. In the entrance there are amazing water features so make sure you have time to stand and water the show. When you are waiting to go up to the sky bar you are stood waiting with everyone else that is having afternoon tea, you do feel a little like you are the poor relations as you aren't allowed to go elsewhere apart from that area.We were really lucky and had seats by the window which was awesome and a stunning view, we had a 4pm seating and would so recommend it as the sun setting is beautiful. We had champagne and I had a none alcoholic version which had 24c gold in it which was like an apple flavoured drink, very nice. Just be aware you have one glass free of them then you pay but you have unlimited tea and soft drinks. The meal was 7 courses and everyone gets it at the same time. We had a white chocolate mouse which was Devine followed by a ratatouille puffy pastry parcel, followed by sandwiches then sorbet, pastries and scones they where all AMAZING stunning food! The only down thing was I have a server allergy to raspberries and they left the cake with them on the plate so meant I couldn't eat most of them sadly.They did give me a rose and a cake for my birthday which was so lovely.Dress code my husband wore chinos, a Hugo boss polo top and boat shoes as its so hot heading there and he was probably one of the smartest so just in case you where struggling with a men's outfit.Enjoy every mouthful!!!

Dream-like Holidays. Burj al Arab offers such a great experience to its' guests, it is hard to descirbe it with words. Every guest is treated like a king. The building is even more impressive from near than from far. The newly opened terrace offers an infinity pool (sea-water) and even a beach with real sand. There is another pool with a poolbar. There are many lifeguards to make you feel safe. The staff is extremly friendly and helpful. We enjoyed using the club cars to go to Souk Madinat or Wild Wadi. The suites are just stunning! Special thanks to our butler, Mr. Anup, who had some great advice for us. He was always smiling, happy and helpful! He is absolutely professional and we were very happy with his service. In our opinion, Burj Al Arab is truly the best hotel in the world! We will come back.

If you can... you should. Went here for afternoon tea... not somethin I would usually do.. but it really is something special. If you can book in for the 4pm sitting, you can have sunset and cocktails overlooking the Palm.Yes it is expensive, £130 each for tea, sandwiches and cake... but if you look on it like a L'oreal moment.. because you're worth it.I would really recomend it, if you can afford it, if you can.. you should..even just once.
WoooW. I have been to this Icon, it's really amazing from inside, I was shocked to see all that in Dubai, it's really consider to be Dubai icon
Warning. Unless you have an existing reservation at the hotel or one of the restaurants in the Burj AL Arab, you would not be permitted access simply to site see.

To look at - never went inside, don't feel I need to. . Having seen the building in numerous photos I thought I'd done it. Fair to say I was wrong. It is an absolutely stunning building both day and night (when it has it's own light show). See it from the beach, it really is lovely. As regards going inside I'm totally not bothered. I'll spend my £33 over the road on two beers and a coke instead. (Happy hour obviously).

New Bar. Opulent hotel with tourists taking selfies as soon as they walk in the door. The new terrace is a great addition. Upstairs 27karat needs some more atmosphere. It's expensive and doesn't have a buzz to it.

A 7 Star Experience. We booked the afternoon tea experience as part or our honeymoon trip to Dubai and visited the Al Arab on the 21st August 2016. I make no exaggeration when I say the service, food and setting are all of a 7 star world class standard. We will truly remember this experience for the rest of our life and was the highlight of our 4 days in Dubai.My traveller tips would be to get there bang on time as they seat you right to left along the room and the tables to the far right afford the best view of Jumeirah to downtown Dubai. My other tip would be to dress smartly, a collared shirt and trousers with closed shoes is suitable for gents.You may think this experience is a bit pricey but it is truly worth it, it is a must visit whilst in Dubai!

Royal Treatment. Being inside Burj Al Arab is an amazing experience. Inside it´s luxuary taking to the next level. When you arrive, you are taken by a golf car to the entrance of the hotel where you are welcomed by employes who look like they came straight from a Arabian movie. Surrounding the outside entrance are many luxuary cars, including the hotel Rolls Royce white cars. When you enter the lobby, what you see just takes your breath away. The colours, the amazing decoration, luxuary, the aquariums are just unbelievable. Upstaires the lobby is breath taking and sorrounded by luxuary shops and a beautiful fountain. The elevator is another incredible experience as it is panoramic. The Skyview bar view is wonderful as well. Highly recomend this experience at least once in a lifetime.
Burj Al Arab. Burj Al Arab is a 7 star hotel. stunning view as the shape of the hotel is like an upside down ship. I like the Al Mahara restaurant.
Worth a Visit. Beautiful beach overlooking the Burj Al Arab hotel, the seven star hotel. Saw people surfing and swimming here. it's a great place to relax.
What a view!!. Another piece of wonderful modern architecture, I must say a jewel in palm. To fully enjoy the beauty of it see it from the other side, that is through a boat ride of Atlantic!!

Must visit. We had an amazing afternoon tea in the sky bar with my daughter and friends they made it so special for us food and drinks out this world defo worth a visit expensive but worth every penny

Old Fashioned . Yes it is grand, and over the top. However all the outlets are very old fashioned, the service is going down with the years (I have been going there a few times in the last 10years) and I wouldn't pay the price for a suite there as many more hotels offer a way more modern and luxurious feel for a less costly price in Dubai. Just not my type of hotel I guess.

great..beatifull. Been our first time in Dubai it was a MUST to see this espectacular building and elegance looking out the Arab ocean...The whole atmosphere is great and make you feel very especial.We enjoy fom the entrance to the restaurant were we celebrate my wife birthday.

Hotspot in Dubai. If you are going for the first time to Dubai and you want to visit and see how the Burj Al Arab looks like inside this is your opportunity to afford you an incredible tea time with a view over the Jumeriah Beach and the Skyline of Dubai.Important is to make a reservation via email and dont forget your dresscode !!! The staff is very polite and friendlyYou will enjoy a great view and a good atmosphere in one of the most expensive and outragous hotel around the world.The Tea Time has delicious canapés mini cakes , other kind of starters any kind of beverages and a well deserved Glas of Champagne to start this great view.So dont miss it and enjoy Dubai

Burj Friday Brunch. Fantastic!!!!!!!!!!Worth every Penny. 50th Birthday, they gave the table red roses and a cake.Food excellent would go back when ever I am in Dubai on a Friday. Brilliant experience
Once in a lifetime. Having high tea on the 27th floor is an amazing experience. So much food is bought out it is more like lunch. It is the extreme form of luxury you go for and get it.
Beautiful!!. On beautiful beach nice and clean. Stop to take nice pictures. If you are staying nearby or in bhuj al arab, you can enjoy even more.
Elegant Place. Most expensive, top of the line, goddy place. I am very impressed.It is very strict but its worth visiting this place.

Grand Style. Dinner with friends in the Al Iwan Restaurant. As you would expect - excellent service in grand surroundings. Exquisite table settings in this intimate restaurant. Our food on this occasion was buffet style - with a great selection, and well presented and cooked. A nice expensive treat - only once in a while maybe for me!

Burj Al Arab, still pretty. It's still worth it to go and catch a photo of the Burj Al Arab on Jumeira beach. It lies to the left of the Jumeira Beach Hotel, and to the right of the Jumeira Beach Hotel is a great beach. It's long, with white sand and quite clean. It's a big white sand beach where you can spend the morning or late afternoon swimming, and get a quick photo of the Burj Al Arab while you're there. From the Dubai Mall Metro Station, take bus 81 which stops right next to Jumeira Beach Hotel. Easy and affordable to get to it.

Legen...wait for it...dary. One of the reason i wanted to visit Dubai was to see Burj Khalifa and Burj Al Arab. Amazing development in the desert. Try visiting Jhumeira beach in the eveing, the view is mesmerizing.

Stunning. Expensive but truly worth it for the amazing experience. I would highly recommend it - the service (as you imagine) is perfect and there's plenty of food (6 courses) for an afternoon tea. I'm not sure I would go back, just because of the price, but I'm glad a went. Money well spent for the experience of a lifetime.

Spectacular Hotel. The hotel oozes class. The wealth you feel upon entering makes you automatically stand up and take notice.Me and my wife visited for Afternoon Tea on the 25th floor over looking the Palm. Although pricey at around £120 per person it was well worth the experience. Great selection of cakes, unlimited tea's / coffee's and service was spot on.

Still brill. We visited for a family meal and did not stay any nights.The hotel is on its own island and very exclusive. The security guards were very efficient and whisked us through the car barriers once we confirmed our name. The staff were very welcoming and polite. The hotel itself is still amazing although it's 17 years since it first opened. Parts of the hotel are being updated so I'm sure it will continue to be one of the premier 'must visit' places in Dubai.

Lunch was amazing . We had lunch at the Burj Al Arab during a business stay. The food was excellent and we had a very nice time. The architecture within the building and the decor are very inviting and beautiful. The hotel is wonderful both inside and outside. It was definitely memorable experience.

Romantic. Afternoon Tea with the wife.... no better place than the Burj Khalifa.A grand entrance with fountains, fish tanks, jewellery shops and lots of rich people and their flashy cars.... who wants a Bentley anyway?Cant remember to exact price but think it was around £80-£100 each which is for as many different teas, coffees, scones and buns that you can scoff before your sitting is over. If you are wise book the last sitting. You are not in any rush to leave and you can watch the amazing sunset. Well worth the visit.

Magestic view in beautiful island. Pros-********Spectacular viewSelf proclaimed 7*Blue sea all aroundnice place to take pics and relaxGood foodnice place for meetingsunique building architecture as a sailCons-**********Allow guests with tradition attireexpensive

7star afternoon tea. Very expensive 7 course afternoon tea at the Burj Al Arab. This 7 starhotel is well worth a visit although you can't just walk in. Luxurious and opulent. AfternoonTea in the sky bar was amazing. Highly recommended

Sky Tea Wonderful Experience. We enjoyed the food, the service, the ambiance and the view (although the view was limited by haze that day).The staff was very attentive. We stayed from 4:00-7:00. We weren't rushed, but it was clear that they were starting to set up for evening cocktails by the end.The food was plentiful and delicious. We were free to try as many different teas as we wanted from the extensive, all included menu. Additional champagne beyond the first glass was extra.Although a bit pricey, this was a really nice special experience.

Afternoon Tea. Attended for afternoon tea for my partners Birthday.Booked for the Sahn Eddar Lounge. Was amazing with great views of the Jumeirah resort also the hotel atrium.Hard to describe a 7* afternoon tea its just as you'd expect it to be. Presented very well and staff friendly. Our waitress Katriana (i think) was pleasant and ran through everything for us keeping us topped up with drinks also. I had emailed in advance to inform them of my partners Birthday. A chocolate cake and a rose were provided which was a nice touch my partner enjoyed. Katriana also managed to get us a tour of the hotel for my partners birthday which was very nice of her.We were shown the Spa, Gym, Library, Games room, Sky Restaurants and also a trip in the Glass elavator which offered great views. We were also told to have a walk round the new terrace area with infinity pool.Overall experience was great and price was not too bad to say you eaten in a 7* hotel.Couldn't thank Katriana enough from Sahn Eddar Lounge for everything she really made our day hopefully this gets passed on to her.

Amazing food!!!. We visited the Al Muntaha restaurant as a treat for my 40th birthday. Wow!!! The food was amazing!! Especially the truffle mash!! My kids loved it this restaurant!! They are aged 12 and 10. To be honest I wouldn't take younger children. The food is very pricey but very luxurious and of a very high standard!

Beautiful and Iconic. This was a must see while I was here in Dubai. In terms of the restaurants you have two options. There is a bar (Gold on 27) where you can reserve a time and then turn up and pay for your drinks as you go, or you have the options of reserving a table in the SkyView bar where there is a minimum spend. I done both while I was here and in my opinion, everything about the Gold on 27 bar was far superior, so in my opinion, I would definitely recommend having a drink here if you are looking to see the Burj Al Arab.

Best hotel I've ever been in. . Truly amazing. When we checked in the butler said this is your room. I said where? He said your in it. It was our own reception room. I was amazed. The rooms are in believable. 2 storey suited. Amazing butler service. The room is massive !!!Small lower pool. Amazing high level bar and pool. We are in both restaurants at £1800 for 6 persons. Rubbish. The views were amazing. The restaurant in the aquarium is beautiful. Over priced. Brilliant rolls Royce phantom airport pick up X 3 cars ! Unbelievable. Hope to come back. Atlantis is more fun.

Amazing Hotel. We didn't say at the Burj on our visit to Dubai, we went sight seeing by land and sea, beutifiul Hotel, and even better at night when the Burj becomes its own light show, all reports indicate a fabulous Hotel, we intend on visiting 2017..

It's amazingly designed. it is really amazing the gold every where I love it.. i enjoyed the “underwater” restaurant the first evening.. By the way, you don't have to be staying in the hotel to dine at any of the restaurants there. Reserve before you go though otherwise you won't get past security.

Nothing to Say....... Words fail me!!! It was worth every penny ($220.00)AUST, & would Happily have High Tea there again. Service- Perfect, Food Superb, View - Exquisit!!!!
The Skyview Bar is an experience you just have to have!!!

Worthy of its reputation as one of the worlds best. Cannot fault the Burj, we have had many extended stays here and the service and quality never disappoint
The new entertainment island takes it to another level
old sign of dubai. in 7 years ago sign of Dubai been Burj al arab . this building to be seen a sale . this tower is near jumeirah beach and wild wadi .

An Icon always to be seen.. What a magnificant building and exciting architecture to be seen.
Stands tall, to be seen at different angles and a landmark which looks iconic and has the facts to be able to be an icon.
Wow!!
A spectacular building. This is a must for any visit to Dubai but it can be seen from quite a distance since it dominates the skyline
Wow. Had high tea there- pricey but can do it once. Luxurious palatial hotel but should allow more viewings of the hotel at that price!

Perfect Anniversary. My husband and I visited the Burj Al Arab on the 12th August 2016 to celebrate our 5th wedding anniversay.We booked in advance to go on the culinary flight and sample a different course in each restaurant at the hotel!This has got to be one of the most memorable things we have ever done....Our visit started in the cocktail bar which was beautiful, and intimate looking out over Dubai. The food in each restaurant was second to none... The wine pairing throughout perfect... I wish I could visit every week!All of the staff were polite, friendly and attentive a absolute credit to the hotel.The Burj Al Arab is just beautiful! Very colourful, vibrant and maintained to a high standard.We will most certainly return on our next trip to Dubai! Thank you Burj Al Arab for an amazing evening and perfect anniversary!

Amazing view . We reached the top one of the restaurant it was called sky view bar,and it was great, Many people people visit the place, so make a reservation from before so we make the reservation one of the quality tours operations which was called,Arabian Exclusive Tours,It was very good cominicat with mr,Ruben special thanks.
Too much!. Rightfully a 7 star hotel. Very grand for my liking, It's all gold and red velvet etc. If you like luxury this is the place that you should not miss. This hotel defines LUXURY!

A beautiful sailboat made of concrete and glass. A beautiful hotel with a very Las Vegas look. Lots of Rolls parked outside for the use of guests. Red and gold are the main colours in the lobby...very, very ornate. I loved how rapidly the lift moved up to the topmost floor. The view from there of the beach is spectacular and the lovely, blue waters. But what I liked the most was the fountains which dance in synchronization and seem to jump like dolphins chasing each other.
High Tea Skyview Bar.. Went for High Tea at last visit in the Skyview Bar restaurant. Amazing panoramic views. Well worth the price if still offered. Very high end food choices.
Go at night. Go there at night, take a swim in the warm ocean and relax on the beach. No need to go inside, unless you have to.
Architectural masterpiece. The Burj Al Arab is opulent, beautiful, and just amazing. A gem among many architectural gems in this city.
Great view. Beautiful view from the beach and also at the place itself. At the beach it's also beautiful to see it.

Once we got in it was fine. A bit of confusion getting in when we arrived as we were not sure what resturant we were eating in, the gate man was not very nice, but eventually let us in as we did have a booking! Food was great but was not cheap!!!
Beautiful. We went to Gold on 27, This building is so amazing, It feels like your in a dream, You must go to see the building and how spectacular it is.

What a place. Enough to make Chelsea look like the favelas of Brazil.. Just a spectacle, no other words for it. The kind of extravagance and opulence that isn't verging on the vulgar, it is well well beyond it. Does that mean you shouldn't experience it? Absolutely not, it's a once in a lifetime and it helps you better understand those whose vast fortunes mean they have no concept of either money or taste. Everything is tuned up to 11 on the scale and everything that glitters in here probably is gold.We had drinks and snacks in the Skyview Bar. Excellent service as you would expect, although the credit card machine wasn't processing Barclaycard so I was one of many who had to go through the very embarrassing ride down to the hotel lobby to withdraw the funds in cash.Would I ever stay here? Absolutely not. A five star hotel is top rated for a reason, anything beyond that is just unnecessary. Do it, tick it off the bucket list and realise you're better off not having the kind of money that means you feel the need to come here and make sure every social media app tells your "friends" that's where you are... ;0)
Beautiful. I have seen the beauty of the hotel from all angles.This time around from the beach.It is an icon associated with Dubai.A must visit whenever you are in Dubai.

Great to Inpress. Well what do you say about a 7 star hotel, really not much it speaks for itself. Everything is above expectation. A must is the Restuarant and bar at top it offers amazing views of the Gulf and the city with food and drinks, a great place to impress your better half. But you have to try some of their Camel milk cocktails a very interesting twist. But prepare to dig deep into your wallets not a place for small budgets.
Fabulous . As incredible as ever! From arrival to departure a truly wonderful experience enhanced by the stylish new Terrace which has ensured BAA remains at the very top

Afternoon Tea at Burj Al Arab. Visited the hotel for a afternoon tea. Even though its over - prices. you get to experience was a 7 star service really is. Each and everyone item served is delicious and crafted to perfection. It is better to reach at-least an hour before your booking , so that you can spend some time in the lobby and reception area of the hotel. The staff is very friendly and professional

One of the finest hotel in the world. If you are visiting dubai, it is one of the places you must visit near Jumeriah Beach. The structure itself speaks for its splendid architecture. If your pocket allows you must stay here, or even just go for a meal or coffee.
Amazing. There's no need to tell you all how much fun we had. The place is breathtaking!!! Worth the visit! The view is stunning

You need to pay to get in....... Book Breakfast, lunch, dinner or a room to stay at Burj Al Arab way before to enter the building and see around. Otherwise just a selfi from outside (far away) is allowed. But this place is constructed from an artificial island created by engineers which looks classy from outside. It would be nicer if we could see the inside. One of the engineering miracle of Dubai.
Mr s patel . It's good hotel nice view for top of the wild wadi park ... you can't go unless you booked room there ....

Opulence at the Burj Al Arab. What a place! After a spectacular helicopter ride, we decided on the last minute to have lunch in the Lounge at the Burj Al Arab. We were treated and served as sheiks, while listening to a 4 piece musical group play beautiful middle eastern instrumental music. The burrata and tomatoes, the mezza platter and sushi were fabulous. The back drop and setting were what you would expect in a 7-star establishment. Worth the drop in, but expect to pay for this performance!

Must Visit . Burj Al Arab is a must see if you are in Dubai and is known as the only 7 star hotel in Dubai the entry is restricted For people who have confirmed reservations to the hotel restaurants All restaurants are equally good The fish restaurants is a must try

7 * all the way. We stayed here for 5 nights in room 1312, first impression wow. We arrived by helicopter and landed on top of burn al Arab to be greeted with flowers. Kate was very welcoming and she's escorted us to our room where there were 6 members of staff singing happy birthday! With more flowers and a cake, she explained everything to us and history of the building and surroundings. Our room was simply magnificent very spacious and a panoramic view. No expensive has been spared on this hotel. Our private butler unpacked our suitcases and was very friendly ( nothing is too much for any member of the staff). Concierge arranged our rolls Royce, hiring our Lamborghini and arranged our trip to burj kahlifa also. Thank you to all the staff that made this a memorable stay. We hired a Royal cabana for the day also situated around the infinity pool, again the staff round there are very helpful. This comes with a price, the most expensive hotel we have ever stayed in down to the soft drinks are eye watering expensive... Billionaires playground
Burj au arab. A white coloured huge building in the water and is visible from a distance. The architecture adds to the beauty. It is not open for all but only the residents
Burn Al Arab. Absolutely stunning architecture inside and out . A true work of art would see it again by helicopter

Birthday Treat. I booked afternoon tea in The Skyview restaurant as a birthday surprise for my husband, it is expensive but worth every penny. The service you receive is excellent you feel so special and the food, wow it was delicious and the view was stunning. My husband also received a birthday cake. It was definitely a birthday to remember.
amazing... It is amazing!! But you cannot get in there unless you have made a reservation, which is very expensive!

Seven stars? Where?.. When you arrive with the car of hotel you have to arrive to a bridge cause the hotel is located in an artificial island. Good location cause everything in the hotel looks artificial. Arriving with the car of the hotel you must stop at security point, if you are in a hotel car why to be stopped?. Waiting in the car between a construction, cause the half of bridge is surrounded of a conatruction. When you go into the lobby, you see a good fountain between two mechanic steps. There are not less glamorous than two mechanich steps, one going up and the other going down. The lobby has two levels, high and down. In the high level there are another nice fountain and small space. All the floors are comunicated in this level of lobby. The decoration of this part is not very elegant it is a bit nagg like the decorator was a nagpie, golden, golden everywhere, shops, columns, chairs. After checking they go with you to the suit, that is the best part of the hotel. Really good and confortable. Service is kindly and professional. But price is not according to the services. There are not large and elegant saloons full of chinesse people. Certanly this is the best option if you are chinesse, not for western, Park Hyatt or Al Qasr Hotel are more adecuated. Beach club is nice, there are balinesse beds and cabannas, service is nice and there are not many people cause it is really hot there.

Living life king size!. It is truly once in a lifetime experience of living life king size, everything their is bigger than life . The hospitality of the staff,the royal treatment, You can get used to it ;) Worth visiting atleast once.
Best structure designed in world. We visited dubai and abu dhabi in june 2016...we visited this burj al arab and this is Best structure designed in world...
Great . We been to drink and dinner in Burj al Arab, very good place, friendly staff, price is little up but for best level sure not to much. Place for Queens.

Skyview Bar. Wow! What a hotel! We visited the Skyview bar to celebrate our engagement and had a fantastic evening. We each had 2 cocktails looking out onto downtown Dubai and the views were breathtaking. The service was exceptional I even said to my partner I was being treated as though I was James Bond! Our host whom I have forgotten his name was also very polite and attentive and a credit to your business (he supported Arsenal Football Club) I would highly recommend as a must visit place!

Unique. This is a very special place full of superlatives and bright colors. Inside you may get the feeling that you are visiting a giant Hermes scarf but remember that it is set in a country with a lot of desert and local are starved for rich color. I recommend the afternoon tea if you are not staying over.

Afternoon Tea in the Skyview Bar. Booked by my Sister in Law as a treat for our Christmas stop over. Afternoon tea for four of us was as you would expect in this seven star hotel; absolutely fabulous from beginning to end. From the moment you are greeted by security before crossing the causeway to the hotel, to the amazing decoration, luxury and hospitality second to none, it's difficult to fault the 'experience' as that's what any part of a visit to this hotel is.The staff were faultless and absolutely nothing was too much trouble. The range of teas and sandwiches available were excellent and despite the considerable price you really do feel like you are getting value for money which is all that's important in my view.

Ramadan Iftar . Amazing location combined with amazing food and the best service you can get. Family Ramadan Iftar in Burj Al Arab was simply the best Iftar we had. We wish that we continue enjoying the amazing game atmosphere for longer period.
Icon spot for visitors . We wanted to go inside but unfortunately the staff at the gate didn't allow us to enter, they asked if we have reservations only then we can get inside which was annoying.

Afternoon Tea - Worth every penny . What a place! worth every penny Wasn't sure if it was over priced but it was worth every penny. The staff are so helpful and pleasant they made our trip memorable. jesicar could not do enough for us. 7 courses of heaven! I am a vegetarian and was so delighted with the custom made treats and sandwiches. Sometimes I find the veggie option can be bland but so much choice and taste. The strawberry ice tea and hazelnut ice coffee was delicious! So many cakes we had to take a doggy bag! The view is breath taking and it was such an amazing experience I will repeat each time I visit Dubai! Thank You very much!!
Out of this World. Reserved a table in the sky bar and the cocktails, canapés and views did not disappoint. The hotel itself is fabulous.
Amazing building. What can I say about the Burj Al Arab that has not all ready been said ?? architect still a stunning building nice beach alongside this hotel is worth going and having a look.
Photo op gone wrong. I attempted to take a photo in front of the tower, there was so much humidity that we could hardly see the tower, and then my camera got all fogged up, made for bad photos

5-Star top to bottom. I took a tour through my hotel which included the Burj Khalifa and the Al Arab. The entrance way and main promenade fountains were beautiful and the architecture was state of the art. I could never afford to stay there but it was great to see in person what so many people just see on television.

Why people keep thinking of 7th star? To know the answer you need to experience::). New platform is just an amazing idea, very well implemented, and just beautiful! We enjoyed the time at the pool, and everything was outstanding..In the August heat we felt like it is 25 - 30 degrees! The biggest compliment to this unique project is the Scape restaurant located by the newly built pool side. Our dining experience was fabulous! We were 15 minutes late and table was held for us, absolutely all staff did an amazing job! And the food quality and taste was up to the highest standard! Definitely recommend!
Afternoon Tea - Fit for a Queen. A wonderful afternoon tea experience - the most Expensive by far but worth it plentiful food and re fills stunning views of Dubai ...

Dinner at Al Muntaha. Visited once again to the Burj Al Arab for my 40th birthday dinner. We ate in Al Muntaha on the 27th floor. The setting is fantastic with a great view of the palm and across Dubai. The service and food are both exceptional so well worth a memorable visit but is quite expensive as you would expect from a restaurant of this calibre.

Overly Ostentatious. We visited the Burj Al Arab on a minimum spend of 350 Dirham each, the drinks were 150 each and that was one of the cheapest cocktails. I must say though it was delicious. We had bar snacks and 2 drink for our 350 (£70) I found the Hotel a bit OFF, however you only live once.

The best. The burj is deffinatly the Best hotel in the world have been twice for dinner now once on Xmas day where the choice of food is beyond your wildest dreams and more and some of it is cooked fresh in front of you and you can have as much as you can consume but leave a little space for the Ararat of yummy deserts that will make your eyes pop out of there sockets like a child does in a sweet shop . The service and politeness is the Best in the world you will find . We also visited the under the sea restaurant wher you choose from a huge menu while the large fish including sharks stingrays swim right next tu you in a massive glass aquarium . This is a must once in your life at least visit the price is a bit high as you would expect in the Beast hotel in the world

Must see architecturally. Beautiful building with much to see on the inside and outside. One of the most amazing buildings that I have ever been in. The height of opulence. Went to Gold on 27 for drinks at night - go before dinner if you want a seat at the window overlooking the city. The cocktails aren't cheap, but the whole experience is worth it.

Once an Icon now a cool tourist attraction. This place was once used to be the Icon of Dubai. Now replaced by Burj but still this place is something to really go n see for. Nice beach alongside this hotel and so many other hotels surrounded by. Do visit this place.

Amazing dinner experience!. If you are traveling to Dubai, the dinning experience is just spectacular. There are so many different food stations offering mouth watering delicacies that you will be too full to try them all out. Beautiful and elegant from the moment you walk in, servers are very polite and will help guide you with food choices.It's pricey but well worth the experience.
Awesome. We had our breakfast with this wonderful hotel and the foods are good. Though it is quite expensive for a buffet the view is worth the price.
Oldman but still amazing!. Burj Al Arab was symbol of Dubai in past years and you can find many many advanced symboll now. So we can name Burj Al Arab as oldman but still interesting.

Afternoon tea at Sky View Bar. Had the most amazing afternoon tea and left very stuffed.
