The food was delicious and included several courses as well as unlimited drinks (including one glass of champagne). They even brought out extras! I came with my mum as part of my 21st birthday and was treated like a princess - even got a birthday cake and a rose! The view over Dubai was amazing. The whole experience was so worth it and I would totally recommend!
Expensive but fun. Afternoon tea cost me about forty quid but you only live once. Seven star luxury with a capital L. You HAVE to go and see this. Off the scale hedonism. Fun!
Magnificent. Its just amazing great to see day and night is worth the effort to.go.there. nearby you have also a souk

Dinner on the beach great disappointment. Kids menu was hot dogs or nuggets - would have been better to eat at macdonalds and on a random beach! Dinner was okay, was over budget for average food and no wine list. The poor waiters just smiled and nodded. Perks was feet in the sand, nice view and a little cart to drive us around and a shawl as it was chilly.

Gold, gold, gold everywhere!. I was at the hotel for the afternoon tea and everything I saw was amazing. Everything is shining and sparkling, mostly painted in gold, but somehow not overstated. The service is perfect and the atmosphere and the view is fantastic. You should definitely stop by a musical fountain in the upper lobby as it plays some amazing rhythms.

I have no money so I can't visit Burj Al Arab. From the outside, there's no something special. But If you really want to vist this pleace, you can buy a meal in restaurant in Burj Al Arab. Its costs around 200 EUR. So there's opportunity to see interior.

ONE OF A KIND. This is a great proper and has stood the test of time for being one of the best hotels in the world.if you would like to go inside you will need a reservation or a friend staying at the hotel,however you can book the High tea or Dine in one of the various restaurants.The other option is to go for drinks to the roof top bar but never the less one must go and visit this place when in Dubai.
It is a piece of art.. it is very nice from both inside and outside. you can feel the arts and luxuriance while touring inside the hotel building.
Only in Dubai!. Amazing! Amazing to think that man could manipulate the sea, build an island and erect a stunning structure in the shape of a sail. You've got to see it to believe it.

Beautiful building, but expensive.. We arrived with no reservations, but the gate guard put us in touch with the reservation desk. We're not talking room reservations, we just wanted to do the afternoon tea and light appetizer visit. At about $150/pp it was nice to see from outside the fence. Wanted to see what a 7-star hotel had to offer and found that it had 7-star prices to keep the riffraff out.

Breathtaking. The landmark of Dubai... the Burj Al Arab was absolutely stunning to see. The sea breeze going along with the hot sun of typical dubai overlooking the water-just great views and good vibes from this place. Definitely worth going to multiple times!

afternoontea. having been to dubai 4 times before we have been on most of the trips offered, so decided to go for the big on this time at the Burj Al Arab.What a great experience it was! From arriving to leaving we just loved the attention,atmosphere and surroundings.The skyview restaurant was something that can only be experienced as words could never describe it properly.We and the other guests were treated like royalty and the food/drinks were exceptional.Nothing was rushed and even when the next sitting of guests were due, we were told to stay as long as we wanted.One of our life memories.

Our most memorable meal.. This was a meal of a lifetime for us. We celebrated my husband's birthday at the Al Mahara restaurant. This was THE most extravagant meal we have ever had. The service was impeccable, the food was fantastic, and the surroundings were so luxurious! We asked for a table near the aquarium and we were not disappointed. It was great fun to watch the fish and sharks swim by while we enjoyed the atmosphere. Make sure you have a good look at the lobby. It is over the top luxury!

Luxury at its best!. This is the only 7* hotel in the world and it shows. We booked for Afternoon Tea in the Sky Bar – you cannot get anywhere near this hotel without proving to security that you have a booking of some kind. We were welcomed at the door and shown where to go next but certainly not hurried through. There's no restriction on photographs in the lobby which is ornately decorated with dancing fountains, exquisite mosaics and luxuriously soft carpet. After going up the escalator (do not forget to look upwards) we wandered past some expensive looking boutiques to another reception desk where our reservation was confirmed again before being shown to a wonderful glass lift going up the outside of the building. We were met outside the lift and taken to our table overlooking the Jumeira Beach Hotel and harbour. It was beautiful. Our 'tea' was explained to us at every stage by the wonderfully attentive staff and came served on tiered stands in the shape of the 'sail'. Everything was delicious and beautifully presented. We weren't hurried and actively encouraged to walk around and take photos. The staff were extremely helpful in taking photos of us together too. All in all this was a superb 'one-off' experience.
From Jumeirah Beach. Took some picures with this iconic hotel as a background from Jumeirah beach. The beach is very clean and good to relax

Incredible . From the flaming torches to the opulent interior ....even the lift doors are impressive !...Rooms are stunning and sitting in the bar is like being suspended over the ocean in a calm sophisticated atmosphere. Food is as expected ...excellent and the entire experience is thrilling .

Amazing hotel that was even more amazing to see up close.. To see this hotel on the travel channel does it no justice. I was able to get some excellent photos with anyone of them a candidate for a screen saver.

Fabulous food and beautiful location - shame about the 'hiccup'. Ahh the Burj Al Arab……the very thought of it denotes sheer luxury and expense; a one-in-a-lifetime, ‘must do’ in Dubai. Love the fact you cannot access the island unless a reservation has been placed. Loved the fact that this is architecture and engineering combined together in what I consider one of the most iconic buildings ever constructed. The entrance and lobby leads you onto the promise that with every step, you are captivated to another place. There is no comparison; there is nothing else like it. There are dancing fountains, golden gilded columns with colourful lights….every aspect is in full colour, it’s vibrant and yet oddly serene. My husband booked the Al Muntaha restaurant on the 27th Floor for our wedding anniversary and since we had moved to Dubai in April, it only seemed fitting that this is where we would have our anniversary here. We arrived at 6:45pm and as we waited for quite some time outside the restaurant lobby / waiting area, another gentleman began to complain to one of the staff as it was quite evident she was a bit flustered and in need of some assistance. They too had been waiting for some time, as we all were. In fact, she openly called out for another member of staff to come to her as she frantically looked at the monitor. We didn’t mind, we figured, they will call us when they are ready, no point adding to her anxiety!Eventually she came to us and whispered ‘sorry’ and brought into the bar area. My husband and I ordered drinks and even though we had dinner booked for 7:00pm, it was now 7:30pm when a female member of staff came to our table and sternly ‘reminded’ us we had dinner reservations in the restaurant. We felt like scolded children; in the wrong place at the wrong time. We told her that we knew what time our dinner reservation was but that we were seated in the bar by her colleague earlier. You cannot simply walk into the bar, a member of staff escorts you in. I explained that it was our first time in Burj Al Arab and we just (quite stupidly I admit) thought that the Burj Al Arab served an aperitif before dinner, as part of the overall dining experience. We genuinely didn’t know and felt clumsy even though it wasn’t our mistake. Instead of just letting us enjoy our drinks, she asked that we go the restaurant (as in right away) and our drinks would be brought to the restaurant (and subsequently added to the bill). Then I just felt embarrassed as the people on the adjacent table looked at us as we were being asked to leave….well, it felt like I was evicted from the party I wasn’t invited to. As we walked, shamefully from the bar, I mentioned to the female staff member that I thought it was odd we were brought into a bar when my husband does not even drink alcohol at all. Instead she remarked along the lines of ‘tell me your secret I can’t staff away from the stuff.’ We cringed and walked on, not the response I was hoping for from a 7 star place. And so we went to the restaurant, were given a wine menu and asked what we would like to drink. I then had to explain that our drinks were coming from the bar area. That said, we made the most of our night as we understand sometimes people get things wrong. The food selection was so perfected with a wonderful array of choices, especially food sourced from our native Ireland (so well done for that!). The evening was topped off with a delightful chocolate dessert they made for us and being presented with a single red rose. The hotel management did contact my husband via email as they do with whoever placed the reservation and we did note what happened. The hotel did respond by way of an apology and noted they would look into it.I would still rate this as 'Excellent' because it is, irrespective of what happened.

Dining flight to remember! . This was not a visit with a teenager but with a son who had recently turned 21. A bit of a foodie our gift to him was a culinary flight in this legendary hotel.Starting with the journey across the pontoon into the private island we were treated like royalty. A team of doormen synchronised the opening of the car doors for us and instantly made us feel valued and welcomed. The lobby of the hotel is breathtaking, containing an aquarium and an unrestricted view from the atrium of all the guest floors and suites. Our journey began at the rear of the hotel at the glass elevator. This took us to the top floor where we were greeted by name by our host. We were escorted to our table in the sky bar and our son was asked to confirm that he is 21 - by law nobody under 21 can enter a bar in Dubai. We explained about this being his 21st treat and from thereon everybody we spoke to wished him a happy birthday!!We were delighted with our table: overlooking the beaches and city skyline as the sun set. The culinary flight offers 4 courses with matched wines each taken in a different restaurant so whilst enjoying the food diners get to explore this hotel.We were given a menu booklet and had to choose our dishes and wines 'up front' : we all elected for the Mr Big cocktails which were served with a range of delicious canapés, flavoured cashews and stuffed olives. We were not rushed at all and were encouraged to stay as long as we wanted.For our first course we were escorted to the dining room on the opposite side of the building so that we were looking out over the Palm. A lovely environment apart from a very loud British teen who was busy informing the waiter he wanted a 'kids burger'.In every restaurant we were served an amuse bouche and in this restaurant it was Parmesan choux buns which were as light as air and delicious. Two of us then enjoyed King Crab with delicate swirls of complementary garnishes whilst the other was served a generous portion of foie gras all washed down with champagne.The second course was served in the Arabian restaurant. The decor was rich and vibrant in complete contrast to the contemporary feel of the previous locations. Jordan was greeted with a Happy Birthday and we were seated in a convenient location to be be able to watch the hustle and bustle.! Dishes served here included king prawns with scallops, morrocan lamb soup and roasted turbot, all of us opting for the extremely nice Chablis. The canapé in this restaurant was delicious, being a mix of tasty warm breads with various traditional dips. The food was extremely good quality, well presented and deserving of a Michelin star. The third course, billed as the main, was taken in the Asian restaurant which is very modern and seems to operate as both a buffet and al a carte dining option. The food, wagyu beef all round, was perfect but the restaurant lacked atmosphere. We were the only diners and it felt quite cold and limp after the splendour of the previous two. However, the staff were very friendly and the service was faultless.Last but not least we were served out of this world desserts in the fourth and final restaurant in the atrium. There was theatre, there was chocolate, oohs and aahs and food too gorgeous to eat, but, you know, we forced ourselves!Just when we thought the evening had come to an end, the staff then arrived with an opera cake adorned with candles and singing happy birthday! We needed little encouragement to devour some additional cake with the rest being boxed up for us to take home with us. We left with the cake, a bouquet of beautiful roses and a souvenir wallet containing embossed menu cards of our meal choices.Not a cheap night out by any stretch but well worth every penny and something we will always remember!!

Very good. Food couldBe much better . The hotelIs incredible. Rooms are huge. Very unique and lovely finishing. Butler service is exceptional. Food at restaurants and room service could be much better. Room service food is above the standard.

Great dining experience. We went to Al muntaha in the 27th floor to celebrate our wedding aniversary and it was an amazing experience. We were 8 people, and we had a round table just at the corner with stunning views! We chose a 3 courses menu @ 595 AED (143€) per person with drinks not included. It was really good. You enter the hotel and you are impressed with the decoration. You have someone very kind taking you to the restaurant reception and you take a transparent lift with sea views. They were waiting for us and said congratulations for our aniversary:-). We were sit at the table and Lorna, our assistant was really good, kind and professional. The sumiller was also very good and helpful. I chose terrine de foie, sea bass and a hazelnut dessert, everything really tasty and good, presentation of the plates was also great. At the end we were given a cake and I was given a rose! All of us really enjoyed and the experience was really worth!

6 STARS. Still considered the ultimate luxury hotel in Dubai. All rooms are supplied with a personal butler. Top marque continental luxury cars are just too common in this hotel. To stay here for a night is just like installing a bomb into a my personal bank vault. Security is very tight. For the public, it could be accessed for a fee coupled with a free drink. Located next to a water theme park.

Amazing. We visited friends who were staying at the hotel. Nice entrance hall and aquarium.
Amazing rooms with two levels and a reception on each floor level.
The bed is huge and the walk-in closet, bathroom and small office are nice.
The food facilities and swimming pool are superb.
Worth every penny!

SkyTea, Lovely experience. We went in our honey moon and they give to us Flowers... Go with empty stomach and hungry because they serve a lot of appetizers and desserts... Stunning view of Dubai! You Must Go when in Dubai. No regrets!
Masterpiece. Definitely need to visit this wonderful masterpiece. It is located on the man made Palm. Need to see at night. However smog may keep you from viewing it in its complete grandeur

Feng shui of Burj al Arab. I thought I would add this review to trip advisor for those of you after a slightly different perspective on the hotel.In September 2009, I was fortunate enough to be a guest at Burj Al Arab’. Since its construction began in 1994 this hotel has had more press than any other hotel in the world. It forms an integral part of Dubai’s skyline and is regarded as an iconic symbol of the country’s urban transformation.I was eager to see what the feng shui of this much talked about building would be like. So armed with my lopan, I decided to take some calculations and understand the form of this striking building.Some facts & calculations:ü It stands at 321 metres high and is the worlds 2nd tallest hotel. (321 is of course 123 backwards).ü The hotel stands on an artificial island 280 metres out from Jumeriah beach.ü Inside the building the atrium is 280 m tall.ü It accommodates 202 bedroom suites.ü The cost of staying in a suite begins at US$2,000 per night; the Royal Suite is the most expensive, at US$28,000 per night. (Of course these fluctuate but these are the printed prices at the time of writing the article.)ü Kwa calculations 8/8 & 8/2If you are a feng shui consultant do you see what I’m seeing with the numbers? So many 8’s & 2’s. (For this fate period the numbers 8&2 are very auspicious) Surely a recipe for success! But are the calculations the only reason for its phenomenal success? I don’t think so.The hotel is connected to the mainland via a purpose-built gently meandering bridge.As our car drew close to the hotel I was amazed at its wonderful form, which seemed to sit so perfectly in its surroundings.The building is an amazing structure, mimicking the sail of a ‘dhow’ an Arabian vessel. Two “wings” spread in a V to form a vast “mast”, while the space between them is enclosed in a massive atrium.Outside the grand main entrance is a stunning water fountain in a ‘goy moon’ (health & wealth) shape. The kwa for the main entrance and fountain is 8/2 in the southeast. (Water in the southeast is very auspicious)As we were escorted into the lobby, we felt the temperature suddenly cooling us, whilst outside the sun was scorching down.We were greeted by an uplifting fragrance, our eyes feasted on hundreds of fresh flowers – all arranged exquisitely, a striking dancing water feature and two huge aquariums also graced the lobby.Staff stood politely holding fresh towels, large dates and pouring tea as guests sat down – every guest was treated like royalty. As soon as you entered it seemed as if you were the only guest there because all the staff knew your name.However, is the fantastic hospitality and the lavish interiors, made of precious materials including 22 carat gold leaf, enough to make this hotel the most talked about, hugely successful and most unique hotel in the world?I don’t believe it is the only reason.So why has this building become such an iconic symbol and why is this hotel almost always fully occupied, despite it being so expensive? Well I think a huge part of the answer lies in the words of the architect Tom Wright, ‘we looked at the other buildings in the world that are symbols to see what they had in common. We found that they were all totally unique in shape and they all have a simple easily recognizable form. We decided that the test to determine if a building is symbolic is if you can draw it in 5 seconds and every one recognizes it.’Well that makes complete sense in feng shui terms; it is a simple form that fits perfectly in its environment; a boat in the sea, it is easily recognizable, is different from all the other buildings. It is also one of the tallest buildings in the world, in a space where most of the land is flat, so obviously it attracts the chi. Apart from all this, Dubai is so hot and dry most of the year and is largely a desert, and of course in a desert, water is the life force.Site and facing – for a boat that is floating in the sea with water 360 degrees around, are the site and facing calculations as relevant in comparison to a property built on solid land? I don’t think so – the main entrance is at 8/2, which is perfect but the site and facing are really not all that relevant at all since water is surrounding the whole structure. The main entrance which faces the land may at first seem like the facing but it is not really the facing at all, since all the bedrooms have views to the sea. Thus, the opposite side, the rear is more like the facing.My Verdict – In my view the reason for its success is a combination of all three factors, excellent hospitality, the calculations; the hotel is built largely in the 8 fate and is built on 8/8 and 8/2 kwas, with 8/2 being the main entrance, as well as having so many other 8’s & 2’s everywhere. However, the most vital factor for its success in my view is its form and setting, water is all around it, it is a boat/sail in the sea. Tom Wright the architect said, ‘if it were built on the shore it would have blocked the light’. Thank God it wasn’t built on the shore, because in my opinion one of the main reasons it is so successful is its appeal of floating in the water – surely a boat/ship out of the water cannot fulfill its function!

Once in a lifetime. Won this weekend in a raffle!! Is it worth the price that is usually charged? Probably not but it's not far off! Butler service, incredibly friendly and polite staff, amazing views over Dubai and an indoor pool about 25 floors up overlooking the city - this really is an unforgettable experience. The apartment (can't really call it a room) is simply huge and spread over two floors with overstuffed furniture and a bathroom bigger than some apartments I've been in. Rich (or gaudy depending on your taste) colours throughout the suite and a bed the size of an aircraft carrier ensure that your stay is one of pure luxury. Get a golf buggy to the private beach where you can enjoy some peaceful sun or make use of the sister hotel's more lively facilities if you wish. If you've got the money you've got to do it....just once!
Burj Al Arab. Nice building and worth a visit but very pricey. The view is nice except in the summer when the air is not as clear.

Must see even if you don't stay at the hotel.. You can only see the Burj Al Arab if you either stay there or have a reservation to one of their restaurants. We did the afternoon tea time on the 27th floor- sky view bar; expensive but definitely worth the experience. The views are spectacular from the 27th floor, even the elevator ride up was amazing. The food was great and filling too, waiters were very nice. Another highlight was the sparkling apple cider that had edible 24k gold flakes. Overall an experience you should not miss out on when visiting Dubai.
Amazing 7 star hotel. . Beautiful hotel. We visited it along with Wild Wadi Water Park. Worth every penny. A must visit for Dubai visitors.
Anniversary visit. Amazing service from start to finish, thank you so much for making our stay memorable and special. Will definitely be returning.

Visited, but did not stay in Hotel. Wow! What an Iconic landmark! Couldn't afford to stay in Hotel but....after studying all packages offered, chose package that allowed you to go to private beach, use spa with massage, and dine at one of many restaurants. Loved it all. Hotel very opulent , very impressive. Infinity pool on 18th(?) floor was fabulous as well as Spa area. Due to time of year or cost, you seem to have the place to yourself. Food was ok, not memorable. However, one of the chefs came over and did his best to impress us. Regrets....wished I could have gone and afforded the restuarant with aquariums. We went in 2012, so I maybe overlooking other interesting items. Unless you have reservations, your taxi can not enter " the sanctum". You feel special....if for only that day!

Afternoon tea . I brought my Mum here for afternoon tea .. We had been advised before that you must mention you would like he sky bar which we booked and I'm so glad we didThe views are exceptional and the food was very nice A great place to being family for the afternoon and to have a slice of home in Dubai

skyview bar & Al Mantaha Restaurant. I would definitely recommend a visit to the skyview bar and Al Mantaha restaurant, your visit starts with the stunning approach to the Berj followed by an impressive walk through the reception where you are greeted. A glass lift takes you to the 27th floor where the view is amazing. The service, cocktails and food is really excellent but most of all the staff are so welcoming and friendly and make it their mission to make it a memorable evening. Love it!
worth a vist. If this is your first time in Dubai, this is certainly worth a visit as an Iconic place in Dubai. The trip is easy from all of the major hotels.

Oh boy!. Went to this hotel venue for a business conference and was honestly, a bit overwhelmed. It is over the top in every sense, yet intriguing. In that sense, it really challenges you. The business conference ares are pretty standard, but, if you want to use the wash rooms, you get an idea.Most visitors I saw in the lobby were either extremely wealthy Chinese with Prada bags, or Russian mafia types, who looked like gun runners.

The best and most beautiful hotel of Dubai.. The best hotel of Dubai with and unbelievable sky bar. You can also visit hotel with guide but best is to make a lunch or dinner reservation as they also have excellent restaurants, a bit pricy but it is a unique experience never to forget.
Oh my god.. The hotel was amazing,the food,the drinks,blabla...was phenomenal.The only thing that the price is very very very very very very very high,but it's really worth the money.
Pretty View at night. The colours of the light changes from yellow to red in the night giving it a very pretty look, really nice to take pics in..

Splendid birthday treat (skyview bar & Gold on 27). Afternoon tea was delightful, as we don't drink alcohol they gave us a great alternative of moet chandons first exclusive non alcoholic apple fizzy champagne with gold leaf extracts... this is only exclusive and made for this hotel as i was informed by their staff, there are several courses for their afternoon tea.. each very delectable and bursting with flavours.Its worth coming for tea here as a one off treat to experience.Gold on 27 bar was truly impressive, i loved the decor here along with their fantastic non alcoholic cocktail menu which had a range of interesting ingredients, i would return to this bar again in future, you really can appreciate high levels of service.. the young gent from south africa was extremely helpful and accomodating.. thank you.Only cons i can think of is lobby area and hallways interior isnt at all to my taste.. the style is questionable with crazy colours and swirls but i know some people really love it.. so each to their own.
Very nice !!! . Burj al Arab is one of the oldest attraction of Dubai . The beach is very clean and attractive . One of the must places to visit in Dubai !!!

Beautiful hotel !!. Went to GOLD ON 27 and came across amazing team. Enjoyed the cocktails and services. Very interactive associate with excellent interpersonal skills (forgetting the name). Will be back soon. Regards Sukhpreet
Amazing. A stunning piece of architecture that is well worth a visit. The bar is as expensive as you would expect but is still worth a visit. Rooms are not massively over-priced.

An Iconic Landmark. If you come to Dubai you must see the Sail aka Burj Al Arab, if you don't come you've missed the most iconic Landmark in Dubai. A Must See!
The restaurants you can book even if you don't stay, quite pricey for the average jo - but well worth it for a special occasion for sure!

Cocktails at Gold on 27 🍹. We booked for drinks at the Gold on 27 bar at the Burj Al Arab. We arrived around 2 hours late! However we were greeted with smiles and still accommodated! The cocktails as expected were not cheap however were delicious! The view that evening was stunning and we were lucky enough to have been given a table with a view! I would definitely be back! The ambience was incredible!
Pure Luxury. What can I say?This place is pure Luxury from the the moment you arrive till the moment you leave.Cant wait to come back on my next visit.

Honeymoon getaway in Dubai. My husband and I went to Burj Al Arab for a dinner. We went to Dubai for our honeymoon and this was one of the places we visited. This seven star hotel is absolutely wonderful. The decor is breathe taking. We went to the top restaurant and had Dinner. You must have reservation inorder to even enter the security gate to go inside this hotel. I would suggest do a lunch or afternoon tea and take advantage of th beautiful scenery of the ocean in the daytime.

great construct in Dubai, must visit at least once. fantastic luxury hotel, must visit. arrange 4-5 days before because of limited availability. you can visit only for breakfast buffet which is amazing from all over the world or for afternoon tea at the top restaurant

Amazing experience . Visited the burj al Arab on a recent trip to Dubai, paid for tea so I could view inside the hotel. Would say the price of tea was over priced but for such an expensive hotel cannot really argue. The food was really nice. But the most amazing part was the building itself inside was just amazing, while walking round you feel like the rich such an amazing experience and all the staff are so polite and helpful, building is amazing inside and out, I would say everybody has to experience it if they visit Dubai, to feel like the rich. Overall amazing hotel and amazing experience.
wonderful experience.. amazing bar, restaurant, shops, aquarium, everything. never seen that decoration, luxury, team work, staff proactive, modernity etc.

Stunning building, smaller than expected.. What a stunning building, really is an impressive structure but smaller than expected. The building is on its own built island, with a bridge connecting to the mainland. There is no clear viewing point except on a beach at the side but it's a magnificent building and incredible that they built this is the Middle East. To get across there is a price or if you book dinner and private for hotel guests. There is also a helipad on the top of the building, crazy to say the least but used by all the oil rich people no doubt.

Wow. One word that describes this place the best: Opulent. Save this place for a special occasion for the sake of experience if nothing else. Two places I absolutely loved here: Indoor Pool and the fact that you have your private butler that ensures you get what you want.

Amazing experience. What a lovely place, when you enter the hotel, you will fell different feeling like always fresh and heaven because of their very authentic views where designs are more on gold. Very friendly staff and mouth-watering foods with a very lovely ambiance and sea views.

Just nice!. I saw it from the first stone growing my house was just in front of it..
Lovely to see it everytime i go back!

High tea at Burj al Arab. Absolutely breathtaking view of the beaches, marinas and the city from where we were seated. Afternoon tea was to die for and the service was excellent. So much to eat and the choice was fabulous. Very special occasion for us.
What a lovely place. The Burj Al Arab is a rare sight on the landscape in Dubai. From all angles the structure is beautiful. A must see when in Dubai.

Very Arabic Tune . This is the main icon of the city. The lobby is really eye catching with that crazy aquarium next to escalator. Rooms are super expensive although you don't find anything special in the rooms. The theme of the hotel is very Arabic so don't expect high technology services. Food are really amazing. Don't forget to check the bar at the top floor. Amazing service at the pool will be served. If you can't effort to stay for a night atleast book a table for dinner or visit the shops in the lobby.
Best hotel i have seen. I go there by reservation i make online..at the 27 floor sky bar....its perfect realy....amazing view excellent service!!!!
Beautiful. A building breathtaking in the middle of the Arabian Sea. A paisagistico the best the world has! Congratulations Dubai!

World So Called Seven Star Hotel. Tourist are not allowed inside. Still it is worth visiting from outside.The Burj is made like striking sail-shape design, and the lavish suite, which is one of the most expensive hotel rooms in the world, has an average price of $24,000 a night. It is called seven star as it is having its own helipad at 28th floor.Burj Al Arab Terrace. Located at Dubai’s most iconic hotel, the terrace is a remarkable, one-of-a-kind restaurant, pool, beach and cabana space,
Only SEVEN stars destination . The buck stops here... ambience..royal... luxury ... BEAUTY... if u can afford it go for it... majority of world A listers been here...

Great Design. Amazing fact is its stand on artificial island, design and structure is very unique compared to other attractions in DXB. Actually its a seven star hotel and main center of attraction in DXB.
Unbelievable. When you look at what we have here in Australia it doesn't even compare to what we saw in Dubai. This building was amazing and spectacular.

Had some drinks.. This place is really beautiful. You will need a reservation prior to getting through the gate. You can have a room, reservation at the restraunt or the bar. We went for a reservation at the bar at night. There is a minimum 350 AED ($100 US) per person at the bar which is about 4 beers or 2-4 drinks depending on what you get. It is expensive but you are in the Burj Al Arab. The views are really nice from the bar though.
more than words can say. Like everything in Dubai, this is something to be seen. Don't miss the food experience between the restaurants

More than hotel . Burj Al Arab is iconic and unique, it is like a piece from another planet. You don't need to stay there depends on your budget however it is highly recommended to visit and take tournament there. Sea food restaurant is amazing underwater.

Terrible. I went with my girlfriend to one of the hotels restaurants. We ordered lamb and after waitin for almost 45 minutes they told us they were out of lamb. We ordered new dishes and they were horrible. Surprising for a 7 star hotel.
The afternoon tea of your dreams . We booked this and we're not sure what to expect. But this is the afternoon tea of your dreams.So much and so much to see.Loved the view.

Cocktails in the evening . Visited this hotel after all the hype we wanted to see what it was like inside. We didn't see all areas as we were only there to have cocktails for the evening in the piano bar at the top. The decor is certainly gold! Not to my taste as I found all that gold shine a bit tacky for me. The service was excellent, as were the drinks. The food was good also. Just be warned that you will have toDress smartly here, no shorts of any length. Glad I have seen the inside of the hotel. But even if I had the money to stay all the time I probablyWouldn't.
Unique Hotel 7 Stars Stander. It's a royal touch of fine arts amazing visit very testy food and so nice view from gold on 27 new bar
it was good. i like beach but this place was good and we spend very good time in beach and gulf Dubai was fun and great
Nice Beach. Nice place to visit and to take picture. Its free to swim here also as it open for public. However, the hotel around here is expensive.

Amazing Afternoon Tea!!. Came for afternoon tea at the top. Superb with a range of courses, great selection of sandwiches and they accommodate for all tastes.
Tea menu was superb.
Make sure you don't eat before going else you'll not be able to finish as this is not an ordinary afternoon tea!!

wow wow wow. probably one of the most opulent places I have been to, expensively decorated, ate in the sea restaurant and this is also worth going to, the whole building is worth looking at, the lifts beat the decor in the London Harrods lifts
Lovely beach and stunning backdrop. The sail-boat shaped structure is a sight to behold and the beach next to it is quite popular with both locals as well as tourists. Had a great time there.

It's back: Bigger and Better than Ever . Having stayed at this hotel countless times during my childhood, I have come to see the Burj al Arab as something of a second home. I feel the pride one does of their hometown when I here pleasant comments about the hotel. Usually with the mere mentioning of the hotel's name, one conjectures an image of the quintessence of luxurious accommodation. Unfortunately this has not been true of the Burj al Arab for the past few years. An outdated and small swimming pool, a school canteen style breakfast buffet and a makeshift beach precluded the Burj al Arab from its former hegemony in the hoteling world. In the past year I have been travelling a lot in the U.S and Europe. Unfortunately I have been saddened to see hotels from Berlin in Central Europe to hotels in Los Angeles on the western coast of America surmount the standards set by the Burj al Arab.After some extensive redevelopment and extension I can now say I am again proud to have been able to stay at such a wonderful hotel. The Burj al Arab is again in my opinion the best hotel in the world: certainly the best I have ever stayed at. The issues were clear and beget simple solutions: new pool, better beach, nicer breakfast area. To my surprise, these issues were not addressed superficially like most hotels would. Instead the Burj al Arab, has reinvented itself in its most radical change since its opening. The corollary of this is an awe-inspiring huge extension. Every detail has been maliciously pondered over. What the Burj al Arab call daytime cabanas, hotels in the Maldives call suites. What many hotels call large infinity pools the Burj al Arab calls jacuzzis. The scale and scope of the island really must be seen in person. It's impossible to compliment the design team in words. A fantastic new breakfast outlet completes the panoply of luxury living.A hotel that transcends luxury, lost its way for a couple of years, although nobody could make the same claim now. The Burj al Arab is again a model of excellence.

Stunning! . We attended the Burj Al Arab for afternoon tea. The experience was absolutely fabulous! From when we arrived to when we left we were made to feel really special! The food was totally stunning and the service was impeccable! Worth every penny! We will definitely be returning!Tip:- go with an empty tummy! You will be stuffed by the time you leave and the cakes are to delightful to waste! X

Review about the Burj Al Arab Beach. This is a perfect weekend getaway. This review is not about the hotel. The view from the beach is mesmerizing to eyes. It has lot of food joints and ample parking space as well. For small kids there are lot of play area including some adventurous activities (of course at some fee) and for adults beach volleyball, surfing and swim in the beach is recommended.
A Memorable Experience. This distinctive sail shaped building is stunning to see in person. We enjoyed a lunch here - it was just beautiful. The food and view as amazing.
Diamond on the beach. Worlds costly 7star hotel,everybody want to live lux life once in a lifetime,very ideally located, crafted,really good experience to see.

Incredible Culinary Flight. Even though I did not stay a night in this hotel, I did the Culinary Flight alongside my sister and Aunt. What an experience. I was in awe the whole time. We traveled from the hotel we were staying at to visit especially for the meal. We started in the top floor restaurant and worked our way down... enjoying 5 courses. The views are breathtaking and it was a highlight of Dubai for me, despite visiting Dubai 4 times in the last year. You really can't get better than this. It is honestly who you would expect the rich and famous to live. The decoration around the hotel is unbelievable. I found myself taking pictures of everything! From the restaurants, to the food! Yes, it is a very expensive hotel, but it is truly an unforgettable experience. The staff were amazing (as you'd expect) and so was the food. I recommend entirely. Hopefully one day I'll be able to stay for a night or two here! It will truly take your breath away.All the best for your travels.

Indulgent Afternoon Tea. Warm welcomeQuality, tasty array of sandwiches and petite, light meals, cakes and scones, along with a wide range of teasLovely experience with a breathtaking viewsWould undoubtedly return if we revisit Dubai What you can see of the hotel, the reception area and the walk up to the elevator to the Sky Bar is amazing!

Looked amazing from the outside!!. I actually visited Dubai in 2012. (Not Sep 2015 as this review might show). The Burj Al Arab is a hotel and is the third tallest hotel in the world. The hotel stands on an artificial island from Jumeirah beach and is connected to the mainland by a private curving bridge. I didn't go inside but it was nice to take a walk along the Jumeirah beach and see this iconic hotel. My friend recently visited and paid an extraordinary amount of money for some tea there!!
Breath taking. Though we have not went inside burj al arab, we just had the view when we were on jumerah beach....the view was breath taking.....must visit

Wow. We didn't stay here but visited to have a look round. Worth a visit. it's definitely got the wow factor. At night it is lit up. A meal at the Madinat restaurants with a view of the Burj at night is well worth booking.
WoW hotel. Its a very nice hotel. undiscribable. you have to try it by your self to understand how nice is this hotel wild wadi water park is a very nice place too. love it
must see in Dubai. This hotel was one of the first in Dubai ! I consider it as Dubai real icon. must give it a visit. its the most luxurious hotel in the world."they say that lol"
Afternoon tea. We had afternoon teat at the hotel, this was quite an experience, being a seven courses, it was expensive but well worth it for a one off.

Wonderful Ultimate Afternoon Tea.. Had tea at the Burj many years ago and felt it really had improved a great deal.Thoroughly enjoyed the many courses and generous staff.Highly enjoyable experience and not as expensive as you may think.

Amazing!. A friend advised us to book an afternoon tea, it cost about £130 each which is quite expensive but worth every penny, we were treated like royalty, we had champagne, sandwiches cakes, sorbets, tarts etc. way too much to eat so we went home with our doggy bag! This was the only way you get to see the inside of this fab hotel unless you are a paying guest of course. You have the tea in the sky view bar and the staff are so lovely they can't do enough for you. They know that you are not there because you are wealthy and that you have saved hard for this treat so they treat you with respect and as they would any other paying guest. The whole afternoon was a lovely experience and well worth doing. Thank you to all the lovely staff there.

Perfect Design. I went there one time and had dinner. I liked the experience. They offer a tour in the hotel where they take you to one of the rooms and show you the design and explain the service that u will get. They offer different rooms, the cheapest is around 7000 Dirhams depending on the season. This hotel have fine restaurants and amazing view of dubai.
Didn't go in. Saw it from far on our city tour and have heard it is very expensive to stay and even enter to visit.

What a amazing construction. The Burj Al Arab building is just a amazing construction by the sea, where you can see what is possible and where the future constructions can go, the landscape, the beach, sand and sun is perfect. Viewed from the beach ,you can just sit around the beach and admire the luxurious surroundings

Excellent ambiance and amenities!. Undoubtedly one of the most premier hotels in the world, Burj Al Arab is bound to leave an everlasting impression of luxury in your heart. Upon booking a certain package, a Rolls Royce will be arranged to transfer you from the airport to the hotel. From there on, get ready to redefine luxury. From VIP concierge services to the lavishly set up grand rooms, everything will leave you bedazzled. It is absolutely worth spending every penny here!
Amazing. Just a amazing construction by the sea, where we can see where the modern and future constructions can go.

Incredible. I had the most amazing time here. Everything was perfect. From the water spritzers by the pool, to the most luxurious toiletries I've ever used, I was constantly surprised by the level of opulance. Just amazing. I don't think I'll ever get to come back, but the memories will last a lifetime.

Nice Background for any Photo. Viewed from the beach ,you can just sit around the beach and admire this hotel building. Once inside the hotel lobby is just so special, wherein it get you thinking someone on earth could create it.

7 star hotel. Went to afternoon tea on a tour to Burj Al Arab. Boy, it sure deserves the seven stars it's rated. There's an amazing entry, a water jumping fountain and two huge aquariums, one either side of the escalators and fountain. Huge gold pillars reach up to I don't know how many levels. The food for afternoon tea was five courses and delicious. The decor was fabulous, as you'd expect.Unfortunately, I couldn't get a good photo of the building because I was too close but I got some awesome shots of the Jumerirah building and beaches across from it.You definitely need to see this building up close if you visit Dubai.

As Tina Turner sang..."SIMPLY THE BEST...!!!". You've visited Dubai, flew on the Award Winning Emirates Airline on the Words biggest passenger aircraft, visited the Worlds Largest Shopping Malls, looked out from the Worlds Highest Building so what do you do next...he's what you do...Make a Dinner Reservation at the Worlds only 'self proclaimed' 7-Star Hotel & prepared to be 'blown away...'7-Stars means 'Exclusivity' and that's what the BAA delivers. Access to the Hotel is only permitted with a Reservation...it does not have to be Dinner at Al Muntaha (The Ultimate), but why settle for Ground Floor eateries when the 27th Floor delivers jaw dropping views and Service.On arrival you enter the copious interior opens up to compete opulence. The dancing Fountains are mesmerising which leads you past the Escalator lined with huge Aquariums to the knee deep carpets of the Ground Floor Atrium. Walk, or more like wade, though to the Lift Lobby to be greeted by the 'Keeper of the Elevator' You will only be able to enter to travel to the 27th Floor IF you have a Reservation. Travel to the 27th Floor to be again greeted with humility as you exit the Elevator. Take time before Dinner to visit the Skyview Bar, not just for the Drinks but for the Views of a growing Dubai.At every stage of Dinner, the Service was beyond Exceptional and the Food keeps up the Impeccable Quality.If your Business is listed on the Stock Exchange, you win the Lottery, decide to re-Mortgage the House or just have some spare Holiday Cash, then when you visit Dubai you cannot leave without experiencing what is "SIMPLY THE BEST...!!!"

High Tea. We had High Tea here at the Skyview Bar, it was just amazing! On arrival the staff were very welcoming and friendly, they really made you feel comfortable especially this was the first time in a 7 star hotel. The food was amazing and it just kept coming. The view was excellent and you couldn't ask for more. Service is what you would expect from a 7* hotel also the price but well worth doing once in a life time.

Get reservations. Stayed at JW Marriott marquis but really wanted to see Burj Al Arab. Got reservations for a bar and the hotel is exquisite, absolutely stunning and perfect. I did not stay there but if I go back to Dubai I'd strongly consider it. 7 stars is a marketing ploy the staff was friendly but I'm not going to say they were better than what we got down the road.

Amazing - opulent - perfect! . Visited the Burj as a surprise long romantic weekend away and from start to finish, the entire stay far exceeded our expectations. Got a deal through Expedia and only paid £340/night which seemed reasonable when compared to other rates at the time. The view from our suite was incredible, the room furnished to the highest standard we've ever experienced. Ate out each night so didn't sample the restaurants, but the breakfast offerings were exceptional. Would highly recommend the Burj to anyone as a decadent treat away - it will not disappoint!

A 7 star hotel !. Well, if you are not in the mood for U$ 1000 rates you will probably join the bunch of its side beach tourists that look for a nice picture shot from this amazing build shape hotel.Unless you are registered you wont be able to see its interior but, if you do want to try one of its restaurants you can go in. Book by internet and have your restaurant vouvher printed and ready to show it at the hotel's road entrance! By the evening you can also check its Xmas like little light show around the building... Quite tacky but after all... U are in Dubai !
Afternoon tea . I had afternoon tea here at the skyview bar. It was amazing! The food left you wanting more and the view was excellent. Service is what you would expect from a 7* hotel!

Site visit. I did not stayed in the hotel, yet I enjoyed our site visit to view and feel first-hand the luxurious experience of this 7-star hotel. The facade and building is just incredible already plus the interiors, When you enter, you'll see a grand entrance and check-in procedures are not the ordinary process you used to have from other hotels, it's really VVIP experience. First category rooms are really spacious! I can't say anything more, from it's furnitures, bed and amenities! It will be worth your every penny spent. I had a chance to visit and see the restaurants inside, wonderfully decorated.

Burj khalfa good to see. Dubai mall main attraction will be burj khalifa and tollest building in uae.we can see building were ever in dubai.The music fountain is amazing.One will be the minus; fees little bit higher.Over all nice to see.

If you are looking for one of the best hotels in the world, with the best service, then this is the one!. Certainly one to put on your bucket list. We were fast tracked through the airport and then led to a white Bentley. My wife was presented a bouquet of roses. We then chose the El Divo DVD. Then floated our way to the hotel. There are no single rooms, only two level suits with a sweeping staircase. Of course you have you own butler who will record your every move in order to give you better service; from the time you get up, to what newspaper you read and what coffee or Tea you prefer? The invite to the managers reception party on the terrace of the 20th floor was surreal. There was a woman with a striking resemblance to Mary Antoinette, dressed in a full length ball gown standing in the middle of a table and moving around serving Sushi off of her dress. The complimentary champagne just kept flowing. Everything about the Burj Al Arab is 1st class. They even give you the whole range of Hermes for Men and also for Women as a gift in your bathrooms. Not cheap to eat or drink here but then 1st class never is.

ONE OF THE WORLDS BEST HOTELS. The moment you see this bldg you get mesmerised the way it looks and shaped. Standing firm on the sea it is one of the architectural wonders built.Before entering the hotel, you get zapped by the number of luxurious cars which are used to pick the elite guests staying in this grand and luxurious hotel. From a Hummer, a Merc to a Rolls Royce. It is a pleasure to the eye and deep hole in the pocket.Entering the lobby makes you stay there for almost an hour with those gold painted huge columns, the shops around the lobby, the music fountain and finally the decor & ambiance.Staying in this luxurious hotel will always be a dream come true, but atleast we could enjoy the nice buffet in the restaurant.After lunch, we could sneak to the top floor through the capsule lift which is at the back side of hotel which overlooks the sea and give you a breath taking view. But you could take your breadth the lift is on its top floor where there is a helipad stationed for the rich and the elite guests. Unfortunately, due to security reasons we could not step out of the lift also and had to return back to lobby.A must visit to this hotel with a deep hole in the pocket...

"True 7 star". I had been for dinner for the Arabic Alilwan Restaurant. The Ambience of this Hotel and restaurant is Awesome.I had choose for the dinner buffet which cost u Rupees12000 per person.The quality of food is good but the spread not huge but very good Service.Overall very good Its must and worth visit.

Wonderful Meal With Heart Attack Bill. Dinner at this mind blowing hotel was as good as we hoped. Staff particularly attentive and knowledgeable. Lorna took our order and was delightful although she did disappear on us towards dessert which was a bit disappointing. Food, location and the most amazing view all lived up to expectations. £875 for four was about what we expected to pay for three courses with wine for four of us. Hard to beat in the world!

Different than anything you have ever seen in Hotels. It will cost you around 50 Euro to go in, on some days they stop accepting visitors, sue to limits. so make sure you call before you go or just go and even if you do not get in, you will still be dazzled by the outside structure.
Wow!!!. The building, the landscape, the beach, sand and sun were perfect. I felt like enjoying a luxurious on the beach and suite here.

Business meeting . Burj Arab is one of the best Hotel built in class at Persian sea.Burj al Arab is finest destination for business meet and leisure.A world class hotel built with modern architecture.

Afternoon Tea at the Skyview Bar. A place I have wanted to visit for a while. Needless to say that a room was outside of my budget so decided to do afternoon tea at the Skyview bar. Booked a couple of days in advance by email for a 13.00 date with tea and scones.The ‘welcome’ gate checks to see if you have a booking, access to the hotel is for those on the list only and there were lots of people hanging around at the gates for photo opportunities go the hotel behind them.Arrived early as all reviewers have advised you to do so got to take a look round the entrance lobby and atrium. Its really a marvel of engineering. The toilets are also fab, you get a feel for any place by its toilets. The glass fronted elevator whisks you up to the 27th floor and the views are amazing.Not may people were taking afternoon tea the day I booked so I was treated to a magnificent window table and fussed over by the staff who were wonderful (as expected) Tea was fantastic, all courses well presented and delicious. Far too much for one so had to take home a doggy bag.Its pricey, but worth it. If you are treating someone or celebrating a special occasion its the place to be. If I had bottomless pockets, I would return and do it all over again.
Terrifying for me- but fab. This is en entire experience. From arrival, the lift, the museum and so on all good. Eye wateringly expensive for a phot- £58 !!!!!! But the pics were fun!

Pretty amazing at night. We were out for dinner nearby and ended up walking on the beach in front of the Burj Al Arab afterwards. The beach was deserted at night, and the view was pretty spectacular. Never went into the building but if you want a REALLY nice beach walk at night, its worth it.

Amaizing. Took my son there for afternoon tea because we couldn't get a reservation for lunch. The "tea" was about 7 courses and very delicious. The atmosphere was very special and the service was what you would expect from Dubai.
good view from outside. i have visited jumeirah beach and saw the beauty of this hotel. it is built on a small island and the entrance itself gives you a stunning distinction to any other top hotels.

Worth a visit. The burj Al Arab is a spectacular building. After having done the Asian high tea (not to everyone's tastes), we opted for the lobby level high tea for a second visit. The service was amazing, staff very attentive and friendly. The food itself was exquisite, 7 courses and each one very tasty. Haven't done the sky view bar but have been informed you need to get a seat by the window for it to be worth it! The high tea in the lobby was quite expensive but worth a visit if friends/family come to visit.

Amazing place!. On our recent trip to Dubai, we visited the new Gold on 27 at the Burj Al Arab. WOW is the first word that comes to mind! The views are breath-taking, incredible ambience and fantastic service. Our evening was made extra special by one of the managers, Agnese. She went out of her way to escort us up to the bars and give us a tour of the Skyview Lounge, even though she doesn't manage that part of the Burj. Agnese also took the time out to give us informative information about the Burj and its various eateries, it made our visit much more memorable. A 'must-do' when in town!

the worst place I've ever visited. the security guards are arrogant and no polite. They don't allow you to approach the place to take pictures. I had to cheat them to get to the lobby. Does not worth the efforts. It's a postcard that will not resist long (due to the behavior of the guards).

Amazing Experience. We made a reservation for afternoon tea in the Sky View Bar. Although it was very expensive it was worth every penny! Staff were very friendly and the food was lovely!! I would highly recommend

Great place. Was there for a photo-op, really loved it.
Enjoyed the evening with friends and the restaurants and all the other amenities are very good.

Among the nicest Towers worldwide. This is a combination of unique, marvelous, unforgettable tower that each person would dream to see. Exceptional decoration, rooms, restaurants, music and service. Extra expensive but it is worth once a life time.

The best place I have ever been too!!. My partner and I went for a Spa Day and it was worth every penny. We were greeted with a warm welcome and had afternoon tea before indulging in the spa facilities. The staff were on hand for your every need. The roof top pool had breathtaking views. I am already saving to stay in this place and I will return soon!!

Dubai's Pride!. From the rooms to Spa its excellent! the service is great and it is what i had expected to be. The spa is amazing, the pool for ladies and gents are big and excellent. I highly recommend to everyone who wants to experience the 7 Star Hotel in the world

paradies. we didnt stay at burj al arab but we went there for dinner at my birthday. you need to book a dinner at least 2 weeks before your date,its always booked. we payed about 450 euros for my husband and myself. the food was DELICIOUS and the price was ok for the best hotel ever. it is importent to say, that you need to book a chauffeur to get the entry to the hotel, otherwise they dont allow you to go in. so you cant go to the hotel with a taxi...luxery !!!

Excellent Meal. We can to Dubai and although we have been here before we had to come again. Excellent meal wine and drinks. Great service. Beautiful scenery and atmosphere Not your run of the meal restaurant but for a one off or special occasion great choice
Go for cocktails. I went to the cocktailbar, which needs a reservation beforehand. There is a minimum spend there, but you'll enjoy the view and the cocktails taste really good.

Afternoon Tea with Family - Stunning. We visited for afternoon tea - Which was fantastic, then we stayed in the bar and had cocktails at sundown which then turned into dinner. The atmosphere was great and the food sublime.

holiday. unfortunatly you cannot get close enough to this building there is security from afar. which is such a shame. we did try n pull a fast one to allow security to let us pass by saying we want to go through to do a booking but the gentleman said we had to be dressed in trousers and shirt and no sandals so maybe next time wer there we'l have to dress appropriately and try again!!!
Fantastic Architecture. Views are fantastic. One of the 7 star hotels in the world. Beach area is nice to have walk .There are lots of activities near the beach

Opulence at its very best. We only managed to visit this magnificent hotel as we were staying next door at the Jumeria Beach Hotel and they are partnered. The tour is really good and you are in absolute awe right from the reception lobby onwards. Every inch of this place is detailed or trimmed in gold or marble even the escalators. Talking of which going up them you'll see the most beautiful fish in the aquarium either side. The views from the restaurant are breathtaking so take your camera with you. Just wish we get the opportunity to stay here one day.

A landmark of Dubai!. The Burj Al Arab is worth a visit for a curious visitor (with deep pockets). Although the interior of the hotel is a little dated, the overall grandeur, not to mention the many restaurants, bars and cafe's, make this Dubai icon worth a visit, especially if you have the money to spend on a pass to the pool or the beach.

Is worth the experience! . Being in one of the most moderns and expensive hotels of the world is not something everybody can do. If you are willing to take the step and spend that amount of money go ahead and live the experience! The suites are big, comfortable, with luxury amenities. Butler service 24/7. The pools and restaurants are very modern and beautiful. The views unforgettable! Is an Arab experience!!
simply beautiful. its simply breathtaking, the location is near most of the tourist locations. the great view makes it even memorable.

Breath taking views. We didn't not actually stay at this hotel but we had booked to see inside it. Well it was well worth it. The views the from sky view bar were amazing. Afternoon tea cost over £100 each, but th experience is well worth it.

YOU'LL BE AMAZE FROM IT'S ARCHITECTURE DESIGN. It's a worth money to spend even for a lunch or dinner date with your love one. Ambiance was so great and romantic over viewing the sea and DubaiBeen there 2 times, definitely if there's a chance, will come back soon.

Great experience. What can I say? Treated my wife a stay for our 20th anniversary... What an experience. Truly one of the most luxurious hotel. A sweet treat from the management and GM of the hotel was a cake to make this occasion more special! Luxury to its best.

Not a fun place . Well Burj Al Arab isn't what you expect it to be. I visited the Spa. It was good but not as I expected. The beach is empty so not fun at all. All in all its not the fancy hotel you expect it to be.

The Most Luxurious hotel Ever. Havent seen anything like there 2 storey suit room. Breath taking view of the sea. Arabic restaurant buffet is wonderful. Free trip to wild wadi and also boat ride in madinat Jumeriah. Will surely stay again. It was worth the money spend

The best hotel in the world. My father has been saving up every year for the last 5 years to spend a week at this hotel. Yes it is very expensive and yet you do get what you pay for. The food, the staff, the atmosphere is heavenly, not to mention that every room is two floors and incredibly beautiful, overlooking the city. The staff obey your every whim which gets a tad embarrassing and you blush from their lovely attitude as early as the very arrival at the hotel. Wish I was there now..

Excellent High Tea. We had a high tea here on a recent visit and whilst not cheap it was a wonderful experience. As we were not guess at the hotel we had booked online and this was the only way you could visit this hotel. The food, and service was excellent and in my opinion well worth the money spent.

whats all the fuss about?. i came here expecting a lot, and because everyone says you cannot come Dubai without seeing the Burj al Arab, so i went and saw it. I have to say, i wasn't so keen on it. Because it so iconic, it feels and stands so isolated, and when you walk in I'm not sure the fish scale architectural design was really my cup of tea. It;s definitely unique and magnificent for some, but I felt it was over hyped and really missed the warm ambience of Arabian style hospitality. It's almost like they found the most unique idea they could, and said were having it! I eat in al sahara seafood restaurant, i loved the fish tank, and the fish (George)it was enjoyable to watch, otherwise I did't really feel the food matched the price tag.
Iconic Burj Al Arab. A must see icon of Dubai. Can be seen at close up or from a distance along the shoreline. Its distinctive sail like design is unique to Dubai.

Great Property!!. Did not stayed in this property as we were booked in Atlantis but its a 5 Star wonder which people often mistaken for 7 Star, the property and the location is itself a major attraction for tourist coming to Dubai.
Magnificent. We had lunch here and once again the staff were exceptional making this a wonderful experience the views are spectacular - not to be missed
From A Far. Haven't been inside the complex, saw it from the beach and it's still as majestic and extravagant as it is.
Aperitivi. We had a lovely time for aperitif at the sky bar before we went for dinner .the place is breath taking you must visit if in Dubai

Love the Property. I just did not get around to writing about the place.. but it is 5 star wonderful.. I stayed only one night with my friend and honestly did not want to leave. A bucket list experience.

60th birthday treat booking with afternoon tea. Booked afternoon tea for my wife's 60th birthday. The staff were great and very friendly. The champagne and food was excellent. The hotel itself is unbelievable an engineering masterpiece
7 Stars - Sez Who. It is an outstanding hotel. The lobby will take your breath away. The lounge at the top is worth a visit alone. Worth what it takes to get in to see.
What an experience!!. This structure is simply stunning. It is the worlds only seven star hotel. The hotel is highly recommended for very special occasions.
The only one. The only 7 stars in the world and yes i know why ...its a magic hotel every floor it s magic, every floor you have something to see ,the smell of the hotel is also special, it s unique

High tea. We booked into the high tea at The Sky lounge. We didn't stay at the hotel.We booked in for the high tea about 5 months before our desired date and we booked through the hotel's website. You can choose what time your sitting will be. we requestaed a table by the window which they cannot guarantee. We caught a taxi to the hotel. We were a little early but this gave us time to have a wander around the foyer and look at the amazing furnishings and decor. We were seated next to the window which overlooked the Jumeirah beach and Jumeirah Beach hotel. The food was lovely and plentiful. We had the option with a glass of champagne.The waiter kept asking us if we wanted more. Sandwiches, scones. pastries, mini pies and sorbet! My husband wanted a beer- he had a London Pride which worked out to about $35 Aussie dollars! He sure enjoyed it! It was a wonderful experience but definitely a "once in a lifetime!" Expensive but worth it!
Amazing architectural hotel. Burj Al Arab is a true amazing work of engineering . built in the sea, a beautiful place to take some good HDR Photo both in day and night
Good Structure. I visited this landmark from outside only. Good for photos and the Burj Al Arab beach is also close to this hotel for spending time.

Afternon Tea - Amazing Experience. Had afternoon team here as a special treat and it was worth every penny. Hotel is beyond amazing. Every staff member was extremely friendly and helpful. Food was just beautiful and we had a fantasic view of Dubai. Would highly recommend as a treat - just has to be done!! Tried lots of new drinks like Almond Ice Coffee and Passionfruit Iced Tea.Glass of Champagen included in price. More food was available if you required it but in all honesty we struggled to complete the full menu as it was. Hotel is described as 7 stars and it definately lives up to it.

Luxury at its Finest!. This hotel exceeds our expectations every time we go. This was our second visit, and this time my boyfriend/lover surprised me with the presidential suite. It was fantastic. Every luxury your could imagine was there.

Awesome place, exceeded expecations. The service is beyond anything that I have experienced in any hotel across the world. Nothing is too much trouble and the staff will do anything to keep the guests happy. Very high standards of cleanliness. We ate all over the Jumeriah area and every restaurant was excellent. The neighbouring beaches which are private and belong to the group are excellent, also patrolled by at times more lifeguards than guests. A wonderful wonderful hotel and resort.

Great. There is no doubt that the Burj Al arab is the most stunning hotel in the world. Inside it is so beautiful! Me and my family came here for dinner and the staff were amazing and couldn't do enough for you. The restaurant we were in had amazing views and had a good atmosphere. Some of the food was nice yet some of it wasn't. It was very expensive but worth the experience to say that we have done it. I wouldn't return to this restaurant because I think that the food was actually better in our own hotel that we stayed in. However, it was definitely worth the experience.
Good balding. I visit. Own time very buteful design building rally I like good stuff and I'm happy there I want this again and I will sure go bak

Just brilliant. Its really a wonderland. Surrounded by sea, an incredible piece of engineering. You will be overwhelmed by the beauty. What you see from outside is just a trailer of the great show thats within
Architectural marvel!. This is one of the great architectural achievements of the world and it is brilliantly designed. You have to see this!
Must see. Trippers we didn't book to get a tour of this place but also ran out of time however we did take a trip down there to see this amazing 7 star structure.

Outstanding. The words get short when you talk about Burj Al Arab hotel. The class on its own and you feel like a king even if you are near to it. Next time I would definitely go for high Tea, missed out due to shortage of time.
Architectural Masterpiece. In this place you see the engineering genius and design of this stunning tower. That is making the Burj Al Arab one of the landmarks in Dubai. Thanks Government of Dubai.

Burj Al Arab...Iconic, Exclusive and most importantly Accessible for All!. If you are visiting Dubai, a visit to the Burj Al Arab is a must. This iconic 7-star hotel has long been seen to most as the "too exclusive or not easily accessible" for the norm. Most people settles with adoration and long gaze from the outside only. It must be one of the most photographed building in the world. Wouldn't it be great if it was more accessible to the general public and one could say..."I've been inside and saw"? The good news is that it is now possible and a lot more accessible for all. I recently visited the Burj Al Arab with visitors from out of town and we booked in their newest addition "Gold on 27th". This stunning, state-of-the-art exclusive lounge allows you to book and come for a drink without a minimum spent. You could visit and have one drink only if this is what your budget allows (starting at 100AED approximately) although we can all agree that this is extremely reasonable considering that it gives you access to one of the most prestigious building in the world!
Awesome Place. You will be stunned to see Hotel amidst water of oceans . We had just outer view but outer view was also must visit when in dubai .
Stunning. This place is just stunning,from the way it looks outside to the way it looks inside,If you get the chance to visit here then take it.

Must see if you in Dubai . Built in 1994 this landmark is a most see if You in Dubai stands above of the ocean connected with a narrow bridge to the landFrom what I heard is the only hotel in the world that's more than five stars Anybody who's interested in architectural.ideas this is for youThis place takes luxury to another level we went there for a quick bike it was very pricey for one-day visit but if it's something that's in your bucket list it's worth it hey we only live once

VERY GOOD HOTEL. I had the opportunity to have a birthday dinner here without paying the ridiculous price of a room. I stayed at a resort which is also operated by Jumeirah, which is a 5-minute golf cart ride from the Burj Al-Arab.The service was AWESOME. Remember this is a World Renowned Hotel. You are required to purchase certain items on the menu.

WOW. This is such an iconic building in Dubai, and it is stunning inside. Even if you don’t actually go into the hotel itself it makes for great photos and you can get great views of it from the adjacent beaches and from Wild Wadi, the water park. It is extremely expensive to stay here prices hover around the £2,000 mark per night! Nonetheless it is an incredible piece of engineering.

The most amazing tea time ever!. We did not stay in this hotel but we did schedule a tea time way in advance to have at the restaurant that hangs off the back of the hotel. This was the most lavish tea time ever. So worth the money just to see the inside of one of the nicest hotels in the world!
Evening drinks. Impressive but missed out on the view as went in the evening. Warning - drinks aren't cheap but it's a tick box on your Dubai visitor list. Go do it!
Burj al arab. Its a very beautiful buliding and most popler area and desion vry good all of side see burj another agle

Afternoon tea. We booked this by email the day before. Escorted to sky view bar. There was maybe six couples for the 1 pm sitting. We all had a window seat which was great. We started with champagne then other drinks were included, alcohol not included. The food was amazing and far too much. The quality was very good. The service was friendly and helpful. Yes it is a bit of money for afternoon tea but we both felt it was worth it. The hotel is nice and you get plenty of opportunity to take photos. I would recommend as a few hours of luxury.

Looks ready to sail off to sea. We saw it from the beach while doing a tour of Dubai. It is a popular backdrop to many tourist photos and is very imposing sitting on its little island looking out to sea.

Dubai 2016. Excellent piece of Engineering looks amazing from the beach, if you wanted to go and look from inside you have to buy a ticket, and anyone without ticket wouldn't be allowed to enter unless your staying at hotel.
In love. I'm just in love with Burji Al Arab.Absolutely fantastic.The beach is near the hotel and with the little cars you can go everywhere around the Jumeirah in a few minutes.

Afternoon tea here was the highlight of my trip!. I booked the 1pm afternoon tea which was quite expensive (about $170 USD before tip) but it was so worth it! Went for my birthday and they gave me an extra little cake to celebrate. The food and drinks were delicious and I was super stuffed afterward. Couldn't even finish!The view was STUNNING. They gave me a window seat which was probably the best one on that floor. The service was above and beyond...they would trip over themselves to serve you. Overall I would highly recommend at least once since it was my favorite part of Dubai!
Awesome view. Its near the beach awesome view from beach. Nice arch .Superb piece of architecture. Must visit site atleast once.
Amazing hotel. Booked sky view bar one evening what an experience. Minimum charge per head but service and views unbelievable. Would definitely return for a very special occasion

Cheesecake in Scape . The good part of about the cheesecake in Scape north deck in Burj Al Arab has fancy look with delicious test, extra ordinary menu Highly recommend that.
I love it

Fantastic. we celebrated our daughter first birthday there.
Afternoon tea and a tour of the place , fantastic, I would love to go back sometime

WHAT A WASTE! . We ate here... although its a great building.. unless you are an architect and are into this aspect.. save your money..We were still hungry after spending near £400 for two of us..I'm not poor but reflecting on it i would say "what a waste of money" Eat elsewhere.. stay elsewhere and you WILL BE HAPPIERP.S: now I know why price lists for the restaurants are hard to come by! If you knew how much they charged you would not go either!
Symbol of Dubai. Whenever looks feeling Wow by it design and surrounding environment. Favorite place always when going to Dubai.
Stunning . I went to this attraction and I thought it was absolutely beautiful create a great back drop to any picture from jameriah beach:)

7-Star Hotel, in Dubai !. I wish I could afford to spend, at least, 3 days as a guest of Burj al Arab. While this still did not happen, I paid a visit-tour, including lunch (self-service) at this magnificent hotel. The tour is well organized and it is available to guests of most 4-5 stars hotels, in Dubai. It takes around 3 hours and the lunch is included. The price is compatible for what you get from it (around US$100). The accommodations of the hotel are so beautiful, sophisticated, clean. The crew is very well trained and the visitors are treated with respect and consideration.

The spa is amazing. I want staying in this hotel I stayed in the jumeirah beach hotel. Which was amazing however I booked the spa with my boyfriends mum. It was amazing from the word go. The hotel staff were amazing and very helpful. The hotel spa is gorgeous and the staff who provided the treatments were lovely. Would definitely go again.

One of the Icons of Dubai. I did not actually go inside of the Burj Al Arab, but enjoyed the view from the beach. It is just one of those buildings you have to see. During the summer visibility is decent.One if the best views is actually from Wild Wadi water park, but you cant bring cameras besides your cell.

Dramatic decor and vibrant atmosphere. I went to Burj Al Arab for dinner in their famous seafood restaurant. The interiors are rather OTT, with printed carpet and aquarium lined walls as you go up the escalator. It is a small scale Atlantis in terms of the shops decorating the lobby and the amount of tourists scattered around the lobby. All in all - it is kind of what i expected it to be.

Afternoon Tea . Absolutely stunning hotel. Went for afternoon tea and it didn't disappoint. We arrived early so we had a look around..wow! We pre booked online for 16.00hrs via the hotel website and requested window seats.The views from the top of the hotel are amazing! The afternoon tea is made up of 7 courses and you will be stuffed afterwards. Unlimited free tea/coffee and soft drinks. Dress smartly. It's an expensive afternoon tea but it's worth doing for the experience. Bring your reservation reference number with you or print out the email as security require it before you go into the hotel. You can only access this hotel with a reservation.

One of the most beautiful hotels in Dubai .. Today I was invited to this hotel by my friend who works there. Burj Al Arab is one of the most beautiful hotels in Dubai and I could not agree more to this compliment. The form of this hotel is a big beautiful sailing boat, actually it is located on a man made island and it was opened in 1999 with only 202 rooms. All of them are suits.
