I visited one of the suits and I have to say that it is so so beautifully decorated in every detail. Every suit has sea view. In fact, every room has the sea view. There are several restaurants, bars and coffee shops, and swimming pools. I can not believe my eyes when I see the view from the hotel rooms. I had coffee in the coffee shop and my coffee had grinned gold leave in it! This is definitely a seven star hotel. One cannot just go see this hotel, one needs a reservation or an appointment to enter this hotel. It is the hotel's policy. I was glad I went.

Best of the best. Must visit. Sky bar has a minim spend of 350 AED but well worth the view and how the other half live. You will not get better service in any other hotel. Must book otherwise you will not get in. Give it a visit you will enjoy the experience.

Nice architecture. If you are looking for nice architecture to look at then Burj Al Arab is one of the nicest buildings in Dubai. You will however have to pay to enter if you are not going to one of the restaurants inside the Burj. Best view you can get it from 360 which is a bar located in the middle of the water close to the Burj.

Awful! . Food here is really bad! Service is great but our seafood was really Overcooked and not something you would expect from such a restaurant. Desserts were nice but mains were really bad. Wouldn't visit again.

Brew of afternoon tea. I have always wanted to visit Burj al Arab…although being a foodie I opted for the Skyview Tea instead of the many world class buffet(s)…also I am not English (to enloy tea) !!!..However, the view of Dubai city, Palm Islands and the Persian Gulf from the 27th floor was breath-taking! Great food and service! A truly memorable experience of “Style in the Sky” and I pleasantly enjoyed their brew of afternoon tea!

"Live your life to the Fullest". Going for High Tea at the most expensive hotel in the world you better be on time. Let's get right to my experience . Just driving up to The Burj Al Arab is a breathtaking Feeling. We went at 8.00pm perfect time to see all the lights. The staff was friendly and patient. I love tea so I just could not stop trying the different teas offered. The sandwiches and pastries was quite delicious too. As you can see in my photos, I had a lovely time. If you want to impress your date, take him or her to the Burj Al Arab . Uber works perfect in Dubai just a other tip.
only the 7 star hotel. the iconic landmark of Dubai, the Burj Al Arab Hotel only 7 start sail like hotel in the world is must place to visit

be treated as a celebrity. what dreams are made ofIt may seem expensive ,but the high tea is worth every penny.the whole experience was amazing, welcomed to the hotel by a 7 foot tall African warrior ,still does not prepare you for the views of the foyer blues and gold every where.A must

Luxury stay . We stayed at the 7* Burj Al Arab as a Christmas family treat. We spent a lot of money and so had high expectations. We weren't disappointed!!We were greeted by name in the foyer. We were shown to our floor where our butler took us to our room for check in. We had complimentary drinks while we checked in.The room was on 2 floors. The bathroom was massive with a jacuzzi bath to fit for the whole family to dive in! The walk in shower was the most amazing thing ever.All toiletries were by Hermes. Both men and ladies with perfume and aftershave to take away.The children got wild wadi toiletries which they loved.The sweet train which comes to your room after the complimentary afternoon tea was greeted with great enthusiasm.The free pass to wild wadi was the icing on the cake for the kids.All in all we couldn't have been happier with out stay.

What an after tea in Dubai. This hotel truly deserves it's 6 star status . Afternoon tea or just dinning at the restaurant is a must. The view, the service, the food all just stunning. Dining in paradise is the best way to describe our afternoon tea in the restaurant. The views out over Dubai were sensational, the afternoon tea food was delicious and very generously served - seconds and thirds were no problem. The staff were all very friendly nothing was too much trouble. It was so very relaxing sitting at the table looking out over Dubai enjoying a wonderful meal we didn't want to leave - there was no rush from the hotel for us to leave we could have stayed all day.It really is a must to book afternoon tea here.Adrian & Di
Afternoon Tea in the Skyview. What a wonderful experience, fantastic food and service from the team and huge thanks to Gotham who looked after us on this very special occasion
Awesome view!. Breath taking view at night, prices fluctuate based on season and level. Lovely experience for first time visitors.
What a place, worths a visit. We spoiled ourselves by spending a night at this great place. The experience was all worth it. Everything is lined with luxury. The food is great.

Land Mark on Dubai. This place Burj'Al Arab is a famous landmark for Dubai next to Burj Khalifa. When Burj Khalifa was not built, this building was holding the landmark flag for Dubai.. This is a 7 star hotel situated near Jumeirah Beach. If you go around the beach, just go to this place for some photo shoots.You can plan this visit when you plan for Mall of Emirates or Jumeirah beach. from Mall of emirates, you can take a bus. You can spend around 20 minutes for this place.
Just a place you have to go to!. This is a Place you want to say: I've been there. The Worlds only 7 star hotel!Have many choises of restaurant- see their homepage and book the table in advance!

Just 4 few clicks. Burj Al Arab, is a marvel and example of a well planned architecture. If you could afford a High Tea, you could pre reserve it and follow the dress code to enjoy the marvel of the tea with a cool overview of the sea else if you are on a budget, a perfect view from any side could capture you in your camera for a perfect memory.

The closer you get the better it looks. I wish I could afford to stay in this most famous hotel on the planet. But even standing outside, on the public beach, some distance from it makes you feel like you are looking at something special. It really is a beautiful piece of architecture.

Wonderful Afternoon Tea experience!. I booked to go to the Burj for afternoon tea with a friend - it was both our birthday celebration which I told them about. They made it really special with individual birthday cakes in addition to the fantastic selection of food. I also have to say as my friend is veggie, she was well serviced with interesting vegetarian options - aubergine/courgette and really interesting concoctions and combination - she was in heaven. It is pricey, but I have been there a number of times for both afternoon tea and dinner, and would definitely say that afternoon tea is the best - as you have the view as well of course!

afternoon tea. Well worth a look in this amazing hotel, Afternoon tea was more like a feast with lovely sandwiches and cakes that just kept coming.In the sky bar at top of the hotel with amazing views over the palm and the world.

Dinner Pairing. Upon the suggestion of an associate, we booked the 7 course meal with wine pairing. The setting of the hotel was lovely but the overall experience was not 7 star. It was a confusing and somewhat disjointed dinner event as we pre-chose our courses and then went from restaurant to restaurant to dine. While I enjoyed seeing the differences in the restaurants, not every course was outstanding nor the service impeccable. The dessert of apple tatin was superb as was my foie gras. The remainder of the meal was just average. For the wine pairing, I felt the choices were rather ordinary. For the price, I would struggle to recommend to others. It has such promise if done with a personal concierge who escorts you throughout the experience from restaurant to restaurant and ensures things are perfect. My guess is they don't do it very frequently so all the kinks aren't worked out.
Breakfast in style.... I took my visitors from the USA for breakfast and they were very happy. It was like dream come true for them and for us also.

High tea delight. Booked in on the top floor for High Tea. OMG what not to say this was more than I expected and I expected the best. You have to experience the high tea not the one on the ground level but up in the sky. Food and plenty of it delicious. The plates or I should say the glass plates and the patterns/shapes were art in themselves. IT is something I will never forget they made it special and nothing was a problem. They asked if we were celebrating anything special, I told them we had an anniversary whilst in Dubai and before we left they present us with a long stem rose and a cake especially for our occasion. People say it is expensive I suppose it was, I paid for it in Australia before I left and I can say it was worth every cent. The view along is incredible. Just came back from Dubai this June 2016 and stayed at The Palms Atlantis Dubai, thoroughly enjoyed that also.

Wow. My wife took me here for my 1st time and alls I can say is wow this is amazing and had the most amazing views over Dubai.We went in the night and had some drinks along with some snacks and the service was outstanding.The pics we got from outside were out of this world and the decor inside is also out of this world.

Outside only Review. You can't come to Dubai and not see this world famous landmark.However, if you're not planning to eat or stay here, make sure to plan wisely because it is technically in the middle of nowhere (at least attraction wise).There is a beach nearby where you can get some nice photos, but I'd recommend if you're planning on doing some day tours, pick one where they include taking you here to avoid being left wandering around in the heat looking for a taxi.Also, it looks a lot smaller in real life than we expected.

Little taste of luxury. We went to the Skyview Bar for drinks - it was an incredible experience from start to finish. With a booking, you are allowed entry to the hotel so we arrived in time to have a look round the lobby etc before our reservation. At first we were seated in the centre of the bar, however once a couple had vacated one of the window tables our waiter ensured that we were moved swiftly to enjoy the amazing view over Dubai at night. The drinks were superb - great selection of wines and cocktails. Nibbles are also provided and replenished regularly - we were provided with so much food that we ended up not needing any dinner. The whole bar has an air of luxury about it that is characteristic of Dubai and the Burj Al Arab. We would definitely recommend this as an experience not to miss whilst in Dubai, it was definitely ones of the highlights of my 3 month stay there!
YES. Highly recommend at least visiting the hotel as well as staying the bottom floors! I was fortunate to have a friend who was staying in the underwater rooms- got an insider tour ;)

So high! Beautiful and clean with spectacular views. The elevator going up was sooo cool! The views were just out of this world, could see so much from the top. There are restaurants and shops around the burj and you could eat up there too. Very very clean with cleaners everywhere! Very well worth seeing.
Nice place. Hotel is situated at beach. Very good place to visit. You need to stay or dine-in at this hotel to visit this hotel from inside.

Service like no other hotel. This was a special vacation for our family. The hotel is expensive, very expensive BUT well worth it. If you want to be "king for a day" come here. You get so much for the money you pay it is a value added stay.
Take care. The view is amazing that's for sure. The lift travels at high speed which affected my middle ear and made me feel very ill and dizzy !
Burj Al arab. i really liked this 7 star hotel as my friends also lied it very much even we visited around 8 peoples together.

Worth visiting once. Advance booking required beforehand even for a visit...Overwhelming view from outside, bright blue and golden garishly designed interiors...More hyped than its actual worth, unless you have dough to burn on nothing else

Overrated. If you want to pay $165/person for tea with some sandwiches and snack go ahead. Make your reservation with time. For us it wasn't worth it.
And if you don't want to pay that, don't even try to go to the hotel because they won't let you in without a reservation.

I visited this fabulous hotel in its first year when it had just opened.... I studied in Bangkok/ Thailand business and engineering. I had stop overs in Dubai/ UAE on my flights back from Far East to Germany. I used the opportunity to visit this fabulous hotel in its first years of opening.I enjoyed the phantastic view over Jumeirah Beach, with its endless sand deserts (at that time there were very few buildings). I rented a 4- Whel- drive jeep and an experienced driver to see the desert around this hotel and around the city of Dubai.Dubai in the 1990ies was much, much smaller than today - "The Palm", "The World" didn't exist. Population was only 1/5 of today. Traffic in Dubai City was much less than today.I visited the restaurant/ cafe in the top of the hotel several times and I enjoyed the breathtaking view over Jumeirah area.

Fabulous. I believe this is the only 7 star hotel in the world? We didn't actually go inside but our guide described the suites have been rented by many celebrities. It is close to Jumeirah beach which is in a luxurious residential area in the city. It was very hot to be on the beach but an amazing landmark to see.

Human Marvel !. You admire the engineering marvel of building a beautiful seven star hotel in the midst of a sea and when you enter it you are bound to be awestricken by grandeur ambience !Worth visiting once ! Dr.K.Sundar, Dubai .

Afternoon tea WOW !. We had afternoon tea here and it was stunning ,we were served so elegantly and in suroundings that were stylish and full of class .The food was beautiful and each course ,think we had seven ,was served with top clas service .We were dlighted with the gold on the coffee ,mmm perfect end to a perfect meal .
beautoful hotel. we also saw this hotel from the air when we were on the sea plane which is great value for money - maybe one day when the lottery comes up we will stay there

Service impeccable . Wow... Can honestly say the best service I have experienced anywhere in the world. We got out of transport provided by hotel from the airport to be greeted be Katie who knew my name as I stepped out of the car.We are the given refreshments and a cool towel - it was 42 degrees - and told our 'upgraded' room was ready for us to check in. Shame I only stayed one day cannot wait to return for an extended visit...!

Burj Al Arab. The Burj Al Arab looks good in photos, better when you are approaching it, but when you are up close and personal with the shape of this hotel and sitting on a beautiful blue water with white,white sand in the foreground, then its magnificentAnd what a beach to enjoy and its open to everyone. The city even supplies sunbeds with WiFi on the beach and were installing some when we visited. Of course you wouldn't be able to stay too long in he sun
High Tea & spectacular views. High Tea a must do (bucket list) spectacular view all round , fine dining , excellent service, great food, also exclusive shops on 1st floor, don't miss out.

Photo Stop only. This was part of a private city tour. It was good to finally be able to see the building, if only from the outside. It was just as dramatic as I'd heard and the tour guide had lots of information as well. Will plan for a tour of the inside on a different visit!

Top class. Great hotel don't be put off by the glitz and money. From the moment you cross over the bridge into it you will be amazed by the place. A beautiful lobby area with a few expensive shops, the fountain will keep you amazed with its dancing water. We enjoyed a couple of hours in the bar overlooking the gulf and city at night spectacular views. It's not cheap but well worth the experience if only for the smoke salmon and caviar canopies which are used to replace the usual bowl of crisps on your table.
marvelous. burj al arab is much more than hotel.. it has got private beach.the view from the higher floors is swesome.

Sky Fall. The overabundance of hotel rooms in Dubai at the moment has got all hotels, including this one, chasing business. The new deck is attractive but in my view detracts slightly from the multi-star experience. The Sky bar's standards have also dropped a bit recently, in my view.So still fantastic - but probably overpriced and standards not as high as they were.
Me and my wife stayed at the hotel. This was was our second visit stay at this exceptional worldclass hotel eachtime we had fantastic time.everything is perfect and for sure we will visit again

Gold Bar. For the cost - not one of my better experiences of a Dubai sky bar. The cocktail list is a little 'way out' and the description did not meet what was actually put in front of me.Staff though are attentive & very happy to explain the menu.

Evening 4 course dyer meal . Visited last nite after years of wanting to visit this hotel...What to follow disappointed me hugely! We ate on the 27th floor"sky view" The entrance and the lift to get to the top was impressive, so I really thought expectations would carry on through the night! We ordered our 4 course dishes which was low in choice only two choice on the course! My partner order a "cheese salad" which sounded ok, but when it arrived I was in shock to see some lettuce leaves and a couple of shavings of cheese on the plate! For a 7* hotel this is a total disappointment.. We didn't even have a view from our seat either, even tho when we arrived there was better seats available!My main was not great atall, just a piece of sea bream surrounded by basic vegetable mix.. Was nothing special atall..Also felt very rush from start to finish Always someone waiter behind you looking to see if you was finished. Four times we got ask if we wanted wine, even tho we are not wine drinkers And already had two drinks each on the table already! When i went to the toilet I was followed by one of the waitresses even tho she told me where the toilets was, this experience was not nice atall and if I already haven't paid the meal via another party I would 100% refused to not pay considering it was £140pp I wouldn't of even payed £60 for this.. Total shambles for such a high profile hotel this restaurant certainly lets you down.
Trip of a lifetime. Fabulous service although it is a bit over the top. Somewhere if you really want to push the boat out but I wouldn't go back
7 stars !!. I wasn't very found about the Burj al-Arab at first but when you're inside you easily realize why it's called 7 stars. I would recommend it definitely but be sure to have the budget

Love the view! . Only visited as part of a tour so got to see the outside in all its glory. Did not disappoint! The amazing white structure with its blue window panes, helipad and great height make this building look like a great ships sail. Very unique design making it stand out in its perfect setting. Dubai is known for the Burj Al Arab and it definitely did it justice! Unfortunately did not get to see the inside...maybe next time.

High Tea the best In The Wold!. I have tried High Tea in every major city in the world but this one is the best by far! The silver service, the SERVICE, the delicious food and the tray of small cakes to choose from, absolutely worth the money. You can't just arrive at the Burj as a tourist and take a look around, you need to have an appointment so do yourself a favour and book in for afternoon tea as High Tea, Dress appropriately as this is an extremely lovely place.
View from afar. This is another of those must sees in Dubai, we wanted to have some photos taken of us with this in the background. We used the Yellow Boats tour to do this.

Symbol of Dubai. Before the Burj Khalifa, the iconic symbol of Dubai was the Burj Al Arab. It's most distinctive sail shaped silhouette as well known as the Eiffel Tower and the Sydney Opera House. Luxury hotel, built on reclaimed land, near the beach. Has helipad. Once the tallest hotel but, now dwarfed by Dubai's multiple skyscrapers.
Great architecture. Came so close to it but could not get inside. The call it the Unofficial 7 star hotel. I wish i could have gone inside.
High Tea. Don't miss a chance for a HighTea at this beautiful hotel. No High Tea compares to this and should be included in any bucket list.
Like Sail Boat. If you are in Jumeira Beach then you can see this BURJ very good and you can take some photos. Absolutely you can’t go inside without check in or reserve a visiting tour.

Amazing service in a beautiful location. We came here for an important birthday and it was totally worth it! I emailed back and forth before the trip to make reservations and they were polite and courtious the whole time. We had our names checked at the gate and then proceeded to the entrance. The whole place screams elegance and luxury. The uniforms of the staff are beautiful; from the doormen outside, the receptionist, the bell boys and the wait staff. The main lounge has a huge water feature as you enter. We were here during Ramadan and they had beautiful gold cresent moon and stars decorations throughout. The acquarium on either side are beautiful and well stocked. We even saw a man inside the tank in scuba gear cleaning!The upmarket boutiques in the hall way are nice to look in and the staff are helpful. We went to the Junsui lounge where we had cocktails and tapas. The food was delicious and the drinks were amazing. It was my mother's birthday and they brought her a complimentary cake with candles. This was a nice tough and we are very greatful for their thoughtfulness. We had the option where it was 300dhm per person for 1 drink and 2 tapas or 2 drinks and 1 tapa. We also were brought nuts and olives to munch on. The ambience was beautiful and luxurious and we were glad we had dressed up. For a special occasion this is an amazing experience. We went for a little walk around after eating and saw the pools and outdoor seating areas, all beautifull maintained and displayed.

Wow. We decided to splurge out and stay here one night, celebrating our wedding anniversary. It was worth every penny. We wandered around the entire complex, looking at everything (somehow we even saw the garage!) After our Butler showed us all that moved and opened and closed, we decided to open a bottle of wine. Couldn't remember (or find) where the drinks cabinet was.... Had to call the Butler back! The staff of course go out of their way to assist you and will stop what they are doing to take a photo of you and your partner together. Nothing is too much trouble. The hotel also surprised us with a cake and a dozen red roses to celebrate our anniversary. Would have loved to stayed longer.

don't bother visiting the bar on the 27th? floor. this place was so tacky like something out of a star wars film. truly it was the doggiest hotel, way too may tourists taking selfies etc not at all high end luxury or boutique

Nice Photo Op. So i'm sure everyone knows you cannot go inside this 7 star hotel without being a checked in guest or visitor having a meal or tea at a restaurant inside. So the best views to snap photos would be taking the Hop On/Hop Off bus. These buses in Dubai are different in that the upper deck is air conditioned so go up on top and you will have some great unobstructed photos of this gorgeous sail shaped hotel!
Anniversary. Drinks in the Skyview Bar and then supper in the restaurant on the same floor, Al Muntaha, was an exquisite way to celebrate our wedding anniversary. The food was superb !
Birthday treat. Booked in for afternoon tea. As it was a special birthday we were given the best table with the most magnificent views. The food and service were amazing. Loved the whole experience.

Afternoon Tea at the Skyview Lounge. There are very few places in the World where you want to go willingly that are jaw droppingly expensive. That being said, I was invited to have afternoon tea at the Burj Al Arab with a group of friends and family so off I went fully aware that this was not going to be cheap and that I was going to have to pay for this priviledge. Having been a doorstep sandwich and mug of tea bloke all my life, I felt like Gulliver being invited to a Lilliputian tea party. The greeting of a glass of champagne lulled me into believing this experience was going to be normal. However, it all went surreal. This hotel is luxurious and you need to go through a checkpoint just to make sure you were actually booked in. Then there's the beautiful women and ornately gold decor. Tea time in Alice in Wonderland was never like this and a visit to the Skyview Bar helped as two more bottles of Louis Rodden champagne blew my mind. Spectacular experience.
super spa. i went there with friends to spa, very cool one! pool, sauna, view. clean and expensive. nice experience.

Didn't have the chance. Unfortunately I didn't have the chance to visit it from the inside. By what I know it's one of the most expensive hotels in the entire world, and with a helicopter pad (helipad). I'm posting some photos done with my phone from Jumeirah hotel

Iftar Buffet in Al Iwan restaurant. This buffet was definitely over the top. The dishes at the table for breaking the fast not only looked amazing, but tasted incredible, too. The dinner included a wide assortment of salads, soups, meats, vegetables and desserts. I believe that there had to have been something for everyone. The staff was extremely attentive to our every need. We followed dinner with an after dinner drink at the Skyview Bar on the 23rd floor. They had an amazing cocktail menu. I couldn't believe the presentation of the drinks. That made it so much fun!The whole experience of being inside the Burj Al Arab, a 7⭐️ Hotel, was pretty surreal. We can now cross that off our bucket list!

Splendor in the Sea. This review is quite late. Burj Al Arab is a beautiful building located at Jumeirah Road by the sea. It is one of the first luxury hotels with a 7 star rating. Definitely, it is not for everyone, just for the rich and the famous!

An iconic building not easy to get into. It is an iconic building built like a sail over water. Like many things in UAE and especially in Dubai, there are artificial lands, bays and beaches. Burj Al Arab is also built on an artificial island just off Jumeirah beach. There is a private bridge that connects it to the mainland. Given it is a hotel there is restricted entry to this building. Apparently if you are not a guest and want to go into the building you have to book one of the restaurants and then you are allowed in. We did not do so therefore cannot comment on the inside of the building. We only saw it from the outside. If you want to see this off the Hop-On-Hop-Off bus be prepared for a long walk in the hot weather. As construction is still happening around the Burj Al Arab the views even from outside are limited. We did not fly around Dubai to see this building but I assume this service exists and it might be the best way to see the outside of the building

Beautiful afternoon tea!. To celebrate our graduation we made a reservation at the Skyview bar and it was absolutely amazing! Kumar was our waiter and he was always ensuring our hands were full with food and drink. The afternoon tea was a package and so there was a lot included but even we couldn't eat it all! The view was also stunning and the service was incredible.
Burj al arab. we been at beach straight near burj al arab.it famouse building and everybody must have pict from there )at night time with lights visible from many places
Afternoon tea. We went for afternoon tea it was fantastic well worth the money for the experience not rushed at all really lovely food and great champagne

"A hotel of class and panache". Burj Al Arab is one of a kind hotel, if one gets a chance to stay or even dine its an experience by itself. Nevertheless even if your not staying there amazing pictures can be shot from all sides of Jumeira.

One of my most-loved properties in Dubai. One of the nice things about visiting the hotel for Evening Snacks is that you can get a sense for the hotel without shelling out the money it costs to stay there. And I'm happy i did, because this place is fascinatingly obnoxious... And i kind of mean that as a compliment, because that's their goal.The experience to visit Sky View Bar was Amazing. Every detail does not go unnoticed. Being treated like royalty from the moment we get entered. Truly memorable...❤
Afternoon tea. Wow, it's amazing. If you can go, you should. The service and surroundings are incredible and the food was so special.

Best interior design so far. It is beauty if u view from a long distance. When i saw near to the beach it was big. Some of the details of the building used for construction was good. If u are architecture or taste in viewing unique buildings, u will surely loved it. Couldnt get the chance to visit the interior (it is costly ) . But heard from some of my friends, all the details in the interior was great . all the designs were top class and fasicnatng.
Most luxurious 7 star in world. Must and must visit to see the beauty of this Giant. Awesome and best hotel in the world with world class facilities and hospitality. feel the luxury and comfort

Not that special. I've been there (but didn't stay in the hotel) and I actually expected to see something wow. However my experience wasn't that fascinating as I expected. There are better places to see in Dubai. We went to restaurant located on the top of Burj Al Arab. The view was beautiful and that's it, there's nothing more to share about my experience. Maybe I should stay in that hotel to go through the REAL experience and rate the place as a hotel but as a sightseeing.

Birthday. Omg wot a hotel gold everywhere unbelievable. Amazing food child friendly lots on hand help showing wot food was and choosing dishes .didnt stay but had dinner then went to bar on top for cocktails lovely view and beautiful hotel.
High and mighty. Shining and immensely tall, in the midst of urban setting. Provides excellent view of the city all around.

What a disappointment. We were very excited to be going to the restaurant at the Burj Al Arab for a celebration. On arrival we were welcomed and told to sit down and wait for our table!. When we were shown our table - we thought that we would be able to have a spectacular view of the city - but the way the room is structured only a few tables have this vantage. We had heard so much about this that we were so looking forward to the experience. Our table had a reflection of the lights in the room. The hostess of the restaurant did try and find an alternative table but unfortunately the table she was offering was close to the kitchen. So we landed up leaving and going elsewhere.
A hot summer day . There are great views, a beautiful beach, and Burj Al Arab in a hot summer day!!!I hope that next time I can enjoy Burj Al Arab.

A Landmark to Recon. This beautiful piece of modern architecture jutting out of the water leaves you awestruck.No matter how many times you drive by the Burj Al Arab you want to give it one more look.It has a very different beauty in the night when the lights go on and the sail end of the structure changes colours. Stand across the street and take a look, Its worth your time.

Afternoon tea . We visited the sky view restaurant on our wedding anniversary for afternoon tea and wow what an amazing experience! The staff are very attentive couldn't do enough to ensure everything was perfect! We couldn't of wished for a better experience thank you to all the staff!

Worst so called 7 star experience ecer. We wanted to go to the Burj for sometime and as it was our anniversary we decided to treat ourselves to their Friday brunch. We were going with our 8 month baby so asked our hotel to call in advance and arrange for them to make some baby food for our daughter a recipe was also provided so as not to get it wrongWhen you arrive it is stunning and the lift to the sky restaurant is spectacular a must see in itself. However when we arrived the reception area started to fill up quite quickly we were left waiting for our table for about 15 minutes and were seated late with no apology of explanation We were seated at a lovely table, I requested the babies food which they said was ready. When the brought it it was mash potato laden with cream, I asked them had the not received the recipe and was greeted with an appalling attitude from and member of staff. The manager came over to apologise and said she would fix it. I relayed the recipe and hoped they would finally get it right. In the mean time we were served a glass of prosecco you pay £125 each for the brunch and get one free glass and it's not even champagne. Very disappointing In the meantime my daughter had fallen asleep waiting for her food, we were at the stage thinking of just leaving as we were so unimpressed and wasn't willing to spend £250 for the experience, however the manager asked us to stay so they could make it right. When my daughter woke I asked for her food. This arrived and looked super creamy I asked the waitress to find out what was in it and if it had been made with cream, she returned to say it had. I couldn't believe it I know this may sound pedantic however she is 8 months and does not have the tolerance for this type of food. I asked for chicken, carrots and potatoes to be cooked and mashed so not especially hard. We had run out of pre bought baby food so was relying on the hotel to make food for us. I got quite upset as this could have really made my daughter sick. I sent it back and we decided enough was enough and we were leaving. The chef came out with bowls of food at this point and aggressively put them on our table and shouted you did not request dairy free. Sorry I didn't realise I had to tell a chef from a 7 staff hotel not to put cream in an 8 month old babies food. The actual food at the brunch is OK not great and because of all the issues with the baby food we didn't get to eat much. The manager took my husband to the side and told him that we would no be paying for the brunch dud to everything that had happened. We accepted this and thanked her. She also gave my daughter a teddy me some flowers and a cake for our anniversary, we then left. Whilst waiting for a taxi in the lobby we were approached by a waiter from the restaurant telling us we had not paid for our bottle of wine we were shocked and embarrassed as ww were told we didn't have to. The manager came down we tried to return her gifts and told her we were appalled as she had said it was on her and there were no stipulations around the alcohol etc. We tried to pay for the wine but she now decided that this was ok and would not accept the payment. Totally embarrassing. It was an absolute disaster from beginning to end and topped off what had already been an awful holiday. Such a shame as we were so looking forward to the experience

My most favourite destination in Dubai. I am always filled with wonder and awe when I enter this building, the architecture design and finishes are exquisite, I have been there several times and want to go over and over again!!It is a must to see at least once, dont miss it when in Dubai.You need to book ahead for the afternoon high tea or any of the restaurants if you are not staying at the hotel
Beautiful. We went here on a saturday night to have drinks in the Sky Bar, not cheap but lovely for a special occasion
No way I will miss it and so shouldn't you!. It was a dream come true to enter that hotel, every piece was art, including that giant "Ocean-view" of those aquarium on both sides of the escalators.

Afternoon tea with a view. My husband and I went here for afternoon which was given to us as a Christmas gift last year. The afternoon tea is amazing with lots of courses. The sandwiches were gorgeous and there were so many cakes to choose from. would recommend visiting the hotel, it was a great experience.

very impressive. great food, great service, great views and a taste of the highlife - only down side is the skyview afternoon tea (the best) is a tad too expensive for most (£150 pp) but ok if you consider it as a once in a lifetime chance to visit "the worlds only 7* hotel"

Once in a lifetime chance. Once in a lifetime chance to stay at this wonderful 7 star hotel... Lot of attractions in the hotel itself like the restaurant at the top, view from the room, under water restaurants...

Best afternoon tea ever!!!. We did the afternoon tea and it was brilliant. Service was exceptional, Michelin quality. Unlimited teas and soft drinks. Spectacular views. Food was so delicious and they were generous with portions. Expensive but an experience worth paying for and high quality food, drink and service.

Worth Every Single Dirham!. Ten years ago I passed through Dubai on my way to Afghanistan and met a young family that stayed one night in the Burj Al Arab. Of course, when told the cost for a night (about a mortgage payment), I thought to myself, who in their right mind would ever would pay that much for a hotel stay? Seems like ten years can change one’s mind, because now I fully understand why. We booked a one-night stay under the UAE residence rate, which included breakfast; discount vouchers for the spa (we didn’t use); access to Wild Wadi (we’ll go another time); in-room cocktails and canapés; and full-size Hermès toiletries for him and for her. This was in celebration of our wedding anniversary.Check in was not until 3:00 PM, so we decided to grab lunch at the nearby Mina A’ Salam hotel in the Souk Madinat Jumeirah. At 1:10 PM I called to see if our room was available and was told to come to the hotel and use the facilities if not. We made our way to the hotel, note that access to the property is only if you have restaurant or hotel reservations, and were greeted at the door by a bellman and our greeter who escorted us to our room. On the way up, she explained that check in was taken care of in the room (!). Our room was 1103 and faced the north end of Dubai toward the Burj Khalifa. As the rooms are duplex floors, it really meant the 22nd floor. We were greeted by the butlers at the concierge desk on our floor and shown to our room. It made an impression with the door open and the view to the sweeping staircase leading up to the bedroom. Soon after we entered our welcome drink arrived, our greeter left and our butler Cyra arrived, who proceeded to complete our check in process. She gave us a tour of the room, asked if we wanted her to unpack our things, (nope) and left us to continue our stay. By this time, it was roughly 2:20PM and we opted to make our way to the new terrace pool extension. What a delight. Two pools, one fresh water, one salt water. We made a beeline for the salt-water infinity pool at the end of the extension. It’s surrounded by the private cabanas and in the front are chaise lounge chairs and round sun beds in a sandy ‘beach’. A beach assistant found us a bed, lined it with towels, and promptly brought over a cooler with water, cold towels, and face spray. It was replenished throughout our visit.We stayed at the pool all afternoon until about 6:00 PM with a stop at the swim up pool bar around 4ish. Our bartender Mahmoud Harris was a star. He convinced me to try a Green Monk (!!) and made great conversation; this, despite the fact that he was fasting for Ramadan, had the best attitude. We also met Paul, an equally charming staff member from Sri Lanka. We left the pool with grand plans to catch the sunset at the Sky View bar, which we were told required reservations and, blah, blah, blah. Not in the mood to make a huge effort, we decided we’ve seen plenty of sunsets and would enjoy the room instead. Our evening butler (didn’t catch his name) soon arrived with cocktails and canapés. He even returned for a second round. There was a nice box of baklava in a Burj Al Arab signature shaped box (delish). We considered our dining options and took a look at the Private Dining menu and decided to order in. I ordered the organic greens and gnocchi with Arrabiata sauce while my husband ordered the lobster Caesar salad. Sadly, what arrived was a lobster salad with mango (his one allergy). Not sure if the communication failure was on our end or their end, but no matter, the intended salad arrived after a quick phone call and we were stuffed! The bill was a very reasonable 420 Aed. Granted, we didn’t have any alcohol, but by Dubai standards, that was an inexpensive meal. As a comparison, lunch at Tortugas (a Mexican restaurant) was 270 Aed. We had asked the butler, Kelly, to prepare our Jacuzzi bath at 8:30 and decided to move it up to 8:00 PM – we were wiped out from a day in the saltwater pool. Soon after, we checked out the Hermes toiletries.We turned in early and found turn down service with bespoke Patchi chocolates in the shape of the hotel and a single red rose on either side of the bed. We were fast asleep in the comfiest of beds by 9:00 (complete with over head mirror). Note you are able to select your optimal pillow from the Pillow Menu! One might find an over the bed mirror cheap a la Vegas or the Poconos, but it was actually a bit fun. At 9:30 our evening butler called to say they had an anniversary surprise for us. With my slumbering spouse at my side, I declined until the morning. Breakfast was in Bab Al Yam located poolside by the original hotel pool, which is shockingly small. We started breakfast outside and moved inside as the temperature became warmer. The buffet had many selections and my husband said his omelet was the best he’s ever had. The coffee was perfection and the service was attentive and prompt. We made our way back to the room and were surprised by the Head Butler Anila and Cyra with a beautifully displayed chocolate cake, a card signed by the hotel general manager, and a bouquet of red roses in celebration of our wedding anniversary. Such a gorgeous display (we even got to take the flowers home) and the chocolate cake too, which was divine.As we were granted a late checkout time, we opted to spend the rest of the morning into the afternoon in the same saltwater pool. Same fabulous pool side attention, gorgeous weather, and a fabulous breeze. We remarked several times how relaxing it was and how it felt like a three-day vacation, when it hadn’t even been 24 hours yet! At 1:30 we made our way back to the room and said our goodbyes to the pool staff. Cyra and Karan were there to pack up a bottle of champagne we didn’t drink, the bouquet of roses, and the cake. Check out was taken care of at the butler’s desk on the floor and we made our way down to the lobby escorted by Cyra. We didn’t make it to the spa or to the pool on the 18th floor. We’ve visited the Sky View Bar and Al Muntaha on other visits so we didn’t make it this time. Al Mahara was under renovation and we hope to visit soon. The terrace pool is one of the most divine pools I’ve experienced.Verdict: If it’s in your budget and you can afford it, stay here. The Burj Al Arab has a wow factor however dated some of the décor might feel (it opened in 1999). The staff and the awe-inspiring interior are what set this property apart from others. Certainly, there are numerous options to be found in Dubai, but to have the privilege of being a guest in this hotel is not to be missed. We approached our stay with an attitude that it has to be done once in a lifetime, at least. We left with the conviction that for as long as we live in Dubai, this will be an annual event. A massive thank you to the staff who made our stay extra special, our greeter (Susanne, I think), our butlers, Cyra, Kelly and Karan (and one other whose name I missed), to Paul and Mahmoud Harris at the pool and to the Turkish man at Bab Al Yam with the American accent – sincerely, thank you. We look forward to seeing you again very, very soon.

Burj Al Arab. We viewed this first from a distance as our friend took us to a great viewing spot on the beach to see is. It was amazing to see as we've seen it in many magazines. We then tried to view it closer through a hotel, but this was not possible due to a security guard stopping us because we weren't staying there, so a little disappointing that we could not get close up photos.
An amazing kind of architecture. Its really impressing building in Dubai build straight into the ocean, they have an amazing aquarium in the entrance.

Fantastic place for our honeymoon . Wow where to start?! We have done Dubai for the past 5 years staying at least twice per year in many different hotels/resorts so I'm aware of the quality of what it has to offer but the Burj is on another level for so many reasons...too many to mention! Starting with the arrival, we hired the rolls Royce from the airport which is 1000AED, my wife received lovely roses and we had a music menu en route , upon arrival we are greeted by at least 5 people welcoming us. Checkin is done in the suite , we had a panoramic suite situated on the front of the hotel and has a sweeping view of the Dubai coastline. The suite was fantastic, huge downstairs and very spacious and luxurious upstairs. Nothing is spared, full Hermes toiletries in both bathrooms . Some lovely touches Along the way such as a cake and flowers congratulating us on our marriage one week before. I could go on forever about things like this there are so many and the butlers are fantastic.We had afternoon tea also in sky bar on the Saturday and our waiter Zen was brilliant and so knowledgable and passionate about what he was doing. The new terrace is fantastic , huge and spacious, so many beds with a freshwater pool also and swim up bar. It was only a week old, plenty of security checking that ur actually staying there so no tourists taking pics which is good! For a change we visited the madinat over the water and visited pai Thai, buggies outside help you get there and then a little arbra takes you right to restaurant. Take plenty of smaller note denominations to tip these guys as they work hard and non stop like any of the service people in Dubai ! The place is fantastic , we will definitely be back next year again child free and it's a little sanctuary from reality, out of this world, can't wait already to go back!!!

Difference and interesting.. Nothing quite like this. Had a full tour including the royal suit and was blown away with the level of detail and the quality of things available. It is something definitely worth seeing while in Dubai

Out of this world . Came here for afternoon tea. Booked this before we started our trip so there was no disappointment. This hotel is amazing got to see parts of it but as we weren't guests couldn't view the full hotel. Your on the top floor for afternoon tea and views were just amazing! We were here in the afternoon so got to see the sun set. There were a selection of cakes and sandwiches and a various amount of different teas to choose from. Would highly recommend this was a highlight of my trip in Dubai!
superb. superbconsidering that besides the Burj al Arab is a public beach is superb as you admire this masterpiece

superb. superb
considering that besides the Burj al Arab is a public beach is superb as you admire this masterpiece

Afternoon tea a must. We visited this remarkable hotel for afternoon tea . We pre booked before we went and when visiting Dubai entertainment vouchers are well worth buying before you go ( eBay ) they give you great offers on enjoying these special treats . The hotel was amazing and so was the view from the restaurant serving afternoon tea . The food was delicious the nicest afternoon tea I've had . The service was excellent and staff friendly .I would say this is a must if you are visiting Dubai . A wonderful experience
truly marvelous hotel. a beautiful hotel to stay. Incase u r not staying then make sure that u visit once. U can have breakfast over there thats how u can start the tour.
Excellent View From the Top. A Very Nice Tallest Building in the World.Very Organized and always Tide and Clean.It is Amazing and Everybody Should Try it.

" Excellent Architecture !!! ". Burz Al Arab is a 7 star hotel Property & required prior reservation for lunch or dinner...Though we didn't had the reservation so we were not allowed inside ... Its a very nice view from outside... We took lots of photographs of Burz Al Arab from sea while travelling through Dubai Ferry Boat...The nearest attractions from here are Wild Wadi Water Park & Jumerah Public Beach....
WOW. Breathtaking! Building is beautiful. The hotel lobby is amazing. Seven stars!!! We were here to have dinner at one of their restaurants.
nice place to must see but entry is prebooked only. you have to pre book in advance if you want to go inside security is very tight there , near by jumiera beach

AL MUNTAHA evening meal. Booked on line prior to arriving in Dubai, confirmation of booking was comprehensive. Arrived about 30 minutes prior to the seating time so had a look around the Burj prior to dining. I must say, the service was very personal and professional. The hotel was, in itself, worth the restaurant visit!! What a stunning piece of architecture and such an iconic landmark of Dubai so allow a little more time to have a look! The service in the restaurant was first class and of course, what you would expect from this hotel. Staff very courteous and nothing was too much for them. First class.The views over Dubai were second to none. Arrived for sun set. I would suggest that a little modernisation is required as the restaurant does appear to be a little dated in its decor. (Minor point)The reason why I am giving this a 4 star rating and not the 5 is purely the limitations on the menu and I guess the quality of the meal. I have to say, very impressed that they had Welsh lamb on the menu, however, the overall menu was limited. The taster menu looked OK, albeit for the price, I would have expected more choice. Food was well presented and tasty.Had the duck for starter and what I consider the biggest mound of salad I have ever seen!! It was a salad, nothing more, nothing less, it was as if someone had opened a bag of salad from tesco's and placed it on my plate. For the main, I had the rib eye steak, medium, well cooked and seasoned. I in no way claim to be a food critic but I can honestly say I have had a better steak at Miller and Carter. The accompanying veg was the usual asparagus tips and mashed potato, of which, was very similar to smash...... I will leave that one there! The dessert was a sticky toffee pudding with ice cream. You can't really go wrong with that!! Overall, 5 star service with 3 star food. For the price (for 2 of us, starter, main, dessert, cocktails and bottle of wine, £450) I would have expected to be completely wowed and looking forward to my next visit, however, it is an experience to visit but would consider eating elsewhere in the future.

Photogenic, Not Much Else. Guys, make sure you wear full length trousers and you make a prior appointment before visiting - if you don't mind spending several hundred US Dollars or British Pound Sterling on one or two fizzy drinks only, then head to this building - it's required before an appointment is booked and you're let in - building-wise, the hotel looks impressive like a boat's sail resisting the wind, but that is it really - everything else, you'll get elsewhere - 7star hotel? I don't think so - but you be the judge

No access granted!. Well it's a great n symbolic building of Dubai. But the access was not granted. We had to take photos from distance. It's near by the "alwadi park" n about 1km from Dubai public beach.

beautiful view. we went here for dinner. The food was great, however very expensive meal. I thought we were going to be underwater, but the only water and fish we saw was a big fish tank in the middle of the restaurant. The lobby and view upstairs was great though.

Reservation required. We didn't manage to go inside but thought I'd let you know so you don't make the same mistake.Thought we would get a taxi down and have some photos taken.The taxi can't go in without you having a reservation so dropped us outside, you can't get close from this point and so we had to walk along the side of the aqua Park in intense heat, finally we got to the beach front and a clearer view of this amazing building.There isn't many places to sit or eat along here so literally took about 5 mins to get the photo and then back in a cab.....to somewhere air conditioned!!Later in the day we took a water taxi out from the Marina this gave us a great view of the burj al Arab completely unobstructed.My advice....get a reservation or ask the taxi to take you to a view point of the hotel and wait for you to go to your next destination or get the water taxi...it's a photo you need in your album !!!
Even Beautiful from afar. Several of our passengers visited this iconic building. It's also great to see from the beach below.

Much hyped. Let me begin with a caveat that we were tourists and did not stay at the hotel. We visited the place for sometime and also went to the restaurant for a coffee. From the outside the building looks good but not awe inspiring. From the inside it was too gaudy for my taste. The coffee was OK and as expected over priced.

Overrated!. This place isn't all it is cracked up to be. I personally thought it was over the top, and the service wasn't very good. We went for afternoon tea and while the views are incredible, the actual tea room was quite ugly. Not a place I would go back to.

High Tea. Great experience in a surreal setting. A must do for anyone visiting Dubai. The views are amazing and the food was spectacular, I didn't leave hungry. Go for the sunset and get there early to get a seat by the window. All the seats are great either way but I'd prefer a window seat next time.

Afternoon Tea. We reserved the A'tea back in the UK & knew this was going to be a highlight of the trip.From the moment the taxi drove over the private bridge to get to the Al Arab the magic began.There was lots of activity in the hotel lobby as guests were taking photos. Bit chaotic!As you go up the escalator check out the huge aquariums on either side.When you arrive at the entrance for the Skyview bar you are politely greeted & shown to the lift. The view from the lift is great but it does whizz up! You're greeted at the top & shown to your table. The service & food is amazing.You probably won't be able to eat all your cakes so do ask for them to be boxed up for you. They are more than happy to do this.Also do mention when you book of you're going there for a special occasion.There's lots of room if you want to go to the windows & take photos. There's great views of the Palm, Jumeriah beach & Dubai. Go on treat yourself, you won't regret it.

Gold on 27!. I visited the burj with my husband without actually staying at the hotel by booking the gold on 27 bar in the hotel. This is cos you can not enter the hotel or its grounds without a reservation of some sort and since the restaurants are to die for but very very expensive I chose this method. The gold on 27 is actually on the 54th floor! You get awesome sites from your seats, privacy, class and guess what there are staff to open the toilet doors for you! The toilet has hot towels and Hermes cream and the bar is just out of this world. We had lovely non alcoholic drinks for like 60Aed each and got some complimentary nuts and water. Excellent for a night out in luxury without the price tag.
Very beautiful. This bdlg is very beautiful and definitely a work of art.. You can capture beautiful views of this bdlg from the beach and around the city.

Beautiful structure. Went there during a 2-nights tour in Dubai and haven't got a chance to go inside. Enjoying very much the view from Jumeirah Beach and it should be the best location to appreciate this beautiful structure from a distance.
Romantic Valentines Date!. I treat my wife for a romantic valentines date 1 of the Burj Al Arab Restaurant, the place the ambiance was great but expensive though.

High Tea. Had high tea as a special treat for my birthday at the Burj. Although expensive it was sheer decadence with outstanding service, great food and amazing views. A lovely afternoon and recommended for that special occasion.

First class surprise stay <Engagement!> . We came to stay at the Dar Al Masyaf for a week during half term back in the uk. Unknown to my girlfriend I had planned a surprise engagement proposal (she said yes thankfully!) at the Burj Al Arab which was superbly arranged by Tarik Skim guest services manager at the Dar Al Masyaf. The whole experience was planned and executed to absolute military precision and the service was first class from start to finish. In summary we were collected in a beautiful white Rolls Royce one of the Burj's many on their fleet and drive the short drive to the hotel from the lobby of Al Qasr. The start was perfectly executed by Naval our butler at the Dar Al Masyaf (whom I was praise in the review of their hotel separately). On arrival at the Burj (as a frequent visitor to the Jumeirah group of hotels here in Dubai for the last 16 years) we were greeted like no other hotel in the world has ever done before. A personal greeting was received by one of the staff who led us to the 19th Floor and told that we have been upgraded to a 'club suite' room. Words cannot describe the room or the service. If you go to YouTube and search for Burj Al Arab engagement you'll find our videos of the stay and I will later review the rooms. There once everything was settled and we'd got over the shock and amazement of the room I proposed in the room with the most amazing backdrop. My partner had NO idea of my plans whatsoever and the staff and our butler did everything to absolute perfection. We later went to the new Terrace (north deck) which was an experience to behold (again check my videos). That night we ate the most indulgent and exquisite meal at Al Mahara beside the aquarium in the basement of the hotel and we were gobsmacked at the service, quality and sheer class of the food. A perfect engagement meal. On the second morning I was introduced to Daniela, head of butler services. Daniela and her team (a special mention goes to Monika-director as well who arranged what was to follow) dealt with the surprise arrival of my girlfriends parents who had checked into the Dar Al Masyaf in the room opposite ours and then whilst liaising with me at breakfast via test message incredibly discreetly, had them delivered to our room to complete the most amazing piece of the jigsaw to this special trip. Again this is filmed on the video on my YouTube channel. Trust me when I say it went exactly how I had planned it to the exact five minutes in timing. After we showed my fiancé's parents around (she believed they were in Venice!) we were invited to the Terrace deck for lunch were they chilled and served our own Champagne given as a gift by the arriving special guests. While we sunbathed on the deck they informed us when the bubbly was chilled and subsequently served with a fantastic poolside lunch from the California style menu at the bar. The staff at the terrace did absolutely everything they could to further enhance our stay. Then as a gesture from the Hotel we were shown to another suite where for a further night they once again hosted us all in a two bedroomSuite which wasn't not expected by my future in-laws and just the most amazing surprise. We were looked after from start to finish in a way that I simply could not have wished for in my most outlandish dreams. The Burj Al Arab, Daniela especially and its staff went above and beyond what I had heard about the hotel and what I had seen on documentaries and read in trip advisor reviews. What I would say is we aren't film stars, footballers or royalty yet we were made to feel every bit as if we belonged there. While it isn't 'cheap' but I didn't not regret the cost and alas if you want details of how to achieve the best prices for a stay see my channel and ask in the comments.No more words can capture the experience. Thank you Burj Al Arab, Daniela, Tarik, Monika and all the staff that made this the most memorable holiday for my fiancé and I ❤️

Beyond beautiful . Highly recommend everyone a visit at Burj Al Arab. We spent approximately 300 dirhams each, this entailed a three course meal and drinks. We went to the Sahn Eddar. Brilliant service and would expect anything less!! We went to the Sky lounge afterwards which was amazing in its self

High Tea at The Sky View Bar. Great experience. Romantic atmosphere with live piano music.Views are a bonus. You must book in advance otherwise wont be allowed into the building at all.Food was ok. Given the status of the hotel I assumed you could pick among different blends or origines of coffe beans for your spresso (wrong!). Only arabiga from Ethiopia which was good of course.Overall a bit pricey but worth it. You can hang around and discretely wonder a bit around the hotel on your way down before leaving the buildiing.

Breath-taking views. We went to have afternoon tea at the top of Burj Al Arab. From the moment we step foot into the hotel, we received first class service (I can see why the hotel is considered to be one of the best). The staff knew we were coming and they greeted us before entering the restaurant. All the staff were efficient, organised and very well-mannered. There was plenty to eat and a variety. we enjoyed the experience very much.

You must visit this place!. This is a place to see! We had a business lunch at this hotel. Very expensive, but very worth every penny! The service is excellent! The food is grand and delicious! Enjoyed it and a memorable time.
Wow. An amazing piece of arhitecture! With his shape of dhow( local boat) at gigantic size, 60 floors and lovely shades is one of the most beautifull things i have ever seen

Cocktails . Went here for drinks at the skyview bar , again like many places here once you've been once you probably wouldn't go again , hotel is amazing but again astronomically expensive , think we had about 3 cocktails each and the average price is 25.00 a cocktail , is a lovely view don't get me wrong and it's nice that I visited here but there is a bar in jumeriah beach hotel on floor 24 and its open air called the uptown bar and I liked this much more as the minimum spend in the skyview bar is £70 pp and I felt the waiters were always over asking you to get another drink like they were worried you weren't going to spend the required amount . It was nice as a special treat .

Night View Of The Burj Khalifa Light Art Display. Amazing light art on the world's tallest building and it's really awesome to view at night!Perfect night activity for couples and family. Can get very crowded so be early to get a nice spot.

Great to see in the distance, but way above most peoples pocket book. A beautiful hotel to look at, built on it's own island in the Jumeirah section of Dubai. With an advance purchase rate of US1500 you can get picked up in a limo from the airport and have a full time butler. I think, for me, I will just stand and admire it from a distance.

The top of this building could be seen from the road.. This is a 6 star Hotel with juinor suites. It has a bridge to it as it is off the beach. We could only see part of it even from the Madinet Jumeirah as buildings and bridges where in the way. It is shaped like a ships sail. At night its exteiror lights up and is a dazzling rainbow -coloured front used as a canvas for spectacular light displays.To see inside you have to book a meal for Lunch or Dinner or drinks, Cocktails, Also it has a strict dress code for Men and Women. The rooms are all suite with your own butler. Arrive by Rolls Royces or it has a helipad on the 28th. floor. It is the tallest all suite Hotel 321 m, 1,053 ft, With a Sky view Bar with excellant panaramic views.
Wonderful architectural design. Great hotel. A must visit place while in Dubai. Incredible restaurants and amenities found at this great hotel. Experience the Tea experience at the Burj Al Arab.
Great experience. We visited this building with my 5 girls colagues and it was really great experience. You must have reservation in any restaurant/bar or be accomodated there.
Unique in many ways. Once you think you have seen it all, then this pops up. You pay to get in but you get your money back twice. Free drink and one of the most exclusive hotels in the world.
Bab-Al-Yam. Staff are very very helpful, brilliant location, excellent food perfect!Loacted on the shoreline with beautiufl scenes of the sea!
Fun!. Completely OTT but lots of fun! A must to go and have a look around, afternoon tea is wonderful and the Sky View Bar fabulous!

Burj Al Arab. The external view and approach towards the hotel is magnificent. But as you go in you realize that money cannot buy taste. It is surely...The Burj Arab is a beautiful building which houses a 7 Star hotel! Great for photos especially when lit up at night!
One of a kind. The place is special by the decorations and grandiose of the inside. it is a one of a kind experience that is worth trying despite the extremely expensive bills
Pointless. Not connected by metro, and the dont allow you to get into the premises unless you have a room booked.
The first ever tallest building in Dubai. It was the first tallest building in Dubai, before the others came out. It looks even more beautiful when you look at it from out in the sea!

Afternoon tea - worth the view. We went for afternoon tea and although it wasn't an amazing afternoon tea, it is worth paying the price for the amazing view from Skybar. There was a harpist playing and you could have as much to eat as you wanted but by the time we got to the cakes, we were full. We had a glass of champagne and there was so much choice of teas, coffees, iced, soft drinks that it was great to have such choice.
Marvelous Hotel. I stayed many years ago, in 2013, ostentatious, great service, it is uncomfortable that you can not go to places in shorts, but, it is part of it

Afternoon Tea, to celebrate birthday?. Fantastic place to celebrate any birthday! Food superb and presented first class, felt very special.Quite expensive but well worth it!Interesting people watching!

Daughter's 21st Birthday dinner. We wanted to give our daughter a memorable experience to celebrate her 21st so decided to book at table at Al Muntaha (restaurant at the top of the Burj) The overall experience was of the highest quality -the bill is not for the feint heated but we have no complaints!

If you are looking for the WOW factor .. look no further. During a stay in Dubai, afternoon tea in the Berj Al Arab was a must. We pre-booked via the website before we went as security is very strict and you cannot just turn up at the hotel without a booking conformation. A deposit was paid at the booking stage also which was none refundable. On arrival you cannot help but be blow away by the pure essence of the building. The lobby area is breath-taking with a floor to ceiling like water fountain. We were taken up to the restaurant in a glass elevator which in itself offered amazing views. We were seated adjacent to the windows (we weren’t lucky enough to get a window seat) but that didn’t take anything away from the experience. Drinks arrived immediately and the food was so good I cannot even try to put into words. You are free to move around the restaurant and take in the views and take pictures. The ambience is peaceful and you can relax in the luxury, feeling comfortable. I would recommend dressing for this occasion, even if you feel slightly overdressed for a lunch date. This experience isn’t cheap experience but I can promise its worth every penny.

Gaudy Interiors, Overhyped. The external view and approach towards the hotel is magnifico. But as you go in you realise that money cannot buy taste. It is surely oppulent but in a godawful way. I personally disliked the interiors. I ate at the Al Muntaha restaurant right at the top. It is soo average and a waste of my money. The view was not bad though. But it is too quiet and eerie with the dim blue lighting up there.
An architecture marvel!. The buolding is amazing to witness. Though it is not free to public to enter, the structure provides a great photo spot!

good for photos. reservation only, security guards won't let you know. you can make a reservation either to stay or to dine and then that will let you in. I think it cost over AED300 just to dine in. looks nice in the evening for photos poses. it's a 7 star hotel for rich and famous.
Beautiful Burj Arab!. The Burj Arab is a beautiful building which houses a 7 Star hotel! Great for photos especially when lit up at night!

The surroundings luckily make up for slipping standards . This was my 5th stay now at the burj al Arab and we have been visiting here since 2012. After having beyond great experiences in the past this time we decided to share our experience we often speak about with family. Upon check in at the hotel everything was quick and accommodating as usual. We was all very excited and safe to say our guests was overwhelmed with the prospect of the week Ahead. Luckily for us the new terrace opened the day we arrived. This is an amazing space overlooking the Arabian gulf and just what the burj needed to keep it up to date and some edge over its competitors. Must say too it's great positioning as you get a great sea breeze which in Dubai's summer heat is fully appreciated. We asked to book a cabana on the new terrace and the floor butler sorted this for us. They told us to let them no when we are going down and they'll escort us as it's the first day they just want to ensure all transitions well. We got ready made them aware we are wanting to go down and nobody was around to do so. We then saw someone who was also faced with having the check two other guests out Aswell as ourselves. I explained what we was waiting for and she told us to just go downstairs she will call to make them aware. We made our way down and it is pristine and amazingly laid out! However nobody was really around to direct us. We then explained we had a cabana booked and he looked confused. After making us walk around in the Dubai heat he told us to wait. Someone who looked more senior then came over and said she had bad news the cabana only sits two people and there was four of us. She could offer us a Royal cabana which was bigger but it was near triple in price. I then explained the floor butler had confirmed the cabana booking with us and had told us to go down and now they had this news. This was the first sign of the bad breakdown in communication.....She offered it us at a discounted rate for the inconvenience which was appreciated but after waiting for some time already we declined and stayed on the normal loungers. She later came to apologise again and later that day they came to our room with chocolates and flowers. There is no doubt that the staff are eager to give you a good service and for that we always respect. The next day we came down later in the afternoon and we was stood again in the heat looking around for an attendant. You see many of them in the pink uniforms gathered at the sides but somehow they don't see the guests or efficient at helping you. We was stood for 15min trying to get someone attention and after asking three of them for towels one of us had to walk to the other side to get someones attention properly, again this was a slow process as he was having to go back and forth for water & towels. I really do think they need a system in place, there's security on the front of the terrace checking your room number it be good if the attendants where near there and they escorted you down as you checked in along with the waters and towels. This system they do at many hotels and other Jumeirah hotels and works fine. Once we was settled there was a man near us who was shouting as he was stood in the heat for a long time while he asked FOUR attendants for towels who all said "1min sir" it was not 1 minute and he was then heard complaining while dripping in sweat. Later that day we went to get food! They don't serve the same menu as they do round the original pool. They also won't let you order from that menu either as we did ask. The terrace menu is only small with little choice and they have tried to be quite Sophisticated with their choices. When asked if we could have one of the pizza's without cheese (dairy allergy) & the burger without sauce they seemed to tell us they don't think they can. We had to ask if they could then ask the chef.... Again this wasn't the "7 star service" where almost anything is possible we was once used too. We felt we was almost having to tell the waiter how to do his job. Later that day a family Infront of us was complaining too about the little menu choice and had to wait over a hour for food.... To which the food came and they didn't prioritise their children's food first which they had asked - most places of this nature would do this as a no brained and they also had to complain there coffee was cold. Again we are listening and observing to complaints something which we have never done before during the years here.....We had to ask for turn down each night as one night they forgot to do it. Minor things like this we don't mind! But again when you pay the amount you do here and you see two butlers outside you'r door sat there you do expect it. One evening we had the DND sign on and was sleeping And they called our room to ask about membership scheme when I explained the sign was on she paused and said sorry which was fine but again it's as though nobody is checking things before they act. They made some restaurant reservations to which they printed our confirmations all wrong and when asked the time of our booking they didn't no, so we would have to call the restaurant to double check. Again I know these are minor issues but they are teething problems you expect from new hotels or staff members which is neither in this situation. We asked for ice cream one day down at the new pool which you'd expect in a hot county they'd be serving a lot and they told us they don't do it. The attendants often go off and can be seen discussing your requests with 3/4 other attendants before someone then comes back and asks what is it you want, you order then your order comes and it's wrong anyway...... Again I don't no if it's a case they don't understand or it's just a real bad break down in communication. The hotel was rather quiet during our stay and having the training programmes for staff and facilities this hotel I know has you just expect a better service. One evening we made our way back to our rooms and two of our family members who was staying in the room next door was stopped and we was asked if we new them & are they our visitors.. All butlers should be familiar with their guests and for me I found that quite rude. We recently stayed at the new four seasons some months ago and they are newly opened and service was next level. They was on first name terms with guests and They had buzzer service for around pool which I think this new space would benefit as it is quite large and loungers are hid away and private. Which becomes annoying when trying to get someone's attention. They also didn't have the complimentary amenities around the pool or to the rooms. We was offered shots of mocktails, ice lollies, sunglasses cleaning ect or evening drinks or canapé's to your room at all other Jumeirah hotels and have had it when stayed and the burj previously. But there was nothing this stay....For us having that personal approach and all these little touches is what makes the hotel stand out and leaves us eager to return each time.The rooms, location, quietness and appearance of the new terrace luckily still made our stay enjoyable. But the big factor of service did let it down compared to previous stays. I think everyone should stay here if they can as majority you'll have a special experience. and after all I would like to put our experience down to the new opening appose to thinking this is now just a 5star hotel than the 7star it has a reputation for....

Afternoon Tea OverWhelmed Guest Experience. Booked well in Advance for a joint celebration of afternoon tea for my Birthday and Wedding Anniversary. Booked a limo to arrive in style and so glad we did as soon as you get passed security and drive over the private bridge to this Iconic Hotel you can see the extravagance everywhere nothing is done by half.First and foremost is the Guest Experience the staff here are world class and from the first member of staff opening our car door to the Sky Bar staff to the goodbye everyone was First Class.We had booked for 4pm and were advised to arrive early to check in which we did at the back of the hotel which is where the sky bar lifts are.You then can look around the lobby area at your hearts content taking photos of all the fountains and stunning architecture. It had been a dream to come to this hotel since it was built and whilst staying here would be out of my budget afternoon tea for a special day was a must.At first i thought the 60 plus guests would be a scrum for the lifts but after registering the staff call you forward in groups of 6 which was a great way to deal with the group awaiting there experience. The glass lift ride was amazing as you had a great view of the Gulf and the beach areas. On arrival at the Sky Bar we were greeted and escorted to our window table which i felt very privileged to have. Then the experience began one glass of champagne which is included in the package which is enough as its not the place to get tipsy.Our waiter explained the menu and the timings etc and one after one delicious food arrived plentiful in size and cakes and sandwiches could be refreshed if you wanted more.Only thing which i have said to the Burj was the sandwiches which were very nice could have had more simple combinations as perhaps too many flavours going on.We were not rushed at all and everything just flowed and even after two hours the afternoon tea goes into the bar and evening meals so you are not pushed to leave at all.Took loads of photos and make sure you walk around and ask to go to both sides of sky bar even if its roped off as the views are amazing.We were given two special cakes for our Anniversary and my birthday and my wife was even given a fresh red rose.If you cannot eat the deserts the Sky Bar will box them up which is nice and the box with the logo on is a nice souvenir to have.We left the sky bar and went in the lift just at sunset which was amazing and it all seemed to be a bit of a dream and it could not sink in what i had experienced.We then stayed in the foyer for a while watching life go by soaking up all the atmosphere and building. The flowers on site are stunning too.We met some lovely people here too and once conversations were over we left the hotel and as soon as we stepped outside the guest experience happened again.
