The valet parking /greeter summoned a taxi for us and of course did the doors but in the last 2 minutes of waiting a female manager appeared from nowhere and started chatting to us about our day , she was Scottish and lovely but both myself and my wife felt like in the quick 2 minute conversation we had known this lady and she had known us all our lives it was a surreal experience but a great end to our afternoon here. This Scottish lady in a grey trouser suit made the day finish in the right way .So if in Dubai and you have a special day go and experience it .Thanks Burj Al Arab

7 star mediocrity . The hotel is nice from the outside with amazing water views though inside looks like a submarine from the 1980's. The price,presentation and quality of food like the service, isn't anything to write home about. This is one of my least favorite places in Dubai.
Must visit place in Dubai!. This is the place for blue beach attraction!! For selfies with BurjAlArab... For enjoying in beach! For the hotel... It feels palace inside it!

The top end of amazing !!. Simply said, absolutely everything is of the very best from the suite itself to the Hermes toiletries in the bathroom. Stayed there for 3 nights on the top floor with an absolutely amazing view. The staff are top notch - we never got to open our door whenever we returned as the "personal butler" is always there to serve your every need. The facilities including restaurants and pool area are absolutely of the best. Easily the most amazing hotel stay we have ever experienced.

Over-rated. Went in one of the restaurants there for a meal with wife and two young children. Food wasn't as good as expected but the restaurant deco and service was really good as you would expect from the only 7 star in the world. Food was a let down.

Our stay. We like to come back every year, because we really feel like we are at home. Great people, spectacular hotel, amazing quality of service and unique atmosphere. It is a must visit hotel if you have chance. A place where there is no chance to hear "Sorry, this is not possible" or just "No".N. Sabev

OMG An Incredible Sight. Even more incredible as you drive up to it. At a modest £1500 a night for a cheap room it's completely bonkers over the top. The architecture is mind blowing we went for snacks & cocktails the view is stunning not the ambience is un- pretentious,the dress code is smart or spectacular its your choice. Dubai is a safe place you can bling out wear your Rolex and or your Diamonds nobody is going to bother you.The atmosphere is relaxed and the experience very enjoyable it's highly recommended as a before or after dinner adventure.

Amazing!. Despite the extreme hot weather, the place is a must see! Its architecture is fascinating! It totally worth a 5 minute walk on the beach to take a picture! :) We didn't entered the hotel, since there was some sort of barriers in front of its street!

"The" icon of Dubai. An interesting and beautifully photogenic building, probably the first of the modern buildings with a high recognition factor that put Dubai firmly on the map as an ultra-modern destination. It possibly still beats the new icon, Burj Khalifa when it comes to international recognition. Interesting location right at the waterfront and a nice backdrop when visiting the Jumeirah Public Beach. Access is really expensive so I just enjoyed the view.

Afternoon tea for two. Lovely experience, prices around £150 but worth it as a one off
Valet parking the Nissan amongst the Ferraris and Bentleys was funny for me but we weren't made to feel out of place at all
Amazing place, friendly staff and nice food.
Do as a treat if you can afford

27th Floor, Burj Al Arab. I have visited the 27th floor twice, once for an evening meal in the Al Muntaha restaurant and the second visit was to experience the afternoon tea in the Skyview Bar. I shall review both here.Al Muntaha is a 5* restaurant inside a 7* hotel. It of course offers excellent service, delicious food and impeccable decor. However, if you - like us - are not millionaires, and are just looking to experience eating inside the Burj Al Arab, an evening meal in Al Muntaha is NOT what I would recommend as being a first choice. The reasons for that are simple. We were quite disappointed with the views, as of course the sun had already set and although you can see a lot, it's mainly just the city lights and the darkness of the sea. You can't really make anything out. Also, the food is good, but we just couldn't justify it! You can probably get better food in restaurants that are more than half the price. Lastly, when we sat at our table we were asked if we would like a glass of champagne...being naive brits, we assumed this was free, so it was a huge shock when we received our bill! We felt that this should have been pointed out to us before we agreed, or at least shown a champagne menu to get an idea of prices. £40 for one glass of champagne was really quite ridiculous. The afternoon tea at the Skyview Bar, however, should be seriously considered if you wish to visit this beautiful piece of architecture. Unfortunately, we cannot compare it to either the Afternoon Tea or the High Tea at the Sahn Eddar as we have not been, but I can definitely recommend it more than the Al Muntaha experience. The first reason for this is the food selection. If you are eating in the Al Muntaha restaurant, you are likely to only try 3 things; your choice of starter, main and dessert. With the afternoon tea, you are served a number of courses containing miniature delights allowing you to taste many different items - and if you really like a particular one - you can order more! I am a very fussy eater - but I can honestly say there was nothing I didn't like! And the scones - being British we felt very critical - but my goodness they were to die for! Here, we started with a FREE glass of champagne and unlimited tea, coffee and water. Yes it is 620dhs per person, but this is far less than what you will end up spending in Al Muntaha. And you feel totally satisfied that you have got your monies worth, as opposed to feeling ripped off. Plus, the daylight views across Jumeirah and the rest of Dubai are just fabulous compared to at night.I hope this helps! If you are planning to visit Dubai - start saving and make sure this is on your list of things to do/places to visit!
Saw it from outside. Haven't been inside but looked magnificent from outside. A great viewing is from Bahri bar or the beach

High tea. We pre-booked High tea, little bit expensive but it was for a special occasion.On arrival you have to get through the Security Gates, the staff very courteous and happy to see you.On entrance to Hotel there is plenty of staff to assist. The entrance hall is amazing with wall to wall fish tanks.We were greeted by Restaurant staff who are excellent. We couldn't fault the service, they explain each of the 6 courses and offer you drinks all the time.We were given a single red rose and chocolate cake for our anniversary. The food was amazing all delicately displayed.The views were amazing as is the Hotel. I would certainly visit this hotel again.

Al Iwan Lunch. Had lunch here the first week in May had a lovely lunch which was buffet style service was lovely but not that impressed for a seven star hotel. Wanted to have a look at the sky restaurant but wasn't aloud as it was busy I thought after spending £375 for lunch and drinks we could have looked around .
Burj Al Arab.. We took a boat tour and had an awesome of this 7 star hotel.Wish we could go nearer but apparently there are restrictions.

Quite an experience. Visited Gold on 27, a bar opened on 8th April 2016 on 27th floor. Gold decor. No minimum price but drinks really expensive. You go for the experience. Prior reservation essential. Very opulent. Gold bling everywhere.

Burj Al Arab. Well this time i did the Burj Al Arab and i wasn’t disappointed I loved it.A shame I could not get inside the complex because I was not a patron.So i could not have a drink or lunch according to the gate.‘Next time maybe.

Stunning Excellent Hotel Beautiful Must See ****. Visited the Hotel on business trip - Amazing Stunning - Really worth the trip - the views are spectacular -the service exceptional and the staff were amazing - food is great and maybe only thing was the price is a little high for the average person - Otherwise its a great place for a booking a wedding or engagement - for the special occasion

Culinary delight for food lovers. . Went for food only on the 27th floor. The title says it all. If you love food you'll love this. You have to be a food lover though as the menu is created that way. I'm delighted I went, it lived up to my expectations.
AMAZING. Grab your wallet, suit up and enjoy one of the best lunch or dinner location in the world. Don't forget to take all courses!

I found it most beautiful compared to other buildings. I found it more beautiful and interesting compared to other buildings in Dubai, though not all that tall. Situated on the beach, it really gives a nice feeling of a sail.

Excellent experience. A fabulous property.The restaurants offer unique experiences...be it at the roof top or at the lowest level. The view is fabulous from everywhere, be it at the entrance or the sides as the Burj is surrounded by water. The trip to and fro in a Rolls Royce or a helicopter is available too so if you want to gift a 'Hi Tea/ lunch' experience at the Burj Al Arab, they will be picked up in a Rolls Royce and brought to the hotel and dropped back in style and comfort. The helicopter transfer is quite an experience too I can imagine.The rooms are very comfortable with latest technology available. Bathrooms are lush and the mirrored ceiling is quite an experience.The spa is something worth experiencing there.Overall a wonderful experience.

Lunch with a view. To access the hotel you need to be a guest or make a reservation for one of their restaurant. You can choose the high tea or dine at the restaurant with a set menu. Both option are about the same price and the experience is amazing. The service is superb and the food very good. The highlight would be the view as you are facing the ocean with the Palm and the World on the 27th floor.
Gorgeous. I love Dubai's architecture and splendor. If you are the kind of person that enjoys 'Grand Designs', you will love Dubai and the city landscape.

Not what expected. We're lucky and manage to travel quite a bit. We "do" afternoon tea at THE hotels of the world so obviously had to come here. It saddens to say it but it wasn't what the hype had said it would be. Very nice, great views but just missed the wow factor for dedicated tea afficienados
The only 7 star hotel in the world. This is a must see in Dubai. Very modern, rooms are really have a lot of light because of all of the glass.

You can experience place multiple ways!. You can go to the beach and lay out. You can rent a boat and see it from the water. You can go to the bar and sip on a delicious cocktail while enjoying the views. You can go at night and it's completely breathtaking. Happy travels!

Too much!!. I felt guilty visiting this place. We had afternoon tea in the Burj. Although the service was impeccable and the decor beautiful.....it was all too much. I was overwhelmed and not in a good way. I felt guilty sitting having my tea here. So much poverty in the world and this is how some people live everyday!!! I was on holiday and knew that this was a once in a lifetime experience but it was hard to shake that feeling. I'm glad I visited and saw this wonder but I won't be returning.
Afternoon tea. Enjoyed a fabulous champagne afternoon tea with my best friends... A must if your in Dubai. It's a resort full of excess so you have to indulge and it's fabulous. Definitely recommend

Day visit. I have just visited this for the day since I am staying at the crowne plaza abu dhabi.. just 1 hour 30 mins. Really nice and the hotel is really photogenic. Must visit also the beach beside this on the right side which is free.

Sail design is fantastic. Couldn't believe I was there to watch this magnificent edifice, an architectural wonder design not to mention built in the middle of the ocean...shame though you're not allowed to enter without paying toll fees.

Beautiful. Nearer the up are to the buliding the more you like it
one can also get a fablous view from Kite beach and Jumeriah beach ; very photogenic location with clean beaches
Just wow. Not only a beautiful building but also a great destination to have that dream afternoon tea or sunset drink. Not to say staying over is not anything but glorious!

Worth a visit (perhaps not a stay unless you're loaded). We popped up to the Gold Bar (brand new). Reservation essential. No minimum spend but you're strongly encouraged to have a drink - about $40 AUD a cocktail but a oncer so why not. We only stayed for about 30mins but was worth it to pretend we're rich :)

A wonderful experiecd. We went to Burj al arab sky bar in the evening. Very nice hotel and very friendly staff very much professional behavior. They are taking care of each guest very well. Of course the bar is very nice and awesome view from the there

pretty impressive. We booked a table for two for dinner whilst we were staying at the Residence at the One & Only. The hotel is big and flash, We both thought dinner was a little impersonal and rushed. In actual fact, my plate was removed whilst I was wiping a piece of bread across some sauce ! and then POOF ! it was gone. Now that's never happened in all of my life !!!!Still, it's all about the splendor I suppose. Glad we went. Won't be going back though.They could learn a bit from the Residence !

check inside. we don't get enough time to check dis point so We only saw Burj Al Arab on the outside but it looks really good. It's situated in a lovely area, near the beach.beach is crowded and we travel burj khalifa fountain show.
Icon of dubai. When you mention Dubai this is the 1st that comes to mind. Marvelous architecture and design partly underwater. It's worth a visit when in Dubai

Icon of dubai. This is the hotel that is associated with the name Dubai. Beautiful architecture and design. Looks elegant from all angles. Partly built under water it's worth to take a tour of the hotel

A Must!. A visit to the Al Arab for Friday brunch is a must as a treat. From the fizz, starters to the scrumptious chocolates everything is perfect. Ask for a table at the window for a view over the Gulf.

It's alright . To be honest it is impressive when you go inside however I think we only went there for the view and the cocktails however we didn't get a great view. Since the bar opens at 7pm I would recommend going as soon as it opens as you'll probably catch views before it gets dark. Or go here for lunch. My review isn't about the actual hotel just my experience of what I thought. Although it is stunning. I built up the experience in my head and I didn't get that much out of it. The cocktails however are divine.
New Years firework display. . Was here just for the new year celebrations Awesome place would love to stay here at some point. Get the lottery tickets on! :)

Fantastic 7 course afternoon tea!. We went and had afternoon tea which was 7 courses and lasted for over 2 hours, it was fantastic and a must do experience. The Sky Restraunt is fantastic with view unpresidented, the hotel is as beautiful as you can imagine the only 7 star hotel would be.

Totally Over the Top!!! - But a MUST DO!. I was fortunate enough to be able to stay in the hotel for 3 nights. The hotels lobby is a real disappointment, not because of the décor but because of the bus loads of tourists just taking photos. If your arriving to check-in it feels very manufactured. Once you get past this and you are escorted to your suite this totally changes. 2 story suites that are so over furnished with gold and opulence. Everything about the Burj is totally over the top but within its surroundings it is appreciated. Although I wouldn't return to stay in the hotel I would highly recommend that you do this once in your life. I will return to the FnB outlets and looking forward to visit the New Bar next week.

Magnificent views of Dubai. Visited the hotel with my wife by booking a table at the roof top cafe. You get great quality snacks and drinks and you get to admire the views offered from the top of this extraordinary hotel. This is a MUST do in Dubai.Highly recommended

Stunning mighty architecture. The Burj Al Arab can be sighted from some of the best new hotels in Dubai on a bright clear morning. Ex: the Sheraton Hotel near Mall of Emirates.On the day I visited, I hired a car and toured the area. You can capture great shots from its external surroundings. A better view can be from the renown Jumeirah Hotel & Spa Resort. Located right next to the beach, you can capture its beautiful majestic structure. I didn't have a chance to go in but just watching it from Jumeirah was enough and worth a visit.
Not really much to complain about. The hotel itself is quite a sight, and from the inside even more!The restaurant buffet is amazing! all you can eat KOBE-beef.. mmmh!

Afternoon tea . We booked afternoon tea only the day before via email. They were quick to respond (not surprising with Dubai's service) to book us in. You can't just rock up at the hotel without a reservation..security will stop you at the gates. Afternoon tea at the sky view was fabulous. It's first come first seated so we arrived a bit early in the first sitting to get the view towards the Kalifa. Service was perfect..thanks especially to Zen for making our first wedding anniversary special.

One of the best experience of my life. I booked via e-mail the Skyview Tea and from the beginning everything was so easy, thanks to Lhotse Suico to contact me and arrange it.As I request they placed me in a table with all Dubai Skyline!Everyone there was so professional, kind and attentive; the service was outstanding not everyday you got the opportunity to enjoy a meal into the most luxurious hotel in the whole world.The tea time consist in various pies, sandwiches and small plates with different kind of drinks, such as teas, champagne and soft drinks.Details that make this experience different and memorable, like gold chips in my coffee!Now talking about the building is decorated with gold and many precious jewels, plus there are two aquariums in the escalators!A dream come true.To last but not least Zen our waiter was really amazing. He deserves recognition.Thanks to Silvia Urbanova to contact me to thank me about my stay.A whim!

Stunning from afar.. Unfortunately the average Joe Blow cannot access this building inside. We could only take photos from afar. It is a beautiful looking building. People can buy a ticket for approx. US $250.00 per person for an hour on one floor only for high tea. Cannot justify that amount of money for a cuppa.

Afternoon tea. We had afternoon tea in Burk al Arab on 8th May...I was visiting from ireland ..it was a special treat from my daughter who lives in UAE..it was everything I expected and more...food and service excellent..I was presented with a rose and a birthday cake ...thank you will remember this day forever

Monumental and luxury. IF you are a European North American art savy with a classic taste of color, you will find the interior too colorful and too much gold plated.Otherwise you will find it chic and elegant.the building is an engineering master piece with fabulous staff carry the 7 star name. By rating it 7 star they just wanted to say do not classify it a little but better than 5 star, it is far better.Everybody agrees that when the bill comes you will see what they mean and you are lucky the stars did not turn into zeros in front of your total.If you are a vistor it is something to be seen when you are in Dubai. If you want stay for the night make sure the body guard and the media are staying out of your room. If dont have any of the two, then you are staying in the wrong hotel.
Fancy beauty. Not worth of spending $ 235 per person. But in order to get inside for sight seeing, we have to pay for it and for the afternoon tea.

One of the BEST hotels in Sunny Dubai. After having lived in this City for many many years I can strongly recommend this property to any visitor. Actually it is a MUST see tourist attraction and while you are there, do check out the many food and beverage outlets. Trust me, YOU will NOT be disappointed as this property is simply out of this world. You can also request for a "show around" and will be amazed at the décor all over the hotel but especially in the Suites and the Ballrooms.There is so much more to write about this beautiful 6 STAR hotel but that means...I will have to miss my flight!!! Now that's certainly NOT an option, m8.

Best day ever!. Had afternoon tea in the Skyview Bar as a birthday treat and can honestly say no birthday will ever be the same! The price is high- but is reflected in the quality of the food, which is delicious and unlimited, the service, which is exquisite and the view, which makes it all worth it. I was treated to a birthday present and a little cake in addition to everything else and made to feel like a princess! Would highly recommend for a special occasion. Oh, and did I mention the building itself is one of the most beautiful things I've ever seen?!

Luxury Arabian life. This place in the middle of the sea with this strange form is so incredible! You can go there to have an international breakfast Or a special dinner if you are over 25! Unfortunately I'm 17 so I couldn't go up but be sure that international breakfast is as special as the dinner!

Amazing Experiance. We only went for a few drinks and ended up having their canopies, which were wonderful, the views are amazing, the grandness of the place is something else.You must try it, be prepared for a big bill but it is worth it

Extravagant . We stayed here at the end of a long few weeks travelling! The welcome when we arrived was amazing and the room was out of this world definitely what you would expect from a hotel of this standard!We ate in the sea food restaurant and the food and service was excellent! It should be noted though that wine was over priced for the quality of wine available! The sommelier however was very helpful and attentive and tried his best to give good wine recommendations.However we had Friday brunch in the restaurant on the 27th floor food selection and quality was average at best! Minimal alcohol was included in the brunch despite it being the most expensive brunch in Dubai. Having been to many brunches in Dubai this was very disappointing. Also our lighting / audio / TV panel in the room didn't work! Overall the experience was one to remember but it didn't have the wow factor I expected.

Afternoon Tea. We had afternoon tea in the Burj Al Arab to celebrate our Ruby Wedding Anniversary. What an experience. A 7 course afternoon tea on the 27the floor with magnificent views of the sea and Atlantis on the horizon. The food was to an excellent standard, but beware, BIG appetites required. Even hubby only managed one cake! The red rose and special cake made for us added to a wonderful experience. I would highly recommend this.

Must see. This iconic landmark is definitely worth a visit, even if it's just a photo stop. It is not often that you get to see a 7 star hotel! We didn't have the time to go up and have a drink but if you do, give it a try!

Champagne afternoon tea. I know it seems a lot of money, but as a one off I would definitely say do it.The view from the Skyview Bar is amazing and the waiting staff are so attentive.I failed to eat all of the 7 courses. Doesn't look a lot when it comes out but take your time and enjoy every minute of it.

See how the other half live!!. Yes, of course it's really expensive but a once in a life time experience on my bucket list!We loved it, worth every $$$ we spent to go there, even my husband who cried down the idea was delighted we went there.There is nothing I can write which has not been said before.... all I can say is Go there you will not be disappointed!

Lovely evening at Burj Al Arab. Went to Sahn Eddar with my family. Located on the first floor of Burj al Arab, the ambience is lovely with live music. The servers are ever so attentive. Excellent service.The high tea consists of a three course meal. The first course being an array of delectable sandwiches, very delicate and delicious. Served with a glass of sparkling drink. The second course comprises of scones, simply loved their raisin scones with a variety of spreads like clotted cream, passion fruit purée etc. this course is again served with coffee/tea or a drink of your choice. The third and final course consists of delicious dainty pastries, loved their green tea pastry.The whole experience of the beautiful ambience, music and delicious spread was amazing.

attractive architecture. During your trip to dubai take a half day city tour . This hotel is one of the costliest hotels in dubai and is situated on jumeirah beach.A cup of tea in this hotel may cost you 27328 dirhams .So you can stop here on the side beach for the photography only. Quite famous building

Sitting on the Sea. The Burj Al Arab (perhaps best known as the iconic Dubai SAIL building is truly a magnificient sight, especially when viewed from the Metro line or from the beach in he evening. It appears to be sitting on the sea & the lighting is superb.

A must see in Dubai. Probably one of the most known and most expensive hotels in the world, the greatest landmark of the city so it's a great feeling to be near this architectural wonder. Don't miss the unique sunset on the free beach near the hotel, it's a must do to make some selfies with Burj Al Arab in the background :-)

Burj Al Arab. Biggest luxury I have ever seen plus completely secure - like CIA Lol :DHotel is amazing, everything is gold plated, rooms have beautiful view to all Dubai and every room has own floor with bedroom and each hotel floor has own reception. If you like to visit the hotel, you need restaurant or bar reservation or guest invitation. Dont forget your passport, they ask for the copy - security reasons. You will love the sky bar as well as very cosy cigar bar with amazing coctails :) enjoy!!
Luxury!. If you can go, its nice to see all this luxury... Be careful and make a reservation before! We had some tea and coffee with croisant. After you can walk to the beach and swim!!!

Wow and Wow !!. This hotel is the best I ever stayed in my life. Architecture,food,atmosphere,and especially service will make you feel like 100000 Dollars Baby :) Recommended this hotel for couples and very special events and celebrations. Experience you will never forget !1

Afternoon tea at the burj. I didn't stay at the burj but wanted to visit it so decided to go with my family for afternoon tea costing £120pp. When we arrived at the hotel we entered to the reception area which is very small and not impressive for a 7 star hotel. There were four receptionists who didn't even acknowledge our presence and when I asked about my booking they directed me to the sky view bar and we were left to find it ourselves. Upon arriving at the sky view bar the staff were attentive friendly and efficient the afternoon tea itself was not as good as I have had at London hotels their was a lack of variety in sandwiches and pastries. The view from the bar was good but it depends where you are sitting to get a good view of the palm. When we left the hotel we wanted to get a taxi but we're ignored by the door staff and had to ask for assistance.  I was not impressed with the overall experience at being at the only 7 star hotel in the world as I thought the service was more of a 2 star hotel. It was disappointing and would not recommend it.

Wonderful afternoon tea experience. My wife and I booked afternoon tea in the Skyview Bar as part of her special birthday celebrations. We wanted to do something memorable and this certainly was! We planned our booking time so we could watch the sunset while we ate, and when we explained this to the very helpful staff they sat us at a perfect table to enjoy the view. Needless to say the champagne and the food were wonderful, and the service from our waiter was superb - efficient but friendly. Although it's "only" afternoon tea, there's lots of delicious food over several courses, we were invited to ask for more if we wanted it but actually couldn't finish what we had!The view of the city and over the sea was breathtaking, especially as the sun sets.The other plus point is that booking the afternoon tea gives you access to the other public areas in the Burj, so you can enjoy the fantastic spectacle of this amazing place.Overall a fantastic experience - expensive but worth it if you have something special to celebrate. For us it was the highlight of our short visit to Dubai.

Interesting to look at. Interesting to look at from the outside but no entry unless you are going in to spend money on a meal.. The cost of these is high. So although it would have been nice to look in we had to be satisfied with the view from outside!

overpriced. We had dinner and drinks at the most expansive place in Dubai. The food was poor to average for the cost. The views were not great from the restaurant due to hazy weather. The service was great, but that't about it. Nothing to get excited about. I would recommend this place for drinks only.

A bit overwhelming with the golden interior. we stayed at this place as we thought it is the most famous hotel in the world. The room was very very spacious, and for a hotel that's 16 years old, they have maintained it quite well. But we found the golden interior a bit overwhelming. There was also too many Mainland Chinese Tourist which were very loud. We would not return to this hotel again. For the same amount of price, there are many other much better options.
One of those must see Buildings. Impressive architecture for sure - beautiful white beaches either side - a place for the rich and famous to hang out

FLIGHT DINNER. We were not staying at the Burj, but decided to do the 'flight' dinner - one course in each of their restaurants with matched wines - beautiful food, wine & surrounds - well worth doing

A not-to-miss sight and experience!. We booked a private tour of Dubai and the very last stop was the Burj Al Arab, firstly the security at the entrance makes you understand that this place is really private and well protected. Entering the lobby is quite something as you look around in all directions for a jewel of architecture... they play with shapes and lights all for the pleasure of the eyes. We then went up the elevator to reach the Skyview Bar... Wow... As the door opens you can see all the smiles from the staff and the welcome is very warm. You feel looked after all the way. The beverage menu was very extensive and though quite pricey, the quality of the cocktails and the wine options were top notch. We ordered a tour of food to share and were really happy with the quality of the food. All in all, we were so happy we got lucky enough to visit this unique building. We would definitely go back again whenever we stop in Dubai again!

Worth seeing but very expensive. This 7 star hotel is opulent but you can't get in without making a reservation in advance. We booked to go to the Gold bar on the 27th floor and then dinner in the al Mahara "underwater restaurant". I wouldn't recommend either particularly.
Very close to Wild Wadi waterpark. We didnt get to go to the hotel but it was way too close to Wild Wadi to have picture of Burj Al Arab behind us. Water park is just under the hotel
Loved it. But oh it's pricey. Awesome place. Went for cocktails and it was everything we thought it would be. Make sure you have a few quid in the bank account though. Minimum spend of almost £300.

Afternoon Tea with Bubbles!. This was a real treat for my 50th birthday from a good friend.The place is very opulent and amazing inside.The afternoon tea in the sky lounge is faultless and views stupendous. All of my friends celebrating were presented with a birthday cake and single red rose.
Fantastic Afternoon Te. Wonderful day spent with afternoon tea and then an excellent 'Old Fashioned' taken in the Skyy Bar. Great, friendly and very welcoming staff. A must see in Dubai

a dream came true. A dream came true.
it was my dream to visit this hotel and when i made it i could noy believe my eyes.
perfect all the way.
i am very happy i can scrach out this of my bucket list

A really interesting place to visit. I am not rich enough to stay here! Then again few people are! If you want to go in and look around, book afternoon tea and you will be allowed in (you can't enter here unless you are staying or are dining there - and the tea is the most affordable). Make sure you are wearing dress shoes etc - this place does have a dress code.

This is just a hotel with just a bar but definitely worth of visiting.. As said in title this is just a hotel with just a bar but definitely worth of visiting. We had a really nice cocktails in a really nice and sophisticated atmosphere. Please be mindful of dress etiquette.

The jewel of Dubai. This hotel is the reason why I got to know Dubai a few years ago and it is truly amazing. It became famous because Agasi and Federer played tennis on the heliport at the top and put Dubai in the map. From an artistic point of view I personally think it is beautiful and if you see from the see it looks like an arabic sail boat. It its a pretty tall building with beautiful blue and white tones.From inside it is very barroque and full of gold and precious materials. Really impressiveI recommend to go there for breakfast one day (around 50-100€)

State of art Hotel!!!. Duing my visit we were taken to the Jumeirah beach which is just 100 meters from the hotel. The beach is open for public and free. We had great time there and enjoyed swimming in the clear water. Though it was bit hot but the cold water and excitement kept our tempo alive.

Afternoon tea good but overpriced . Onviously the hotel is beautiful and a bit extra special as it would have to be to justify its 7 star rating. The afternoon tea however was a bit of a let down and probably around the 4 star mark and extremely expensive. Other hotels do a tea and probably more worthwhile so shop around.

Must Stay. The great masterpiece of Architect is stay for ultra high end.Their lobby is excellent and Fountain show in the lobby is remarkable.Rooms are great with control device.Rates are cheaper during June,July and August.

Gold on 27 bar at Burj Al Arab. After some research, we decided we would splurge to have cocktails at the Burj Al Arab Skyview bar. But when we arrived there, we found out we couldn't go without a dinner reservation. Instead they suggested the brand new Gold on 27 bar, which opened in early May 2016. True to its name, this bar is all gold and on the 27th floor, with views to the north and east over the gulf and city. The signature cocktails are expensive (about $30) but worth the experience. We ordered cocktails and 2 appetizers to share, and that was enough for dinner. The hotel decor is way over the top - you have to see it to believe it!

Something you ont see every day. The 7 Star Hotel in Dubai and the only one in the World is something that makes this Hotel the only one of a kind in the World. Even seeing it from the Beach it was fabulous landmark build in the middle of the sea something that you need to see what man kind can do.
Must see and great photos. Highly recommend drinks at skyview, we also took some great photos from differnent areas in Dubai in day and night times

Must go have dinner at top!. Delicious drinks and dinner. We had to make reservations at our resprt across the bridge they drove us over. Beautiful structure and the drinks are yummy! The yellowfin tuna tacos are good appetizers. Yes pricey but your asking for it by going here. Absolutely worth having fun.

The most expensive drinks. Ever. . As a Londoner I like to think I'm hardy to a pricey drink. We were prepped for the minimum spend at the bar etc of £70pp but one drink we indulged in was genuinely £50 which was a tad shocking. That said the venue, service and drinks were all divine and I couldn't argue with that!

Gold on 27 - stunning lobby and entrance. Went to Gold on 27 for the sunset. Had the Light Sweet Crude - which was a mixture of whisky, foie gras, saffron, truffle oil... etc. about $40 USD. It smelt awful, but tasted great. The lobby was stunning and worth the visit. The view from the 27 is a bit far away from the financial centre or marina area - so the main attraction is the Jumeirah hotel in-front of you and the mall of emirates. It is quite calming though, looking out to the ocean. The drinks menu had some lower-priced options such as beer and non-alcoholic juices.They do take the collar shirt policy seriously - and have jackets available for you to "cover-up" if you come in with a t-shirt.

Honeymoon hot spot . We've dreamed about going to the Burj since a documentary was made about it. The opulence and grandness has fascinated me . We booked the bar for High tea. It did not disappoint. The service is impeccable. The views out standing. The high tea cost us around £300 as we had an extra glass of champagne, we were celebrating our honeymoon. I emailed before hand to ask about the table as I wanted to be right by the windows and they did not disappoint. During the meal they came over with a long stem rose to celebrate with us, the gesture was so sweet.The fountains in the main lobby are mesmerising, we got to the hotel a bit early to have a look round, defiantly recommend this. Thank you for living up to our dreams.
Holiday tour. Burj al Arab is situated in the sea wonder full n excellent property of honest DUBAI it's word famous architectural power of DUBAI in the word.

A Fabulous Landmark!. I will never forget my first visit to the incredible landmark building. A group of team members visiting the UAE were given the opportunity to visit the Burj Al Arab. So many pictures of Dubai show this structure in the background. Why do I recall the first visit? The four of us got out our Ministry van. I was last to exit. It was getting dark. I stopped because something about the Valet Parking area caught my attention. There was a row of 13 Rolls-Royces lined up as for inspection. I think I had, at the point, seen four in my life. Upon entry the gold doors, gold pillars and everything else helped understand why this hotel is SO special. My group went to the top of the building to look out at the view and relax in a lounge area. Later, we went down to about the fourth floor to dine on wonderful Lebanese food. On a couple other lower level floors the most exclusive and prestigious clothing, jewelry, and shoe stores abounded. No price tags! I assumed that if you had to ask you were in the wrong place. :) I have been back in recent years to visit -- not to get a suite. Frankly, I couldn't afford it. The Burj Al-Arab is a wonder to behold. It is absolutely worth a visit. It is unlike anywhere I have ever visited...

A unique building to behold.. Burj Al Arab is a building that takes my breath away. It's a giant sail boat that stays there by the sea. Good for me so I can enjoy it every moment. I saw it from the Big Bus. I'm not sure if the public is allowed to go inside. A spectacle to add to the spectacular high rises of Dubai although it's away from the city center. So no competition. Very clever.

Great place to go... Great hotel even thought it's a bit brash inside.
The bar and restaurant at the very top is excellent with stunning sea views.
Even if you don't stay there you can pay to use their beach area.
The whole place is faultless.

Iconic and worth the visit. Nothing prepares you for the beautiful setting of this iconic architectural wonder. It's stunning. You can book to eat although we chose to enjoy the beach and warm waters of the Persian Gulf as it was late afternoon and beginning to cool down.

Outstanding afternoon tea experience. we booked this through our concierge at the Hilton and got Free limo to take us and only £85.00 each, on arrival outside you are checked and have to show your booking slip as you cannot just walk up to this stunning hotel, after getting through the security checks, you drive up to this beauty, you are greeted with cold towel and yummy dates to enjoy before being taken up to the 27th floor, again greeted so warmly by the staff, shown to your window table for tea and the views are out of this world, you can see Atlantes, the Burg, and other stunning areas and out to sea, afternoon tea was amazing you get a 7 course lunch with a choice of teas/coffees and soft drinks, and it comes with a glass of Champagne which is so smooth, this is a dress up occasion and worth every single penny as the experience you will never forget as we will not,

Once in a life time. If you visit Dubai please make sure you do high tea here. The hotel is unbelievable- like nothing you've ever seen in your life! The customer service is fantastic...as I've found is standard in Dubai. Food is great- not mind blowing but you pay for the experience in my eyes. Our server was Zen- what a lovely, friendly, knowledgable man. We loved Zen!!! To be fair, every single staff member we encountered were fabulous!! Loved every second, brilliant experience & great if you're looking for something good to do to celebrate an occasion! Thank you- we had a lovely afternoon!!

Great. We were booked here for dinner reservations. The views were beautiful. Once you reached the 27th floor you were greeted by name. Everyone you came in contacted with were very nice. Food, a bit pricey but worth every bit, it was so good you wanted more but couldn't eat anymore. My husband is skinny but can't eat a lot and he was full and both of us enjoy our dinner very much.

Stunning setting for a special day. We went to burj al Arab to celebrate a special occasion with afternoon tea. This was a once in a lifetime experience and didn't disappoint. The hotel was the ultimate in luxury and the tea was amazing. Unlimited soft drinks and tea/coffee, unlimited sandwiches and scones, cakes etc. a beautiful setting up in the sky view lounge, I would definitely reccommend
Dreamy Oasis. Incredible attention to details and impeccable service. From shopping to dining and everything in between .
Iconic and inspiring. Not just the biggest or fastest etc, the Burj has style and an engineering beauty. Wow, I would love to stay there.
Fine Engineering with Luxury. The masterpiece of Engineering with luxury stands at the sea beach and is one the best place to be visited in Dubai

You have to visit this 7* hotel at least once!. We booked a table at The Gold on 27 bar....lovely views and very nicely decorated...although there was a DJ, the atmosphere was lacking. Service was fantastic and nothing was too much trouble...be warned, the drinks are very expensive!

Wonderful for afternoon tea. Dress up and enjoy the fabulous service.
It was lovely wondering around the lobby before our afternoon tea and taking photos of the extravagance. It all feels rather tacky but we do love a little tacky for fun :)
Afternoon tea. We visited the Burj Al Arab for afternoon tea in the Skybar. We really enjoyed the experience. It is pricey but nevertheless, wouldn't have missed it.

Spectacular Design and nice location, but for the (super)rich. In contast with the Burj Khalifa (see my review) the Burj Al Arab is more interesting. A spectacular design, both outside and the inside patio. Nice location on the Waterfront, good swimming pool and tiny beach with a longer beach a bit further. Of course, as is the case of many such "showcase" buildings in the UAE, this is a hotel for the rich, although at low-season times you may get more reasonable promotion rates.
Beautiful breakfast great hotel. We book just to have breakfast which was expensive but we'll worth it, the food was excellent and the service was great, very friendly and helpful

Looks nice . Have not been inside it for 10 years. When I went last month they now have a gate you have to get through to get to it. you used to be a able to just walk in. Looks nice, but I won't ever stay! need the €$€$€$€€€

An excellent landmark of Dubai that is a bust to visit by tourists. I was taken to Burj al Arab as part of Dubai city tour by my International Conference organizers.The hotel has received alot of publicity in the media and i remember making reference to it to my students during a lecture on Coastal Environments.It is wonderful to see it live and even after the organized visit i went back again myself to enjoy the beach /scenery.

Amazing!. We made our reservation at our hotel when we got to Dubai. Dinner is very expensive …. you can go for breakfast around 250 AED per person.We went for lunch, We took a taxi from our hotel. You have to have your reservation in hand in order to let you in the hotel. Lunch was so fantastic. Food, service, everything was GREAT.We really enjoyed it . Just remember when you are coming back to your hotel, the taxi there ( its Lexus car) except only cash so make sure you have enough for ride home :)

Oh wow. When you arrive you get escorted up to the hotel by a buggy cart, which makes you feel important straight way.Once inside you inform the reception area of your destination and you are directed to the appropriate area.The entrance up to the first floor has a water feature that sounds like clapping, but it's clapping like a song.This area also has shops with Lots of diamonds pearls and watches( amazing to see).We were escorted into the lift which took us up to the sky bar for afternoon tea, and this was amazing as the lift is full glass do you can see the view all the way up.Afternoon tea is a little expensive but well worth the experience. I visited with three of my friends who were celebrating there birthday. We didn't expect the amount of food that we received, but we came away feeling really stuffed.The ambience is stunning and unbelievable. The staff are really nice. On leaving we also received a rose each which we thought was really nice and finished a perfect afternoon off really well.

Unique Building in a great seaside location. What a unique building this is located on the water front providing one of the best views in Dubai.Its a landmark in dubai and definitely a tourist attraction.

Afternoon Tea. As the most luxurious hotel in the world we were expecting something special. It didn't disappoint. My brother and I had afternoon tea - I am a diabetic and each course for me was tailored to that, my brother had the standard afternoon tea. It was just so good. Food, table linen, cutlery and china were all first class. The hotel was beautiful. Staff were friendly and explained everything. It did cost over £350 for the 2 of us so was quite expensive - but if you go to a 7 star hotel you have to expect to pay 7 star prices. Beer was over £20 a pint! And what a spectacular view.

Fantastic look. What a great look this hotel boast of. Really worth to visit this place. Almost all tourists visit this place. We have taken lot of photographs with Burj Al Arab as background. One beach is also there near to this hotel. So taking photos with background a hotel & beach is worth.

Great 1 night stay. We've stayed just for one night and definitely that wasn't enough as the hotel have so much to offer. The whole place is incredible and everything is very impressive. Our suite has two floors with breathtaking views from every window. The rooms are decorated in Arabic style with posh furniture. Our butler greeted us on arrival and showed us around the suite. We've received complimentary Burj Al Arab wine (which we kept as a souvenir) and Arabic sweets in a lovely Burj Al Arab shaped box. The bathroom is very luxurious stocked up with Hermes amenities and every guest receives Hermes perfume as a gift. As it was our anniversary we've also received a chocolate cake and beautiful roses with a card - it was a lovely touch. In the evening we had a complimentary canapés and our butler prepared a jacuzzi hot tub for us. We've had a breakfast by the pool, it was a buffet with plenty of choice. We've also had a lunch in the same place and everything was very tasty. The staff is very polite and helpful.The pool area is peaceful with great views of the coast and the Palm. There's a sunbathing deck/extension being build at the moment but we couldn't hear any noise so nothing was disturbing. It looked like it will be completed very soon and it will look amazing so that will be just another reason to visit Burj Al Arab again. For the dinner we've choose Al Mahara restaurant that is located in underground and have a fabulous aquarium which makes your dinning experience truly special. Overall great stay, can highly recommend to everyone!

Way overrated ! I'll explain why . . . .. 1. you cant get pass the gates without a reservation2. it gave itself the rating of 7 stars but is really only worth 3 to be honest!3. the views are basic4. the menu's are basic** take a selfie outside the gates and save your money and time!!

Amazing building. The Burj Al Arab was not where I was expecting it to be. Having never visited Dubai before I thought it was in the city. It is a stunning looking building and it's setting on Jumeirah beach just makes it stand out all the more away from all the other skyscrapers. It's difficult to find the entrance as there is a dead end where you expect it to be when walking from the beach. Have a look , it's amazing.

An impressive alternative to the Palm.. This is next to the Jumeriah Beach complex and shares its beach with that famous hotel and is open to the Arabian Sea to give it a more typical coastal setting. Fantastic views.
AWESOME!!. I went there during October 2015 with my family and stayed at Burj Al Arab for one night. It was an amazing experience to be there and we are excited to go there again someday.

By far best hotel iv been in. I have been in the share of my hotel this hotel is just out of this world, service, views, food, restaurants, shopping within the hotel, butlers, amazing cars to drive you around, peace, spa, pools, sea I could go on for ever you just check it out very very highly recommended
Amazing. Very nice place. In order to get in you must have a reservation in a restaurant of the hotel. The skybar has a menu where you pay 70 uss per person and it worth it.

Not sure about 7 stars, but it's definitely worth 5. When I heard there was a 7 star hotel in Dubai, I thought- who assigned that? When I found it was mostly self-proclaimed, I thought I'd go to check it out. Having been built in 1999, this building/hotel is old by Dubai standards, but is iconic.The hotel itself is very nice- top notch security at the front making sure that you have a reservation before letting in all the riffraff trying to get a pic. Then greeted by name at the front and shown around. We had a panoramic suite (1412) and it was gorgeous. It's 2 floors so maybe not great for those with mobility issues. Everything is top notch and you have a floor butler that will help you with anything your heart desires. We had the culinary flight which takes you through all the hotel's restaurants- one entree at a time. It was awesome but a little overindulgent. Everything at this hotel is over the top, but for a "7 star" there are a few lacking things- they are renovating a bit and some of it was dirty/unsightly. The outside pool was tiny and not that great (there was a lifeguard there and one person inside the pool- a joke if you ask me!) and our floor butler gave my friend (visitor) a hard time about not having brought her passport to the hotel (she was coming to the spa with me, not checking into the airport!). Overall? Five stars, sure- but not quite 7.

Amazing Hotel but take you wallet!!. This hotel is off the scale!! We have never seen anything like it in our life. We did get warned how expensive it was, and oh YES it was!!!! But a one in a lifetime experience. You have to ring and book which then u get a booking code which gets you onto the island and past the first security check point!! Service is outstanding!!

amazing hotel. been there 9 years ago when it was fairly new. Enjoyed a hairdo in the salon and visited the entire hotel. Just beautiful. Very high end hotel and lots of amenities.
Recently I visited again and found very interesting again. Loved being there.

Excellent experience . Went for high tea at sky bar.
Perfect experience.
I literally cannot think of one thing to improve
Go hungry. They serve you a lot more than just tea and cakes!
THE BURJ. Stayed here in the opening week many years ago. What a beautiful Hotel. Still an awesome sight to see (sea) given its age.

Perfection of the Classic!. Second time having Breakfast at the Burj Al Arab, and it is simply an incredible venue. The choice of food, the atmosphere and the service you get is designed to perfection. The amount of choice on offer even at breakfast is amazing and it feels like you are customizing your new car until you realize this is only breakfast. After breakfast your car is ready and waiting for you. Perfect from start to finish.

One special night. Birthday special had dinner in room the room are the best and staff made it special they bought a cake in with candles and five staff one with a guitar played happy birthday thanks to all at the Burj
Afternoon tea . Fabulous experience all round, highly recommended. Service very professional and food excellent if a little too much.

Disappointing stay . One of the worst hotel I have stayed. We had 3 rooms ( 1908, 1903, 2003) Bed was very bad, old room old decor and terrible service. We booked 3 rooms, GM upgraded one room to a club suite which was Very kind of him but when checked in ,their staff seems to think it was a super favour to us. Fair enough guests had to leave by 12am but they should have communicated during check in but they failed to do so, instead at 11:20pm ( we were back in hotel at 11:10pm) their staff Daniela and Fatima knocked on our door and told us / lectured us saying basically my guests had to leave now, later when I discussed a little more they said 12am but if not they will call the security and they asked us to sign a voucher to confirm if guests don't leave by 12am then they will charge us AED1800 per person. Obviously the hotel have all the right to charge us and I am happy to pay if they stay , but the way to deliver the message was wrong and rude. Breakfast was poor, slow service and limited choices. The worst is Daniela and Fatima accused my 60+ years old aunts pushed their colleague, I asked their duty manager to check their cctv , and the duty manager confirmed to me they couldn't record any pushing. I asked the duty manager to investigate properly and get back to me why would Daniela and Fatima would have made such an accusation which is very unfair to my guests- my aunts. Overall, I don't rate it a 7 star and I will not stay there again.on top of that, room 1903, where my mom and dad stayed , it had a terrible stink which was confirmed later by their room manager it was due to their carpet, my poor mom and dad didn't make any complaint to change room as it was quite late when they wanted a room change but they rather just stayed there to avoid further argument after the late visit by Daniela and Fatima. Very disappointing stay.

Afternoon Tea. We booked afternoon tea at the Burj Al Arab to celebrate during our honeymoon. The experience is second to none and the service is of the high standard you would expect , it was highly apparent that every member of staff took immense pride in their job. The Afternoon tea comprised of six courses and you will not be left hungry, the quality of the food is good but does not stand out from other good quality restaurants . We can highly recommend going , if you ar royalty or not... you will feel like it for one day, and the memories will last forever.

Excellent !!!!. Excellent !!!! A must must visit... It is locatedon an island in a striking sail-shaped building, this luxury hotel and a 5-minute walk from Wild Wadi Water Park and 4 km from Mall of the Emirates.. A must see

A Christmas wonderland in the desert. An amazing hotel that in December had a Christmas display to rival the best that I have seen anywhere. Crystal trees and beautiful lighting providing a truly impressive spectacle. If dinning at the restaurant at the top of the hotel, to avoid a severe shock when the bill is presented, it is worthwhile checking the prices of the wine before ordering. 7 star hotels it seems have prices, even for table wine, that rival those of the finest rare champagne elsewhere.
Nice sea hotel. A beautiful D shaped hotel in side the sea on the costly hotels in Dubai with helipad the main attraction is the under sea restaurant
Lavish. Beautiful, iconic architecture. Inside, there are some entertaining water displays and some designer boutiques as well as the famous seafood restaurants al mahara and al muntaha.

A unique hotel worth seeing. Burj Al Arab is a unique hotel. You may like the design or you may hate it. But you can not deny its commercial success. The bold architecture and interiors of this hotel put Dubai on the map. This hotel is associated with Dubai where every you go in the world.That said such publicity creates high expectations for visitors. The food is quite good in Burj Al Arab. Our favorite is Jin Sui which is an Asian restaurant.Even though it is buffet food quality second to none. Seafood is top quality and cooked to your order at buffet.Remember you are not paying for the food only. You re paying for the experience, the photos you are going to post on your FB.If you are not on a budget, I recommend going for a meal or high tea to experience.

Lovely view. This is expensive but well worth a visit. We went to the sky bar on 27. Try and get there for the sunsetting I would be magic. There is a minimum spend of about €100 per person but you can order food as part of this spend. Ask for a table with a view of up town dubai.

Stunning in all aspects . We spent a morning there and it was quite the experience.The hotel has 202 suites and no reception (as such). Instead, guests are met at a "meet and greet" lobby area and then shuffled to their suites where a butler awaits them for registration. The views from the suites are stunning as all you see is blue water (all rooms face the water apparently).There are a myriad of shops on the lower levels of you feel an itch close to your wallet. At the time our visit the hotel was putting the final touches on an outdoor deck (apparently made in Finland) which will have two outdoor pools and a handful of cabanas.All in all, well worth the time spent visiting !

View with mediocre brunch. This was my 4th time in Dubai and I insisted on visiting the Burj Al Arab this time. What a stunning hotel. That being said, the brunch on the top floor was poorly laid out. The selection was good, but the quality was not nearly what I would expect, especially after the brunch we had last year in FiDi

A waste of money. You have to pay a lot of money to go to the skybar, nobody greats you when you arrive in the hotellobby. The skybar is outdated, they have green and purple light which is the worst to use in a bar or restaurant because everything turnns pale. Poor service by the hostess, who was rude, not very nice and was question us how old my daughter was. After she and I told her that she is 21, she just did not believed us, can you imagine.... so she was going to call our hotel to check this, but never ever came back, so she just gave us a hard time for nothing. Overall, just spend your money on much nicer places in Dubai.

Just surface wow..service needs attention. I have visited the burj for spa, dinner, tea, drinks and stayed once. It's a tourist trap and nothing more. The service is just ok and it's not 'individualized' as they claim. It's self proclaimed 7 stars but I can tell you the spa and room service donor live up to 5 stars.
Stunning view. I went to Jumeirah beach to take a good photo of Burj Al Arab. A very high end hotel, classified the only 7 star hotel in the world.Will definitely make a stay there in the future.

Loved it although a bit disappointed I couldn't see the upstairs bar when we asked. Brought here by a friend for my birthday and her daughters, couldn't fault the staff who were amazing and afternoon tea reminded me of having tea at the Ritz many years ago, so I would say as good. Definitely worth a go

Burj al Russian. The hotel is crowded with arrogant Russians. Built in the mid-90s for Dubai standards this is a dramatically old hotel, offering overpriced food in faded luxury atmosphere. From the restaurant on the top literally nothing was seen in the evening, but the price we paid was even more than in Atmosphere, which was the top-of-the-world in all the meaning of this phrase place.
Architectural Marvel. Burj Al Arab is an Architectural Marvel in Dubai and its one of the most photographed tower in Dubai. There is an entry fee of approx AED 250.

Mr roy oswell. Very disappointed having been to the fish Restaraunt before very very average at a very very high price,service good , best part of the evening was being chauffeur driven in a complimentary BMW 7 series 2016 car

Fantastic. Even approaching the building I felt nervous, it is just such a wonderful sight and I was so excited to go inside. We went for cocktails in the Sky bar and it was totally worth the experience. What a fabulous place, a must visit.

Evening drinks in style, luxury & magnificence. We were staying at the Jumeirah Beach Hotel which is directly opposite the Burj Al Arab, we wanted to visit the hotel as it was something on our must see list whilst in Dubai....after all it's not often you get to taste what a 7 star hotel has to offer. You can do afternoon tea or evening drinks but we opted for the latter so made a reservation in advance. As the hotel we stayed in is linked to the Burj Al Arab we hopped on a golf buggy within our hotel and were driven round to the grand entrance of the hotel, at the bridge there was a quick security check to ensure our names were on the list. As we approached the entrance there were bentleys, rolls Royces and lots of grand cars. There was a short escalator ride to the next floor (at this point were looking up and taking in all of the grand decor of the hotel including the huge aquarium built into the walls) we then reached a desk and were escorted into lifts that took us up to the top floor. On arrival we were greeted again and taken to our seats. The sky view bar is gorgeous and there is a relaxed but sophisticated ambiance. Our first seats were away from the window as it was busy but we were attended to immediately and given menus with a short introduction into the fabulous cocktail menu (roughly £35) a cocktail but it's worth every penny. We were then brought canapés such as olives, nuts & mini quiches on a platter in the shape of the hotel which was a nice touch, we were also offered the choice of ordering additional food or bar snacks from the menu. Shortly after our first drink arrived we were offered a window seat which was just amazing....although it was night time the views were incredible seeing the whole of Dubai lit up including our hotel and the Burj Khalifa but I would imagine in the day it could be that bit better but still loved every second. We met a really nice Scottish couple who we got chatting to. I had a cocktail with petals in it and I really enjoyed it. I was then surprised with a birthday cake with a candle which I had no idea about so that was sweet. A really nice waiter called Sardor served us who was really polite and smiled a lot. As we left the Burj we were expecting to jump on a golf buggy to be escorted back to our hotel but Paul joked with one of the lobby staff and said to him to get his Bentley ready just joking next minute he clicked his fingers and said I can give you the next best thing, his colleague then drove a top of the range bmw to us and told us to jump in....we were then drove round to the front of our hotel, this may seem like absolutely nothing to some people but it's little touches like that, that make them very memorable. Although the drinks aren't cheap I would highly recommend the experience and the hotel. We will definitely be visiting again

Somewhere very special. If you are looking to share a special moment with someone this is it. I was lucky enough to be treated to dinner here and it was an experience i will never forget. The views were spectacular and the food was exquisite. The staff have been trained to a very high standard and have excellent knowledge of the menus.

Overated. If you're coming from New York, this building is a bit overrated. It's too crowded and the view at night isn't as clear. I was under the impression that coming there at night would be better. It's so over crowded and there's a queue for everything, even looking out the window. If it wasn't a highly-recommended must see, I would have skipped it.
Drinks only, stunning place. We came here for drinks just to see and visit the place, stunning location, great services, quite pricey but beautiful location

Amazing and spectacular experience. My fiancée and I visited to try it out, the food is outstanding, along with the service and the venue. To really enjoy it I recommend saving yourself for the whole day and spend a few hours in a peaceful and beautiful evening out. Outstanding and beautiful venue, food, service and staff.

Amazing. We stayed here for 3 nights over the Easter holidays. From the welcome at the airport, to being shown to and around our room, the service was exceptional. The atmosphere was relaxing and the buggies to take you to and from the beach area and executive pool at Jumeirah beach (as there was building work going on at the Burj) worked well.There were the occasional rude guests who thought it was acceptable to push in front of my 9 year old son at breakfast, but generally this was not an issue. Before we went I was worried that the kids (aged 9 and 11) wouldn't enjoy the experience, but little touches like the evening sweet train made them happy. I am now worried that no other hotel will ever live up to our expectations!

took a dinner. I spent my bday, over there taking a nice dinner buffet.
Was nice and a good way to get into the hotel, unless you want to spend a night there.

Top Notch. Jumeirah`s Flagship Burj al Arab is definately one of the best hotels worldwide. The Service is absolutely fantastic, the staff extremely well trained. Only downside is the tourist groups in the lower lobby - but the hotel ensures, that guest are not disturbed in any way (e.g. no photographs). All the outlets are special. We especially enjoyed Skyview and the new Bar Gold on 27. It is not the cheapest hotel in the world ;-) but worth every penny! Will absolutely be back when in Dubai.

No visitors until you have a reservation at the restaurant. Having lunch in the horizontal space is rather unique. Imagine that under your floor is simply nothing for quite some distance.... Unique. The taste to the hotel decoration is very local (much gold and bright colours).

A 7 Star Experience.... I visited the hotel and enjoyed the surrounding, the lobby is out of this world and the service is impeccable. The aquarium placed closely to the escalators is something to marvel at....Lovely views of Dubai from there. The lobby and atrium are spectacular and when you enter, you are very much overwhelmed by the luxurious furnishings.A reservation is required to gain access into the hotel.The Emperor's US$ 2 billion...is highly justifiable...You have to see it and experience it to believe it.....
UAE trip . Amazing architecture. Beautiful place near the water. Very pricey hotel. Beautiful fountain in lobby. A must see

Nice architecture... Worth a detour!. To make sure to get the best view on the building go to the public beach after the Jumeirah hotel. Access to the hotel is very limited and you need a booking to get a drink at the top of the building.

Overrated, but one to tick off the list. Visited the Burj Al Arab for the Al Mahara restaurant and Gold bar. The hotel lobby and general architecture of the building is quite magnificent but lacks character, feels very sterile. The Al Mahara restaurant has a beautiful aquarium, which is incredible (if you like that sort of thing) but the food was a little disappointing. The Gold bar, which is about a month old has some 'interesting' decor, but the view is good - a typical city skyline. The drinks/ cocktails were excellent and they give you these complimentary seaweed crackers which are delicious! We were told that they could "squeeze us in" implying the bar was busy...in actual fact we were two of perhaps 10 people there, therefore it lacked atmosphere and energy...obviously not the hotspot it was made out to be. Definitely one to 'tickle off the list' but not all it's cracked up to be.Need to know: You can't visit without a reservation
Expensive. Yes it was expensive but a must visit to see the great Ambience decore.... Staff too gentle.... The property belongs to the Emperor himself...... Super infra...... feel like on cruise

Spectacular Hotel with the most amazing view. Burj Al Arab is one of the finest hotels. The exterior and shape of the hotel is amazing and breathtaking. The interiors are awesome too. You can only enter the hotel if you have a reservation.
Majestic Hotel.... A tourist spot by default. This is one of the landmarks of Dubai and a short walk away from Jumerirah beach. Very picturesque and a must visit for any tourist.

Gold bar with no minimum spend. New gold bar where there is no minimum spend. This entitles you to a fantastic visit to this amazing place without spending a fortune. You book a time buy a drink and you get stunning views from this new bar. Sunset is a great time for a cocktail and what better place , you can watch the sun go down turning the burj khalifa - visible from here - into a strip of gold .

Kitschy as heck. Unbelievably kitschy. After the huge fuss at the gate - can't enter without a confirmation/ booking / credit card promise to pay through your collective noses ... found that there's a tour bus packed with chinese tourists right up against the door. Whoa ! Love the look of the building - it is meant to look like the sail of a dhow - complete with helipad and tennis court up on the roof. I'm wondering just how breezy it'll be up there to play a half decent game of tennis. You're greeted at the entrance by a bevy of slender ladies who all look like they escaped from a James Bond movie set. All 6 ft and above - just like signing up for The Guards in the army y'know.Been to the cafe in the lounge a few times, and to Al Muntaha, which is a seafood restaurant, rather nice - and which threw a majorly exciting bash on new year. The food, and the view made up for the v.expensive price tag. We (including a couple of Cuban American lasses who Know how to party) responded by ordering bubbly and had corks flying for a while. It might be time to try another restaurant there. Wait for the review.

Blingy. Good if you are into gold taps. Was staying in the sister hotel, so had the option of a free visit, at certain times in the afternoon, as long as i was suitably dressed, otherwise, I think it was around £18 to visit! tremendous engineering feat and got the lift upto the restaurant to look around. Impressive view, though there was a haze that day.The decor is very much 'look at my wad!', not really my taste, but, if you are in the area..

Extreme opulence. Not a place to visit if you're on a budget, but a life-long memory in the making. Great food, views, atmosphere, etc. It is 7 stars for a reason. Service levels that leave you smiling.Eat in the aquarium restaurant and watch the fish swim by while you, SO relaxing.Wear a jacket if you are going for dinner, although they will lend you one if required.If you like your cars, bring a camera, Veyrons, Aventadors, Koenigseggs, they are like Ford Mondeos around that place!
Afternoon Tea. OMG....one word...amazing.....not cheap but worth every penny...go if you can. You must pre book otherwise you will not get through security on entrance to hotel grounds

I only went for Dinner. It was my special birthday and myself and my daughter went for Dinner.The night started with the Burj sending a car for me and taking me there.I shall not tell you how you get to the restaraunt because only them that go will know how.The Dinner was out of this world and the service was immaculate.The burj made me a birthday cake and sang me Happy Birthday. It is a memory I will never forget.I have also been for a afternoon tea also.It is not as expensive as you think.I have also looked around the Burj and it is awesome.It definetly is an experience.Go enjoy.
What a view !. Not only the view is great, but you have an extremely wide space for your events ! a NO miss whenever you visit Dubai ....
Wedding Ceremony. A friend of mine had wedding ceremony. Everything was amazing and nice. The staff were running around. They really worked hard and well done. Thanks for your effort.

Royal experience. When u stay here u feel like ur staying in the kings palace in Aladdin Disney cartoon. Breathtaking luxury . Huge suits! All gold fixtures, stayed in it the second year it opened. Loved the experience.
Gorgous . Spectacular building, surrounded by clear blu water and white sand. Like a dream boat out of the sea. Bring your bathing suit and drinks !
Must visit. Dubai has some of the most unnique building in the world, this location is visible from many area, but right next to the beach

Iconic landmark. All the photos in the world don't actually prepare you for the sight of this hotel. The outside isn't that luxurious looking but I suppose the interior would make up for that. The beauty lies in the shape and design which is magnificent. Amazing from any angle you find yourself drawn to it all the time and end up with tons of photos. Would love to go and look round but that isn't an option.
Great experience!!!!. Burj al arab hotel is the most beautiful and elegant ive ever seen. Its really a great experience to be in the only seven star hotel in the world.
Man made Beauty. Simply stunning and awesome creation, awesome views, water and sand. The sand from the Jumeirah beach get changed every once or two years during winter

A hotel unlike any other. You must have a reservation to get onto the island with the Burj Al Arab, so make sure you book something like afternoon tea to get there. That's what we did, and boy we were not disappointed. After a small snafu where they said our reservation was cancelled, we were allowed onto the island and went up the escalator to the second floor to have tea at Sahn Eddar. Before we were seated, we explored the lobby and first floor with solid gold everything and fountains. There were upscale stores as well.The afternoon tea was a decadent, seven course experience with tea, champagne, juices and soft drinks along with tea sandwiches, scones and other goodies. The views at Sahn Eddar were of the beach, Wild Wadi waterpark and the entrance. We spent a good three hours eating and drinking, before leaving.

Lovely nibbles and drinks. Visited the sky view bar with drinks and bar snacks. View was amazing, the service was excellent. Would highly recommend visiting here. There is a minimum spend so be prepared.

Excellent Afternoon tea.. We had a last minute afternoon tea booked at the SKYVIEW BAR. Cant describe the overwhelm feeling about it. The service we got was the world class. There were 6 of us with different dietary requirements and all of us enjoyed the experience of being felt special in our own ways, we had booked for 1.30pm and we left the seven course afternoon tea at 4:30pm. We were not rushed at all, Its indeed the world's best Seven star Hotel.
;Great birthday dinner. Lovely dinner at the Top Restaurant. Very expensive and very good. Service was great and we willl be back. Thank you for a lovery evening......
Cool design!. I didn't even go inside the hotel, just the view from the Jumeirah Beach was fantastic! Such a cool design and a really neat area of Dubai. Glad I got to see it in person.
Magnificent!. The beach was white and the heat was just enought. Perfect for summer getaway but we were just there for a quick tour so we were just all dry.
Really 7-star hotel experience. Really the experience with the restaurant! Please choose restaurant with aquarium with children. Excellent service!

like Alice in wonderland . Amazing experience in a fabulous place. It seems to live in a dream with unusual shapes and colours.
Too expensive but too beauty.

Not much to say. Its Iconic Dubai Landmark, but not much use if for us non residents just to see it from roadside, you get to see it little nearer when you are at Wild Wadi, you can go in for overprice coffee!!!!!!!, basically that's the only view you get to see

Luxury at its best!. I would recommend everyone to have at least one meal here. We had our breakfast at the Sahn Eddar restaurant. This hotel is amazing, the interiors are beautiful and very tastefully done. The food was really nice. And the Christmas decorations were really very nice. A must visit when in dubai. Don't forget to make prior reservations and the dress code is formal.

Truly Spectacular. I was glad that I made a reservation at one of the restaurants in order to get a close up view of this masterpiece. We all know what it looks like from the outside, but the inside is truly unbelievable. The architecture is stunning, in a city where everything else is architecturally spectacular, this place stands out. In order to get into the hotel you need a reservation at either one of the restaurants or the bar. It's not cheap, but if you spent the money to come to Dubai, this is a must visit.

A must see. This is a must see from the shoreline, but it is not a place for the frugal traveler. Only registered guests or those with restaurant reservations are allow in. The cost of all is prohibitive for the average traveler. We were quoted upwards of $4500. a night. Yes, $4500., not $450. We were also told that the best way to gain entrance to the hotel is by signing up for afternoon tea. Supposedly, over $100 per person, but a three hour affair. If I had more free time, I would have considered the tea.
High Tea. Wonderful experience of high afternoon tea. Delicious courses filled with tasty treats, and friendly and timely service.
one visit is enough. food is average and very high priced , the service is immaculate the wine list is over the top in price
Nice to see. Well we went to the beach there and visited from the outside. You can't go it..which is a bummer. I wouldn't go until the from of grew hotel again..

Seen on whistle stop tour. Again another must see sight that we did see and I am sure many love it but not my cup of tea. An interesting city skyline with all the skyscrapers with cranes on the top - not for the faint hearted!!

Afternoon tea with aview. This was a treat from my daughter and what a treat. Afternoon tea with a view over Dubai and the sea, the food was amazing, so many courses, staff very attentive. Worth every penny for a special occasion.

HI Tea. 24 floor sky bar . View amazing
Hi tea excellent food and just keeps coming
7 Star service
Not cheap but very special memory
