You can have HI tea on first floor but worth
Paying little extra to have 24 floor sky bar

Special Afternoon Tea. This has to be a one off experience because it is expensive and has to be booked in advance. There is a strict dress code. We were very lucky that they acceded to our request for a seat in the window, where the view over the water was supreme. Entry into the Burj is exciting with its completely exotic décor and the lift doors hidden behind patterned gold. While tea is being served there are almost more staff than guests available for the slightest behest. There was a plentiful array of tiny sandwiches, savouries and sweetmeats, and the crowning glory is the gold dust sprinkled on the coffee!

Tea time. Amazing. Atmosphere, attention, high class service. All is just breathtaking. Not something that we would do on every visit of Dubai but definitely once in life must do experience. Every course is served with extra care, everything is fresh and delicious. Dont miss the chance to go to the bathroom. Hermes toiletries, person who actually open the tab for you and pass you towel to wipe the hands. Everything what can be done in gold, is done in gold. View is million dollars worth. In general; you will not get amount of food equal with the amount of money you pay for the Tea time. If you pay so much in good restaurant in Dubai, you will have enough food to eat for a week. But, the whole experience is just amazing.

Great hotel with over-the-top luxury . The hotel is one of a kind, with amazing interior design and magnificent indoor fountains. A hotel truly worth visiting.The restaurants at the hotel are of high standard and serve great food.The service and staff where helpful and fast: you barely had to wait for anything.However, why I did not give this hotel 5 stars, is because it has been turned into a tourist attraction, with bus-loads of Chinese tourists coming every 10 minutes.Also, the hotel seemed to have lost some charm due to the amount of luxury stores: which has turned Burj al Arab into almost a shopping mall.Overall, the hotel is definitely worth visiting!
Wonder of West. Magical Burj Al Arab,7 star hotel for VIP travelers. You can find rooms starting from 9000$ per night.
Superb. Amazing view in the night.. located at Jumeirah free beach. Must watch.. the sight of Burj AL Arab between the International waters is worth going...
So Worth It!. Such an amazing experience -top class everything!Food, drink, view and service was 5 Star. If you have a special occasion this is the place to do it.

Welcome back - after ten years!. Visited the Burj for a drink with friends as it was their first time in Dubai.Security at the gate informed us we could only go in if we had a reservation which we didn't have. However they said we could make a reservation there and then. When they phoned through to the bar and passed me the phone the lady took my mobile number and said welcome back! I was surprised they still had my details on file after ten years!Service excellent, drinks expensive, view fantastic, hotel still looks new, with luxurious fittings - the only thing that has changed is there's a smoking area outside!It's worth a visit....

Overrated . I've only been here for the high tea and I wasn't impressed. The view is definitely nice but it's not worth the price for the food that was served. I wasn't impressed by the basic sandwiches and desserts. Maybe I'm just not a high tea person but for the cost, the food didn't blow me away. I can't speak for the rest of the hotel experience but I wouldn't recommend the high tea. I would definitely spend money on a wonderful Friday brunch instead. You'll certainly get better food there.

Amazing Engineering at Sea... The Burj Al Arab is an engineering marvel exotic luxurious hotel built on sea.While returning from Palm Atlantis I headed to the beach road to ve just a snap visit..the structure made me to wonder about the herculean task in rising this structure and the feats involved..This luxurious hotel in yatch shape is an iconic attraction in Dubai and on seeing the magnificent structure I was amazed to witness such a fascinating man-made wonder on earth...

Simply fantastic lunch at Bab Al Yum. Went for lunch at the Bab Al Yum restaurant and really enjoyed every minute of it. The building is well worth the trip, but the great thing was the food and the service. We simply had probably the best service I have ever had at a restaurant in my life. The staff were friendly, professional and extremely helpful. The chefs were fantastic and their food even better. Oh and the cocktails are a must also

Lovely tower, must see. Recommended to see this lovely tower, is an amazing view. My husband and i took a tour to the museum and the burj al Arab tower. Amazing view for sure. You also visit inside which i didnt get a chance to do. But im sure it would of been awsome to do aswell.

Oustanding Experience at Al Muntaha. Very welcoming staff and very polished. The lobby is spectacular in particular. We had a reservation and were greeted by name all through our three hour dinner by each one of the staff who interacted with us. Our salmon and pheasant were done to perfection. The rose was matched to our food by the helpful sommelier. All in all something I would like to repeat in the near future
No reservation, No entry!. You can't get close to the hotel without a reservation but it's still worth the effort to travel to this part of Dubai to visit this iconic building.

Our of this world.. 7 star all the way We stayed for three nights and had a wonderful experience, the Staff were attentive and friendly, and the food delicious. Its a hotel that you need to visit to experience memories of a life time.

Wonderful High Tea :D. We visited Dubai for only two days in April 2016 - stop over on way to Sri Lanka. We booked the Burj Al Arab for the evening High Tea and very glad that we did! It was a wonderful experience and we were treated like royalty by the staff. The three courses of the High Tea filled us up MASSIVELY and I was glad that we didn't do the Ultimate Afternoon Tea which is apparently 7 courses! Although we only got one round of sandwiches each, scones and pastries were offered more :) - LOVED IT. At around £75 per person it is pricey but we very much enjoyed the experience and being in such a beautiful hotel.

Must see. This building represents not only the image of Dubai, this is an amazing architectural building. It is very expensive to get close to it, so the best way to photograph it for free if you are on a budget is to go to Souk of Medinat or to the Wollongong public beach

Another spectacle second to the Burj Khalifa.The public beach next to it will have you taking amazing photo shots.. Must see, must go, must experience. It is most definitely Dubai's most popular tourist attractions. Depending on the day, you will find many tourists trying to get this experience.

Unforgettable experience!. Staying there would have been way out of our budget but we went for a tea time at the Sky Bar. We had an unforgettable afternoon sitting by the windows in the highest floor of this luxury hotel while having sandwiches and sweet treats you can watch the splendid view and afterwards spend time wandering in the public areas of the hotel which is a spectacle in itself!
Afternoon Tea. Best (and most expensive) afternoon tea ever! Be sure to book a window seat in advance. Lovely music and very attentive wait staff.

wedding party. we had my niece wedding party here at the top , AL FALAK ballroom. it was beautiful.
the food was great and so was the service. it is a very exclusive hotel, with total privacy.
the manager Mr. Shahid was very good in facilitating everything for the Bhadelia wedding.
Worth a visit at nite. this is an amazing hotel offering the best picture of modern Dubai; looks better at night with the lights!
Impressive. Beautiful hotel set out into the sea- amazed at how big it was- awesome sight - a must see. if your in Dubai
Simply Beautiful. A marvellous piece of architecture. Viewed it from the beach adjoining it and it was breathtaking. Don't miss it.

Really superb 7 star dinner :). Me & my Girlfriend celebrated a night here, and this really one of the nicest places I have been !
Excellent service and excellent food!

Gold on 27. This new addition in massive selections of bars in dubai made its point. Very classy and superbly elegant bar with the best tasting cocktails and non alcohol drinks presented so well ! View is definitely beautiful from the top and the service staff was amazing!!! I never had a bar staff who is well knowledgeable and highly confident of what is on the menu.

Amazing. You can not actually go to the hotel unless you are a guest or are booked for drinks or the restaurant. You will be taken to the beach to have a look of the hotel. You can take great pictures from there

It's got to be done whilst you are there. There is a new cocktail bar Gold 24. Yeah have to reserve in advance and the drinks are not cheap, but it's worth every penny just go do the 7 star experience and see inside this amazing hotel. I was disappointed however that the bar was a smoking bar,mans equally disappointed that the hotel does not have a dress code. We made the special effort only to step into a lift full of Japanes tourists staying in the hotel dressed in T -Shirts and flip flops. So it kind of took the glam off our visit. All the same visit the bar, to say you have been there.

7 Star Hotel of Dubai. Excellent view from the entrance of security office to 5he main hotel. Wonderful security arrangements. Plenty of assistance for valet parking. Friendly staff who take you directly to the meeting room and make sure you are comfortable.
Very nice. I love this hotel and dinner was really Awesome. Customer Service was Great as well... This is a MUST if you are ever in Dubai

Over priced, over hyped and over the top!. This hotel is most enjoyable from the outside. The moment you step in, everything goes wrong. I've been disappointed with this "7 Star hotel" on every visit. The food and service are well below expectation. And the interior decor is not for everyone's taste.
Nice view of Burj Al Arab from Jumeriah Beach. This is one of the good attraction of Dubai and worth picturing. The experience at the beach also is nice. IT is all blue water.
Worlds best hotel. Burj Al Arab is the only 7 star hotel in the world. A landmark destination of Dubai standing tall on the water front of Dubai at Jumeirah.

Service and pampering at the highest level!. A grand experience overall. The rooms were exquisite, spa was wonderful, dinner at Al Muntaha on the 27th floor was amazing and outside pool and staff, specifically Reubens from Capetown South Africa was exceptional. He provided a wealth of information about the hotel and the surrounding area. Every traveler needs to experience the Burj Al Arab Dubai.
Beautiful. Perfect architecture but if you not have much money not can enter. But is beautiful see it. Is big, original shape

Looks good from a distance. Great to see from a distance. I got quite close and there are barriers stopping you from entering. but a good sight to see due to the waters around it and great design. Lovely beach just a little down the coastline with great views

The 7 star extravagance. We got to see this 7 star man made extravagance from the edge of the sea. Apparently you need reservations to even get in. Our tour guide told us that the restroom accessories are also made of gold. We really did not know what to say but to just listen spellbound to the amount of money the arabs have :).

Iconic Burj Al Arab. The iconic Burj Al Arab is a gorgeous building but of course almost impossible to stay in. Go for high tea or simply go to the beach next door to enjoy the view. Also great views from the hotel next door, the Medinat.

Saw it from outside.. but its amazing. Nothing much share.. I heard you can go inside, provided you book an appointment for tea or lunch or dinner.. whichever suits you budget. Neither suited mine so I could not go. May be next time. But looks awesome from outside so I bet inside will be breathtaking too.

Afternoon tea in the Skybar. We were celebrating our 50th Wedding Anniversary so booking afternoon tea was a great way to create a happy occasion. I emailed the hotel to make a reservation and told them of the special occasion requesting a table in the window to take advantage of the views. They said they operate on a first come first served basis for tables but offered to do their best for us. Well on the day we were shown to a fabulous table in the window with 2 very comfy armchairs and proceeded to enjoy the most expansive and tasty afternoon tea we have ever had served by a very attentive and efficient waiter. Towards the end he presented us with a small cake with Happy Anniversary in chocolate and a red rose for me to present to my wife-what a nice touch.It was expensive at 620dms per person but regardless of it being a special occasion for us sometimes in life you just have to do certain things and this is one of them.

Expensive, but well worth doing.. The worlds only 7 star hotel...that speaks for itself really. if you have the means, dress up and go for high tea, or lunch. Dinner is a bit of a waste, as theres not much to sea from the top when its dark!

Wish I could go in!!. It looks a beautiful piece of architecture from any spot in Dubai. There is a beach close by from where you can have a close look during sunset time. You can also stand at the main entrance and click selfies. But you cant go in unless you have booked urself a meal or a room. And any of it is way too expensive.

Worth a photo stop. When in Dubai this is one of those iconic buildings that you have to make the effort to see with your own eyes and take your memories of it home in your camera. It's quite cheap/easy to get to by Metro/tram and bus and this transport system provides you with views over other parts of the city. You aren't allowed to enter the hotel grounds but you can get decent positions for photographs at the entrance. We found that to optimise the use of time whilst in the vicinity it was good to walk just down the road and visit the Souk Madinat Jumeirah which is well worth a look around too - also benefits from having toilets, restaurants, the opportunity for a little boat trip and a good view of the Burj Al Arab (see pic).
amazing. Only went there for lunch, but for what I saw it was really great. Loved the design and the staff was super nice as per usual.

Nothing more to say about Burj as everyone knows about it. Nothing more to say about Burj as everyone knows about it. Food there is pretty expensive but is worth. Only plan to go there if it is very very very special ocassion

Worth to go and see... One of the famous hotels in Dubai, you will find its picture on many wall papers, worth to go and see..have nice selfies with..stories say its a very expensive building :)Nice restaurants but expensive inside..
Meh.. It is far more impressive from the outside... inside, not all that - the decor is what you'd expect from a cruise ship or a casino.

An iconic building. Worth a visit.. The friendliness of the staff could not be faulted. Even the security guards were smiling. The decor is not to everyones taste but it fits in with the whole Dubai feel. Its more of a tourist attraction than hotel, too many tourists taking photos in the ladies room and the lobby in general.
A must visit place. Did a visit and what an impressive place a wonder to see, i had drinks in the topfloor cocktail bar and donner in the resturant briliant but expencive

Amazing view. Have seen the 'Burj' on a number of occasions on previous visits.
However this time took a speed boat towards it and the views were even better, the closest I have ever got. Took loads of pics. Really beautiful as alwAys. Hopefully next will get to go in!!!!

Evening in the Skyview Bar. We booked a table in the Sky view bar. I can only describe it as wonderful. The service was impecible, we were moved to a window seat for the evening - the view over Dubai is breathtaking. We had a bar meal and cocktails - very expensive, but you know that before you go as you are given a minimum spend figure when booking. Would definitely go again.

Must see at least once in your life. Our entry ticket to the hotel premises was a reservation at the seafood restaurant in the basement, the one with the fantastic aquarium (and fantastic food). Of course there are many other tourists but the architecture and overall athmosphere is still an awesome experience. Check their restaurant websites for the food that you like and that is somehow affordable. There are also lunch deals.

Wow . I went there in match with my mom, brother and his girlfriend. We arrived a bit early so we had some time to take a look around before we went up for our afternoon tea. My mom was the only one out of the four of us who had been there before and thank God for that, she warned us about how full we would get. The food was marvelous and personal I loved the ice tea
Unique hotel experience. This hotel is real Icon of hotels - there is no way to compare it with any other hotels. It is so special and outstanding in all points.

Out of this world!. Most amazing experience, from entering to leaving this hotel we where treated like a king and queen. Beds are like sleeping on clouds, incredible waking up to the panorama views. Tick of the bucket list!

At least Once you should Go... Burk Al arab...wow...What a place.. We went for breakfast.. Its really nice place.. what a royal feel you get moment you entered.. You can not go just walking..you need to have some prior reservations...Food quality was awesome.. staff is very nice...

rip off. You have to pay 130 uae per person just to travel by ordinary elevator to floor 124 where you have a hazy 180 degree view of the city, You then have to pay a further 350 uae to go to floor 148 which includes a few cheap food and drink extras.

Dubai's icon. Constructed in 1994, finished in 1999 on a reclaimed island from the sea. It has a helipad so VIPs can fly directly from the airport to their hotel. Cost to construct: only $2 billion. This was Sheikh Mohammed Bin Rashid Al Maltoum's idea to make Dubai as a tourist destination and to be known all over the world. What motivated him was -- one day, when he was in another country he showed his passport, the immigration officer did not know where Dubai was. He then bowed to make sure that it does not happen. This building was one of his many projects. There's construction going on all over Dubai. I also heard they are going to build all the 7 wonders of the world. I wonder how will that turn out.
It was visit not stay. This luxurious hotel is one of the 7 wonders.looks like 1000 nights tales.very special in every corner

Afternoon Tea A Must. We had prior booked our afternoon tea prior to our arrival in Dubai. This spectacular and opulent hotel has a lot of security so one must have a reservation to gain access. We were free to wander around the lobby prior to our reservation slot. The only criticism I would have is that you are not allowed up to the sky view prior to your reservation slot, this means queuing at the elevator. There were not enough seats and having leg problems I found this rather long and uncomfortable. The afternoon tea lounge was spectacular, with unrivalled views. The food was first class and service outstanding. Very expensive but worth it!

Afternoon Tea as a Birthday Treat. We went with my daughter and her friend for afternoon tea at the lounge at the top. Quite pricey as they include Champagne without a non - alcohol option. The food was impressive, but it is at many of the top hotel afternoon tea venues.Overall, the girls, who had never been to the Burj Al Arab before, were absolutely blown away by the hotel and the experience - worth every Dirham!

Beautiful sight to see. We took a night tour with Dubai Private Adventures and this is very beautiful to see at night but even better during the day. Americans are welcomed in Dubai and it is very safe. If you have a stop over here, stay a couple of days to visit the Dubai Mall of the Mirates with the indoor ski slope and aquarium that you can snorkel in. The sand dunes trip is a must!

Stunning. You have to see it to believe it. What an amazing hotel. You really don't know where to look as it's so beautiful. From the stunning atrium and the beautiful fish tanks to the wonderful uniforms. It really is a sight to behold. If you visit Dubai book a cocktail eve in the sky view bar at the hotel itself amazing.

Luxury Treat. Amazing experience at the Burj Al Arab High Tea, be amazed at the views from their sky bar. Sit back relax & enjoy sumptuous sandwiches & pastries served with choice of tea and or Bubbles. Divine luxury for a special treat

Unmatched experience. Visited the Burj al Arab with a group of 20 people for lunch set up in a boardroom on the 27th (top) floor. We were not expecting the setup prepared for us. The tables looked as if they were set up for a really expensive wedding. We were just mesmerised. We counted at least 7 people serving us so all of us would get the same dish simultaneously. They had prepared a menu for us with wine specifically selected for each dish. The food... Oh the food... It was all an artwork. I couldn't memorise all those French names for every dish but the desert was just stunning. After the meal we had time to explore the public areas of the hotel. I really don't know how to describe the tastefully designed opulence everywhere. It's really worthwhile to go there for a lunch or high tea. I'm sure everyone feels like he's got way more than he's paid for. And I guess it's needless to mention the views of Dubai from the 27th floor...

Sky tea, a thoroughly lovely experience. We had Sky Tea in the Skyview bar at the top of the Burj al Arab last week. Although a little expensive it was definitely one of the highlights of our trip. The food was exquisite, with seven courses, and a glass of champagne, and unlimited tea and cold drinks. I would recommend the second sitting at 4pm as then you can stay as long as you like, and watch the sunset if you are lucky enough to have a clear day. Enjoy!

Very nice stay. We stayed two nights in February 2016, with half board. Our stay was vwery nice and the rooms gorgeous, Unfortunately, since we were with our 7 years old daughter, we were not allowed to book in most of the restaurants (except two of them) which were international buffets. Should you dreqm to stqy in this hotel, I would recommend you not to come with childrens, despite the fact that the staff was very friendly.

A touch of absolute luxury. Never thought we would do this but if you are going to Dubai it is a real treat. What an amazing hotel and it takes your breath away the minute you walk through the doors. We were greeted so warmly by the staff and shown to our lift up the outside of the building to the Skyview Bar. We were shown to our table which was a window seat like we had requested and had probably the best view up the coast with the Burj Khalifa reaching up to the sky in the distance. Afternoon tea was a real treat starting with a glass of champagne followed by 6 courses of really lovely food and endless supplies of remand coffee. The staff were really friendly and explained all the courses. We booked direct with the hotel on line, very easy to do but don't forget to take your booking form with you. You are not allowed to wander around the whole hotel, only the area you are visiting. It really is luxurious and it was a pleasure to experience it. Walked down the causeway when leaving to get some great photos looking back and caught a taxi from there
Truly Beautiful. I had lovely experience at the Burj Al Arab. This is must to go place; if you are in Dubai, don't miss this chance. The architecture is amazing. Everything was great!!
iconic building. it was a very great experience.very nice view around it. it was so divine. great service. 7 star hotel it is....with pride.

Ask security to deal with nice behavior. It was nice to visit there with family but just need to ask their security team at the entrance to deal with nice attitude and dont be rush when guest looking for their reservation documents.
Awesome Building. Like nothing you will ever seen before, Its a amazing, Real Gold everywhere you look. Well worth a visit.

Nice to dine but avoid the wine..... Impressive building and luxurious setting. My wife and I had dinner in top restaurant which wasn't cheap but worth the spectacle....Felt robbed, however, by the wine bill adding up to 500 Euro's for 3 small glasses of just reasonable french wine.......

Overrated and over the top. I don't care if I am in the minority, my opinion is just as valid.
I am bit a fan of overvthe top and found this place one of those where people say oh, I've been here... We were not impressed, seen better views from other tall buildings in the world and better views from mountains

7 Course afternoon tea. £110 pp for Afternoon Tea sounds a lot but it is a 7 course tasting experience with champagne to start.
This actually turned out to feel like value for money it was that good, along with excellent service and amazing views.
Book it you won't regret it!!

Afternoon tea was wonderful. A wonderful afternoon for my mums 80th birthday. First class service. Would highly recommend. We took the buggy after to the hotel next door and enjoyed walking round the souks there. Staff were fantastic and the food and cakes were lovely.
Iconic building of Dubai. Over the years Burj Al Arab has been the iconic building of Dubai and one cannot miss visiting it. Great experience

Opulence, Style and service that takes you to another level. Crossing the causeway gives you a sense of elitness and luxury and when the concierge is awaiting your arrival at the door, you know it's going to be special. We had asked for. High floor and got the Top ( exceeded expectations) The Butler greeting and the opening of the room door was met with wow from our children. They wanted to put ball gowns on and come down the spiral staircase! Fabulous amount of space and plant for them to sleep down stairs while we were upstairs in our fantasy room! Pop up TV's ,mirrors, floor to ceiling window a and views to the city and gulf. This has to be on everyone bucket list and we will certainly be back

Bit too much for myself. The outside architecture is stunning but once entering the lobby it kind of disappointed me. There is too much of golden elements and "kitsch" to appeal to be stunning. The Fish restaurant in the basement is a nice location but the service has been a bit sloppy. Not to be missed should be the view from the top level Bar with excellent vies over the sea and the city itself.

Visited as part of a meeting with Jumeirah staff. This is all about what floats your boat. If you live ostentatious decor, very expensive facilities with unbelievable service this is totally for you.If you don't like being in an environment where you are scared to touch anything, of actually do anything at all for yourself you won't like it.That being said the cocktail bar is stunning and affordable if you take out a mortgage before entering (you can't just enter - you need to acquire an invite first).
Breath taking. Had lunch here and the service was unbelievable. I would recommend this place to everyone as it's totally amazing

language problem. please make sure which station you want to go by knowing perfectly, because sometimes you might have to change two trains. the police and the railway staff are not that understanding about all the stations.

Nice to look at--lobby too, but otherwise you can pass. Beautiful lobby and building. It tries to be as fancy as it can be. And the staff treats you very well. We ate on the 27th floor and it was passable, but certainly not worth the money. Very expensive for good NYC food.

Pricey - but worth the experience - just the once. Had afternoon team in the sky view bar. Stunning views and great service it's a real treat - 7 courses so make sure you are hungry ! Pricey but worth if - only just.

Birthday dinner. I booked a table in the sky bar as I had read so many great reviews that We had to experience it. The vistas were fantastic and to see the lights of Dubai from such a night was fantastic. We had a reservation at the Al Mahara restaurant as it had been recommended to us by many friends. The staff were great, knowledgeable and a pleasure to be served by them. The food was of such high quality that I had to have a go at the flambé myself as I thought "In for a penny....in for a pound" our waiter paul obliged and this made for a memorable night. Great effort Burj al Arab and thank you for a great night!!
Best hotels. It's land mark architecture and most popular before bruj khalifa. You need book breakfast or high tea in advance. Worth an experience

been here love it.. The worlds only 7 star Hotel and restaurants ,the tallest building in Dubai ,and the higher one resides in one of the ultra glamorous suites the more one has to pay. everything is possible,every wish will be granted within reason .always here every year soon in may there will be a euromoney conference and then im on the top floor with a friend of mine ...to stay on topic ,this is one of the best hotels in the world ,

Unforgettable experience . I have visited Dubai several times as we have family friends that work and live there. On this occasion we dined at the Burj Al Arab - having each course in a different restaurant - and it was sensational. My personal favourite was the Japanese/Asian style course which was packed full of flavour. And for my starter I had scallops with cauliflower pure and pomegranate - best dish I've eaten in a while. While the fish course was disappointing for all of us, the venue made up for it. Definitely recommend!
Incredibly. We only had a guided tour of this hotel. If you can manage to get one - do it! Has to be seen to be believed.
Beautiful. It an amazing structure to behold,this used to be the symbol of Dubai before Burj Khalifa was constructed. Glad I visited there

Great for sunset shots. For travellers, best to visit this place on weekdays where there are lesser crowds and more parking space.
Great for sunset shots.
It was windy & breezy at night when we visited this place in March. So do bring something to warm you up.

Nice architecture. I went there during Chinese New Year. there were Chinese characters welcoming to Dubai. The place was certainly filled with Chinese tourists. The hotel is known for its price. But, having visited the place, I agree that it is worth staying for a night.  You were welcome by staff which lined up to greet you with garland and tea. The view is breathtaking. Unfortunately, February was still a cold month and I could not swim outside. The cuisine was good. not every one of our group appreciated the food but Chinese are choosy with their food to the extreme. The service is excellent. Every one assumes that service is proportional to price. Go to the Sheratons in London and you'll know that assumption is wrong.

OK but too expensive. We went to "tick a box" of seeing a 6 star hotel and it's view. The lobby was nice but quite over-run with tour groups. The view from the top is not as good (in my opinion) as from Singapore's Asia Space bar at the Swissotel, and the minimum spend is too high. I would not recommend this as there other other experiences in Dubai without the $$ involved.

Unbelievable until you see it. Its a smashing experience! The gold seen everywhere is real. Take your paperwork as they do check it. The aquarium adds to the stunning impression. Its not everyone's cup of tea at cheapest just under 2,000USD with taxes and gratuities for the cheapest room. But, its the experience of a lifetime. Have high tea at the Skyview and then some drinks till sunset. You won't regret till you see the credit card bill.

5 Star all the way. Well having stayed a few times and just got back from another visit all I can say is there is nowhere else to stay if your visiting the service is excellent the hotel is out of this world and the food is just to die for, I can't wait till my next visit

Burj Al Arab - Jumeriah Beach. This beach is very clean and has few shacks of food. The Sea water herre is crystal clear and blue green in color. The right time to visit the place is around 1700 hrs when is not so bright.

Looks beautiful from the outside. My family signed up for a tea package so we got to go inside the hotel. It's nice on the inside but the outside is much better. The food and the tea are just so so for me, my wife and 10 year old son. Service took a bit long so we didn't get enough time to take pictures. Should have just skipped the eat and drink and just walk around the facility and take more pictures.

Fantastice. was fantastic afternoon tea, the service was good and he food was great, the location is really great, I loved this part of duabi thank you for the great time and for the good service.....

"Truly Spoiled". This was a surprise for my daughter, her husband and our 8 month old granddaughter. We have stayed in the past....and when you think it cannot get better it truly does for sure. We had a lovely 2 bedroom suite overlooking the City and on the 20th Floor and gorgeous cot for the baby with a special teddy with her name on it.We had Paul as one of our many butlers on hand to unpack whilst we went to breakfast at Bab Al Yam (also done a review for that) which as always a delight. We all had a spa treatment (apart from baby hehe) which was divine. The chefs would prepare meals for baby too, just had to ask in advance. Dinner in Al Iwan was a feast as usual and baby took her place in a highchair at the top of the table. They are very child friendly and even had a sweetie trolley came to our suite each night which the adults enjoyed for sure. Evening canapes and drinks were also served before dinner and on our last night a stunning chocolate tree with strawberries was delivered by Stephanie and her team, so a big thank you for all you did and not forgetting Nimal for all his help in arranging the surprise......they loved it as much as we do...Thank to all the staff we encountered for being soo kind once again. Of course we will be back :)

Great ending to our Honeymoon. We enjoyed a great evening at the Burj Al Arab. Sometimes in posh places you can be made to feel inferior, not here though. We were treated like royalty from start to finish, which was a nice feeling. It's expensive but it's worth it for the experience. We were congratulated on our wedding as soon as we arrived, which was a nice touch. We enjoyed our drinks, we weren't rushed and the service was excellent. It was great looking out over the city from the top in the SkyView Bar. We're going back to Dubai in September and we'll be looking at going here again.

very good Beach with awesome jogging track. Beach is really good to spend family time. No water sports available here. But Jogging track created with shock absorbing material which add extra joy to your running/jogging.

Pretty freaking amazing..... Had drink reservations at the sky bar...was fun...the drinks will not let you down...i had know idea each drink had its own performance...was quite fun....The crowd was friendly and fun...appetizers amazing...food was good....it was worth the minimum...plus some....i enjoyed and reccommend it.

Over rated. Unfortunately not worth the money to visit. Outrageously expensive with views that are ok but available elsewhere for a lot less dollars. Amazed to see so many tour groups being escorted through the hotel at sunset. Wouldn't have been to happy if I'd been staying there. Would feel like a fish in a fish bowl. Everyone taking photos and staring. Better value hotels.
sail away. To me this is a building that has to be seen to be believed, the architecture is fascinating, staff are welcoming and friendly and go out of their way to help you.

Grand and Beautiful. We did not stay at the Burj Al Arab, but were able to take a tour and it was amazing! The lobby area is beyond anything I've ever seen in my life. So colorful and vibrant. The rooms are very luxurious and it makes you understand how they say they're a 7 star resort. They had a beautiful pool with a swim up bar on the beach that was so appealing I wanted to jump right in.

Afternoon tea. We went for tea in the lobby.You must have a reservation or at least staying in the hotel to gain access to the hotel. The tea was $165 per person and it was actually a meal. It was fun to see inside the lobby and the hotel.

Luxurious High Tea. We've only done this once but we went to the Burj Al Arab for high tea with some close friends. As you can imagine, having high tea in the most expensive hotel in the world isn't going to be cheap, but we can tick it off of our bucket list now! We really enjoyed the food and the atmosphere was welcoming and at the same time kind of made us feel like royalty >.< If having high tea is not really your cup of tea (pun intended) and you'd rather admire the hotel from outside, the closest you can get without entering the grounds of the hotel is by the entrance to Wild Wadi (right next door).

Looks like a monument.. Situated in Jumeirah , in ocean, i could only see it from beach and while i was in catamaran , couldn't see it from inside, but one can imagine from external looks , how it luxury it must be form inside too. very scenic.
Pleasent afternoon tea. Great experience to have tea at this iconic building. The service was excellent and the food was delicious.

It is the third tallest hotel in the world. Burj Al Arab stands on an artificial island 280 m (920 ft) from Jumeirah beach and is connected to the mainland by a private curving bridge. The shape of the structure is designed to mimic the sail of a ship. It has a helipad near the roof at a height of 210 m (689 ft) above ground. Reservations are essentials for dining Map 3 E1 Mall of the Emirates.

Amazing Hotel. Hotel like no other... If you want luxury, you'll get luxury. Amazing view from the suites. Very luxurious. Everything is covered with 24 karat gold plate. Toiletries are Herme's products ! If you have extra money to spare, this is the place.

As an attraction. You can say you have seen it but only from a distance unless you are staying there or have a meal inside.High security here.Glass lift Lovely foyer arealunch in Al Muntaha 27th floor very pleasant but VERY expensive, service and food good, vegetarian catered for but not greatly. Sea view mainly, view of Palm to left if sitting on that side of restaurant, world such as it is, to right. If you dine here at night book and request a table with that view otherwise will just be black nothingness. Overall not a good as Armani/Amaltaxi to Dubai Mall AED40, to Atlantis up Palm AED 35 20 minutes.

Afternoon tea is excellent. As yo would expect from a 7 star hotel this place is all about service service service. They really look after you. We stopped there just for Afternoon Tea. It's not cheap but for the experience it was 100% worth it. The view is good from the top and food and drink was great. Best afternoon tea I have ever had. Glad we booked this in advance as you can't even access the hotel unless you have a reservation confirmation to show security on entry of you don't even get over the bridge into the hotel.

Good but.... Is a good piece of architecture but I have to be honest that I expected more. But as I did not reserve a visit in advance I did not go up there. Make sure to reserve and get tickets beforehand. I still think os a good visit to go up there. But if you just have one opportunity Burj Khalifa is much more impressive.
Lunch. Great place. Warm welcome and they couldnt do enough. Lovely view of fishes in the Al Mahara resturant. Food nice and atmosphere great.

The icon. This is the most iconic place in the city. Beautiful from every angle especially once you step inside, great sunsets and photo ops from the beach immediately north of the burj, it is also open and free.

A why not moment solo at the Burj Al Arab for afternoon tea.... Not sure if I wrote about it but I had such a lovely experience at the Burj Al Arab in January 2016 when I was on business in Dubai. There are times when I have been on business I have been a solo traveler. Thoughts come to mind for some who wonder since they are alone should they order takeaway every night at the hotel? I happen to think quite opposite of this. Why visit a new place in the world sitting in your hotel every night? When you can go and venture out - you should. I do and I did when I went to the Burj. The last time I was in Dubai I went to the Burj Khalifa for tea which was lovely but wanted to go to Burj Al Arab. I had written about the experience months ago in a journal but wanted to post here. As a recap I enjoy going to afternoon tea. When I found out I was going to Dubai the first thing I did was make a reservation for tea. Did I go up or down? Well there was two tea options. One was downstairs on the first level but I chose to go upstairs instead to a room called the Skyview Bar. I had made a tentative reservation for my colleague just in case if they were able to go but that did not happen so I went. I went alone. Gasps............alone you ask??????? To the seven star hotel of all places?YES I went alone.Because I could and I had the opportunity in my hands and I chose to take it.Have you ever heard of Seizing the day or the moment?WHY NOT!Why not live life. Why not just do it! Why need an excuse.I did it simple as that!Once inside and instructed where to go I stopped and took some photos and to my left and right were some of the hugest aquariums I have ever seen. I had to take the escalator up and go into the back almost like into the “spine of the sail”. I cannot honestly describe how it looks inside except it looks so exotic and rich. It is one of those places if you are into stuff like this even to experience once you just have to go in there. Really stunning and parts of it are dim lit however once you get up to the top of the escalator and look up it will blow you away. The architect whoever designed this really is on one other abstract level. It has this sort of Arabian feel but -------how the hotel, or the architecture is aligned with the rich blue. Wow the decor is beautiful. Really out of this world. Architecture alone it is a masterpiece. Once to the back you have a choice. To the right elevators (glass) is where you go if you are staying at the hotel and to the back you have the hotels that take you to the top and you can top !!!!!!!!! To the Skyview Bar! Once you get there they are totally expecting you and then you walk through a very Arabian looking door case and then voila you are there. You have a panoramic view from the 27th floor! When I was seated I was seated by the window as I had requested. I must say I felt like a Diva up there. Fearless let me tell you! Once seated I was greeted to explain the menu and was also greeted with a plate of dates. Another person came over to greet me and said “Is there something special we are celebrating today?”. I said yes there is. I am celebrating me. The actual service was pretty spectacular. There were 7 to 8 portions and the afternoon tea itself is broken down into 2 pages that define what you are getting. I started off the tea with a glass of champagne admiring on the 27th floor Palm Jumeriah to my left while the sun went down and Downtown Dubai to my right. I was treated with the utmost respect considering I was alone. The food and service was impeccable. I ended up with a takeaway bag with some scones but for this experience for tea writing is one thing. Experience is another. Without giving you more details I suggest you go and experience. BTW It was around $170.00 USD for one person. Yes it was worth it. Will share photos later

Everything we hoped it would be and more!!. I cannot state enough how fantastic an experience we had here!!We were seated frontline, in the centre of the room with views right out over The Palm and the service was exceptional from beginning to end!We had afternoon tea, which seemed endless and actually consists of a few small courses before they bring out the tea stands! Everything from the bread to the decoration was outstanding in quality & freshness and our server was so attentive & friendly!My husband & I were there for both our birthdays & we each received a lovely little cake & I, a single red rose which was such a lovely gesture!!After watching the unforgettable sunset, we were asked if we'd like to move to the other side of the room so we could see Dubai all lit up at night, which we did!This experience was one of the highlights of our 1st trip to Dubai & we can't wait to return in the future!

Icon of Dubai. The most majestic man made iconic marvels of dubai. The hotel is simply majestic with its Gold architecture staircase and the amazing history behind this hotel. One of the most luxurious and best hotels in the world. A proud Attraction of Dubai

A Beautiful Structure. This is like a dream come true construction of a man. I had the opportunity to get a private tour of the entire facility except the rooms as they were running full. The restaurant with the massive Fish Tank is brilliantly made and would be ideal for anyone wanting to go on a date. The panoramic lift that took me to the restaurant on top of the building some 200 metres high was also amazing. The view from that restaurant is something to die for where you can see the palm islands. The fountain in the lobby is also extremely good.

I live in Dubai but still visiting this place a lot. What can I say, nothing like this place everywhere else.Even with the new Burj Khalifa, this Burj Al Arab is has charm with it's unique architecture.To enter this place you must have reservation in any of their restaurants or appointment with resident, but it is free to take picture from outside.

High Tea like no other!. 7* hotel with a price to match but exceptional experience and one of those things where I would say - forget the price tag and enjoy the moment. Food quality is first class as you might expect but surprisingly, it is also more than enough in terms of quantity. If you don't have enough time when you arrive, make sure you take some time to scout round the lobby, lounge areas and shops - not quite your normal high street options....'Chopard' etc all on view. One of those things life which I will always remember............

Undeniably the most spectacular hotel in the world.. Even if you have seen lots of photos and videos of this place until you see and experience it in real life you can't appreciate how amazing it is. Sitting alone on a promontory it is so visible as if no other building dare encroach. We paid about $3,000 for one night for the basic suite, and they only have suites, so we had high expectations which they managed to exceed. Our suite was two story and enormous with lavish decor and amenities. You can ecperience a slice of life that only the very few will. Needless to say the service was exceedingly good and personal. If you can justify a stay don't miss it.
Beautiful building. Whether you're staying here or just viewing from afar this building is beautiful. Located close to Jumeriah there are many nice facilities in the area.
Good One. In middle of sea this hotel stand as tall as it can this is man made marvel. one of the best building in world
Beautiful at night. Went here one evening before i went home. The view was amazing and at night it was beautiful. Defo something to see
nice to see. nice to see if you dont wanna spend 500 a night at hotel just got to the beach near it. take alot of pics better at night as youll see the sail looks different colors
Birthday Dinner for my wife. The skyview restaurant was awesome. The staffs were professional and friendly. Roland was really exceptional in his duties.

Incredible food flight . We booked the food and wine flight here and had 6 courses. Absolutely choreographed from each restaurant as we moved through the food. absolutely delicious food along with response service. All in such an amazingly luxurious yet welcoming setting. Worth a really special treat
Fantastic. Great place, somewhere to go once in Dubai, you can't miss it and definitely its a trip you need to do.

Drinks and some food at the Sky Bar - unforgettable experience. We had drinks and some food at the Sky Bar - an unforgettable experience and cheaper than expected. The staff are very friendly and professional. A must whilst in Dubai!

tea package. we paid 280 dhs for a package . It was good to be in the Burj - but the lobby did not have anything wow to look at. THe 285 we spent could be used to order snacks - which was highly priced and not tasty food . 90dhs for a schwarma is ok to pay , but not if it does not taste good - not something I will do again
An experience I will never forget... Fabulous. Lunch here was amazing...its a ' must do' when in Dubai. Then in the Sky Bar for sunset cocktails afterwards... Incredible experience...
Impressivd. Didn't actually go in, but grabbed some lovely photos by the beach. It is gorgeous. As impressive as you've seen in photos. Would go for afternoon tea if we go back to Dubai.
Incredible. To go inside you need a reservation at any of the restaurants, its worth it! The hotel is just amazing!

Exquisite. Luxury at its finest! What is there not to like? Extremely beautiful hotel, with magnificent views, fantastic customer service, and attention to detail is superb! I came here for afternoon tea, and it was delightful!

Very expensive sky bar fee for views you may not see. Not a great menu for 350aed fee.... Wouldn't rush back. Service good but food average. Hectic gaining entry if an event on we had to get out of tech on the road up, too much of a tourist trap.
visit. we visit borgArab city it,s beautiful city air is fantastic and the sea very clear water and sloly moving

One of Dubai best attractions year after year!. The fountains, architecture and the entire design is amazing, make sure to book dinner at the fish restaurant, right next to the fish tanks, or afternoon tea on the top floor restaurant so you can go inside. Otherwise it is closed to tourists. They also have a chauffeur service which can pick you up in a white Bentley and bring you to the hotel.

Still a sight to behold. I love looking at the Burj al Arab. It is like a dhow sail, although some say it is in the shape of the letter D for Dubai. It is reputed to be the most expensive hotel in the world. Situated on the Gulf, it is perfect for a photo opp.

Stunning to see!. Built of reclaimed land and located on sea beach, this is regarded as seven star hotel in the world. We saw this hotel from out side only.Very scenic if you see it from Jumeira Beach, more beautiful in night.

A BREATH TAKING VIEW. we had to make a special appointment to go here before we landed on the plane, there is a especial road to go to this hotel, inside is all jems and gold, it's like ur in a castle, the lifts take u up and u could see the sea while u r in the lift it's a magical experience, the service and etiquette of the waiters are so different from the hotels outside, it costs us 400 Aus dollars for 3 people for lunch, a bit expensive but u have to go here if u are in Dubai, arabic music around is so romantic, the toilets had perfume and hot towels, every thing was beautiful and worth the money as you would do this once in a life time. We had camel and goat meat for lunch I did not like it but tasted some for experience.

Wonderful . The Hotel environment is very nice, service is excellent, the room is spacious and with very nice decor. All the people come to stay at this hotel because of it's luxury, as it is the landmark of Dubai.
Exy. Worth the trip just to say you have been, but decor inside is already very dated and prices at the bar are insanely expensive.

Afternoon tea. Unsure initially whether to invest that much money on afternoon tea,glad we did main highlight of our stay.Impeccable service great selection of treats and friendly staff fantastic view.

Outstanding Excellence Hotel. One of the Best Hotel in the World, with elegance interiors and outstanding services . Must experience property . The Iconic Hotel in the World. Man Made Island Hotel sand above the Gulf 321 meters. All six outlets amazing . No words to explain .. feel the difference .

Wonderful Family Visit to Burj Al Arab. Visited with our family of 3 my Wife my Son aged 9 yrs and myself. Our Holiday was in Jumeirah beach hotel but we went to Burj Al Arab for the evening to see the interior and have a meal. Take your time when entering the hotel and don't miss a thing, it's a modern day palace beyond belief.Most gracious and beautiful it's impossible no to be amazed, we felt so honored to be Burj Al Arab guests for the evening. At no point did we feel out of our depth in the 7 star hotel it did not feel snobbish at all. All the staff was amazing even took photos for us. The food was to die for. I highly recommend staying here if you can afford it, if you can't a visit is just as good. Just remember to have fun and respect the staff and hotel we are only guests ;-)
Depends what you class as tasteful. It's an impressive building, inside it's very dramatic but a bit overdone for my liking. Very colourful and thoroughly unique though, worth a visit
Beautiful and expensive!. This is the only 7 star hotel in the world situated on Jumeirah beach. It is beautiful and you can go up to the top for a drink if you want to see the view. appt. necessary.

Sky bar cocktails on the 27th floor. If you like cocktails this is the place to visit, it has an extensive drinks menu. Cocktails are served from 7pm and there is a minimum spend of AED350 per person. You also get lovely nibbles. There is limited seating by the Windows but you are moved to those tables when they become free. The staff are friendly and knowledgable. Just arriving at the hotel and getting to the sky has the wow factor.

One in a life time experience. We had the chance to go in through the luxurious and world class hotel. We we're welcomed and assisted all the staff during our stay. What you gonna expect was there hospitality and professionalism. I truly amazed and tantalized the colorful architectural structures inside Burj Al Arab.  Room we're absolutely spectacular, extravagant, and beautiful name it. For sure, during your stay not even you will be have a one in a life time experience but of course with your family. It's a seventh star experience to the world most known luxurious hotel. If you visit Dubai, choose Burj Al Arab for your entire stay. Relaxation and experience matters everything.
excellent hotel.. excellent hotel . world class facitilites with proximity to jumeraih beach. must see if cannot stay there

very beautiful hotel. This hotel is not very tall, but it looks so beautiful inside. Water fountains are amazing. Gold plates are everywhere. The shopping inside gorgeous and the restaurants are delicious.

7 Star Luxury that is beyond your imagination. Managed to get onto a tour inside the apartments, pretty amazing to see the inside of one of these rooms. Go to the upper bar and enjoy fabulous cocktails too

Pricey but fantastic afternoon tea. I unfortunately went on a day where a storm started to come into Dubai but I had afternoon tea at the restaurant. Scheduling a reservation for afternoon tea is by far the easiest and cheapest way to get inside to see the Burj Al Arab. It is so ostentatious but stunningly gorgeous. Smaller than you would expect it to be on the inside, the restaurant at the top of the hotel provides panoramic views. I was a table of 1 but they gave me afternoon tea for 2. The food was great and the service was even better. I highly recommend this if you have some excess cash lying around and can splurge on a meal.

One of the kind. I visited the hotel and enjoyed the surrounding, the lobby is out of this world and the service is impeccable. We had a spa treatment there which was extremely nice and a drink in the bar on the top, which has a dress code. Lovely views of Dubai from there. The lobby and atrium are spectacular and when you enter, you are very much overwhelmed by the luxury and during your stay, you will be always taken care of and every detailed need will be anticipated by the ever present yet very discreet and smart staff.
Worth a visit.. We went to the sky bar and had a meal in the restaurant. Views from the bar fantastic, but both it and the restaurant very over-rated and expensive.

Stunning and very different. This hotel needs to be seen and visited once, roof top drinks must, the rooms are just spectacular, your private butler can arrange anything you would like, service 100% friendliness and professionalism outstanding. High respect of the trained staff i encountered during my stay...
Snacks and drinks. You have to eat here to see inside so we opted for snacks package in Asian Restraunt with choice of 2 snacks and 1 drink. Food amazing. Hotel lobby beautiful. Good views

Afternoon Tea. This was a must do on our first trip to Dubai and whilst it was expensive, I would recommend it to everyone to try once. The service was attentive but not intrusive, and the views spectacular. Even the sandwiches and cakes were served on sail shaped stands. Overall a lovely afternoon

Out of this world hotel - a must see if you can. We were staying at the Jumeirah Beach hotel and it wasn't until we got talking to a couple who had holidayed in Dubai before that we found out you can visit the bar at the Burj Al Arab for a drink if you are staying at the Sister hotel. You need to go to the Jumeirah Beach Information Desk by reception to tell them that you want to go for a drink at Burj Al Arab, as they will need to call ahead to the hotel to check there is space available and also to print off a letter to allow you entry into this hotel. You are then able to jump on one of the golf carts used to transport people around the Jumeirah beach resort to get across to this hotel.When you arrive in the hotel it is breath taking to see - everything is gold and sparkly you can tell that this hotel is a cut above the rest! You are shown to the elevator at the back which takes you straight up to the bar on the observation level. We had two cocktails which were out of this world, the presentation alone blew us away and the flavour of both cocktails was lovely. The atmosphere was a little pretentious so for that reason we only stayed for the one drink each and then left but it is definitely worth the experience just to see the levels of luxury this hotel has to offer.

My most expensive lunch. I pulled up to the valet in a Toyota Yaris, as I stared at 4 Rolls Royce parked by the entrance. We took the elevator to the top and waited for our table. I have made reservations online before going out there. We sat by the window and had a gorgeous view of the ocean and the Atlantis. The prices were extremely high from what I expected, I knew it would be pricey but not that much. I paid about 80 dollars for an appetizer, yes my total was grand but the food was tasteful, at least. This is one of them things you must do to check off the block, or you can do it often if your wallet is deep enough.
Awesome. had been with my family to visit this place recently. We were all struck by the detailed luxury in display. Truly the hotel deserves to be stared with 7 stars.

Al Iwan Restaurant . As a wedding present we were gifted a meal at the Al Iwan Restaurant....All I can say is OMG - we were in absolute awe from the moment we arrived.... The setting is beautiful, the staff are amazing & the food was out of this world...We will be back!!!

Once in a lifetime experience!. I booked a stay at the Burj Al Arab as a belated birthday surprise for my hubby and everything was magnificent from the moment we entered the lobby. Staff serve dates and refreshing towels are given to guests on entry and the check in is conducted from your suite. There are fish tanks on each side of the escalators and a large fountain in the lobby and another one upstairs. The suite was huge and big enough to fit another 4 people - note that the bedroom, bathroom and walk-in wardrobes are upstairs, so if stairs are a difficulty to navigate, reconsider. We were very touched by the arrival of a birthday cake for my hubby, even though his birthday had passed. A complimentary bottle of wine (you can choose red or wine), water and fresh fruit (you can also order fruit of your preference) are provided daily and we received a little gift each night, which was placed on each side of the bed. All guests receive complimentary Hermes toiletries and the bedroom slippers are the most comfortable I've worn (hubby brought his home). Everything in the hotel is opulent and magnificent - staff are unobtrusive but always on hand to greet guests and a butler is on hand to assist with any needs as well. It was the grandest hotel we've stayed in and probably ever will and is ideal if you want to splurge on a luxurious getaway.

Ostentatious to the max but food & service spectacular. This hotel is like no other, it oozes affluence and is unashamedly ostentatious. We were a bit in awe of the level of opulence, like two kids in a sweetie shop. The lift to the sky view bar is glass and moves pretty quickly. On arrival at our floor we walked through a short passageway of green and gold then we stepped into the Skyview bar/restaurant. The only disappointment of the day was that we weren't seated at a window despite making our reservation being made well in advance (my fault, I didn't request a window seat). The restaurant is bright and airy with a grand piano and pianist adding to the relaxed ambience. It was faultless from start to finish, from the moment we entered the building until we left. Our champagne afternoon tea was excellent with the produce sourced from all over the world (smoked salmon from Bonnie Scotland, clotted cream from Devon). Our smoked salmon mousse inside a choux bun was topped with caviar and gold leaf!!! We weren't rushed at all and spent several hours enjoying the experience. The waiting staff were delightful and informative and as the bar emptied they gave us some interesting facts about the hotel and its surrounds. Food, drink, service 1st class but so is Gleneagles & Cromlix House) Not sure if I'd return, I've done it and I'mglad I have. It's a unique experience.
Fantastic view from the top.. Well worth checking it out even for the view, very nice beach to spend a few hours on. Didn't stay for lunch so can't say whether it is worth it.
Holiday. Best hotel in the world by far!Amazing service, rooms that just have to be seen.Sky bar view and service the best ever and the staff could not do more covering every detail.

A luxury not everyone can afford. We have only experienced Burj Al Arab from outside.The place has a beach adjacent to it which is an awesome place to be in Dubai. Try to add this into the top 5 places you need to see in Dubai after all how often can u get a luxurious hotel behind you in your selfies.
Good. Nice. I vist in 2013. Burj al arab very nice. This burj near the wide wady. Wide wady is water park. Whether very hot
At a high price, one can.. One can enter this only with a valid booking. It is highly expensive, though one can take a chance to experience luxury.

Went to visit Burg al arab. We went up to Burg al Arab with the intention of visiting it inside but they woudnt let us in, they said you need a previous booking, but we saw it from the outside which was impressive.
Just before u arrive to the gate that leads into this tower there is some fountains and a children s park.

Beautiful Hotel..even if it was only to take photos of. My brother is an avid photographer and we spent time at the marina to take photos of the Burj Al Arab. One day when I make my millions I would love to have the privilege to stay at the hotel but at the moment all i can do is dream.
Afternoon Tea. Went for afternoon tea. What an experience absolutely fantastic. Would highly recommend this if visiting Dubai.

Lovely Afternoon Tea. We had booked a 4pm slot about a month earlier as it was our anniversary. We arrived about 3.30pm and checked in on the first floor. We were told to have a look around the building, take photos etc and be back at the desk just before 4pm as we had requested a window seat, and it's first come first served.We were the third couple called to take the lift up to the restaurant, and were shown to a table over looking the Jumierah Beach Hotel. It was a clear day so had a lovely view.We had a lovely waiter, I think called Zen, who talked us through the menu. We had a glass of champers to start with, with dates, and then worked our way through the 6 courses. We chose to have extra sarnies as they were so nice, but then struggled with the cakes and scones. At the end of the meal they gave us a small cake for our anniversary, which they boxed up, with other leftovers, to take with us. There was a good choice of teas and soft drinks also on offer.In all we were in the restaurant for about 2 1/2 hours and found all the staff extremely professional, friendly and helpful. Even though it is expensive at 620 AED each I think it was well worth it as a one off.

IT IS WHAT THE PICTURE SHOWS, NOTHING MORE. Like everything in Dubai! Only desserves a 5 minutes stop. Dubai is a city without past, without history, just buildings reflecting the money of the petroleum! I will never waste my time again togo there.
Must do thing while in Dubai. While the hotel is private for its guests, you can access and visit via a lunch or dinner reservations. Make it short, this hotel is deserved a 7 stars hotel in and out.
Amazing building. This is the only seven star hotel in the world, you are not allowed to go into the hotel unless you are staying there or have reservations for lunch or dinner

Fabulous food in amazing surroundings. We attended the 2016 Global Restaurants Awards dinner here on Wednesday evening and so the kitchens probably had a point to prove. The chefs did not let us down. The food and wines were fabulous and the kitchen staff thoroughly deserved their standing ovation. Well done! Just what you would expect from a class establishment.
Great hotel. Great hotel on the beach, Quite expensive for drinks though. Only had one drink and left as the selection wasn't the best.
Excellent site.. It is a must to visit this hotel. Looking at it from the beach is beyond words and having dinner there is raving.
Luxury off shore. Greatest hotel, build just off shore and visible from main road outside also and even from metro train.
An icon. This building has a unique shape and the design is impressing. It is the icon of Dubai. A very stunning beauty.

Wow!. Visited the 'Skyview Bar' for drinks. You must book ahead to visit and there is a minimum spend (350 Dirhams). This hotel is jaw-dropping in an ornate over-the-top way, gold leaf fittings, leather sofas, ankle deep carpets etc etc. Escorted to the lift by immaculate, efficient staff, met on arrival at the bar and addressed by name and taken to our table. There is a vast array of (expensive) drinks to choose from so it's easy to reach the minimum spend but on the upside the free olives, nuts and savouries just keep coming. The Burj Al Arab is very expensive to visit but is a Dubai icon, a must see in my book.

Skybar Visit. We booked in to the skybar for drinks - minimum spend of £70 each. We were seated very quickly and menus brought to our table very promptly. We chose our first drink - cocktails (I couldn't drink it far too strong for me) and a bottle of water. The waiter was over constantly to ask if we wanted another drink. I had mentioned on our booking it was our honeymoon and the waiter came over with a red rose which was a lovely gesture. Thank you. We felt as though there was no atmosphere in there - we were seated across from each other quite far apart we asked if we could move our seats together but were told no. It was really cold in there - I was chittering the whole time. After 1.5 hours we were told we could now move up to the top so we could have the views. When the bill came I questioned an item on it and I was told it was a glass of rose wine - we never ordered wine. The manager appeared and apologised profusely about the error and gave us 2 small boxes of chocolates and a pen as a token of apology. I would probably not go here again, don't think it was worth the money.

Afternoon delight..... We booked afternoon tea in the Sahn Addar at this iconic hotel and it was wonderful. Greeted by a glass of champagne then all sorts of delights including sandwiches, cakes, sorbet with a choice of numerous teas to wash then down with. We stuck to the champagne as this was a special treat. Not cheap but a great experience and you get inside this fantastic hotel

An iconic building. Looks great. Good go and see, but the food we were served was disappointing. Inside is mostly gold. You can only go inside if you have a reservation at one of the restaurants. As I said previously we were not impressed with tea at sky bar.

Once in a lifetime. This hotel is one of a kind and attention to detail can not be matched. Everything is catered for. The hotel itself is a holiday, however we found Dubai to be so exciting.Highlights : Swimming with Dolphins, water roller coaster, riding camels and of course the wonderful shopping centres. We went october 2014

Highlight of My Travel Life!. I made a reservation at Burj for breakfast solely to get on property. I've wanted to visit for about 15 years. It exceeded my expectations. I've never experienced service like this in my life. Beautiful!

Unforgettable experience. This was my second visit,so I was able to truly enjoy the experience as I was able to appreciate the service and the surroundings and the individual quirky fittings, the staff are just excellent they are there to assist appearing and disappearing as and when required, orchestrated my management that oversee and insure that each guest is looked after...
Brunch. The brunch on top level restaurant in Burj Al Arab with my 7years old son was one of the top experiences in Dubai... Brilliant!

Birthday Celebration . We went to Burj Al Arab for a birthday celebration and apart from being very expensive, there was nothing special of different from other hotels. Staff was "OK", not as friendly as you expect! Surely I won't be back!
An amazing man made building. Looks fantastic especially when lit up at night. It's a shame you can get to the grounds itself unless you have a booking but otherwise a great backdrop
Best Hotel. Best hotel in the world, slightly let down by crew but never the less TOP experience location food prices

Unique architecture, over-the-top decor (in a good way). Stunning building, fantastic service. Arrived early for dinner @ Bab Al Yam and had drinks in the lounge. The service was outstanding top-to-bottom, drinks were amazing and the food was very good. However, it really wasn't worth $430 for two people. If money isn't a concern, then do it.
Dubai's eye candy. This famous site can be viewed from almost everywhere. The best view of this Building would be via helicopter that would cost you around 800 Dirhams.
Great design but .... It is a beautiful building that I even prefer to Burj Khalifa, but it is not accessible and the hotel there is very expensive.

One time extravanzza. We traveled as a couple in January 2016. We have booked an afternoon tea in Skyview bar. It is not cheap but deserved every penny. You can also travel around the hotel, and take a glimpse of the opulence around. We definitely recomand the tea there if you can afford it. It is more like a dinner experience, and seeing the sunset going over Dubai from there is priceless.

I hoped for more. The Burj Al Arab is an architectural wonder and I was thrilled at the chance to visit and also to dine at the restaurant that is on its top floor. The big moment came and when we walked in it is quite impressive - the scale of it, but the decor and style was not what I expected. It felt more Las Vegas than luxury. There really isn't much to see inside and maybe that is the point, but it what was there lacked a sophistication and felt more cartoonish or Cirque du Soleil. Can I say it would be worth a special trip to see the inside? No. And if it weren't for our dining reservation I would have been very disappointed if I had come to see the interiors and left after the short time it would take to take it all in. [Note, I also reviewed the restaurant experience which was also a bit lacking.]

Girls Afternoon Tea. My friend and I booked afternoon tea-we arrived via private taxi and our names taken at the security booth.We were shown to our table and had very pleasant afternoon tea, selection sandwiches, cakes, petit four etc-wouldn't say it was out of this world-just very good-prefer tea at the Ritz.Nice experience to see the hotel but nothing to rave about.

Could not have asked for more !. I contacted the hotel before booking Afternoon Tea at the Burj for my Partners birthday, to help me set up the perfect proposal ! They did it perfectly and more. They had a perfect seat for us, took some pictures, provided the perfect atmosphere to propose and gave my new Fiancée a birthday cake. Wonderful occasion in a wonderful place ! Afternoon Tea was lovely and the whole occasion made perfect by the wonderful staff in a perfect setting. Thanks to everyone at the Burj Al Arab for making the day so special.
dubai in 1/2 day. It's a fine piece of architecture to look at. We didn't go in. Feeling it is beyond our league as regards prices of rooms, so we let it be.

Tea at Skyview Bar. The only way to get into the hotel is to be a guest or to book at one of the restaurants. My friends and I decided to do the tea at the Skyview Bar. The service was excellent. The price is a bit steep at 620 AED for some sandwiches and pastries but I guess when you're on vacation you do crazy things for the experience. The views from the bar were really nice. Note getting a regular taxi from the actual hotel is nearly impossible so you will have to walk back to the street or take one of their more expensive hotel taxis.
Spectacular view. The hotel has been around now for some time and still looks great.ICONIC is not overused. Trey the Friday brunch up on high.
Amaising place . Amazing place you can be relaxation and enjoy for it with good view and good hospitality it was perfect weekend there on UAE
Amazing. Wonderful dinner restaurants. We did all the restaurants, from the top to the bottom and finished in the piano bar for coffee and port

Culinary Flight Dinning. For the ideal way to visit the Burj Al Arab and experience the culinary delights of 5 restaurants all in one night book the Culinary Flight Dinning to taste all the different cuisine available at the Burj Al Arab !

You'll feel like a Fairy Tale Princess. I love this hotel! It is a bit old fashioned and quite decadent in design but the facilities and service will definitely make you feel Royal! I stayed here for my Birthday, the beach was amazing!

Must Place on your visit to dubai .... Hotel interiors is quite unique. A fish aquarium beside the escalator while going up to the main hotel floor which has restaurants and shops. You feel lush of golden color in it's interior Decoration.
The best hotel. I didn't stay there i went at the sky view bar. My friend had birthday and they bring to her sweet with candle and one rose the staff was so friendly.
What a design.. One of the most beautiful art it was. We want to spent some more time but heat was so bad. But Burj Al Arab great.
Best hotel. Best hotel in the world for the luxury and dinning, also provides best view from the Dubai beaches during the new year and other events.

Whatever it shines, it is really gold!. There are tours to the hotel but I knew somebody who let me in all around. It is extremely luxurious and it has a front desk in each floor. The pool view from atop is awesome. They are building a new pool around the hotel with an artificial island.

MSC Musica Arabian Gulf Cruise - Excursion to Burj Al Arab for High Tea. When we booked this cruise and found out it offered an excursion to the renowned Burj Al Arab for High Tea I knew I had to book it. It was expensive at £140 per head, but when I looked online the hotel offered afternoon tea with a glass of champagne for £129 so I assumed it was the same. The excursion was described as high tea at the Burj Al Arab and panoramic city tour, so I thought the extra cost was attributed for the hour and a half bus tour.We left at 2.30pm and had a tour of the marina where we had a 15 minute photo stop. We were then taken to a souk where we had 50 minutes free time. From there we drove on to the Jumeirah Palm and were dropped off and had to walk to the Atlantis Hotel for another photo stop and then it was onto the Burj Al Arab. These stops do not constitute a panoramic city tour, but I didn't mind too much as it was the high tea that I wanted to sample.I have had afternoon tea at The Ritz and Claridges in London and I expected the same excellent standard but was very disappointed.We were on the 27th floor in a private room. There were 3 tables of 10 of us. The food had already been laid out and was pretty average and had been covered with a damp paper serviette to stop them drying out. There was no choice of different teas. This too had been prepared in advance and was poured from silver plastic flasks.We were served the sandwiches and when the chicken ones ran out they said that was it! There was one round of sandwich each with a couple of small cakes. The scones were served warm and you could have 2, but once the small bowl of cream for the table had run out that was it. We were in and out in 90 minutes and it was a very disappointing afternoon after looking forward to it all week.I did complain to the waiting on staff, but it didn't really make a difference. When I got back to the ship I went to the Excursion Desk and made a formal complaint to say I feel their advertising of this excursion is misleading. I was also asked to fill in a questionnaire about the trip and wrote a full page of the issues.I wish I had booked it myself on line as that would have been the real deal and got a taxi there as I probably won't return to Dubai so won't be able to do this again.Readers beware of this excursion offered by this cruise as you will be as disappointed as we were!
Might as well. Make a reservation to have a drink. Expensive, but think of it as your admission ticket to see the hotel and that the drink is free.

Worthy of its 7 stars. Love love love this hotel. Can't find a single fault or anything to complain about but after staying in Jumeriah properties for many years I cannot find fault with any. Burj certainly offers the special treatment you would expect. Cannot wait to return
Must see places before you die. Must see places before you die. Luxury at its peak. Architectural marvel . Humans can do amazing things.

Mesmerizing Breakfast !!!! Worth every moment. A mouth watering breakfast at man-made wonderland. We booked for Indian vegetarian breakfast and loved each and every moment spent on this beautiful island hotel.

Not as big as it looks!. Burj al arab - a very photogenic building - is only 28 (28x2 inside) stories high and looks very small on the banks of the Arabian Sea.
