Take a city tour in any bus and it will take you to the public beach where it is placed.I think it is a place to stay rather than to be admired from outside. Amen!

Very pricey but once in a lifetime experience . It's a must see if your visiting dubai
The most expensive high tea experience with mini sandwiches and scones
They were scrumptious and house are even allowed seconds if ur still hungry!!
But keep for a special occasion when u don't mind spending that much!!!
THE BEST HOTEL IN THE WORLD!. The design, the room, the view, the prestige make this hotel one of the best in our planet! Restaurant is amazing! Price is amazing! Do it once in your life!

Sky tea. How I wished I was staying here. We were here for the afternoon tea and it was faultless. Jaw dropping bling everywhere. Pure luxury and what a beautiful hotel from the fountains in the foyer with the aquarium on both sides of the escalators.Fresh flowers and gold everywhere. Views amazing. Loved it.

a bit touristy. I have been there for an afternoon tee at skyview bar
as a diabetic guest I had requested low carbo offers and they did perfectly even deserts made with sweeteners
overall was ok just intense care of waiters was a bit overwhelming
Great visit. Beautiful place to visit. Had cocktails in Bar on 24th floor. Would recommend a visit here to top off your stay.

Afternoon tea - spectacular venue. Sinéad and I went for afternoon tea, as part of our honeymoon in Dubai. Being a special occasion, we decided that the Burj Al Arab was a good venue to try it - we weren't wrong!This hotel, and the building in general, is spectacular. It's extremely elaborate and ornate, it seems like every part of it has gold trim.The afternoon tea itself was expensive, but not obscenely so, it was also well worth it. The views from the hotel are spectacular, and the service was brilliantWe were really looking forward to visiting the Burj Al Arab, and we really enjoyed the experience.It is extremely opulent, but it is well worth a visitIn a bit!Stephen

Best restaurant and services. My friend and I went to the Junshi buffet of Burj Al Arab on March 3, when we went there so earlier so that we stayed outside to take some pictures for a while until the restaurant opens at 6:00 PM. During our dinner, the waiter Vikram served us nicely and politely so that we were joyful and cared. The price is reasonable not too expensive. So I recommend the restaurant if anyone wants to go to Burj AI Arab for a dinner.
a wonder to behold. i think you need to book to visit the place, they were not allowing visitors to enter by the gate unless you have a sort of pass.

Brunch & People Watch. Flew into Dubai at 8.00am (3 hours late), checked into hotel & dashed to the Berj for 10.00am Brunch. Friday no afternoon tea (holy day) so instead they do a brunch in the restaurant on 27th floor with the views & all. 10.00-4.30 (only day of the week they do it. NO alcohol!! and its £20.00 cheaper per person if you go 10.00-12.00 and £10.00 cheaper if you go 10.30-12.30. Two hours is a long time to stuff your face and although there is loads of food even I had to ay enough and come out in that 2 hours. The dishes are very wide & varied through the nationalities and taste buds with loads of hot & colds in starters & mains and live chefs cooking several dishes to order. sweets/chocolate/cheese & Tea & coffee & sort drinks a plenty; then down to the foyer for a couple of hours to people watch! what a place. I booked a week in advance to get a confirmed reservation.IF you are there on a Friday as no Afternoon Tea you can eat once for a few quid more and won't want to eat for a very long time!!Well worth that once in a lifetime extravagance!!
Architecture. It has a great interest for people that are interested for architecture and constructions!! Impressive building in the in the water of Dubai Golf.

A must when you are in Dubai. Before i left US for my vacation, I told my 3 bffs that we will be having afternoon tea at the Skyview Bar at the Burj Al Arab (since this is the best way to get inside the hotel.We were awed at the lobby and we were asked to proceed to the Atrium which was impressive. There we waited for the staff to bring us to the 27th floor. We used the glass elevator(which I didnt enjoy due to my fear of height)but which my friends did.We were seated with the best view overlooking the radiant blue sea and the Palm Islands at a distance. The sunset was exquisite as we devoured the sandwiches and sconces brought to us one after the other. Our waiter was so pleasant, explaining every item that was on the plate. The food was good, we enjoyed it. Im planning to go back again and bring more friends with me.

This is a must when in Dubai. This hotel is the ultimate in elegance and glitz. The one thing that is a must is to book for the bar at the top of the hotel. This place is expensive, but, a must to do. The hotel s currently extending out into the sea to include a man made sandy beach and swimming pool.

It is the Senate Chamber on Coruscant. Once you get over there are escalators covered in gold leaf, if you can get over that, there is something about the place which makes one even less comfortable. There is something quite memorable it it… it looks just like Senate Chamber on Coruscant. When that image is stuck in your head, it really is rather ridiculous.

Cocktails in skybar. We booked this as a treat and loved every second. We booked a package where we got 2 cocktails each for roughly £70 per person. Quite expensive cocktails at £35 each but worth it for the overall experience and the view. We were given canapés and nuts which kept getting topped up, we asked for a move to a window seat with a view and the staff couldn't do more for us. Drinks on this package were not just cocktails and included wine and beer. I ordered an additional beer which cost 70 aed
Visit not to be missed. We visited the Burj Al Arab when we had diner in the restaurant. The inside is as impressive as the outside and a visit is not to be missed when in Dubai.

Afternoon tea. Visited again and as always treated like royalty. However, did noticeiin the sky bar that someone had painted the ceiling and let paint drip down the green frontage overhanging the bar. slapped hands there for someone:)

A real treat. Booked the culinary flight dining experience as a birthday treat whilst in Dubai for my husband.From what I am told, there are limited ways to enter. We had to show our reservations to enter the grounds via Taxi. Again at the entrance where we shown where to go.The staff were very helpful when booking. The only problem was it was Ramadan, hence no alcohol until sunset. This was ok, as we adjusted our arrival time but it made dinner a much later experience. We started in the sky bar and experienced each course in a different restaurant.Upon entering the Hotel, the decor especially fish and water tanks and waterfalls was impressive. The staff were very helpful in explaining especially to my husband the programme for the evening. There are cheaper alternatives to experiencing Burj al Arab, from dining perspective afternoon tea if budget is a concern. I would recommend visiting and experiencing it from inside. It is spectacular. I would recommend the culinary flight, if it started earlier. It is easily 4 hours.

A Must see Iconic Hotel. we did not stay but went with a group to visit this iconic Hotel. From The Grand entrance one enters one of the tallest lobby spaces that confirms that you are in a special Hotel. From then on everything is glitzy and expensive. No doubt one may debate about the many colours used in the rooms and public areas. But that makes this hotel so different from any other. one whole wall of a restaurant is a lovely fish tank. The Bars Restaurants all have unique expensive décor.The staff are from many different nationalities and all share a great pride in working at the Burj, They are very helpful and courteous and seems to be very eager to make visitors happy. The best rooms/suites have toilet shower area walls tiled with Gold surfaced wall tiles, the faucets are also plated in gold. Its very different from any other luxury hotel many people would have seen. That itself makes it a special place to visit. Definitely a place to stay when one has to celebrate a landmark event in your life like a honeymoon or an anniversary. This is not anyone's regular weekend hotel. Go there to celebrate. Must visit at least once in your life
Great View. Every time i pass by, i am impressed by the architecture, I see it also from the metro, worth to see.

Dinner at Al Mahara. We did not stay in this 7 star beauty but had dinner in the seafood restaurant Al Mahara. We spent an amazing 4 hours here enjoying food prepared the perfection along with a bottle of 1989 Rothchilds wine. Our waiter, Gianluca made our evening very special. We thoroughly enjoyed his humor along with top drawer service.

Most expensive hotel on earth. Burj Al Arab. The most expensive hotel. Unfortunate without room reservation not possible to visit. Only by driving allong. but still worthfull to do. also very nice object to make photographs.

7 star. We booked at Junsui restaurant for lunch to see burj al Arab and it didn't disappoint! The place is magnificent from architecture to gold furnishings! They have aquarium on the side to enjoy your going up & down the escalator. They won't let you enter the hotel unless you have a reservations in one of their restaurants that's why we booked at Junsui! I posted a separate reviews on the foods and our experience . After eating lunch we just hang out in burj al Arab and took lots of pictures!

Beautiful but over priced . Went to the the Burg Skyview Bar but you have to spend a minimum of AED 350 ( £70 ) which is a total rip off. Staff & service is excellent but unless you have a window seat you do not get a view of the lights. Cocktails very expensive!!! £35 for a cocktail is not justified & especially as we had middle seats with no view.Singapore & Hong Kong have fantastic 360 degree roof top bars with fantastic views & no minimum spend so why is the Burg allowed to get away with a minimum spend of AED 350?Won't be returning any time soon.

Iconic site of Dubai . The Burj Al Arab must be one of the most iconic sites of Dubai. It is certainly very picturesque, by day & night. We had a photo stop on the public Jumeirah Beach, from where you can get an excellent view. We can also recommend visiting the Madinat Jumeirah, which includes a souk, restaurants & bars, and which provides some incredible views of the Burg Al Arab too.
Really nice view. We haven't got a chance to enter the hotel, but we've observed it from different angles (land, sea) and it's really nice
awsome view. we covered this as part of our city tour in Dubai.we did not stay here but outside the architecture looks so amazing
well worth the Price. We went for the brunch and had a great time. Food, service, location is truly exceptional. Need to reserve well in advance.

Looks great. Obviously not allowed into this beautiful hotel with no reservation, but lovely to look at and beautifully positioned on the coast by the Indian Ocean. Remarkable hear about tennis match and golf played on the helipad!

Nice dine and wine. Very nice ambience and truly world class architecture. Had dinner with few associates twice last year. Though a tad costly but that's what gives the place a privacy tag. Not your daily affair for food but can be looked at when you want to impress your clients
BURJ Al ARAB. Apparently seven star hotel. Built in the Arabian Sea. Access across a road bridge but no access to non residents unless you have booked to eat at one of the restaurants!

Still Dubai's icon nr 1!. Travelling to Dubai for eleven years now we stayed at the Burj a few times. Altough a lot of really luxerious hotels opened the Burj is still not replaced from its throne. Form the super delicious variety in restaurants below sea level up till the 200m above sea level restaurant with stunning views, maybe just the Emirates Palace in Abu Dhabi is in its league. Great staff, great chefs, superb rooms, nice shops, I can go on and on. Took a clients company, Johnson & Johnson ones here and a couple of times friends. Never dissapointing and always a big succes!! Keep up the number 1 position in Dubai!

A once in a lifetime experience!. High security, you must have a reservation to even get on the driveway, I suppose it's to keep the rif-raf out, but we still got in! ( We had a reservation ).Amazing decor, but a bit too "being" for my taste. The Sky View bar lives up to it's name and has great views over the city.The food and drinks are as you would expect an quite expensive by Nottingham standards, but maybe not so much compared to other restaurants in Dubai.When you order your drinks you also receive a mini Burj Al Arab tower with a selection of nibbles - nuts, olives etc.We chose to have the Mezze to eat and ordered two, but the waiter said one would probably be enough - he was right! The Mezze was very good, but not exceptional.We're not really cocktail people, but thought we should try some while we were there and they were very pleasant, but I'd rather have a pint of real ale, sorry!So, overall an excellent, once in a lifetime experience, as they say "You pay your money and you make your choice"!

A flight with a difference. We went there for my wife's birthday and pre ordered the Culinary flight, which has a course and matching wine in each restaurant in the hotel. The staff were great , we were not hurried and the food and wine were both excellent. Moving from restaurant to restaurant was a bit strange at first but we enjoyed the experience, loved the views and would do it again for a special occasion. It is not cheap so worth planning to be there for some special reason.

Afternoon Tea, mmmm..... We want and had an amazing afternoon tea here - the food was great and the bar was 00's retro. I really liked it. I can only imagine what rooms are like as the service was second to none!

Evening cocktails with fireworks!. Pre booked prior to leaving uk and would recommend this as was extremely busy even on a weds evening.Arrived a little early but staff were very courteous as you would expect and said look round take some photos then make your way up to the 23rd floor.We were shown to a bar table until our table was ready and given a drinks menu .... It was like war and peace never ending spoilt for choice but don't choose with your beer goggles on it could end up being very very expensive!!!!We didn't unfortunately get a window table but enjoyed our drinks and evening together we will remember it for a long time .... My husband says he will remember the prices till the day he dies!!!!!!
afternoon tea. Of course this attraction has got some costs but you will never forget this view from sky bar while attending to a five course tea time.
Splendid. Burj al Arab is just amazing. Only seven star hotel in the World. For Good snaps go to Jumeirah Public Beech. Enjoy the beech as well as the splendid architectural marvel.

Met all my expectations. Visiting Dubai has always been on my bucket list never have I thought that I would have gone in this lifetime. I have watched all the documentary of the Burj Al Arab and I was not disappointed when I had the opportunity to actually have high tea on the 6th of February above the Lobby. Photos can explain and show the beauty of the Hotel everyone should experience once in their lifetime. Our reservation was for 7.30 at the Sahn Eddar and we were not rushed and the sandwiches and pastries were delicious. Visiting in the night really gives you a sense of all the details that were but into this hotel.

Height of luxury and good service.. Celebrated birthdays here and it met our expectations fully. The view is superb, the food is excellent and the service is good but not intrusive. Initial cost may seem a lot but should be considered as an almost theatrical experience.
Luxury Defined. Must visit to experience luxury at its best. Slightly expensive for a meal. Limited choice for vegetarians.
A sight to see, day and night. We only saw it in passing, didnt have time to investigate further. A wonderful achitectual acheivement. Beautiful at night when its lit up.

Landmark. This is I believe the most famous landmark of Dubai. It takes reservation to visit this building. However, it can be seen on adjacent beaches at no cost. It is a magnificent looking building.

Amazing. Make sure you have plenty of memory in you camera you are going to need it Service was excellent staff efficient but make you feel very relaxin do and welcome It's expensive but an experience you will never forgetThe afternoon tea experience was most enjoyable And you left very full up It was our anniversary I was given a rose and a cake staff also took pictures for us The views are amazing I'd advise the 4pm as you see the sun set which is amazing
Something to see. Cool building... iconic not as many people late at night... it's an interesting culture that is for sure

Food and Service .....Top Notch !!!. We had an opportunity to dine at this beautiful location in Burj Al Arab. The view and ambiance was great and the quality of food to complement it.The food was very vibrant and loved the chefs as they were having so much fun while cooking for us. The flat breads were delicious and the Arancini was Super. To finish the meal, rustic desserts specially the carrot cake was to die for.Chefs and manager recommended to try the breakfast as well which we will try in our next visit.Great experience and memories !!!
One of a Kind.. What a place. Absolute gem. Go there for dinner, brunch, lunch, drinks, whatever. The service is perfect, the people are great, and the rooms are insane.

Best from jhumeirah beach. Dubai has maximum regard for this structure even more than Burj Khalifa or twisted building or any other structure. You see any promoting material or museum or books, you will find this structure depicted very prominently with regard.In fact this was the first internationally acclaimed architecture Gem in Sea at Dubai.
Expensive but a treat . Afternoon tea at the Burj is a real treat. Highly recommended but very expensive. The food and service are to a very high standard.

Iconic but felt like an outsider. We did afternoon tea at the Burj Al Arab as it was something on the tourist tick list. We were told to dress smartly and it was pretty evident who the non-resident guests were as they were the ones dressed smartly. The more casually dress people were residents. This amused me somewhat.The car-park sets the tone, all supercars and Rolls Royces. Something you don't see outside your normal Premier Inn.We were guided to the first floor where we sat (behind a purple rope) to enjoy our afternoon tea. It was first class, excellent food and drink and plentiful.The architecture is wonderful and the fountains etc are something special. BUT I can't pretend I felt welcome. Everyone we met was welcoming but I felt a stranger in a strange land. I thought it was me but everyone else I spoke to felt the same. Maybe I wasn't a resident but I had still paid my fair money to go there. I did feel were shepherded into our area, then shepherded out again. If I was told not to make eye contact with the elite I would not have been surprised.I think you should go, just follow the paths.

Out of this world. We had dinner in the restaurant and enjoyed a pre dinner drink in the lounge area. The design of the building as you arrive is simply stunning. The service, food and decor is exceptional in every way from the moment we arrived. Rather expensive but worth every penny for the experience.

Breathtaking. The nicest building i have ever seen. The burj al araba is inside the sea linked with a short bridge to the ground. It is a must see in Duba even if you can't slip there because it's quite expensive...and you can not enter until you have a reservation to one of the restuarants available... it deserves a visit from the beach.

picture perfect. It just looks amazing. so beautiful, but we couldn't go in as you have to book well in advance for even breakfast. you can only walk up to the path and take your pictures, Not been able to go in but still found it exciting to be somewhere that looks so amazing. You have to take a taxi there as there are no metro stations close by.

Beautiful but Over-Rated. Don't get me wrong, this building is a site to see while on your trip in Dubai, but I don't understand why people feel the need to go to the beach here? There are so many pools, and other things to see then to waste too much time here. Go snap your picture, check it out for 30 minutes, and continue. Unless your staying INSIDE, then there's not much to look at on the OUTSIDE.
Didn;t go in mearly observed from beach. Went to JBR beach and walked very near this masterpiece. A beautiful sight. Peaceful serene area. The beauty of Dubai displayed in it's elegance
Totally amazing!. We were able to lunch at Burj Al Arab while visiting UAE. Stunning architecture, delectable dining, an unimaginable experience. Just beautiful!

Perfect for a celebration. Went to the Friday Buffett to celebrate our 45 wedding anniversary. Everyone there went out of their way to make it a very special experience. They gave us a table at the window and presented us with a anniversary cake and a red rose. Spectacular views. The hotel itself is very beautiful but is extremely busy.

Breakfast at Shan Ed dar. The cheapest way to enter the hotel is reserve a table for breakfast which comes at 295 AED per person. The breakfast was about Ok, nothing great. It was a set menu served at the table. The overall experience was lovely. The hotel is impressive. Don't miss to see the big aquariums on both sides adjacent to the escalators. It has some beautiful fishes.

Apparently you can't go inside if you don't have a hotel reservation. But I love the design of it and it is next to a lovely beach that has waters as clear and beautiful as the Caribbean. Apparently the elevator is so fast that you can watch the sunset on the ground and take the elevator to the top and watch it again!
Hotel & Beach are well worth a visit. It is worth your while to spend at least a half day here viewing the hotel and taking a relaxing break on a beautiful beach

Afternoon Tea at the Sky View Bar. The Burj Al Arab is one of the places that you must visit once in your life. We have been fortunate to visit on several occasions, and have never been disappointed. One of the easiest ways to visit is by dining in one of its restaurants, with Afternoon Tea in the Sky View Bar on of the least expensive at around 620AED.Ensure you make a reservation, and note the reservation number, as you will need it to get through the very tight security at the main gate or “Welcome Centre” as they call it. Bookings can be made only via the internet. Although you give credit card details, you don’t pay until the actual visit. We did see one couple who came and stated that they had already paid on-line, so just check at time of booking so as not to embarrass yourself on the actual day (friendly warning). Booking times are from 1:00-1:30pm and 4:00-4:30pm, and if you are a little early, you can sit in the small waiting area and take photos. We always book well in advance, and arrive 5 minutes early, requesting a side window view, as this is much better than a front view, see photos. Dress code is smart casual to fine dining the choice is yours, but certainly no T-Shirt, shorts and flip-flops.When you arrive, take your time. You can arrive well in advance of your booking time, and take the chance to look around the hotel lobby. There are several shops to browse through, and many great photo opportunities within the hotel.The Sky View Bar reception is on the 1st floor (not ground floor) up the escalators, so just before your reservation time, go to the booking desk, and let the receptionist know you have arrived. The Sky View Bar is located on the 27th floor, 200m high, so if you don’t like heights – be prepared. Access from ground level can be via the rear glass elevator, which gives unrestricted views of the ocean as you ascend, or if you prefer, travel in the closed elevators – just ask the receptionist at check-in.After you are escorted to your table, your server introduces him/herself and presents you with the menu, after which you are offered a glass of fine champagne, very nice. Our server was Tejas, who seemed genuinely happy to be with us, and looked after our every need – thank you Tejas. If you have any allergies etc., let your server know, he/she will be happy to modify the menu to accommodate.The menu not only details the courses to come, but also a beverage listing. All non-alcoholic beverages are included within the price, and you can have as much as you like, and as many different beverages as you would like to try. Just order when the mood takes you. Alcoholic drinks are also listed, and are an additional cost, which of course includes further glasses of champagne. Try the “Tale Of Two Hearts” cocktail, very fruity and delicious.A small selection of fresh date’s are already on the table as a taster. After the champagne, a white chocolate and apple pot was served. This was more like a dessert, but still very good. Afterwards, a warm ratatouille tart was brought. Although the courses are small single portions, they can be very filling. We are then served with a selection of sandwiches, crusts removed and very fresh. If you are still feeling hungry, you can request more, though your server will ask you in any case.To cleanse your pallet, lychee & rose sorbet is served. Then came our favorite, homemade scones & clotted cream and a selection of mini patisseries. Again, your server will ask if you would like any more, and will happily serve additional items of your choice.You can then complete you afternoon tea with a hot beverage, I would recommend any of the coffee’s, they smell divine, and taste just as good. The final part of the experience, the ladies are presented with a single red rose, though this could have been due to the date we visited (Valentines Day).My wife and I thoroughly enjoy our time here, having done it twice already, and pre-booked again for August this year, it’s a truly magical experience. Our total price (for February 2016) was 1695AED, though we did have additional champagne and two amazing cocktails. It sounds expensive, but for 2 hours of pure luxury and indulgence, it’s well worth the price. Remember, its Dubai, it’s the Burj-Al-Arab.Tipping is of course up to you, so depends entirely on your personal experience.Points to note: you will find that if you have a window table offering an amazing view, other people will want to experience the same, and will not hesitate asking you to move while they take pictures, it can be a bit frustrating.One Final Point, as you are already within the hotel, you can walk around the grounds, take your time and explore. I suggest you do this AFTER your tea, since it will be very warm and humid. Taxis will be available as you exit the hotel entrance, with the porters very happy to assist you.

Must See When in Dubai. It is one of the main landmarks in Dubai and I would recommend you visit it. If you want, you can even relax on the beach and have a view of this building. If you do this, be careful because the sand is very hot.

Afternoon tea, 25/02/16. As part of our trip we'd booked afternoon tea at the Burj al Arab . We were treated like royalty, food was excellent, views absolutely stunning especially as the sun went down! The staff were excellent. Really can't fault it !

Royal Experience that was well worth it. I was just visiting and passing through and decided to go the Burj Al Arab for a look and boy was that a total sensory experience that I will never forget. From entering the doors you can't help but feel like a celebrity or Royalty. It was opulence at every turn with rich colours and great attention to detail in all fixtures and architecture. Something different and unique to visit. Has a great vibe and feeling. Recommended for special occasions or must visit if in Dubai. Will go back one day.

A dream come true.. The High Afternoon Tea at the Skyview Bar on the 27th floor of Burj Al Arab was excellent. The 7-course afternoon tea was wonderful. What was great was we had an awesome view of the Arabian Gulf and Dubai Skyline. Not to be missed experience. Expensive,but well worth the $$$ spent.

beautiful. Set on an island in a striking sail-shaped building, this luxury hotel is a 5-minute walk from Wild Wadi Water Park and 4 km from Mall of the Emirates. Opulent suites feature floor-to-ceiling windows with gulf or city views. All have 24-carat gold iPads, free Wi-Fi, flat-screen TVs and iPod doc. They offer Egyptian linens, designer toiletries, whirlpool baths and butler service. Upgraded suites include snooker tables, libraries, cinemas and private elevators.A breakfast buffet, parking, and water park passes are free. Amenities also include 9 restaurants and bars, 4 pools and a private beach. There's a spa, a fitness center and a kids' club.

Seven star. This is also a kinda must to do while in Dubai. But it's expensive but it's a once in a lifetime experience. We went there to have an afternoon tea since the only way to see the inside is to either book a room or make a reservation in the restaurant. The interior is different from anything I've ever seen before and the service from the staff is excellent. When you enter the hotel you're greeted by staff who're there to assist you from your very first footstep inside the hotel. For the afternoon tea it was a nice experience but I've expected more extravaganza. But the service was impeccable.

What a view. My partner and joined some friends and lashed out on the high tea on the 24th floor of the Burj Al Arab. Now the view up there was second to none, we had a beautiful clear day so we were very lucky, I do believe it is not always like this. Our high tea was very satisfying 5 courses and they thankfully allowed us to have as many sandwiches as we could eat. The price was extravagant though at $250 a head and that only included 1 champagne, if you wanted a second it was a cool extra $80 per glass. It was a once in a lifetime experience.

Wow what more can I say............. We spent 5 nights here - we are a family of 4. We had a corner room and it was magnificent. There is a reason this place is the only 7 star hotel in the world. It is worth every cent or should I say dollar!

Tea at the Skyview bar. Expensive but well worth doing for a special event or just the experience. Arrive early so you can take in the sheer opulence of the lobby and book in on time.I had requested a window table which they wouldn't guarantee but seemed that if you arrived early you were seated in order of arrival. Waiter was fantastic nothing too much trouble. Took a friend who was vegetarian and gluten free and they created a whole special menu for her. View spectacular over the city and we spent 3 lovely hours just enjoying the lovely champagne, food , tea's of every type, harpist playing and just being waited on. Even gave us a doggy bag to take home. Don't think I'll ever get to stay there but this was the next best thing.

Lovely afternoon tea. We decided to treat ourselves to an afternoon tea at the Burj and thoroughly enjoyed the experience. The inside of the Burj has to be seen to be appreciated; fountains, swags. and glitz wherever you look! Our afternoon tea was held in the sky view restaurant on the 27th floor, affording a wonderful view of the sea beyond. The tea itself consisted of champagne and local dates, then a small veg tart, a selection of sandwiches then a palate cleanser of a sorbet. For sweets we were served a selection of scones with jams, mini cakes and patisserie items. Unlimited teas, coffees and cold drinks were also offered throughout. A lovely experience even if indulgent, I would recommend this to others if looking for a treat whilst in Dubai.

Out of this world . We dined here one evening oh wow what a fantastic evening the the food is the best we have ever had, we must have had eight courses, we ate in the Junsui Restaurant the service was fantastic from the receptionist who explained every dish, the waiters and the Chef's who came over to us with different dishes for us to taste, and all had a smile and extremely pleasant.Don't miss a treat the hotel is fabulous as well as the food.WE WILL BE BACK

Top Notch. Outstanding hotel. Fantastic attention to detail. Name me a girl who doesn't like to have a butler and I tell you she's a liar! Great place as a really special treat. Haven't managed to make it to afternoon high tea yet, but if anyone wants to invite me....I won't say no!

what an imposing building. Well. Many years ago, was the old brown, Chicago Beach Hotel. This has taken its place. So incredible. Have been there for lunch so will write separately. Hear there is going to be a swimming pool on the ground floor soon.

Sunset hard to explain. We visit the area nearby the Hotel, we access there planning on going to the 360° restaurant, which is at the end of the harbor, but we started taking so many pictures as walking around the area that we decided to stay and wait for the sunset. We love it, it was such a wonderful feeling. We didn't pay at all, at the entrance we just said that we wanted to go to the 360° and the let us in.

One of my favourite buildings in the world. From the time I had seen Nadal and Roger playing tennis on the helipad of this building, I wanted to see Al Arab. This January my dream has come true. Though I could not afford to go inside(some day, hopefully), it just looks amazing from outside - both at day and night. you get beautiful photos from the Umm Suqeim beach.

Great place to book overnight but pricy. . Great Hotel and Unique in its Concept. Great restaurants to be explored. A nice cafe to chill and relax in the afternoon with stunning views through its wide window and music to bring your mind to absolute rest with its live harp music. A must.
From the outside. This hotel is totally worth the detour. After all it is the only 6/7 star hotel in the world if not the highest.

Amazing experience. We visited the Burj Al Arab for dinner on Valentines evening for dinner at the Bab Al Yam. We had a wonderful meal and our waiter was fantastic, at the end of the meal he brought over a single red rose and Burj Al Arab box of chocolates which was an excellent touch.After our meal we had time to wander through the hotel which had been decorated specifically for valentines and looked very romantic. We took some pictures and then exited and got a taxi back to our hotel.

Amazing, though too much gold. What can I say, this is one of the finest hotels in the world. Perfect service, well secured, a nice private beach and great food. Though I must admit the gold interior isn't really my taste. You will find it sprinkled on the steaks or gold leafs in the champagne, but that's Dubai and they love that stuff. If you want to spend a lot of money, this is the place to go.
icon of Dubai. Its Iconic Tower Of Dubai It Is A Seven Star Hotel Build Like A Design Of Ship It Is A Great Hotel Excellent Place To Visit

Luxury and beauty at its heights !. It was the tallest hotel in the world until a few years ago and also the icon of Dubai. People recognized Dubai by this hotel and it does justice to its name. Even thou it is not the tallest but surely one of the most luxurious and the most beautiful hotels there is !

Summer Holiday. We spent five days in the Burj - I would recommend this to everyone - just for the experience. We spent Nine days in the Al Qsar Hotel - still part of the Jumeirah chain. We preferred the Al Qsar - just because of the freedom to do the basic of things - In the Burj you get a personal butler - so if you want some Tea - he will get it for you.The décor is second to none with vivid carpet colours lending itself to the Opulence.Every room has a Sea View - which is spectacular the higher you go. The upper restaurant is not as good as the Lower one - however the beautiful water feature fountains in the atrium are not to be missed - watched them for hours. BRILL.

A Special Feeling. It's Really made of Gold...the Parts of the Rooms..Taps and Toilet Handles...with a good Jacuzzi Available at the first floor of the Room...one of the Best hotels in Dubai with a Amazing View of the Arabian Sea and and 5 Star Luxury Service..Duplex Rooms Availble with Top Class Dinning Facilities and Meals Availble in 7 Courses...A Private Beach with A Club Availble for the Guests Staying at the Hotel...Will be Able to view all the Biggest and expensive st Sports cars available from all around the world with diplomats and VVIP's Available Here...

Memorable Breakfast. Reached Burj Al Arab in 33feet long Limo had our good south Indian breakfast in the lounge of the hotel with beautiful view of the Arabian Sea in the background of majestic and royal interiors of the hotel.

Had expensive lunch!. Please be aware that unless on a specific bus tour you have to book in advance to get to the hotel. When we went to do so we were advised that there was a minimum spend of Dirham 500 per person which is pretty excessive to walk around a lobby. we managed to agree to lunch at the pool which was a minimum spend of Dirham 290 each. It has been on my list to visit this hotel since it opened. I was slightly let down. While an impressive lobby area there really was not a lot that would jump out to say that this was 7 star hotel - really came across as a five star. In places some touch ups are required.The lunch by the pool was excellent and enjoyable. Do be aware that currently there is some work underway on a building beside the pool (part of the hotel) which was noisy.It was part of the bucket list to stay here, however unfortunately I am not sure if it still is.
Afternoon tea at the burj. I went for the afternoon tea. It was nice to show my visitor the hotel The amazing design colors & water fountains were really cool the afternoon tea pricy but it was nice.

Hi-Tea. Most memorable moments to be in worlds 7 star hotel.Hotel is in sail shape. About the hotel, no words.Main entrance, lobby and rooms made of gold.Mostly visited by rich people.Very well design and best service provide. Only those who booked room or restaurant allowed to enter. Hi tea took about an hour. Quantity look small but it's delicious and heavy. We unable to to complete our last course with varieties of cake and pastry. All served items are free and can request for additional except alcohol.Staff are friendly and explain well on every course given. Able to get vege foods too.Since it was my honeymoon, they gave me a rose and so touching.Expensive but should go once if gifted.

Seven Stars Seventh Heaven. From the moment you enter the magnificent foyer with its ornate art deco come arabic design, you know you are in a completely different hotel. More of a day trip museum piece. Great for the family to see and the escalator is an experience in itself

One and only. This is the ultimate Hotel. It have it all, fantastic superb exelent rom with high luxus. A spa and sport senter with all eqipment you wanted. A lot of restaurant with first class food and a service you never before have had. Memory for the life.

Pricey but worth a visit just once. 8 waiters per table. That must be why the £34 bottle or red cost £350! Food was excellent. I don't think the room price would temp me. I'd rather stay somewhere just as good (almost) and give the balance to a good cause.

Visit to Burj al Arab. Afternoon tea at the Burj is a must for first time travellers to Dubai , costs AED 560 for a Louis Roederer Champoo tea with unlimited teas/coffees - have had better for less but not in this setting !!
Iconic. I only saw this as part of the bus trip but it's a must see as it's so well known around the world. There looks to be a nice beach area not far from the hotel.

Visit to an Icon. A friend arranged a drink night at the Skyview Bar in the Burj-Al-Arab, at my request. Entering the hotel, one can feel the glamour of the place from the waterfall and aquariums. A quick look up of the ceiling also reveals interesting architectural pattern. On the way to the elevator to go up to the bar, one can enjoy the mosaic design on the floor. For my taste, I feel the decor is a bit mismatched overall. The outside is grand of course and the hotel is one of Dubai's icon. The bar itself is not cosy. The blue and green light really bothered me. And given the minimum spend per person, I ended up "forced" to order a glass of 2005 Dom Perignon. Something that I would not usually do. I am not complaining though...I enjoyed every drop. This is not something I would repeat on every Dubai trip, but it is interesting to experience once.

Worth the price. Booked the Skyview bar for drinks and appetizers for my daughter's birthday. The attention to detail on the drinks and the presentation and combinations were excellent. The only way to get in this place is with some kind of reservation. We went early to look around and take pictures. The shops were really fun to look in.
Great afternoon tea . The sky view restaurant for afternoon tea is wonderfull and a must to do when in dubaiWould recommend to all

Very, very expensive. Dress code not adhered to, brunch very expensive (only one small glass of bubbly included for £120), more of a tourist attraction than a fine-dining experience but you have got to do it to see what the fuss is about. Glad we went and experienced Burj Al Arab but we won't be back.
The Beach Bug. This was a place I found very disappointing as a tourist. The access is restricted. The beach is blocked by this structure for miles.

A wonderful experience.. My wife and I pre-booked our lunch here and it was well worth this wonderful experience. We had been allowed in a little early and were given permission to take photos from the restaurant. An excellent view over Jumeirah Beach and a tour of the opulent hotel itself.Not cheap but for us, a thrill and a once in a lifetime experience.

Another Beautiful Building. Although we did not get into this wonder of architecture because of time and money, we appreciated the building's architecture as we drove by it a number of times. The shape like a sail is really unique. Dubai has so many gorgeous buildings!

OVER RATED PRETENIOUS AND RIDICULOUSLY EXPENSIVE. If you have money and no sense this is the place to visit to throw your money away what a waste. Entrance to hotel is amazing one of the best reception halls of a hotel in the world and the Aquarium along side the esclators was mesmerising.

So hard to go inside. Ok it's the only 7 stars hotelIn the worldIt s what the hotel website sayWe went to for have a drinkFirst there is a check point before the hotel bridge accessIf you have no booking no enter!Second one at the lift deskAnd third on the rooftop restaurantWe went to it for enjoying the tea timeIt was so good and so pleasantDon't forget to bookAnd enjoy

Very nice but...too gaudy. I had the experience of having breakfast and tour of the suites through my niece. The price you have to pay for such luxurious maybe not worth it considering that its not as Zen as I expect it to be but more of a very gaudy or too much of everything. I like to see it but to stay there, no.

Not so impressed .. but still a great place. We went for the tea time, the service is great, as can you expect for 550 dirhams per person... gut still a tea time you can get for a fraction of this price in any other hotel as St Regis or four Seasons..

Checked this one off my bucket list with Easter brunch. Expensive, but a lovely afternoon.. For years, during stopovers in Dubai with Emirates airlines, I admired the architecture of the the Burj Al-Arab.and dreamed of going inside - placing it firmly on my bucket list of things to do in my lifetime. For varying reasons, it took its time in working out...for either I thought I was dressed too casually when I was in the neighborhood or I hadn't made reservations enough in advance, etc. etc. In retrospect, I should have done it 13 years ago when it was much easier and less expensive to go in for a simple afternoon tea or a drink. As years went by, entrance for those who were not hotel guests became more difficult and considerably more expensive. That said, I finally made it in 2013 for a birthday with a big round number. I decided to make Easter particularly special and dine in there for Easter brunch. This time, I wrote and reserved at the Al Muntaha restaurant on the 27th floor of the Burj well in advance of my trip, so I could arrive in Dubai assured of a spot for my special occasion.The buffet was large and spread around various stations of the room, giving people plenty of room to circulate without causing too much congestion. There was a nice array of salads, light dishes, fruits and desserts. Alcohol was ordered and paid for separately. It was a beautiful day, and while our table was not by the window, we still enjoyed a lovely view out over the water and part of the coastline.My final evaluation and observations? I had wanted to mark my trip and this landmark year in my life with a visit inside this iconic monument, and I thought that the day and the brunch turned out very well. I am very glad that I did it and considered the price worth it - for me and my "needs" at that time (note: to date, it is the most that I have ever paid for a meal). However, it is nevertheless good to keep one's expectations in check.I strongly advise visitors on a tighter budget to read the comments of various travelers to understand clearly what to expect and to determine if this visit will meet their expectations.Stated truthfully, I am not as big a fan of the interior design or lobby (which is not at all reflective of the exterior), but I am nevertheless very glad to have seen it. With all of the windows, the restaurant on the 27th floor was nice, spacious, filled with light and airy...and who among us doesn't enjoy a view of the sea?As for the food, there were some solidly good options, but overall, it was not extraordinary, nor among the best meals I have ever had. Yet this evaluation will always depend upon the visitor's point of reference. For those who live in a major European capital and enjoy some of their city's best restaurants, their criteria may differ slightly or greatly from those who live elsewhere. That said, I truly enjoyed the day, my meal and the time there...and I do not regret having made that decision.Note: it is my understanding that the Burj offers the choice of several restaurants and lounges in different locations throughout the building, but I can only comment on the buffet of the restaurant on the 27th floor.Would I go again? If someone invited me or if I was with someone who had a special occasion that they wanted to celebrate there, then of course. I would also return if they would make it easier to go up for a simple drink, such as a glass of wine. In the absence of those things, I will probably use my money to try out other restaurants and experiences on the city's ever expanding list of things to do. Dubai is pretty incredible in that respect, and my short visits always seem jam-packed.***Visitors should always check the latest updates for information on eating establishments and options for entrance if you are not a guest, in addition to the latest pricing. Do not rely on what is stated in a travel guide from previous years.

A wonderful experience. To see Burj Al Arab is a wonderful experience, also Tea Time in the Skybar at 27th floor with excellent food. But for all this you need a reservation, otherwise you cannot see anything of the hotel.

Opulent beauty. When I was told that the Statue of Liberty would rattle in the foyer of this fabulous building I couldn't work it out at all. The wow factor was unbelievable. Every single tile on the floor would make the most amazing pendant. The views, the restaurants, the staff are incredible. It's a little expensive but it's easy to see why. The staff are wearing things that royalty would be proud of. The atmosphere is very calm and the food is second to none. Iconic for good reason. Oozes class and quality

Delicious way to visit the iconic "sail hotel". If you can't stay at the Burj Al Arab, a bisit is the next best thing. Unfortunately, you must have business there to gain admission. This is easily accomplished by booking a reservation at one of the restaurants. I recommend Friday brunch at Al Muntaha, the cantilevered restaurant high atop the hotel. The buffet is superb, if pricey, and you can spend all the time you want exploring the hotel itself...well worth the price of the buffet. We've been back every time we visit dubai.
Once in a lifetime opportunity!. Absolutely stunning place to go into. The architecture is beautiful, and is one of the most iconic images of Dubai.

Burj Al a Perfect. I see this view from my balcony every morning, but nothing comes to being up close and personal with this landmark. The high-tea and amazing views are a must for any travelers to Dubai.
Nice and expensive. What a feat of architectural mastery. This place changes colour during the night. Went for a meal, a bit expensive but very nice.

Celebrating my marriage anniversary. I think everyone should visit this exceptional hotel. I was fortunate to be in this hotel for two times. I have booked in two restaurants; AL-Mahara and AL-Muntaha. Each restaurant has its unique futuristic view and atmosphere. You can't go to the hotel without pre-booking. You need to call one of the restaurants and reserve a table, they will ask you to provide your credit card number. Your name will be at the main gate of the hotel. You don't have to go for a meal, you can go to drink a cup of coffee or tea. I wish that everyone can visit this wonderful hotel. I'm don't miss the fountain at the reception area and your camera.

Spud night . Me and Hubbard tore it up one night they never had any dry ice so we couldn't have the full experience of the drink we wanted but that was the fault of the supplier not the bar Kenneth was our host and he was a hero if your reading this promote him and the female manager was good aswell can't remember her name she was Italian though ,very pricey establishment but it's worth doing just to say you done it great view aswell
best place to visit. We book hight tea here through our hotel we were treated like queens nothing was to much for them a must place to visit
Spectacular view on Beach. Enjoy the evening during sun set while swimming, playing on beach with spectacular views on Burj al Arab hotel.
Amazing architecture Marvel. Was at this location, though could not go in. This is certaining an amzing architecture nad wouldove to either stay or Dine there

Amazing!. From the minute you pull up the Burj Al Arab, you know you're getting first class service. The service was amazing and the food was spectacular. I was full by the time the entrée came and still finished it with little room for dessert and coffee. My boyfriend and I relaxed after in their cigar lounge. I couldn't have asked for a better night in Dubai.

Expensive Afternoon tea. We booked the afternoon tea with champagne and on our arrival realised that it was being served on the first floor atrium. It was very noisy and not relaxing at all. Whilst we were eating ,a couple and their children came and sat down in their swim wear with no shoes to have lunch.( they were hotel guests) . We decided to leave after the sandwich without waiting for the cakes as we just wanted to leave. Nearly £100 per person !

Overpriced Afternoon Tea . There's no denying that the Burj Al Arab is a spectacular building and well worth visiting. The entrance and the interior is everything you can imagine from a 7 star luxury hotel. I visited with 5 friends for Afternoon tea and was surprised at how disappointing it was. The location for the Afternoon Tea is upstairs in the foyer of the hotel and the atmosphere really isn't great. For the extremely expensive amount we each paid I expected a lot better quality and more than the few measly, tasteless sandwhiches and few cakes we were served. I would recommended the Atlantis Afternoon Tea experience over the Burj Al Arab any day. It's still worth visiting just not for the tea.
Striking building. We only saw this building from the outside.This building is as lovely as we saw it on some movies and we had a good view from a speedboat tour that we took.

Add the World's Most Luxurious Hotel to your Bucket List!. During my family's final visit to the UAE, I treated them to a once in a lifetime treat--a stay at the iconic Burj Al Arab. Of course, my wife, daughter and my daughter's best friend were immediately blown away when I surprised them and pulled up to the hotel. Upon arrival, we were royally received, and, after the requisite photos, immediately taken to our butler station to check-in on the 2nd floor where our two bedroom suite was located. When we were shown our suite, we felt like we had just stepped into the residence of a tycoon-millionaire. Everything was simply perfect down to the last detail--the plush carpet, the brilliant and rich fabric on the furniture, the tile and exquisite murals in both bathrooms, the gold and marble bar, and the tremendous size of the two level suite was simply spectacular. And, the restaurant choices, spa and fitness center, and the pool area adjacent to delightful cafe with both inside and outside dining all added to aura of our briefly indulging in the life-styles of the rich and famous. The surreal dream may have ended at checkout, but those 24 hour memories will last a lifetime.

Still the Best. Birthday trip and i had forgot juust how good the Burj is after having afew years at other places. Cannot wait to get back especially with North Dock project comng soon. The service in the hotel is second to none. The restaurants are fantastic. Glad they are upgrading pool, needed a bit of tlc after fifteen years. The kids loved the sweety train coming to the suite every night and it is simply my favourite hotel bar none. Anyone who says its over the top etc just has not experienced staying here where it is so relaxed. The pool guys are fantastic and had two areas set up for us, one for when the sun went into shade on the corner of the hotel, now where would you get that? The popcorn treats etc poolside are the top! Back this summer and thanks. Did the helicopter from the top of the burj and back, what a trip, nothing beats it!
Sail on the sand!. Did not go inside but found it beautifully standing on the beach like a sail boat ready to sail away!

Honeymoon afternoon tea. Stunning what a setting at the burj al Arab can't believe how stunning and classy this place is! We had afternoon tea on the first floor which was amazing. Little snacks that are classy and very filling along with champagne, as it was our honeymoon there were extra little gifts and treats staff are Amazing! Sky view bar next time I think

007 Meal. This hotel is designed in the most amazing way. Our meal was straight out of a 007 adventure and not as expensive as some meals in this price zone.We were sectioned off from the other hotel guests which was a little disappointing, but the staff were excellent and the meal was fabulous.An great hotel and again one to be experienced.We visited in 2012.

Birthday Suprise!. This is one of the most luxurious hotels that I have been too and stayed in! They treat you like royalty, and whatever you want they will get you. My family and I stayed here for 3 nights, was welcomed with a bunch of flowers and had a chauffeur. Such an amazing hotel and amazing staff all with a big smile on their face and are always ready to help. The room we had was fantastic also had our own butler. If you are looking to go for a luxury break or just a relaxing holiday then this hotel is a must!! Would deffo be staying here again :)
Great High Tea. Went to the Burj as a treat for my wife's 50th, well looked after and given a celebratory cake by the hotel staff, exceptional views from the Sky View floor

Gorgeous!. The building is stunning inside and out!! You must have a reservation in order to get across the bridge to enter. We had afternoon tea in the lobby. The food was delicious! It is very expensive but I highly recommend if you can afford it. You can walk around inside and take in the decor.

Glitz and Glamour. I sat on the beach and watched this being built out of the water and then it opened to mixed reviews as it is so over the top inside. We were lucky as they did an offer for residents all those years ago and we got to stay in one of the suites for a mere 350 pounds. It was worth every penny. The decor, the mirrored ceilings in the bedroom, arriving to a high chair, baby food, a full cot and bottle warmer just because I had said I had a baby was sheer luxury. Yes you do get your own 24 hour butler and we had the swimming pool upstairs all to ourselves which the children found such good fun as they are not used to swimming in an inside pool.We got ourselves out of the pool and got dressed but couldnt find our swimwear. A lovely lady had it washed and dried and in a bag for us as we left the changing room.. we felt like celebrities. We didnt leave the room apart from going to the pool and Wild Wadi and had all our meals sent to the room of course.Everything is very garish and gaudy but very tasteful. It smells of money and it feels so rich. Yes felt like a princess staying here and then when we moved across for a night at Jumeirah Beach Hotel it felt such a let down. It is definitely 7* and if you can do it once then stay the night if not go for afternoon tea or see if you can get yourself a tour of the rooms and facilities - we did but that was many moons ago and when Dubai was far more laid back..

High tea. The people who own and run this hotel know how to run a hotel. The people who own and run this hotel do not know how to serve afternoon tea. We were served coffee and milk in matching teapots. No napkins. One teaspoon between two people. How common. Perhaps the owners should go to Claridges or the Ritz to see how it is done properly to improve the lacklustre service and teach their staff to smile at the paying guests.

Wow! ❤️. Myself and my wife visted this spectacle hotel on our honeymoon in July 2015 , we only stayed for afternoon tea with was out of this world , didn't want to look at the cost for staying :-( defiantly a tick on my bucket list visiting the burj amazing !!!!

Stunning.. especially at night!. I love to view Burj Al Arab at night time especially when it has colorful light display… it gives great photographic opportunities. This place is lovely for hi tea as well.
I must see when you in Dubai.
Best viewed from a boat on the water. Stunning but limited views from land. Best viewed by taking a boat ride. A 'not to be missed' sight which is iconic. Worth the effort.

Great for a visit - impressive aquariums and architecture.. If possible go to visit. We cant comment on the afternoon teas etc. as we were allowed to visit the place through an aquaintance. It is only possible to get to the island if you are on the list. (pretty cool ;)).Staff was very friendly and helpful with everything. No problem to store the stroller while we were looking around.

Has lost its shine. I visited the Burj al arab, by having the afternoon tea at Skyview bar. This is my second time visiting the place, last time was about 3 years ago. I could say I was in awe the first time, and I loved my experience at Skyview bar, this means I could not wait to have the same fun. Well, this time I was disappointed, mostly because of the food and drink quality at the Skyview bar. Also, this time the price was 200 aed higher. We had a good view seating,and I took many photos. The food,I would guess was not fresh, I did not like most of the finger sandwiches and desserts. Drinks were poor, we ordered "fresh"watermelon juice which tasted like chlorine water, and iced mango tea had a watered down taste. As for the hotel inside, it is very beautiful, but a one time visit is enough. P.Sto book the afternoon tea you do not need a credit card anymore, you just write an email, with the time and day you would like to visit, and they will reply with a confirmation email. I was able to book 2 days before the date I wanted

Afternoon tea. We had afternoon tea here. You need a reservation just to get in. Once you are in, have a walk around. It's lovely. Very rich looking. You will be treated like royalty at your afternoon tea. And there is plenty of things to eat and lots of it. Some drinks are included in the tea deal. Ask for a window table. The view is outstanding.

Simply incredible. Sheer luxury, from the fantastic dining experiencexperiencen on the 27th floor where the views are superb to the 'underwater ' al mahara dining with the massive aquarium. This hotel is 7 star if there can be such a thing.

AN AMAZING PIECE OF ARCHITECTURE. The building looked way different from the normal views of 5* Hotels. This is completely different and is an amazing piece of architecture. They refer to it as a 7* hotel but in reality it can only be classified as a 5* hotel despite its opulent and extravagant fittings and furnishings. We had not made any reservations and as it was the festive season, they were heavily booked.Thus we were not able to gain access into the hotel. But I will make it a point to make a reservation in time on my next visit which I hope to make in December 2016.
From jumeirah beach. Had a photo stop in jumeirah beach for around 15 mins.The architecture of the hotel is too good.I wish one day i go and stay there.

Afternoon Tea - Unbelievable. I've never stayed at the Burj, but have visited and been given a tour many times.UK Sunday Papers (Sunday Times) have some great flight and accomodation deals, which seem quite reasonable for such a quality and iconic hotel.Luxury at its highest standard.Spectacular views from the bar at the top.

If you can afford it , you should do it.. You can only be admitted if you are going to stay or reserve for lunch or dinner. We had a lunch reservaion and visiting the hotel was a once in a lifetime experience. The architects must have had a ball being allowed to get pretty much free hands and no budget to worry about. The hotel is a masterpiece in both the design and the interior art work.The lunch selection was great with service accordingly. You have to be prepared to pay for the fun. We loved it.

You can contemplate from the distance. It is worth to see it from the beach - as you cannot enter the hotel (if you are not a guest; I heasrd it is possible to book a tour, but I do not know the detailes). For sure it is a symbol. And it is worth to know that even if it is occupied in 100% for 50 years it will still not bring profit...
Been there done that!. If you look for an nice extraordinary building you have never visit go to Burj Al Arab on afternoon tea or Friday brunch.

It doesn't get more extravagant. Pay AED 260 and visit the proud of the arab world. Sure, it is kitschy but amazing all the same. Visit the underwater restaurant and ask to visit a room. You will feel like a Sheikh.

amazing but very busy. this is amazing hotel we stay here for 4 nights, but due to this hotel is such a statement there are lots of visiter and it is very busy at the restaurants and lobby at all time, therefore beside breakfast and one dinner which we stay at the hotel the rest we end up going out, but of cause there are due to other plans and great food out there as well.The hotel itself is lovely great service you get your own butler, and the north deck is not open yet when we visit therefore if you are going later in the year is worth having a look as it look amazing
Cocktails in sky bar. This is the second time I have stayed at the Burj and it's the best and most unique hotel in the world! Cocktails in the sky bar is a must with fantastic views of Dubai city!

"Burj Al Arab the 7* hotel" One of the Tallest Hotels of the world in an artificial island!!!. It looks like the mast of a ship in the high seas.The 7* facility is built in an artificial island in the Jumeirah beach.We could not stay in this hotel as we have not pre booked for the room.I was told that it has amazing interiors,serves an awesome buffet and a drink in the roof top bar is magnificent.I made it point to prebook and stay here next time.
VERY IMPRESSIVE. We did not go into the building but just viewing it from the outside it is one of those buildings you just continue to stare at because of it's unique design.
Very good Restaurants and Skyview Bar at Burj al Arab!. We stay there for eating dinner. It was very great! Very great service! An the viexw from the Skyview Bar was very great!
Fantastic!. Got to be on everyones bucket list! It was a present from our children, we felt like royalty. We eat in the Sky Bar and saw the sunset. Amazing!

Excellent . Very expensive hotel. Service is good. Location is good too. Only problem is, if you want to go in city centre u need taxi. Please be careful of Dubai taxi service. They will still your pocket.
Amazing experience. We were lucky enough to have birthday drinks and visit the hotel. What a place, opulence beyond belief.

Buffet dinner - excellent choice. I had the pleasure of having dinner here one evening with my professional colleagues. Suggest a drink at the rooftop bar before dinner. We had the buffet dinner which was wonderful.

Very expensive but a must see. Top tip. Book or you won't get in. It's a must see, but go prepared to spend. The views are amazing and the interior even for Dubai blows you away. We went for drinks, but a meal would have been out of our budget and you have to book a slot or you won't get past se unity to the building.

Handsome 7* Hotel !!! Brilliant Burj !!!. Luxury @ it's best !!! Elegance personified Hotel representing the pride of Dubai, Attracts visitors with it's sheer beauty !!!We went to this wonderful hotel on 04th Feb 2016, since we don't have a booking we couldn't go in, but the view from the the entrance gate itself is so stunning, took some pleasant photos and videos to cherish, decided to come next time with booking and go in and experience this Majestic Burj.Same day went to Wild wadi water park which is just before Burj Al Arab and the views from the water park was awesome.
Seven Star hotel. Burj AL Arab is the most beautiful and singular in midel east and the world.but evrything in this hotel very expensive.I love this hotel very very much.
not as fabulous as expected!. we had afternoon tea, it felt rushed! Staying at the Atlantis, was underwhelmed by the Burj Al Arab fish tank! It does look ecaxtly as in the pictures tho, & is iconic!
Picturesque !!!. Great location for photos. Nice beach to swim and relax. Will suggest visiting it in first half of the day. Might get crowded in peak time....

Mieke and Wim Dubai 2016. The high tea was a amazing. Very friendly and nice atmosphere. The personal gives you a very warm feeling and welcome. The food With champagne and tea is awesome. For people with a high travel budget a must do. Very nice view of the Atlantis and the Arabic sea and the view over Dubai .
Was great. We had breakfast at Burj Al Arab - it was amazing the quality of the food and the service were outstanding. It's not cheap but worth it - The inside is beautiful too. All 4 of us loved it!
Hight tea. We went to the Burj for high tea. Wonderful experience would definitely recommend the skyview bar rather than the lobby.

Worthwhile to visit.. We had tea which is the cheapest way to see the hotel. However, even tea is expensive. The hotel is a shrine to wealth and what it can buy. Luxury everywhere. No other hotel like it. Much better visit than to the Burj Kalifa which is a waste of time and money.

Impressive. Huge and massive 6* hotel. Locals are proud of it.
The beach is not so crowdy and has nice and peaceful athmosphere.

Great high-tea in sky-bar. It already starts when you arrive with the taxi. The staf will open the door for you and greets you friendly. Entering the Burj al Arab will surprise you. The hall is very big and amazing. There is a lot to see and it is all very light. A big fountain is nice to watch. Again the staff will welcome you and a personal member will guide you upstairs to the lift. Once at the sky-bar again you will be welcomed by friendly staff. The bar is astonishing with a nice ceiling. The view to Palm-island is nice. Then the high-tea. Again nice staff and ofcourse a lot of cakes, cholate, bread, juice, tea, coffee and champagne. Every bite was very good and the cakes tasted very well.Ok, it is very expansive ($150pp) but it is a great experience.
Luxury. OMG! So extravagant, and classy but fun and modern and welcoming. I loved it. I felt in heaven. A must see.

Impressive. It is impossible to see the building up close, unless you have a reservation made there, so be prepared to just see it from a decent distance, or from the Jumeirah beach you can have a pretty decent sight on it.

Afternoon tea. My husband and I had afternoon tea at the Burj. It was fabulous. From your meet and greet to exit, it's is amazing. Please note tho, there is a dress code. Gents must wear long pants,not jeans or shorts. After all it is afternoon tea. Ladies dress up its worth it. Firstly you choose your tea from a beautiful tea chest. The food is amazing. Delicate sandwiches amazing cakes. All served by your own butler. After tea we were guided around the hotel and was able to enter the restaurant at the top of the Burj. We stood and looked out over the city to its amazing views. We had a fab time. Make sure to look out for the celebs that are staying there. All in all beautiful. Not expensive,just what you would pay at the Ritz. Treat your self. Kids allowed too.

High Tea @ SkyView Bar. First and foremost by no means I am writing this review to say that the hotel is not great or doesn't deserve to be a 7 star. Its a great sight to see a great building and interiors are very well done and well maintained. Hotel is spot less and makes you want to just stand and admire it for hours.Building, decoration, beauty, location, beach etc every thing is splendid.Now I would like to give my detailed and most honest experience of the much talked about AFTERNOON TEA which me and my partner recently had at the famous SKY VIEW BAR and felt that's where the service fell short of what I had expected after reading about in some of the online reviews.1) SKY BAR - It is one of the best bars I have been to and the strategic placement of this bar on a higher level with the view of ocean in front actually makes you feel like you are sailing in the ocean while having a great high tea at a 7 star hotel.Decorated with lots of hues of blue and swanky washrooms of this bar will make you feel that your decision of spending 1500 dirham (for two including cab rides, cover charges and a small tip) is well worth it. This bar would be almost full with like minded people (cant say if any in house guests were there as every one who came in with us...left with us) who want to experience the worlds only 7 star just like you so keep in mind it can be a busy day for the staff which ultimately can lead to them rushing you through the high tea and not delivering a great service, like it happened to us. If you are expecting to have a look at the property from inside as many of the blogs and other reviews talk about...then the answer is NO! From a relatively small lobby (filled with Chinese tourists click pictures madly) you will take an escalator to a level where you will meet the hotel staff to direct you to the sky bar.A fast paced glass elevator will directly take you to the sky bar and that is basically what you can see for the day. Same route will be followed on your way back so still no extra access to see and admire the only 7 star.2) HIGH TEA - At 620 AED per person you will go through a 5 course high tea.This tea experience will last for about 1.5-2 hrs and you will be served some great and some not so great bite sized foods. If you are a diabetic or a weight watcher this high tea is not for you as most of the courses are an over load of sugar which you will not be able to finish.Dates and champagne were OK to start with. Severs looked happy serving us till this point and we definitely felt welcomed. In case you are not a beef eater and don't prefer duck they will suggest you a vegetarian dish so feel free to ask. I was served a cold lasagne which was OK. Green apple creme brulee with white chocolate was awesome. Sandwiches were also not bad and you will be asked for a refill of sandwiches by a server carrying a big tray loaded with sandwiches (I found it quite odd). I would suggest holding on at this course to save some appetite for next courses.In the beginning staff will tell you that you can order as much drinks as you would like from a set menu and then you will not be able to catch them to take your order. Once you get hold of them for your order they will take half hour to bring your drink.What we did not like was when we orders the second round of our drinks we got clear reactions from the servers that they were not pleased.This time our drinks took 45 mins! So basically you can only have 2 drinks in your duration of stay there and I would recommend trying their Iced latte caramel (best one I have had till date) and Rose bud tea.Lychee & Rose sorbet was again an over dose of sugar and was not at all enjoyed.It was so sweet that I just tasted it and was done with it in first bite.A selection of pastries and scones will be served which I again found to be ok...nothing great about them which I can mention.By this last course the server clearly looked rushed and just want to clear up our tables asap so that we can go and a new batch can come in. This attitude is understandable as the servers might be bored with serving people that too every half hour when a new table comes in (they have booking slots every half hour and every thing seems very time calculated which doesn't let you relax and enjoy) with new guest with high expectations.We settled our check and left. Some guests were given packets with chocolates or cookies (I had read that they give you a small box of chocolates or cookies on your way back to be taken with you) but we were not offered this and dont know what the reason could have been. There were some who came out with packets and some with none so cant say what the criteria was.Will I go back to the hotel? - YES, but for staying.Will I repeat this high tea? - NO! Neither the service nor the canape are worth repeating.Is this high tea worth the money? - NO! this much money can get you so much more in Dubai. There are many hotels and restaurants which do high tea.I guess the only attraction for this hotel is that its a self proclaimed 7 star.Hope this review helps others who are in two minds if they would like to put this much money into this high tea or no.Thanks :)
Beautiful structure. Its a beautiful structure and we were glad to see it. One of the most beautiful buildings to see in Dubai.
Lifetime experience. Unless I become a lottery winner afternoon tea at the Burj Al Arab was a once in a lifetime experience. A "must do" on your "to do" list
Surprisingly Small. I was disappointed at the size of this building, although an interesting shape, it is small. compared to other impressive buildings.

Tea time. Book your table for high tea
A lot of very good things will be served and then no need to have dinner
Expensive but a great experience

Amazing!!!. We had a wonderful breakfast in 2014 for our second honeymoon. Everything was perfect, I strongly reccomend it!!
A very romantic experience.

Undoubtedly the most fascinating Hotel in the World. Burj al Arab is the top address in Dubai. A must see. They are now building an extension by adding a Ship attached to the Hotel for Hotel Guests to have an extension and additional spaces to spend their time. The vessel is currently on the way to Dubai and the idea is to have the extension ready faster than building it from claimed land. Smart Idea and surely surprising to see what the Sheiks have in mind.

Wow . I first laid my eyes on this place back in the summer. Now I'm back in Dubai and I have to say it's still got the wow factor.An impressive sail shaped hotel filled with luxurious bars and restaurants. The entire hotel bases its reputation on being the best in the world and it delivers on every level. Fixtures, fittings are first class.Service is the best I have ever encountered. Superb
Only to see from outside was cool. Beautiful place to see at night. This hotel is a beacon for visitors. The 360 bar near gives you a view for pictures to enjoy.

Couldn't get in without reservation. As the first and only 7-star hotel in the world, we took a taxi here but were tense away because we didn't have a reservation for a meal or for the spa. I was tempted to book a spa appointment until I was told that I would only be able to visit the spa and the lobby, nowhere else in the hotel. I plan to come back when I have deeper pockets!

Beautiful from afar - make a reservation . Only 6 star hotel in the world. Make sure to book at one of the restaurants to be able to go in. Security will turn you away at the gates as my friends did not have a booking. Tea time is good at $250 for some brunch. The hotel itself it beautiful a lot of gold decor and the exterior architecture is fantastic.

Only 7 Star. amazing infrastructure and engineering. Surrounded by beautiful beaches and great nature. But only issue is that you can visit this place with reservations only, which is not affordable for everyone

Stunning building. We stood outside long enough to take a photograph. It is best viewed from a distance to appreciate the full effect of the distinctive shape of this building. Unfortunately this is a very popular spot with tourists and there are security people ensuring that you don't stay too long or get too close to the gates at the front of the hotel.
Nice architecture . This has a nice architecture and it is just close to the beach. The look from the beach of burj Al Arab is beautifulAnd the walks around the beach is peaceful

Worth the money. Great view.
Relaxed atmosphere.
Amazing to see dubai from above.
Definitely come back again :))))))))
Amazing. it was awesome to see this hotel.Outstanding in side and out side.If you love luxuery and new modern fashion then you should go see this hotel and 7 stars hotel in world highly recommend it

Amazing Experience. This hotel in a word is just AMAZING!We booked for cocktails in the sky bar which cost around £160 for 4 cocktails. They were worth every penny! You are paying for the experience and the amazing service. Our waiter brought us over nibbles and kept replenishing which was really nice. He was. very knowledgeable about the cocktails and helped us pick some great choices.If you are visiting Dubai you need to visit this hotel. It really made our holiday very special.
Photo-Shoot From Outside. Be aware that tour groups are not permitted inside. You will stop by the gate and take pictures from outside.
Luxury. Everywhere you look is beautiful from the dancing fountains to the multi-story aquariums in the lobby. I had drinks and small eats in the bar at sun down and it was heaven.
Amazing view . It is nice to see and stay in front of Burj Al Arab. Perfect match of Dubai.We took very beautiful pictures and the sea is unique.
