Must see. I'd go at least once!! It's a but expensive but a must see if you are in Dubai. The cantilever restaurant on top is amazing but a bit $$$$

Fabulous. Had two wonderful meals here and drinks in the bar and lounge. Absolutely loved it. The bling, the scale, the service, the food and the view. Wow. Would love to stay here too, especially once the new pools etc are opened. Just wonderful. It inspired me to watch two documentaries on the architecture and engineering of the place. So impressive.
dubai 2016. Visited hotel with escorted tour which included a buffet lunch. Some items at lunch were only lukewarm expected on normal buffets but not at this location!

A tower with a view. we took regular ticket to the regular floor, with the regular queue.The general experience is not bad but not really exciting as someone might think is should. The sight was not perfect because of mist in the air, the photographers a little pushy, and after a few minutes we were ready to go down. The shop almost useless.

A tower with a view. we took regular ticket to the regular floor, with the regular queue.
The general experience is not bad but not really exciting as someone might think is should. The sight was not perfect because of mist in the air, the photographers a little pushy, and after a few minutes we were ready to go down. The shop almost useless.
Burj al Arab. It was a rally nice place we only walked around the gardens after going to Jamie Oliver's resteraunt was lovely.
Worth a visit. The aquarium and amazing lobby is fun to see. We went for high tea, one of the few ways to visit and while expensive it's worth doing once.

Brunch: Spendy, but Worth it If First Time in Dubai. This is obviously more expensive than high tea, but perhaps high tea is booked full already. This is a good alternative, although quite a bit more expensive. Still much less than staying a night...An inordinate variety of food (all you can eat), even more than expected. I don't frequent incredibly upscale restaurants that often, so perhaps I'm not as picky/demanding as some other people. I tried salad, lobster, numerous Indian dishes, sushi, Wagyu beef, and a few others (small amounts of many things), and I had no complaints about any of it. There are scores of desserts as well for the chocolate or sugar fanatics.Atmosphere was very nice, with live piano/cello going on. I wasn't able to get a window seat, but generally people don't mind if you wander to a window to take in the views or get some photos. The brunch is a must-try in my opinion.
Mostly good . Good service mostly but they didn't bring us the ice we requested even though we called the butler twice. The rooms are spectacular; a must visit.

Bliss. Visited Dubai with some friends last October and the BAA was a MUST for me. Instead of doing the Afternoon Tea which so many so, instead we discovered a spa package which was on special at the time for 695 dirham. We got to spend the whole day at hotel, starting off with the infinity pool on the 18th floor overlooking the Palm and had the place to ourselves. Next we were brought to our treatments rooms on the 19th floor with floor ceiling windows again, overlooking the Palm. My massage was THE best I have ever experienced. After our massages we were then shown to a relaxation room where we could have some tea and juice, before being brought to the Assawan Lounge where we were given a full High Tea - seemed to be the same as the Afternoon Tea to me. After this we then had access to the BAA private beach for the remainder of the day where we were spoilt with cold facecloths, ice, cold water and Burj ice-pops!Am heading back in April and am considering doing this package again!
Boring and small. Boring and smaller than expected. I rather stayed in a car while my family took some photos. Just like most attractions in the region - nothing to offer.
Too posh for me. Stayed twice but this place is too posh me,a first class faultless hotel but it is really out of my league.
7 stars. Simply amazing and highly recommended.The hotel enviroment is very good and fantastic, and the most I love from hotel is the accommodation
Visited jumeirah Beach. A great time out at the Jumeirah Beach near Burj Al Arab. A great day nice weather, took a lot of photos of Burj Al Arab.

Over the top hotel. Burj Al Arab is like no other hotel in the world. From the moment you enter you can immediately see why. I recommend doing afternoon tea at the Sky Bar to enjoy the view over the ocean, Dubai Marina and Jumeirah. It's pricy, but worth it.
Luxury Defined. a place to be wowed from the colors to the service and ambiance. Highly recommend trying the talise Spa and taking coffee in the lounge area.
7* of world. Super Luxury 7 star of the world. Gold plated restaurants. Under water restaurants are superb identifications of this.
A MUST SEE. We went to the SkyView Bar at the view is spectacular. Ask for a table by the window so you can see the view. The drinks are amazing! The cocktails are so different and very interesting!
Dinner at burn el arabj. We had the most amazing experience here with the aid of all waiters and waitresses the food was excellent
Beyond your imigination. Great work on this unique structure, great food and friendly atmosphere, jthe staff was very friendly

Wow What an experience - worth the minimum spend. We went here to celebrate my husband and my nieces successful run in the Dubai Marathon.
We had the most superb animated cocktails which the staff were super at supplying and explaining.
If you can afford it please visit the observation bar for evening cocktails or in the afternoon for tea and cakes.

Landmark building but stupendously expensive!. Unless you have money to burn go to the beach, take a photo and walk away. To go inside you have to book a meal. This we did and the hotel is breathtaking in it's interior design but at £30 for a G&T I think that's obscene!
Amazing hotel. Tough we didn't get an appointment to visit inside we had a look from the beach side, magnificent structure and a nice place for photography
burj al arab selfie. very attractive outside didnt have time to get in but will definitely see inside next time i come back to dubai.beach in the area very nice.

Too outdated.... This might have been a wonder of the world at one point but really wasn't up to scratch on my last visit, same old story inside with nothing really that pleases the eye for the price you pay. I wouldn't recommend wasting your money just to have a look around.
Awestruck by architecture and view is astounding. I could not stay here, but will be on my 'to do' list. I had jogging on the track near by and pleasant time at sea shore.
burj al Arab . the best. very professional service. not to be found like this in the world. .very exclusive. best quality food and enjoyable atmosphere.

Good. You can no more go inside the Al Arab to see the beautiful hotel from inside. You have to book a breakfast, lunch, high tea or dinner which will cost you a bomb. For a tourist, the closest you can get to this structure is to its entrance gate which probably is half a KM away.

Amazing . The Burj al Arab hotel is one of its kind,supposedly known to be as a seven star hotel,it's way beyond expensive from a Normal man's reach as the rooms start from $ 3000 upward,even to have a look one needs a reservation in the restaurant and a cup of coffee cost $ 100,all said and done it's surely a landmark for Dubai
Only 7-star hotel in the world. It is the one of the best hotels in the world with an incredible infrastructure and an amazing service.
Beautiful. Afternoon tea in sky view was excellent. Expensive but you only live once! Cost was 238 pounds for two but was worth every penny! Highly recommend
7 Star Attraction. If you have money & wanna have a fun or if you have 700 Dirhams . go & enjoy your tea ...Beautiful Architecture
Awesome. Location is excellent. Just loved the view of the property. Next time when ever i visit Dubai i will definitely stay there.
Burj Al Arab is finesse art. Quite an awesome view specially from the beach. My next trip to Dubai...this is a must visit hotel. It is conveniently located

Don't bother. Who wants to pay so much for a cup of tea unless your staying there and you have to book in advance you want to see a hotel Emirates Palace in Abu Dhabi 1.9 billion pounds to build it says it all really now that's 7 star
Fab. This area is so nice. Folk very friendly . Just amazing and well worth a visit. Taxis very cheap also . Nice temp in January. Glad we went
modern art. the building is awe inspiring and is a fine example of modern day architecture. though we did not go in, the trip to the Jumeirah beach for this building was worth it.

Expensive hotel. I think it's the most expensive hotel in the world. If you book rooms here, the hotel authorities will pick you up by Rolls Royce. Located in the sea so they have private beach also. But if you are really rich, then only you can afford this place.

In a word Superb. We went here for drinks on our honeymoon. I mostly like the sky bar was amazing and the views are incredible. Anyone could see Atlantis and the shape of the Palm as well as the newly built world. The views of the town are also stunning. Definitely a must do!

Totally opulent one of a kind amazing place!. This places rocks! Just a one of a kind phenomenon! The four buffets they have are just totally awesome and reasonably priced for a place of this calibre. Highly reccomend anyone that comes to Dubai must see this!

Oyster galore. There is a minimum you have to purchase at the restaurant but its worth it. Sometimes u get a table u can't see much of the outside view. The food is excellent and the staff is just doing their job, nothing memorable except the oysters I slurped on, probably the best I have ever had

AFTERNOON TEA. The splendour of this amazing hotel I don't believe has been lost by its age now. The lift up to the Sky Bar is an experience in itself. I felt slightly overdressed as I followed dress code, others clearly didn't.We were unlucky not to have a window seat but honestly that didn't matter, we could still appreciate the beautiful sunset and chatted to lovely people next to us.Jessica looked after us beautifully. The 7 course afternoon tea was amazing, champagne lovely and more than enough to eat and drink for the three hours we were there. Even had to bring some home in a box. My husband enjoyed a complimentary birthday cake too.We will visit next time for cocktails.The only negative thing was as we were leaving. We were totally overlooked by the door staff on several occasions whilst we looked for transport. The gentleman who wanted the white rolls and the other couple who were known to the staff were dealt with, absolutely no acknowledgement to us. In the end we stepped out and flagged our own transport down. That was a shame as otherwise an amazing afternoon.
Jet Ski Al Arab. Had the pleasure racing around the Burj Al Arab on a Jet Ski with my girlfriend. Amazing adventure setting of from the beach marina.
awesome place. you can see the sea sky and city from the top , very luxury place , it's a place to relax enjoying the beach and the sun

Drinks and food . Was there for the second time , I have to say equally as spectacular the second time round , breathtaking views both inside and outside , went to the sky view bar and had drinks and food .again service was incredible attention to detail fantastic . Had burgers and cocktails and to be honest for the location and the service didn't feel in the least overpriced , there was 4 of us and I think the bill was between 600-700 euro but we were there for hours , if you had a night out in the pub you'd nearly spend the same with a group , loves every minute and would definitely recommend
7 star luxury fro afar. A beautiful building but unless you have loads of money just enjoy it from the beach and get that iconic photo with it in the background .

Afternoon tea was a delight. A really classy afternoon tea experience as the top of the Burj. Yes it was expensive in this over the top hotel but well worth it. Having done it we probably wouldn't do it again but loved every minute. Quality food, plenty of it and great variety. Fantastic views of the Palm and Dubai Downtown.

Afternoon tea at the Burj Al Arab - Skyview Bar. I booked this for my father as it was his 70th birthday and he and my mother were on holiday in Dubai to celebrate. He told me that it was an amazing experience and on top of this the staff apparently treated them exceptionally well, giving them an incredible seat and an additional birthday cake and chocolate gifts. This was well above what I expected and I would definitely recommend this to anyone, thanks very much to the staff who made this an unforgettable experience for them!

300 dhms to get in?. We decided not to go in as we had 5 people and it was 300 Dirhams ($80pp) to get in the door. Now, you can put that money toward food, but we just saw it from the outside. Maybe next time.
Over rated. Went there for breakfast.service was superb of course the food too.but I feel its over rated..maybe if I can afford to stay there I'll appreciate it more..
Had a wonderful lunch. I had reservation at the restaurant AL MUNTAHA. The view from the restaurant was spectacular and the food was fantastic. The service was top notch.
Lunch. Had a lunchtime package here - very lovely setting and very attentive staff. Food was very nice and great to experience such an iconic hotel.
You can't get too close to the building. You are only allowed to view the building from outside the gate. Only residents of the building or patrons of the restaurant are allowed inside.
An incredible sight. This building is spectacular. I recommend having lunch at the Waterfront so that you can view the building. It's just amazing.

An evening of cocktails . Wow this experience was most definitely worth the a visit. We were staying at the Jumeriah Beach hotel.A visit to the Burj is by appointment only, so prior booking essential if you have a specific date, time in mind. The welcome and excellent service continued throughout the evening. There is a minimum spend of 350 AED's per person, which we exceeded !Reuben welcomed us to the lounge and continued the first class service. Initially we were seated where the view was limited, but without even asking he arranged for us to be moved where the nighttime view was breathtaking .Although expensive , it's an experience well worth having.

The top of the top. We booked a 3-course lunch at Burj al Arab. Only to get over the bridge was a history. You have to show a reservation to get through! The lobby was fantastic, the reception was fantastich and even the elevator up to the restaurant. Very friendly staf, a good meal and very very high prices of wine, which i will never forget. But still worth a visit that you will never forget.

Sightseeing that wasn't . Can't go in the compound unless you have reservations to eat there. Asked the parking guy if there is a place to park and walk around and we were told we need to move. Next time make reservations
Nice View. I enjoyed the sunset at their beach. Photos can be more captivating with the that tower. It's nice to stay with the cold weather.

Amazing view. Special lunch shared with my two nieces at the Muntaha restaurant with wonderful view of the Palm. Food and service were superb as expected from one of the most famous hotel in the world.This was my fourth visit and enjoyed the experience as much as my first visit in 2007.
Fantastic hotel structure. Nice structure... Though have closed for visitors ..need prior reservation with proper dress code to enter hotel...

A wonderful birthday meal, although very expensive. Service was excellent, food was served very well and a lovely birthday cake and flowers, the cigar lounge attached to the restaurant has an amazing choice of brandy.

so beautiful. There are taller and newer buildings in Dubai, but this one is graceful and stunning. What can I say? Even if you don't get inside, do find a spot to view the building. one of the best and cheapest ways to experience the building is to sit on the waterside of the metro train and see how the building seems to sail as you move past it...This is breathtaking architecture.

Best 9 course afternoon tea in the world!. This was a gift from our children. My daughter,who has in the past worked in Dubai (so knew the hotel)chose the perfect time of 4.30.We arrived at three and didn't leave until nearly seven, giving us plenty of time to enjoy the ambience of the fabulous surroundings!The view from the restaurant was truly breathtaking as we could see virtually all over Dubai, and due to the timing we were able to watch the sunset and see all the lights glistening on the sea below us.It was a magnificent sight which I will never forget.The food was wonderful, consisting of both hot and cold dishes.The sandwiches and pastries were presented on a stand in the shape of a sail(replicating the hotel)Waiters were totally attentative, constantly 'topping up' champagne and tea.At the end of the experience we were presented with a gift box containing home made chocolates and a souvenir pen.Granted, it was expensive( and this was a gift!) but I can honestly say I would willingly have paid for this myself and felt it had been money well spent.The whole occasion was truly something special and something that I will always remember.

Special Afternoon tea . We visited to celebrate our parents anniversary and it was special. From the welcome in the lobby from the beautifully dressed reception staff, to the staff in the Sky view Restaurant especially Reubon who made our Afternoon tea very unique and memorable. Food delicious and the choice of teas and coffees are outstanding. When visiting Dubai make time to visit the Sky view Restaurant.

Mrs Coyne . Very special evening at the Burj al Arab at the al Muntaha restaurant. Wonderful service and attention to detail. Marvellous food..even if on the expensive side. Shame other diners couldn't stay off their phones long enough to enjoy the food or their surroundings. Silly people. .....

Disappointing as not accessible without booking reserving first. Unless you reserve a booking you cannot get near the place!!
Spent 80 AED by taxi to take photo from outside the gate, note!!!
Best Place , Luxury Redefined. It was so good , i was feeling stepping in a new world , The Staff was very good , beautiful exotic cars , Incredible Place.
Impressive looking hotel. Went to see this hotel as we went to jumeriah beach, it looks very impressive & not they have an extension on the way from Finland for sunbeds & pool area I believe.

Very goog. He months of the fire on the flag, it is the most important attractions of Dubai and the most famous, and goes beyond the concept of hospitality to become a dream for travelers and a real adventure begins from the first moment

A Theatre of Opulence. A theatre of opulence, Essex meet footballers wives, Hilarious people watching, more and bigger, brighter and blingier is considered better, the black and white diamond covered football said it all

Breakfast at Burj Al Arab. The beauty of the Burj Al Arab is perfection. Aside from the construction taking place near the entrance, the Persian Gulf in the background, the sounds of the white Rolls Royce's, black BMW 7 series, black Mercedes S Class arriving to drop off or leaving to pick up guests the exterior was silent. The entrance is lined with paintings of the Dubai Royalty, as you enter the grand foyer you look up to see what mimicked sails from a boat as the inner balconies. Below there is a cascading waterfall flanked by the reception and concierge desks.On each side of the waterfall are escalators to take Burj Al Arab guests to there suites unless you are privileged to have arrived by helicopter and ushered down the private elevators. At the top of the landing is a fountain and several shops to purchase gifts such as a diamond covered soccer ball or diamond covered hand gun.Our breakfast started as scheduled with our personal waiter there to describe the various delicacies on the menu. Arab and Indian cuisine prepared for the palates of the elite just waiting to be consumed. The flavors of such unique foods created with Sheiks and Sultan's in mind were there for us to eat. Our breakfast dining area gave us a view out of the front of the Burj Al Arab, revealing the waters of the Persian Gulf just in front of the nearby wave shaped Jumeriah Hotel. In the midst of breakfast a quartet of musicians played sweet music as we received our meal. This was undoubtedly one of the highlights of our time in the United Arab Emirates, this self proclaimed 7 star hotel is truly worthy of the claim.
hate the decoration. Hearing all the good advertisement s about this hotel I was expecting a nice decent hotel but I hated the decoration.

High Tea at Burj Al Arab. This is a must do!!! The hotel itself, both outside and inside, is like nothing you've ever seen before. The high tea is a seven course experience for your eyes and tastebuds. While it's expensive, it is so amazing and delicious that it's worth every penny for this experience.
A must see!. Whether you go in or just go around the hotel, it's an attraction that you cannot miss! you can see the tower from the the beach, beautiful!

great treat. my dining experience and drinks were spectacular
also the gift shop the luxury of hermes at this place
Fantastic experience. We went for Afternoon Tea and would highly recommend this! Enjoy the spectacular views, amazing food and wonderful service.

very good. It was our 30th wedding anniversary and we decided this was going to be the place we were going to celebrate and the place did not disapoint.The staff were very attentive and we were put at a window table,The food was excellent but expensive (as you would expect).We did have a delicious chocolate cake as a complimentary gift for our anniversary.
4oth birthday. myself and friends came here for a joint 40th birthday celebration, it is what it is 7 stars and breathtaking
Amazing building. We viewed this building as part of a private city tour. The tour guide took us to the beach where we had a fabulous view of the building.
Grand. It is everything you expected to be... magnificent building.. a real landmark. Nice free beach near with a stunning view of the hotel in the background.

Stunning surroundings, stunning service!. We had booked here for tea and it was absolutely fantastic from start to finish!. The staff were friendly, approachable and above all very professional. The whole enterprise is geared towards service and providing the best. Our 7 course tea started with either Champagne or a non alcoholic Fig drink, the latter is wonderful. The following 6 courses featured speciality sandwiches, macaroons, cakes etc. The flavours and presentation were spectacular, with each course explained as it is served. There is of course a wide choice of teas to accompany the lovely food. The surroundings are luxurious and the entrance had been decorated with a Christmas theme at the time of our visit. WOW! and that was before we even saw the full height fish tanks alongside the elevators! This experience is not cheap but should be on every visitors "to do" list.You should note that the Burj Al Arab is on an island and there are security measures in place.
Visit for sure . This place amazing . Here you mean find everything you need , sun, sea and beach, view , the greatest building !!!! I can spend all day here

Real Experience. Our son and daughter in law treated us to afternoon tea (glad they did as it comes out at £120/head!)It is a truly magnificent experience, seven courses of top quality food with a glass of champagne and seconds if you waned it.We had the best seat in the house and the service was excellent.Particularly impressive was the fact that we over tipped and the manager voluntarily refunded the amount. Classy!

Burj Al Arab High tea was beyond disappointment !. I think it was important to visit Burj Al Arab. The arcitecture is stunningly beautiful and one of a kind. Entering the small island it sits on your expectations are raised only to be dashed with contrast the interior of the hotel . It reminds me of Disneylands "It's a small world" ride....not exactly what I would envision a six star hotel ! We booked reservations for High Tea Sunday in the upper open air mezzanine lobby ....honestly it was the WORST tea we have ever attended. Overpriced...$200 plus per person, slow service, poor tasting food....then adding insult to injury...only one glass of champagne per person...second glass was extra...really?????Go see hotel because it's "Burj Al Arab" ....but skip the tea!

Places to see before you die. If you don't have reservations you won't be able to see the Hotel. I got a tour of the Hotel because one of my classmates from College was working there as a Hotel Manager. My experience was incredible. I went there for my birthday and I felt like a queen.

Extravagant! . We visited the Burj Al Arab for evening drinks in the restaurant at the top. It was not cheap with a minimum spend (sorry, I can't recall the cost) required. The staff were very friendly and rotated guests to try and ensure they had a chance to be sat at the windows to get a great view.If you go to Dubai and if you're budget allows you, I would recommend having drinks in the bar at the top.

Special moments. . A must do for all visiting Dubai. The staff are extremely friendly and will absolutely treat everyone with the greatest of respect. Our host was a young lad called Durga who is so happy energetic and willing to enhance everyone's experience at the burj al Arab. Our time and food at the burj was lovely and they ensure that all dietary needs are carefully looked after also. The sunset Mocktail is a must!

Overrated. A very opulent hotel, but lacking character and sophistication. Very guarded in letting people in, and overly restrictive when you have people visiting you. The bar has a good view and is impressively large, but there is a terrible arrogance with the unnecessary dress codes applied in the bar and restaurants. Not enjoyable but worth a look once.

Another highlight of my day trip to Dubai. It is onlyneeds to have a hotel reservation to se. Lovely souvenir to take home,a picture that is! One can't tour unless they are staying at the luxurious hotel

*Burj Al Arab. To my knowledge, only place in the world where you can pay money to visit a hotel?! Actually, only the „mezzanine”(?!), have some canapés, tea, & a glass of champagne. Despite the glitzy Xmas decorations & live harp music, the production set looks rather outdated & run down.

good Photo Op. Saw this attraction only from the outside. It provides a good opotunity since this building is haped like a yatch. There is a beach nearby which you can visit even in day time in the month of January. We were there around 12 in the day and surprisingly it was pleasant and not hot.

Lovely views. We went here for drinks on our honeymoon. The sky bar was amazing and the views are incredible. You could see Atlantis and the shape of the Palm as well as the newly built world. The views of the town are also stunning. Definitely a must do!

Arabian Hospitality - AWESOME. We stayed at the Burj al Arab on January 1st 2016 for Cocktail Time. It was stunning. The Entrance to the Hotel Lobby, beautifully decorated, the Personnel throughout very kind and helpful. They made our stay an extraordinary memories. Thank you. Looking forward to coming back in the near future.

Buji Al Arab. Best hotel that I've ever been to but the only thing is heartbreaking is that, that huge hotel that costs billions and people in Africa who are starving to death. Lovely hotel and atmosphere. Definitely recommend

Afternoon tea at the sky bar was a lovely experience!. Their afternoon tea is such a great experience. Super polite and friendly staff, finger food and deserts, live piano music, all surrounded by luxury. The rooms here are way over my budget, but the tea experience was awesome as the view. Go for it.

Amazing and Beautiful attraction.. There is no free acess near to this hotel but is visible from beach side where you can enjoy beach also.Excellent for photography.Its a unique design built on artificial island.This is attraction next to Burze Khalifa and must see.
Luxury at its best. Best stay i ever had. A dream come true to experience this most luxurious hotel! Experience that I will definitely tell my kids when i grow old.. B

Impossible to see close details. It was a bit disgusting go there to see the hotel and one option was to see it fron 150 mts fron the crowded access street, the other option was to see from the beach, but the private beach force us to see from 300 mts.

Interesting building. Haven't been inside only around. It's tricky to get a nice pic but not impossible. Go to the Soukh Madinat Jumeirah and beside the beautiful interior you can take pictures of the Burj Al Arab too. You are not allowed to go inside the building only if you have made a reservation but they let you till the entrance of the connecting bridge. Then go into the Jumeirah beach hotel and take the best pictures from their beach for Fere

Amazing view from the beach. The building in itself is a marvel, it has been built on a piece of land that was created by pumping in sand and creating artificial island kind of setup. The view from the adjacent Jumeirah beach is simply breath taking.
It's Dubai you need to see. We did afternoon tea although it is pricey it provides access to the Burj AL Arab and it is much more than tea many snacks and sandwiches with excellent service

Worth every bit..!!. This hotel is definitely worth every bit of it (even a worth multiple visits if one can afford lol)! Luxuriously spacious rooms, grand entrance, every floor and every room has its own butler!We stayed for one night for our honeymoon. Our stay was so touching that they delivered us a cake and a card to congratulate our wedding! Amazing experience, highly recommended.
Average ! . Amazing hotel with luxury feeling. Went for high tea at skybar 27th floor AED620 per person. Service was great/ food very average! I would expect higher quality for such price and hotel!

Magical stay. The hotel is not for everyone, and some may just be better heading over to it for a dining experience. However, our stay was sensational on all fronts, especially the service and rooms. It was worth every penny, although my family and I were a little caught by surprise by all the tourists roaming around the place, and non-befitting hotel guests staying. Maybe the hotel has to be a little more consequent on whom to allow into the hotel, and stricter in not allowing intoxicated individuals.

Cocktails in the sky bar. Interesting decor and not as grand as you think in regards to dress code I was surprised to see people in casual dress despite all the instructions on the website.we only had cocktails and nibbles but they didn't offer any gluten free options so we went elsewhere to eat

Over the top, but definitely worth doing once!. Seeing the Burj from a distance is actually worth the effort in itself. Entering the foyer changes the perception as you are overwhelmed by the over the top decor. We first had lunch on the top floor and the view, service, style, food and decor were beyond compare! Next we had dinner in the aquarium restaurant and the experience was certainly quite unique! However, it was all priced at the highest comparative levels globally.Enjoyable and worth experiencing. If you are price sensitive then having cocktails after five is a good alternative. It will still be outrageously expensive, but you will be able to experience the decor, view and incredible service.

Champagne afternoon tea at the top!. Booked afternoon tea at the Skyview Bar. You can request a window table which they acknowledge but they don't guarantee it. I was taking my wife there for her birthday.Wow, terrific experience from start to finish!You need a reservation just to get past the control gate before the bridge to the hotel, you can't just wander in. They will have your name on their list, else you don't get in!My biggest surprise on entering the hotel was that it is hollow inside, you can see right to the top inside, with the rooms down both sides, and light shines through that curved shape towards the land.You then go to a private reception just for the Skyview, and give your name, and you wait until called by name to enter one of the two lifts, two couples at a time. Get there early if you want a window table, it's then just stunning. You get called to the lift in the order that you arrived. At the top of the lift you are received by another person and wait a few moments in a seat until someone else then escorts you to your table. We had a wow view, see the pics!The server then introduces him/herself and explains everything in great detail.Hint - when its the sandwich course, you will get offered more, don't take them, there are about 7 courses, and you will be full without taking extra sandwiches, unless you have a huge appetite!The tiered trays you get served with are shaped like the hotel!You get a presentation box at the end with luxury chocolates and a Burj pen.The whole experience is just exceptional, especially so if you get a window seat overlooking the Jumeirah hotel end, you can see towards the city from that end.It costs about £120 per person, but what an experience!

Memorable Seafood Experience. One of my most expensive and memorable dining experience is of Al Mahara Burj Al Arab , we went there few years back. What a beautiful setting under the Aquarium. Calm atmosphere, dine with a view of Aquarium where water creatures are busy in their world. Dark and dim restaurant setting and colors goes just in accordance to their Aquarium theme. We had a complimentary dining for two. We were treated with extra care and attention by their well trained team /staff. They ensured from us whether we were allergic to any kind of sea food. Staff asked twice before serving any of the food items . They served us many things before our final order . I would say mini food souvenirs from the sea like caviar , certain pastes or combinations and mini servings made out of sea food etc whose names I honestly forgot …. So we tasted many starters before the main meal. Although small in quantity , I felt filled up with those mini tasters.  The main focus of attraction was our main dish , we took advise from the staff and I think he suggested us the best from the menu. It was a big platter of mixed sea food, and quite expensive one ! After that you don’t need to order anything separately . Actually It was the special dish being served in that particular week when we dined. But without being stuck up in the long and complicated list of menu it was a very good decision , we enjoyed our food with everything on our big sumptuous platter one for each of us, we could not even finish it all. Over all a very good and filling dining experience.We did our sweet ending with a mixed serving of small dessert bites which were are all too delectable !Burj Al Arab has a magnificent interior. Bright colors are used in furniture and flooring , Arabic styled décor. A very interesting setting !

High Tea was amazing. we visited the sky bar at the Burj Al Arab for high tea, the whole experience was brilliant all the way from the service to the food. there was so much food you didn't go home hungry. and they even gave you a gift on your return home of some nicely wrapped chocolates which was a nice touch.the view out of the sky bar was incredible, even the lift up the spine of the building was impressive to start with.the dress code was formal which was nice so be aware of this is you attend high tea. a dress below the knee etc..
Nice place to visit. If you ever visit Dubai, do not miss Burj Al Arab. You can go for a meal or coffee in one of the popular restaurants in Burj Al Arab and enjoy a very relaxing view!

Amazing Friday Brunch (well worth the price). We went for a Friday Brunch at Burj Al Arab and it was SO delicious. We ate for 3 hours and there was really not anything else I could wish for... Lobster, shellfish, fish, sushi, sashimi, caviar, wok, risotto, fois gras, meats, - desserts, desserts, desserts... Beside the great food, the view is absolutely beautiful from the restaurant, live music and really good service. You don't feel misplaced because it is too fancy, everyone is just very service-minded and nice.It is expensive but we definitely think it was worth it.

Design & Built: Super. Food & Service: Pathetic. Visited this place on 26th Dec 2016. We were a group of 17 and visited this place for morning breakfast.From the very start our group was literally ignored and not attended to nicely.About the food: We all ordered for vegetarian food. 1. There was just too less to choose from. In-fact in the main course there was just parathas and another choice of south indian (idly + dosa). Apart from this there was just juice, fruits and some bread. 2. The taste was very bad. We had our expectations high since this was a Luxury Hotel and we expected top class food here, to be honest giving the food average also would be unfair, it was bad.We reached on time but the service was very bad, we were unattended for quite sometime, for e.g. we had ordered for a coffee and didn't get it even after 4 reminders to the staff, it was only when we started to make a fuss about their service that they noticed and then also the manager comes and defends their staff and didn't apologise. The staff was so bad, they didn't have the courtesy and manners just to accept that they lacked on service on that particular day. We had to fight for about 2 hours just to get this down their minds. It was only when the senior officials stepped in and apologised.In they end they offered us some monetary discount on our bill and offered a complimentary tour of the Burj Al Arab.Even though the senior staff did solve the situation in the end, I would strongly recommend to visit this place just from the outside, and then be on your way.

Reservation only. If you haven't booked dinner or tea you can only view from a distance. Very well guarded. Still there is a photo place reserved to take a nice picture and the beach is just along the road to get a different angle
Worthy of 7 stars. The hotel is quite special, opulent. Loved it, rooms amazing, service and staff so helpful, the food & restaurants amazing, would definitely be back
An icon in Dubai. Incredible views and amazing beach, all in an atmosphere of luxury, with gold dust in the sand of the beach!!

An experience to remember. Whilst in Dubai it was my wife's birthday and I arranged evening cocktails in the cocktail bar at the Burj.we have never been in a Hotel where so much attention was paid to us during our visit. An escort met us at reception and we were personally accompanied on a hotel tour and eventually to the tube cocktail bar at the top of the hotel. The bar was brought to our window seat and we had our drinks and canapés . A bit of an expensive treat but well worth it. The view ,the people we met and of course the drinks.breat experience but not our kind of hotel.

An icon of Dubai. The building is beautiful great design and very nice to visit. Better to get something to eat etc or the ticket is for just seeing is pretty steep. I would caution our conservative readers that the beach next to it should be avoided, its quite liberal and not a place to visit at all, the building is along the beach.
Afternoon tea. Delicious, beautiful, very expensive but worth it.I made reservations on line. Seven course tea including duck confit.

absolutely overrated. My biggest disappointed in Dubai so far. I took my parents there for dinner, during their visit to Dubai. We had dinner in their fish restaurant.First disappointment: the main fountain was not operating. This fountain makes up for 50% of the charm of the lobby, so when it's dry the lobby is way less impressive.We were early for our reservation, so we thought we would go up the elevator, to have a view from the panoramic restaurant. We were denied access to the elevator. So we had a cocktail in the bar of the lobby. The lobby is currently facing a gigantic construction sit, so much for the view.We finally went to the restaurant, difficult to find because not very well indicated. When I entered the dining room of the restaurant, one word immediately cam to my mind: feet. The dining room smelled like feet. Oh, and the wine menu is ridiculously expensive.

Beautiful Luxurious Hotel. You need to make a reservation at any of the F&B outlet before you can visit the hotel. We book the High Tea at Sahn Eddar as certain lounges do not allow minors. The 3 course High Tea included one Glass of Champagne and the price is the same for kids and adults. The quality of the food is good but not excellent for the price. Overall, its a good experience to visit the hotel.

Too many good dishes and amazing view. Worth trying during lunch time or brunch Very nice diverse dishes, nice drinks , excellent service , but leave room for the dessert section !!! Between chocolate fountain, ice cream, pastries ,.... Difficult choices to make
Beginning of revenge . Its beginning of revenge of dubai, dubai is found of that palce in beginning, its one and only 7 star hotel in whole world,

Well worth the visit. Another of the must visits when in Dubai . A great way to get a panoramic view of the entire city . You can have your picture taken doing various activities such as standing outside of the tower ( all computer generated , of course ) .

Stunning piece of architecture . We had brunch at the Jumeriah towers beach cover and the view I had was the Burj Al Arab. We didn't go inside as its exclusive really but It has its own island - our beach was very close hence why these fabulous photos Beautiful site

FANTASTIC HOTEL. We had a great time at the skyview bar in Burj al arab , I actually don't know what should i 've to say bout this place that isn't alreay been told.
The place is simply amazing and the staff is very very kind.
great asset to dubai and this world. Nice view and great experience. Visit in evening time so that you can have both view. For day time and for night time.

lunch buffet at burk ul arab. once again sun city tours outdid themselves in perfectly arranging the best price for lunch at burj and travelling to and from thr venue. almost 2000 rands per person but it was a dream to go there and we did so. be prepared for stiff prices on drinks. food out of this world. almost 60 dishes if all types of cruisine. dessert to die for. the magic and opulance of being with the rich and famous even if for 3 hrs. instead if shopping malls save money to go to burj. thank u sun city tours for making this a reality.

Great for clicking photos. You will have wonderful pictures by having Burj Al Arab in the background. Its situated on an island and is a true reflection of Dubai's magnificent landscape and architecture. You can also enjoy the sea in the backdrop.

Beautiful!. This is definitely worth a visit if you are out sight seeing in Dubai. Our tour guide stopped at the beach and we got out and walked almost right up to it and took some pictures. That was enough for us, was great to see.
How a beautiful hotel. It's a beautiful hotel beside the Arabian Sea!!!Only can look at it & take a photo far far away, for not to be hotel guest, no way to walk in to take a look about the inside!!!

A architectural delight in the middle of the sea. It is as exquisite as most of the buildings of Dubai are. Build on the Sea it stands tall in the Jumeirah beach. If you are the person with a heavy pocket go inside and experience the hospitality and luxury, if not you can have some wonderful photo ops from the Jumeirah beach, to make you look good in Facebook :-)

Amazing! Another World. This hotel is out of this world, 7 stars! We visited the Skyview Bar & it was worth every penny! It was for my boyfriend's 30th birthday & they made it extra special by bringing a cake out for him & a red rose for me! Would definitely go there again!

Afternoon Tea in the Sky. Great place for chilled afternoon - whether it be with friends, family or that special person. We had an amazing time, especially endulging in the amazing selection of desserts!!!!! Great views of the palm, world islands, and along Jumeirah beach. Keep your fingers crossed the weather is good though, can get a bit dusty and makding visibility poor.Overall great spot - will be back!!
Stunning Hotel awesome food and staff. Didnt stay here but went of for a meal for a special occasion, lovely food expensive but to be expected for 6 stars.

7 star WOW !. shared a beautiful evening here for dinner in al Mahara restaurant, and experience we will not forget; sitting right next to floor to ceiling aquarium is hard to ignore; the wait staff are very knowledgeable, very helpful, their timing impeccable; food was to die for, as was the beverage selection. don't kid yourself by saying "oh we saw the Burj al Arab", splash out a bit, dine there people, c'mon , it's a magical experience !!

Once in a lifetime. The Burj al Arab visit was one not to be forgotton. My daughter wasnt 21 yet and wasnt officialy allowed to join is for the high tea we had booked.In the skyview bar you can book a high tea at aprox 100 usd per person and it allows you to have the full experience of driving to the frontdoor of this 7 star hotel and entering the hotel as if you are a guest.Take about 15 minutes to absorb what you see, its height, the aquariums left and right of the escalators. The first floors hides some shops but at the end of the hall two kinds ladies will welcome you. Once accepted and only if you are on the list you will be allowed access to the elevator. This will be your second life time experience. The elevator goes up at the seaside if the hotel and allows views onto the sea whilst going up.In a few seconds you will step out and into the sky view bar, with lights in the ceiling and a long streching bar. A waiter will help you to your table.It became a problem for us once he found out our daughter wasnt 21 and as we had no ID's they were nearly refusing us entrance.It was because we had a table next to a rope which devided the restaurant area from the bar that we could anjoy our excursion in this fabulous place.After the high tea , it tooks about two hours all together, we had a look outside where the most fantastic cars were parked and self proclaimed rich and famous were walking in and out.

Take the Burj and sale. Approch the Burj from the beach side, wonderfull view and inside , ouaou...compared tto burj khalifa which is more impressive inside, i prefere burj el arab for its architecture.

Extreme opulent decor.. This must be one of the most expensive hotels in the world. The only way to get in is to make a reservation for a room or one of the dining options. The high tea may be the most reasonable. The decor here has to be seen to be believed, dancing fountain, pillars and sconces, bright colors with cathedral ceiling. Staff are pleasant, friendly and helpful.
OUTSTANDING!!!. Being the only 7star hotel in the world. I must say it's an outstanding structure just to see and more so enjoying time around Burj al arab is a plus.

Culinary flight. It was my birthday celebration to take culinary flight in burj al arab with one cuisine in each restaurant. I was amazed to see Hermes in bathroom.Now coming to main thing the feel of 7 star yes it is very royal. sky view bar is amazing one can see palm jumerah full palm shape form sky view bar.food was nice too though i am not fan of 5 star hotel food. But experience was amazing once in lifetime thing for me. they celebrated my birthday by giving cake in last course

This seven star hotel is like a fairy tale. This hotel is very exclusive and can only be seen inside if you reserve tickets for lunch or high-tea. There are several options for lunch and different types of restaurants; so ask the local agent before you book.Lunch is expensive (around 200 euro per person) drinks not included. The inside of the hotel is magnificent. We were there around Christmas and the entire ground floor and first floor were decorated with deer and trees in white light. Interesting as well is the fountain on the first floor. It has different rythms and the way the water falls alternates, so you get a kind of small water ballet. The lunch we had was a very extenisve buffet of Western and Arabic delicacies and we had our own butler who even helps you carry your plate.

Love at first sight!. My favourite building in the city! The architecture is so romantic! And the view are super amazing! It's a top luxury place to visit! A plus that you don't have to book a room to go inside! Must see! It is something very special!
Fun to see, but just a photo opp. Beautiful to see, day or night, as it's a landmark of Dubai. However, incredibly expensive to stay in and really just a good photo opportunity.

Classic Design. This is my favourite building in Dubai, love the classic design. I was able to see it up close by driving by and parking for a few seconds to take photos. This is a busy area and you are not allowed to park, security everywhere trying to get people off the property. Its better to go on foot. I also got a good view from the Monorail on the way to Palm Jumeirah. Definitely worth seeing.

High tea is spectacular . I went with my mum and sisters to the high tea which I originally thought was very expensive. It's well worth every penny. The hotel itself is out of this world and the quality of the food is very very good. With mini versions of main dishes it was diverse and they kept coming back for more. A definite must do
The buidlng Dubai is known for. Good place to see when you are visiting Dubai. One can take good pictures. Landmark location sea. Good architectural exampal.

A formal breakfast. We went here for a breakfast. It's usually always booked, so I would suggest you book this place well in advance. The spread was awesome and we had a pretty fulfilling meal. You have to dress up formally of you wish to enter here. It's a must visit as you can see how grand the hotel is. Absolutely worth the money you spend.

Dinner at Bab Al Yam. The food here is pretty overrated, I would not pick it as an option again. If you really want to visit the Al Arab, a better option would be reserving space at the upstairs bar - but you must meet the $100 per person minimum. Won't be as hard as it sounds, given that a cocktail is $30.

Unique Hotel Structure. Tall and beautiful hotel located in the sea. Although I didn't go inside but you can go and pay to have food available in the restaurant of the hotel.many tourist visit this place to take photos and enjoy the beach.

Holiday . This was one of my favorite part of my trip to dubai with my partner. The Burj al Arab was spectacular . It stands beautifully at the palm beach and jumerah beach. The clear blue sea with the white sand makes it hard to forget. The experience was simply awesome.

Amazing architecture and views!. First, you must have reservations to the lounge in order to enter the premise and visit the hotel. We made reservations to the sky bar and it was worth it (a once in a lifetime experience), it is not everyday you go to a 7 star hotel! The hotel was beautifully decorated for the holiday season and it made it that much more glamorous. The second floor has stores and this is where the elevator to the sky bar is. An attendant takes into the elevator and up to the lounge. Once you are there you are greeted and men make sure you were a collared shirt or jacket, proper acquire is required. the lounge is very nice and you are treated very well; they give up appetizers with your drinks and you are able to order food or something light to enjoy the view of Dubai. Yes, this is a pricey experience, but one you will always remember.

7 star. very lovely staff. they make all the difference. the butlers.. best part of it is the bed, you will sleep very well. you would wake up not sure where you are. the Chinese restaurant that does breakfast is just amazing. and the butter chicken from the room dinning chef. that would make it even when its not on the menu. come on.

Have to be a resident of the Hotel to visit........................ Top of the list to see from bus tours I know this hotel well,marketed assignee stars is all Hype home to individuals who can dish out thousand per night for their stay.Architectural masterpieces appearing as a sail in the wind with heliport to one side.Visiting rights restricted to guests only thats the price paid for total privacy.

Worth the Visit!. Visited the Sky Bar in the evening for my wife's birthday! Yes its expensive but you are made aware of the min. spend when booking, I think it was 700AED. The cocktails were excellent and the presentation of the ones we chose breathtaking(I had one where dry ice was poured around it/the wife got her cocktail in a handbag(like a tea pot) with a lipstick made of a jelly substance with little makeup jars with flavorings so she could make her own concoction ;-). You also get finger food with savory nuts included.It was worthwhile as you can walk around the hotel and the lifts and bar area itself is impressive. They only allow access to the hotel if you have a booking, if not a resident!The views were limited to the city lights which we cool however the day time experience would offer great sea views but we had that every day from our hotel room so chose the nighttime option!

Wonderful. Its a wonderful hotel with great architecture. We covered it as part of our Dubai City tour. We thought of going there for the breakfast, but then we skipped it due to time shortage. But we will definitely go there again.

Birthday treat. FABULOUS, went to The Skyview Lounge as a treat for my sisters birthday. The entrance (especially at Christmas) is a wow, there were six of us myself, my sister and her adult kids and their partners and we all walked in and just stood there taking it all in, really is wonderful the pictures we took do not do it justice. We had booked the drinks package which was great value and mentioned when booking that it was a treat for my sisters birthday and they produced a cake for her. The waiter produced a special cocktail for my nephew as he couldn't decide what to go for and then said they were moving us to a better table and took us to one of the best tables with a wonderful view over Dubai. Was definitely one of our highlights of the trip to Dubai, the Burj Al Arab is one of the most beautiful hotels I have visited and the staff are courteous and polite and if ever back in Dubai would put it on my list of places to visit again.

A luxurious hotel. We had our lunch here on our last day before catching our flight. We also had an opportunity to take numerous photos at the elegant lobby which was still all dressed up for the Holiday Season. The lobby was comfortable because it had ample seating areas for everyone in our tour group. It was interesting that the ladies room had fresh red roses by the faucet and a bottle of Hermes lotion that was ready to use after a hand wash.

Iconic. A bit posh, a bit funny, hyper-dyper luxe. The price is extremely high, it depend on what kind of person you are, but that is no my kind of experience. I wouldn't go back again no matter if I become a CEO or win millions from the lottery.I would rather prefer to do sth else with the money.But the experience was unforgettable with all the exquisite service and private attention. If that is important for you, than that's the place.
Burj Al Arab. Once in a lifetime experience great well worth a visit although expensive a must in Dubai luxurious surroundings, cocktails must try and food is delicious

Overrated but interesting to see. I had lunch in Al Iwan restaurant. Very good buffet but a bit to expensive. It seems to be now a bit old hotel and a little kitschy. But still it is one of dubai's symbols so worth to see it once.

You gotten go!. We booked in for cocktails at the sky bar for 8pm on aSaturday night direct with the hotel which was very easy and efficient. There is aminimum spend of 350 AED pp which was just about what we did spend on two lovely cocktails each. Expensive you betcha, but if you want to visit this icon you will have to either pay to stay to eat or to come to this bar. Given superb service, lovely service, freedom to wander round the public areas we thought it was a really good two hour trip. don't hold out for the view though as its only from one side and not that spectacular. The hotel interior is truly special to look at.

Stunning and beyond. Al iwan- the hotel it's self is just a sight to behold, the lobby, the balconies, the restrooms, the little boutique shops Ali g the corridors are all experiences within themselvesWe dined at the al iwan restaurant and though the service was second to none I wasn't blown away by the cuisine. It was listed as a contemporary style North African/Arabian menu but it was all quite oily and nothing special. However the surroundings and seating and the table was just stunning and made up for the mediocre food.

Stunning. If you have the chance to go inside this stunning hotel, do it, because it is once in a lifetime! A unique 7 stars hotel. Personally I prefer to see it from outside but the Fountain inside it is just great!
Burj Al Arab. A truly breathtaking experience, no matter how many times I see this iconic building.My daughter loved being here.
Very expensive. Burj Al Arab one of Dubai's landmarks. Went for the afternoon tea package with champagne. Very expensive for what you get and I was quite disappointed with the interior.

Magnificent!!!. Somethings are best experienced first hand because words are not enough.Only way to get in to this class of its own hotel if you are not sleeping there is to dine there.We had ultimate high tea at Sahn Eddar!Our hostess was eversmiling.Its quite pricey but I would do it again.There are things which are best felt and this is one of them!

It is really a personal choice if it is worth paying for one of the Icon of Dubai.. Being almost like the logo of Dubai in most travel magazine, one is lured to enter into this very expensive venue. Therefore, I booked a breakfast at Junsui in order to be able to enter the hotel. It is pricey, food quality is just average, service is quite good. I'm trying to give feedback to the hotel and not just the restaurant. As a day visitor I would say it is a good thing to see the interior of the hotel. If it is something worth doing then it is really up to the person who wants to see it. You can view most of the pictures here but paying AED 355 for an average buffet just to get a glimpse of the hotel lobby is basically a personal choice. Some might say it is overprice but for some it is an experience worth paying for just to see the hotel inside. After all, it is one of the symbol of Dubai.
Lovely view. Lovely Beach around the hotel and has lovely view. Beach is at walking distance from the hotel. Good for evening times.
Burj Al Arab Not accessible to the public. We were disappointed that we could not gain access to the Burj Al Arab without having to pay a fortune.

Best Value in Dubai - A Must See/Do. This experience was the best thing about my Dubai trip. The staff is excellent, the food and drinks are of the highest quality, and you absolutely cannot beat the scenery.GO TO TEA HUNGRY. I thought this would be like most fine dining experiences where I leave hungry, but this was far from the case. There is so much food and drink and they even come around with seconds for some of the plates.

Afternoon Tea. This is a seven star hotel, don't think it's seven star service though, there seemed a great many staff walking around looking important, instead of being attentive to their guests. Choices of sandwiches, cakes were ok but not worth the price. Also did not feel the hotel has the 'wow' you dine in the atrium which is overlooking the water park, and having previously visited Las Vegas several times this hotel looks tired.
Very amazing . Beauty of Burj al arab is the infrastructure and services of the hotel. Very luxurious hotel and full on entertainment... Must visit hotel for everyone.

Al Mahara. We booked lunch at the Al Mahara restaurant with our children as it was our first time to Dubai. This is the only way of gaining entry to the hotel and we thought it would be a once in a lifetime experience. It certainly met our expectations! When you approach the hotel you are met by security who check if you have a reservation. A short drive our the bridge takes you to the main entrance of the hotel which has a line of white Rolls Royce's, apparently the hotel's exclusive taxi's, well only the best for the Burj!The entrance hall is extravagant in every way possible, almost like a film set out of James Bond. The staff were lovely, professional and very helpful. We were escorted straight to our table and treated like royalty. The aquarium was situated in the centre of the restaurant and each table placed around it, so everybody gets a great view of the of the sea life, which is totally mesmerising! Service and food impeccable as expected!

Impressive hotel, must see in Dubai. This hotel is a must see during your stay in Dubai and can be easily combine with a visit of Souk Madinat. This place is very close to the Burj Al Arab and also worth visiting. The beach around Burj Al Arab don't have a lot of restaurants and other facilities, for this I can recommend the beach in the Marina area.
Nice View from Public Jomtien beach Dubai. Luxury 5 Star Burj Al-Arab Hotel Dubai, there is one hotel dubai there is facility of Heliped, you can see this hotel from jomtien public beach dubai,
Amazing. Book a dining reservation there so you can see the inside. They won't let you near the hotel with out a reservation.
Wow amazing. Hotel decorated for Christmas absolutely stunning, we had afternoon tea in Saar Eden ambiance amazing, ask for window seat for best view. Once in a lifetime experience

Afternoon Tea. Delightful afternoon spent in the sky view lounge having afternoon tea.It was hazy out which affected the view but the waiter took the time to point out certain landmarks that we could see.The service from start to finish was excellent and we were made to feel very welcome.Afternoon tea was lovely and we took the time to enjoy several different teas, lots of sandwiches (with several top ups) and delicious cakes and pastries. We were not rushed at all and had a lovely relaxing afternoon. Left with a lovely box of chocolates as a gift too. Would recommend this afternoon tea but would like to try brunch their too.
Can see from everywhere. It can be seen from anywhere u go in dubai,it's a landmark of dubai.It can be clearly seen from Jumeriah public beach.

Disappointing . Nice to see and take photos (along with the millions of others taking photos) but you can not get within 1000meters of the actual hotel. You have to stay there to get through the security. I would recommend getting the big bus, red bus or taxi as the tram station is quite a walk especially in the heat. You will then need a taxi or bus to your next destination as nothing is within walking distance.
The view is good. I couldn't go inside because of the sheer volume of tourists. Also, it looks really nice from the outside. So was contended with looking at it from the beach itself.

High Tea - A great way to spend the afternoon. We recently had afternoon tea at the Burj. It was a really nice experience - albeit a bit on the pricey side. The service was great and the staff were really accommodating. It was a great way to finish the holiday.
Wow !!. Went to the Sky-view bar for cocktails. This was an amazing experience. The service was impeccable and the views amazing.

If the word luxury has a shape, this is it. Amazing place, Dubai is full of man made marvels and this is probably the best they could build. There is no free entry, they won't allow so book yourself a table for lunch or tea. I'd strongly recommend lunch. Well deserved 7 stars.

Hotel for the super rich. It's an iconic hotel for the super rich and though we didn't see the place from inside it was quite an experience to see it from outside. The architecture of the building is itself unique and one can get different views from different directions. We would definitely like to have a meal here next time we visit Dubai!

Disappointed in Afternoon Tea. The high tea at Burj Al Arab was a must do on our recent trip to Dubai. Although very pricey we were hoping for a once in a lifetime experience. Unfortunately, it didn't live up to the hype. We arrived at the beautiful hotel which was swarming with other "tourists." We were unable to book the tea at the top because my son was only 17 so we went to the tea on the first floor. We waited to check in and although the building was beautiful it did not feel "exclusive." We checked in and were guided to a table by the window. It took nearly 15 minutes before someone came over to give us a menu and glass of champagne. The service was very slow and nothing more than I would expect at a chain restaurant. I will say the food was delicious but overall the experience was not worth the money. I would not recommend paying the $$ unless you can afford to stay in the hotel as a real guest.
What A Hotel !!! Pure Luxury. Really 7 Star hotel !!! visited there to have food !!! Simply amazing another man made marvel in artificial land created ;)
Don't bother.. Don't bother if you just want to go for a look as they won't let you in unless you have a booking for lunch or afternoon tea.

Book a table if you want to get inside to check out the view. We went to Kite Beach which is lovely, with busier areas with kids but quieter areas too. Places for food/drinks. Just a shame the infrastructure is a bit of a let down in Dubai.. Obviously the beach will be a tourist attraction and people will need to change, especially in such a conservative country. Surprising then that there are only 2 ladies toilet cubicles and signs saying use the showers on the actual beach and please don't use the toilet to get changed.. No signage telling you where to privately freshen up or change (there are sets of 1 male & 1 female changing cubic, every couple of hundred meters on the beach). Dirty toilets with no soap, no loo roll, 1 snoozing attendant who was fast asleep with her feet up. Her purpose I have no idea... What's the point of living in such an expensive place when it's set up is so rubbish.. I prefer Singapore which is a millions times better in terms of planning and facilitiesWe walked down the beach to the BAA but the Guards won't let you in unless you have a reservation in the hotel. Will have to book a table in the bar and go back to check out the view. Horrendously busy so no taxies to flag, we walked to the Souk nearby and tried to get a cab there. They have no taxi queue system so that's also a bit of a nightmare with people pushing and shoving when a taxi pulled up. We ended up eating inside at the Cafe Rouge which was ok and booking an Uber

dissappointed in our tour. We just tour the hotel for a 7 star hotel they treat there visitors that may stay there not well. we paid 200.00 US to tour the hotel and wine, they basically bring you the back door because if there are any celebrity's there they don't want to bugging them (in fact they make you sign a waiver saying if you do see anyone famous no pictures) up the elevator show you a room which is nice very bold colours very Arabic, then to an off the beaten path lounge with a view of course have one glass of wine and your out. Save your money don't take the tour take your 200 bucks sit on the beach have something to eat 3 glasses of wine and look at it from afar much nicer.
It's the Al Arab - what can you say?. Great brunch experience - pricey, but good. The hotel its self OTT decor wise, it is the Burj Al Arab!

A beautiful building. One of the tallest, it is just one of examples of excellent architecture. Burj means Tower in Arabic. Most of the tourist buses just stop on the beach as one can get a good view. Entry is not allowed unless there are reservations.The beach near the Burj is clean and nice to sit for a while.

Luxury redefined. A seven star luxury hotel for the super rich!! It is a place which one cannot but admire. A must see during one's visit to Dubai. Alas, only the privileged few can get the opportunity to go inside. Lesser mortals have to be content with view from outside.

A visual delight. We only viewed this attraction, several times, from the tour bus. However, the guide information and the history of some of the celebrities that used it as a backdrop was fascinating
Valentines Date. My Husband dated me here last Valentines Day, it was such a lovely place indeed however it cost you much.

Amazing architecture worth a visit day & night. A must see up close. We visited the public beach during the day and a had dinner at a nearby hotel at night and then drinks at a rooftop bar overlooking the Burj, spectacular at every angle!

Burj Al Arab Hotel & Fine Dining has a unique shape so amazing from far view.. I made my reservation for dining from home. I love their unique construction which even from far away you can admire it. It's worth the name of a 7 star Hotel & Dining. On the rooftop there is a helicopter landing which a famous tennis star landed there.You must take a taxi , limousine to get there, there is no public transportation . Security will check your Reservation paper from outside before the entrance. A service counter is at present on all floors. Right when entered you will see the beautiful gold coloured columns , blue & white painted rooms which ranged from their website as from 14,000 to 28,000 US$/ night. Huge tanks of all kinds of fish are on both sides of the walls. Floors with expensive restaurants vary from different countries..The elevators face the sea will zip you up to the floor with reservations. The services are great of course. Souvenir shops are also available. Anyway, it's worth a visit.
Burj Al Arab. Only 7 star hotel in the world. It's very exclusive and has it's own noghr club for hotel guest. You can fly in if you have a helicopter as it has it's own helipad.
Still my favorite in Dubai. Many new hotels have come to the ever changing Dubai scene, but I stay true to Burj Al Arab, it will always be my favorite place to stay

Burj Al Arab: Afternoon Tea at the Skyview Bar. The afternoon tea was expensive, but the view and the quality of food and beverages justifies the price. The bar itself is also very beautiful. Make sure you visit the bathrooms because of Hermes hand lotion and perfume. Overall, a wonderful experience you should do once! The only bad part of the whole experience is the unfriendly staff in the lobby, especially the male salesperson at the souvenir shop who would not greet us, even after we greeted him in English and in Arabic.

Awesome. We went for brunch on Boxing Day. Amazing experience with the family and one of the best buffets I ever went to. First class service at a first class price, but worth every cent. It was also my birthday and the made a really special effort.

Beautifully Set, Beautifully Executed. Came for the day with my parents who currently have a membership to the attached country club. While all of that was very nice, I was more interested in the building itself. The engineering and overall execution is only surpassed by that at the Burj Khalifa, but why stop there? The staff was very friendly and helpful. Check it out!
its just nice thats it. if you are one of dan bilzerian relatives so go and enjoy it otherwise dont waste your time cuz nobody even pay attention or listen to you
Amazing Hotel, DPauls. Excellent Location, amazing hotel. I am in love with Dubai. Everyone should visit this City. Thanks for making my tour wonderful.

Came Here for High Tea. My wife and I came here during a cruise ship excursion for high tea. The hotel itself is as lavish as one would expect, and you are allowed to take photos. The tea service itself was okay. Only one tea selection (or coffee) along with finger sandwiches, scones (with jam or clotted cream), and some small pastries. My wife is from London and a high tea aficionado, so I can say we have had much better in terms of selection, but the atmosphere and service were both very good.

Spectacular to visit. Decided to celebrate 30th Birthday in the sky bar here. Service was fantastic, it would of been nice to have a window table for the duration but they were able to shuffle us towards the end of our evening. For a bar i think evening entertainment could of been a little better but thats very much personal opinion. Its suits everyone of all adult ages I suppose and definitely worth a visit if its on your bucket list.

Touch of luxury a must try. Seven star property is located in right on the beach and wow , you will never regret visiting there adding the luxury feeling to your memories. If you want to visit always require a reservation. You have to make an reservation in advance and the best and most economical way to enjoy it is going for a high tea. Enjoy !

Bucket list stuff. I have eaten in the Asian- Junsui restaurant and the restaurant at the top called Al Muntaha. Both were excellent and very enjoyable. Al Muntaha is better for lunch if you want a view. Went there for a wedding anniversary dinner and because it was dark out all we saw was our reflection in the windows. Lunch is great for having a incredible view. The brunch is kind of pricey but your selections are what you are paying for. Lobster, crab legs, caviar and so on. Have not stayed there but have visited the rooms of friends who were. Each room is two floors. Very cool.

Iconic Image of Dubai. You can't go to Dubai and not see this hotel. You'll be stopped at the gate, but hey, shoot your photos anyway. Only guests are allowed inside the gate. $3K per night in a 7 Star hotel, you get the picture... Take a short cab ride from the nearest metro stop.

Great experience. I had a brunch in the hotel. It is a grat experince to see. The view is excellent. All the decoration from inside is a bit too much but in a interesting way. Brunch is good quality but not the best one I ever have even though certainly the most expensive.

Hotel looks amazing from outside! . I was informed by my fiancee she was taking me for afternoon tea.. The hotel sent out a Mercedes G Wagon to pick us up...so much security...Inside I was expecting 21st century decor. Something out of this world...Errr sadly no...Why people spend thousands to stay there I don't know.Afternoon tea. Drinks were fine...food was too salty..we weren't the only 1's complaining..When I found out the price for 1 person to eat there...it be cheaper to do a weeks shopping at Asda Tesco and have money left to fill up your car..go to the pub...and have a meal...
Spectacular unique building. Probably the most photographed building in Dubai and well worth a visit. Also visited the public beach and had a snack at the fruit restaurant. Well worth visiting.
Stunning food. Many to chose from with in the hotel , I recommend the sky view as the best for me right at the top but extremely expansive
The Sail. This is a truly amazing building. I didn't go inside however to see it from the beach or even Madinat Jumeirah is pretty awesome!

WOW ... This is truly deserving of its 7*. As amazing on the inside as it is on the outside. Dubai's iconic building is home to several restaurants, and an atrium to have an amazing afternoon tea to compete with the very best.
I cant add my thoughts on the hotel-side of things as it is just slightly outside my pay-bracket!!!
A Must-Visit Hotel. Amazing scene and great food. make a reservation, and enjoy high tea in the afternoon, sitting next to the window towards the ocean.

Worlds only 7 stars Hotel. The best I have seen the interior and exterior of the Hotel is the best among the rest. Located in beach of Jumeirah. Luxury service all staff are hospitable. Parking is not a problem Valley parking is FREE of cost. Restaurant inside is so great.

Disappointing. We came here for afternoon tea 9 years ago to celebrate my partner's birthday. It was magical. Chilled Champagne, beautifully-made sandwiches, scones and clotted cream served by delightful, polite staff. All enjoyed from a window seat overlooking the turquoise Persian Gulf.This time, though, the experience didn't come up to expectations which was a shame because it was a 'special' birthday for her. Despite booking well ahead of the day, requesting a window table, and receiving an email from the hotel with an assurance that they would "do their utmost to make this occasion special and memorable", we were shown to an inside table with restricted views.The sandwiches were bland and we sensed that the staff were simply going through the motions. Unlike our previous visit when we sat and savoured the experience we left as soon as we could and almost felt hurried out by the hotel staff.Maybe this is one of those things best done once and once only.

More than just a hotel. . Not actually stayed there but have been lucky enough to have the full guided tour. What a place, the bars, restaurants and suites are to die for. However so are the prices The colour scheme for each floor is exquisite. The huge fish tanks as you go up the initial escalator are superb as is the fountain in the middle of the hotel that blasts water up near the top every few minutes. What amazes me is that you can stand within 3 or 4 metres of it and not get wet. I have been to many hotels in Dubai having been there numerous times over the last 13 years and this is by far the most lavish. One word of warning: they have a dress code for guests who are not staying at the hotel. Wear shorts or tee shirts no matter how expensive and you won't get across the bridge.
Nothing too see. No idea to go see this one, you can see it kilometres away much better, stupid to take a taxi and go look at it. Don't understand why everybody gives 4 & 5 balls for it.

Beautiful place to visit must not miss the opportunity
:). Very beautiful mosque made with one of the finest stones and art work lovely water around the mosque must take a veil or big scarf to cover yourself, if not not need to worry you will be given one at the beginning of mosque but you MUST take your passport as they take it for security when giving you the abaya.This is one of the most beautiful mosque I've visited so far and very big to walk around, it's in ABU DHABI about approx 2 - 1/2 hours drive from Dubai.

The BEST hotel in the world. I wouldn't want to stay anywhere else - I am always made to feel at home here and treated so well. The staff are amazing and really make the hotel what it is. I am honoured to have met them all and share some amazing experiences with them.
The food service was not good. Did not fgind it exceptional as it is made out to be. the food service was not good did not get moneys worth

A spinnaker risng from the sea. The Burg El Arab looks lije a large billowing spinnaker rising from the sea when seen from the beach. The best place to see it is from the Juemrai hotels complex, five hotels along the beach belonging to the same group. Seen from the sea, it rises as a giant cross. I did not have a chance to see it from inside.
