The view from the top is either the distant view of the impressive skyline of the financial dustrict , or the sea, or unfortunately the construction of the extension of the canal. We staid at the jumerai beach hotel for one night and we love the hotel with a great view of the Burg el arab from each room, as well as the fact we could walk in the uniterrupted gardens of the hotel complex along the beach, still looking at thr Burg along the way. If you have kids, the entrance to the water park is included in the price of the Jumrtai beach hotel. And it is a lot of fun.

Awesome. Brunch.
Booked in advance.
Need to!
5 star? No. Deffo better.
Not possible to compare with anywhere else I've ever visited in the world.
Sumptuous.
Amazing food.
Excellent service.
Amazing views.
Exquisite.
But - book it up....
Good landmark . Didn't actually go inside the building as we didn't make any reservation but the building itself looks unique and is a must see.

Breath taking...thanks to Dominique M.. Our friends had gone there few days before and recommended we had to go. So we went the day we were leaving Dubai actually. And in addition to the food being super good! Dominique made it quite an experience. He was very nice, personal with us, fun and at the same time still kept it professional. From the way he poured our wine to the way he served us our meal was just classy. I will definitely visit this restaurant when next I visit. Shout out to Dominiq!! Hopefully you will be the head of the restaurant by that time as your talent and skills cannot be put in a box, it is for you to build up on, expand and continue to use it to influence and make people's experience a memorable one just like you did for my friends and myself.

An Iconic Building. Build next to the Beach, easily accessible to residents of the Jumeirah Group of Hotels. We rode a buggy for about 5-10 mins from Jumeirah Medinat Hotel.This Icon is a bit over sold....other than it standing along the beach, & housing a Hotel, try taking a few good pieces of photos home.
Amazing!. Breath-taking architecture, amazing interiors. We went for afternoon tea at BAA Al Muntaha. Terrific. A go-to on your visit to Dubai.

Beautiful!!! As simple as that!. We couldn't stay at the hotel but we went there for the diner at the japanese restaurant. This gave us the posibility to be inside the hotel, it is a must when visiting Dubai. The construction is amazing. The japanese restaurant is great the menu is delicious and the service is really good. Anyway my husband prefers the option of "afternoon tea" and the atrium. Sooo take a chance and enjoy, totally worthed!
Once in a lifetime experience. I had to take the family to the restaurant under water. Expensive, but once in a life time experence
stationary sailing boat. looks and shape and location looks like a sailing boat and its beautiful and around the area theres even a free wifi thats fun

Awesome place, lovely construction. We saw this attraction/ hotel from outside at Jumeirah beach. Its a good tourist spot. You can book a table well in advance if you would like to have a tea or dinner.I would suggest few online sites like Groupon, or Yall banana do do it and you can save lot of AEDs

Amazing Hotel. Unfortunately, we didn't stay at the hotel but we certainly spent a lot of time looking at it. Sat on the beach and just looked way up. This hotel is priced quite high and as a middle class family of 4 we weren't able to afford their prices. But looking at the bridge and then trying to see the very top to see the helicopter pad and tennis courts were alot of fun. But you had to look way up.....
Work of Art. A visit to see the hotel is well worth in, it's a stop on the Big Bus Dubai Beach Tour, the beach alongside is open to the pic lib as well.

SEVEN is the Number to Remember Here.. 7 Star hotel which is beyond spectacular! We had afternoon Tea at the Skyview Restaurant, boy it was pricey! At $167.00 I felt a little slighted. The delicate sandwiches and sweets that they served were ok but didn't live up to what I would have thought was 7-star level. the Lychee sorbet was great! Aside from that and the view nothing else really stood out. the hotel was a marvel but they will not allow you to float around the hotel. Its to your destination and back out to the lobby. Tight security. Unless you are dining at one of the 12 restaurants or staying there, you cannot get on the premises.

Gold gold and no words to describe . Now I know why is the only seven star hotel in the world. Inside is possible to find the most famous stores covered by gold. I entered there because I went in a cafe named Skyview, located on the 27th floor

Afternoon tea. Visited the burj Al Arab for my birthday last week for afternoon tea at the sky view bar and it was amazing!! It's 620 dirhams per person so about £120 each which is a lot for afternoon tea however it is so worth it. we went for the 4pm booking as this way you can see the sunset. One tip is that you should get there at least 30 minutes beforehand and let the receptionist at skyview know you have arrived. Then she will write your name down and you can go and take pictures in the opulent lobby before you go back to the waiting area. It's first come first serve so this will mean you will get a window seat as you'll be taken up first. I don't see the point in not having the window seats especially if you're paying so much, It starts with a glass of champagne along with some dates which were lovely. We then had a Duck and foie gras pie, followed by finger sandwiches, sorbet, and then cakes and scones. You can ask for more sandwiches if you'd like. The food is gorgeous and does fill you up for the whole day. You can have as many hot drinks as you'd like and the tea menu is quite extensive. Views are stunning and they even give you a rose and box of chocolates as a gift. I was also given a cake because it was my birthday. The washroom even had Hermes products that you could use.The staff were lovely and took lots of pictures when we asked.I thought there would be a strict dress code, so we dressed nicely in dresses and heels etc however saw some people in flip flops. this is a must do when in Dubai!!

Breathtaking View. I went to a business conference and It was at the top floor. There was an amazing view from there all over dubai you can see from there. When it comes to staff they were nice and polite. Mostly they are very professional. There is no complain about their food. It was delicious I swear every bit of it.

Disappointed in High tea. Was at Burj Al Arab for High tea. Lot of money and hype about nothing. Been to better High tea's. Only reason to go would be to see the lobby and into the hotel. Nice view of Jumeirah Beach and hotel.

A wonderful afternoon tea experience!!!. I have admired this building/landmark for many years as it is the icon of Dubai......always wanting to go an have a nose!! I had the opportunity to visit my friends in Dubai recently so grabbed the opportunity to book afternoon tea here. There are 2 places in the hotel where you can have it - the Skyview Bar or Sahn Eddar. The difference is that one is obviously much higher in the building and the views are better and the other is above the lobby area. I attempted to book the Skyview Bar option but this was fully booked and therefore went for the Sahn Eddar option. I have to say that from start to finish I thoroughly enjoyed it. The service was impeccable....the 7 courses were varied and delicious.....oh not forgetting the glass of champers at the start!.....you can have refills of teas/coffees throughout your visit. The view from the Sahn Eddar is also lovely - overlooking the entrance, the beach and the impressive Jumeira Beach Hotel. The cost is £110 each which I know sounds a lot - but let's face it - you're not going to do it every day! - I loved it and would highly recommend doing it if you are in Dubai!....I actually want to go and do it again....
Like a tall ship in the ocean. Beautiful piece of architectural design which I like very much. But it looks very small from far. Classy look from outside and was told its even more luxurious inside

Height of Richness. I had been with my friends recently to celebrate my friend's birthday party.We booked the table online. We got the table booking about 8.00AM.No one can enter the fantastic and richest hotel without permission. We were warm welcomed by the hotel staffs.They were courteous and caring. We were given arabic coffee and dates. We waited in the reception to get our turn to go up by the escalator to our restaurant . The waiting period was really enjoying moment because in and around us beautiful natural flowers were found decorated with colourful look and fragarance. While going up in the escalator, we can enjoy the marvellous water fountains and fantastic decorated wall by the side of us. Wow....Then we went to our restaurant and we had our breakfast. There also we were taken care of by the supervisor and the serving staffs very well. First time we ate the foods served in silver platters and silver spoons. We can never forget in our life. Then we enjoyed the dancing fountains in the same floor.Ofcourse we visited the skybar and the hotel rooms outside the corridors. We visited the washrooms .Even the water pipes were gold plated I believe. Me and my friends will never forget the visit to Burj Al Arab. When we came out of the hotel,we could see and take photographs of world's costliest cars like Rolls Royce . This hotel is Iconic symbol of Dubai I feel. Though the booking is expensive, it is worth spending our time and money because it is an experience---the height of richness. I would recommend all to take a visit .Thanks to UAE government and the ruler of Dubai.

Great Icon. Burj Al Arab was one of the best sight seeing spot in Jumeirah Dubai. The magnificent view from the beach and at the front road was spectacular. Staying at the hotel was too expensive and was totally luxurious! Restaurant was expensive too but perfect for one time experience of a lifetime! Early booking is advised to get a good rate (AED 3k per night). You'll never complete your Dubai experience without passing to this iconic and famous hotel in the UAE.

Dinner in Burj Al arab. We had a great time dining here, we really loved the whole experience. The place is very stunning and the crew are very hospitable. The Atrium is very attractive, this so called 7 star hotel, the interior is aesthetically done to perfection.
The food is really great, this is a must try experience.

AMAZING FOOD. We were luck enough to have been taken to lunch by a client. A three course buffet, with food from around the world. The food and service was absolutely amazing. From what I understand, this is the cheapest and easiest way to get to see the hotel, which we thoroughly enjoyed.

Very good security, but with beautiful beach.. This hotel is very exclusive hotel. Without booking or appointment, you can't enter the hotel lobby. Some gatekeepers are so severe for strangers. After reaching the lobby, you can enjoy the marvelous Arabian style furnitures and golden decoration. The room is Arabian, so you feel king mood. That creates the gorgeous trip for you. My favorite beach is there in Dubai.

Go if you have time and a clearly defined purpose. Interesting Architecture, Old Interiors. Would have loved to visit the sky bar that looks so cool from down below, but not allowed with a little child. We tried the breakfast at the lobby which we found very average.

Undeniable Dubai. There's no escaping the BAA, it's a beautiful landmark that dominates the beach skyline. It's also a must do if you're visiting the city - there's no denying that it's high on the visitor's list. There's something very special about whizzing over the bridge after telling the gate guy your reservation number. BUT the decor is not to everyone's tastes (very garish) and drinks or afternoon tea in the Sky Bar are eye-waterngly expensive. I"ve done it twice and that was enough.
Amazing!!. Visited this place from the outside of the hotel and it was really looking wonderful. A 7 star hotel in the world and it is the first.
TOTAL LUXURY. Was privileged to be at this place and could see the rooms. Expensive but total luxury. Very neat and clean and one time experience to be there!!

Sky view birthday surprise with hubby. Firstly I would like to start off with saying thank you to Ronetham (I do apologise if I've spelt her name incorrectly ) for making it a special evening for my husband and I. My hubby had surprised me with the sky view bar at the burj al Arab and upon arrival we were greeted by Ronetham. She was so friendly, funny and polite from the offset and made us feel so welcomed . She took the time to converse with us and the waiters Hussain And Roshem were equally helpful and made conversation . My hubby had surprised me with a birthday cake and the staff brought the cake and a rose over, they offered to take a picture for us and allowed us to walk around when it was quiet to see the spectacular views. It was an amazing experience and one I won't forget.
What an experience. Went here for afternoon tea out of this world ,food just kept coming and pots of tea and pots of cream they were small pots but we had 9 mmmm

7 star hotel. Everywhere you look there is gold. The butons from the elevators are made from solid gold. They have a 20k iphone for sale made from gold. The fountain from the entrance interesting. There is a lot of security, you can't come near for a photo if you aren't staying here or a reservation in one of the restaurants. There is one aquarium type and another on the last floor.

Burj al Arab. Great place with amazing sky bar and beautiful private beach. This hotel you cant miss while your holiday in Dubai. Even just to see it is an amazing experiance. I strongly reccomend this place.

Afternoon Tea With a View. I went with a friend for this several course tea experience at the top of the hotel in its bar. We had excellent views of the city and over the water. Over the several courses we tried many teas and excellent finger food. I can highly recommend the experience despite the price. You get in the hotel and see the main lobby and can walk around. There is shopping if the prices don't knock you over. The service throughout the hotel including eating is excellent. It is an amazing experience and great way to spend the afternoon while watching the sunset. There are two services each afternoon. This rates as one of the best experiences I have had during my many visits to Dubai.

Tacky. Very tacky interior! Maybe the Chinese decorator and the local arabs dig into that stuff. I wouldn't stay there if it was my own choice. Just average restaurants and the same indian-philipino service throughout the hotel. Employ some more European staff with a character and then you can say you're different or better than other dubai hotels.
amazing tower near beach. I completely suggest it.an amazing architecture.you should spend 1 day for this tower and other place near borj alarab

It's another world. We didn't get inside so you can only see it from the entrance next to Wadi park. On Jumeirah beach you can also see the building very well. But on these places you can take good photos of it.

Good experience in the hotel . My partner surprised me with a booking at the Burj Al Arab for dinner! The decor was very impressive and so was our table! This was located next to the beautiful aquarium! The waiters were very accommodating, maybe a little too accommodating and assisted you to the toilets and back. The food was well presented and delicious. Towards the end of the meal we decided to take some pictures next to the beautiful decorated Xmas tree. The reception staff reluctantly took our picture and rushed us out quite quickly then we were assisted into the Lexus to take us home. The taxi driver was extremely rude, had no idea where he was going and on a number of occasions shouted back at us when we tried to explain the hotels location! He then handed us his phone to find the location and stopped the car on the motorway to find cluster p. As a taxi driver for Burj Al Arab, this is extremely uncalled for and unacceptable. The amount was more than double what we paid to get there and the experience ruined the night

50th birthday treat. Loved the Burj Al Arab! Afternoon tea was delicious and plentiful!!! Loved my box of chocolates, my birthday cake and my rose! Views were spectacular (despite me not liking heights)! Thank you

Special Afternoon Tea in Dubai. If you want to visit the Burj Al Arab luxury Hotel in Dubai without staying overnight one option is to enjoy their famous Afternoon Tea. We had ours in the fancy lobby area. There is also tea served at the Sky Bar with a view. The tea and the related servings were of course fine and enough to replace a dinner. The atmosphere was also something special. The lobby is really worth seeing although bit fantasy style. There was a harpist playing creating a comfortable environment. Also the service was excellent and in-line with the aristocratic feeling you easily get in a place liike this. Recommended to people enjoying the small special moments in life. The only drawback is the price. Please note that an invitation, which can be got by booking beforehand, is a must.

A must visit. This place i call it the Dubai icon . It is a seven stars hotel where every part in this iconic place is in a high and exclusive quality.HAVE you ever had a lust to be exclusively pampered.

Absolutely fantastic afternoon tea experience. We booked afternoon tea here at 4pm, which was great as we saw the sun set and Dubai light up. The service was fantastic as was the tea, cakes and sandwiches. One of our party was lactose intolerant, which I forgot to mention on the booking, this was no problem, they adjusted the menu to suit . The Burj Al Arab is fantastic inside abs well worth booking something to be able to visit. Thank you for such a lovely afternoon
Tip top attraction. Did not find this attraction too easy to get to but possibly should not have attempted by Metro, it looked close but was not! Lovely beach and Waterpark close by

One of the most attractive buildings in Dubai!. You must have heard and seen a lots about Burj Al Arab on media, I must say you need to visit it at least once! You can only enter the Burj if you have booked in to stay or booked a restaurant. I heard their high tea and brunches are good too. I have been to dine there several times with family and friends and each time it has been a great experience! An expensive place but with royalty experience!! Recently there's a lot of building work going around Jumeirah, so I would advise you to check the place before making any booking by calling the information help line during your stay in Dubai!
fantastic. It is an absolute amazing hotel.remember to book you can not just walk in, it is also pricey.definitely worth seeing

Great to photograph!. Of course this property is not accessible to the general public without reservations, but you can take a photo at the checkpoint. Here's what we did. We went to the nearby Jumeirah Hotel and went to their bar on the 24th floor, which opens at 6pm. From there you have the most excellent views of the Burj Al Arab and the Dubai skyline at night. Drinks at the bar start at $45 AED ($12 US), well worth it for the views.

Hotel of a lifetime . This is without doubt the best hotel experience ever . From arrival to check in within suite to introductions with personalButler and staff and bookings for restaurants it was simply first class. Highly recommend the culinary flight experience with wine pairing - magical - also skybar is amazing as is private beach - nothing too much trouble felt relaxed, cared for and welcomed regardless of your finances everyone should visit this place at least once in their lifetime - I plan on doing so at least twice

Tea at the Skyview bar. My friend and I went to tea to celebrate my birthday. We were lucky enough to get one of the tables at the end with a wonderful view of Dubai and the Arabian Gulf. The food was good and the service was excellent. It is expensive, but worth doing at least once.

Spectacular to see - tough to go inside. Obviously this is one of the major Dubai sites but be prepared if you want to go inside you must have a lunch, dinner or tea reservation. The cheapest was a tea reservation but it was still about $100/person (you may want to confirm that). There's a great market/high end souk (souk Madinat) right next door where you can sit outside at a restaurant with a great view of the structure. You can take the metro and then catch the tram (I don't remember the names of the stations but it's not hard to find out).

What an experience. What an experience we had for afternoon tea at the burj 7 courses worth every penny for what we received and the service what an amazing hotel lots going on seemed very busy all the time. The views out at the beach . It's a must .

Worth seeing even from just outside, going inside not worth the expense, catch a ferry for best view. Before the Burj Khalifer was built, this was the iconic building of Dubai, and for those who appreciate beauty more than size, still is the iconic building itvwas meant to be. It unfortunately does itself much tourist harm by making the price of going up it, even relative to the expensive price of Burj Khalifer (see our seperate review), ridiculously expensive. In the absence of a public viewing platform, the only way is to pay a ridiculous AUD233 per person for a 7 course afternoon tea in their sky cafe. Don't fall for the cheaper afternoon tea in their other cafe - it's on the ground floor in the lobby, access to some of which is free!The view from the Burj Al Arab is priceless for its proximity to The Palm development. Othervthan seeing it from the air, you won't see the shape of the palm from anywhere else unfortunately. Worth the high price? We didn't think so.So the remaining challenge is to find the best spot from which to get a good view & photo of the beautiful exterior of the building. Whilecwe don't know if we found the best spots, we found a couple of good ones:* Riding the monorail up the stem of the Palm to the Atlantis resort gives you a good view, but only brief as there are highrise buildings blocking the view as you go along* An excellent view and photo opportunity can be had from the beach-end of Jumeira Madanat (or similar, meaning the Mall).* Another good view is obtained by catching the RTA ferry from Pier 7 of Dubai Marina. They do a run at 11am, 3pm & 5pm which goes outside the marina and either around the outside of The Palm or under the bridge linking the Palm to the mainland if seas are rough. Either way, the 60-75min trip offers a good view of the building from the water.(If this review has been helpful, please click the helpful button)

Eclipsed by Other "Bests. Nice to see, but it shouldn't be at the top of the list. The beach is nice, but strangely feels like Long Beach, CA - low rise, tony buildings you could see anywhere. See Burj Khalifah first.
Good breakfast place. Generous breakfast in the spatious lobby. Recommended both for business and private meetings. Book well ahead.

A most amazing, fabulous piece of architecture. An awesome and amazing hotel, I loved it. As you approach it on its little promontory it is a glorious sight, utterly beautiful. Inside is beautifully designed, with a huge tropical fish tank and a giant atrium leading up to the roof. Awesome. Our suite was huge with fantastic views. Decorated in Lapis blue and gold, it felt a little like being in Tutankhamen's tomb but was very comfortable. The full size Hermes toiletries were a great touch (and you get to keep them!) Restaurant downstairs great but the roof/sky bar was very packed, mainly with outsiders so those staying at the hotel couldn't get a good seat - that was a let down. The only one. The adjoining waterpark with free entry for guests was amazing for the kids.

Luxury on the outside. I was expecting a lot inside after seeing it for many years from outside. It has a great look and beautiful outside but nothing much inside. Worth taking photos from outside.I have attended a conference in the ball room on 27th floor, view in the front side is not good from the top but the jumeriah beach view is somewhat okay.

Best restaurant ever been . Had been to the restaurant here ,we didn't have booking at the first instance so the staff at the gate were very helpful made reservation for us at the restaurant for same evening ,awesome place must visit
Beautiful on the outside very tacky on the inside. Overall beautiful on the outside and IKEA tacky on the inside. Good gift shops and restaurants. Great picture taking

Bad service for the fake luxury. Most people call it seven-star hotel, but in my experience, it is less than a five-star hotel. The service was so bad unless you drive a Bentley or Ferrari. When I drove to the lobby area in a "normal" car, no one came to greet you or opened the doors or offered valet services. The valets were just chatting with each other and I had to stand there for five minutes until they walked towards me to give me the valet ticket. This was only the beginning of the overall bad service. I then went to the Skyview Bar on the 27th floor and seated at my reservation for the afternoon tea. The server was nice in the first hour, but he didn't even ask us for the choices of tea until we told him. Later we asked him to take a picture for us and he showed some impatient. We are aware of that the next seating is at 4pm so we are not supposed to stay later than that. But as soon as the time passed 3pm, the server will rush the desserts to the table, even though we are still working on the sandwiches. Immediately after, he brought the last "gift" to the table, which suggested that we should leave soon. By the way, the gift is a box of cheap chocolate and a plastic pen that I didn't even pack into my luggage traveling back. We had not received ANY service afterwards, and the server never stopped at our table to ask if we need anything. He didn't talk to us until I asked for the check, and he didn't even offer coffee at the end. I left the hotel with only disappointment. I'm so glad I chose the suites at Waldorf Astoria at the Palm Jumeirah over the suites at Burj Al Arab. I cannot see or feel the luxury in this place, and many standard five-star hotels in US had done way better than it. I don't know if they treat everyone like this, unless you are wrapped in Louis Vuitton and Hermes, but due to my experience, I will avoid all business with the Jumeirah hotels. Lucky for me to know that before I give them the money for their resorts in the Maldives. I will certainly find another hotel for better services I will receive.
Just Amazing... 7 star hotel. This is another great modern engineering marvel 7 star hotel of the Jumeriah beach....just to enter this hotel you can book a tea/breakfast for 500 Dirhams.
Skywiew. Improbable view! Very nice evening, beautiful decor, impeccable service, soft music. Air conditioning too strong, a bit cold !!!

Great Views. Went for afternoon tea with my fiance and we loved the experience from walking into the hotel up until we left.The views from the sky view bar were breathtaking and the service and 7 course afternoon tea menu was fantastic.Highly recommend it.

Seven Star Super Luxury Hotel.... If there is paradise then Burj Al Arab has to be an integral part of it.. If you ever visit Dubai and don't visit this piece of uber luxury I would say that your trip is incomplete. Everything about this property is simply fantabulous.. From the atrium lobby to the fountain to its restt and bars.. The fleet of Rolls Royce and the views are simply breath taking.. Sky View bar has exquisite views and super premium selection.. Al Mahara the seafood restt is another out of the world experience. . Simply superb and Must Visit Destination..
7 Stars. The only 7 Star hotel on this planet.The hotel is magnificient and a must visit on a trip to Dubai.The surrounding beach is very nice too.

Out of this world. This place is amazing. We went for cocktails and although it is expensive it's a fantastic experience. The hotel is breathtaking inside and out, we were greated at the door and taken to the lift were we went to the sky bar. The staff couldn't have been nicer, the cocktail menu is full of tasty surprises and if there isn't anything that takes your fancy they will make you whatever you like. The views are breathtaking especially at night when the city is lit up.
See from Far... View it from Outside. Beautiful architect. Unique Structure. Indeed the icon of Dubai. But it's very costly to stay and costly to dine.
great decor great food. amazing place, the most beautiful decorations that i have seen in a hotel to dateexcellent food6 star service

Afternoon tea is fantastic. We visited here for afternoon teaIt is on the expensive side, we paid nearly £100 each, but I am sure that you could get it cheaper, if you shopped aroundHowever I felt that it was well worth both the experience of visiting the hotel (as you cannot go inside without being a guest or a reservation) and the food/service, both being first class

Took a tour, enjoyed the grandeur. The look of this hotel always attracted me a lot. It is such a beauty that I couldn't resist visiting the insides of this hotel. I took a breakfast tour of this place with two of my friends. It was quite expensive but I would say it was worth. I wish I could spend a night in this place. As part of that tour we got breakfast and were taken around to see the important places and told the facts. The Grandeur of this place is unbelievable. Just by looking from outside is definitely not enough.They have gold dust used in the lifts and various other parts of the buildings. They have a sky bar at the 27th floor which is worth an amount which signifies the height and floor of that bar. What I am trying to say is that these details are very fascinating to know and live in the tour.

pay for the iconic landmark. In this time I was just a Jumeirah enthusiastic customer, that's it. I have been in many of the beautiful hotels around the world including the Americas, Europe, Africa and Asia; and I've never had such a disappointing experience in all my travel.I spent couple of days with my team. We booked 3 rooms.Upon arrival everything seemed perfect. The property looks very nice, just in the typical Dubai style, but there are a lot of problems.First It is in the middle of a major construction zone, so expect a lot of noise and beeping from trucking all day and especially all night long.The service at the restaurants has been incredibly slow, regardless of being often few or the only customers in the premises. The staff have been very apologetic about it, but they have not really been able to improve.We often waited for 1 hour to be served.Last night onward the entire place seems to turn into a big disco with blasting music up to 3am. The music coming from the bars was so loud that you would think to have speakers in your room!Even if your windows are closed.The staff could not really offer any solution because of no other availability.The hotel seems to be a hang out for prostitutes, they are everywhere. So it is very far from your typical Emirates environment.Overall it was a very disappointing experience! The only affinity to the Burj Al Arab experience is the cost.I certainly would not recommend it to any one especially to a family.If I was His Highness Al Maktoum, I would not associate my good name to this establishment. Marbles, colours and high finishing are not all to be a 7 Stars Hotel.
great hotel. I had booked a high tea in the Burj al Arab. It was expensive, but worth the price. It was a luxurious experience with lots of choice and very kind and professional staff.
Great Wonder. Burj Al Arab is in a class of its own. It is just majestic. It is on the high end in terms of cost but it can be worth it an experience of a lifetime
Costly. Saw it from far. Didn't get an opportunity to go inside. Heard the hotel is very costly even during off season

amazing decor. tried to get in to the skydeck bar but had not booked in advance so instead paid a hefty sum for afternoon drinks and nibbles in the first floor bar .. interesting experience. amazing interior decor
Very beautiful. Its a place that have to see at least one in a lifetime. The only wrong with is that you have to stay there to see it from near or pay 500 AED at least for a dinner.

Expensive but worth it. We went here to see the only 7 star hotel in the world and enjoy drinks at Skyview Bar.It was a wonderful experience. The lobby was beautiful and there was an aquarium by the escalator. We arrived earlier than our reservation and was asked if we wanted to look around or sit and wait. We then went and explored around. It was expensive with a 350 AED minimum spend per person but was definitely worth it to see the hotel. They inform you of this when you make a reservation on the phone so it is not a surprise. Staff were great, helpful and friendly. Enjoyed three cocktails here, all were great and some complimentary snacks.My husband has a dairy allergy and they were still able to cater for him with complimentary snacks and bought him out some berries on ice.The view was amazing and we were very lucky to enjoy the view by the window. Was an amazing experience, would definitely recommend it.

its an amazing building but too many tourists. I went for drinks here and dinner on my birthday but on arrival the hotel lobby was just full of people taking pictures, it just lacked a little of the wow factor i was expecting. The sky bar was very nice but be prepared to pay the 7 star cocktail costs. Dinner was divine in al mahara but again 7 star prices. Overall slightly underwhelmed by the experience.

travelling round dubai. most places we did visit we travelled by taxis they wernt expensive round about 7-10 pounds there is also a tram available just minutes from the hotel.but this area we stayed at so near the beautiful marina and jbr walk and beach best ever .

Culinary Flight at Burj Al Arab. They sure know how to make you feel special there! Very attentive and personal, beautiful place, of course, as to be expected. The bar on top floor has amazing views of the city. The seafood place has a huge aquarium! The dinner lasted about 4 hours.

Worth every penny. We had lunch here and it was such a fantastic experience. The customer service, attention to detail, food and a look around this amazing hotel is a must do in Dubai. Yes it is a costly lunch experience but money well spent for that little taste of luxury.
totally over the top!. went for a look around this stunning hotel, its so amazing. Huge fountains, aquariums by the side of the elevators, massive display for UAE day
Worth every penny!. As the title suggests we were impressed!Luxury service, great food, amazing views, and champagne.It was the perfect afternoon, and we truly felt like VIP guests.
Nice place to visit in the evening. Near to beach, this building stands as a hugh building facing the sea and gives a very good view from beach next to it.

Gorgeous but at least $100 per person. The famous seven star hotel but you can only get in with a reservation to one of the restaurants or lobby bar with a minimum spend of $100 per person during non-peak hours

SkyView Afternoon Tea. Wonderful experience to go into this luxorious hotel for afternoon tea. Arrived early around 12:30 and registered at desk and took some photos. Allowed up the elevator early and managed to get an excellent window seat with view of Jumeriah Beach and Burj Khalifa in the distance.Food was excellent and service very good, expensive but worth the money for a once off.

Expensive, but a fun experience. Since it is difficult to even enter Burj al Arab Hotel if you aren't a guest there, we decided to go to the high tea on the 27th floor. It is quite expensive, about $168 a person, but you get a wonderful view of Dubai and the Palm and the Islands. The tea is quite extensive and tasty and you will definitely be full when you finish. You can shop and look around the hotel when you finish the tea. It is an enjoyable expensive--but it is definitely expensive.

It's OK. As afternoon tea's go, this was a nice experience but for the price and hype, we expected more. Staff and service are good and the food is OK. Location is what you are paying for and if you are an afternoon tea first-timer, you'll enjoy it.

Friday Brunch is amazing!. Went for Brunch on my 40th birthday - were staying at the JBH but even the drive across the bridge is the Burj executive golf buggy was an experience. Once in the hotel you can admire the glory of this hotel. We had Friday Brunch on the top floor and it was amazing. I was slightly worried when I booked as we were a mixed age party ranging from 75 to 9! but I had no need to worry, there was something for everyone. This is no ordinary buffet! you name it they have it, seafood, meat, indian, pasta etc. Contact the hotel in advance an request a window table, they can not guarantee it but if you are lucky to get one like us the views are wonderful. A great experience, not cheap but well worth it
Marvellous. Luxury @ it Peak.... Very attracting places to visit...Great pleasure to visit either day or night trip....

Ohhhhhhhh yesssssssssss!. This hotel is absolutely breath taken! The only way to get a glimpse inside is to either stay there or eat in one of the restaurants. Evening eating there is pricey, but it's worth the splurge just to see all the gold, crystals, marble, etc inside!
Luxury @ its best. Amazingly crazy interiors with world class services portraying professionalism at its best ., Indeed will be a visit of a life time :)
It maybe getting on in years but still a wonderful sight. Went to the 360 bar next door and enjoyed the view immensely. Maybe one day Ill be able to afford to stay here.
icon of dubai. one of the most iconic hotels of Dubai. termed as a 7 star hotel. ultra luxurious but comes at the hefty price.

Nice one.... Another attractin for the visitors in Dubai is the Burj al Arab..
Nicely located and the views from the top restaurant is too good.
A must see place in Dubai

Birthday dinner. Celebrated my wife's birthday along with 2 other couples. We had asian buffet. Twas really a sumptous dinner. Enjoyed the food and the place with friendly staff who even helped us in picture taking. Enjoyed every minute of our exclusive dinner in this 7 star hotel! Our most expensive one to date but it was surely worth it!

expensive. Great service you are made to feel special staff very attentive food highest quality but **** £150 for half bottle of wine that was the cheapest water £11 a bottle it was our 50th wedding anniversary so you splash out glad we will not have a hundredth anniversary Mr Bob

Amazing Hotel. A hotel on a man made island. Excellent architecture. One of the landmarks in Dubai. Visit Al Mahara restaurant at Burj Al Arab and enjoy the finest wine and seafood. Hotel's subtly lit seafood restaurant with an underwater feel thanks to a wall-to-ceiling aquarium
Outstanding!. Beautiful hotel - service is absolutely brilliant! Restaurant at the top looking out over the sea and boats is fantastic. Views and food are brilliant.

Luxury all the way. Well we didn't stay there rooms starts at $4000. A night but you can book with lots of time ahead a light lunch with a glass of champagne and it was amazing experience the 27th floor view and anviance with the perfect pouring of the glass of champagne makes it all worth it and of course you can pay extra and have as many drinks as you like !!!!!
EXCELLENT FOOD AND AMBIENCE. We celebrated a birthday with excellent food ,care and ambiance.We had dinner on the 27th floor restaurant The reception and attention was to perfection.

Top at the top. Luxury at is best from top to bottom best standards I have experience extremely professional and well trained staff astonishing surroundings views attention to details the food excellent was not cheap but brilliant apart from the heat 45 degrees in August
floating ship. The main sight seeing in jumeriah beach, the one of the most loved place by all tourist. The hotel appearance is first class and look like a gijantic ship standing alone
Fabulous. Very Nice to be there it's like dream come true to be there with located in JUMEIRAH BEACH with awesome view from everywhere........

Looks nice from the outside. It's a must stop on the city tour. More than seeing the structure from afar, the bits of information about the place are more interesting. (Like the fact that even the dustbins inside the hotel rooms are lined with gold :O)

Amazing to see .... from afar. Beautiful sight but unless you are staying at the Burj Al Arab or booked prior for a meal, it is not open to the public to look around. Was still great to see albeit from the entrance of White Wadi World!

Most Luxurious in the world indeed..!!. This is a great hotel. No wonder it is considered the most luxurious in the world. The atmosphere inside is great, people courteous and excellent attention. The bar on top is just great..!!

Breath-taking, although a little tacky. So there it is: the most luxurious hotel in the world. It does feel that way from a service perspective. However, the tastefulness is a touch below expectation. The F&B is very special.

World's only 7 starer Hotel!!. We got the view of hotel while we visited Jumeirha Beach.It’s location is superb with helipad at upper section.It was also told that everything which shines in gold color inside of hotel is of actual gold and they also have Gold ATM’s inside to grab out gold.Pure luxury.would surely plan out next time with budget to have a lunch out there in it’s skybar.
A view you will stamp to your memory.. Visible from the JW Marriott hotel's 71st floor, while sipping on a cocktail, take in the view especially at night as traffic trails on the freeways.
Need reservation. To visit this site you need to make a reservation. A seven star hotel check dress requirements when booking your visit.

7 star hotel . I couldn't get chance to go and see it from inside but it's fabulous and Filthy expensive.Common man can't even think of going and staying there.It's base fare per night per room start from 115000.It's nicely made and location is awesome.It's Royal place for Royal people only.Regards, Sunil
truly the most luxurious hotel. it is not only ultra luxurious, but also your every need is efficiently anticipated, including gender specific perfumes
Awesome View. You will not disappoint if you will visit Burj Al Arab . Awesome place and awesome view. and good place for selfie lover :)
Amazing. Enjoyed dinner over there quality of food amazing burj al arab coffee was best and desert banana split was amazing loved

Afternoon tea. Afternoon tea here is a must. You cannot help but feel like a million dollars. The tea itself is great. The sandwiches have a lot of attention and the menu is well thought out. The service is highly personalised and the view is to die for!

Nice, wonderful but expensive. We were in Al Mahara restaurant. This restaurant is in the sea, very nice and impressive. Food is just god, alkohol drinks is very expensive. This place is worth to visite but will see to menu price :) Burj Al Arab I think is one of the nicest building.

Another wow- experience. Fun experience, with this mad luxury twist with all the bentleys and rolls royce cars pulling up outside. Inside the high end luxury continues, with well dressed staff greeting you at the door. It sure is worth the while, but beware of the large groups of tourists who can suddenly appear and take tons of pictures with flashes. :( definitely a little bit of a dealbreaker, as the groups make it quite crowded and 20 people needing their pictures taken in a row... Uggggh
Good view. Burj Al Arab is the pride of dubai. You will love to see this place. Get nice snaps as a back ground.
Afternoon tea. Wirth every dirham with 7 rounds of delicious treats, and spectacular view of the palm and skyline. Worth it just to get in the lobby and experience 7 star luxury.

Magnifique!!!. Everything was so beautiful from outside the shape of it, the entrance, restaurants, special foods, we tried gamile milk, misical fountain, elevator with golden entrance, bar on top of it, only by reservations, Special and unique place.
A must to when in Dubai. Make a pre.booking for the top bar and if you book early, book for when the sun goes down. Check :-)

Tea at the skybar. Booked the 1pm tea at the skybar at the top for my wife 40th birthday, well worth the price as you get 7 courses & champagne to start in the most luxurious setting overlooking the harbour. Top tip get there 20 minutes early and go through to the skybar lift area as they do a first in first up so you will be able to pick your table
Burj Al Arab. Star Hotel situated in Dubai beach with star amenities. Very nice location. Beach is good for sun bath

Best afternoon tea in town. Visited with friends for afternoon tea in the Sky view bar and we were not disappointed the views were great and the food superb and what a hotel the finish inside is beautiful and the staff very friendly
What can you say about a 7 star hotel in the world. Best rooms, best view, best food, best service, awesome staff and a beautiful spacious lobby to sit and chit chat. alot of activities and outlets.

You must visit the bar at the top!. Hubby blagged his way in, we went in a taxi, asked him to wait, then asked if we could go in! It's a lot of money taken from your credit card so you need to get your money's worth, we did and loved it, actually this was the best part of our holiday in Dubai!Take a camera, the views and toilets here are to die for! Xx

Exceptional Brunch. The very best in every course Oysters, fois gras. Desserts to die for, cheeses andeverything between oysters & dessert. Unlimited cold poached lobster. May be the best brunch in the world!Sadly, wine needed for many matches only available after 12 noon.

Dubai highlight. This is one of the most amazing places for afternoon champagne tea. The building is way over the top, fixtures, fittings and food all of the highest quality. Pianist plays whilst you watch the sun go down sipping champagne and enjoying a wide selection of sandwiches and cakes. Bought as a gift so I don't know cost but worth every penny and something I would love to do again

Unique Structure. beautiful structure... good photo could be taken in front of Burj al arab itself .. you can't go into the compound though.....you gotta take pictures from the entrance itself.. the Burj is also situated next to Wadi Wadi Water park....or walk into Madinat Jumeirah whereby you can capture the Burj with a beautiful backdrop... and you can also shop at Madinat Jumeriah..its bit more pricy though ...

Worth a visit even if just for afternoon tea. This is a luxury hotel and you can't just turn up. You must have a booking for one of the restaurants or afternoon tea in the lobby area. The restaurants or afternoon are higher in price than other venues in Dubai but you are paying for a higher class of service and food. Once you have enjoyed your meal you are free to have a nosey around the communal areas and marvel at the opulence of the place.

“Go for the View - but the Food is Great too”. Most beautifully situated on the water-edge, very soothing experience to be with someone in love, its the romantic spot in town, all said , food is fine, and service is serene much to the credit of the mangement, professional staff.

Minimalist from the outside kitch from the inside. We reserved to have breakfast at Burj Al Arab... not really worse it. If you want to see Burj al Arab from the inside many travel tours will take you there. The inside of the hotel is surprising and very different from the outside. Visitors will never mix with the clients as the hotel is restricted for the guests. You can also reserve for the restaurant at the top.
Unic hotel. The most amazing experience! I celebrated my birthday in this majestic and unic hotel, with beautiful winter season decorations which made me feel like I entered a fairy land.

Sheikhly Moments. Once you booked in their rooms you will feel like you are one of the sheikhs and kings in the GCC.
View and architecture is majestic.

Worth a nosey! - but expensive.. The only way to get into the worlds only 7 Star Hotel as a non-guest is to book afternoon tea! @ £100.00 per person...it's not cheap. But for a (VERY!) special occassion well worth it! Try and book in and around sunset...ad allow a few hours there!

A bit too much. We enjoyed our recent stay at Burj-Al Arab however it is not the kind of hospitality we like. The service is not refined and tailormade. Moreover, the furnitures are heavy and we disliked this. The rest was great including food!

Lovely hotel. We went to this hotel when on a tour. We had afternoon Tea there which included a glass of Date We had 8 courses in all which were lovely.The hotel building is lovely inside. It has an aquarium at the escalator and when you look up the rooms are all inside the sails. there are 4 pillars which are made of gold!There was a lovely dancing fountain and designer shops and beautiful décor.

A great 7* experience. Oh how the other half live! Went here for afternoon tea, this hotel oozes opulence & status! The tea high up in the sky view bar was to die for and well worth £110 each for the 7 courses. A must do in Dubai!
Bur Al Arab. I visited Burg Al Arab in 2009 and I loved it, I recommend itto all the visitors who happen to visit Dubai.

Not for all tourists. It is located at marina beach.Most of the tourists view this landmark attraction from outside only. Now-a-days, Burj Al Arab, have introduced a "High Tea" time from 19:00 to 20:00 for tourists @400 AED with sandwiches and sweet cookies.

Cocktails at The Burj. We decided to treat ourselves on our final night of our holiday and were blown away by the scale of this hotel. I have wanted to visit for some time and delighted that we finally managed it.

Really amazing!. The "Tower of the Arabs" with its rivolutionary structure and decor absolutely worths a visit! it has 7 suites, 2 restaurants and a Skybar with an astonishing view of the persian gulf!

Skybar was a waste of time. Probably the most underwhelming experience I have had. Bar tenders who couldn't pour a beer properly, who forgot orders - I mean 7 star - you are joking. The views were limited and the decor strange, glad I have ticked it off the box but there are some amazing places to have drinks in Dubai and this isn't one of them.
good!. i love the place, the food and the staff. i forgot the name of what we ordered but it is really good. :)

This was on my wish list. As I worked in the hotel world, it has been my wish to visit Burj Al Arab for along time, and last September my wish was fulfilled.This is a 7 star hotel, and it does not disappoint.The lobby is very impressive, and from the Shyview Bar where I had a high tea, yousee lovely views of the Palm Island, and other Dubai buildings.I would recommend anyone to visit this hotel and have a high tea.
Dining at its finest. We spent our last evening dining at the Burj Al Arab, had a great meal very worth the -high- price of it!

Lunch at Burj Al Arab in Al Mahara. I had lunch at Al Mahara in the Burj Al Arab on jun 2015. The service was exceptional from arriving to leaving, the staff could not do enough for us.The food was amazing and great advice from staff about various ingredients, very knowledgeable sommelier offering great advice on the wine list. The restaurant itself is beautiful with a giant aquarium in its centre - very romantic.I would highly recommend this restaurant.

Amazing….... Fantastic visit for afternoon tea served in a beautiful room expensive but worth a treat c. £108 each. We then went up to the top bar for Champagne, what a view service was amazing. Minimum spend up there too but if you book early enough then you can have your afternoon tea up there which covered the cost. A real treat…...

Luxary and awe. Wow is the first word i can think of when i first set foot on this lovely place. A luxurious place that will captivate your imagination of how royalty lives and relax. Every room we were ushered and toured will leave you breathless and the view will take the remaining breath away from you. If you want to just relax and unwind go to their lounge and have a coffee or wine and listen to the relaxing music of a live band. If I have money to spend will surely spend it here.
What a view !. Even though I didnt go to the Hotel itself, but the view from Jumeirah beach was breathtaking. The lighting at night is a class apart !

SevenStar Luxury hotel Ship shape. We went to Jumeraih Beach from where one can see this ship shaped luxury hotel.It is a good sightseeing spot.We went there around 11.00am.Good to see & take some snaps with family as a memory.

Burj Al Arab. Was amazed how beautiful is near.I really hope in the future I could visit the inside also.You can get here by dubai hop on hop of bus or taxi. Really nice surroundings next to the hotel. Worth a visit if you get to Dubai.I also had a visits to the shops from Dubai, I get a nice ride with the Camel and make pictures on 52*celsius on the desert.I can say nice memories.

Afternoon tea at the Sky bar. We were bought afternoon tea at the Sky Bar as a gift for our honeymoon. We weren't sure what to expect based on mixed reviews but I can say that it was excellent. We arrived early at the hotel to make sure we got a look around - it is a spectacular building. We were first to be taken into the Sky Bar and were given a table on he corner by the window (best seat!!). As soon as we sat down we were greeted by the lovely members of staff and the menu was explained to us. Then the food started... it was lovely! All the courses we excellent although a little strange to have a dessert type course first before the savoury. The sandwiches were topped up so no chance of going hungry.As it was our honeymoon I was given a rose and we both got a small box of chocolates (everyone got these). It was a lovely experience but over very quickly.

Lunch at Burj Al Arab in Al Mahara - excellent. I had lunch at Al Mahara in the Burj Al Arab on Tues 10th Nov 2015. The service was exceptional from arriving to leaving, the staff could not do enough for us.The food was amazing and great advice from staff about various ingredients, very knowledgeable sommelier offering great advice on the wine list. The restaurant itself is beautiful with a giant aquarium in its centre - very romantic.I would highly recommend this restaurant.

Top class🏝🌇 views✨ & expensive cocktails 🍹. Beautiful city very kind people Burj Al Arab well worth a view take few quid not that cheap but views surroundings are to die for well worth stop by leave kids babysitters though Can see desert & Atlantis palms .

Grandiose hotel. Beautiful to look at, glad we didn't stay here. Instead we booked high tea for 2 3 months in advance and that's something you must do. Dress conservatively. Not much to see if you don't do high tea!
speechless. what a design, colouring. every one must watch it & take a photo for his/her memory from visit Dubai ...its situated near jumirah beach.
Paul. My daughter and I had lunch there and it was fantastic, the service and food were 5 star.Have recommended it to all my friends. Excellent
Fantastic. Once in a lifetime you must visit. Because it is built in such a great way. Arabs usually go for name and fame

Friday Brunch - to die for !!!. Booked this as a surprise for my husband who was 60 whilst we were there - OMG how the other half live. We were greeted like Royalty every step of the way. The food was nothing like I have every tasted before and probably a long time before I do again. My husband was presented with a cake whilst the band played happy birthday. We were both given chocolates and myself a rose. He was so happy with this surprise so well worth the money to me.
Dinner at the Arab. Worth going for cocktails to see the architecture and decoration but the meal was bland with extremely poor service and nowhere to complain.

Iconic Building. No matter what your views of Dubai are this is an amazing building that withstands time. The engineering is very impressive, its a shame they don't emphasis on this more. I would recommend drinks at the Skybar or afternoon tea. BE PREPARED for the Bill! The restaurants are OK! Not worth the costs and there is better within the area.

Probably, the most wonderful hotel in the world. Outstanding architecture inside and outside. The landscape around is great. It's necessary to book a reservation (for the hotel or some of the restaurants) to get in. The access is very restricted. A must-do in Dubai.

Gawdy and exuberant . The only 7 star hotel in the world. But, I'm not a fan.its all about the bling bling bling and money money money.restaurants like al mahara are super expensive, make a huge dent in your pocket and no value for money.
A must see!. The architecture itself is worth the visit, but if you combine it with a brunch seating with the beautiful sea view, you are guaranteed to start your day in a good mood.

Best in Class. A planned visit to the Restaurant at the Top.
Outstanding service, great food and a solid feel of exclusivity.
All in all an experience worth the price
good views from beach. It is not allowed for public to enter the burj without table booking so best is to spend the time at beach and take a photos with burj Arab.
landmark not to be missed. Try to find the opportunity to visit the inside of Burj Al Arab and experience the luxury within, the fountains the designs in gold the view from above, Wow

Amazing design - unique and beautiful. Part of the city tour - a must for all visitors- a beautiful piece of
outstanding architectural design , truly amazing and makes Dubai's skyline magnificent.

Wow!. We visited the Burj Al Arab to participate in their "Culinary Flight" experience where each course of a meal is served in a different restaurant. Casual visitation is not possible at this seven star hotel and if you are not staying or eating there, you will be turned away at the gate. We thoroughly enjoyed the entire experience at this magnificent hotel and structure. What a special treat! Would highly recommend.

Luxury, premium service and innovation at the same place!. Burj Al Arab's international fame is without any doubt well deserved, this is one of those places that look awesome on TV but that you don't fully appreciate until you are there. The 300 meters sail, its original decoration and luxury and the quality of the service are impressive. If you want to visit this resort you need to have a reservation, a good alternative is to have the High Tea at its famous 27th floor restaurant, with an amazing view to the Persian golf, Jumeirah and the Palm It will cost about $180 USD per person, but it will allow you to access the building and experience a bit of its world renowned service. Try to reserve at least o a couple of weeks prior to your visit to the City.

A very expensive afternoon tea. The architecture is very impressive both inside and out. The afternoon tea per person of 560 AED++ Hotel tax ++ is 20%. (approx A$265 per person) only includes 1 glass of champagne. A bottle will cost 1107 AED++ (approx A$437), a glass will cost 60 AED++ (approx A$72). Indeed a very expensive experience, but only done once.

Had breakfast at Burj Al Arab. We made reservations in advance and had a lovely breakfast here. The metro does not go here so we took a taxi. We were able to arrive 1/2 hour early to enter building. Since we were with another couple celebrating a birthday and anniversary, we were served 2 very nice desserts. Nothing was too much for them to do for us. They even brought a chair for us to put our purses on. We watched the prepare a table for the next use and they even ironed the fold wrinkles of the table cloth. The price included 10% service (tip) and 10% tax.

High Tea at Burj Al Arab. What an amazing experience. It is expensive ,but well worth it. The view is spectacular from the High Tea area. Just getting inside and seeing the building was worth the cost for us. The 7 courses won't disappoint. Would do it again on another return trip to Dubai

Afternoon Tea. This was hands down the best part of our trip to UAE. The service was impeccable. We really enjoyed our time at the Burj Al Arab. They were also very accommodating with our touristy antics and offered to take pictures of us so that we could remember the moment.

7 star but quite a hike. I love this Hotel...none other compares in architecture and its iconic stature. Go to a Brunch there...not too cheap but the best deal. If staying there, the rates are best off season ( late Spring, Summer and early fall ). Its quite a drive with tolls if you are just going as a tourist site.

Burg Al Arab - Dubai. We drove to the beach to see this important building in Dubai,considered an iconic structure and a symbol of Dubai till recently when Burg Khalifa took over.the inspiration for the architect to come up with this unique shape is said to be the shape of the local boats which he saw one evening as he was strolling along the beach looking for inspiration. One can actually relate to the shape.It is worth seeing this unique building.It was during sunset we were near this building and it looked even better with the setting sun lighting it up.As the darkness transited the whole area got lit up with colorful lights - another lovely sight,

Amazing architecture. You will never see anything like this and at night the outside lights up with an array of colors. Could not afford to stay there but it was worth the time to go and see the building itself.

Add to bucket list. If you are an adventourous person Burj Al Arab is a place to visit. No words can explain the magnificent of the structure of the building. Just in awww... if you want to treated or splurg a bit.. this is the place to be. From presentation to service and food beverage is 100 out of 10.

Regular Visitor. It is hard to believe this place is 15 years old. Still the best hotel in the world by a country mile. Excepting the technology in the room, which gives away its age. Although even this is now almost classic with its Tardis dashboard like appearance, so does not detract from the splendor. The hotel overlooks a mirage of Jumeirah Group properties, which are constantly being added to and enhanced, so the place always feels like it has something new to offer every time you visit and it really is the jewel in the crown for the hotel chain

High Tea. This place is totally grand. The architecture is amazing, tallest atrium in the world is breathtaking. The service is the best, the host, waiters and waitresses were very attentive and professional. The food was beautiful, as was the live music,especially the harp.

Breathtaking View. For first time visitors to Dubai, its pure excitement. A must do is take the Dubai City Tour. This is organised by most hotels or you can book in advance through e.g godubai.com and get exciting discounts. One of the stops is the Burj AL Arab the 7th Star Hotel. Breath taking view and you can take pictures upclose. On the check list, A must Visit.

Iconic Structure. If you're into architect, then this is a nice place to see. You can also go inside to view the interior, which is simple but impressive. If you don't have time to go in, you can get a photo from many vantage points, especially if your traveling through The Palm.TIP: If you have time to go to the beach, select a beach along Jumeirah Beach Road, so that you may enjoy the view of the Burj Al Arab at the same time.
awesome. So cool to see the sights that I saw in movies....slightly smaller than expected after seeing how big everything else is!!!

$$$$$ Breakfast in 7-star Hotel. Not sure why, but I really wanted to see the inside of the hotel, and the cheapest way to do it was to book breakfast for 350 AED. It was a good breakfast, but they didn't allow me to beyond that mezzanine level. Would have liked to take an elevator to the top for a view, but no way. Not sure it was worth the cost, but ... like the Burj Khalifa, it was an experience.M.

Excellent . Really nice place.We stayed at the public beach.Very impressed by they have a free wifi even at the beach.Clean and safe.The only down fall is that you cannot hire a sun lounger and parasols to protect you from the sun.

A must see, but not necessarily a must do.. Enjoyed afternoon tea in th sky ire lounge. It's a very grand looking place with unique architecture, but as you arrive you don't get the spontaneous welcome and really friendly greeting you will become accustomed to in other hotels in Dubai. Sadly this was very ''English' for me. Nice but the real fine bits let it down.The view from Skyview is wonderful and the afternoon tea was very pleasant, but at over £110 each, it isn't a return venue for us sadly, but glad we did it just to see what all the fuss was bout.
Stunning view from Jumeriah beach. The Hotel looks stunning from beach.Do remember to take nice snaps.No doubt its replica models have become ideal souvenir to shop in Dubai and gift it to friends
Great hotel on its own small island. Awesome look with its small island raised. 3 years to build island and 3 years to build the building. Great colors at night.

Amazing internal Architec. I like this luxury Hotel, Nice entrance walking on the handmade wooden bridge while you are coming from Jumeirah Hotel or by car throw a big long Bridge , Nice music fountain at the first floor while you having a drink at the snack bar. high quality professional service, very comfort , nice staff,

Best Afternoon Tea in Dubai. What a great place to have afternoon team, sitting at the top of the Burj Al Arab looking out over the ocean, cannot be beaten. Service and quality of food and tea selection was exceptional. You might think it a bit pricey but believe me it is certainly worth it

It's 7-star, there's a lot of gold, its posh.... How can you not rate this place 5-stars? Even going into the place will give you that "wow" factor. Being honest, is it for me? Probably not, too much gold, too much pomp, too damned expensive - but that's the market its being aimed at. If's an experience more than anything else. Maybe if my numbers come in one day I'll spend longer here... but I somehow doubt it... I don't like faff... It's one hell of a place though and well worth a visit... just take your credit card!!!

Arabian dreams!. About Burj Al Arab i can say it's beautiful hotel,i wasn't inside but it's nice just when you are very closely to it!was my favourite beach closer to Burj Al Arab lot s of peoples joining the time on the beach into the sea..which it's so warm and clean and salty lots of yachts in the evening..you must visit

Views. Too too much to look at. Sorry but it was just too much.
The beach looked great......
and the water inviting
Dubai fun . Worth watching but very very expensive. Should have made more accessible like Atlantis.... OK for people with big big pocket

Luxury. If your pocket allow do visit the world famous Burj Al Arab hotel. Staying is a luxury option but still you can plan for breakfast/Hi Tea/Lunch/Dinner. You need prior reservation or will not be allowed to enter. It is a must for any visitor.

Reduced waiting time. I was here already 3 years ago and now there is far less waiting time in the queue. It's well organized and you get up quickly.
The price is now 37 euro for the 124th/125th floor, but you have to add much more if you want get higher

Wow view if burj al arab. Burj al arab is very well known 5 star hotel for being luxury elegant, and fantastic hotel and views. This hotel good for leissure tourist and most of business trip as well good to have meetings in this kind of place, also this is romantic place good for couples

Honeymoon afternoon tea. This is wonderful, breathtaking, tasty and uber luxury to a whole new level.....i went for champagne afternoon tea at the skyview bar......definately do this its brilliant..... the mrs got a rose and choclates to take away and 7 courses including hot dishes which exceeded expectations
Amidst the Bay.... The structure stands tall pure white and splendid, there are no words to describe the marvel.. As i said in my earlier reviews on Dubai, they are truly way a head....

WOW. Oh my goodness how the other half live!! Went here for afternoon tea which was absolutely amazing. The service was second to none and the whole experience was a real treat. Just being able to spend some time in this fantastic hotel was brilliant it is so beautiful inside. I would highly recommend afternoon tea, you won't be disappointed.

Stunning piece of work. I've visited the Burj Al Arab twice for breakfast and dinner. A room or restaurant reservation is required to get on the property, but its definitely worth every dime. With a restaurant reservation, we were allowed to roam around afterwards on the same floor, the hotel lobby, and around the hotel outside. The room reservation is very expensive, but meals here will also cost you a good penny. Breakfast at Sahn Eddar was about $125/person, but their was A LOT of food and all sorts of options. The views from where we were seated were amazing...worth every penny. Dinner at Al Muntaha was a so so experience. The food was mediocre and it costs about $230/person depending on what you order. My friend ordered steak and said it was the best steak shes ever had. I ordered salmon and was not informed that it didn't come fully cooked. Later when I discovered it was partially cooked, a staff member came out and apologized and offered to refund some of my money and offered us a free cocktail which was a very nice gesture. The hotel itself is very well made, an exquisite piece of architecture...the hotel and restaurants are definitely worth a visit :)
Nice. Been here with friendsSimply amazing... Very original design.. And sarrounded by a lovely/ clean beach

afternoon tea. an amazing experience, definitely with the money and would suggest you do it :)
the service was wonderful just like the food.
7 Stars. If you go to Dubai, try to drink a nice turkish coffee here. It will set you back around 100 Euros for two people includibg a small snack, vut the experience will make up for it.
Amazing Hotel. . This 6* hotel is a true reflection of Dubai at its best. With its golden interior and stylish sleek look. Expensive but worth the extra $$$
Luxury stay. It was a memorable stay of our life so far. It is very nice and grand. One should try at least once in a life time.

High Tea at new heights. The family enjoyed a traditional high tea with ALL the trimmings presented in a 7 star environment and a view to match.Perhaps only a once in a life time experience it was well worth the memories

Smaller than expected. You can see it from the public beach or the mall it's nice to see the most expensive hotel, however it's pretty much has a building site all around him. And it's smaller than I tought. There was not much of a Wow factor for me.

Dream Building . I always wanted to visit this place since childhood.It is a bit unbelievable when you see it first, by the beach which is so beautiful and amazing view.Very easy to get to via Bus and few minutes walk and you can't miss it. Beach is also next to the hotel is worth going to. In all you haven't seen Dubai if you haven't seen Burj Al Arab, after all this is the face of Dubai.

Overrated and outdated. Advertised as a hotel that rises above all others, but falls short by a distance. The seafood restaurant in the basement is quite spectacular. Otherwise, there are many others in Dubai that have overtook it
Didn't stay but worth a vidit. Came here for cocktails in sky view and meal by the Tank. Could not be more impressed by the scale of impressiveness. A must on your list.

Culinary flight. We visited here last night for our much anticipated 'Culinary Flight' experience as a special treat to round off our first trip to Dubai. We were really surprised by the atmosphere when we entered the hotel, and we were delighted to be able to wander around the public areas and take photographs before heading up in the lift to the Skyview bar on the 27th floor. The culinary flight takes the form of 6 courses (including cocktails and canapés) in 6 different venues within the hotel. Yes, it's ridiculously expensive at over £800 for 2 people including wine pairing and tip, but for us it was a once in a lifetime chance to visit the BAA. Everything about the evening was perfect. The staff were professional yet extremely friendly, with several taking time to stop at our table to chat and genuinely take an interest in us. The food was faultless, fine dining at its best. It was presented beautifully and cooked to perfection. In each restaurant, a basket of bread (prawn crackers in Junsui) was presented along with dips, butter, olive oil etc. Portions were generous and so we had to pace ourselves (and resist the bread!) or we'd have struggled to manage all of the courses. We also opted for the wine pairing with each course, and water and soft drinks were also included. Our only negative comment about the whole evening would be about the smokers lounge situated next to Al Mahara. The smell of the smoke reached in to the restaurant. We are very strong 'anti smoking' and are both quite sensitive to cigarette smoke. It wasn't pleasant, especially walking past on the way in to and out of the restaurant. The whole experience took us 5 1/2 hours from start to finish, but in reality it felt much less than this. Time went very quickly and before we knew it we were enjoying our last course, dessert and coffee in Sahn Eddar. Being presented with a beautiful bunch of roses at the end of the evening was a really lovely touch. The whole evening was such a fantastic experience, I'd definitely recommend it as an extra special treat.

Wow!. We went here for the high tea at the sky lounge, yes its expensive, but worth every penny! the experience is first class all the way, don't think you are going to get a cup of tea a fruit scone and then be turfed out, I was bursting with food after I came out of the sky lounge and there was never any hurry to get rid of us. for a once in a lifetime experience for those of us who are not film stars footballers or Simon Cowell, its worth the visit.

Sky Bar. Wedding Anniversary Afternoon Tea.As expected, service was undeniably the best, the food was amazing, and they even presented us with a token cake as an Anniversary gift. Highly recommended, even if the hotel was a little tired...

A place to visit (one day) in your life. We did not stayed there. Just went to have dinner. But the lobby and shops around are unbelievable. Also the decoration is something that you do not see everyday !
exquisite beauty. a breathtaking experience by just seeing it stand in the middle of ocean. Worth to take a snap and best is to have a coffee though its very costly.
Jannat! Luxe - Marvellous design. Only in Dubai is such a luxurious hotel possible. Everything is beyond imagination. It truly deserves the seven star rating that it gets.

felt very spoilt. a bitpricey but thought wed give it a go just for the experience. as the saying goes you get what you pay for. the food was delicious and pleantyfull. they carry on serving untill youve had enough. tea and coffee in abundance..... i eat gluton free and was amazed at what was on offer. very elegant surroundings and wonderfull views. felt very spoilt.

The kite Beach near the hotel. Nice spot for use Dubai beach , very easy acces from the emirates mall , 15 dhrs by taxi and 20 mns drive only ...nice view to the Burj al Arab ..PS: this hotel is limited acces
VERY NICE. I love that place so much.. we spent 2 days there it was beautifulsuch a good time i spent withy family during my first visit to dubai
Fun Tour. A must see place in Dubai , Seven star hotel at the strategic location.Its alongside beach.Hotel is iconic .
Impressive. Though did not stay here as it is too expensive would definitely like to experience a stay one day, especially in the underwater room

Perfect dinner for a special occasion £470 for 2!. We visited the Burj Al Arab for our wedding anniversary and last night in Dubai. We booked well in advance (2months) and asked for a window table over looking the palm. We got this. We decided to enjoy the taster menu (6courses) which was good value for money. As non drinkers we didn't pick the wine pairing although the this was available. 5 out of the 6 courses were incredible. The cold celery soup course I'm afraid I couldn't stomach.The service was excellent and as it was our anniversary we were given a cake to take away. I also asked for a copy of the menu which was no problem at all, even rolled and tied with a bow to fit in my handbag!Would recommend for a special night, if you're thinking of hiring a Rolls Royce to get to the hotel book it through a local firm and not the hotel, we saved 50%! If you like nice cars this is certainly the place to see them!

luxury defined. The title of world's most luxurious hotel has certainly been well awarded in this hotel. Whilst the opulence borders on complete tackiness, it is the actual building itself which is beautiful, striking and impressive. Without a doubt, stunning architecture. The sky view bar afternoon tea is in my opinion the one thing that travellers to Dubai should definitely do.
7-Star Experience. A unique landmark property that vibrates the 7-star luxury it promises. This was an unforgettable experience and an important part of Dubai you should not miss!

Loved it! . We were lucky enough to have lunch at the Muntaha restaurant and it was lovely. We had initially wanted to do the afternoon tea at Sky Bar but under 21s are not allowed due to UAE laws. The interior of the Burj is wonderful with fountains and an aquarium between ground and first floors, it was certainly a very memorable afternoon.
Drinks. Went there for drinks just because of the environment. Stayed at the hotel just beside soit was convenient as well.
burj al arab. The very architecture is amazing. That too it appears to be springing from the sea. Even the finish gives one side of the structure to appear as a sail.

Below par. Came here for afternoon tea with my husband and three children. It all started promisingly enough. The table was beautiful and the views from the windows lovely. We started with a glass of sparkling grape juice and a white chocolate mousse with strawberries, which was delicious. We asked for water, which didn't come. Sandwiches arrived and underwhelmed us all. Canned tuna anyone? Nothing special - the sort of sandwiches you might make for lunch at home, oh and a soggy choux bun with some smoked salmon. Still no water. We ask again and also ask for some tea. The next course was a meat pie which is difficult to make look elegant. The chef clearly thought so too so didn't bother. The pastry was very good, but the filling (confit duck and fois gras) was repellent. The meat was grainy and sour tasting and there was a bitter red berry in there, I'm guessing cranberry or barberry, but it could have been a redcurrant. Nobody finished it and most of us wished we hadn't started it. Tea arrives, one pot of Assam and one Earl Grey, both lukewarm.
