The hostess passes our table so I tell her the tea is cold and could we have some hot. She tells me the tea is not cold. I assure her that it is. She tells me it is only cold because I have put a splash of milk in it. It is my fault the tea is cold. As we're paying over £500 for this I am beginning to find the whole experience a little irritating, but as my husband is not keen on scenes of any kind I take a bit of a walk and he secures fresh, hot tea. When I return there are scones, but not very good ones. These dense shiny discs had been made in a mixer that had been left to run far too long. The gluten had fully developed by the time they were shaped and then any hint of a rise was negated by an incredibly heavy egg wash. They were tough and gluey, but would have made a very strong supporting wall. Still no water. Two ladies wander into the tea taking area. They have clearly been spending money as they are carrying bags bearing the hotel logo. They want a peek at the view, but are shoo-ed away by a waiter, so we ask them to join us for a few minutes as we didn't think a look out of a window was much of a crime. They stay for a few minutes, are unimpressed by the scones and then leave before the swat team arrives. We decide to do the same and ask for the promised cakes, pastries and petit fours to be packed for us to take away. The box of cakes is handed to my husband along with the eye watering bill and, finally the water we asked for at the beginning. We gratefully leave. That evening we plan a sugary supper, but opening the box we discover cakes, for two people, no pastries and no petit four. We went out for a sharwarma instead, five chicken sharwarmas for under £10, all hot, fresh and totally delicious. My children shared the cakes for pudding and assured us they were very good and I have no reason to disbelieve them. This whole experience was made all the more irritating by the fact that my husband and I had tea at The Burj on a previous visit to the Gulf and the food was excellent. This was to be a treat for our children, but just ended up a massive disappointment and a triumph of style over substance.

Breakfast at the Burj. To me the Burj al Arab is iconic and the symbol of Dubai ....in the same way that the Sydney opera house is of Sydney Australia. The building is just as stunning inside. Dubai is ridiculously expensive and the Burj al Arab is no less so...but if you do go , I would recommend seeing the inside of the Burj as well as the outside. We had breakfast there and it was an amazing experience

You are transported to Heaven..but you return alive... The hotel is beyond words.. this is what we call fantasy world.. every bit of it, from Skywalk to Al Mahara Restaurant to the lifts and Bars is exquisite.. this is a must visit if you are in Dubai.. If you can't afford to stay, go for Breakfast, evening tea or Dinner. You may then be able to see most of the hotel
GREAT PLACE. I saw this is the one place near to sea u can see the top of bur al arab u feel your on middle of sea its amazing feeling

23rd to 29th oct. Very nice and very cute looking building which is out of reach of a common man so I do not have much of attraction to this building. never the less the commendable job by the team who has build it.. worth seeing as an attraction point in a tour.

Wow, just wow. My daughter treated me to afternoon tea here and wow. This hotel is an experience in itself. The service is first class, the dress code is smart and the seven course afternoon tea in the sky view restaurant is to die for. It might be on the expensive side 620 dirham a head, but is worth every penny

Gorgeous and Unique Building. We visited the restaurants and bar inside. The service was truly exceptional from every member of the staff here. I would recommend at least seeing and dining at the hotel.

diffrent expirence. if you really want to have unforgettable time this the hotel to stay one of the best hotels in dubai if is not the best the room is duplex room large room and livingroom best view full sea view they meet all the small detils is from the time you arrive you check in insid your room arabic coffe is little expinsive if you keep cheacking the hotel web sometime they have very good offers

Exquisite dinner, stunning restaurant, amazing service.. We had dinner at the Al Mahara restaurant - a once in a lifetime, beautiful meal in the most stunning surroundings. We had a table by the huge underwater aquarium with exotic fish swimming past inches from your table. The service was impeccable and the food was amazing. Our hostess gave us a tour of the private dining rooms. Overall a very special experience.
Fantastic place to see in Dubai. It is one of the symbols of Dubai, not easy to access unless you reserve a suite or for a restaurant .

Worth a return trip. This was our second visit and this time we paid out for the expensive package. Last year we did not realise there was an even higher observation deck. The higher deck was exclusive. You received a coffee, dates, a soft drink and one small cake/sweet. You also had a guide for a short time. Am I glad we did it? Yes. Was it value for money? Probably not but you only live once.

Below Expectation. I visit Burj Al Arab twice or thrice so far. I like the look from outside but interior from inside does not impress me much.. except fountain next to elevators I does not see any fancy or extravagant to say WOW.. Instead I like the Atlantis much with big aquarium and nice Interior...
Lavish and indulgent. Luxury at its refined best. This is an iconic landmark of the world and is well worth the cost of visit.
Extravagant. have only seen pictures of the interiors and it's like an extravagant dream. Another iconic building of Dubai, when you view it from outside.
Better to watch it from the outside. Personally, I find the interior is too "old-styled". The entire building looks a lot better & stylish from the outside.

Gorgeous landmark hotel, but hard to visit.... Unfortunately (or fortunately, depending on who you are), you can't just walk into the Burj al Arab. You need to have either a hotel reservation or dining reservation to get in. We chose to visit by making reservations at Sky Bar. The bar is pretty cool and you get access to the inside of the building, but there is a 350 AED ($100 USD) minimum per person to get a reservation. That would seem like a lot, but that gets you 2-3 drinks and a tiny appetizer.

An expensive photo!. The most expensive hotel in the world but you can't go near it unless you pre booked a meal here or are a guest. The journey here is a struggle a it's a 20 mins walk from the metro so needs a taxi ride. You come, take a selfie with it behind you then leave. We tied it in with a visit to the nearby souq mall to make the journey worthwhile.
There is nothing to see!. As a tourist when we visit, we won't get an entry into the hotel premises. So, obviously there is nothing to see from outside. This is like any other super structures.
one of a kind restaurant. the place where everyone wants to be invited to..went there on a invitation by a client..the place is literally out of this world

Magnificent!. Good to visit, but a tad expensive. For those who want to experience this, you can opt for a hi tea which is available at 4pm. You need to book it prior online to make sure you do not miss out. Also, please note that there is a certain formal dress code which needs to be adhered to.

Disappointing. The Burj Al Arab protects its Illusion of mystery by refusing entry to the public, so after travelling there specifically to see it we were kept at the gate. Watch the TV programme and save the taxi fare.

This was one night only and what a night it was.. A dream came true for us after travelling through Europe. One night in The Burj Al Arab. All other accommodation faded into the background as we were driven to a security checkpoint then welcomed at the door by multiple staff, with butler service to our room, delicious dates and hot towels. The room was exquisite, golden, blue and opulent, like a luxury town house, 2 levels with chandelier, fit for royalty. Even the television said welcome. Magnificent views of The Arabian Gulf. That moving staircase, whisking us upwards with a whole wall of swimming fish as a back drop. In the bar, drinks were horrendously expensive but to be savored. The mirrored ceiling over the bed, watching that view and the shadow of the structure superimposed outside in the water, the Hermes toiletries in full size bottles were ours to take home. The huge bathroom all in gold and robes to relax in at our own work station. Suffering jet lag, I succumbed to sleep. However my husband stayed up all night - to not miss one single moment. There is nothing to fault, not even the price. It was worth every minute. Spectacular in every way.

I went to the beach just to get a picture. Its not as impressive as I though it would be. It seems smaller. Well, it is one of the "older" hotels now. The newer hotels are all bigger and grander, but it is still unique.

The Best Meal of My Life. Booked a Meal for our wedding Anniversary and from the moment we arrived were made to feel special - we were seated right next to the Fish Tank and were literally waited on hand and Foot - The Food was glorious and the service was exceptional - yes it was expensive but to me worth every single penny. Would go again at the drop of a hat - loved it

My favorite hotel). Well, I was passing by this hotel for Canoeing(in the hotel I was not), but I know that there are very nice and there is a tennis court at the top of the hotel. Soon we will go there with my family, but for now that's all I can tell)

Beautiful building. We didnt go in the Al Arab unfortunately as when we were in Dubai they didnt have any avaliability for the tea for two in the sky bar. We did go to have a look at it though from a far and it is definately worth seeing. Beautiful building.I would recommend visiting a bar called 360 which is in the Jumeriah Beach hotel, you have a great view of the Al Arab from there. We went at sunset and it was gorgeous.
High Tea at the Burj. Had to see the Burj Al Arab best way to do it afternoon High Tea food, service and atmosphere was definitely more than 5 star take some friends and enjoy the fantastic view
Burj Al Arab. It was great picturesque view to walk along the beach with Burj Al Arab in the background. It is a pity we couldn't spend much in the daylight but overall it was good.
went to see the building. I went to look at the building but I didn't actually go inside. looks cool in photos on the beach and seems popular.

Afternoon tea in the Skyview bar is a must. We had afternoon tea in the Skyview bar and it was excellent. If you arrive early you can wander round the lobby and the first floor with its shops and wonderful aquariums. Tea is served promptly and you will not be allowed access to the restaurant early. It is worth going to the first floor and letting them know you are here, as they take people up in the lift in the order of arrival and you stand a better chance of gaining a seat by the window. We booked the later sitting as it gives you a chance to see the views by day and night, as well as the hotel at both times.Food is excellent and it includes a glass of champagne. Refills are expensive however you can drink all the tea and coffee you want. If it is a special occasion let them know as they bring out an extra treat. The views of the Jumeirah beach hotel I found were the best however you can wander around and rake pictures.Do dress up as it us a 7 star hotel and it is afternoon tea however not everyone does which I was surprised at. Yes the price us expensive however this is one of those 'must do' things

Amazing Buffet. We visited one evening having been recommended by a resident to try the buffet, it was absolutely amazing. Obviously because of the superb location and very high quality of the food and the service, it is not cheap but then the best never is. The range of food available is truly mind boggling, covering most eastern and western tastes, all cooked in front of you by individual chefs.

Stunning. Booked a package for afternoon tea here then Burj Khalifa. This is elegance at its best. There are signs saying no cameras but everyone was taking photos. There was a dress code of no shorts and gents had to wear covered in shoes. Afternoon tea consisted of 6 or 7 courses with a champagne option.
must see. went by on big bus tours. Its an iconic landmark. Only way to get in is to reserve a meal. Didnt need to figured it would cost an arm and leg at least. Just needed to see it.
On top of the world. Must to see!!. Of course. Not but so mutch to see, while this is most higher building. Please make reservation for appointmant

Amazing experience. We have booked this as our wedding present as we recently got married and it was an amazing experience which I would definitely do again in future. We booked through the Jumeirah website. Everything went smoothly. The hotel inside is amazing. The food was great and you could have unlimited amount of soft drinks, coffee etc. The view is just amazing try to get a table by the window. The service was excellent as you would expect. Over a great experience, highly recommended.

Unsurpassed !. We had the afternoon tea option. Yes it's expensive some $800 aud for 4. However , superb in every way and wouldn't have missed it for anything. Who cares how much it was - I'll never do it again. You MUST try it once !

A HEAD SHAKING GOB SMACKING PLACE TO STAY. Unless you have zillions, the Burj is not the place for the majority of Trip Advisor readers. However, Qantas had a brilliant deal going with thousands of points credited, so it just had to be!!Trying to get into the place is an effort in itself. Fortunately my Emirates limo glided up and was admitted with me and my battered suitcase in toe.Having just flown from SFO, I was not the picture of satorial elegance, but the 10 or so middle Eastern beauties who greeted me did not show their distain openly. My personal butlers whisked me to my suite on the 30th floor and showed me the ropes.If this is heaven, let me go there now! It is certainly not understated luxury, the luxury hits you from all angles, from the marble staircase from the living quarters to your sleeping quarters, to the spa, the electronic everything, and the BED!!! OMG what a bed.I loved the restaurants, especially Al Maraha where you share your meal with a thousand exotic fish surrounding you. and Al Muntaha, the bar at the top of the hotel.The cost is for a night is about the same as a round the world ticket......but the experience is incredible.It surely is one of the two things to do before you die....and I did it!!
Sightseeing in Dubai. I recommend the city tour. It is excellent to get the full picture of the city - amazing! The tour was very professional and the guide imparted lots of interesting information.
What a beauty on a virgin beach. An excellent piece of Architecture , constructed on a beach with crystal clear water , must visit and preferably have a swim and sun bath .
No words can describe the beauty!. this hotel speaks for itself by being the only 7 star in the world, we visited for the buffet restaurant and the sky bar which had beautiful views.

WOW. We visited here as part of an organised tour. Friends had recommended the afternoon tea atop the building. When we saw the tour which included dinner at The Burj, we thought we would have a similar experience to our friends. Not so. Firstly, high up at night you can't see much at all. Dinner was buffet style, good quality and quantity but no view to speak of. The room we were in had small windows and you had to leave your seat to see out. The bathroom was worth a visit in itself. So luxurious! There was no opportunity to look around, we were kept moving in and out of the dining room. Having said that, the building itself is beautiful and breathtaking. Definitely worth a visit.

1 night stay for my girlfriends 50 birthday oops 40 lol. As they say the most luxurious hotel in the world,lived up to all it's expectations.We were picked up from the jumeriah beach hotel with a private butler,presented flowers and a cool flannel due to the heat.Transferred us to the hotel with a stop on the way for photos,well appreciated.On arrival we were met by a fellow Scottish lassie from Aberdeen whom gave us a tour of the hotel,such a great lassie.She then showed us to our room and on entering three guys with guitars singing happy birthday,that was so emotional,romantic and naturally a moment never to forget.Each floor has he or she private receptionist and butler.We decided to have in room service for our meal,fantasticBar areas and buffet breakfast not 5 class,6 class.We saved for two years for this experience and will save for another 2 years to once again hopefully savour this experience,WORLD CLASS .
very nice view from the beach. wonderful construction in the sea. it's looking like a huge boat in the sea; it's a necessary place to visit in Dubai;

Beautiful sail like building.... At some 300 meters this is a tall beautiful building, looks like a large sail, it is attractive and seductive, once inside it is a bit over the top but I suppose this is its attraction. The eateries here are disappointing but you don't come for the food but the building.

High tea. High tea excellent .pricey but good way to have a look at the 7 star hotel.extra drinks very costly.food excellent and plentiful. Great view although some heat haze. A special treat in Dubai

Amazing hotel!. Entry without a prior booking (room or restaurant) is not possible, so don't just decide to drop in for lunch or dinner. They are right on the beach and have amazing view of the sea and Palm Jumeirah. We had gone there for High Tea, which was quite a varied spread of fruits, sandwiches, scones, tea cakes, bakeries and other delights. Must visit for atleast one meal, even if you are not staying here.
Crazy architecture. The place to be! very special architecture building! we couldn't go inside, but when we've been on the beach, we saw everything from there, is very nice to see that place!

Bathed in Luxury At The 7 * Property. When it comes to Dubai, there are umpteen luxury hubs and hotels to choose from. However, the Burj Al Arab Hotel is a stellar stop-over if you do not mind spending some extra bucks for a day. The drinks--the wines especially-- are pretty expensive but the food and service is awesome. The staffs are friendly and the concierge is very assistive. The rooms are spacious and luxuriously decorated.

Mezmorizing. 1 of its own Burj Al Arab . unique design in whole world that is the reason Dubai is famous for. Situated on sea shore for which beauty comes out automatically. its a mst visit place to get a pic clicked if u are in dubai
Woaw Experiance. The architecture is out of this world, the location, the views, the staff and the serenity of the hotel. it is just incredible.

Amazing but improve needed. The hotel is completely amazing, a jewel of architecture. And the stuff was really nice. But in a hotel of this level you expect more, order a Gin Tonic and notice that they don't know how to make it. In a 7 stars hotel like this one that is something as amazing as his structure. I could teach the stuff in little time at least to be at the level of the hotel.
High Tea. It was a great experience amazing food, hotel and views. A bit pricey but worth the visit. Extra alcoholic drinks were very overpriced

Unbelievably Amazing. To just see Burj Al Arab takes your breath away but to go there is even better ... we seen it in the day and the night and we didn't want to take our eyes off of it ... Seeing it is like feeling the beauty
7 star hotel. it is really a miss if someone couldn't able to see it. have a breakfast with a pre booked time... a nice one
Nice but not amazing as I thought it would be. Nice hotel but not amazing interesting story about the cross facing the sea that the architect built into the building

Lunch at the Burj. To celebrate our silver wedding anniversary we had a visit to the Burj for lunch. Obviously as a 7* hotel the reception, service and food was amazing. Drinks were obviously expensive with a small glass of nice wine £18 each.Staff were amazing and one misunderstood the date of my birthday and presumed that was the reason for the visit so hurriedly arranged a presentation cake before we departed which was a nice gesture.Top of the range attraction but expensive.
Great Experience with great views and Gold settings. Vist the Burj el Arab and you fell like you are in a Luxury Hotel with great views of the sea and gold aplications in a lot of places.

Viewed from the beach. As we had 6 weeks of travel ahead of us after our stop in Dubai we just couldn't afford to go for afternoon tea! Had his been put only holiday I would've allowed for it! Maybe next time! I got lots of awesome photos from the beach and the gate though! If you can afford it then go for it!

7 Star. When you are in Burj, you consider yourself lucky, You don't need to talk on its Ambience, coz you are surrounded by the World's Best, this place is class apart with international standards of luxury. You can spend time around just watching the decor. Restaurants are too good within and expensive too. Don't expect anything Cheaper.

Luxury Beauty. One of the finest hotels , this is a MUST try if you are in Dubai . It needs a reservation always , the place is very expensive but on a buject like 300 dollars you can get the luxury dinning experience.

GOOD HOTEL. I had a great experience in this hotel and really everyone should come here once in a life time. The hotel located in a beautiful beach area which gives good memories. I enjoyed the stay there and really it was a memorable trip.
World most beautiful building. I just say WOW ... what a beautiful building and what a restaurant, if you will not goto burj al arab then your dubai trip will incomplete

Afternoon tea.. Me and my wife visited on the 20/10/15 around 1300hrs. When we arrived we were met by a stunning entrance with lots of staff ready to welcome you. We were directed and led to the sky view bar for afternoon tea. They staff were 1st class very attentive but not in your face. Our waiter explained all the courses and was happy to change some of the selections as my wife does not like fish. Each coarse was better than the next.The view from the lounge was stunning. If you book for 1sh you will get a table by the window. When afternoon tea was finished we walked around the bar taking some photos and again the staff were very helpfull and made you feel relaxed. The toilets were were stunning with gold plate everywhere. They supplied Hermes deodorant to freshen up with. The foyer had a select selection of shops out of my price range but nice to look around. A perfect treat.

Superb view and service. We attended to the Skybar with my wife during our stay in Dubai, as soon as we entered we were welcomed like celebrities once at the lobby you can wonder around the fountains and have a look of the luxury shops. Once a the bar they offered us a table were we couldn't see much but 2 mins later the moved us to a table with a wonderful view of the city. The cherry on top was a fireworks displayed just next to the hotel. Definitely 100% advisable

ONCE IN A LIFETIME. We had high tea here and although it is expensive it is one of the few ways you can get inside this world landmark. There is heavy security to get in and you have to book well in advance but the architecture is stunning, views to die for and food delicious. You are treated like royalty and there is no way you could eat every delicious morsel. A must do!!!

High Tea. Relatively expensive but in our view good value. A magnificent building the views from the Skyview Bar are spectacular. The staff, the service, the quality of the High Tea were each excellent.

Not as good as it thinks it is!. We had two stays at this hotel during the Summer months, some good points some not so good.The rooms, they are definitely big enough and have plenty of gadgets. Large and comfortable beds and quality linen, Hermes toiletries if that pleases you but I prefer a good bar of carbolic soap.A semi free minibar, TV in the lounge and bedroom, computer and printer and a mirror on the bedroom ceiling to help you get a bird's eye view of yourself and companion?Each hotel floor has a dedicate concierge and butlers to cater for your every need. They seemed a little bit too eager for my liking and continually requested info on our plans. Maybe some guests will appreciate this type of suffocating service and consider it is being treat like Royalty but it got on my nerves. I prefer to go about my own business without being recognised and prefer a more relaxed service.Room hygiene is outstanding, the staff are discreet and flexible. Food, you have a few restaurants to pick from. Al Maha, Al Iwan, Junsui and Bab Al Yam. All have good service but the food can be hit and miss. I hate buffets! You cannot get hot food from a receptacle with a candle underneath it!Junsui is interesting, informative and well staffed.The sky view bar is worth a visit for a beer or two, a coffee in the lobby area is relaxing too.One big problem is the amount of day trippers The hotel is among the top tourist sites in Dubai. That says a lot about Dubai?You are slowed down by a constant stream of visitors taking photos, videos and selfies that have no thought about any one else's privacy. I think the hotel has the odd rule about videoing/photography inside but it must be impossible to enforce in such a popular tourist site. I suppose if was paying upwards of £100 for a scone and a cup of tea and wearing my most sartorial outfit I'd want a photo to prove it too! Getting in and out of the hotel is can be difficult when having to get through a photo shoot. you know when it feels impolite to walk in front of someone taking a family photo, its like that most of the day and night. Customer Questionnaires, why are they given out so often? Staff ask you to fill them in sometimes after every event. No doubt they want a good personal highlighting and they are concerned about any negativity. Come on, be yourselfI found some staff to be far too servile, too nervous and not relaxed. The hotel staff are people, not machines and definitely not minions. Let's see a bit of personality from the staff. The hotel is good but it lacks that touch of personality that other good hotels have.My wife loved the Burj Al Arab. I liked it, I would have liked it more if the staff actually looked like they enjoyed being there too,,,,

"Evening Cocktails". This was an experience we had missed on our last trip to Dubai. This time we ensured we booked 3 months ahead to get in and with a window view. The building is a beautiful piece of architecture with so much gold emblazoned all around the internal area's.The lovely piano music upstairs set the scene before we were guided to the lift area for the floor of the restaurant and cocktail area (these are both separated). The evening view over the city was well worth the experience, the cocktail list extremely comprehensive and delicacies very nice.

Super Amazing. The Burj Al Arab must be the most photographed building in the world today. It has an excellent Sky View Bar on the 27th which is highly recommended for High Tea. It starts at 4pm and goes on till 6:30pm. One can take lots of pictures of the bay area, the palm, the sunset from above and also enjoy the 7 course High Tea which costs 600AED-Expensive but worth the experience as all emplyees are always smiling, engaging and it is a very beautiful sight to remember.

Expensive but Good Value. Did the afternoon tea at the Burj Al Arab. Although I found it expensive it was actually good value and very enjoyable. Very good views from the Hotel and in my view much better value than the Burj Khalifa

7* Afternoon Tea. When booking our trip to Dubai, afternoon tea at the Burj al Arab was the number one.. ok.. maybe two.. on our list of things to do (it was our honeymoon!) and we cannot say it disappointed.The hotel is elaborate, break taking and... quite surreal. Who knew you could jazz up gold by putting more gold on it? Then put it on a gold pedestal. And throw gold at is. Extravagant isn't the word.The afternoon tea experience was exceptional. Considering the large intake at tea time we never felt rushed, the food was deliciously filling and the staff were outstanding- it was a phenomenal experience that I would recommend to anybody and we'll certainly be returning. I recommend arriving 20-30 minutes before your booking to walk around the hotel and check in at the restaurant concierge promptly. You will then be called into an elevator from this list in groups of approx 8. Remember, those who rush into the elevator to beat you to it will, in fact, be the last out of the elevator. Take it slow, play it cool and you'll be first in line to the best table in a breeze.

AFTERNOON TEA. STUNNING7 course extravaganza over 4 hours - amazing well worth the money for the food and experience , we booked for 6 and one with food allergies He had a whole seperate 7 courses meticulously planned to his allergies and dietary requirementsgreat service Date wine bubbly is lovely what a treat

The best hotel ever. the location , the architecture , the ambience , the staff and the service levels -everything is seven star rated . the building itself is magnificient and being in the sea itself gives it a royal touch...

Not enough star ratings to Rate this hotel - Truly World class. To date the most exquisite hotel I've ever stayed at . Best attention to detail I've seenA bit intimidating upon arrival but this is quickly taken away by the superb staff and team.Very well done to Isabel from the Concierge and Paul the Floor Butler - I now understand how Royalty are treated thanks to your outstanding service and welcoming personalities .Dining options and quality beyond belief - room service go an extra mile by recommending the best suit to your palate A must for any traveler
Not to be missed. Great experience - 452 meters in the air - the elevator takes about 20 seconds and is an attraction in itself. Great attraction.

Excellent hotel , luxury but a little bit old. I was invited to spend one day there. We were visiting ll the rooms, including the amazing Royal suite of 750 square meters. Insite the room , you have 2 fllors, amazing views, and a lot of rooms and luxury furniture, with incredible paintings. You also have a bed with an engine, so you can turn it in cercles. The restaurant at the top offer a very good food, even they put gold in the meat. Is not cheap at all but is worth it. I would say for being 7 stars, they should give more facilities.
برج العرب. Reception was excellent, Room was fantastic to be expected with the room rate paid. Nice buggy ride to the beach site. Check in time at 3pm was not good.

High Tea with a View. My sister came here on holiday and as she prefers a more sedate experience I took her to the Champagne Tea in the Skyview Bar. I had lived in Dubai for about 4 years and this was my first experience of the Burj, despite hearing so much about it.The Hotel decor is not to my taste (far too blingy!) but the Skyview was an amazing experience!The food was excellent and the whole experience was amazing! My only comment was that it felt a bit of a production line as I felt they wanted to clear for the next sitting but we weren't pushed out and left to wander around in peace & quiet.

This is a must see sight, in Duabi. We had High Tea, and it is worth it! A wonderful experience.. We booked in advance (please do that, other wise it is so busy you will be disappointed) it does seem a bit expensive at the outset, but you do get value for money. As a package you will be picked up (and dropped off) at your hotel, you will be treated like royalty, and you even get a gift for your visit. Excellent views, and a lovely afternoon experience.
Not for common people. Lovely place. You must be dressed formally. People can western world can even walk in with rags and beach slippers.
Lunch. Had a once in a life time lunch at this 7 star hotel . The food was unbelievable , the service was outstanding , a definite treat for a very special occasion .

One and only 7 star property. The hotel is extra ordinary. It has its own beach with its own helipad which is also the highest tennis stadium. It also has an underwater restaurant which gives you an option to chose the fish from underwater and the same fish would be caught in front of you and served. Good ambience and property. Its unique architecture keeps you attracted. Very good place to visit in Dubai. This used to be and is still a symbol of Dubai. Must visit.

Go for the High Tea @ the Skyviewbar !. If you get the chance to have a high tea at the skyviewbar - Go For It !Every girl deserves to be treated like a princess, and i felt like one!When I entered the Burj (you can only enter with a reservation!) I caught myself staring at the interior for a while. The people at the reception were very friendly and helped me within a few seconds.The view is amazing and the fingerfood (so much, i didn't even manage to try everything, too bad !!) is delicious ! It was a very relaxing and delightful afternoon.Do not forget to make a reservation in time! You can't just go there and hope for the best, they won't let you enter the domain :-)Enjoy !
overrated. this hotel is ok to look in, but if you are not staying the only way you can get in is to book the most over rated and expensive resturants in Dubai

Afternoon tea - fabulous experience. The only way anyone can get near the Burj Al Arab is through a reservation at one of their restaurants - guests are screened at the Welcome Gate to ensure they have a valid reservation. Afternoon tea a the Sahn Eddar, their signature international lounge, was a unique experience: the opulent surroundings, the magnificent food and attentive service. This was one of our highlights in Dubai and well worth the expense. By far the best afternoon tea I've ever had!

Must see. I love the burj al Arab architecture , quite timeless it is often in many of my photographs while in Dubai, the interior decor is quite tacky to me and I would not return to the Friday brunch which was disappointing ( great views!) but I will always love to admire it from afar

AL MAHARA Restaurant @ Burj Al Arab. Well of course awesome place with all the fishes around you the service was good few mistakes happened while service, I went there with family the love seafood I am vegetarian but there is one dish on the menu which is vegetarian and that was including alcohol!!! I don't drink but lucky me it was dry day due Islamic New Year so no serving of alcohol or cooking with it. But still 2-3 side dishes were vegetarian. But to honest the main vegetarian dish I ordered was anything but tasty, the only reason I ate it is I felt sorry for the money wasted US 80 for this dish!!! For seafood lover I assume it is a paradise my family enjoyed there food very much. I am sure I will not go there again

Another cross off the bucket list that left everlasting memories. Wow, Wow, Wow. The extravagance and opulence of this place was astounding. I would have to say that per sqm in the 2level suite, it would have to be best bang for your buck around, by the time you take into account the attentive service, the included toiletries and all and sundry, it was definitely worth it. Not for everyone and not within everyone's budget but gives a taste to how the other half live and well within reach of most. I will be back.

High Tea at Burj Al Arab. The entry says it all, firstly you have to get in .. along the causeway .. by invitation or appointment only. We had a booking for high tea, way up high. The entrance, with water features was stunning enough, then the glass elevator and then the most magnificent view, luckily for us, it was a clear day. The high tea, although not cheap, was absolutely wonderful. We were served French Champagne to start with, then your selection of (unlimited) fine tea (or coffee), followed by a magnificent stand (in the shape of the Burj Al Arab) full of small sandwiches, mini rolls, slices, cake and scones. This was then followed by a desert plate. The place, the view, the service, the food, the experience - AMAZING!. A must do in Dubai!
Another amazing 7star. all as described by tourist guide all found in front of us....it is true testimony of world's best man created structure.

Amazing!. We enjoyed a sumptuous breakfast here. A good spread, with virtually everything you could wish for. What's not to like. To top it off, the plushness of the room and the views afterwards were truly stunning.
Amzing and Luxarious. The view from outside is amazing, in the night it is more amazing, it like it in night most with the lighting.

wow, what an experience!!. This hotel is another level!!!! The foyer entrance is a bit of a sightseeing tour, however when you're past this and on your way to your room, from there it is another experience altogether. We were checked in, in the comfort of our room, however neither my husband or I were interested in checking in as we were too busy looking at our magnificent room!! Over two floors these rooms have everything you need, from a Mac computer to dressing room and pillow menu. Our two personal butlers were fantastic - discreet yet always on hand, bringing us afternoon nibbles that we didnt know we wanted until they arrived!! I ripped a dress before arriving and when enquired about the in-house tailor, she was in our room within half an hour, whisking my dress away to mend, then hand delivering it back the following morning, fixed, washed and pressed! fantastic service! We had afternoon tea in the sky bar which was also fantastic with views across the sea and to the burj khalifa. The hotel pool is being refurbished which was a bit inconvenient, but understand it needs doing and was informed it is hoping to be completed by dec15 and they are also working on adding a beach around the hotel island, which they currently dont have - this will be a real added bonus for the hotel. Whilst we stayed, we were taken in a buggy over to a private part of the beach opposite for burj guests where we were looked after all day with beach staff service. I had a pre-natal massage and a La Prairie Caviar Facial in the spa which was amazing, with views out the window over the palm. The spa facilities were fantastic. We dined at Al Mahara, which was a slight disappointment - the menu very small, with most items containing either raw seafood or foie gras which when pregnant makes the menu even smaller! we had a three course meal with water and two mocktails, which was nice but not the best we'd experienced out there, but was by far the most expensive (approx £400) Overall, this hotel is definitely 7* in service and room standards. The hotel pool and beach area will be much better once all the renovations are complete. We are already planning our return for next year, and I cannot wait. Given the chance, I would have moved in for good.... the rooms were big enough!!!

We never went inside.. It is not possible to get into this hotel unless you stay there. We thought that we could go for a drink or go for brunch but we would have to book several weeks ahead. We did not think about that before leaving for Dubai so we only saw this hotel from the nearby Beach.
If only the best is good enough. We tried the restaurants, the afternoon The, and its just in a special class... do it its wort every AED.

Wow . We pre booked drinks at the Skyview bar so that we could experience this impressive hotel. As you drive up to the hotel it definitely has the wow factor and is very impressive. It's a 7 star experience from start to finish and as you would expect comes at a 7 star price. To pre book drinks you must agree to a minimum spend of 350 dirhams. The view is spectacular we had a table overlooking the Jumeirah beach and ordered cocktails and snacks from the menu. It was the last night of our holiday and was a great way to finish. Should be No1 of the things to do in Dubai
Dubai. The Burj Al Arab is out of the world as are most of the buildings you will encounter in Dubai. Keep looking up and be amazed.

"Skyview bar at the sky". Can't imagine a better afternoon tea experience than this. Outstanding ambiance & great service of this hotel made me feel when to "Gold al Arab". I am Very much excited to go again.
Great architecture. This is quite a memorable building, well worth going to see and enjoy with friends. Highly recommend a visit if you're in Dubai.

High Tea on 27th floor. The building is extraordinary. Modern day Baroc all in gold a, silver and blue. Champagne, canapes, pastries and cakes made up the tea, but the whole experience centres around the building itself. Pity it was misty so we could not see much from the top. The lift is all glass and glides up at incredible rate from sea level to the top. All in all a great experience that is well worth doing.

Overrated. Way overrated and not worth the money. The staff was interrupting us too often and I think they tried to trick us into paying for a praline to the coffee we didn't want. Better visit just the bar for a drink.

Incredible Afternoon Tea!. My friend and I had an experience for life the other day, when we visited the amazing Burj Al Arab at the Skyview afternoon tea. I will savour this experience always - it really was something else!To start of you're poured a glass of Louis Roederer, which recently was awarded to be the best standard cuvee in the world! It was followed by a very tasty white chocolate pudding with raspberry. Thereafter, an amazing pie with duck confit and foie gras - and then finger sandwiches of various kinds. All of which you were offered more. Oh, there was so many delicious items, well, you have to experience it all for yourself. Our view was of Downtown Dubai and as our seating was at 4PM, we experiences the sunset making the lights of Downtown Dubai a fantastic view!

Entry restricted. Good photo option from Jumeirah beach.... The structure is worth shooting. No point venturing inside unless you plan to stay there. You can get a good picture from Jumeirah beach for your bucket list...
Cocktails. This was an ok night out but I much preferred my visit last year for afternoon tea. Much more of a sense of occasion.

The hotel which is Wonder of the oWorld. We visited Dubai,first time in August 2010.This was Ramadan time.We had pre-booked Breakfast at this hotel.They charged us Rs4500/- per person.The hotel is situated on sea shore.Known as Seven star hotel.In side they have number of restaurants of different Menu and taste.Some restaurants have formal dress while at some casuals are allowed.Have a helipad also to receive the guest directly in the hotel.This is situated at 689 ft .height. The buffet breakfast was lavish and having varieties from all over the world.Must be having more than 150 items on display counter.You can take at-least 2 to 3 hours to sit here and enjoy.Take the seat which is sea facing.The taste of each variety was worth tasting.If you are non-vegetarian,you have still more choices.It is worthwhile to visit once at any cost.Rakesh Agrawal,Gujarat,India

Once in a lifetime indulgence. What can I say? It is simply the best hotel in the world, with the most elegant and luxurious furnishings I have ever experienced, and the staff was superb. The Burj Al Arab deserves its seven-star rating!
Nice. If it is your first time in Dubai then Burj Al Arab is a place you should visit it .. Enjoy the sunset from there
Afternoon Tea. 5 of us booked this - had an amazing table at the window - view was phenomenal. The hotel itself is breathtaking. Is expensive but was worth it as a one off. Go in daylight hours.

Exquisite Breakfast at Sahn Eddar. My husband and I made the most out of our 24 hour layover in Abu Dhabi by packing in lots of sightseeing. It wouldn't have been complete without a visit to THE Burj Al Arab. Since hotel reservations or onsite restaurant reservations are needed for you to enter the property, we booked a breakfast at Sahn Eddar - the hotel eatery located on the 1st floor. It was a memorable dining experience.Everything at Burj Al Arab is over the top sophisticated, classy and gorgeous. The lobby interior is draped in rich colors and the architecture is breath-taking and like nothing I've never seen before. The service at Sahn Eddar was excellent. I don't think you rush when you dine at such an establishment. The wait staff is attentive; the presentation is impressive; and the food is very delicious and aplenty. We had the continental breakfast which included an entree choice, a variety of pastries, and drink of choice. It was expensive, no doubt about that. Breakfast was AED 350 a person (~$95) excluding gratuity. But if you find yourself in Dubai and it's not somewhere you would frequent, you just have to experience the "only 6 star hotel in the world," wouldn't you?

Girly high tea to commence our holiday !. What a fabulous spoil before we left Dubai on way to the Rugby World Cup. The Burj high tea was beautifully done . Food and service excellent as we sat by a window and gazed at the view over the gulf . Truly a memorable experience and we felt thoroughly spoiled by the Burj staff. They were chatty , informative and looked after us beautifully . The Burj is a special treat and very worth it !
Colorful and Awesome. The more visible symbol of Dubai, this looks best in the night. The detailed plan to build this reflects in its architecture and impact

Iconic Landmark of Dubai. Burj Al Arab is the pride of Dubai and is located along the Jumaira Beach and adjacent to Jumaira Beach. It is along with Burj Khalifa is the iconic landmarks of Dubai. It houses Dubai's only 7 Star hotel where entry is restricted and costs around 200 dirhams. The view of the hotel from the Jumaira beach are excellent. Also, it can be viewed from Madinat Jumairah Shopping mall.

Afternoon Tea at the Burj. What a wonderful experience. Staying at the Burj was totally out of our reach but having High Tea/Afternoon Tea was something well worth while. We were staying at the Jumeirah Beach Hotel (amazing) so a golf buggie took us across the bridge to the Burj. The food and views were amazing - a cake stand, the shape of the Burj, kept being filled up with lots and lots of goodies - coffees, teas, and even milkshakes were endless... jams i've never even heard of and delicate little cakes we're just to die for. On our return we asked for a golf buggy to take us back - a few seconds later the concierge called us over as a beautiful milk white Rolls Royce purred to the front door 'you're car madam' - 'but we were only waiting for a golf buggie' - 'there is not one available at the moment so please accept this car' - OMG - it was stunning and we loved it... Love Dubai, Love the Burj... wonderful, wonderful memory

High tea in the skyview bar.....aaaamazing!. Booked high tea in the skyview bar which was amazing! The 16.30 seating allows you a day view and a night view (left around 6.45) The views make this an experience of a lifetime. Thought it a little expensive when I booked (620 dirhams per person) but have to say it was money well spent and a fantastic treat whilst visiting Dubai to visit this amazing hotel. The food was fantastic, delicious! Service superb! Worth every penny Thank you Burj al Arab the highlight of our holiday!!

Only outside view, couldn't get in. I really liked and enjoyed the outside view. However, as I had no reservation, they haven't even allowed me cross the bridge to get to the island.
The surroundings are pretty cool.

High tea experience. The overall impression of this hotel is breathtaking. First we got a trip with our private driver to the hotel beach area. Then we went to the lobby of the hotel. There is so much luxuary and gold... The restaurant is located 180m avouve the ground and the view is fabulous. You feel part of the rich and famous for a few hours...

Hi-tea on the 27th floor. Dream come true ! We went for hi-tea at the top floor at the Burj Al Arab. The most expensive hi-tea of our lives ;). Its only for the view from up there, for which one is paying, The snacks served was nice, but nothing for which one would pay so mcuh.

Well worth a visit. We visited the hotel when we stayed at JBH. We enjoyed taking pictures from the beach and just staring at the outside of the hotel. We visited the inside and were not disappointed at all. We went up to the to restaurant where the view was amazing looking over the city and the palm. They even laid on a car to take us back to the hotel, well worth a visit.
Great . 7 star hotel in the world standing in water gives u a amazing sight. I have been hearing about it and when saw myself I was happy like anything

Dinner. I had dinner at burj al Arab. This 7 star hotel is worth having dinner at. You are treated like royalty from the moment you step inside the hotel. The hotel lobby water fountains are just amazing. The food was really good with lots of different variety.

Lovely attraction!. I had an amazing time taking pictures and visiting this attraction. It was very, very hot but it was well worth the visit. The view of the water and the beach was amazing as well. I will definitely make this a must-see for my friends.
Nice. Another must see attraction. You can go by taxi to the free beach next to this hotel and at least make a few photos.

Great hotel. This is one of the great hotels in Dubai. Most expensive and luxury hotel in Dubai. It has great location and can free access theme water park namely Wild Wadi. Here in this hotel you will feel something special yourself.

Fit for the Gods!. Had high tea with friends here. Loved the ambiance, the royalty and the service, which however came at a high price. Had heard from a few European and Asian friends that the staff at times act biased and treat guests based on their ability to spend / financial status. However that was not the case. Being an Asian, was looked after well like any other guests. Thank goodness for the things money can buy :)
No limit luxury. Its really absolutelly touch of high top luxury. We can visit empty mezonet appartment and there is evrxthinkg you can inagine!
Best of the best!. Probably a one and done, but I'd give my right arm to be able to find another excuse to visit this astonishing hotel again.

High tea at the sky lounge is wonderful. I went with friends to the afternoon tea at the sky lounge burj al Arab. Now I love afternoon tea but this was a first for me, a champagne 7 course afternoon tea finishing off with petit fours. A 7* high tea for a 7* hotel. Expensive as it's the price of most high end Dubai brunches but a real treat or perfect for a special occasion. Unlike some afternoon teas in Dubai who should be shockingly ashamed, they provide endless tea and refill provisions until you say stop and that's what a good afternoon tea is all about. Al Qasr, one and only, address hotels and fairmont are high end afternoon teas who provide refills and top quality afternoon tea and should you not wish to pay 100pounds for high tea, they are my top alternative recommendations at a quarter of the price. Dubai has some awesome afternoon teas ....London is famous for the Ritz but it's standards have not reached Dubai..steer clear but until it reaches that standard....there are some amazing options for what I find is an amazing way to spend an afternoon with friends at great value for money.
A MUST try/see if you go to Dubai. A MUST try/see if you go to Dubai. We went there for drinks and food and went around to see the hotel. It was amazing and very beautiful.

Over rated. Al Mahara restaurant.....$385 AUS for a half bottle of red wine..$245 AUS for a dozen oysters...$55 AUS for a vodka and tonic, interior of the hotel looks like Disneyland for adults.....Don't bother....

It is the only 7* hotel in the world!. It is the only 7* hotel in the world!This and only must make you visit it!If you want to enter though you better make a reservation in a restaurant inside (get prepared it will be expensive) or you can book a ticket online (which is also expensive).

Birthday/ shopping trip. Went to Burj Al Arab for afternoon tea on my birthday with my daughter. It was fantastic, lovely food and staff were extremely professional and polite. Went for sunset amazing views and a lovely time. Was given a small birthday cake and a rose. It is a must to go here!!!

Drink your cocktails slowly. Obviously an expensive place to go for cocktails, however the views from the bar are spectacular. Plenty of people watching opportunities to be had. Make sure men wear shoes and long trousers otherwise they will be turned away.

The unique of dubai. Many mistaken to view it inside, bare in mind you required to do booking in advance if you want enter inside( booking for the hotel or the restaurant). Get ready your popcorn and sandal because it's close to sandy beach. Thus, worth stopover
HEAVEN. This place is like heaven who can afford to live in heaven.its architecture defines the actual meaning of a 7 Star property

Genuine & Real. Visiting and going up in (via lower level of Dubai Mall) is a must. The panoramic views (all four sides) from the observation floor are
something special. Be sure to book an advance registration time if going before sunset.

Only 7 Star hotel in the world. This place is a wonder. It is known as the only 7 star hotel in the world. This hotel stands on a separate man made island and not everyone can go to this place. I had booked myself for a costly breakfast and hence i was allowed inside. The interiors are gorgeous and too good. A must visit place and completely worth it for the amount you shell out. The dinner and lunch are more costly.

Great for Photos overpriced for food.. Viewed both day and night, you can see if from most parts of Dubai. Night time is nicer as it is lit up. Priced having dinner here and for Afternoon Tea it worked out around £120 so decided to go to 360 Bar on the pier next to Burj Al Arab had a few drinks and took a couple of pictures. Buggys available to take you to 360 and drivers are more than willing to stop for the best picture.
Burj Al Arab. There was a lot of smog or heat haze on the afternoon we went and hard to take a good clear photo. What a beautifl building.

Amazing and expensive!. Such a beautiful building, build with class and style. A real pleasure to see! I have seen a lot of documentaries about it but when you see it yourself you feel the richness on your body. If you have the luck, take a look inside and enjoy a Tea Time!
great. best seven star hotel ,like burj khalifa burj ul arab is also an icon for dubai. must see .best of dubai tour

Great Structure to drive around and have a look. We went to the Burj Al Arab from the Yacht and had one of the most spectacular views. Not really required to go under the building, a drive under is a great idea.

Insane but expensive. The scenary is marvellous. The building is modern and furnished of whatever you desire! Fantastic sight towards the city of Dubai and on the Persian Gulf. All is absolutely perfect unless the price: is too expensive! About 1300 dollars per night!
"Fantastic piece of engineering". Excellent visit to one of the most famous buildings in the world set on the white sands and the bluest sea you have ever seen, luxury at its best.

Tea time . We booked an afternoon tea in THE HOTEL. We were pleasantly surprised by the huge amount of sweets and sandwiches that we've been served. The payed price was definitely not too high for a hotel of this category and it worth. This is the easiest (cheapest) chance to get to see Burj al Arab.
Once in a lifetime. Fantastic experience. Nice to see how the other half lives. Costs a bomb. Great service buy it would want to be for the price.
Worth seeing. Loved it - we were in an organised tour guides name Oliver booked through our accomodation at Ibis mall of Emirates Concerige (Honey) very helpful chap

Fantastic view from the top of the world!. We chose the most expensive tour, which was 500AED. It's expensive, but took us to the 148th floor instead of just the 124th/125th. A once in a lifetime possibility to get to the highest man-made place on earth (I believe 555meters above ground). You can get better prices by booking online in advance through other companies, but I don't think that gives you the fast-track possibilities, which allows you to pass all the long lines to get to the outside patio and the elevator back down to earth, which is almost worth the extra price in itself. We went up to see the sunset which was spectacular. Just try to time it to a day without haze/fog/clouds. We was a bit unlucky on that side, so the view wasn't as good as it could have been. Were treated to some local delights as dates, coffee, sweets, fresh juice etc which added to the overall experience!
Would recommend. Would definitely recommend the views are amazing. We went at night and dome the drinks package. A bit expensive but worth it. The cocktail were really good.

Beautiful place, but very pricey.. Beautiful iconic building of Dubai. The inside is spectacular but the restaurants are quite overpriced. We had drinks at the Skybar and dinner at the underwater restaurant.... Both great views, reallly innovative. The bar was a bit more trendy and lively and the restaurant was a little too quiet for our liking. Food was great but all in all, everything in there seems quite overpriced, especially when there are so many other amazing options with similar opulence in Dubai.
BURJ AL-ARAB GREAT MONUMENT. Burj Al-Arab is a master piece of the Civil Architecture. It can be accessible from Jumeirah Beach. It is a 7 Star Hotel.
Wonderful experience. Come here for a wonderful meal experience at the highest level of attention. The ambiance is second to none. You are made to feel like an Arabian Princess.

Amazing and very expensive. Well worth a visit for the experience of visiting a beautiful hotel with impeccable customer service. First thing is to book your experience asap for lunch, afternoon tea, dinner or just drinks. We did the drinks at 350 AED per head minimum spend to confirm a booking. Book asap.Our booking was at 8.30pm in the bar which is pretty amazing but get ready to spend your money.Cocktails start at 160 AED+ and spirits start at 100 AED. Fantastic cocktails but when you convert them to AUD it is very luxurious $57 AUD per cocktail. Extensive drinks list and amazing service.They do however provide a few nuts, olive free of charge.It is a one off experience.I would however do it in the day time if I was lucky enough to attend.
Checked off the list. Just saw it from outside although also very impressive to stand in front. Not really that keen to see it from inside.

Honeymoon of a life time. If there was a higher rating available I would give it unfortunately there is only five this truly is a seven star hotel in every way. This is where we ended our honeymoon and what a place to have ended it this palace is nothing short of excellent. We stayed in the panoramic suite for four nights witch was not enough time the bed was like a silk cloud that was made up for you twice a day. The staff were magical so attentive from the bottom to the top. On every floor there was a 24 hour reception desk with butler service we stayed in room 1112. Our butlers names were Abdullah and Paul they were both amazing we did not have to lift a finger it was a real royal class service. Paul was particularly outstanding the attention he lavished upon us was incredible he offered to pack our bags for when we were leaving. There was a gift on our pillow every night and some chocolate, cakes, canapes and wine or champagne and clothes that you had left on the floor were neatly folded and put on a chair when they cleaned your room. if you were ever thinking of going stop thinking and just go because I am the type of person that is very hard to impress and The Burj surpassed all my expectations and beyond. What I did not mention was the first part of our honeymoon was three nights in Abu Dhabi Emirates Palace considered to be a seven star and seven nights in the Residence Maldives considered to be a six star, The Burj Al Arab blew them out of the water.

Beachside in the Middle of the City. Burj Al Arab is a 7-star hotel located in the middle of a man-made islet. With my 1-day free time in Dubai, I decided to go for a quick trip to Burj Al Arab first thing in the morning before heading to Dubai Mall which still opens at 10am.I was surprised to see a very beautiful beach in the middle of the city. A few people are swimming and the waters are very clear.What also fascinated me is the airconditioned bus stop I saw while walking through the streets in the area.It can get very hot in the area thus better to bring an umbrella and sunglasses.

High Tea at Burj Al Arab. Lovely afternoon at the Burj. Fabulous customer service with a great selection of sandwhiches, cakes, teas etc. Did I love everything? No but we were given more of what we did like and rolled out afterwards. This particular afternoon there was a piano player. The atmosphere was just lovely and we never felt rushed. It was a great time with a visitors.

Definitely once in a life time treat. The Burj Al Arab truly deserves a 7 star for service. We were here for lunch. The restaurant is very spacious and the view breathtaking. The butler and waiters ensures all your needs are attended to, before you even voice them. Burj is one of a kind hotel that everyone should have on their bucket list! Truly exceptional!

Over rated tourist trap.. Over rated tourist attraction. Vulgar decor of gold and red, showy but tasteless furnishings, extremely poor quality food in the Skyview Bar, mass produced and directed predominantly to the tourist. Delightful staff, professional and respectful, pity about the overall quality.

The Best. What can we say except thank you. from the first moment we were welcomed in to the room and the butler..our butler was the best ...we love you Burji Al Arab...we will be back and can't wait to see the new outdoor pool .

Must do while in Dubai. The luxury at its best !! You cannot access this hotel built in the water without having either a booked room ( Awfully expensive !!), a high tea reservation ( $ 175.00/ pers.), a lunch or dinner reservation. Highly recommended although pricy, the Friday brunch ($ 200.00/pers.) . This brunch is the best we ever had in all of our trips. You can think about any food, you get it. Although pretty expensive , it is worth every penny. Also great views from the restaurant located on the 27th floor.

Very special - Booking a requirement. Expensive for afternoon tea but worth every penny. Fantastic selection of teas and cakes not your usual afternoon tea plenty to eat and very attentive staff. Shame some other foreign nationals had to spoil it by stealing the perfumes from the restrooms
Don't miss it. The 7 stars hotel in Dubai city, luxury and the location will make you crazy. I love to visit here and stay near by water park.

afternoon tea with champagne. my cousin and i visited for afternoon tea in september 2015. at around £110 each, the price may be off-putting to some but it was an experience not to be missed. the stunning burj Al Arab hotel is like being inside the pipes of a giant golden organ. the lift to the sky bar was amazing, flying up all those floors in just a minute. the tea was 7 courses of delicious food. tea and coffee were unlimited and the variety was astounding. the service as you expect was impeccable and I'd thoroughly recommend it for a special occasion or a treat.

Pretty good. Me and my wife went in May not long after our wedding for very "high" tea. Food was really good and well presented. Only fault was that some of the sandwiches were a bit stale as if they were left sitting out for a while. We had them exchanged for some slightly less crusty sandwiches. We were also given a red rose due to it being our honeymoon. Overal, disappointed by the crusty bread, but not put me off from recommending to others l.

Its just a pricey Lunch!. Not worth the price, its just a bucket list thing :) Though there was style & grandeur .
Went to eat at Al Mahara Seafood Restaurant (ground floor). Could not get reservation in 15th floor restaurants.
Every common man's dream stay.... You get an excellent view of the Burj Al Arab from the beach front. It's a pretty awesome structure and signifies Dubai on the world map.

WOW!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!. What can be said about this hotel that has not already been said. This place is spectacular, everyone that goes to Dubai should stay here at least once. How many can say they stayed in the worlds only 7 Star Hotel? If you go to Dubai and do not stay here, you will have let one of the greatest landmarks in the world pass you by. There are reasonably priced rooms as well as rooms for the Lifestyle of the Rich and Famous. Definitely a worthwhile place to stay.

Marvellous Structure. Nestled between Madina Jumeirah & Wild Wadi this hotel is known as the Only 7 star hotel in the world (officially staring system ends at 5). The structure is inspired by Dhow. One has to book a table to get an entry which can't be in advance necessarily it can be done from the entrance to hotel,The helipad location is amazing. You feel lucky if you get chance to see a chopper landing on it.
I will come back. Great views from the top of this majestic building! You must see seven star hotel, rooms were absolutely stunning!

When the world 7 star hotel hosts a press conference for one of the biggest movies ever and their cast !!! Star Trek. So people look at Burj Al Arab and they think ... 7 star! Omg I need a billion dollars to get in - the fact of the matter is no. The experience of driving up there is quite breath taking. The Falak ballroom was turned into a press conference for 7 of the cast members of Star Trek. The room itself is stunning, the suites, the SPA ... Omg the SPA and the food. Definitely a once in a lifetime place to try out. I go there a lot for work and I keep discovering a new area, dish and well new angles to shoot! And what's cool is that the super police cars always make their rounds at the entrance and well you get a super cool 7 star hotel pic!

Super Cars And Sky Bar. Booked the Sky Bar for 7pm Sat 26th Sept and what a view we got from the corner area overlooking the Jumeirah beach and the bright lights of Dubai. Lovely nibbles were brought to us as we settled in to look at the drinks and food menu. Drink and food ordered we just relaxed into what was a fantastic experience and worth every penny. As we were leaving some super cars were dropping more guests off and it was great fun to just watch and soak it all up. Do It....book the Sky Bar you won't regret it.

Glitzy through and through. Burj al Arab lives up to its hype! Everything is OTP and blingy and glitzy. But very interesting to see so much extravagance in one place. We were lucky to be able to get to the helipad on top, and the views from there are to die for! Worth a visit.

Words cant decribe the place. Went there for lunch to the Al Mahara. The whole experience is amazing ,you go through an artificial submarine & as you enter the place its just Wow . The large Aquarium , the decor and hospitality is just amazing . Ordered a pasta and was bit disappointed as paid approx 80 usd and just 8 tiny pieces .

Stunning hotel. This hotel was beautiful inside and out, only thing we didnt like is that we wanted to go to the skybar for a drink but were told it was the equivalent of £70 minimum spend per person - and it was already midnight, so we didnt go up there in the end. For a future visit we will go earlier!
Just do it!. Worth the experience if you're in Dubai! Great views from the top of this majestic building! The inside is lavishly designed.

Sailboat hotel. Beautiful hotel in the shape of a sailboat on the shores of the Persian Gulf. We thought the water of the gulf would be dirty, but it was clear, clean, and blue. The Persian Gulf looked similar to the Caribbean.
Amazing views but dated interior. Obviously amazing but interior looking really dated now, looks like something out of the late eighties!
Crazy hotel!. Visiting during a friends wedding, the hotel is absolutely crazy with gold everywhere, fountain show in reception. Super cars parked up outside. Well worth a visit.

One of its kind in the world. Excellent place.... the only 7 star hotel in the world... We could not stay there since it was very expensive but we did go there for a cup of coffee... Prior reservations are required at the restaurant... But this place is worth a visit...
Stunning. By far the best hotel I've ever been too - restaurant on the top of hotel was to die for! Definitely will visit again, staff wonderful and rooms were absolutely stunning!

7 Stars. Visited the Hotel as we had dinner at 27th floor. I was a little surprised when we arrived that it was allowed tourist just to enter the lobby as I was told they are pretty strict only to let people with reservation come in. Besides the very crowded and noisy start rest of the visit was fine.

A DREAM OF A SEVEN STAR HOTEL IN DUBAI. This hotel is situated on the Jumeirah Beach Strip and was the first seven star in the world..so when a relative who was studying at the Hospitality Academy there invited us to visit..we were pleasantly surprised and jumped at the opportunity..its situatuation like on the sea..with a bridge across..is astounding in itself..the foyer with its amazing water feature and mind-boggling chandeliers..are out of this world..and the apartment we were shown..oh my word..thats something else..and the skybar..was even more of an adrenalin rush than dune bashing.which Dubai is famous for..a must see
Nice public beach. Very nice view from the public beach.If you want you can rent a board and padle around Burj Al Arab.The beach is very interesting to understand the lifestyle of the expats
Past resident. Did not stay there but went to the bar for cocktails. Did not think it was worth the 250 dirhams. However many people think the afternoon tea is worth it.

lavish and luxurious!. How could we pass up the opportunity to see the only "7 star" hotel in the world. We went here for dinner one night and the hotel is absolutely lavish! Lavish and luxurious are the best words to describe it! You have to have reservations in advance to even cross the bridge to get in.

High tea at Skyview Bar. A wonderful once in a lifetime experience. FABULOUS views and the staff really look after you. If you have a special celebration and tell them when they ask, they will present you with a rose and a special little cake with a candle. Food was superb and we could wander where we pleased around the hotel's public areas afterwards. We went for the 4.30pm afternoon tea and stayed for sunset and then wandered outside for the night light views. I recommend you paying the bit extra to go to the top. The cheaper packages are for the lobby floors only.
Magnificent design. Haven't stayed at the hotel, but it has magnificent design, right next to the sea, where you can swim (if you'll manage the heat).

Majestic and powerful. There's a reason that this hotel is one of a kind. It's magniffisence and beauty make you feel small and insignifficant, yet special because you're there. The view is splendid and the crystal clear water, surrounding it sparkles in the sun.

An amazing building. We checked out this very fancy hotel from the beach, making it one of the most beautiful hotels in the world. The inside is awesome also and the luxury on it shows the wealth of these countries but the best part is looking at it from the Gulf. From there, you can see the facade is a huge Christian cross, maybe made up on purpose bay the westerner architect who designed it... something to see, for sure.

Unimaginative food, poor & rushed service. 6 of us visited this place for afternoon tea booked by my nieces for their mums birthday treat. On arrival we were greeted by one of two gowned ladies - we weren't offered fresh towels or dates they had in their hand, neither were we asked if we needed directions.After admiring the gold leaf, fish tanks and fountains near the entrance we wondered where we should go for our tea so asked one of the lovelies by the door who told us we should head up the escalator. Once in the sky bar our waiter introduced himself ,noted that we had 2 diabetics & 3 vegetarians amongst us. He didn't explain the drinks menu ie what was included & what was chargeable, he served tea 4 courses in, so with the scones, until then we had champagne but no offer of water etc. He never came back to ask if we wanted a refill of tea or any other drink.The food was unbelievably boring & poorly presented: duck pie served with a bit of chutney, 4 types of sandwich filling - chicken paste, tuna paste, salmon paste and cucumber & cream cheese. The veggies & diabetics got an even worse deal. Pastries were solid stodgy lumps of Dundee cake, carrot cake etc. Most people left their food untouched.The atmosphere around us was not that of calm & serenity - waiters were hoovering, table cloths were being ironed and the blender was going off in the bar area drowning the sound of the pianist.We could not have felt more rushed by the serving team - it cost over £700 for the 6 of us for the experience and it was so disappointing. Worse still, my son in England arranged with the Burj to pay for our experience as a treat and he stressed so many times to them to not tell us he had paid until we asked for the bill - even this was rushed as we were advised he had paid during our sandwich course - another example of the rushing experience.It's such a shame as the afternoon tea experience at the Burj was meant to be the highlight of our trip to Dubai and something we had dressed up for and looked forward to for such a long time - spoilt by waiters & chefs thinking they are manning a production line and not caring that for some it's a once in a life time experience.

#touristMode . My friends and I decided to dress up and have a little photo shoot. It is the most Instagrammed site in the world... #Basic. We got our white linen pants and white shirts and took some pictures. I mean. It is the only 7 star hotel in the world right? Heck yes.

LUXURY!!!. I can't remember if I have ever visited a more luxurious and royal place in the whole world more than Burj Al Arab. It has the royal, modern and traditional experience of the Arab luxury. It is way more than amazing!

Dubai's best attractions. This a must see location in Dubai, the hotel is absolutely beautiful from inside and you do not have to be staying in to explore it, you can visit it for a coffee and check our the views and stand right underneath it. Highly recommend it.
Meal. Had lunch here. The experience was wonderful and recommend that anyone that hasn't been here visit for the experience

Birthday treat.... What an experience...wanted todo something special for my wife's birthday whilst we were on holiday in Dubai and this is the place to do it. Treated like royalty as soon as we got out of the car.Then wisked up to The Skyview Bar for Afternoon High Tea...o.k. it is a little bit expensive but what an experience...seven course's,a glass of Champagne and a separate menu of speciality tea's and coffee...dont be afraid to ask for more sandwiches,cake etc...the only thing extra to pay for is alcoholic drinks. We didnt get a window table..dont think it matters...because you can get between the window tables to take any pictures. The wife was also given a small birthday cake from the hotel...Staff are polite,courteous and friendly... The tv series doesnt do the hotel justice,plenty of wow factor,one less off the bucket list....
book an afternoon tea tour. booked an afternoon tea tour. didn't disappoint though we only went up one floor. food was excellent. had some expensive champagne but it was worth it

Brilliant. Absolutely Amazing.. From the moment we checked in until or departure we were treated like royalty.. Our room was magnificent.. the facilities superb!! l the staff from the pool guys to restaurant staff were so kind and courteous.. particular special thanks to the concierge Anzil who checked us in and especially to the duty manager Sonya who made sure that our every need and request was immediately addressed from helping confirm our excursions to organising a late check out! Thank you so much. I guess our only complaint was that we had to leave... we shall definitely return in the near future and would most definitely recommend this as THE hotel to stay at when visiting Dubai.
Photo scenic place. Very good place to be at. This view can be seen from Jumerah Public beach. Go to this place during evening before dusk. Get a chair or paper to seat on to enjoy the view

Afternoon Tea. We had afternoon tea here and whilst it was a brilliant experience I wouldn't do it again. We requested a window seat on our reservation but didn't get one sadly so we couldn't see much at all view wise. We had to go up to the window which is awkward when people are trying to eat their lunch. Food is amazing and the general atmosphere is very pleasant. Try and arrive in good time so you can look round the hotel to begin with because that's beautiful aswell
awesome view. a place facing a sea is awesome always. The panaromic view of sea and winds from the window is so awesome anyone would love to stay here.

The Arabian knight. It is the jewel in the desert!, a place for the richest of the rich visiting the Emirates. It is the exclusive super ~7 star luxury dream hotel for the de la crème.If you are not staying there then best to book a table at the eating places to have the feel of the gold leaf destination. Al Muntaha is on the top floor Al Mahara has a aquarium and Sahn Eddar for afternoon tea. last but no the least is Majlis Al Bahar on the beach.

Utterly fantastic. Book afternoon tea in the Skyview bar and enjoy a fantastic view and an utterly amazing view of the Palm. Everything is as you would expect for this hotel from the moment you walk through thr door. It's utterly fantastic

Amazing life time experience - do it ! forget the price. My wife and I had a cocktail evening at the Burj. Was amazing going through reception up to first floor gallery with fountains/acquarium and loads of gold leaf. Had window seats in sky bar with great views of glittering nightlights. Service was excellent free nibbles served three times we had 3 cocktails and one bottle of wine (£170in total) but you have to spend min 350 dinars each so you know it is not going to be cheap. One of those lifetime experiences you must do.

iconic hotel. Being an iconic landmark, is one of the qualities of this hotel. It stands out, you know your in Dubai !!I have visited the hotel but not as a guest, they do NOT allow visitors any longer, no doubt as everybody wants to view this hotel in the reception areas. This would be unfair for the people that are staying there to have to walk through so many tourists talking selfies !

Must Do. We booked tickets for this on line before we travelled to Dubai and it is well worth it in terms of price. We deceided on dusk which is popular as you have the benefit of seeing the views in day light, watching the sun go down and thn experiencing the view with just the city lights.
