Not for the faintherated but well organised and not to be missed. You can stay up as long s you like.
Best food ever. The food may cost a bit more but it is well worth it. The view is wonderful, the staff were fantastic

A beautiful Skyview bar. We went here for a few drinks one night and my gosh the view! and 7* is right! even as a visitor and not a guest you get the best reception and such lovely staff!the drinks were great and so was the view! i'd highly recommend going at night you get to see the city in all its glory
Afternoon tea. Afternoon tea with a window view is a must, pre book to avoid disappointment and arrive early to try to get a window seat. Gorgeous food arrive hungry :-)

Great views, and good experience.. Great experience to here - we had the Afternoon Tea for 6 people. Views were amazing, and being in the Burj is an experience. Not sure I would go again as its VERY expensive.

Smaller than I thought it would be. We didn';t actually stay here but stopped and looked at it on our way to Palm Islands. It's not as big as I thought it would be but still impressive. It is right on the Jumeirah Beach so if you want to spend some time here, that would be a good way of doing everything.
Burj Al Arab great moments. Awesome! Did this with the sightseeing bus, Hop on Hop Off. Weather was like 102 degrees. You cannot be outside for long periods of time with the weather so hot.

Wow !!!!. Wow !!! What an experience , we loved it .From the moment you enter it is so opulent I didn't know which way to look , we walked through the lobby and took pictures we were shown to the lift to get to the sky bar , we had booked a table for cocktails . It was lovely , there is a minimum spend and yes it is expensive but well worth it if you want something different .the cocktails were very dramatic and theatrical and I loved it . I would return

Beautiful and extravagant- definitely Dubai. Fabulous service , gorgeous place. Quick hint - don't wear shorts if you're planning to stay for cocktails or dinner, they really don't like them. While the staff trousers they lent me to wear was a very kind gesture- I'm sure you'd prefer to select your own outfit for the evening.

Marvelous in: views, building, food and room. unbelievable place Its very thoughtful of them for creating an excellent place to hang out, relax and enjoying the view..The security very strict which I love to see it happen.

try the lobster!. dined in al-iwan restaurant. food was international and arabic mixed. the dessert selection was lovely. the quality of service from the people at al-iwan was something i have never encountered. it seemed like i had my own designated waiter.

Special Afternoon Tea. This hotel is just beautiful. My partner and I had the pleasure of visiting for afternoon tea and it really is quite an experience.The decor is extremely grand and the service is unbeatable. The tea was the best I have ever had and the food was exceptional.It is quite a pricey experience but one that I would highly recommend you try whilst visiting Dubai. We hope to be able to stay here some time in the future.

Magnificent Place. There are no words to describe the Burj Al Arab, it was just amazing. We did the Culinary Flight Experience and it was wonderful. It was nice to experience each course in a different restaurant and see a lot of this magnificent building. The staff could not do enough for you and the food was unbelievable.

Great!. This building truly is breathtaking and the views were amazing....unfortunately the day we went it was very hazy and so this made the view slightly less amazing. I can imagine on a clear day that you would see a lot more.

You have to go there. I've been there and the building is simply amazing. Really worth going there, you can take some pictures and appreciate this beauty. And still, if you want you can have a good time at the Jumeirah Beach, a calm place. If you don't feel like spending some time there because of the warmth, go for a tour. It is definitely on Dubai bucket list.

Pricey but worth it once. Complete luxury at the highest level. Dress up and be ready to have everything taken care of from the time you enter. VERY EXPENSIVE, but worth a once in a lifeltime experience

Dream come true. It's a dream come true experienced to stay in this magnificent hotel so beautiful suite room with panoramic view, great staff, super loved the brand hermes they have in the bath room they have nice bar amazing pool thumbs up! Me and my husband experienced to be in many hotels already but the break fast in Burj Al Arab was the best! They have a great restaurants that will fit your taste! I am looking forward to stay here again ...
estatic. It was the shortest ride to the top floor (148). The view from the top was amazing. My only regret is the photos are too expensive.

Its all bout the outside night especially view of the outside. I went there for high tea witch cost 250$ per person!! but anyway its one of the ways to get inside this hotel,and i must say it wasn't worth that amount of money to pay for it.Plus the staff especially the ones at the elevator are not so polite,definitely not even a 3 stat attitude.This hotel is amazing from outside but i didnt got amazed from the small inside veiw i could have.I do not know nothing about the rooms if worth or not the money even for a night stay
Top attraction. A perfect place for an evening stroll or a swim in the afternoon near the beach, make sure you keep this background for every pic you click

good architecture though not free to see. well if you have money and want to expierence luxuruy first make booking for stay or dinner or coffey for this hotel before going... else you can go till gate and get a photo done from outside hotel ...security will push you to go away but you can have photos done from road, nothing else.
Had to see it. Lovely to see and nice views of the surrounding areas lovely sunsets at the beach and then go to one of the nearby restaurants for dinner
An indulgence, but worth it. 7* - afternoon tea was an indulgence,but worth it for the experience and the service was first class.
AMAZING. The place is the best hotel in the world, and it proved just that. Great food, service, area and part if the great complex with the best waterpark in dubai

Amazing...better than the Burj Khalifa. We did the culinary flight where you get a food course and drink in every restaurant in the Burj. The food was amazing although way too much as they are full portions by the time i got half way through i was stuffed. They bring bread with every course which is a killer but tastes so good. The best bit is definitely the bar and the restaurant at the top mainly because of the amazing view a much better view than the burj khalifa as you look out over the whole of dubai and the burj khalifa. Definitely recommend going up at night for the best view. Service was impeccable when i went. Highly recommend for a special night out.

Luxury at its very best..Simply Amazing. What can i say about this hotel, i have not stayed in but did get a chance to visit the rooms as well as had food in the restaurant..Sheer class is all i can say..Loved the hospitality, the pro activeness of staff, very friendly tooViews are awesome from where we were
Very classy. We had a beautiful meal here on the 27th floor then cocktails afterwards. You do have to book even for a drink.

Was amazing to see how small the helipad looks but Federer and Djokovic actually played tennis on it!. Did not go inside but took lots of pictures from the outside. It was a hot day. Try taking pictures with your palm under the base. Looks like you are holding it in your hand.
Amazing restaurant. Access to this attraction is by reservation only. Getting here by taxi will be a better choice. Be prepared to wait for a while to get in.

Afternoon tea - Dubai style. Well worth a visit whilst in Dubai, the hotel is amazing and the afternnon tea delicious. A little more expensive than the usual afternoon tea but then thats what you expect from a 7 start hotel . Prosecco with your sandwiches, a cocktail of your choice with your scones and tea with the very dainty cakes. Lovely expereince in sumptuous surrondings.

Sky bar restaurant . Went here for afternoon tea on our honeymoon . It's the second time we have been for afternoon tea and both agreed the first time was better in 2013, it lacked atmosphere this time , the staff seemed very rushed , but it is a lovely place to go albeit very expensive and the views are superb.

Wow!. We booked afternoon tea here and although very expensive we had a wonderful time. You can only access the hotel if you are a hotel resident or have a reservation for a restaurant. Afternoon Tea is served in the Skyview Restaurant on 27th floor. Absolutely amazing views and we were given the best view in the house (or so we were told). Afternoon tea consisted of 7 courses - I won't say anymore so as not to spoil the surprise! But if you can, you must visit!

Not To Be Missed. Went for afternoon tea to celebrate my anniversary and can only say although it was expensive i would'nt have missed it for the world.Only the Al-Arab could have provided such exceptional service and food would recommend this to anybody celebrating anything from entering to leaving everything was first class.
The Hotel. I just visit this hotel two times and find it very amazing place with luxury taste. it is too expensive to eat over there.
Worth it.. Very expensive but unparalleled experience in Dubai at an icon of the city. Excellent service, great views, you'll never feel this decadent again!

The Burj al Arab is an elegant form that sits lightly and elegantly on the Dubai shoreline.. This beautiful building floats gracefully in the warm sultry waters of Dubai. It is an iconic piece of architecture that never fails to impress. I still enjoy the sight of it every time I pass by. The interior skeleton is also beautiful however it is sometimes overcrowded, or interrupted perhaps, by some of the over-the-top interior decor. None the less, it deserves the stars and accolades it has achieved. I have dined in a few of the restaurants and enjoyed cocktails in the sky bar, it is always a special (if very expensive) occasion. But you need not dine there to appreciate it, just viewing it from the beach is joy enough.

One to do as a special treat. Is definitely one to have on your bucket list. The location is spectacular, the building awe inspiring, and the service second to none. We had lunch here as a treat, which although extortionate price wise for relatively small portions, is more to savour the atmosphere and experience rather than expect to satisfy your appetite.

Amazing. Well what can I say. Went here for High Tea , as a treat from my Husband and what a treat this was. From the minute you arrive at the Hotel it is amazing. It cost 620 dirham each but it is worth every penny. You really need to do this if you visit Dubai. Just to see inside the hotel, all the décor, the fountain, the shops , all amazing. I was a bit nervous about going here incase I felt out of place or if I didn't wear the correct out fit but I felt so at ease as soon as I reached the sky view I was made feel very welcome. The staff are lovely.We had champagne and sandwiches and pastries, cakes ,scones ,jam and clotted cream, tea coffee and unlimited non alcoholic drinks. We were sitting right at the window with an amazing view of the Palm. Also when leaving we got a lovely gift , a pen in a beautiful gift box with chocolates at the bottom. This was just an amazing day.It made our holiday special.

Once in a lifetime experience - fantastic!. Loved every minute of our visit to the hotel - afternoon tea in the sky bar was amazing from the views to every single morsel which kept appearing for around 2 hours. Staff friendly and service was excellent. A has to be done experience. 7 courses of perfection in gorgeous surroundings.

Mashaallah.... Awesome shape building with an awesome view. Went for breakfast and believe me they had vast range of food selection. Less of veg options. Nevertheless was mesmerised with the ambience of the hotel.. Such a luxurious place to be..

Too posh for my tatse but definitely worth a visit. A very nice, but too posh place...
I visited the hotel with is 7 stars...
Reservation required..
I went to Junsui restaurant, not cheap but if you can afford it is definitely a nice experience.

Afternoon Tea with friends from UK. Lovely afternoon tea with two friends from UK. The Harpist played Happy Birthday to me, really lovely and thoroughly enjoyed the few hours spent there. The choice of teas was endless and the cakes were delicious. Will be returning there with other friends and family . Would definitely recommend this.
Amazing 7 star, views to die for. This is an amazing hotel, definately 7 star. We had hi tea for my birthday what an experience. Quite expensive but worth it just to see the hotel.
Afternoon tea.. Had afternoon tea there and explored the hotel. Booked through a travel agent. Cakes yummy and view amazing.

Burj Al Arab. Fabulous building that can be seen many kilometeres away. We caught a hop on hop off bus to get there with the view to have afternoon tea & a look around, but we couldn't enter the property without a reservation so we travelled all that way for nothing.

Afternoon tea-treat. Me and my wife celebrated our anniversary by having afternoon tea and it was a fantastic experience. Every single member of staff was polite, smiling and happy to help.The view was splendid from the restaurant of the palm.The food was delicious and it was very filling and they came around with extra's as well.An incredible experience to see the amount of gold leaf and the extravagance at the shop of gold platted iPads. Would love to come back, and maybe stay next time.
Top of the world. Very thrilled to be on top of the world, especially the children. One can reach so fast at such a height was unbelievable. Well maintained, well guided and pleasing.

Amazing view and Afternoon Tea. Went there for afternoon tea.What can I say, this place is just amazing.Money really does buy luxury. Would love to stay there one night.Views are amazing from the sky bar.Really recommend if you like the finer things in life.

Birthday surprise. My husband had, unbeknown to me, booked Afternoon Tea at the Burj as part of a Birthday surprise. We went by taxi from our Hotel.The Burj is so sumptuous. You enter the door and go up an escalator past the beautiful aquarium. The interior of the hotel is a wow factor. So much gold, deep carpets, fountains, lots of very polite staff.We were shown to our table. We had Tea, Scones with fresh Cornish cream (flown in daily) Sandwiches, and Cakes. All served by polite staff and as much as we could eat.We wanted a photograph but had to wait until no-one else was around us, in respect of other guests privacy.It was a lovely afternoon surprise. Yes it was expensive but we were treated so well and felt it was equal to Tea at The Ritz Hotel in London.
Boat Shape Hotel. This is one of my favorite places in Dubai, it is an amazing hotel. To get admission into the hotel, prior booking in the restaurant is required.

Amazing. We booked the high tea at the Skyview Bar to celebrate the end of our honeymoon. While the price was high, the hotel, restaurant, staff and food were top notch. The staff hit the balance between professional and friendly perfectly, we felt like VIP guests and were even given a rose to celebrate our honeymoon. The view was incredible and the food delicious. There was no sense of rushing us out of the restaurant. If you can, I would definitely recommend going here.

Once in a lifetime!. Dubai is a very remarkable place with so many things to see and do. We were fortunate to be able to have tea at the Burj Al-Arab Hotel in mid-afternoon. There is only one word to describe this place------Beautiful. We had a great time shopping, duning, dining, and had our first ever camel ride. It is a place to visit. The date is actually March 2008
Whaw. Fantastic i felt at the entrance receiving guests was a little too much maybe for us while we Are from Germany
Great Lunch!!. We had lunch here at the Al Mahara. It was very nice and expensive. The service is outstanding. The food was good. The atmosphere is great!

Great food, amazing location.. I visited the Burj Al Arab with my Fiance for high tea and it was a great experience. The hotel exterior is impressive but the interior is truly jaw dropping with gold leaf and lush carpets every where. The 7 course's we had all tasted great and we also had a glass of sparkling date juice which was a first. A couple of things - we had booked a package that included a glass of champagne but were told when we got there that we had to pay for it. Also, we were also told that the high tea takes place in the restaurant at the top of the hotel, this was not the case as we were on the first floor.
High Tea. Went to high tea on the 27th floor. Glass of champagne,sandwiches,cakes etc and a gift to take home. Amazing.
Ancestral. A little outdated now, overly price... but kept the luxury feel to it. Dining at the lower restaurant watching the sharks, fishes and other water species is amazing.
Fantastic restaurant.. State-of-the-art building. A must-see hotel and restaurant. A unique experience, to see the stairs, with dancing waters, all the gold, the luxury, etc
Excellent !!. Excellent !! A must stop during the Dubai stay. Has nice view and the restaurant is very good. highly recommended !!

An afternoon tea with a difference.. My Husband booked Afternoon Tea in this hotel for my Birthday.This was an experience I will never forget. We had 7 wonderful courses. Every corse was delivered with the upmost attention from the staff. Because it was my Birthday I was given a beautiful Gift which was a boxed pen, a red rose and a piece of cake. An excellent afternoon which I will not forget.

Breath taking. Can easily see why this is the worlds first 7 star hotel so beautiful and luxorious stunning staff are lovely and polite and very helpful so nice beautiful food amazing resort and amazing views of the beaches and so nice

amazing. Beautiful to see, the photos are wonderful and this side has a beach where tourists can bathe. The hotel is sumptuous, gold and coated with a giant fountain at the entrance. It's amazing. The restaurant underwater much worth going, very beautiful and you feel inside a movie. An incredible experience ..

Wonderful. the place that absolutely must visit in dubai
The fairy tale and the dream
The most beautiful hotels in the world
Nevere ever I seen the wonderful place
Breath taking. By itself a great landmark and another of the Seven Wonders of Dubai. You can`t get in unless you have lunch, afternoon tea or dinner. My full report is in the restaurant section Dubai

Great View. It is what it is.... but you need to do it.
The view is spectacular, and with the amount of construction going on in Dubai it will only get better.
DRINKS IN THE SKYBAR. Great view for drinks although exceptionally expensive two drinks £70.00 per person, although the ambience and the views are great its still an ouch!!!

Each time it gets better. This is the 3rd time we've had brunch in the Skyview restaurant (Al-Muntaha), it simply can't be faulted. Food is exquisite, atmosphere great, views outstanding.
The whole experience simply gets better each time.

GREAT. Great building on the planet! For 2 minutes you are on 139 floor.
It is amazing. All is done very well.
The iconic building!. Has to be visited once if you go to Dubai. This buildings profile is evocative of the new Dubai. You need a reservation at the hotel or a restaurant there to get on the island.

Pure Luxury!. We had a trip here for afternoon tea (booked via Viator). Everything here is so luxurious! It's amazing to see. There was so much food in the afternoon tea and it was all home made and superb quality. Never quite had an experience like this. Would definitley recommend to anyone visiting Dubai. A must do!
High tea with a difference. This hotel is truly beautiful. Friends and I visited for high tea. 360aed for a wonderful treat to be remembered
boring. you cant do anything except for looking at it unless you have a hell lot of money. better visit at night , the day time it is too scorching for your skin
unforgettable experience. My husband and I had an afternoon tea at sky bar. It was unforgettable experience with breathtaking view and very excellent service.

3 Course Dinner at Burj Al Arab. Water was $25 and the tab was $450 USD for both my daughter and I to attend a 3 course meal at this hotel. Frankly, we went for the 'experience'. It was not worth it. The food was good but nothing to write home about. The view at night was sparkly but you couldn't really see anything.

Out of this world experience. Visited with friends to celebrate a birthday and just to have experienced such a worldwide known hotel. We had afternoon tea (Booking is a must - You will not be able to pass security onto the island without one) Prices are a little on the high side £120 approx(per person) but for a one off experience, well worth it. Greeted at the entrance and shown thru to the lift, Upon entrance to the Skyview bar we were again greeted and shown to our table, The food and service were second to none. A must visit venue.

tommahawk steak on a salt baord. We went to the top restaurant for a meal, we had a tomahawk steak on a salt carving board, oh my it was delicious! We had pureed mash and sorbets for dinner. We got a bit trapped when we were asked if we wanted a glass of champagne, at 50 pounds a glass, we didn't realise until we paid. ... Apart from the champagne, it was an amazing experience, just watch the champagne!!

Lunch at Burj al Arab-value for money?. As it is extremely difficult to enter the hotel if you are not a resident then one option is to book a lunch with a tour operator.I did this with viator. The cost was £205 per person for lunch including a pick up from and return to our hotel. We had lunch at the Al Muntaha restaurant on the top floor.Info for you if you are considering this is as follows-1. You get a set 3 course menu with a choice of 2 starters and 2 main courses.2. Meal excellent but the price is far too much just to enjoy the experience of a seven star hotel.3. Service and view excellent which you would expect.

Just look form the outside. Overrated, looks better outside than inside, very expensive which I expected however we waited 15mins to be seated in the skyview bar and received the wrong drink order twice which isn't good for 7 star service. Alcohol was very expensive but that is because it is a dry country, it was my dream to visit here and i finally did it but was left a little disappointed, alot of it just needs updating from the seats to the carpets stick to the 360 bar which is situated 100 metres away from the hotel in the middle of the sea surrounded by Jumeirah beach.
One of two seven star hotel in the world!!!. Its great thats all i have to say the food and service u mit have never seen in ur life. It has a hotel swimming pool football etc

The best hotel I have ever been in. We went to Dubai for my 60th birthday in December. We only went for a drink experience on the top floor . Every where we went was impressive if money is no problem this is the place to stay.
Must go. A Magnificent building. Must go just to look at it. It is easily accessible through public transportation system

just an ok building. I really dont understand why this is such a place to visit !I can admit Dubai is a really different city but this building is
for no reason famous!!!!

Brunch was incredible. My husband and I visited this spectacular hotel for Friday brunch , from the moment we entered the hotel we were treated like royalty . We arrived at 10.30 and we were able to eat what we wanted till 4pm . We booked a window seat and the view from our table was amazing . There is a huge choice of food here and the dessert buffet is out of this world . Although it is pricey I would recommend it to everyone going to Dubai , it's a once in a lifetime opportunity .

Landmark hotel of Dubai. This is the landmark hotel of Dubai and people say Dubai tourism increased after this hotel was build. It is on a manmade island on Jumeirah Beach. The Beach is near to it and the only place you can see people wearing swimsuit.

Amazing Building. this is an amazing building and great to get some fantastic photographs.If you have a booking for the restaurants or bar then you can get inside and view the beauty of the decor with the giant aquariums at the side of the escalators. It is all so opulent.

Simply Beautiful!. My husband and I had the pleasure of dining in one of the restaurants inside of the Burj Al Arab. From the time we stepped onto the property until the time we left, our experience was extremely enjoyable. The hotel itself is beautiful and the staff was phenomenal. Our views of the city while dining was extraordinary! We will definitely visit again when we come back to Dubai.
Best Experience. Any thing in Middleast is the best you can find. Burj Al Arab is mind blowing service is outstanding and Amazing.

Iconic building, but maybe a bit over rated.. The Burj Al Arab has a reputation as an iconic symbol of luxury in Dubai. It takes a bit of planning to get in as you cannot just walk in unless you have a reservation either for a suite (known as a room in other hotels!) or for a meal. Apparently there are also tours of some sort to the hotel judging by the number of people of all nationalities being bussed in, taking photographs and then leaving.The inside is pretty impressive, but not something I would necessarily be prepared to pay extra for just to see. It capitalizes on its reputation, but I do feel that the reputation is being surpassed by other places already built in Dubai and elsewhere in the world.I was a bit excited about the idea of going there before I went, because of its reputation, but now that I have "been there, done that" I feel I could say that maybe it is worth a visit, but be prepared to pay for the privilege.

nice hotel. very nice and UAE Dubai. It has been called "The world's only 7 star Hotel" and is the fourth tallest hotel in the world; however, 39% of its total height is made up of on-occupiable space.[7][8][9] Burj Al Arab stands on an artificial island 280 m (920 Ft) from Jumeirah beach and is connected to the mainland by a private curving bridge. The shape of the structure is designed to mimic the sail of a ship. It has a helipad near the roof at a height of 210 m (689 Ft) above ground.

The Most Expensive Hotel in the World. The Most Expensive Hotel in the World with 7th Star Class.This Hotel was located at Palm Jumeirah area and one of the most expensive hotel. We can't take a photo at the lobby. You have to reserve for dinner with the amazing price of US$300 per person.

Afternoon tea . You need to book it , and then you can walk across the bridge into the most lavish hotel lobby you may ever have seen , while most of the other restaurants are off limits , the afternoon tea is sublime and top sophisticated . What a photo opportunity too . A major attraction. ThT not everyone gets to see .
Nice to say that you went. You have got to do it really spectacular views and definitely a huge record breaking landmark. Take a few hours out and go visit it

Worth a visit . The burj Al Arab hotel is a very interesting and quite stunning exterior the very long drive up can make you feel you are entering somewhere very special once through the grand entrance it's a very busy and glitzy decor for me a little overdone in taste.. A lot of money spent but i wouldn't say in the best way but its different.. as you go up the escalator the whole wall is an aquarium to relax the visitor after their long flights there are also dancing fountains for our entertainment lots of red and gold paint around to give it the luxurious feel. good to see for a visit but i feel much too overdone but ok for a tourist attraction.typical Dubai hotel really has mainly Russian occupancy ultra expensive & all rooms are suites
An iconic landmark of Dubai. Whether you want to spend £100 on tea and cakes or just take a few snaps from Jumeirah Beach - it is worth it!
Wonderful Stay. We juct stayed there for just 2 hours but i loved the stay and also had a good view around. Good place to visit
wow. Worlds tallest building, amazing !!!located outside Dubai mall and next to water fountain great trip.

Nice to see different structure. It is nice to see something different but going inside of this building will cost you $$$$$$$$$$ You can make reservation for highnoon tea for $150.00 per person then gard will let you go inside.

Stay or stay away!. Having considered it as a main attraction of Dubai before arrival.It is visible from many parts of town also.Decided to see it from close by.Well closest I could get was about 200meters.Security does not allow U any closer.Unless U staying as a guest of course.So how could I give it a good rating?
Dubai`s post card. Unfortunately I couldn`t book a reservation at any restaurant but will definitely try again on my return to Dubai

An amazing engineering feat!. Had dinner here many years ago when it first opened & now just love to look at this place from the beach. What an amazing building & a fantastic place to be shown round if you get the chance. All that glitters IS gold in the Burj!
Expancive. It was very expencive to enter the beach round it, otherwise you can drive round and the beach is free, you need only to pay for the parking. The enter cost 500, prox 25 euros.
DUBAI ADVENTURES. Just took awesome pics of the hotel and is amazing, so modern, the architecture is one of a kind, just Dubais signature

Afternoon tea in Skyview bar. Afternoon tea in Skybar was expensive, but perhaps worth it. There was plenty of small bits to eat, a glass of champagne (refill was very expensive) and limitless tea. Skyview bar reminds me of boats sailing between Finland and Sweden - same 80s style. The Burj al Arab is a sight in itself and its worth visiting.
luxurious weekend. Amazing architecture...The butlers are magnificent and will try to accommodate your every whim. Well worth it for a once in a lifetime experience .

Simply stunning. Amazing afternoon tea in sky view restaurant. Fabulous venue with stunning views. Wonderful tea that left us full to bursting. Staff extremely friendly and welcoming. Can't praise this experience enough. Will certainly repeat next visit.

My Second Stay at the Dubai Intercontinental Airport Hotel. Every time I fly from the United States to Tabuk, Saudi Arabia where I currently reside, I now stay one night at the Dubai Intercontinental Airport Hotel to rest up and await my flight to Tabuk the following day. This has now become a habit. Once again there was someone from the hotel to greet me with my name sign and he escorted me to the hotel. My husband had paid for a junior suite for me and when I arrived in the room, well, there were several rooms in the suite, it blew me away! There was a massage chair, huge walk in shower, large sunken tub, a comfortable bed with down comforter and huge pillows that you just wanted to throw yourself down on it! There were two juice pitchers filled and plates of goodies! Top notch toiletries in the bathroom. A coffee maker that used the pods. Free water bottles and a mini bar which I did not use. I got room service for breakfast at about 2 a.m. when I woke up from my long nap, having checked in at 12 p.m. noon the previous day and it was fantabulous! I requested a wake up call for 8 a.m. because my flight left for Tabuk at noon. I never heard the phone ring, I was so tired and in such a deep sleep. At 8:15 a.m. one of the female desk staff came into my room and awakened me! Now that is going above and beyond the call of duty! I am also a smoker and though they did not have smoking rooms, they did, however have a smoking room next to the entry desk. When it came time to leave, one of the employees escorted me to the place where I would catch a bus van to get to the terminal I needed. The one thing you must remember is NOT to go through customs or exit the airport. The hotel is for transients only. For my next flight, my husband said he was going to get me a business suite! Regardless of the room size, you get top notch service! It is so very worth it if you have a lengthy layover.

Lovely to look at but......... It's quite staggering to look at this building and alas that's all I did as it's so very expensive but you can get a tour round it or have afternoon tea which is more affordable for mere mortals.

Very nice hotel, food was ok.... The Burj al Arab is a great hotel, the food was alright however the prices are ludicrously expensive. It's the only 7 star hotel so I honestly think it's worth it. The rooms are bigger than 10 normal sized rooms from an average 4 star hotel put together. The bathtubs are awesome. The beds are oversized and the setting is romantic and exacting at the same time. If you have a lot of money to spend in Dubai, then definitely stay here.
worlds largest CHRISTAIN CROSS. worlds largest CHRISTAIN CROSS, the best think is to visit is we have to go in tramp to reach over there
Wonderful experience. Really out of this world experience.Was offered a deal so was really worth.Beautiful surroundings and infrastructure.Superb rooms and delicious menus.
Amazing Architecture. The architecture is amazing and a place not to be missed if you are travelling to Dubai..Also take a walk down the beach if you happen to visit the place..
up above the world so high .... unbelievable architecture and construction ...its mind boggling view from the top of al burj , a must visit place in dubai .

What a view.. Technology at its best. For sure a masterpiece - an architectural wonder. The detail in the design and even the smaller issues are really fascinating. Just visited not stayed there but the food and drinks are superb.
Wonder of the human mind.. Hard to believes your eyes from the top ,what a ride unbelievable human work and design ,breathtaking at the least .Once in a life time visit .
Amazing. There was amazing feeling when i reach there Hotel is Worlds luxuriest hotel where all the service is provided specially devices and crockery is made from gold

sky tea. visited for sky tea whilst on honeymoon
the experience was incredible, so much food and unlimited soft drinks to which there was a good variety
the service is second to none. staff very helpful and happy to take photographs for you etc.
definitely worth doing
Worth a photo!. Unfortunately you can't get particularly close but it's worth swinging by for a photo regardless. Not as large as we'd imagined, but an iconic building all the same.
Beautiful View. The view from almost any part of this structure is nothing short of breathtaking. very beautifully contructed and designed.
Brillant building. The Burj Al Arab is an amazing landmark which is a great place to visit since it is a good tourist destination. It is a great place to visit with the family.

IMPRESSIVE!!!!!. A very impressive building and stunning architecture at a very nice position! Unfortunately I didn't have the chance to see the building from the inside as it was not the hotel I was staying, but I took pictures outside and enjoyed the view a lot. I'll definitely visit Burj Al-Arab Hotel during my next visit in beautiful Dubai!

Iconic. This is onw hotel you cannot enter without reservation and to entre book a table ot pay Dhs 200 and entre...see the beautiful hotel and the Dhs 200 can be used to buy food...if you just want to see the hotel then you can have small snacks and a beer...if you wish then there have regular offers for breakfast for about Usd 75...
Burj Al Arab. 7 Star Hotel, it was our dream to go there, Went for a cocktail package there and it was booked with ABC Tours and it was realy great.. A very beautiful place

A disappointment they managed to turn around . I had afternoon tea here which I was incredibly excited for. When we arrived I was blown away by the hotel, although I find it completely over the top it was what I was looking forwards to. However when we got to the lifts up to the sky bar you had wait as they send you up one at a time. Which would be lovely if it was not a 15 minute wait with minimal seating. I am not sure why you would tell everyone to turn up at the same time for a sitting surely if you staggered this by even 5/10 minutes it would avoid this issue. - really disappointed by this. I am also a fussy eater. I know this but I don't make a big deal. They asked what we don't like which was nice and I gave a quick overview that I don't eat fish and cheese. Assuming that would be ok. Upon reading the menu I realised neither me or my partner would eat one of the courses so I said not to bother. However they sent up something they assumed we would like, which was a lovely thought. The issue came with the sandwiches. He mentioned a chicken one which I loved the sound of but never got and then replaced all the fish ones with veg ones that I do not eat but didn't feel the need to supply a full list of my eating. I didn't want to cause a scene but I asked where the chicken ones were. He mentioned because there was Mayo in there he didn't bring them. I asked for some none the less but he wouldn't agree. Then another man came and had the exact same conversation with me and I asked again to have them. In the end my partner had to but in and I was getting frustrated as no one was listening to me. Then a 3rd lady (the manager) came over and it started once again. At this point I just said I didn't want to talk about it. She offered us a free cocktail and we accepted. My issue was not that they wanted to fix this my issue was that I was made to feel like I was causing an issue. One then implying it was our fault for not specifying before hand (not sure where we were meant to do this as we were not asked prior). I was very embarrassed by this situation and it was upsetting. However they did turn this around the rest of the tea was beautiful and me and my partner were offer a tour of the hotel as an apology - amazing touch. Overall I think the problem was almost over service. They were trying to hard to please us which made me feel incredibly awkward and embarrassed. But they did turn it around and it ended up being a nice afternoon. Oh and the gift at the end was a lovely touch!I am glad I did this tea and have seen the hotel - but personal wouldn't need to go back under my own cost.

To the TOP. We booked and went to the top and it is spectacular!Lift ascends quickly after our guided foyer view with background of the buildings development. Terrific and fun photos professionally taken. Lovely souvenirs are available for purchase.

Bucket List Must Do. Wow, scale is impressive, and while the Chinese are building some super scrapers to be finished 2018-9, this place is going to be hard to beat. Went to 124th / 125th floor viewing platform, worth the $50aud each to do so, great gift show and souvenirs to choose from, awesome views of Dubai 360 degrees. Do it.

Best Afternoon Tea!. No visit to Dubai can be complete without visiting this iconic hotel. Since pre-bookings are required, it is wise to book the afternoon tea. Served in the lobby atrirum, it gives you great view of the hotel from the inside. Post tea, you can take a tour and go to the restraunt on their higest floor and enjoy the panoramic views of the town.Its really worth it!
dream land. great and fun.. unique has many advantures..shopping and food.. music and hotels can't found else where..

MAKE A RESERVATION FIRST! Worth checking out. Make sure you make a reservation at the restaurants or hotel instead of doing a walk-in as they would not allow those without any to drive in to it. Has free valet parking (YAY!) and the Japanese buffet is probably the cheapest alternative of getting into the Burj and getting an adequate amount of foods for the price you're paying (560 dirhams per person). Shopping for the things inside are only for those that are carrying over 10,000 dirhams as everything were super pricey, but well worth it just to get in and see everyone being shooed off at the gate cause they didn't make their reservations LOL.

The unique icon of Dubai. Is anyone visited this magnificent structure in the shore of Jumeira and not get stunned by the greatly engineered unique building. The hotel is innerly and outerly unforgettable, as everything designed for perfection. Undoubtedly this is number one must see in Dubai.
Burj al arab. Just amazing to see and wonder its qualitu, height, spectacularly made and shines in the sun, the reflectins are amazing

Feel the Difference. It's a hotel built for the super rich. The place oozes class from all the corners. Right from the time you enter the hotel till the time you exit it, you feel like you are in a different world.The hotel has some amazing restaurants. Al Mahara is one its best. It is a seafood restaurant with an underwater feel because of its wall to ceiling experience. Dining here is like dining in a sheikh's palace.

Amazing. We did afternoon tea here and it was worth every penny. The building is amazing and the food exquisite. They catered for everyone. The staff were friendly and welcoming. The entertainment was gigantic harp and just elegant. Dress up, the more extravagant the better. Very fancy location and you need to look the bizz.
A view to a kill. A must to have a bite, lunch, dinner or afternoon tea from the top restaurant of the Burj. Bit pricey but worth a trip, amazing views and breathtaking decor.

Incredible and Unaccessible. The topest Hotel from dubai has to be visited from inside, unless you are a client of the place a fine of 50 euros has to be paid, which sounds normal to protect the privacy of thoose who pay huge amount for a night saty

If you like Vegas: you will like this hotel. Not my thing.. If you love Vegas: you will love this hotel.We almost cancelled our trip to Dubai as all friends were coming back with feedback that Dubai is another Vegas without gambling. This hotel is totally Vegas.Over the top on every level.Not my thing.
Rich And Royal. Each and everything used in Burj Khalifa is a Rich and royal product, even if it is the toiletaries inside the washroom.

Room Was Stunning plus Bucket List Ticked. Most reviews tell you this is luxury and it is without a doubt, i was very lucky to get this 2 nights in a flash sale and when you arrive at the hotel you are met and taken upto your own floor and to your room straight away with paperwork being done there and honestly you will go wow as you realise you have entered your room not another hotel lobby.The breakfast was of very good quality but I have had 5 star hotels that have been better.There are faults with this hotel like there would be in any hotel in the world :) we had a very rude member of staff at the pool one day and a few other tiny problems but overall this is sheer luxury and we loved our 2 nights but for us the luxury did come at a cost of relaxation as it was a bit too posh for us and we felt out of place and did not felt welcomed into the hotel, they were 100% professional but not warm with it, hard to describe but we would go back to Al Qasr in a heart beat but we both agreed a beautiful place but not for us.

A little taste of luxury. We had a splendid afternoon tea on the 27th floor. The inside of the building is beautiful. Expendive but if you have the funds go for it ... Enjoy! You've paid to come to Dubai, you may as well experience an Icon. It's tasty too :)

Panoramic Views at high tea. We came here for high tea, and it was really beautiful inside. The environment was a bit stuffy, especially if you aren't staying at the hotel, but it was still worth heading there for the views. You are really propped off the side of the Burj Al Arab, and you have amazing panoramic views. The tea and pastries were good, but the motivation here really is the view not the food.
7 perfect Star. A brilliant, and the only seven 7 star hotel in the world, I had the privilege to visit. everything is on point, and falls short of NOTHING.

Superb. Booked afternoon tea but unfortunately children under 21 not allowed in the bar. However we got to eat in the restaurant on the 27th floor which was absolutely brilliant. Meal was fabulous and so was the service. Lorna a credit to the hotel and to the UK .
7 star for a 7 star. exquisite hotel. excellent and beautiful decor. very clean even the toilets are luxurious. beautiful aquarium too

great looking hotel....... Hotel looks great and location was brilliant. We had food at the Al Muntaha and to be honest it was very very overpriced for the quality of food served. Horizons restaurant at the Amwaj Rotana hotel served good food and suggest the chef at Al Muntaha pays a visit to see what good food is. Service and Greeting was average....... once again Horizons team at Amwaj Rotana can maybe assist you in some way.

The rooftop. Breath taking, defiantly have to see and visit. We had a golf buggy pick us up every journey to and from the hotel.The hotel is amazing, you see things you didn't think you ever would inside a hotel.Such class and decorum.

Afternoon Tea a Delight. We had afternoon tea the food was amazing, even the pastries had gold leaf on them very decadent, booking is essential as they are extremely busy. Very professional staff .The ladies are wall to floor glass which is a little off putting if you suffer from a fear of heights.

Good Experience. Went for the buffet dinner here and the food was amazing. You pay for your own drinks so beware as they offer you water and tea and coffee after your meal and you are charged for it. We had a bottle of water, 1 cup of tea and 2 cocktails and it came to AUD $180.
You can view from the beach................. But unless you are one of the Super Rich it's probably better to be in awe of the architecture of this lovely building from Jumeirah Beach!

Great views but incredibly overpriced. A trip to the penthouse bar will set you back a lot of Dhirams for a cocktail and pretty poor service but the view and glimpse into this incredibly vulgar and extravagant hotel is worth it. Amazing how people trot along the red carpeted guilder corridors in their wet swimsuits. Do use the loos and checkout the gold taps and marble!
A bit pricey but great. Went for high tea, something quite special! Normally don't indulge in this type of thing but the whole experience was great.
once in a life shall experience. Upper restaurant has nice view, but personally I prefer dinner at lower level. Service is good, very good. All the restaurants have great choice of wine!
Burj Al Arab. This is such a great hotel to see. It is beautiful inside and out. If you get a chance check out the high tea at the top. It's pricy but great views.
Disappointed. Too glitzy not my sort of hotel very expensive for evening meal not worth cost but amazing views from the restaurant
Luxury Hotel. Amazing architecture, very nice hotel, a bit far from city centre but you have to take a taxi in Dubai anyway, so the distance doesn't matter

7 star hotel. Been here last 2009 and up to this moment am still in awe whenever I think of my experience there! The rooms are just so amazing from the condiments up to the service. Well deserved to be graded as a 7 star property. But foods/services, etc. are really for people who have money as everything is expensive.

Champagne afternoon tea is a MUST!. Amazing afternoon tea in the Sky lounge with glass of champagne is worth the £100+. 7 course menu and you can keep ordering more sandwiches, teas etc. You will definitely be full up. Views are spectacular. This is a must experience in Dubai.
Nice building. Nice view as we were covered with sweat standing on the beach to take the picture. We got a leaning tower of Pisa angle looking like it was held up with our finger tips.

We didn't want to leave!. When we booked it was described as a high tea......this is so much more! this is one of the most exclusive hotels in the world and you can't just walk in.....the truly beautiful design and inclusions in this hotel are remarkable. We were made to feel welcome the minute we arrived....the entrance is breathtaking. The high tea was first class and the waiters service was second to none, you can have a choice of cocktails, champagne, tea (endless choice) and beautiful coffee...not just any high tea.....they do not rush u - we arrived at 7pm and left after 10pm even though our tickets indicated it was for an hour. This is a must and definitely under sold by travel agents!
HOTEL. Another "Must See " places in dubai... The first only 7 star Hotel in the world... It stand tall on the man made beach....
Afternoon Tea :-). Iconic Hotel, maybe not to everyone's taste, but the Afternoon Tea served here should provide something for everyone.Loved it
Beautiful hotel. I have not been to this hotel. I didn't entered into the hotel. I saw from outside only. Nearest beech is very good

The Only 7 Star Hotel. Burj Al Arab Was Amazing It Had Everything You Possibly Want Free Wifi With A Lounge A Resturant A lot Of Stuff Made Out Of Gold Everything Even A Nice View Showing You The Jumeriah but I say If You Go There It Will Be Expensive Afcourse! because It's the Only 7 star Hotel in The World Bussiness Man Go There A lot For Their Work. THANK YOU✋

wow. Only did brunch but it was amazing, there is anything you want to eat here, and if you cant see it you just have to ask. The views as expected were awesome and the journey to the restaurant itself was amazing, seeing the foyer was breathtaking with all that colour

A landmark that has to be seen. This is definitely the landmark of Dubai and a must to see - we had dinner there and a little visit - I must admit, we were happy we did not stay there (it was too overwhelming for us), plus the fact it is far from Dubai town.
WOW. was just speechless when i first saw this place.. infact this was on my fist visit to dubai..must see for all
Pricey but memorable. Had a visit to the top roof bar. Nice drinks and service (as expected). Fun to have seen the place from the inside.

Great stay - But. Stayed here last August for 1 night, the room was amazing, the butler service attentive and not over done, the spa is the best i have been to, lunch was good, dinner was ok, I always expect a bit more form the Bruj and it always seems to disappoint me when i eat here.underground bar is also very nice

Beautiful Building. The Burj Al Arab is an incredible building that can be seen from miles away. I recommend walking along the local public beach where you can get a beautiful picture with the sand, water, and Burj Al Arab in the background.
Opulence. Visited the skyview bar for drinks with friends.The hotel is beautiful, gorgeous architecture, amazing water fountain, exquisite fittings. A must visit, great views at night.

Like a 70's Bond Flick. Extremely entertaining interior design. Extremely expensive rooms (we didn't stay there) . Pretty expensive, but just okay dinner. However, you need to have dinner there or stay there to be admitted to the grounds. Very cool to tour this fantastical place.

A marvel . This is a building which put the city on the map. No question about it. Unique architecture in a unique location with a unique (at the time) approach to service. Returning to it many years later it's hard not to notice the dated interior design which is still as kitschy today as it was at the opening. It still bills itself as 7 star, owing to the ratio of staff to guest I'm told. It's true the service is as attentive as ever, and there is still the impression that no expense is being spared to make the place stand out. That said, something has changed and it's hard to explain what. Maybe it's time for a renovation, simplifying down that extreme approach to interiors and giving it all a fresh look. Surely it will not ever fall off any dubai tourist itinerary any time soon, but somehow it feels like it could use a boost.

The world's only 7 star Hotel. Amazing experience been visiting this hotel . Wow .. all gold plated . i had wonderful time to visit nearly 90 % of the hotel . I feel Crazy with the Atmosphere . Perfect Hotel i ever seen in my life.
Amazing looks and sevice. This hotel is the best hotel I've ever been to i'd recommend it to anyone that has a lot of money and to anyone that loves looking good

Beach pics. Saw this from Umm Suqeim beach. It seemed a lot closer than what I had seen in pictures, and a lot smaller.
Right near the fishing harbour, where you can do a lot of watersports.
This is a must.. Easy access via the mall, and a very organised pre bookable time slot. You are quickly to floor 124, & can take the stairs to the next level, which has better viewing areas.

Best Seven Star Hotel. Best Seven Star Hotel...
NIce Room Nice Views Best Location
Food is the Best
Too many shopping stores
Malls are the best

Magnificent structure. This hotel is considered as 7 star as per dubai standards but ideally it is a 5 star hotel. You cannot simply visit without an appointment even if it is for a breakfast or dinner. Make sure you book your appointment in advance. Very expensive though
The only 7 start hotel in the world. This hotel visit is not to be mssed. Worth visiting the top floor for views of Dubai and the beach. Did not stay here as could not afford too. worth a visit !

Luxury to the maximum level. Stayed for 1 night ! Luxury to the maximum level ! the room is two floors and the size of an apartment ! you get your own butler (one per floor) ! The beach is amazing ! By night I recommend taking a tour on one of the golf karts around the Hotel and Beaches !
Amazing building. We didn't stay in the hotel but we wanted to go and have a look and so we had to have tea there as you can't just go have a look. The building is stunning and the food is good.

Loving it. We were passing by during our daily trip around Dubai with the open top bus. When we arrived close to Burj Al Arab we jumped of the bus enjoyed a walk on the beach to take few pictures of this iconic building. Unfortunately we were not lucky to have an opportunity to see it any closer or the visit one of the bars and restaurants. There is a minimum spent and you have to book far in advance.

The Golden hotel. An amazing luxury hotel. We went for afternoon tea as a treat for our honeymoon. We were able to explore the hotel on arrival and enjoy the giant fish tank before being taken to the Sky bar. The staff wet all. Extremely polite, helpful and friendly. The food was amazing and presentation fantastic. Definitely somewhere to consider going for a special occasion.

Drinks con spoilt the experience. We booked for a lunch visit. Food was v. good but watch out for the con. They ask you what drinks you would like failing to inform you that the drinks are not included in the Package and suggest a lovely champagne For 2 drinks have another £200 at the ready. I wrote to the Hotel but did not get a response. Wont be returning but only because we were ripped off. By all means visit for the experience. Just don't drink.

one of the oldest. i guess burj al arab is the first and the oldest and beautiful attraction...it is the most expensive hotel were one can enjy sea view and beach...the hotel itself is build on a beach

Heaven on the 24th. It's great that you have to book. Luxurious interior. Staff are attentive, our assistant had some great suggestions for cocktails. they are pricey but very tasty. We had the burgers ( more like sliders) and they were super tasty. You cannot book a window view but they will come and offer you seats as they become available. All in all a great location, a great venue, a really nice treat for someone special ( including myself!)

Afternoon tea . Where ever I go abroad I always try and sample afternoon tea somewhere.What a place to try it!It wasn't too expensive. Delightful afternoon tea served in perfect surroundings. The staff accommodated my dietary requirements with ease and were so polite. Loved the champagne South I simply had to have a second glass.... And a third :)Superb experience. What a treat. I recommend 100%

Beyond a certain height it all looks the same. The best way to get an idea of a city is to go to the highest point. Trust me, it does not get higher than this. The walk to the lift is good, with some nice interactive displays. Its brings home the point on how high the building actually is. The ride up is smooth, and you can easily spend some time loitering around up there.Tip: try and catch the sunset from up there.

OTT and not in a good way. I have visited here before but do not remember it being so pretentious. Arrived 10 minutes early for our booking and were told we had to be there precisely on time so we went away and came back. Escorted upstairs and were then asked to sit again and wait to be escorted into the bar. Finally got seated but it was all too fussy.Ordered a gin martini with a a twist of lemon; it was good but came with lime. Did not bother to send it back as it was not worth the hassle. When came time to order another I asked for lemon and the server said "you are changing now"? I replied "no it was always lemon" and he then said "you ordered lime before" and then proceeded to argue with me! Not impressed. Views are terrific but the hotel is really garish and I do expect an order to be right, without an argument, when you spend £130 for 4 drinks. No, I will not be back.
Great dinner at a fantastic restaurant. Great dinner at a fantastic restaurant with great staff , the fish tank is an amazing experience , a must do for all !!!

Experience that will not be forgotten!. This place is magical! Live the life of Royalty if only for a few days. Was blown away when I walked into my suite number 1306 and saw the view. This hotels ambiance and décor demands that one dresses to the surroundings. It is expensive but if you want a taste then stay here. Everything from the breakfast to a sandwich is perfect.The treatments at the spa at a level not experienced previously. The service provided by the butlers cannot be faulted in any way. They feel they simply cannot do enough. A very special thanks from the children to Feroz Alam.Definitely a hotel that will be visited again very shortly.
good. lovely view stopped off on the big bus tour. great picture opportunity, could also see this from wadi water park

Hasn't changed since it opened. I understand why people stay here, my family have ourselves but honestly I wouldn't go back. This hotel is very luxurious but it does need some changes bringing. We Stayed here in 2004 for 1 week, it was beautiful. However, my mother has recently gone for afternoon tea with some of her friends and says it hasn't changed at all and that all the gold and Arabian style is authentic but feels it needs something fresh bringing to it.

7 Stars to Heaven! . This was an absolutely awesome experience! We booked afternoon tea at the Burj Al Arab as part of our 22nd year Anniversary and It far exceeded our expectations! We hired a Bentley to take us to the hotel and were warmly greeted by every member of staff we met. The reception was Grand and busy with lots of people taking photos, so we went up the escalator to the lifts for the Sky View Bar. Most people were given their own lift to travel the 24 floors, with fabulous views of the sea and the Palm. At the top we were greeted and seated efficiently with a view to take your breath away. We were asked about which champagnes we wanted and had the menu explained to us, all we had to do was sit back, relax and eat the many platters that were put in front of us! Finally we were invited to have cakes from the extensive selection!We cannot fault this Afternoon Tea, everything was excellent, nothing was below standard and we had a fantastic Anniversary afternoon thanks to the staff. We were not rushed at any time, and when we went back to the ground floor we were able to browse the shops and jewellers and purchase items in our own time! Thank you Burj Al Arab for my Red rose and Special Anniversary cake - we are going to find it very hard to top this Anniversary! You deserve every one of your seven stars!

Wow, impressive. The setting is picture perfect, design is one of a kind and opulent. Currently billed as the most luxurious hotel in the world, staff are attentive and professional as you might expect. High tea is not cheap at around £220 for 2 adults, 1 child. But it's 7 courses, beautifully done and an experience. Glad we did it. Once is probably enough though, unless you are staying at the hotel.
Amazing Architecture. An amazing architecture. View from the beach area to take great photos. Arrange to have a half day tour through Arabian Adventure tours
Bur Al Arab. A must see in Dubai. The waterworks are exceptional. A lot of good restaurants . The shops and other attractions are excellent .

Expensive, luxurious, wealth and 7 stars. We visited to celebrate our wedding anniversary, so it's not something we can do every year. Think of Ritz or something similar.We tried our luck the taxi took us to the security gate, it's not near the Burj Al Arab, if you want to just take photos you be wasting your time. I'm not here for photo's already seen the documentary of the beautiful place being built.We asked if we could go in for a drink and snack and they asked if we had reservation which we didn't and would like to book but they asked us if we were interested in afternoon tea. I know its not your average Starbucks or Costa.We went in and a golf buggy took us to the main entrance. After we went in on first floor we were greeted and took us to our table, for the next 4 hours or so we had Champaign sandwiches cakes and even minute steak meal. The experience was great the food and drink was out of this world. Was it worth it, well YES, I've paid more watching a football game (Chelsea FC Hospitality), figure skating, ice Hockey both Vancouver Olympics, even F1 Abu Dhabi 2014. This is one of my dreams come true. For 4 hours I was in the millionaire league.We even had live classical music.
Visitor. Fantastic building and architecture. A sight to behold. Mesmerising and beautifully breath-taking. Great hotel and rstaurants.

Wanna feel like King ? Visit Burj Al Arab. Burj Al Arab does not need any recommendation or review! it's a eye catcher structure it self.... on bay of gulf most amazing and royal treatment you've ever expect from any hotel!
Place to Visit. I have been there with Friends and spend almost 2 Hours time all around. Burj Al Arab is one of the most Great place in Dubai and situated near Jumeirah Beach..
the tower of arabia. the magnificant hotel or the tower a 7 star hotel a most beautiful hotel in the world with all the amenities.
Burj Al Arab Beautiful Building. Burj Al Arab for me an special attraction because beside the tower is the Wild Water Park is too an special attraction
Magnificent . World's most luxurious hotels. Amazing view and design. True and honest description of the mix between traditional and modern architecture.
Awesome!. Great Architecture! Lovely city. Many nice places to visit. Great food and shopping! Definitely place to visit

Nice to do, but quite expensive. Not quite sure how it's seven stars, but it is very nice regardless. You need to reserve a table in advance at one of the bars to get in, a few days should be enough. When you are in the bar, they move people around as people leave, so you'll get a nice window seat at some point.

Unreal experience. We visited here for dinner, which cost around 1250 AED for two. It is expensive, so be prepared, but it is simply stunning. We ate in a buffet style restaurant and the food was incredible. The service is like nothing I have ever experienced. The design of the building is beautiful, and it really is the world's most luxurious hotel.
World's beautiful hotel. World's beautiful hotel.. amazing experience.. it's expensive but worth to visit there.. i love their breakfast..
VIP place. I had the chance to visit this hotel recently, although you must have a reservation to enter, it is worth the visit. Its imposing and a new experience culinary wise

The excellent view of the Wave Hotel and the Islands. We take an coctail on 27 floor and they Bring to us an excelent treat, the most beautiful place to see the view and the food was wonderfull. We drink Lady Marmalade, Adriano of India, other Icon of Burjaca Al Arab, they tradicional beverage, Other was The art of the Mixologist, is a craft of mixing caktails. The last one Taste the rainbow, is one of valentines day worlwide. We aré four ladies. They bring some things to eat likemacadamias, olives with alcachofas, almonds, and little cakes with caviar. Then desserts like Tiramisu, Apple Beignet, Chocolate cake, and cheeses. Finally capuchino with cakes of pistachios. All and each with flakes of gold. Wonderful time We have.
An experience!. We had to go here, at least once! It was an extravagant treat which we thoroughly enjoyed. We had cocktails, drinks and snacks and received exceptional service as you would expect!

High Tea at SkyView- Amazing. High tea at the Sky View is an experience that everyone should try. It is not your normal tea, sandwiches and cakes - high tea here is at a different level, a 7 course high tea takes some beating alongside a breathtaking view
Good Photo Location. Good hotel to watch from out side once a gr8 dubai landmark but now nothing gr8 to watch. Just near the Dubai Beach
The best hotel. We took a taxi to go visit the Burj Al Arab hotel. This hotel has got to be one of the best hotels in the world. You will go speechless marvelling the architecture of this place.
Lovely place.... Really nice place and lovely hotel..Great customer service.lovely beach but the sand was super hot, overall 10 out of 10
Awesome. Lots of people in this area, its best to go in the evening when all the lights are on. Its quiet impressive.
Honeymoon-the hunt for zen. Had afternoon tea here on the last day of our honeymoon. Although expensive it was definitely worth it! Food was exquisite and service was second to none.

Seven Star aren't enough.. When you arrive at the Burj Al Arab you immediately get the sense of Royalty. The first thing you notice upon arrival are the taxi's. The taxi's are now Mercedes, Lexus, Range Rovers etc. As you walk into the building the walls are lined with portraits of Kings and Princes. Once you enter the lobby you are enticed by the Gold plated everything. The escalators are flanked on the sides with wall sized aquariums with a beautiful dancing water fountain between the escalators. The Concierge desk is staffed by a very friendly and professional staff. Everything about the hotel announces excellence and beauty from the dozens of flowers bouquets made up of miniature roses to the numerous Swarovski crystal pieces, to the vast array of colors and craftsmanship that went into the design of the hotel. Glass elevators take you to your floor were you will find your very spacious and luxurious room. Lying on the bed makes me wonder what lying on a cloud would be like. The rooms have beautiful views of Dubai and the Persian gulf. The hotel has several wonderful restaurants within but my favorite is the Al Muntaha which is at the very top of the hotel and is unbelievably gorgeous with the best food you will find anywhere.

Visit of a lifetime. This place was simply something else.A true 7* Hotel,very exclusive and no entry without a booking /reservation .The dancing fountain at the lobby was a treat,you could spend hours watching it.We had lunch at the Al Mahara restaurant "with the sharks and the stingrays" amongst numerous other fish in the aquarium.Superb personal service and food,and the bill when you add the champagne! but worth itAn experience of a lifetime,worth spending the money,no regretsThe Lobster salad is not to be missed.

Stop over . Stayed here in a beautiful suite. Two bedroom suite with so many goodies. Gorgeous bathrooms, bedrooms, living room and office space. Play station game system for the boys and delicious chocolates. We were so spoiled and was loving it.
Must see. Spectacular looking hotel. Did not see up close but from about quarter mile. Still a quite awesome experience.
Luxury and High class experience. We had dinner at Junsui restaurant. All the experience as unforgettable. Luxury, great asian cuisine, and exceptional service given.
Wow. A must see. It is just jaw dropping inside, we had a high tea that was scrumptious, even that had specs of gold on it. Unbelievable

Must be done..... HGas to be seen atleast once in your lifetime.
Interior is amazing - afternoon tea is very good as well.
Lids loved the fountains.
Sky bar is pretty views in the evenings.
Room sare tro die for.
Over indulgent and luxurious.
Infinity pool on the 26th floor is amazing.

We visited the attraction (hotel) as on the public beach next door!. Son took photographs of all the expensive cars parked there- entrance next to wild Wadi over a road which has security on- but the guys were nice and allowed him to photograph the cars which he enjoys doing!
Excellent location- unfortunately out our price range!
Amazing. Very nice place and deserve the money you will pay for, also you can use the public beach near to and it is very good one and you will enjoy full day there

Trip to the top, but not quite. Nice trip especially if you can get one of the many discount vouchers that exist. Sadly there is a "trip to the top" and a VIP trip which takes you several levels higher... so a little disappointed but well worth the view... gift short is expensive but its a captured audience right and sells stuff you can only buy in this one location so probably worth it!!
Unique. This one-off institution is a once in a lifetime must do. Everything, from decoration, staff, suites is out of the norm. Love or hate its still a must do.
Burj Al China. views, views, and Chinese people. Great place to meet Chinese travelers who are keeping this place paid.

Wow!. We had been to Dubai many times and generally stay at the Jumeirah beach hotel. On a trip without the kids my husband and I decided to stay here for a night as a treat. We transferred on this occasion from the Atlantis hotel and called the Burj Al Arab in advance to see if we could check in early. They said this wouldn't be a problem but when we got there our room wasn't ready. This was the best part-as we got upgraded to a two bedroom suite! The rooms are breath taking. I have never stayed anywhere like it and although I'm writing this review 2 years later I can remember it like it was yesterday. We had a bathroom, study, 2 lounges and a kitchenette on the ground floor and two huge bedrooms with ensuites on the top floor. The floors were joined by a beautiful spiral staircase. This is luxury. The toiletries are all Hermes with aftershave and perfume included. Somebody is assigned to look after you and canapés were brought to our room around 5pm. The pool area was quiet but we were well looked after. The staff found us sun beds and brought over a cool bag for us with water and other goodies. Personally, we prefer something less quiet so we headed over to the more private pool at the Jumeirah beach which has a lovely swim up pool and a more vibrant feel. The hotel were kind enough to extend our checkout by two hours free of charge so we really felt we made the most of our time there. I would highly recommend staying here for a couple of nights. One slight downside is that it is less conveniently placed than the Jumeirah beach so waiting for a buggy is a pain.

Truely Amazing Hotel. I working in the hotel on the 24th Floor for three days in a conference suit. Firstly the drive up to the hotel is spectacular, you know you have arrived. The staff are so attentive to your needs and throughout the time I spent all the staff and the service was second to none. The view from the floor was not so good on the first day as the visibility was not so good. There is a restraint on this 24th floor and the view out to sea is spectacular and looks out to the Dubai World set of Islands. The lunch was served on the ground floor restaurant where there was so much choice you could spend all day just eating.The views outside are complimented by the view inside the hotel colours are vibrant bright with a large aquarium on the ground floor when you walk in to reception. there are small dancing fountains close to the shopping area on the first floor. Where you can find the major high end retailers.Because of the security and restrictions to access this hotel you can only see it form the beach or the driveway. You need to have some special access/pass to get into the hotel.

Nice food but disappointed!. Had afternoon tea last week - nice 7 course afternoon tea but was very expensive and didnt feel it was worth the money at all. The service was good but not outstanding and was not offered more tea and this was only served at the end. The ambience of the place was disappointing - not a good view and was not at all what i expected. Very disappointing although food was nice. Also we visited the ladies room which did not smell very nice either! All in all would not return.

Beautiful at night, with lights that change color !!! Futuristic building, spor. We have not stayed in the hotel and so we did not make us to the entrance but it is very beautiful seen a little further. We would have liked to enter, drink coffee at this self-proclaimed most luxurious in the world with 7 star . For best views, go for a swim at the beach in Umm Suqeim, both day and night.

Just Visiting buy what a extravagant place. We had an amazing experience while visiting the Burj while on business. While waiting for our meeting I have to tell you the lobby is something else to believe. We had our meeting and then we were lucky enough to get a tour of two rooms.One a single bedroom suite then a two bedroom suite... wow these are big. in fact huge. Huge sweeping staircase as you enter the suite. Amazing hotel and I hope my next visit will have me staying in this stunning hotel.
Amazing building. It is hard to not be impressed when you see the Burj from the outside It is massive and iconic. We didn't go inside because it was too expensive!

A must experience for those who respect themselves and their standard. Be swept and surprised. Literally.. This is the mother of all luxury and pampering. I've seen many nice places, but this is a unique experience by itself. If you can afford it, then you've got to try it. The colors, the attention to details, the quality, pushing the envelop to a new and brave level. In my opinion, as a businessman, do yourself a favor: spend sometime at Burj Al Arab. Not for the luxury and joy of the experience only, but to raise your taste and concept of what's possible. To me it's an investment in your mind and upper self.
Dinner. I went with my uncle for dinner, which was pricey but most definitely worth it.We had a great time and enjoyed the views and the complexity of the hotel.

Fantastic experience. Had afternoon tea. Bit expensive but was well worth the expense. The platters with sandwiches and cakes just kept coming out and the speciality teas were fantastic. Don't let the price put you off if you are celebrating something special as we were.
Out of this world. Went there for a juice in the lobby ! Had to pay a fee to enter ! Beutiful hotel ! Wish I can stay there one day
Luxury. I did not stay here but we spent the day in the Jumeriah Beach's Wild Wadi waterpark so we had the most amazing views over the the Burj Al Arab.

A Must Do In Dubai. Spent a wonderful and slightly expensive night at the Burj Al Arab. From the minute you arrive at the security gate and pass along the causeway you know you are heading somewhere special. This is further endorsed by the cars parked outside and the first impression. We were there only for drinks in the Skyview Bar, but we were still made to feel special, and the attention of the staff was second to none. Its defiantly a must do if you visit Dubai.

Sensual Overload, oppulent styling gone mad, visually sensational.. Our stay was older than September 2014, but there is not an older date on the menu.We stayed there as a mini-conference so thankfully it was just about affordable. As we arrived, Donald Trump has just landed his helicopter on the roof heli-pad and was coming down the main escalator. That set the scene for us. Having the butler unpack for us was a "challenge" for my wife and she vowed in future to pack certain "personal items of clothing" in cloth bags. The whole stay of 10 days was sensory overload. All restaurants served excellent foods, all staff were brilliant, we had great fun with them. We tried almost everything in the hotel with the exception of the "submarine" to the Al Mahara underwater resturant - it was inoperable.We managed on two occasions to get tables right out on the edge of the Skyview Bar - breathtaking. When the girls saw where we sat in the Skyview from a suite on the upper levels, they blanched and swore never to sit there again - you are on the edge of the world.Most amazing room we have ever stayed in and it was the basic Duplex Suite. What were the others like?What do you say about the Burj to top the fact it was awarded 7 stars.

Be Amaized. They say "not all what shines is gold" that will change visiting this 7 stars hotel, we have been to most of the restaurants in here, the skybar is perfect place to have some cocktails, and we also done the afternoon tea in skybar ... perfect

Tea at the Burj Al Arab. Lovely tea in the lounge on the upper floor with a view of all the luxury limousines in the front and the comings and goings of guests over the bridge. Very good service but no wow factor. For the price of a room, you had better have a few wows. Needs a new colour scheme as it screams too loud. Not refined enough for 6* luxury in look of the hotel, but certainly a very good team who work very hard to please!

We had a great dinner and really enjoyed seeing this hotel.. Being one of the most luxurious and tallest hotel in the world. You have to visit this place. You need to have a reservation to enter this hotel, but it will be worth it. Reservation either to restaurants, bar or checkin. We had a dinner reservation and also celebrated the birthday of our friend. We dressed up and really enjoyed our evening. Great food, great place and great experience. Even though it is costly, but still a great experience to be able to eat and see inside the most luxurious hotel in the world.

Beautiful Structure. Our tour guide allowed us to view this up close and from the water so that we could have amazing pictures. This structure is nice - we were not able to go inside of it but was able to see it from the outside. This is a must do when you come to Dubai

Excellent. This hotel is far the best I have stayed in around the world, All the rooms are suites and have amazing views.The service is 1st class in all parts of the hotel, breakfast was included in the package that I booked and the choice of food was outstanding, nothing is too much trouble to make if you have special requirements.The pools inside and outside are beautiful and clean with lots of lifeguards to watch over the children.The hotel is not cheap but is a must do at some point.
Sailing in the sky. Love the ionic silhouette, even better close up. Still looks brand new after 7 years. Does not fail to impress, good photo opportunities.
