Amazing. Located in Dubai mall , provides amazing views from amazing heights don't go there off the street will cost a fortune do it on internet 1day prior for best price or Agent

view of the Burj Al Arab from Jumeirah Beach hotel. I visited Dubai the Burj Al Arab and the sunset was beautiful view from the up town bar Jumeirah Beach hotel. You can have a drink at the roof top bar and enjoy the magnificent building.

The Sail Hotel. Didn't get to stay in the hotel but the view from outside is spectacular. We were told about the different amenities in the hotel which was quite amusing. The tour of the hotel is a must. Rooms cost roughly 7000 AED and plus per night.

Modern Day Feat of Engineering. We did the tour of this. The tour was pricey and beware at the top it is nothing but money money, even the trinkets were outrageously expensive. But this is Dubai and this is the Burj so -- you must see it anyway. The views from the top are really astounding and the building itself is truly a feat. if you go at certain times, it is cheaper. you can get tickets and access from the mall. all in all the tour is well organised and queues move smoothly. the guides are knowledgeable

Flawless hotel. I loved my stay at this hotel. I have stayed here twice and would again. All rooms are 2 floors with private butlers, beautiful décor and fantastic customer service. Hands down one of my favorite hotels in the world.

An experience worth doing once. Was one of the highlights of our stay in Dubai. We had afternoon tea at the Skyview bar. A window table gave an amazing view of the Dubai skyline and then saw the sunset. Service is superb, friendly and efficient .... but it is expensive

Loved the Burg Al Arab. Had the high tea at the hotel. It was expensive but worth it to spend a couple of very enjoyable hours at this famous venue. Plenty of food and the champagne was the best I have ever tasted.

Amazing architecture,quite stunning.. We didn't pay for the tour or could afford the hefty price for the high tea,but did a stop for photos on the hop on hop off bus,have to admit it is an amazing building and when we were told the Eiffel Tower would fit inside,that tells you something of it's "hugeness".
Just simply incredible. visited Skybar for afternoon tea. Just astonishingly good. See separate review I posted under for the afternoon tea.

More style than substance. It was at one time a must visit and having visited for dinner with my family which was excellent, drinks with friends also excellent but when I brought a large group for drinks and dinner on a business trip I was really dissapointed. On entering the sky lounge i was met my a blond lady who just started to quote me one drink prices for my group which was very poor service and spoiled my evening. The sense I got was that it was more about the money I could spend (which wasn't an issue) more than providing an excellent service. I did email the hotel after my visit but did not receive a reply. The Burj Kalifa is a better experience with some excellent dining options.
Burj Al Arab. Was in jumeriah beach and took photos with this hotel. Excellent view and my next visit i will plan to stay in this hotel. excellent structure

fabulous. delight ful evening, fabulous food. Only problem was the continuous reiteration of the dress code for men. Once we accept, twice is iverkill, three times and it starts to feel as if you are thought to be worthy of the place.
Afternoon tea at the Burj. Worth visiting to say "I've been there" but I don't think I'd like to stay there as it seemed soulless to me
Dubai's Opulent Landmark. Good to visit, probably once is enough. It is an opulent landmark in Dubai that leaves little to the imagination.

An Amazing Hotel. There is a good reason why this is a Seven Star Hotel. The minute you arrive you are treated like royalty. We only went there for a meal yet we were treated so well. You are treated like a person not a number. The inside of the hotel is like no other and you will never forget it.
25th Anniversary Afternoon Tea. Wow what an exception hotel. Surprise lunch booked by my husband to celebrate our anniversary. The service was excellent, the food faultless. Highly recommended.

Quality. Simply put you will not be disappointed. We've stayed twice but only for 2 nights as part of a bigger holiday. This hotel excels in its service standards, an experience but we personally wouldn't stay solely here whilst in Dubai
Luxury Hotel- Afternoon Tea. You have to go to the afternoon tea. the food was amazing and the service even better. Also is a good place to take pictures and enjoy an excellent atmosphere.

Nice Building to look at!!!. Awesome building to look at and take pictures! One of the highest (Fourth) hotels in the World. Easy access and a nice area. Disliked: I don't have the $138K to stay in the "Royal Suite"!!!

What a night!. Had our anniversary dinner at the Burj Al Arab and do not regret it for a second. The service, food, wine, atmosphere and views were all 1st class. It is really expensive for the average person but I knew that before we went. We paid about $1000 AUD and didn't go overboard. The menu is sensational, caters for every taste and available online. The experience was well worth it and the staff made us feel very welcome.
Worth visit of Dubai landmark. Worth visit of one of the Dubai landmark, beside expensive prices of drinks inside. Good to take photos from outside from the beachside.

No Words!. Not many words I can express on the experience staying at the Burj Al Arab - save for Unbelievable! My friend and I stayed there on a guys trip to Dubai a couple of nites. The service - impeccable. You are greeted at the door with a person who checks you in. The "onboarding" process took about 30 mins at least and that was before we were introduced to our floor's butler who walked us through the workings of the room for another 10 mins. I loved that as they were professional, measured, organized. The Butler comes to provide the overview and to facilitate most any wish. Their desk is near the elevator and some will get up & push the elevator for you. People do come in and out of your room, but it is for following up on things, dropping things off - such as the divine mint lemon juice that was fantastic in slanted bottom glasses. Rooms are at least 1600 square feet. Try the Panoramic view rooms - Un-freaking-believable views! The infinity pool area was great. Massages are giving by same sex therapists. Gym has machines that track what you do, reps, effort, etc. Hermes soaps, deodorants, and lotions await. Cuticle creams (what is that really), treats, etc are delivered to your room w/o request. This is one splurge that should be tried. I went through American Express to get some extras such as the massages (free). You can ride in one of the Phantom Rolls Royces, or Mercedes S class cars for a fee. Detail - awesome, Service - Impeccable. As the saying goes, there's not a bad seat (room) in the house!
Beautiful. Was a great and beautiful structure in Dubai. I was highly impressed and it made up part of the marvelous skyline of the city.

Afternoon tea . Excellent food, really nice staff and an overall pleasurable experience. Would love to go again and try another dinning opportunity but the tea was sensational and worth every penny.If you ask the golf caddy drivers they will drive you to the sand for the best photographs They even made my daughters chicken nuggets and chips as a birthday surprise half way through the afternoon tea and and they played happy birthday to her on a wonderful violin and piano.
A lovely place to visit. I have been to this place, the structure is very beautiful and a lovely building, It has a fascinating view of beach.

Afternoon tea!. My husband, 14 year old son and I booked afternoon tea which was approx £300. It was 7 courses consisting of sparkling date juice, finger sandwiches and lots of sweet cakes. We weren't allowed in the Sky Bar as our son wasn't old enough so had to eat downstairs. It's nice to say we've eaten in the World's only 7 star hotel but I felt it was very expensive for what it was.
High tea. High tea here is just amazing and the only way to see this amazing hotel if you are not staying there

BRING LOADS OF WATER. Its great to see this building.. unfortunately I didn't get to go into it but you just have to get pictures when you go there! bring loads of water when sightseeing, it is just so hot and humid you need to keep hydrated.

Nice View, Worth a visit maybe once. In Dubai for 4 days and the Hotel is always somewhere I wanted to see (although I have been in the kitchens 10 years ago). My sons Girlfriend insisted we went so she could cross it off her list.We booked for the Skybar for Drinks and snacks at 7.30. YES you have to book and secure your booking with a credit card. Minimum spend PER PERSON is Dhrams 350 or about £70 so it's not cheap just for a drink. (BTW if you don' show they charge you 150 each on the card).You cannot get on to the island to see the hotel unless you are staying or have a booking of some kind so this is one way of seeing the interior of the hotel which is amazing. View from the bar (27th Floor) is OK, it was dark when we were there and I am told best time to go, due to the light, is 6 to 7.30 pm. If you want a better view, and you can see the Burg, try the JW Marquis Hotel (Tallest in the world) their Vault Bar occupies the 71&72 floor of the hotel, really nice).Range of drinks was good, service swift and attentive, bar snack menu limited but good quality. We had burgers (2 "sliders" at £36 per person so it not difficult to hit the minimum spend) and battered prawns!.Not sure I would rush back but worth the trip once.

Unique hotel, most expensive 7 Star.. This hotel sits on a manmade island and you can only go in if you are a guest or have restaurant reservations. Lobby is awesome with water fountains around the steps leading up to 2nd floor, elevators are gold plated, it's worth seeing. Arabic Buffet and Asian buffets are $100 to $150 per person. Asian buffet is not worth it but 2nd floor Arabic main buffet is good. There is also underwater restaurant, a novelty.

Overpriced. £274 for Ultimate Afternoon Tea, lovely food and staff,but you are sitting in a lobby with people coming in between your seats to take photographs out of the window! Can't access the Sky Tower if under 21.

One of the few Seven Star Hotels in the world. This iconic structure is one of the most expensive and luxurious hotels in the world. I photographed it as I passed on the metro railway. I only wish I could afford to stay there. Apparently it is incredibly expensive.
Must See and Must Visit. Unique 7 star hotel which deserves the best evaluation. Every detail is perfect. See pictures but see it on your own is the best

Go and see it. If you get the opportunity to visit this icon of Dubai then please do go and see it. If you have a friend with a Sirius Gold card then you can go any time, men though apparently arent allowed to wear shorts unless hotel guests, as I found out and after a short deliberation I was allowed to show my friend around anyway. Everything is expensive, much of it is worth it though. My last visit just involved drinks in the lobby lounge to show my friend the amazing worlds largest atrium, the fountains and over all splendour of the interior. It is impressive for sure, even if not specifically to my taste. Stop on the bridge on the way over to get the obligatory selfie, and take the time to wander around the areas you can see, and pause in amazement at the shops and what they have on offer. Breakfast is another option for a cost effective visit, do make sure you book though, as if your name is not down on the list you are not getting in!!
Exquisite-Burj Al Arab. Exquisite, fit for Royalty, excellent service at the high tea although we could not tatse some of the treats due to time, I think our tour guides show increase the tea time.

Oh look, its the burj. Its a fancy shaped hotel outside. Inside its the place that taste forgot. Catering to Russian/Arabic tastes of 15 years ago.
Gauche.
Beautiful Attraction near Jumeirah. A recognizable symbol of Dubai.I had my photos taken with the backdrop of this hotel from the Jumeirah Beach. It looks like a sailboat from afar.

Must visit landmark on your city tour. The tour buses go right in front of the beach that is close to the hotel, you get a great view of the hotel from there. If visibility was any better, it would have been an even better sight.

High quality experience. We booked the high tea in the afternoon. Quite glary sun but still beautiful view of the ocean. Service was excellent and the food was of a high standard. We didn't leave hungry at all. A bit pricey but worth the experience.

Tea time. We booked a tea time at burj al arab and it was an awesome experience. we were picked up by our own driver from our hotel and he then brought us to burj al arab. the tea selection left nothing to be desired

High class . Just brilliant! Not cheap but high tea at the Al Arab is a great experience! We were fortunate to ask for and receive a table on the window, pre booking a few months out and being 'off season' would have helped. Don't eat before hand, lots of food will keep you full, stick to menu and there will be no extra costs! Access to the Burj is restricted to those living there or having bookings, need to adhere to dress rules.
7 experience. The hotel is great, very flashy with a lot with activities, the restaurant with the aquarium is wonderful but the food was not worth it, common food for nothing extraordinary.

A must visit, if you are able to make a restaurant booking so that you can see this building up close. Unfortunately we didn't realise that to have a good look around , you need, at least to have a restaurant booking. No the less to see this amazing building up close is awesome and not to be missed

iconic building. Iconic building you'll see from Jumeirah Beach. We had a family picnic at a park across the beach then head on to the beach to get some photos of the building before it drizzled suddenly and we had to board our van and leave.

Looks great from the street....see if you can get in!. In truth, we walked up to the Burj Al Arab, but decided not to spring the $100 USD just to get it. Guess they don't like too many people having an up-close look. It is stunning to look at -- almost get vertigo trying to see the top. I think one night per week they offer a dinner package with they chance to go inside, it just wasn't any of the nights we were there.

A top class afternoon tea. We had Afternoon tea in the Burj Al Arab and the whole experience was great. The setting is fantastic and the quality & quantity of food is great. There are security gates at the front which seem to keep out "photo tourists" which allows for a calming relaxing experience which can sometimes be hard to find in Dubai! It really is something special Make sure you check dress codes before going to the Burj Al Arab
Burj Al Arab. There are no words I can say that can do this place justice. Believe all you hear. Once you see it up close you cannot look away. The hight of luxury. Would highly recommend High Tea

A must do whilst staying in dubai. A must do for visitors. We went up to floor 125 in the lift in less than 1 minute. This provides panoramic views of the city. The lift is amazing as you don't really feel movement. The displays of the construction are very interesting to look at
Burj visit Afternonn tea.. Had the afternoon tea in this hotel on 122 floor.Great view over whole of Dubai from 122 floor.Food provided top class and service excellent.

A good visit. This building is one of the signature buildings of Dubai. They only 7 star hotel in the world! the architecture is inspired by the sail of a ship and is amazing. Even if you cannot go inside (i couldn't, because of time crunch), it is a good place for great photos.

Beautiful structure. This outstanding hotel remains one of the landmarks of Dubai. It is well maintained. It is best appreciated from the water so take a boat ride from the Dubai Marina that includes cruising around the harbour to fully appreciate the architecture of the area

Must visit. I couldn't go inside due to time crunch. It is the only 7 star hotel in the world. I just checked it from outside and it was amazing. Outside view give splendid. I will definitely visit it if i will ever go to dubai again.
Amazing. i have a fear of heights.. But this was fantastic!!! The view was awesome .. Sunset time is the best time to be there!!!

Wow Factor.... We took photos by the beach with the Burj Al Arab as the main background. This is my second visit in Dubai and it is on my list for must see again. The impressive structure always gives me the feeling of wow factor. The beach is quite beautiful too. Love the combination of beach and burj al arab in photo.,
High tea. We had a very enjoyable High Tea experience. Ax you would expect the service was excellent along with the fantastic views of Dubai and it surrounds.
the only 7 stars hotel in the world. we did Not get in, we only saw it from out side, but we watched a very informative film about the hotel."Great" is the word to describe the hotel.

One of the best hotels in the world. High class service and exclusivness living. Everyobe should have the possibility to spens a night at this landmark. High class, you get everything you don't expect.
Cool architeture!. We stayed right next door to the Burj in the Madinat Jumeirah Al Qasr and I gawked at the Burj al Arab every day. Cool looking hotel....
must visit. the man made beaches surrounding the hotel are awesome! this is a must visit place. very beautiful in summer

nice experience. Went here for afternoon Tea., the afternoon tea was at the top of the hotel and it was quite an experience going up there . The hotel is fabulous although I have never actually stayed here only visited
The view was gorgeous.

Ohh la laaaa!!!. What elegance! What majestic-ism! What service!
Simple, if you are travelling to Dubai then this is a definite stop of gold binding bliss and excellence! Water features! Gold! Smiles! Elegance. Disbelief. Did I mention gold? Oh and a gold wet floor sign!
Simple brilliance and just breathtaking!

A stunning building. My husband and I visited the Burj on a day trip. We had the 7 course afternoon tea. It was all beautifully presented and very leisurely. The food was delicious (although there was a couple of courses I didn't try).The building is stunning. The outside and in. We were slightly disappointed that our trip didn't allow enough time for us to look around. It would have been fantastic to go to the 27th floor to see the views.If you do book an afternoon tea, make sure you book the 27th floor one so you get to see out. We were on the first floor, so we didn't get to appreciate the view.Very nice all in all. Worth a visit to look at the spectacular hotel and the pure luxury the other half live in.
Drop by the beach nearby. Nothing really to see exempt what shows in this photo. However, there is a beach very nearby, which you should visit at sunset or night

Afternoon tea. We booked a trip via Virgin holidays for afternoon tea. It was amazing! As you arrive the first thing you notice is the fleet of white rolls royces outside. Reception area is mostly fountains and lots of gold leaf. A big aquarium lines the wall as you travel up the escalators. Afternoon tea was 7 courses and had every kind of cake and sandwich you could imagine. Service was superb and they gave us a gift when we left. I think you can only visit as a guest if you have a reservation for one of the restaurants, otherwise it's residents only.

7 stars of opulence. This is a 7 star hotel and you know it. We got collected from our previous hotel by a chauffeur in a very luxurious Mercedes. From the moment you arrive at the hotel you know it is 7 star. The hotel is just awe inspiring. From being addressed by name, to the most opulent suite, to the big bunch of roses, to the high level of security... Everything is opulence. We enjoyed the beautiful Talise Spa with a lovely massage and a dip in the infinity pool on the 18th floor. All suites have floor to ceiling windows and the views are amazing. Be prepared to have everything done for you - staff is everywhere - and of course prices are at a premium. However if you can afford it,or you just want to know how the other half live, then put this on your bucket list.
Car and star spotting. Didn't get to go inside but it looks fantastic plus the cars heading up/down the driveway where proper supercars, so if you like your cars take a camera and snap away.
perfect in every way. absolutely loved it here and will make it a life long mission to stay here again it was unbelieveable

Skybar!. Visited the skybar with friends one evening. A minimum spend of around £80 per person but after a few drinks and a table snack it was well worth it. Included is free reign of the hotel too which means you can spend time checking out the lobby and the shops etc.Spent around 3/4 hours talking, drinking and snacking and it was perfect. Would definitely recommend.

Dubai's Vision to the world. It seems long bright pillar of excellent architecture build across soft seas of Dubai. I had opportunity to look on to the property from far away, but aspire to spend in couple of days there. It will be an experience of a life time for someone who can. For ones who wish to enjoy the landscape as well as the mighty structure, it is advised to be in the public beach of Dubai by the sunset and have your self clicked with one of the wonders in Dubai.

High Tea Please!. The one thing that my father wanted to do when he visited me for the first time in the UAE was to see the Burj Al Arab. One of the world's most iconic hotels, it offers a high tea sitting at the weekend that should not be missed. Although expensive, you really do pay for what you get, and this is no exception. You are treated to a selection of sandwiches, cakes and beverages without limit. You will also find one of the best views in Abu Dhabi.
Go to the very top. We went to the top, what an amazing experience, we were able to sit in very comfortable surroundings and have juice and nibbles.

Afternoon Tea as a teat. I visited Dubai with my mum to see a friend, as a final treat we booked Afternoon Tea in the Skyview Bar (i think it cost around £70-£80 per person- we had the champagne tea!) As you would expect, a fancy schmancy assortment of treats. Great staff, very helpful and attentive in stunning and impressive surroundings
Great views. Please visit the bar around 18.00 hrs and see the surroundings changing from daylight to sunset with changing colours. It's a relaxing place. Please be dressed correctly.
amazing. amazing place you must visit , see the beautiy and the pride of dubai , located very near from the center and shopping centers

A Great Get Away with your Partner for Sundowners!. Look at that colorful sky while the sun goes down over the Arabian Gulf while you sip onto your soothing beverage be it Freshly squeezed Lemonade or a Negroni!
Hold the hand of your loved one & walk on the beach admiring the fine work that was put to creat this Gorgeous hotel over the water.

Just wow. I booked high tea there. It was an amazing experience- the high tea itself very posh but very small portions and will not fill you up; but my purpose was to book the cheapest way to get in. It was my daughter's birthday and the staff made a real fuss and sang happy birthday for her which made her day. I then requested to be shown around and the hotel manager came downstairs himself and took my children and me to have a look- was too good. The views were to die for. A bit bling but in a nice way..

View is Outstanding!. This is the best view ever! Better than the Eiffel Tower and Empire State Building. On the elevator ride up you do not feel a thing. It is very well done and a great investment if you are visiting Dubai. There could be more room for visitors on the viewing deck, but other than that it was a treat!

Only seven star hotel. We have been to this hotel more than thirty times. We still go there at times. No words can describe it but you need to just experience the luxury. The roof top bar is a great place during winter evenings and the restaurant are nice too.
Burj in Dubai. It is one of Dubai's icon. The view from the beach is good. I didn't have a chance to go into the hotel but still could take picture from the seaside
What a FABULOUS place. Was here with a friend its fabulous staff just couldnt do enough for you . would love to go back costs alot but well worth every penny

Great afternoon tea. A must do while in Dubai. I have regularly visited the Burj as a previous resident of the UAE. The well known afternoon tea was a popular option when friends and family visited. You will need to book in advance as its very popular and does get busy. It by-passes paying through the roof to stay there but still get access into what is one of the most interesting buildings in Dubai. The afternoon tea is absolutely wonderful and the staff are always very accommodating if you cannot eat certain things or wish to substitute specifics on the menu. Scones and clotted cream are just gorgeous. Definitely a must do!

The National Pride of Dubai. Designed by architect Tom Wright, this iconic landmark is more than a luxury hotel. Located in the backdrop of the emerald waters of the Persian Gulf, this highly recommended tourist destination is just outstanding.
Fantastic Experience. Great piece of architecture near the sea. It the place where Shah Rukh Khan also has a room. It was great to be there
No need to spend a 100 $ to drink a coffee to see the Hotel. Drink coffee in somewhere else then see the hotel from the seaside next to the beaches. It is better.

Having Great Time on top 27th Floor Skyview bar. Have a pre-reservation before going which is the right choice. On the day, the hotel gate house staff even on hold the list that whose are those in coming guests name with details. I felt impressive on it.Inside the Skyview bar, me and my family 4 ppl got a corner seat with great seaside plus city view. It was breathtaking view which can compare to the views on top of Burj Khalifa.Hotel staffs are helpful and pay attention on what we needed. A "black skin" male staff (My sincere apology but I do not know the staff name) whose served us was great in photo shooting and his services was excellent. :)For me, it is highly recommended to visit this well known place when you visit Dubai. P/S: Please email or make a call to make reservation to avoid disappointment which without RSV you might get block when you reach the hotel gate house.
Wow. In awe of this place wow. Lots of expensive cars to be seen around here. We stayed at The Atlantis on the Palm and this hotel was our main view.

A must see!. You could take pictures outside but honestly its worth it to buy the ticket and go to the top of the building and see the views from up there. Try to pick a clear day to see as much as possible.
Fantastic. great architecture and you can enjoy the beach near the place. how ever it is kind of expansive if you want to eat inside or near the place.
The Burj. Excellent atmosphere around this beautiful building. Beach is nice. My personal recommendations. DislikeNone

I'd give it a higher rating if I could. My hubby REALLY wanted to see this but when we found out from the concierge in our hotel that the only way they let you IN (you can take pics from outside and down the street) is if 1) you are a guest in the hotel or 2) have a dinner reservation. I was okay to just see it from the outside but hubby argued the point that this was our first time in Dubai and its the only 7 star hotel and he REALLY wanted to do it. Since spending around $2000 per night for a room was a tad outside the budget, LOL, we made dinner reservations at their asian buffet restaurant. I think the bill was somewhere around $600 for 2 adults, 2 children, and no alcohol. HOWEVER, it was worth it to be able to go inside and see it up close!It sounds crazy but it is unlike anything I've every seen. It is unique and beautiful. The aquariums, the escalator in the amazing interior. I'm glad my husband talked me into it.

Outstanding. beatyfull, everyone from valet parking staff to ladies & gentleman around the hotel were very helpful and with great etiquette. Gotta love this luxury place. You can see ( from in&out) why it is called the 7 stars hotel. A must visit.
Dhaylene&Avi. Burj al arab - stunning #heart - visited during our honeymoon in november 2014 truely amazing experience

Sky bar at the Burj. Excellent, we went to the sky bar for drinks after dinner, we were picked up in a merc which was fabulous , and were treated like royalty on our arrival, drinks were fab, and service excellent it really lived up to our expect ions and more, it was a wonderful experience.

Iconic yet cold. When I first moved to Dubai in 2013 this was the symbol of Dubai and it was even on all our plate numbers! Ever since Dubai has become a flashy bling bling tourist hub, Burj Al Arab has lost its appeal especially that if you are not staying at the hotel or any other Jumeirah properties, you have to pay to get in! The bar at the top is nice if you do get in and watch the sunset....... However overpriced cold and lacks any character.. as a Dubai resident I dont even think of any reason to go there...

Luxury. This place is impressive in every aspect. It generally looks as if Dubai gathered all the best architects and stylists worldwide. I've visited this place and really dream of being wealthy enough to spend a night over there just like that ;)

Amazing Hotel . Came here for afternoon tea with my fiancée on our visit to Dubai.
The hotel is truly magnificent and afternoon tea in 29th floor with spectacular views is a must do if here.
A bit expensive (to say the least) but food was great and service was fantastic.
A once in a lifetime experience (unless I win the lottery)

Symbol of dubai. When we first saw this tremendous architecture we were left amazed, its just brilliant. It was more exciting to see the hotel from outside ( nothing extraordinary inside ). Overall we had an amazing experience , excellent food and service .

Unique. As the major turist in Dubai I visited Burj Al Arab from outside :) The best pistures can be taken from the beach close to there. Anyway I recommend to visit this place even you have a short period in Dubai;

we visited in 2103.. It was a remarkable experience
A most elegant structure
We were well looked after
The meal was excellent
The small gfroup entertaining us as we ate played most enjoyable music
Great architecture. Hotel outside is symbol of Dubai, inside is not like outside if we consider the level of the hotel, service perfect but not super perfect.
Afternoon tea. Fantastic had afternoon tea with my husband what can I say but utter luxury a day we will never forget

Stunning interior decor. Burj Al Arab is not only an exciting looking building on the outside but unlike some icons does not disappoint on the inside. Equisite decor needs to be seen. Breakfast in the Asian restaurant is a delightful experience great food and wonderful service.

Skyview Bar. Wow. We went to skyview bar at the Burj Al Arab for afternoon tea for a special birthday celebration. Wow. What a hotel. We were staying at Jumeirah beach hotel so went over to the Burj in a golf cart. Going over the bridge was amazing. The welcome was fantastic . Very upper class hotel but very relaxing and friendly. Please dress accordingly! Some French ladies were turned away! T-shirts and cargo trousers are not allowed. Well when you book you are given a dress code, and why not. Lovely afternoon tea with glass of champers and cos I'd told them about hubbies birthday, birthday cake. Wonderful afternoon. Lovely staff. Something to remember. Thank you Burj Al Arab
At the top. We took the fast pass,and it really was fast in a few minutes we were at the top, only a few people like 30 only so it make special not crowded, incredible view!!

Beautiful building!. We went here for dinner. Actually three different times we went there. The first was a restaurant on 3 or 4th floor. That one featured buffet stations of different types of food (sushi, pasta, meat, salad, dessert, etc). You had to get up to get your food and while you are away, they will re-fold your napkin and help you sit down again. The second time we went there was at the restaurant at the top of the building. That was a more traditional restaurant. It was a little bit more snobby service, but the food was good. I think if we go back, we would go to the first restaurant again because they has so much more choices of food.

Afternoon tea. After booking well in advance, directly with the hotel, I was pleased with the correspondence received. We arrived in the hotel with a little time to spare, we were allowed to walk around the foyer and outdoor areas. At our given time we gave our name to the lady at the desk nearest to the skyview elevator. We waited a short time for an available elevator and were taken up in a small group. We were seated quickly and in our opinion had the best seats in the house, overlooking the Jumeirah beach hotel and Burj Khalifa in the distance. Staff took into consideration dietary requirements and were very polite and attentive. Food was delicious and presented beautifully. Would recommend to those looking for something different to do on their holiday and obviously being treated in a little lap of luxury for the afternoon.

Great view from the lounge. Freaking amazing. Reservation for just drinks, the view and service was amazing. Drove up to the "guard house", after verifying I was "on the list", the large concrete barrier was lowered. At that point, they did all they could to earn the "7 star" rating
Opulant. What a magnificent hotel, obviously but very expensive, only went for high tea, don't have the extra glass of Champagne it is pricey

Breathtaking! Can't wait to return. We stayed at Burj Al Arab beginning of July with our 3 year old son, I was a little sceptical about whether this hotel would be for us as we are not rich and famous just an ordinary family who enjoy nice things in life. We have stayed in Dubai for over 10 years and never got round to visiting... All my concerns went out out the window from the second the rolls Royce picked us up from the airport! The driver was extremely friendly and made the whole experience of the transfer to the hotel an experience we will never forget. The Burj Arab itself was breathtaking and very welcoming our suite was stunning and although I was expecting the decor to be a little over the top it worked perfectly!! Out son was treated like a prince having his own robe,Slippers,sweet train,presents the list goes on! We stayed on the 12th floor and out butlers were Paul and Gwen and what fantastic people they were, nothing was to much trouble but genuine with it! The grounds, pool and beach were perfect as was everything else. I really cannot speak highly enough of this beautiful landmark and as out little boy repeatedly says "the Burj Al Arab" was the best and our favourite and we will definatly be returning next time, thank you for a wonderful stay!

What can I say... there is nowhere else like this place on the planet. I brought my partner to the Burj for drinks for his 30th birthday after visiting yeas ago with my parents and have had this place imprinted in my mind ever since.Yes... this is a very expensive spot but its worth it just to soak up the amazing atmosphere and enjoy the spectacular views and 7** ambience. We paid £150 for about 6 cocktails but I would do it again its so worth it for a special occasion!

A Must Do on any visit to Dubai. Amazing Afternoon Tea, was treated like royalty throughout the whole experience.Worthy of a visit and a must see when in Dubai. Remember, you need to have an afternoon teareservation before hand to enter - bookable weeks in advance of your arrival if you can.

Great place for a look-see !. The view from the beach is fantastic ... it can be real windy though ... if you get a chance to see it at night, then you can enjoy the changing colours ...make sure someone points out the Helipad ... famous for the tennis match b/w Federer & Agassi ... plus some movie shoots of course ... from there the drive to the Atlantis offers fantastic views :)

Most luxurious hotel in middle east. That's my view .. Most luxurious hotel in Middle East.. With more than 320m height standing on small man made nearby island and looking like a ship sailFood is super amazing and beach is very nice and safe

Beautiful site. This is beautiful hotel inside and out and it makes you feel like royalty when you visit. There are several ways to even have access to the hotel and that's by either staying there which is expensive or booking a reservation for afternoon tea which is what we did while visiting the country. Its a beautiful site I swear and I didn't want to leave.

Superb afternoon tea in the Skyview Bar. A wedding anniversary treat. Expensive but superb multi-course tea with pampered service and wonderful views. The staff are wonderful and can't do enough. We took the 16:00 serving and, although a bit early, we were shown to our table as soon as we arrived. We stayed 'til sunset and were never put under any pressure to leave. Taking tea there also gives the opportunity to view the lobby areas of this gawdy, totally over-the-top hotel! Impressive - yes, tasteful - hmmm, depends on your point of view!

It used to be mesmerizing, but it's dated. I remember coming here as a little girl when it first opened, and there was nothing that could compare to it. But now, Dubai has built itself around it as the jewel of the Middle East, where it really takes a lot to "wow" a local. This place is a bit dated. Still nice and beautiful, and the staff are above and beyond hospitable and friendly, but with tourists being bussed in by the load to take photos for an hour in jeans and t-shirts, it's lost some of its charm. There is a beautiful view from the spa and the indoor spa pool.

Amazing Architecture. Amazing structure, absolutely love it, cannot get enough of it. However, the Afternoon Tea restaurant was a let down. The decor looked tacky and poor, very gaudy. Expected it to be a bit more glitzy and classy considering it is rated as 7 stars.

Amazing!. This iconic building was amzing to see in real life. It is one of the most commom images associated with Dubai so it was great to finally get the opportunity to experience for myself. I took some pictures of it outside but unfortunately didn't make it inside the hotel. It was 250AED to go inside which I felt was out of my budget being a student backpacker but I'm sure the inside is as amazing as the outside is!
Great Landmark Hotel in Dubai. We did not get a chance to go into the Burj Al Arab, but i don't think and trip to Dubai would be complete without getting a photo next to this iconic hotel!

Best Hotel and Restaurant in Dubai. Many people have experienced this magnificent in many ways, but to all the pilots who are reading this post, just hire a small GA plane or helicopter for Dubai sightseeing, you will get the most beautiful view of it. And in the afternoon come here for some amazing foods to satisfy your taste buds.

burj al arab,. dubai burj al arab has its own beauty.we have seen from outside only but its white beautiful ship like structure attract towords it, The way to hotel from sea is also beautiful, . we had clicks from the sea shore,

Wonderful Site. Whilst I was there on Business, I could not help but be amazed at the architecture and overall beauty of the place. From the moment you got onto the causeway to the hotel entrance, the reception and the front coffee lounge you could not help but be amazed.It is not cheap to stay there but well worth it if you can afford it. If not, make a booking to go there for Dinner or Lunch, that way you will get the email that lets you get past security onto the causeway entrance. The restaurant facilities are some of the best in Dubai and that is saying something.

JUST ADMIRED!. Only drove past, but absolutely admired the attention to detail and wonderful architecture and the beauty the Burj Al Arab! Yet again money doesn't really seem to be an object in Dubai. None the less amazing to see such an Engineering marvel =D

Nice. Really happy to finally see this live. We did not go inside but instead, we went to a public beach nearby where we were able to take some photos. Next to this is Wild Wadi waterpark which looked great fun.

A fairy tale hotel feels like a Vegas. the attention to detail and finish is fascinating the fountains are fun
all rooms are suits and very well appointed
the underwater restaurant is beautiful

Beautiful architecture. Like most of the buildings in dubai burj al arab also has its own beauty. have seen from outside only not been in there but its beautiful the way its made. Dubai is a city of beautiful buildings which enhance the beauty of the city. We could see this when we were taking a boat ride in The marina hotel.
Such a pleasure for tea. I really wanted to see the hotel. It's truly amazing and like most things in life a little smaller than expected. I really enjoyed my afternoon tea and I was so glad we went.

if you happen to be in Dubai, go look at the hotel. You can't enter the hotel unless you live the or have restaurant reservation. We booked an Iftar buffer at the Al Falak Ballroom and that gave us the opportunity of entering the hotel, walk around and participate in the event related to Ramadan. If we visited Dubai during Ramadan, we decided to experience something new for us. The food was great, the service was superior. Everything and everybody was nice. The hotel is beautiful to the extend we could see. The interior is exaggerated to my taste, too much of everything but it is definitely the place to see. It is expensive event but not beyond each.

Worth a visit. Depending on the time of year you visit the views can be hazy or non existent. We paid for the express pass and were pleased that we did, I would not have been happy if I had had to queue but it would be a pricey option for a family.

Afternoon tea reccomended. Beautiful hotel. Visited for Afternoon tea in the Skyview bar on the 27th Floor. The view was stunning. Staff were very polite and friendly. 6 course menu, including chef's cavery of the day, sandwiches, Scones, pastries endless pots of tea and alcoholic or non alcoholic bubbly. Was also surprised by the waiter with a small birthday cake and rose for my birthday ! Excellent service, will definitely go back when in Dubai.

Amazing !. I was several times at Burj Al Arab and had dinner in all the restaurants . Burj Al Arab is a great place for business travelers or when you have a special occasion.the best an most impressive restaurant and bar is Al Muntaha , when you want to discover Burj Al Arab a little more the Culinary flight at Burj Al Arab is the perfect choice ! never forget to make a reservation in front otherwise you don't come in the hotel.The rooms are really great and have all you can dream . The personal butler is always ready to answer all your questions .

Awesome !. Our stay at this incredible hotel was a truly memorable experience for my husband and I.I love lots of bling so I was in my element.Our suite was huge, larger than our apartment, our bedroom overlooked the Palm and the service was out of this world.I would wholeheartedly recommend it !

Amazing. We had afternoon tea here in the banquet suite. A truly amazing unbelievable experience. View is completely stunning. But then we visited the burj kaliff which is another matter.this hotel is luxury at its limit. Well worth a visit.

Yummy but getting a little dated on the inside. There is no denying that the Burj Al Arab is one of the most remarkable landmarks in the world, so when we were in Dubai dining at Al Muntaha was a must do.The food was very, very good and the view was to die for. No need for a heli-tour when you are on the 27th floor. Outrageously expensive but worth the money for a once off. Concierge remembered that it was my sister-in-law's birthday and bought her out a gorgeous cake and presented us both with a single stem rose. Nice touch!I would recommend for a once-off. The only con is that the decor is ageing slightly but it is such a minimal discrepancy.
Amazing.. This has to be the best spent dollars in Dubai, the tallest building in the world. You have to try it.
Amazing. You really have to see it to truly understand its real beauty and engineering marvel, nothing to dislike here.
Luxury Hotel. Burj Alarab is one of most famous hotel in the middle east. It's very luxury hotel. You can have a tour inside the hotel if you don't want to stay there.

beautiful on the outside ugly on the inside. beautiful architecture on the outside the inside decor is like from the 15th century. a lot of gold fixture and old style carpet... food is good the view is amazing and the prices are sky high.

Creme de la creme. Had lunch on the 27th floor to celebrate my birthday with friends. The service is impeccable and the food is delicious. You definitely get your monies worth. Also the view across the sea and beach is stunning.

Had to see it, but it wasn't up to the hype.. So, we only went for dinner, but the place was dead. Nobody was around, and the service was pretty bad. We spent a small fortune here, which was expected, but it wasn't worth it. Cool place to say you have been, but I would not revisit.

An icon... Reminiscent of A thousand and one nights.. Elegant. Has many futuristic and smart themes.
The largest internal foyer in the world so far.
I did not like the shops there, just did not fit in.
Service at the lobby is exquisite.
Needs reservation.
And do dress smart..

Teatime. Me and my girlfriend were there for the "teatime". The view was unbelievable, food and drinks very very good! For us, this was the absolute highlight of our Dubai vacation!!!! I can fully recommend this!

Great afternoon tea!. We loved every minute of this experience! Even though it was Ramadan we still had a brill time. The sparkling wine was replaced by sparkling fig wine........... yum! Just spending a penny was a million dollar experience!

Fatmahat. "Amazing"
Am speechless, Burj Al Arab...like the say, open the book and see inside. amazing, we have alot of fun, visiting and spending...never regret at all. am looking forward to visit again..soon.

Not as grand.. from a distance!. To visit this hotel, you have to either make reservations to eat and dine there (online booking avail) or you stay as a guest. They do not let visitors into the property anymore. So manage your expectations here!

Tip about the best view of Burj Al Arab. I did not visit Burj Al Arab so this review is only about the attraction itself and the possibility to see the hotel from close up. Getting to the hotel is impossible unless you have a booking for a room or dinner. But if you visit the neighbour hotel Jumeirah Beach they have nice restaurants where you can sit outside and get nice views of Burj Al Arab, including a photo with the hotel in the background.

Great product with well maintained level of service. It it truly one property you must try, you don't need to be in house guest to feel the luxurious in every single corner, and to feel the great hospitality levels with great personal touch with every outlets, outstanding conferences facilities, great food quality, View you shouldn't miss from the top, truly a hospitality icon in Dubi.I enjoyed the conferences services more than 5 times at this property they truly keep standardeds on top possible levels.

Unreal experience, but plan ahead. This is not open to the public. You must get a reservation ahead of time. When you arrive a private golf cart picks you up and delivers you to the hotel. The lobby is jaw dropping. The view is amazing. Unfortunately, our experience in the cocktail lounge was far less than expected. Our waiter was a bit of a flake and drinks were forgotten. The cocktail lounge was a bit underwhelming overall. But that lobby!!!

Sky view bar - night visit. We enjoyed the experience of visiting the Burj Al Arab and talking many pics, the cocktails are sky high prices as you might expect with a minimum spend of £70 per head you may not get drunk but will enjoy the experience.

Photo Stop!. While only the wealthy may stay at Burj Al Arab, but strolling around the Jumeriah Beach and having Burj Al Arab in the backdrop is definitely picturesque and affordable for thrifty travellers ! Bollywood fans (like me and my cousins) would instantly relate to this place as shown in many bollywood movies ! An early evening visit might be pleasant if you want to avoid the sun and save on some sunscreen.Enjoy!

A 7 star Hotel but not all 7 star. I enjoyed the experience at the Burj Al Arab over the years but it never was truly a 7 star experience. I have the same level of service and quality at many of Dubai's 5 star hotels. I feel that it is an ICON of Dubai for sure and a testament to its amazing ruler especially HH Shk Mohamed Bin Rashid Al Maktoum.

A must visit when in Dubai. At least once in your life you must visit this place if you were in Dubai. I visited it during my 2nd trip to Dubai. It is worth paying the fee ( or the charges for dining at any of its restaurants). Choose the cheapest of the restaurant because you are there not for the food, and the food may not be to your liking. You are there for sight seeing and the interior of the hotel is worth seeing. It is like in another world - a world of luxury.

Would love to stay there but visited it for the restaurants a couple of times.... A massive opulent hotel. The restaurants are amazing in every way and the reception area is simply awesome. Whether you look at the hotel from the atrium or outside you have just got to be amazed by its truly superb form. I would love to stay at this hotel one day but the price is a little to steep for my pocket right now!

tallest nd the best. it shouls be the 8th wonder of the world, its amazinggggg mann! it has all the best things, armani hotel is breathtaking and the view from the top will amaze u, u will fall in love with dubai! go check it out

Burj Towers Above the Rest. Quite simply a genuine 7* establishment. From the moment you arrive till the moment you depart, you are treated like royalty. The decor and opulence has to be experienced to know what it truly feels like.Cannot fault the Burj in any way - a must do foe everyone at least once in a lifetime. Expensive? Perhaps, but how can you put a price on such an experience, and really, when compared with some 5* establishments, it's tremendous value for what you get.Highly recommended.

Great to be there!. I remember the feeling I had when I entered this wonderful place, it was amazing to be there because I always wanted to. It is not possible to visit this place if you don´t have booking to stay at the hotel or to the restaurants. My husband and I were in honey moon and booked some months in advance to have dinner in the "culinary flight experience" (review in that section) and we were able to visit all the restaurants and the amazing hotel. It is a small hotel, sometimes it feels very crowded at lobby. It is amazing to be inside and to look above and see all the colors and the decoration. If you go to Dubai you must visit this place.
High Tea. High Tea was excellent overlooking the OceanThe underwater restaurant is now a bit dated, over 10 years old, opulent but needs a reno

Nice but expensive. Beautiful architecture. Very luxurious. Interesting afternoon tea with stunning views. Depending on the currency you traveling with it is obviously not affordable to just anybody. If you have the time and money. Great way to spend an afternoon.

Afternoon tea during Ramadan. Very good as usual... Been there a number of times... Staff very attentive and almost had a number of heart attacks when we found an eyelash in the butter...Recommend it for afternoon tea but the sky view lounge rarely has a clear view due to the heat haze... I would recommend the afternoon tea down on the first floor, longer time, nicer food, cheaper price... Lovely views and lots of potential for people watching which is always interesting :)

Unique, but disappointing.. It is in deed a unique building, but the truth is that I would never visit again nor take the time to dine there. We visited as it is one of the icons of Dubai, but it is a peculiar building with fancy decor, no personality.

Beautiful and is a must see. The hotel is really beautiful. if you want to see it from out side then evening is the best time when light glows in different color. We visited many times and night photography with dsl is a must for this from the side of Jumeirah beach. You can also have a meal and view inside the hotel.

Expensive with showing off twist. I have no idea why it is built, i think in general this whole joke called Dubai is not for poory tourist who wants to do things in nature. It is only for people who have lots of money and want to spend it

Amazing structure. Too tall to put into one photograph, the Burj Al Arab is the world's tallest building, and is easily and best viewed from the fountain area adjacent to to the Dubai Mall. You may have to hang out a while to see the top, as the mist and fog tend to move over it quickly.

The Aquarium on either side of the ecalator seeing the diver in their cleaning the tanks out is amazing.. Any visitor to Dubai must see this amazing 7 star Hotel. The detail of the decor is just mind blowing. It is expensive but worh every penny.
Nice to view. Its just another marvalous high rise building with a background of beach, one can enjoy in the beach and take pictures for memories

Always Interesting!. A visit to this amazing tower is always interesting, grandeur and elegant! Though I cannot smell, I was told by my companions that there is a unique smell that is same in all floor of the tower.
The perfume through the air-vents are created using a mix of scents and after a lot of research and trials.

BEAUTIFUL ARCHITECTURE. What I liked particularly about this hotel is its shape and architecture. It also is based on a small island that stretched out about 100 meters into the sea connected with the mainland through a road built exclusively for this hotel.
I have just seen the hotel from outside but not stayed in it.
Sail-Hotel. First, make a reservation if you want to get inside and have lunch there (strongly recommended). Beautiful views of the Gulf. It's worth going to.

Good place. The restaurant was sumptuous and service was very good. We fekk a lovely view's place where we had a wonderful view over the city.
The personnel did everything they could to give us a good experience.

Treated like royalty. Booked afternoon tea for a special anniversary,party of 4,had a great experience,some might say rather expensive,but it was luxury,treated like royalty,beautiful food and presentation,and felt like "on top of the world"

Afternoon tea at the Burj. The Burj Al Arab offers you the chance to enjoy the fabulous views of the Arabian gulf with their sky tea in the restaurant on the top floor - a must for any special occasion

Wonderful holiday.. Fabulous holiday, very luxurious, it's just the place if you need a bit of pampering. Stunning outlook with great views, food second to none, just amazing. Beautiful beaches and beautiful seas. Can't wait to go back.

Well worth it!. Pre-book an afternoon tea in the Sky bar before you go to Dubai and sit back and enjoy! It's expensive but it allows you entrance to the Burj and a very pleasurable, relaxing, top quality experience in the Sky Bar with amazing views. Great choice of teas, lovely Champagne and totally amazing food! Good sandwiches and savouries including Beef Wellington, Scones and cakes. Take your camera. Wow!!!!

The Burj Al Arab. The Emirates is definitely not lacking in the creativity department. The Burj Al Arab (amongst many other buildings) is an example of this. It is quite a spectacular sight to see. The sail-boat looking building is amazing beside the ocean-side.

Passionate Embrace. We went for cocktails at the Sky-view bar, first of all make sure you order a passionate embrace. Minimum spend was £65 per person , however its a must to enjoy the experience and view the 7 star hotel . It seems that when your close to your limit , you get moved to the best seats and what a stunning view. Yes it's a little expensive for what you get , however well worth the experience. Please ensure you read the cocktail menu and prices as £3k for a "birth of an Icon" shows how the other half live!Ps don't worry the nibbles are free!

definately worth a visit! even if only for lunch and drinks!. wow what a placeA grand, posh, exhilarating and another Dubai attraction that's out of this worldthe décor is amazing, although I cant tell u much about the hotel as I didn't stay there ( I just had lunch and tea )theres so much to see, the food and drinks were amazing and the staff were brilliant and so happy in there work. iv never in my life been anywhere as grand as this place, I really didn't want to leave and wil definitely be back for drinks soon!the views from around the hotel are definitely to be photographed and taken advantage of with ur camera and photo opportunitys. and at night wow u should see it light up!

High Tea at the Sky Bar. What an experience! We thought the last visit to level 1 one fantastic, but this topped that by a long way. Right from when we entered to when we left, we were treated like royalty. The food was a six course snack menu and the food was absolutely gorgeous. We really enjoyed the sparkling date wine (non alcoholic), along with all the food. We even opted to take some of it back to our hotel ... the Ultimate Take-Out!!I would really recommend this as a treat for birthdays or anniversaries, as the view from the top of the Burj is awe-inspiring..

marvel. its one of the modern art structure which you cannot miss. its an outstanding building and amongst the top hotels in the world. price comes heavy with the popularity but worth it. have a go if you are in dubai.

AMAZING!. Thought the views from the Empire State building were brilliant, but this place is just amazing. It is a must if you visit Dubai, especially good to go later in the day and watch the sunset.

Oh Yes!!!. The best way to see this hotel from the inside is to book a reservation at the Bar, which is located on the top floor. Reservations do go fast, so book as soon as you can. Once inside the hotel you will see the wonders of this super hotel. The views from the top are amazing. If possible, try to also book an inside tour. We did and it was well worth it!!!
7 star hospitality.. Though i haven't stayed at Burj Al Arab, i have attended 3 weddings here. Enjoyed them all especially the kids buffet table. Very innovative.

Re-union. My Boyfriend did a reunion anniversary for US, it got me in tears, everything in that hotel is luxury, lovely evening, with lovely view, the restaurant was located on the top, it was one of the best evenings we spent together, after many glasses of wine and delicious food.
Burj Al Arab. Great to see although there was a sand storm while we were there and it was a bit blurry. We did the hop-on hop-off bus so saw it from a distance, unreal how they built it.
We know why this is a seven star hotel!. A lovely view from the restaurant, AL MUNTAHA. The meal was very nice as well. The presentation on each plate was wonderful!

.unforgetable evening.. My grandson arranged an evening meal at the Burg for a treat,how can I describe the hotel. ,magical, a surprise everywhere you turn and the most incredible view! The food was exceptional too,
The beautiful bunch of roses I received just made me cry!

Afternoon tea with great view. A perfect afternoon! Afternoon tea with some champaign, very delicious sweets and little sandwiches...englisch style. choose between tea or coffee. Very good service! Sitting close at the window we had a wonderful view over Dubai!

Well...one word,luxury. We didnt stay at this hotel but we saw it from outside, i heard that there is a fee to go inside and have a look..something like 50 $..most of the people i think they book for the dinner so they can see the interior but at least they get the dinner. I suggest you to see this attraction in the evening when this sail shaped hotel is all covered in colorful lights, i have also heard that the cheapest room is 1000$ .enjoy
lavish. One of the most outstanding properties in the world, a once in a while treat or special occasions will create a truly impressive stay!
sailing high definitely. i don't know whether it is the norm or our group wasn't taken close enough since the distance from where we saw it doesn't do justice to the attraction.
an magnificient hotel i have ever seen. a magneficient sea face view hotel.. awesome mantainence..awesome service and a problem little problem which i think we all have faced.....EXPENSIVE...

Best of the Best. This hotel is the best of the best. You cannot even enter the island without an appointment to meet someone or a reservation to stay at the hotel or at one of the restaurants. I had the luck of having a meeting there, and even tried their breakfast. The hotel truly is a vision and is worth a visit. I haven't been down to the underwater restaurant yet, but have left it for the next visit. I did however visit their whiskey bar underground and it simply spells luxury.

Al Muntaha Restaurant. We visited the Al Muntaha restaurant on the 27th floor with spectacular views of the Palm, this included 3 courses, I have been reserved through Dubai See Tours and was a better option than booking directly with the hotel. Service very good, food in the restaurant nothing relevant
heavenly. this place is a real paradise out of the world, you feel very royal when you are here. all staff are very excellent !

The Cement Sailboat. After the Burj Khalifa, this is the second most important architectural marvel of Dubai. Alas I only saw it from the outside, as the cost of lunch would have been stratospheric, ($40 for french fries...?) but it is so compelling an image, that I spent the next hour going to different nearby vantage points to capture its wondrousness. I have seen a thousand pictures of it, and the reality is even more compelling. Go.

Fabulous. Excellent place in a world I love it , I will always come back to this hotel, the staffs are awesome I love the way they treated me and my friend we were treated like kings, their amenities are so great a specially MR RIC he really made us feel at home.

Amazing architecture. This is an amazing example of architectural excellence and luxurious interior decor. It's definitely worth a visit if you are in Dubai. Personally though it was not one of my top experiences of Dubai, as I liked the down-to-earth experiences more to my liking.

It's all about luxury. We made reservations to have drinks in a bar inside the Burj al Arab, since you can't even go inside if you're not a guest or have a reservation in one of its restaurants. It was worth it because we really wanted to see the building from the inside. Staff from the restaurants were very nice and kind, and it was cool to feel the luxury ambiance of the hotel.
Bringing Sea bottom experience near to you. Best place to have morning coffee and watch natural marine evolving sense of happiness and query. Also a luxurious stay with lots of privacy.

Life time experience. We did a Viator tour which included High Tea at the Burj Al- Arab Hotel.First one has to pass through 2 checkpoints.The foyer with the coloured water feature was specialThe multi course afternoon tea was amazing, not to mention the flair at which the sparkling grape juice was poured.The cupcake was embellished by a gold leaf.Just for the ambience, the fact you can say you have been there, but especially the actual High Tea go if you get the chance.Also Hermes perfume is standard in the female powder room.
Burj Al Arab. what a hotel.couldn't get a chance to get in but seen from outside what a lovely piece of engineering
Only 7 star Hotel. This is the only 7 star Hotel in the world and fourth tallest hotel. It is construct on artificial island and connect with bridge to the mainland. Worth to spend some time.

WHAT A CONSTRUCTION. The most amazing building I've ever seen, even saw window washers cleaning glass.Our guide took us to a fantastic vantage point to photograph.Will go back next time for afternoon tea. We could see it from our hotel, its looks fantastic at night all lit up.

Architectural wonder but lacks soul. Has the glitz and glamour of a concrete tower. Lacks soul though and appears random amidst a sprawling desert. I like cities that have history and some civilization. However, Burj Al Arab does get 10/10 for its architectural grandeur. If there was ever a Tsunami, this building could withstand that and more.

Great afternoon tea. The hotel is out of this world, and the design of the building is incredible inside and out. The afternoon tea was so tasty with several courses. However if you have a nut allergy like myself and advise them beforehand, there are no alternatives for the dessert course which is full of nuts in each cake. This would be my only criticism, that they do not cater fully for those with food intolerances.

Felt like a Queen and King. Afternoon tea at the Burj al Arad was an experience to remember, we were treated like royals and for the 2 approx hours there we were there.7 courses of afternoon tea, no wonder we did not feel like any dinner that night.It was not cheap but well worth the experience to travel to the top and have at least 6 star service. Great!!

The symbol of Dubai!. Luxury at its best! The top attraction in Dubai that is a must visit. If you have limited time this one is definitely worth a visit. If not staying and afternoon tea is a good option to enjoy this luxurious 7 star, all suite hotel. Surrounded by beaches one can enjoy a stroll around while enjoying the view at sunset.

A diamond in the desert. Famous attraction. As part of package tour we did not have access to inside only sight see from outside. Regardless this was the original landmark when one was to mention Dubai and of course the popular tennis match between Roger Federer and Rafael Nadal was played on its helipad. If the desert heat does not bother you this place is just snug on the water shore. Nice location for a stroll and perfect for the photography savvy to snap a nice background.
High Tea.. I only took high tea there - The view is spectacular and the little sandwiches worth the exorbitant amount for tea and cakes. I recommend it to everyone.

Amazing views.. If you are going to do the burj it is worth spending the extra and go for the sky package,it takes you to the147th floor also giving you access to the 125th and124th,you have 30minutes on the highest floor then can spend as long as you like on the lower ones.If you want to be there as it gets dark you can go up just before 5pm for 300aed,and stay until it gets dark but if you go after 5 it will cost you 500. Amazing views and really interesting,

Words can't describe. Absolute pure class in every way shape and form. Rolls Royce Phantom arrival and departure, with every perfection in between, rooms, staff, food, housekeeping, pools area, and butlers all outstanding, thanks you all and hope to see you again very soon

Don't get the hype. I don't understand how this is considered a self proclaimed 7 star hotel. I didn't get to see the rooms so they may be amazing, but the lobby and the SkyView lounge is old styled and tacky and nothing amazing. The outside is a cool idea and the closeness to the Palm is great, but otherwise, not worth us going to get drinks and paying the $100USD minimum (PER PERSON!)
Iconic Dubai building. Iconic Dubai building. Very expensive hotel, but you can go for afternoon tea or an evening meal if you are not a resident. Pre booking is essential.

Wonderful staff, beautiful restaurant. My husband and I came to celebrate his 30th birthday with our young daughter. We booked a table at the Junsui Restaurant and were bowled over from start to finish by the excellent decor, the wonderful attentive staff and then the food!Even our daughter who is 2.5 gasped and said 'wow!' and exclaimed how beautiful each part of the building was.Our meal was delightful, the staff going above and beyond to accommodate my vegetarian diet and making sure our daughter had everything she needed.They even surprised my husband with a cake and candles and a soft toy turtle for our daughter! We felt like royalty for a couple of hours and it was worth every hard earned penny! Marvellous!We will definitely come back to stay in the future!

Made to feel welcome and special!. Visited for the afternoon tea, although very pricey it was worth it for the friendly attitude of the staff. No matter if you are just there being treated to tea for your birthday or a very wealthy guest, you still get the same polite treatment. The tea was super with choices of beverages not limited. Worth saving up for a treat, loved the glass lift!

Dubai First Marquee Building.... Famously known as the 7 stars hotel, the Burj al Arab (Tower of Arabia) was the symbol that put Dubai in the map for many years. It was also the tallest hotel in the World, a record that lost a couple of years ago and its an outstanding building to admire. The design of the hotel and how its maintain its a magnet for your eyes, and its a difficult building not to admire, even though if you saw it a thousand time. In the past, was easier to access it. Now a days, to enter, you need either to book one of the 7000 USD suites, make a reservation in one of its very expensive restaurants (way in advance) or book one of the 2 more affordable choices (book for drinks or high tea in the Skyview Bar or Shan Eddar). You can book online the high tea and drinks on line in a very easy way but you would need to print the reservation to gain access to the island. The interior its marvellous and pure luxury, and the staff its so well train to maintain that royal service essence. The food might not be the best of your life in the high tea but the experience might be.The prices varied from 350 DHS to 600 DHS per person (around 100 USD to 180 USD per person). TIP: you can make an online reservation for drinks at the SkyView Bar (which requires a minimum spend of 300 DHS) and pay just what you drink without complying with the minimums.
average unless you love architecture and heights. it is beautiful and magnificent indeed but donot expect to spend hours there. It takes hardly 30-45 minutes to be done seeing it.
Amazing!!!. brilliant. Took afternoon tea. Fabulous. Wondered around shops and looked out at view. Request a table overlooking sea...

THE Hotel of Dubai. While our stop over in Dubai, we had quite a lot of time to spend so we decided to take a trip to its center and the stunning Hotel Burj Al Arab.Nearly everybody has seen it on TV/Internet and its quite a nice experience to see it in real life and how huge it is.When you were thrilled while seeing it from the outside, just go in and it gets even better!If you are in Dubai, dont miss it!Enjoy your trip,Alex
Tallest building. By ticks early then go shopping until time for you trip to the top. Bring your camera for some great shots, we got great shots of the Fountain Show.
For a romantic holiday or family vacation.. Burj Al Arab is a lovely place to visit, It's location is superb and has a lovely beach for relaxation.

Exceptional service and my favourite Wagyu beef & Oysters at the Billion Dollar Hotel. Our recent stay was eventually quite delightful after an initial booking problem the way the hotel resolved the issue was admirable, The attention to detail was very welcome.The Suites are duplex and are very well appointed what one would expect from The Jumeirah Group as we have visited some of their other hotels, however the mirror above the master bed does raise more questions than answers !.I would highly recommend this hotel to any luxury traveller like myself. I would like to covey my appreciation to Nimal Joseph the reservations manager, Izabela Osowska Hamilton in public relations, Lorelie Austria for the way my issues were resolved and to the General manager Anthony McHale for the excellent response and the obviously exemplary training of his staff, one can see the influence from his Mandarin Oriental Hyde Park days where we have also had the pleasure of visiting under his stewardship.in summary if you have the opportunity visit this hotel you will be amazed...
iconic. It is just exciting to be able to visit a place you have seen in so many pictures! I was surprised though because I thought it was much bigger!
Afternoon tea. We had such a nice afternoon tea on top level,excellent view and very pleasant hotel to just walk and look around.

Experience the view from the hotel and near private beach!!. This is the hotel near the Beach, the view from the hotel top corridor is not to be missed and only accessible to the people who stay in hotel.
Impressive and impeccable. I took my friend to the hotel for the afternoon tea and she left pleasantly surprised by the extremely helpful staff members and delicious snacks.

Valentine's dinner at Burj Al Arab. The luxury and service is phenomenal in the hotel. Found it to be a little small in overall size compared to the many other popular hotels in Dubai.
The food was amazing and definitely a trip worth taking again!

Wow..... sitting by the fish tank was mesmorising. What an amazing hotel, the service and food was exceptional. We were treated so well and the staff always addressed us by name. Totally amazing. Make sure you bring appropriate clothes and a jacket and Tie for the men.

Amazing Al Arab. I took some friends visiting Dubai for an afternoon tea in the high restaurant- to be fair we did have very high expectations of the food and service, but as my friend was Celaic and has very limited choice in many places we had resigned ourselves to a fairly unexciting time for him. How wrong i was the booking confirmed and the special dietary needs conveyed the food selection for him was simply fantastic - the food trays and service were all differently identified for him so he know exactly what he could eat without fear. this made what was a special treat an amazing never to be forgotten experience - real well done and the views of the sunset are timeless. thank you

Skyview bar worth it!. Make a reservation in advance. They allow ONE couple in the elevators at a time to make the experience amazing! We arrived at the rooftop bar at sunset! awesome! The hotel is really something to see, inside and out!

Dinner at Burj Al Arab.... Very beautiful....!!As we did not stay here...we had gone to have buffet dinner at the hotel...The hotel is exceptionally beautiful from inside and is very well made...!!It is definitely worth a visit....!! :D

Do the High Tea. Staying at the Burj Al Arab is expensive but if you want to just get the feel and the experience of the place then just book for High Tea which is located in the observation wing on the top of the building..the view is spectacular and the High Tea impressive… and even if your on a diet it will be hard to resist the cakes etcThe walk in throughout the lobby past the aquariums and fountains is over the top and the life trip up the back of the building is also a great experience…In terms of the view it is better during the day for the High Tea rather than dinner at night

Sky View Bar. What a breathtaking view from the 27th floor which is suspended in air. The window seats though hard to get by are worth the wait. Sipping your drink at that height gives the fun element another dimension.
Amazing Architecture in this 7 Star hotel. This is a must see attraction for Dubai. Highly recommended. Try going to see the top and have tea in the tea lounge.
nice hotel. nice and famous hotelvery nice warm hot water in the surroundings  PLEASE MARK THIS AS A HELPFUL VOTE, in the link bellow

Private tour of the Royal Suite. We got a private tour of the famous Royal Suite at Burj Al Arab, which is 8,400 sq ft and just $20,000 per night. The hotel is 200 suites but has 1,500 employees - that is 7 employees per room (the industry standard is one per room). Each floor has a concierge for the suites on that floor. Gold plate everywhere in the hotel - 20,000 sq ft to be exact. Definitely worth a trip to visit, even if its a cocktail at Al Mahara which has an enormous aquarium on the ground floor.
high. beautiful hotel, cannot go past the gates unless you are staying there, security on the gate, happy for you to take photos of the area, nothing around it except from the water park.

Exceptional....... very good, but pity that people cannot have better access, at least to visit the hotel and the site. We were stopped at the access gate.No entry unless you have a booking. Architecturally.......what to say? simply incredible

Anniversary Sky High Tea. View decor and meal in Sky High Bar a trip everyone should do at a least once when visiting Dubai. Celebrating our 40th wedding anniversary we were looked after, I was given a red rose to present to my wife a nice touch.

Unbelievable hotel. We couldn't,t afford to stay here so we went to the sky deck for afternoon tea. Very expensive but worth every dirham. Stunning building, incredible architecture, just awesome! We arrived a bit early to try and get a window seat and it worked. Had a nice chat with the lovely hostess at the lower lift level where you check in. We were lucky enough to be asked to go up first, an incredible glass lift ride, and then greeted at the top and shown to the best window table in the corner. Fantastic view, 5 star service and a great experience. After noon tea is quite large and you won,t need dinner.food is very well presented and tasty, but go for the experience not the food.

If you cannot stay there, have a brunch. An excellent alternative to staying at this icon hotel, is having brunch. It is still expensive, but hey, how often can you visit a 7 star hotel?Make sure you make the reservation a couple of weeks before your visit and in case you are in a rush, tell them. I had very little time and for me the brunch took forever. I realize, however, that I should have told them and they would certainly have served me faster.Remember you can come by. Vallet parking is available. Tipping is appreciated!
Treat Just to See It. One of the most recognizable hotels in the world located right on the beach. Worth the price just to get in.

Gives you the WOW factor upon arrival. Upon driving up to the Burj you realise how special this building is. When we entered the Burj and travelled to the bar/restaurant the lift experience was again special. We entered the bar/restaurant which overlooks the Gulf and WOW! It takes your breath away, the most expensive Cognac in the world is served at $40 a shot, the other drinks and food isn't as expensive but make sure you have enough money on you for a meal and drink or 2 costing around £100 a head.

Dinner. We had a meal at the sea food restaurant right in front of the aquatic and was one of the highlights of our stay in ABU Dhabi . IT WAS WORTH GOING FOR A MEAL just TO SEE THE INSIDE OF THE BURJ AL ARAB FABULOUS .
