Gr8. A huge and beautiful hotel. Food is also ok. An architectural master piece which any tourist in Dubai should visit.

Stunning architecture!. Amazing piece of architecture. According to the tour guide, no way we can go near to that building unless you are the guest of the hotel. So I can only see it from far, which is a bit regretful.
food aint good. food was not good at all.The brunch was not up to the standard.I will recommend visiting the place but dont opt for dining in here

Ultimate champagne high tea experience.. Afternoon ultimate High tea champagne experience for part of my wife's 40 celebrations whilst in Dubai. A great experience to visit a world famous landmark hotel. Lots of expected small courses accompanied with champagne & cocktails, top glass on all accounts as you would expect

Superb Archicture. This is one of the iconic land marks of Dubai. It is called Tower of the Arabs. It is a five star or more hotel. Entry is restricted for tourists if you are not staying in the hotel. If you want to see the hotel from inside then you must book a restaurant to eat and show the security the voucher to get entry in the hotel. It has a jutting deck which is oval in shape which gives you a great view. Alternatively you can click photos from the beach side where you can see the hotel from outside but from a distance.
burj khalifa. Wow what a building. We can not have such a huge and well structured building anywhere. Reaching to the 125th floor within seconds was really fantastic

Overpriced tourist trap. Why do people bother to pay US$100 just to go see this rather garish, tasteless monument to money? Perhaps I've just answered my own question. Masses of tourists wandering around snapping photos (including me!), therefore ruining any exclusive ambience the Burj is hoping to create.
Finally. I hadd always wanted to see this place and finally got my chance. Unfortunately and very understandable you cannot go inside for obvious reasons but, to look at such an icon is great.
good but very costly to go inside. we only see from outside coz it demand 400 dehram fo 1 to visit itu get small tea break in 400 dehram so we see from outside

Hi Tea Extravagance!. We decided to experience Hi Tea as a 'once in a lifetime' thing, very pricey but we thought the location would make it worth it. The property is beautiful, classy, elegant...you feel very special just coming through the gate!They sent us up the elevator to the Sky Bar where we waited til our reserved time when we were escorted into the restaurant. Food was delicious and plentiful, service was perfect, view was ok. We were a little disappointed as we were seated at the window but when the sun came around it was blazingly HOT for at least an hour, so much so that we were actually uncomfortable. The seating wasn't all in this area, others who had a full view of the city of Dubai were in the shade and didn't have the heat challenges.All in all, it was wonderful, glad we did it but if we were to go back we'd save the large cost and have drinks in the same location!

DINNER. We ate in the Lebanese buffet restaurant, the place is amazing. You have to eat or drink there to even get on to the road. We felt very privileged, its not cheap, the food was ok but the service was impeccable.It was worth every penny just to go and watch the world go by for a few hours. Loved it.
Amazing!!. We got spoilt rotten with service second to none both in the sky bar and in the restaurant, the food was amazing and worth every penny.

Luxury and Opulence. Fancy a cup of tea at Burj Al Arab? That will be 200 AED, please. What do you expect? It is THE place for rich and famous tourists to show off. The hotel screams magnificence, luxury and opulence so do pay a visit if your pockets allow it. Otherwise, just enjoy the light show from outside.

Good yes but worth it?. I am writing this review a few months after my experience dining there. I suspect one of the reasons for not giving it full marks is that I expected more from the ambiance. It does not feel to be underwater at all, but as if you had a big aquarium in the middle of the room. The food is good but VERY expensive. Some Chinese tourists were there and were surprised by their bill which they thought was included in their package. When they found out it wasn't this created some uncomfortable scenes for diners all around. The decision to go or not to go is based on what to expect. It's interesting if you are looking to experience this building but be aware that it does not necessarily offer value for money.
Burj Al Arab. Burj Al Arab is certainly exclusive. I prefer a more relaxed feel, however this would be a very special place to stay for a special occasion.
Nice. Crazy seven stars in every aspect Luxury beyond imagination Very expensive but you know what to expect from such place The restaurants are mouth watering

You expect so much more. We changed our reservation to drinks in stead of high wine and they seated us at the bar.. We had to spend over 100 euro and we could nog even get a normal seat. If you go for a high tea, you do get a lovely table but then you have the spend I believe 150 euro per person. I would definetly recommend to go there and see it, but just don't expect the 7 star treatment, it is really touristic.

This hotel went above and beyond its number 1 and I will go back again. The staff knew what you wanted even before I could ask, the food was out of this world and I can not say enough about this beautiful hotel, the rooms were so clean and always fresh flowers fruit and the views were so beautiful, every thing about this hotel is beautiful

Architecture & Interior Marvel. Wonderful Interior with Traditional Arabic Touch. Excellent Ambiance and Tasty Food. I have been twice to Burj Al Arab for dinner and Forum. Perfect for the price. No regrets. Restaurants require pre booking and strict dress code adhered.

Stunning hotel. We went to the Burj for afternoon tea in the sky view bar, this hotel is absolutely stunning we had to book the afternoon tea as you can't just turn up when we arrived we were met by a hotel concierge who directed us to the special lift to the sky bar you have to dress accordingly but they make you feel like a millionaire on arrival we had champagne as soon as we sat down then they asked if we had any dietary preference and which blend of tea you would like the food was fabulous and the views are out of this world , you are allowed upto 2hours for tea and when it was over they gave us both a gift which we did not expect. If you can afford this trip we would highly recommend it as a special day you will never forget

Burj Al Arab afternoon tea. Afternoon tea in the Burj Al Arab ....AmazingServed with style and a choice from a tea and coffe menu. Advised by waiter which tea complimented each plate as you went along. Stunning hotel and views, was expensive but hey worth every penny....mmmmmmm
international breakfast. if you are in dubai you must go to burj al arab to have a perfect international breakfast, inside you will be in paradise.

Seven Star!!. A Seven Star property that gives you royal treatment.
To get in, you need to have a room or a booking in any of the restaurants in the Hotel.
Make sure you are loaded before you get in!

Wonder on its own. Colorful, well maintained and top notch service. gold gold and gold, visit the seafood restaurant to have a glimpse of the species and hanging restaurant on top floor for breathtaking views of the palm and the world island

afternoon tea. fantastic experience, seven coarse afternoon tea served and explained as to what each coarse was by the waiter, with spectacular views . food was mouth watering and considering one member was vegetarian it was not a problem as was delicious, as much tea or coffee as you wished or alcohol was extra, free glass of champagne on arrival
Worth every penny. Overall a spectacular stay. The service and the facility are well worth the expense. Truly a memorable stay.
OTT. An experience like no other, had a great meal, very ostentatious and expensive. Blingy to the extreme with gold everywhere

A must visit. We visited the Burj for afternoon tea last year and definitely worth a visit. We were in the sky bar where the views were amazing. The food was amazing and lots of it. Quite expensive but worth every penny
Superb !!!. What a place, right in front of Jumeirah beach. Clicked couple of fine photographs, loved the architecture.

Over rated. We visited in June 2015, this was our first trip to dubai so was worth seeing however we wouldn't go back. There are a lot nicer bars in dubai for half the price.
If you want a rooftop bar in dubai visit the address hotel bar on 53rd floor! Amazing views of the burj khalfia and the dubai fountains.

Just. Great!. Although I have visited three times, like the Grand Canyon or the Taj Mahal, the Burj Al Arab is certainly a place one has to do once in a life. Although it is expensive, you can dine at some of the restaurants for around $200 a person. What can be said, the decor is opulent. Some of the staff can be a little snobby, but over all, the vast majority are friendly and helpful.The highlight of my previous visit was running into the Egyptian president. Nice he enjoys the Burj while his country burns lol.

Architectural jewel. Hard to say is it more beautiful outside, or inside. Indulge your self in stunning under water restaurant, the atmosphere and the food are absolutely magnificent. Or visit the observatory deck either for cocktail or two with your friends or an intimate diner with your love one!.You will not forget the experience for years.

Thing to do 1st time in Dubai. As it was our 1st time in Dubai, we said we'd splurge and have cocktails in the Skybar (AED700). The hotel is lovely but tacky if that makes sense. It's just a bit ostentatious. Unfortunately, it was quite smoggy so it was hard to have a clear view of the Palm or World islands. The service was great, but to be honest so are all of the other hotels. We had it on our list of things to do but I wouldn't be rushing back for the price of it. Anyways, with the amount of skyscrapers in Dubai, I'm sure you can get similar views!! Don't get me wrong, I'm glad we went but it was a once off visit.
Nice. The make is great. Food at international restaurant is average. Have overdone the interiors. Could have been made more subtle in expression.

Amazing hotel!. Visited with my wife for our 25th wedding anniversary. Service and quality is second to none. Very expensive, but worth it for a special occasion. Also had the afternoon tea in the Skybar - this is not to be missed!
A must do while in Dubai. Purchased the Sky tickets and it was definitely worth it - seeing the sunset from the top, the city around full of lights and the fountain show below ... just mesmerizing!
Stunning building. Very different to any place we have visitedVery hot and would recommend that you plan what you want to do before going

Very disappointing . Came here for afternoon tea last year and loved it ..... this year it was AWFUL. The champagne was fine, the shortcake with fruit was the best thing we had!! The sandwiches were made on turned up at the edge bread tasted of NOTHING. The steak was tasteless. The scones were edible. The creme brûlée was fine.The cakes ...... well...... they were heavy, unimaginative and mass produced and tasted disgusting. There was nothing dainty about this afternoon tea. It was evident as most people thought this as there were plenty food being returned on the stands!! Our waiter Wen was great though he was very chatty, we had a sea view by the window which was a bonus.Considering the price it's disgraceful the quality of this food we have had far better in the UK for quarter of the price we paid here. Burj Al Arab claim to be the worlds only 7 star hotel ... they could learn a thing or two from afternoon tea at Gleneagles or even any tearoom in UK. We did receive a pen and chocolates this year, pity they hadn't served the chocolates in the afternoon they were delicious, but mass produced too I'm sure!! DEFINITELY WONT BE GOING BACK .......EVER

Afternoon tea. Superb on arrival champagne,turn up half hour early sometimes they let you in early.Amazing views so lucky to get a great seat.Excellent service all very posh nice food and drink very happy.

Must see. We went to medinat to see the Burj Al Arab excellent ace to see it with overly luxurious surroundings! We went on a boat with gives you a good opportunity to take photos with the Burj in the background! Fantastic views!!The boat driver was full of information and even took some photos of us!Then had a tour of Medinat waterway

Don't regret that Staycation after too long talking about it!. Took advantage of the summer rates for UAE residents to go and stay at night with the family (3 young kids below 9) at the Burj. The hotel is really very impressive - much more so in it and up close than it seems from afar for some reason. The suites are very impressive, sure a little gold and maybe dated now, but genuinely luxurious and still very nice to spend some time in. The view over the ocean back to the Palm (in our case) from the master bed with full length windows the whole wall was very good to wake up to. The kids loved the two days at wild wadi and the buggies as expected and we had dinner at the European restaurant at the top which was very good. Food very good (excellent not sure), wine list took a few deep breaths on but the view even at night back over the coast was great to do just once. All in all a very good stay and the kids loved it, as did we. Got to do it at least once if you live here !

Still the best. Still the best building you will find in Dubai. The architcture, the design, the layout, the supreme quality, it just amazes me. And to find out it was build by SOuth African contractor Murray & Roberts

Very Nice!. This is a great hotel. If you have a room in here than you can enjoy all facilities but even if you don't have a room, don't worry. Still you can book a table on restaurants or on lounge for a drink. Just keep it on your mind, this is not a cheap place. But it worths.
Not close but interesting. This hotel can be seen from quite far. You can not access too close. Anyway it can help make your stay at jumeira beach nicer.

If you want to see the inside of the Burj Al Arab .... We had dinner in early June at the Bab Al Yam pool side cafe in the Burj Al Arab in Dubai. We choose this spot because you can't get in to the Burj Al Arab if you aren't staying there or have restaurant reservations. We definitely wanted to see the inside of this building (and it is amazing) so this was the best restaurant choice that is family friendly ... we were traveling with a minor and there is a 21 age minimum for the Skybar (which would have been our first choice). It was an International buffet, and for three people the bill was over $470 (we had one bottle of wine) but it was worth it for the experience. The food selection was the expected array of seafoods, great salads, roasted meats, pasta, fantastic desserts. We celebrated our anniversary and they very nicely surprised us with a special dessert. One of the managers also took us on a little tour the hotel, so we felt like we got what we were hoping for, a good meal and a nice experience.

experience you will never forget. a jaw dropping wow when you walk through the hotels doors, your own butler, the spiral staircase in your room and even a 4 year old that said wow to all of this. All blue and gold in the room with remotes for everything!

Great attraction. Really enjoyable experience of going up the tallest building in the world. We used the ticket which took you about half way up to floor 124 where you could walk around and see 360 degrees around the city. The ticket was reasonably priced at 125 dirham (around £22) for the early hours ticket which was up until 5pmm which was perfect for us, though it would have been absolutely amazing to have seen it at dusk (this ticket was around 200 dirhams I think or about £35). An absolute must if you are visiting Dubai.
Breathtaking view. If you can afford a night here, then do it because it is definately 7 star. The rooms and the hotel are beautiful and you get treated like a King/Queen.

Beautiful but over rated. Fabulous building and location, sky tower was very nice for drinks, and pan asian restaurant had great staff but was very underwelming and so was the food. extortionate price for our night out for very average fare

Unique. Had afternoon tea which, if you are able, is something you really must do at least once in your life. The food is simple yet exquisite with several courses so don't eat like no tomorrow! They will give you a box to take any remaining goodies home though, which in itself is worth having. The hotel is absolutely stunning and lies with its star grading. Wonderfu.
Amazing Architecture. I went there after a tour at Souk madinat jumeirah and i really enjoyed it so much. High quality food, high quality service. I really enjoyed it so much

Bling bling experience - A voir. C'est kitschissime mais cela vaut la peine d'y faire un tour malgré tout mais attention pas d'entrée possible sans réservation au restaurant ou au bar. on vous impose aussi un montant minimum à dépenser pour les consommations. Voir aussi mes commentaires sur le restaurant Al Muhana. C'est le temple de la démesure, on en prend plein les yeux avec les couleurs et le mobilier ampoulé et extravagant. Fontaines et aquarium en prime. The ultimate bling-bling experience in Dubai. You need to have a reservation at the bar or the restaurant to get in and you need to spend a certain amount on food and drinks (no one course meal allowed). We went to the bar on the 27th floor and to Al Muhana retaurant. The bar overviewing the bay is a must, good music and unique fancy cocktails. See my comments on Al Muhana restaurant. A must see for the extravaganza, the colours, the unbelievable furniture, the fountains and the aquarium. Gives you an idea of what money can buy.
Expensive , but amazing. we just loved the afternoon tea here surrounded by the rich and famous, in this beautifully lavish hotel, wonderful experience

Iconic !. Iconic structure of dubai . Its sad that u can watch it only from a distance .reservations are required to visit the hotel from inside .Lot of souvenir you can by to get the feel of this Fabulous HotelIt is a Tourist attraction and is included in the city tour of most itineraries
Beach side view. It is beautiful built , but i could not get a chance to go inside it, but i had a beach side view & feel around that hotel it was nice.
High Tea amazing experience. A truly unique experience to have High Tea in this amazing building. A once in a lifetime experience. The staff are amazing and the setting is top class. Well worth it
Saw from outside. We took a cab from airport on our layover in Dubai. We didn't go inside but driver gave us history of how it has few floors under water.
Awestruck!. This is the tallest tower in the world and a landmark in Dubai! Was simply enthralled by the architecture and the scale of the building! A must visit!

Dinner experience. I went for a dinner to Burj Al Arab last year on a business occasion... The experience was quite pleasant i was surprised at how good the food was and the service was impeccable... The fuss around this hotel is understandable...

Estravagance and money. Whist starting to show its age, this place is amazing. The cars parked out the front door ranged from RR, Ferrari, Lamborghinis, Aston martins. $$$$$$$$$$ plus. The dancing fountain was lovely and the service was warm and welcoming. A must visit.
take a photo from the beach. take a photo from the beach or from inside the wild wadi waterpark. you can't go through the gate to get up close thoough
Great hotel. journey of great luxury business hotel with exquisite attention this place wins quintessential modern architecture is a great experience .

What a magnificant building!. All I can say is... WOW!
What a truly amazing piece of art!
Defiantly a must see when you are in Dubai but defiantly wouldn't suggest paying the stupid amounts of money just to go inside.

Heaven in real world. It is hard to find words to describe the excellence and superb quality of this hotel. It feels like you are in a magical word, where everything works beyond your expectations. It feels like a dream. At least once in your lifetime: a must to stay.
wonderful night. enjoy the fountain show and go around the dubai mall it was crowded and inside very nice restaurant which offer variety of food

High Tea Experience. Worth the money to experience 7 star luxury. I'd suggest skipping breakfast before you go because the delicious treats just keep on coming! View is amazing and the staff are polite and professional.

Exudes luxury. We booked afternoon tea, it was every penny., pure luxury and opulence. we had a seat at the window with great views. The service was outstanding, very posh but not stuffy. I would highly recommend as a one off treat. We also got a gift at the end of a small box with chocolates on the bottom tray and a lovely pen on the top tray.

Overrated and simply not Chique. Yes everything is gold and glitter, everything shines and is of the best materials, everything is rich and expensive and yet, everything is tasteless and lacks real class. It's over the top. Hated it actually
Feels like you are a king. The best luxurious place to stay. Don't forget to order the helicopter pick-up from Dubai airport - nice experience to have in the beginning of you vacation
Special treat. Cocktails at Sky view bar is a special treat. The stunning views over Dubai whilst sipping cocktails is a memory to last a lifetime.

Perfect end to the holiday!. I didn't know what to expect of this visit at first after hearing so many mixed emotions. The night turned out to be a lovely end to a weeks holiday in Dubai. Me and my friend booked the sky lounge bar last minute for evening drinks which came at a 350 AED minimum spend per person. At first we had two of the 'special' cocktails which were around 90 AED each, despite being expensive they were so refreshing! We then decided to share a bottle of wine. The service was brilliant, although you had to wait until a window seat was available before you could benefit the view. It wasn't as glamorous as we had thought, however being able to take some amazing pictures of the Burj Al Arab and the views from the top floor was definitely worth it. All holiday we tried to get these photos and found that you couldn't get a decent picture of the building without booking a reservation there.
Sky Bar. Worthwhile experience. Book in advance. Be prepared to wait for a window table but stunning evening views. Amazing selection of cocktails.

Dissapointing. We saved really hard to afford to go to The Burj Al Arab for afternoon tea, we organised a trip with Virgin back in the UK. We were advised to book early as it gets booked up. We decided my daughter and myself to do the 5 hour trip with a tour guide up the Burj Al Arab for afternoon tea, on to the Burj Kalifa and see the sites, then to come down from the Burj Kalifa and see the water fountains at the Dubai Mall.We arrived at the Burj Al Arab to be directed by our tour guide to the 1st floor. I thought we were waiting to go up in the lift to the Skybar that I had read up so much about.But to my surprise we were directed to the seating area on the first floor were we had low coffee tables and had to be seated with other people from the tour.Ive got to say the whole experience was such a disappointment, the guide even asked if we could take photos upstairs at the view and they said no. I felt the people were very pleasant at the Burj Al Arab but always felt we were an inconvenience.This trip cost £190.00 per person, I am still so upset to this day that we didn't go to the sky bar.On getting back to the hotel I mentioned it to the Virgin rep and still we have had no email from anybody explaining this. On returning home I read the info on the tour to see that I had misunderstood the info, and yes we were to go to the 1st floor for tea not the Skybar.So please anybody paying this amount of money read the info and make sure you go to the Skybar.Otherwise if you don't go to the skybar dont bother , go to Claridges in London instead.

Old but Gold. I have been coming here ever since it first opened, 15 years ago, and alot has changed being one of the many improvements this hotel has been trough. While comparing with other hotels that keep popping up, i still find it to be a 7 star hotel as the level of attention you get from the staff is amazing. The other attention the hotel gives is to every single detail, however this hotel will empty your wallets, but worth it.
must go. Brilliant if you can afford it must go seven star hotel went for lunch treated very well take a camera really nice views.
Breath-taking place !!. It's a must do while your in Dubai. Breathtaking place. Afternoon Tea was a treat !! Staff at the hotel were just wonderful. Highly recommended.

Awesomeness!. I emailed the resort and asked if I could drop by for a visit.Not only did they give me and my friend permission to visit, they offered to show us around! The lobby impressed us right off the bat with enormous gold pillars and dancing fountains. The honeycomb-style grid is very rare in hotels, and here it was an amazing design element. This hotel is all about breathtaking grandeur.The Royal Suite was actually booked during our visit, despite it being the lowest point of low season. Instead, we went to see one of their #2 suites. It starts with a grand foyer and merges into multiple sitting rooms with many bars, adjoined to offices complete with Mac desktops. The suite has two en-suite bedrooms. I remarked that I really liked the shadow clock that was projected onto the wall. Turns out these clocks were such popular items that the Burj began selling them to their guests!
One of a kind !. This is an awesome property and truly a 7 star hotel !..the architecture, design and style is a must watch ...world's one of a kind hotel and one of dubai 's iconic towers

Fantastic treat. Went for afternoon tea... £110 a bit pricey but worth the occasion. 7 courses including a fruit tart, roast beef and potato, sandwiches (that are replenished), scones with cream, a selection of cakes and creme brûlée and finally a gift and chocolates to take away. If it's your birthday or anniversary then tell them as they make it a little more special (no spoilers here). With a huge variety of drinks (coffee, tea, iced teas and coffees, milkshake etc) you easily wile away 2-3 hours. An experience worth the visit! Oh and the view's not bad!!!

Because of the feeling it gives you.. We had afternoon tea in the skyview bar: the service is second to none, the view fantastic indeed, and the feeling is just like sitting in a Rolls Royce. The food and drinks themselves though, are second to the ones we had in UK.

A brilliant property. A fantastic property, however the cover charges hit you. The food is nothing exceptional, however the service is brilliant. The decor leaves nothing to imagination and is amazing. You get stunned by the Opulence.

Truely a 7 star... 7 star hotel with all the facilities that one could ask for, very expensive though... Must visit if you love fine dining and don't mind spending a huge amount for the meal.. But if you are not a guest you cant visit this place.. But can definitely see it from the beach and enjoy the view..

Afternoon tea at Sky View. It was an amazing experience. The service was excellent we were running a bit late shopping (50 minutes late) but once we called them up they immediately shifted the reservation time. The food and drinks were excellent and presented really well and our hostess took great care during our tea. The view from the restaurant is great you can see Palm islands on one side and beach on the other. The bathroom has Hermes Products as mentioned in other reviews. The fountains in the lobby are amazing and you get all the time you want to look and photograph. The people in the hotel are very friendly and professional they take time out to talk to you and make your experience an un-forgetful one.

Best Part was the dancing fountains. My wife and I visited the Burj Al Arab for high tea. A couple of observations below:Burj Al Arab:The hotel is certainly different and commands respect. There is no doubt about that. The structure is amazing from the outside and is quite opulent on the inside. Not necessarily my taste in color scheme but amazing none the less. The dancing fountains on the inside were also quite a hit.High Tea:The food and tea were great however I do have a couple of quibbles. 1. I had booked my reservation and specifically requested a window table as it was my honeymoon. I was placed on a bench overlooking the water away from the window. There is no point in going to this establishment, spending $150 per head on tea and accoutrement, and not getting a window table. It almost ruined my whole experience there as no one from the hotel told me that it was a first come first served policy for the window. Had I known, I would have shown up earlier and not taken so many photos in the lobby. 2. The tea and assorted courses were ok, nothing spectacular. You are up there for the view so do yourself a favor show up early for your seating and be prepared to gently place down your Amex Black Card.Overall:Visiting the Burj Al Arab is a one and done event for me. I would try one of the other establishments for high team next time I visit dubai, or even better yet just eat a regular lunch and continue on to a notable restaurant for dinner.

Amazing!. We came to The Burj, to celebrate my daughter's 20th birthday, and treat a friend, with whom we were staying. Absolutely fabulous! Enjoyed looking around the atrium and marveling at all the decor.The food was exquisite, and Regina looked after us beautifully. My daughter was given a little birthday cake, whilst the string quartet played Happy Birthday.I explained to Regina, that had it been, her 21st, we'd of booked The Skyview Bar, could she take us up, just to have a look. As they were setting up for evening service, it wasn't possible, so she gave us a private tour of the 12th floor instead, incredible!Everything was done to make us feel special, and we felt like royalty for an afternoon. An experience never to be forgotton.
Very good. Very attentive staff in the sky bar shame about the doorman who left us wItinf as we asked for a normal cab

The world's only 7 star Hotel.... "The world's only 7 star Hotel" and is the third tallest hotel in the world.Burj Al Arab stands on an artificial island 280 m (920 ft) from Jumeirah beach and is connected to the mainland by a private curving bridge. The shape of the structure is designed to mimic the sail of a ship. Though we did not have chance to have the look inside but seeing it from outside was mesmerizing. But you can always take pictures from outside from the beach side.

Nice!!experience d 7* hotel!!. U need2 make reservation if not staying at d hotel ..Der is min spend ., we booked in eve 4 sky view bar..! Nice bar & view ... Food/snack was ok.. Not spectacular ... I was expecting more range -and better taste!!!... But d experince of seeing the 7* hotel is worth d time spent .. & going der!!! Must visit

Dinner in the underwater restaurant was out of this world. The dining experience here rivals the best in Paris. The service is perfect the setting is amazing and the food is unbelievably good. We enjoyed every mouthful and the presentation is exquisite. You will not be disappointed. Come once in your life if you can.

Wonderful afternoon tea at Skyview. Having read one or two blogs about the afternoon tea at the Skyview bar, we were keen to go! We booked the 4pm sitting and also booked for cocktails. As advised, we arrived early to look around the lobby and were pleased to find that you were seated in the order in which you'd checked in so we had a great window table overlooking the coast + the sea. The complimentary champagne went down very nicely (so much so that we ordered another glass!). The afternoon tea consists of 6 courses: berry tart, carvery (we had beef + mash), sandwiches, sorbet, scones+ cakes, with unlimited tea/coffee. You are offered additional sandwiches too. The scones and cakes are served on the same stand, in the shape of Burj al Arab. To finish, you are given a box of 4 chocolates. We thoroughly enjoyed everything! The cakes looked a little unappetising when they arrived but tasted wonderful and it's all enjoyed in an incredible setting. Cocktails are not such good value (£25-£30 for one) but we enjoyed seeing the view at day and night. Totally over the top, but thats what you go for! We have do many wonderful photos and memories from one afternoon/evening.
Yes, its tall. But will anyone come here if there is another building next to it beeing talller. Its a magnificent tourist attraction which will fade when a higher scrape is built
Nice time to spend.... I am visited for the morning breakfast it was a nice time i spend their almost 3 hours to see this place.

AMAZING!!. The views and High Tea were Very Grand and Extremely Impressive!! We were there just last week 2/6/15 to celebrate our 10yr Wedding Anniversary and they gave us Complimentary Rose and Pen and Chocolates. Silver Service was Fabulous in a Very Opulent Hotel and Location - I highly Recommend paying for the Experience :))

Afternoon tea. A must visit even if you don't return , not everyone's taste the £ 1 billion Hotel ( there not quite sure how much it cost) is in a different league to any other Hotel I've been to , sell the car ( or mother -in - law ) before you stay there and don't look at the bill as you won't be able to afford it ! we have been twice and would go back again Service impeccable as you would expect

Very posh.. When in Dubai this is perhaps the number 1 thing to do. While it was expensive, it was worth every cent. Sky tea, all 7 courses were taste sensations. 1 glass of champagne each included was very nice, but expensive to buy another, especially when your husband knocks it over. No offer of a replacement. Such a waste. The view was stunning. We had a corner table which gave us the best view. I would recommend every one do this if in Dubai. The whole experience was outstanding.

Excellent architecture. Go for breakfast there, you can reserve it online. select the restaurant inside and not the lobby one. The one inside is expensive but worth it as the spread is more and experience is amazing. to experience the hotel you have to stay or else you get limited access

A Must Visit When In Dubai If You Love Fine Dining. Truly a lovely dining experience but incredibly expensive (approx. $240 Aud for 12 oysters will give you an idea)It is one of those places you just have to say you have eaten at!!Great views, service and food and amazing wine list!!

Simply the best. Stayed here 3 times, total of 12 days, it is the most luxurious hotel I have stayed in. You come across people from all walks of life, it is amazing, from movie stars, footballers, rock stars to market traders from the east end of London. If you get the chance to stay, go for it...nothing will live up to it ever. It is huge, you will never imagine how big it is until you stay. The spa is amazing. The Hermes toiletries .... In your suite and the beach loo's ! Awesome, the whole experience.
View from the top. What an experience and that includes the 60 second trip up 124 floors. Views for miles. A trip not to be missed.

Live the luxury. It's just amazing how you feel the luxury and the richness just by arriving in front of it! I admit that many projects hotels and sky scrapers have been built after this one but still this comes on top of all... It's the icon of Dubai!!!! Must go and check it out on your next visit!
Pure quality, wow!. Amazing place, excellent service.Well worth a visit, sky view bar a great experience. Go in the daytime, you can see nothing at night!
You cannot come close. It's a beautiful building but you cannot come close if you are not a guest. You can see it from a public beach beside it or from Madinat Jumeirah.

a modern wonder. Iconic structure, that stands out from the urban sprawl of Dubai's skyscraper skyline.
A beautiful structure.
Like all things in Dubai............... very pricey!
Magnificent high tea in sky bar. A must do experience to visit this landmark hotel and go to the top floor for high tea. Expensive but once in a lfetime.
A must if your in Dubai. We visited the skyline lounge bar , three cocktails each and £200 bill , that being said you really must do it once , booking is required even for cocktails .

Loved this Hotel!. We booked to have cocktails right at the top of this Hotel and then have dinner at the restaurant next door.. It was amazing watching the sun set! you can see the world and right up to Atlanta's Hotel.
Afternoon tea at the Burj. Beautiful views, very calming peaceful. The interior was great, a grand hotel with an aquarium. I thoroughly enjoyed the great selection of treats for tea. A must do.

Neat experience. Together with two colleagues I went to the Burj after work on Thursday night (which is the start of the weekend in UAE). We had heard that traffic could be terrible on Thursday we left well on time from old Dubai (Dubai Creek), but actually made it to the Burj in less than 25 minutes, so we ended up being there at 6pm while doors to the Sky Lounge didn’t open until 7pm. We had the chance to take marvelous pictures of the building (and us standing it front of it!), admire the Disney like structure (inside), the aquarium and the water fountain. We waited in the lobby and had a drink in the café there (my orange juice was UAE 45). Then we went up with the elevator to the 27th floor and were struck by a beautiful site and the most extensive cocktails menu I’ve ever seen - so much choice, but lucky the waiters are very knowledgeable and can recommend you a drink (I liked both the ones they recommended to me!). The only downside was that it was foggy (sandstorm) and it grew dark within half an hour and as such you didn’t fully appreciate the truly unique place as all you could see was darkness (we were with 3 people so we couldn’t get a seat with the city view, we had an ocean view). The waiter, Ruben, was awesome and because it was a colleague’s birthday he brought her a rose and cake, and ended up giving all of us a rose (which was very sweet). My I two cocktails and they were both great, we were also foreseen of a variety of snacks (mini quiches, olives, roasted almonds and cashews). It was a great experience and worth every penny (minimum spend p.p. is UAE 350).

Nice view from the beach.... Nice view from the beach... I didn't go in as I was alone and it was very expensive and from my past experiences in UAE when I wanted to enter a place (club or "romantic" attraction) alone I was told I wasn't allowed in as I needed a female partner.... (is this just me??) But the view is nice and the architecture is great...
towering beauty. The landmark of Dubai for quite a long time Burj Al Arab is a wonderful architecture on Jumeirah beach road
Fancy. Very fancy and a must see place , the luxury is in the rooms you gotta make sure you have a visit room access ahead !!!! Gold everything played place , awsome

Amazing view and service. We went for late afternoon tea and cocktails for an opportunity to see the hotel and the view. Make sure to make your reservation well in advance or leverage Amex Platinum for a reservation. A Must See!

Brilliant burj. It's worth paying the extra to do it in style being greeted and taken to the separate first class lounge que skipping is a must so fast track is the way to go it has the most amazing views it proceeded expectations almost a three hour venture

Over the top 7 star!. I went to the Sky line bar for cocktails, thats the cheapest way to get in this 7 star hotel and have a sneaky look around. Cocktails are VERY expensive but I am glad I have been there. great views from the skyline bar in the evening

a standout for sure and a must see. This 7 star hotel is worth a visit but you have to book a meal or drinks on the top floor restaurant level before you go there. They need to welcome you in
Its worth the cost. Everything is so opulent. The wine and drink menu is something else....here's where you can impress anyone!!

Sky restaurant Lunch. Booked this for my mum. She was excited and really looking for ward to this. Unfortunately, my booking had been cancelled without informing me. It was sorted out but not very quickly. we were left to wait outside the gates in the 40 deg Dubai heat! My mum was a hot red mess.Once the booking was sorted, the situation was much improved!The staff inside the restaurant were really friendly and welcoming. The Nepalese manager was very accommodating and asked on our progress at each stage of the lunch.The food was amazing, my family were really happy with each course. So much so that they started taking pictures on their phones. The glass lift going up and then down to the entrance was an experience in itself. Be prepared for the ear-popping feeling.

Just wow. Got a chance to visit this place and not just looking from outside so it was fabulous experience to see it from outside as well from inside and I really liked it. It was wow experience for me and I find it really good. Go and try this place
Brunch. We booked to have Brunch in the Sky Bar and it was totally amazing and worth every penny. The selection of food was incredible, and you could eat as much as you liked.

Height of luxury. We had an amazing, unforgettable experience of 7-star luxury at this place. You need to book yourself in for a minimum order of food, but after being treated like royalty, we were pleased that we did not miss the chance.
Magnificient. Magnificent piece of architecture.. A perfect location for an evening tea. The one of its kind restaurants and lobby..

Review on just the View. Burj Al Arab is an iconic symbol of Dubai. It looks much smaller in the photos! It can be seen from many parts of Dubai (Not as much as Burj Al Arab which can be seen from everywhere!). It has the best view in the city, right off Jumeirah Beach! Just sit at the beach and enjoy the view. Another person from my hotel went on the tour inside and said its over rated and not worth the money. There is nothing inside that I want to see anyways.
Amazing. Had lunch at the Sky View Bar for my birthday. It was the best experience. The food and desserts were delicious. Well worth the money.
Amazing structure. One of the worlds greatest feats of engineering and a beauty to view. You'll be amazed by the inside and the cocktails aren't shabby either

Worth a look. Worth checking out for the opulence and experience. The sky bar is not great at night since there is no view --- just a dark ocean out the windows. The escalator fish tanks and people-watching was the best part of our visit to Burj Al Arab.
Worth the trip. Buy tickets online before you go, they are cheaper!! It also means you have a set time for your trip, no need to queue.
Mind blowing!. The Burj Al Arab is quite simply the most amazing hotel to visit. we were lucky enough to eat in the restaurant on the 47th floor, and it lived up to its 7 stars?

High tea in the sky . not as good as expected at all. Whilst staying in Abudabi I took my wife out for High Tea, at the Burj Al Arab, it was a surprise for her birthday, but it was very dissapointing, the even was average, the staff far too pretentious. They gave a very warm welcome, they found it difficult to actually make a decent cup of tea, despite the many selections on offer, a simple strong english tea was amazingly weak. not a great experience at all, and certainly not value for money, although it had a great view. When it came to leaving the staff at the door were unhelpful, and it took me some time and lots of moans before they got me a cab. The up side was that I did complain, and I would give the hotel credit as they gave me a full refund. So their after sales is great...
luxuries. i remember when i went there it was before party; it was interesting how to make foods like burj al arab! and other thing i love elevator of burj

A must for dinner. Dined at the Bab Al Yam restaurant at the Burj Al Arab. A great buffet restaurant where the choice is endless whether, it is caviar, oysters, sushi or curry you will find it all. The staff are friendly and helpful.

Awesome high tea!. We had high tea at the Burj Al Arab and it was such a delightful experience. The inside of the hotel is just stunning and the service outstanding. The high tea menu was lovely, with alternate options for vegetarians and you could literally eat as much as you want. Worth the money!

Afternoon tea treat. Went for afternoon tea on a very hot day, had a window seat and as the haze cleared we could see the palm. Amazing views, surprised at the number of sandwiches and cakes that kept coming if you wanted it. Glass of champagne each and unlimited teas and coffees. Waiters are very accommodating and most visitors are regular folk wanting an experience. Stayed about 2 hours. Made much use of the free wifi and taking lots of pics, really fab afternoon, definitely do it , cost per head £114 at current exchange rate ... Do it!
Skyview Bar - Amazing Experience. Skyview bar on a Friday night... Birthday drinks with my fiancée. Outstanding service and amazing experience. A must try for anyone visiting Dubai...
Champagne lunch. Brilliant! What an experience! It might be pricey, but you only live once! Great to see the hotel, staff super attentive. Make sure you ask for a skyline view, its superb!

Need a head for heights. Brilliant, you must book in advance to save disappointment as it can get very busy. Great view of Dubai although the sand cloud spoils the horizon. You can actually feel it moving. well worth the trip
Junsui !!!. Very good.... had amazing food at Junsui... was best Asian food I had in my life... extremely good... would love to go back...

Beautiful in the backdrop of the Persian Gulf. This seven star hotel overlooks the turquoise waters of the Persian Gulf. It makes a beautiful set up. Went there for the famous afternoon tea. It is a bit expensive but why not it is the only seven star in the world. Excellent service and views.

High tea at Sky Bar. Visited the Burj Al Arab for high tea at the Sky view Bar and it was an amazing experience. I have read on previous sites on how expensive it is, however I do not agree. The staff are extremely attentive and all of us were full before we even got to the pastries section of the high tea! Great value for the experience and quality of food. Would definitely do it again.

Lunch. Had a business lunch at the restaurant on the ground floor which faces the sea, quite nice food. The hotel interior is a bit over the top with the colour selections. nice line up of cars outside as well, havent stayed at the hotel.
Luxurious Afternoon Tea. We came here with friends for a special occasion. The time stopped indeed and enjoyment began. The atmosphere was awesome. Live music, attentive staff and delicious food.

awesome. Just wonderful place to stay, everyone at least once in a life must have to try to stay in this beautiful and wonderful hotel of the world. I have really enjoyed whetehr it was room, facilities, recreation or restaurants. I would definitely recommend it as it still remains as no. 1 destination in dubai.
wow. Birthday dinner with my daughters. The scenery and the ambiance were jaw droppingHighly recommendable. The staff were exceptional

Great atmosphere. A beautifully presented hotel. You cannot help to be impressed upon entering this building and viewing from afar. It is such a pleasure to sit at the bar at the top and the restaurant 'below' is really something to see! You will need to book and dress smartly but you will not be disappointed.

Hi Tea at Sahn Eddar. So this turns out to be the cheapest way to enjoy the self claimed 7 star hotel. Well actually it is really amusing. I mean 24 carat gold pillars arounds!We wanted to get the sky view bar but it was fully booked a week in advance as well, any way we got the Sahn Eddar booked. The high tea menu is the same for both sky view and Sahn however in our case you don't get access to the entire hotel only the common area which is also approachable to tourists for free.Our high tea was a 7 course meal with mostly sweets. The food/snacks were indeed fresh and served exclusively. You actually do are treated well but of course for 500dh per head is more about the experience than the food.It was our anniversary so in the end we were presented with a rose and a slice of cake and lastly every table gets a chocolate box with a burj al Arab pen, which kinda leaves you happy taking back a good memory in hand.
Wow again. you must go for afternoon tea its a bit pricey but well worth it.The service is out of this world the view is stunning if you are lucky enough as we were to go to the top

Middle East Luxury. No doubt the hotel is iconic and paved the way for luxury hotels globally. I really wanted to see the place for myself and must admit it does not disappoint, from the original architecture to the opulent interior and over the top decoration.Be aware the hotel is on an island and you cannot access this without a prior agreement or reservation. To get in call ahead and preferably make a reservation for lunch or dinner if you want to guarantee access.On a budget - go for the Bab Al Yam pool-side café/restaurant located on the ground floor, you still get to travel through the main parts of the hotel and see the amazing interior. It's an 'all you can eat' buffet but by that I mean expect to pay a minimum of £100 per head with a drink, take it easy, stay a long time and make the most of keep going up for different food, I had seafood (lobster, crab, prawns and sushi) followed by a pasta dish, then choose your meats with roast potatoes and veg, then make another visit for any bits you still fancy, don't forget to leave room for a couple of desserts. Seriously I did seven light courses over two hours to make sure I was getting the most for my money. The food was great, the best buffet I have experienced.The staff were exceptional, the called me by my first name from the moment I entered and every member of the team knew my name not just one. With the heat they kept bringing me cold flannels.Of course if money is not object then you dine at Al Mahara where you are surrounded by the aquarium and given the 7 star silver service treatment, however expect to pay £250 per head minimum, significantly more if you go full out with champagne and caviar.In my reservation I also requested access to Sky View Bar located on the 27th Floor because I wanted to check out the views of Dubai. Worth heading up there to see 'how the rich live' and check out the typical Burj Al Arab design, but be warned it is very extravagant and expect to see some of the most expensive cocktails in the world on the menu, one at £870 allowed you to keep the Swarovski glass and another at £3,000 was made with gold leaf.... A regular wine or G&T would set you back around £20 a piece. I would also suggest heading up there during the day because after dark you cannot actually appreciate the view.Tacky to the extreme the hotel and bar are a world away from what I enjoy in my regular life but I would recommend anyone to check it out just to experience the sheer extreme of a places designed specifically for wealthy Arabs and Russians. The weird side to it was the fifty or so Chinese all lined up for photos in the reception, obviously as part of their sightseeing trip and the two English families sitting close to me at dinner, instead of being aligned with the other foreign wealth at the hotel, they actually spoke and looked like they were on a cheap holiday break, one couple were very 'my husband is considerably richer than yow' and the other family looked and spoke like they had paid for the trip from money earned from appearing on benefits street.On passing the row on Bentleys and Lamborghinis outside I did look back and think 'great to experience, but I prefer to be a sightseer than a resident.'
Wealth !. Visited here 4 years ago , had tea on the 26th floor , what a treat and the views are spectacular . Interesting looking at the decor , gold and plush .
a miracle over the sea. its the most luxury hotel in the world , they treat you as a prince or Mehraja in your own mansion , unique in every thing

Classy hotel. We didn't go inside the building because we certainly couldn't afford to stay there but it is exceptional to see. It is touted to be a 7 star hotel but we were told that that rating doesn't really exist. It is in a great location, right at the beach and worth a visit.

Outlandish Hotel but one heck of an experience. This hotel is the crown jewel of Dubai in my opinion. Hearing that it was the World's only 7-Star hotel made it beyond interesting to us. We were only there for one night but everything there is done well beyond any other hotel we've set foot in. I could go on forever about the amenities but it's one of those places that you have to see for yourself. If you're in Dubai, you owe it to yourself to check this place out.

Afternoon tea. Had afternoon tea here for a special occasionFood was excellent, much more than expectedService was outstandingHotel is quite amazing, well worth a visit Sky lounge area where afternoon tea is served has breath taking viewsAnd a little gift/ surprise at the end
Wow. If you want to have a look in here you have to either stay here or eat here. They have several options . Make sure to take your camera as the foyer is amazing.

There's a reason it's the worlds only 7 star... Likes: It's considered world's most luxurious hotel, and is.
From the cocktails to lobby, this place oozes with class.
The views rivalled the Burj Khalifa's, the interior far exceeded.
Swanky, class and utterly amazing!
Dislikes: Can't afford to stay.
a nice experience. u have to see how luxurious is that hotel u spend a couple of hour having a coffee or something to see an imaginari life

Felt like a Princess. As you can't just rock up at the Burj Al Arab we arranged a tour and was picked up by a chauffer and taken to the Burj Al Arab for evening drinks. The tour included a certain amount of drinks and we also bought a small meal which was excellent. The views were amazing at night. The hotel itself inside was worth the visit.

truely mind blowing. Excellent everything amazing and amazing amazing views of Palm Island and Dubai, the service team were amazing so friendly but at the same time very professional, and the lifts well you have to go there and experience it for yourself

Highlight of the visit. When we eventually found the entrance (you simply cannot miss the tallest building in the world) but access is through Dubai Mall which takes two days to shop through, the night time water display set to music brings tears to your eyes

High Tea at Burj Khalifa. Burj-Ai-Arab, the iconic and magnificent hotel standing tall at the manmade Island. The Design of the building is inspired from the ancient ship and is flabbergasted for its architectural brilliance. Explore and adore the architectural design of the Hotel. Rejuvenate and enjoy wide range of tea parties from traditional to signature teas and delicious cookie and pastries at the Burj-AI-Arab
Spell Bounding. What else to say. It was mesmerising. The roof Top restaurant was the cherry on the cake with its wonderfull biew with Food
Amazing Hotel. Unfortunately not in my price range but it did not stop us going to visit and live the dream for a couple of hours, treated the same as a paying guest unbelievable.

One not to miss.. Lunch at the roof top restaurant with stunning views and excellent food either from the taster or a la carte menu is an experience not to be missed before retiring for a lazy cigar and brandy.
amazing hotel.. had dinner at the top floor restaurant, beautiful place a must visit. expensive with excellent service altough the food was good but not for what was charged.

Very luxurious. Lovely hotel and lovely surroundings. I love the bar at the top of the hotel. The place is very luxurious yes but it is nothing compared to the service and luxury of a 5 star hotel in Manhattan or Paris.
Wow!. Magnificent hotel, lovely afternoon tea, well worth a visit and you get a special gift to take away.

Top of the world. Best thing to see in Dubai and well worth the cost
If you can book with groupon and you will receive a good deal that includes fast track

Skyview Bar. First time in the Burj Al Arab and could not fail to be impressed by the building. The staff were fantastic. My only gripe was with the actually drinks, I don't mind paying the price for quality but the ingredients were no better than a hight street bar chain in most cases and after sampling many of the cocktails from the menu was really not impressed by the quality at all. poorest cocktails I have ever had in a high end hotel and I have had a few. They were also the most expensive cocktails I have ever paid for. Saying that I would go again but only for convenience if I was staying at the hotel. which I hope to do one day. Once I started ordering classic cocktails that were not on the menu the standard went up and I enjoyed them.

Not to miss in Dubai. One of the hyped places... cant miss to see if in Dubai...However would love to be on the private balcony... couldn't get access... Guess should travel during winters during Dubai since its a hot placeShopping only when there is sales and discounts!

Worth its seven stars. Over the top sheer luxury. You need half a day to learn how to use all the gadgets in your suite, 12 telephones, private laptop and fax, automatic curtains (three layers) huge plasma screens , music that can be piped through whichever rom you want...the list is endless.I would have loved to use my magnetic leather bound door 'key', but our butler Francis beat us to the door every time. So many sumptuous couches to lounge on, a bed you didn't want to get out of I could go on and on. Order a cup of coffee by the pool and you get a tray full of sugar lumps, tongues ,milk, cream, iced towels etc.The pool towels are too thick to dry yourself on. I could go on and on for hours but I think you get the point.

Luxury you wouldn't believe - or would you?. We had been told it was almost impossible to get into the Burj if you weren't staying there. However, much to our surprise, we had a chance meeting with a young local man who had an uncle who has a business in the "foyer" so he was able to invite us in. We had coffee and hot chocolate in the "foyer" and walked around looking at how the other half lives! Truly an amazing once in a lifetime experience. If you can arrange to take afternoon tea there, then my advice would be to splash out and do it!

7 star ecstacy. blown away not by the hotel but the service staff been there for lunch amazing experience suncity tours organised this lunch at burj al arab along with the dubai city tour , some parts of hotel very loud but overall good

Fantastic. Going On top of the world is a great feeling. What a ride up - the floors go by faster than you can count. And the various descriptions of how the property was built and is being maintained was great.
Amazing view. Amazing view, gives you some basic information about how the tower was constructed and in which timeframe. You actually feel the tower moving if you stand on the deck

Honeymoon . I stayed in one of the 7 stars hotel suites and it was just like a dream you can ask to be pick up from the airport by Rolls Royce and have a dedicated butler for your stay the suite was actually a penthouse the ground floor consists of a very large living room with windows from ground to ceiling a very luxury dining area , bar area and full functional office also luggage room with guest bathroom. On the second floor a panoramic bedroom with seating area and mini bar .the bathroom was very spacious and luxury with Hermes toiletries double sink jacuzzi and rain shower with massage also there's a big walk in closet. Staying there is almost like a dream I really recommend try this hotel as a lifetime experience.

A breakfast treat. There is only one Burj Al Arab and it is a must see for anyone visiting or living in Dubai.It can be rather formal and stuffy, and is of course expensive.For me the best time to visit is for breakfast, but try and get a table with the higher seats or it can be uncomfortable on a low chair and low table to eat properly.The food is great, the service is good and the Hermes toiletries in the bathrooms are a nice touch.
Fantastic hotel. We had lunch on the top floor and it was superb although very expensive. The view was fantastic, the service beyond question and the cuisine excellent.

Afternoon tea. There was nothing to dislike about this hotel or the experience we had, we were treat with care from arriving at the hotel. The seven courses were excellent the service amazing nothing was rushed.We were celebrating our 40th anniversary and we were presented with a long stem red rose and a cake a lovely touch.

Snooty reception but first class restaurant. A beautiful but probably too overstated hotel for my taste. The decor is luxurious but I felt that the reception staff for the restaurant were not as welcoming as I thought they should have been. On the other hand the restaurant staff were brilliant and the views at dusk over the palm superb. As for the food do not know if it was worth it but it tasted excellent and the ambience, which you are paying for, is out of this world.

Hands down best hotel I have stayed at. I was lucky enough to stay here last year and i must say the pace blew me away, the rooms were incredible the view as just spectacular. The service is impeccable and i only wish i spent more time there.

Very very expensive and very little food choice in Skyview Bar. We visited the Sky View Bar here and the cocktails are really superb. The issue is the food, very little choice so make sure you eat first and then go to the bar just for the drinks. Only music on offer was Jazz that wasn't that great and overall a very expensive night for mediocre service. There are much better and cheaper options.

Afternoon tea at The Burj ..a must do. You must do this ..a very special experience. Booked for two ladies first visit to Dubai in celebration of a 50 th birthday.Booked for 4pm slot. Not sure if just pure luck .was seated down the window edge looking back up towards downtown over Jumeirah beach...wow what a view..Afternoon tea is a 7 course affair....plus unlimited pots of tea And gold dusted cappuccinos. Not rushed at all waiters were very knowledgable and not intrusive ...even finding a safety pin..spent virtually 4 hours at the Burj at approx £120pp ...worth every penny!
Most Beautiful Hotel. View from Hotel is spectacular. Hotel itself is a masterpiece. We just went for sightseeing and if I could afford it I would like to stay there.

The Poster building for Dubai. Fantastic place and a real iconic landmark away from Dubai's skyline. it's one of the first things you see when coming to Dubai. The beach on the palm is absolutely fantastic, and to think its a man made beach is mind boggling!

Great Asian afternoon Tea. Thanks to the previous reviews on Tripadvisor I booked the Asian Afternoon Tea in the Junsui Restaurant.
Make sure to come early so you can view the ground and first floor, before you go down to the restaurant.
Leah, Vipin and Melody made sure that I thoroughly enjoyed my 7 course tea experience :-).

Afternoon Tea. What a wonderful experience.
We loved everything about the time at the Burj Al Arab
Do it for a wonderful experience.
You are only on this earth once

A must see!. We have all seen the pictures but nothing compares to seeing the splendour of the actual building! We had an excellent view not only from the hotel but also whilst on a city tour where we got an up close and personal view from a public beach which was just as impressive! Please make sure this is on your list!

Mother's Day -Tea For Two. Superior experience in every way. Very attentive servers, food was delicious . When you are seated you're served champagne which is a great way to start in my book! It was a wonderful Mother's Day!

Sheer class. We have been fortunate enough to stay at the Burj Al Arab several times . Every time is an amazing experience it is absolutely the best hotel and experience anyone could have. My husband organised the rolls Royce phantom it was just the best experience !!! The driver just amazing too lovely made my day . Just can't recommend this experience enough times oozes class .

Impressive!. Had to see this hotel and was impressed by the building and the view from the top restaurant. we enjoyed an absolute stunning buffet with an excellent choice of food. The highlight was a helicopter tour from the top, the start and landing after the tour were simply amazing!

Interesting though costly. It was interesting that they provide information of the building as you travel your way to the lift. Up there everything is still, a little boring because the view was not fantastic but good experience.
got to do it... Just time it right at sunset, so that you can see both daylight and night Dubai...unfortunately we went at night.Experienced the fastest lift I have ever been on.
Out of the world experince. I stayed and visited the hotel with my friends in December its feels like heaven to be in there the staff is vigilant , the feel is very good ,

WOW!!!. The absolute highlight of our holiday. We had booked for dinner several weeks before we arrived and had a ball. The staff were the nicest, friendliest people and encouraged you to take photographs and enjoy your experience. The restaurant was on the 27th floor and we had a table by the window looking out over Dubai as the sun set, it was spectacular. We had the taster menu and the food was sublime as was the matching wines. Definitely for a special occasion but I think we'll be back.

only 7 star. what else can be said. The true 7 star hotel. stunning deco and the restaurants second to non. Breath taking building and the service is out of this world. I highly recommend the high tea, what an experience
Overrated & over priced.. Not worth the £138 per person for lunch, decor in Hotel far too ostentatious for our liking. Certainly something to see, but I would not rush back!
Got to the gate.. not passed it. Couldn't see the value in paying a huge amount of money for coffee and cake. Walked through the Atlantis at the Palm instead!
an experience. Just to visit it is enough, very opulent, had drinks in sky bar, amazing view, amazing price too But worth the experience

Simply the best!. Lovely relaxed atmosphere, no stuffiness. The staff are classy and chatty. The food and drinks were perfection, as you can imagine.We had thee Champagne Afternoon Tea and would recommend it to anyone. Next time I'll be back for dinner and cocktails for sure.The reception and general interior of the hotel are worth visiting for alone. Throw in the warm welcome and exceptional food/drink and you're onto a winner.

two night stay. Booked the one bedroom suite but was upgraded to panoramic suite because of gold level sirius. The suite is immaculate. The carpet and furniture are so clean they look new. The amenities are of the highest quality I have ever experienced. Even the clothes hangers and hairdryer are high end. The butler service is amazing. They will carry your beach bag and escort you to the pool. The spa is beautiful and the jacuzzi has much stronger jets than the one in the suite. The beach lounge chair area is exclusive but the swimming area is for all of Jumeriah beach hotel guests including club members and day pass guests so it can be crowded at the weekend. The only thing I didn't like was the video and picture taking in the lobby. There are signs saying this is not allowed but it is not enforced. So you may end up in the background of strangers photos. A nice touch in the breakfast buffet is you select your bread choices and the waiter will take it inside the kitchen to toast and bring it to your table.

Outstanding Sky Aftrenoon Tea at Sky View Bar BAA including a glass of champagne. High Tea Afternoon at Sky View Bar on the top floor of BAA is an amazing experience in overall, from the moment you step in the Hotel with the most professional staff attitude, kind service, superb quality of all specialty delights included in the treatment. Window tables offer amazing views over Dubai coastline. We have booked directly with the Hotel's restaurant reservation department, everything was more than fantastic.

Surreal and spectacular . Had afternoon in tea here. Entrance spectacular as is the hotel. Scones amazing. Great selection of sandwiches and cakes and children loved it too. Staff friendly and attentive. Loos gorgeous. Best to book in advance. Best part was just being in this amazing place. Visited sky bar for a quick drink afterwards and enjoyed the stunning view.
Amazing view. Amazing view over the of Dubai. Book in advance and you get the tickets lot cheaper. Elevator was amazing experience as well.

Great burj. We visited burj al arab on half day city tour. It is an impressive building in the middle of quite and deep blue sea and white sand. We wanted to visit inside but entry is restricted for prebooked guest and that is costly.

Amazing view. We called to reserve a table , they asked for the credit card number cause in case we didn't show we will be charged 200 Aed, and they told us about the dress code no shorts no flip flops, and that there will be a minimum charge of 350 aed/pers.The place is cool and for some tables they have an amazing view so for that you need while reserving to ask to sit on the tables with view cause there are tables without any view even tough it is called sky view. we did get the chance to move to a table with a view and it was really great
Fantastic. Me and my friends visited earlier and Bab Al Yam restaurant was just fantastic.Food and service is so great thats why Burj Al Arab stands out around

Tea Time. This was a great experience and the view will blow you away. Make sure to book this in advance and book the 1PM time. The reason for 1 and not 1:30 is because if you book the 1PM tea time you will be sat right next the window. You can see downtown dubai and the palm. The service will blow you away. My wife is vegetarian and doesn't eat eggs, they remade all her courses without eggs. The food was good and make sure you don't eat before hand because there is so much food. Well worth roughly $200/person

The most excellent Tea set. Really great service great view only… for the taste.. I would rather give a fair rate. Must book in advance, pay in advance and also need to be there ON TIME. Need to be register first in order to get in to the Burj Al Arab after all this is the most exclusive world class hotel...

Arabic Restaurant. To finally see inside the Burj was the first treat and then to sample arabic food in the beautiful surroundings made this a perfect evening. We ate in Al Iwan and enjoyed a wide range of Arabic foods plus some continental flavours too. All delicious.

great !!. me & my family had an friday brunch on 8th of may 2015 at burj , it was an un forgetable experience , the quality of food was fantastic , the decor , the location , crockery , service , everything , no words to discribe burj...... must must must visit place.

Unique Experience. Had the opportunity to see the Royal Suite. Fabulous. This is not open all the time but during a visit to Emirates Academy of Hospitality Management, they invited all of us to walk over and see the suite. Crossing the Bridge to Burj Al Arab is breath-taking. The interior lobby is Fabulous!
Burj Tour and Lunch. The service and staff are extremely friendly and helpful. The different restaurants to choose from are set in amazing settings and the food is 7*.
7 Star Luxury Hotel. Enjoyed the High Tea experience by the window. It was wonderful and the service impeccable. Delightful music as we dined. The views were as wonderful as the service!
symbol of UAE. Everything is great in a seven star hotel. The amazing view of the beach from the hotel is mindblowing .The thing I disliked is it was too costly.

Six stars. When you are ready for the stay of a lifetime, book one of the suites at the Burj! Outstanding views, terrific service and hands on floor concierge. Amazing restaurant and lobby with special shops on site.

Burj Al Arab treasure in Desert...beautiful master piece.. Burj Al Arab is a place you can dine with amazing experience of master of architecture. Although it comes with price, it's worth spending at least once.
Worth the price. The dining is on the top floor so the view is just amazing. Food good but over-priced. Had to have a reservation to even get onto the property.

High Tea. We had booked high tea in the sky bar, although very expensive it was an excellent experience with the very best quality food and plenty of it. Make sure you get a window seat not looking out to sea because all you will see is sea (there's a surprise....)
see it from the water. we saw the burj from the sea. It was cool to see but a little too expensive to actual visit. It's taller than we thought it'd be

Amazing building to see from outside. When I looked at it coming out of the shopping Mall, I was struck with an awe looking at this magnificent building. It did not look real to me, it looked like a painting on the canvas and the canvas is the vast skies in the back! I will not pay to take a ride to 124th floor.

Burj Al Arab afternoon tea. We stayed in the Atlantis, the Palm, but had afternoon tea at the Burj Al Arab. My wife and I were on the 1st floor but you can pay more and go on one of the upper floors. The service was excellent as you would expect. There are about a dozen table settings with a window view. A lady was playing on the harp. There were several different courses and they ask if you have any food allergies an any special occasions. It was my wife's 50th and they brought in a Birthday Cake slice with Happy Birthday and a candle. Plus the waitresses sang happy Birthday and the lady on the harp played Happy Birthday. We arrived by taxi and left by taxi which was not included in our booking. It was a bit pricey, approx. £100 per person when you compare London's Ritz, Savoy, Claridges of approx. £60 but it is a superb hotel and landmark in Dubai and we were on holiday so all is good. A worthwhile experience. The service was 7 star as it advertises. We went in May 2015

Lovely evening. We visited the Skybar. we first visited in 2013 getting engaged so thought it only right to visit on our honeymoon. Once again service was fantastic, so friendly and the view amazing over Dubai at night. Definitely worth treating yourselves, for a cocktail or afternoon tea.

If you are afraid of heights, you have to avoid this one. If you are a tall buildings fan then this is paradise. It is a theme park for architecture buffs. But if you are in any way afraid of heights, this is a site you can easily avoid. As the views from down of the building itself are just fine.
Awesome property.. Burj Al arab is a awesome property. Beach of Burj Al arab is also very happening and clean beach. must visit place of Dubai.

Breathtaking. We pre-booked an evening meal in a restaurant overlooking the pool so we could watch the sunset which was beautiful.
The food was amazing, the chefs explained individual dishes to us while a guy serenaded us with a guitar!Nice touch

Worth a visit. We had cocktails before dinner at the Sky View Bar in the Burj Al Arab hotel and the view of the sea and shoreline is lovely. Service in the bar is impeccable, but be warned, it is very expensive. We knew going in that we were expected to spend a minimum of $100 per person, so we went fully warned. We also dined at the Al Mahara restaurant on the first floor, the one that looks like you are underwater. Food and service are excellent, but again, very expensive.Don't expect to be able to stroll in to the hotel just to look around. You will need a reservation and confirmation number with you, or you won't even get into the parking lot - security is very tight. Plan ahead, book your reservations and enjoy the beautiful property as a once in a lifetime experience.
Go to 148th floor. Feels very futuristic. The extra 24 floors makes a huge difference. breath taking views. Just before Sunset is best time to visit. The only place that is a must see in Dubai.
Afternoon tea. Fantastic place to visit, afternoon tea was awesome, prices are steep but what would you expect for such a service, fantastic

Beautiful building.. As you expect, its a beautiful building, great to see. Unfortunately because of its exclusive-ness you aren't allowed inside for a look. Unless of course you have a reservation in its restaurant, bar or of course a room. A bit disappointing if I'm honest but hey, if you have enough money to stay there you don't just want anyone walking in would you!
just wow. we went to the top, floor 148 , night time expensive, £60 each , but ,while in dubai, well do it , and a great view, seen it now, no need to do it again

got to visit this hotel. had evening dinner here as a treat.you can also have afternoon tea or cocktails.food and service is unbeleivable.best to ask your consierge to sort it for you,as it will be cheaper.if you visit dubai you have to go here.

Burj Al Arab. It is the state of the Art 7 Star hotel...... Every thing is made to the choice of the traveller..... If a person can effort once in his life time at least must stay there for 3 nights.... Seeing is beliveing

sailing the sky. I guess you could take a photo. Like this one, many building in the country have incredible shapes like their neighbor Qatar.Sometime it looks like a competition, who will make the more intricate one....So look up! And please your eyes

It's a WoW.. The location, sights and the wow factor is amazing, get on a big bus tour which includes a stop at Burj Al Arab unless you want to splurge and have a meal at the Burj. Worth every cent you pay.

Expensive afternoon tea. The place itself was really very impressive. We were dopped off by our tour guide for 2 hours duration there. We were cordially welcomed and sat down but the service was very slow. The drink came very quick then after the first two course, we were being told we have four more course to come. We waited and waitedand they just took their time, not sure why I am sure they have afternoon clients before. The place was not even full then 5 minutes before our departure time, they rolled out trays of pastries and scones but we could only have time for a couple. Then we need to leave and they took those trays of lovely food away. Too expensive for bad service and not relaxing at all!

Out of reach of the Normal Tourist . The normal tourist can't enter it without reserving a room or restaurant.It is not allowed to even view it from outside the compound gate! I asked my taxi driver to stop for a second - he said he will be fined...
Burj al Arab. It is a must every tourist must see and take a photo. The surroundings very nice at night or at sunset when there are only few people.
