A splurge at the Burge Al Arab. A very beautiful hotel with discreet extravagance. Had a wonderful afternoon tea there with my husband to celebrate our 50th. Wedding Anniversary. Staff were excellent and made us feel very special.I would highly recommend this afternoon tea.

Burj al Arab .Experience not to missed!, '. The Burj al Arab is one of the greatest architectual wonders of the World. A must see attraction while in Dubai ! On a recent visit on Valentine's Day we were treated to the most magnificent display of Red Roses in heart shapes all over the foyer and escalators and even on the incredible water features!! Many spectacular venues to dine .Reservations are a must. The entire structure of the Burj be inside or out is not to be missed .Other attractions are also nearby .Madinat Jumeirah ,wild wadi water park and Jumeirah Beach Hotel.You are in INCREDIBLE DUBAI !, spoil yourself .Enjoy.

Memorable place for sunset worshipper !!!. So amazed with the service , perfect for romantic getaway. Cant wait to taste the arabian cuisine with so many choices. My family friend treat us with luxury. Best month is september , sunny everyday and lovely sunset.

40th Birthday Treat. We visited the bar at the Burj al Arab for my 40th Birthday and they treated me like a Princess! We had an amazing view over Dubai, fabulous food and drinks, a really memorable experience.
Magical place to be seen. Everything they say is true! The camel milk mocktails and high tea made for a luxurious afternoon...then popping golfballs off the penthouse green into the Arabian Sea.

Skybar - not impressed . Dinner at the skybar tonight was extremely unimpressive. Sliders were not very flavourable and extremely dry. Service was not what I would expect even from a 3 star. Oysters were good, view amazing. No repeat visit from me.

awesome!. Very beautiful by the beach. A must to see and take some pictures. Nice to go during sunset and dec is best time to go. During summer, it can be super hot and make you feel bored and want to go back hotel.

Afternoon tea. I was treated to tea. What can I say? Fabulous! The Burj is beautiful in very opulent and ostentatious decor. The outside lift just about saw me off (vertigo!). But what a treat! Can't recommend it enough!
Epic Views. Views of the city were great, and the view points that allowed you to see the city view in past years was very cool. Elevator was also awesome. Worth a visit.

Afternoon tea. Thought it might be a ripoff but instead it was an excellent value.
Well worth going & seeing this must see hotel from the inside
Also gave us an anniversary cake

Stunning service, view and high tea.. If you are a frequent visitor to Dubai and have often admired the Burj Al Arab but can't afford the 2,000USD plus a night rooms. Then the cheapest way to get inside the hotel is by having high tea or lunch/dinner.We were a group of 5 that went to the Hightea in the Skyview bar. At first the 620AED or 168USD price tag for high tea seems exorbitant, but the experience is well worth it. You are allowed into the hotel up to half an hour before your scheduled reservation. Take the hour early entry and take loads of photos of the entry way and foyer of the Burj Al Arab :) You will take the separate elevator to the 27th floor, to the Sky view bar for high tea, on a clear day the view is stunning. On the right side is the city (Burj Khalifa) and the left side is the Atlantis hotel and the Jumeirah Palm island.After a glass of champagne you will take part in the many courses (7 I think) starting with a pastry treat followed by slice of beef, a range of sandwhiches, sorbet to cleanse the pallet followed by a tower of cakes, sweets and scones. Apparently a year or two ago, the high tea used to have all the food served at once, but now the experience is broken up into 7 courses.If anything the views were stunning, there was ample of food, and 7 star service as is expected from the Burj Al Arab. Our hightea session had finished 1:00 - 3:30pm, The next session was 4pm, but we were politely asked if we would like to continue our high tea at a different table.An excellent experience albeit, once in a life time.
One of two landmark in dubai. A 7-star hotel in the world. No need to say anymore. And one of the reasons be there. Combining Plam Jumeirad it is a good sigh-seeing location.

Great Architecture but Average for Food. I visited this Hotel for morning Breakfast. Interior Decoration is Amazing, but if you go for breakfast they will not allow you to go to any other area than restaurant. You can not visit the sky lounge. Food was average. In Vegetarian category they offer two types of set menu, North Indian and South Indian.
Dinner. Fanstastic sky lounge and the views were excellent. Pool was great after breakfast. Beach amazing with great service and cocktails.

Simply Magnificient. The first time I visited Dubai was thirty years ago in 1985 and since then the city has never failed to amaze me as it casts a magic spell and spread its charm in every nook and corner of the emirate with its development and progress like no other and Burj Al Arab is their landmark as the Statue of Liberty to New York !! Dr.Javed Rasheed
The skybar lounge. Very classy and great ambience. Celebrated my husband's birthday . good selection of drinks and snacks.
Average. We experienced an average restaurant.Not the same service as you expect from this style of restaurantThe, fish was good,

Great way to chill out!. I spent the afternoon at 360 degrees after taking a friend there from the UK. After 9.30pm we decided to book the Burj after looking at it all afternoon. Minimum spend is 350AED but that's easily made up with 3 cocktails which is approx twice as much as most other places. For special occasions and to tick the box do yourself a favour and do it..... Great watching the sunset over the Arabian Sea.
Afternoon Tea.. In the Skyview lounge the Staff and Food where fantastic. The Hotel entrance and reception was very nice.The sky view lounge its self is looking tired and needs a refurb.

Afternoon tea. Very expensive but worth it for the experience. Fantastic experience just for the view from the Skyview Bar. Afternoon tea including one glass of fizz, tea, coffee, finger sandwiches, loads of cakes and impeccable service. Sovenier of a pen given out at the end. Cost £242 for 2!!

Very scenic. See what you saw in the pictures, don't forget to carry a camera to click by yourself. They feature luxury brands and you would empty your wallet to your passion or wait for the next credit statement
On The Top. Greatest view ever! 124 stories in one minute. Exhilarating!Highly recommended. Most beautiful building ever. Love!
High Tea. 7 course high tea in high class settingTakes around 2 hoursDefinitely worth a visit and a great way to see the 7* hotelDid it as part of a Modern Dubai tour as an add on

Excellent Service. We went for the afternoon tea and were not disappointed. The food was great, plenty of it and the view sensational. My husband thought it was certainly the most expensive High Tea he has had but well worth it.
Great - Book first. Pre- Book, otherwise pay nearly 3 or 4 times the price on the day. Very expensive, great views although, probably another one which looks great at night.

Cocktails at the Burj Al Arab. Myself and my husbands made a reservation to have cocktails at the Burj Al Arab. You have to have a reservation to get through the security gate. I would recommend everyone to do this. I know it is a bit expensive (350 dirham minimum spend per person) but it was so worth it. There is a small bar food menu available there if you dont want to spend the money on drinks. But we spent it on the cocktails and we were blessed to get a table by the window. Most of the cocktails are an experience like one was lit at the table for me and another came out in a dome filled with smoke so you could smell what was in the cocktail. In all we were there for around two and a half hours. Worth every penny.

good. we don't ge enough time to check dis point so We only saw Burj Al Arab on the outside but it looks really good. It's situated in a lovely area, near the beach.beah is crowded and we travel burh khalifa fountain show.
amazing landmark. Burj Al Arab has a unique architecture and will always has its charm in Dubai. i love it more from the outside though.

Afternoon tea,. We went for Afternoon Tea, a special birthday treat! What an experience, from the door men opening the taxi door and guiding us into the hotel, made us feel really special. The water fountains at the entrance were fantastic and whole atmosphere was just lovely. Everyone was so friendly and helpful and the staff in the Sky view were just lovely. The "Tea" was superb, beautifully presented and absolutely delicious. We managed to get a window table and the views were to die for. They also gave me a rose and birthday cake which was totally unexpected and just lovely!! You just experience this when in Dubai !

An architectural work of art!. We booked tickets for the cocktail bar as a special treat, however I found the atmosphere a bit stuffy and the burg Al Arab cocktail was horrid. We had better nights in many of the other hotels and bars in the area. Having said that it is one of those things you want to tick off the list of things to do. I've done it once but wouldn't go back.
book in advance for the afternoon tea, not cheap, but what a treat. to be in a hotel like the Burj is a must for a visit but you MUST book inadvance before you goon holiday

Afternoon Tea. This has been my 2nd visit to Dubai and my first time in the Burj Al Arab, you need to have a reservations to enter this hotel which we did not have the first time in Dubai, this time we decided on the afternoon tea which is in the SkyBar on the 125th floor, the view is amazing, Afternoon tea was very nice the scones very tastie and also the dates, the waiting staff are very helpful and they give you a gift when you are leaving we got a pen and chocolates. It is rather expensive but its something you should try if only ever once.

superbbb.. what to say guys its mind blowinggg a fabulous tremendously awesme place guysssssssssss its like superb interiors superb entereance ambiance residance resturants superbb a full on 100 % living . well dubai is superb awesme place whta u say trmendoulsy awesme interio superb architecture superb ambiance well its just fabulous . gys u just think by watching wallpapers on goolge we think to go but when we feel face to face it just aweme .. all shopping mall ,resturants ., hotelssss , malls theatres parks beaches ,cruises , resorts residence all first classsssss. 100 % superb.
Looks good. We only saw Burj Al Arab on the outside but it looks really good. It's situated in a lovely area, near the beach.

Afternoon Tea Surprise. We were in Dubai for 4 nights on our way home from Mauritius and surprised my husband on his 60th Birthday with a visit to the Burj al Arab. Yes, it was expensive but well worth the experience. The food was delicious and plentiful and view was spectacular. The hotel itself is simply stunning.
Excess and bling, but why not!!. Yes, there is blingYes, it is expensiveYes, it is worth a visit!!!Best bet is one of set lunches, a wallet freindly way to wow your guests.

Afternoon Tea Skyview bar. Booked online for afternoon tea with my wife, The food was excellent and the variety of teas and coffee are amazing! The view and service is unsurpassed. Yes. it is expensive but totally worth it. They really make you feel like kings.

Must see. Everybody knows it ! You ave to go on the beach nearby and observe it from there. Not for all of them you have to pay so you can even enjoy the view for free. Sometimes its lightened up in different colours at nightIf you would like to get inside , prepare a lot of money to pay in some of the restaurants there
very nice and extraordinary. A must visit and see when you go to Dubai.The view from top is amazing and the speed that you reach the top is breath taking.
High Tea. Went to Burj Al Arab on a sightseeing tour through our hotel JAResorts the only 7 star hotel in the world. Had High Tea, truly amazing experience, a must if you are in Dubai.
Beautiful!. Visit the Madinat Jumeirah for a stunning view both day and evening of the Burj al-Arab. Very majestic on its own little island.

Amazing unforgettable experience. Dined in the Al Mahara restaurant for our 30th wedding anniversary treat. It is something that must be experienced to truly appreciate it. It was a mixture of theatre and wonderful service which made the dining unique. Had sea bass baked in a salt crust, which the staff then remove the crust at your table and then serve the fish. Went to the sky bar after the meal for drinks, had a memorable cocktail, views are great, but wish we could have experienced it in daylight. Probably one of the most expensive meals we will ever have, but for a special occasion worth it and it will always be one of the most memorable. Thank you so much for our beautiful anniversary cake which was fantastic and brought a tear to our eyes

Afternoon Tea. I can't even explain. My family and our family friends had afternoon tea at the lobby lounge last week. Every course was amazing and everyone in the party thought it was great. First we started out with the berry tarts. The berries were SO GOOD! Next came the sandwiches, great and simple. Then came the beef with aj jus, tasty and cooked greatly. Then came the scones, the best scones I have ever had. Then we had the sorbet, amazing. Lastly, they came out with pastries, the best! At the end of us eating they gave out chocolates and a golden pen a really nice touch. The bathrooms are stocked with hermes products so that is a plus!After our amazing afternoon tea, we went to the lobby and got a buggy. The buggy drove us to there private beach and we changed into our t shirts and our swim suits. My kids and I had a lot of fun at the beach and the lifeguards there were really nice and fun to talk to. After an hour of playing we got the buggy and then they got a uber to take us back to our hotel.Is this hotel worth the 560 price tag for afternoon tea? YES IT IS! It was one of the best experiences that my family and friends and I had in Dubai. I loved it!

Fantastic Experience. We are celebrating a milestone birthday this year and we were presented with a gift certificate from our family for the I Alwan restaurant. What can I say it was memorable. Simon looked after us so well, food and choice was brilliant. I was presented with a birthday cake, a rose and 5 of the staff came out and sang Happy Birthday to me. We will never forget our visit to the Burj Al Arab. You can only visit this hotel if you have a reservation and it is expensive. A bottle of water cost 55 dirham, but it is a magical experience.

Top of World. Wow the trip up in the lift was an experience and then at the sight seeing deck that was also quite an experience. I liked the photo service to help create a professional memory of your trip up. This photo I still have to remind me of my trip to Dubai

High tea opulence at the Burj al Arab. Opulent - oh yeah!!! But if you ever get the opportunity to have high tea at the Burj al Arab, spend the money and do it. Certainly one for the bucket list. We were surprised at the amount of food served! We were treated like royalty and it was really worth the money. The hotel itself is spectacular in design and quality. Could not fault anything. Loved it!!

Amazing. We visited to eat for a special occasion and it was faulted...a must see and eat visit! from going up the escalator looking at the aquariam absorbing all the detail that has been put into this wonderful hotel
Sheer opulance. Went for high tea - hotel just gorgeous - worth the experience. We were taken to a private room snd had the whole floor to ourselves - sheer luxury
Excellent Dinner with Post Dinner Drinks. I will recommend to all readers to Book at a Minimum of 2-3 Weeks in advance, both Restaurant al Mustafa and the bar
exellent. really fantastic places next time i will come back to dubai i choice this resturant in this hotel very very good hotel and resturant
High Tea. Once again an excellent experience on Easter Sunday. Allow yourself to indulge in this splendid hotel. Met with friends visiting Dubai and thoroughly enjoyed by all.
Ultimate Afternoon Tea. Absolutely, a lovely ending to a wonderful stay. Visited with two friends and celebrated my Birthday, the Harpist played "Happy Birthday" to me, beautifully. Magical moment!!

A MUST VISIT. You cannot go to Dubai without visiting this striking Resort. We indulged ourselves with the Champagne High Tea, a must do!! Totally decadent and highly recommend. If this doesn't appeal just visit to enjoy the amazing architecture and decor.
High Tea is Excellent. We took the glass lift up to the restaurant for High Tea and it was superb. The food, the service, the views and the atmosphere all made for a nice afternoon for all of us.

Afternoon tea. While the hotel was clearly expensive to build, it was a bit over-the-top. We spent $300+ for afternoon tea for two, which was good, but not a good value. I wouldn't go again, or recommend it, having had better afternoon tea in London and Chicago for less. Our waiter seemed surprised when we wanted to leave after two hours, saying something to the effect that most tourists stay longer. However, the views were nice from the 27th floor, and the scones and teas were excellent.

Just an old icon. There is no metro Going there but you can take the bus. Nothing to do around, just a horrible beach for the unfortunate expats that have to love in Dubai. Like the rest of Dubai nothing really worth seeing

The ultimate hotel for 3 week budget vacation.. The Burj Al Arab Palads Hotel is a hotel with so many items, the reception, the gangways and all other tings, is like an old adventure telling about what the traveler still is so filled with all this gold around all corner. But it´s all gold.If you plan to stay at this hotel, then start with being in very nice clothes with blank shoes. Because you will be picked up at the airport by a driver with a very nice white Rolls Royce.When arriving to the hotel, a team welcome you, and helping you direct to your room where the minibar (big) is for free using for no costs.If you prefer coming in a helicopter, the Hotel "Tempel" have a private helispot att the top of the hotel/Tempel. It is also there you can use your swing in golf.It is like the 1001 ferry tails.The room service is very much more than ever tried before. The problem is that you will be addicted to all this service, why you come back again and again.You will fell to be in a new story, and try for more than just a week, there is so rich thing to discover in the hotel, so you do not go out.
Mind blowing experience. I liked the apartment . very comfortable , v good staff ... especially adarsh , ramesh , samuel and others as well.

Boat Shaped. The Building in a boat shaped has now become a tourist attraction........
It is a very beautiful shaped building even visible from far....
Unfortunately tourists don't have access to it but you can still click photos with it.........

Amazing busy hotel of sheer opulence!. On arrival its like a very busy car park with buses, cars and people everywhere. Once inside you cannot help but be in awe of the sheer opulence everywhere you see. It is very 'touristy' but then it is a place for tourists to stay so I guess you cannot complain about that. Excellent food of very high standards and presentation. Amazing views as you would expect. You have to experience it but I prefer to stay near the Dubai Mall and Fountains.
best high tea ever. the high tea was 7 courses absolutly fantastic very pleasant staff lovely harp musicalso a nice touch was a small box of chocolates on leaving
Dinner Time. For the first time in my life had the most expensive Dinner at Burj.... Even the additional Bottle of Mineral water costed me a good 15$ which was worth it.
incredible hotel. Must be seen, difficult to tell. Perfect view inside, perfect view outside, perfect staff, perfect services in the hotel.

A once in a lifetime experience! You have to find or stay here. I spent my birthday at none other than the worlds only 7 star hotel and I certainly wasn't disappointed. I couldn't fault anything, not like I was even looking to. The service, the architecture, the ambience, the interiors and the exterior are superior and so glamouros. I didn't want to leave. I look forward to coming back.

A must do!. Ok, the tickets are not cheaper, and I faced some big queues! but when I got the lift, and started to see the number related to the floors changing very fast, and feel the pressure changing on my ears and when the lift stopped, the doors opened and I saw that amazing view, I just left behind the tickets price! Totally worth it!!!

Friends Birthday. I went here with some friends for a 50th Birthday and we got a package deal for drinks and canapés In the sky view bar which is a lovely setting with great views. You do have to book though

yes yes and YES. Oh common, it is one of the places in the world to be and visit, how can it be bad experience when best of the best chefs and staff selected to work here?? As usual, visited for an afternoon tea at the Sky bar. Loved it! (price not...), can't be any better or more perfect as it was and completed with little surprises it makes even more special place to visit for special occasions
worth a visit for a spot of lunch at the top. amazing went for lunch and it was great nice for a birthday treat and to see how the other half live

Stunning evening view!. During my trip to Dubai, high tea at the Skyview Bar was all booked so I opted for drinks in the evening as I still wanted to see the inside of the hotel. I was a little hesitant as everyone raves about the daytime view and advises that it's pitch dark at night. I had no other choice so just went ahead with the evening reservations. We got there were seated nowhere close to the windows so in my head I was already regretting that I didn't listen to the reviews.....BUT everything changed 15mins later when we were offered a table next to the window as one had just became available. Let me tell you..... the view in the evening is just as stunning!! It's pricey but well worth the experience. The hotel is beautiful inside, my boyfriend really enjoyed his drinks, we both loved the view....all in all it was a great experience!

overcooked food. we booked cocktails with nibbles in the sky bar, you have to pre book to be allowed in the hotel, which is fine. Was not impressed as we arrived at the front of the hotel, a coach load of chinese alighted,cameras at the ready. Chinese taking photos videos everywhere within the hotel even where it says no photos. We were told a correct dress code was adherred too. Shame they forgot to tell most of the visitors, a right scruffy bunch. We duly went to the sky bar, again visitors very scruffy, the food was either stone cold, over cooked, or had been sitting under hot lights for far to long. Our waiter noticed we were not eating the food prepared and the manageress came over. She very kindly refunded our bill for the food, but we do not expect this standard in a 7 star hotel, the food was of a 2 star rating. Very dissappointed we were going back to stay their for a week. Not now. Also you have a new hotel being built next door, building work going on 24 hrs. So not condusive to a quiet location. Such a shame,
Great Afternoon Tea. We didn't stay here but had the best afternoon tea here. It was quite expensive but we thought it was well worth it.

Special. Very much enjoyed the afternoon tea in the Skyview Bar. Had a 4pm booking but arrived 20mins early to "check in" which ensured one of the better tables facing Jumeirah public beach and Burj Khalifa in the distance. It's not cheap but there's plenty of great finger food and one of the best views in Dubai. Also, it's one of the only ways to access the Burj Al Arab if you aren't a hotel guest. Definitely a special experience.

High Tea. A worthwhile experience for couples. Incredible building and setting. You certainly get looked after when visiting the Burj Al Arab and will be "wide eyed" by the design and shopping outlets available!
Impressive yet average. It's quite a experience. High speed elevators and the views are stunning. Children and youngsters might find it more exciting than the grownups.

Indulged our senses with the finest teas excellently infused with set seven course meal.. Refreshed our palate and indulged our senses. This was simply the best experience .Higly recommended and very well priced. 500AED set in the lobby lounge with the best views around. All booked plesantly over the phone with easy. Arriving at 1pm lasting approx 2 hours. A must do...

Paradise on earth. In the middle of the sea lies a monument which itself by its view proves its beauty. Morning beach goers click the pictures and evening in the dim moon the hotel shines through its wonderful lights. Helipad as well as yatches make it a wonderful place. If you want to try luxury nothing better than this- its an expensive retreat

Afternoon tea. Must be done! Its wonderfully OTT but the food is simply delicious and plentiful. We were celebrating a birthday, an anniversary and a successful trip to Everest base camp. Staff went the extra mile and also took account of my food allergies so I could enjoy all of the food. Couldn't have been better

Best of the Best. This truly is the best hotel in the world. I've read lots of different reviews on this place and unless you see it for your self you can't really comprehend the experience. Highly recommend it for a visit and either high tea or dinner.

Ultimate afternoon tea, enjoyed but greatly over priced. First holiday in Dubai so decide to go here with the wife today.Staff who served us were excellent, very efficient and pleasant. The seven so called courses (plus a glass of champagne) included a small pastry, 5 finger (with emphasis on finger) assorted sandwiches of OK quality, very very small piece of steak (tastey), sorbet, scones, cakes and teas/coffee's. Over than the high walls and water feature the internal decoration was disappointing and the view not particularly exciting - far more interesting are the views outside. All in all it was OK but at a price of 560AEU (£114) each its grossly over priced.I'm sure we will find much better attractions for far more appropriate price during the rest of our stay.

I now know why it is a 7 star Hotel. We enjoyed afternoon tea. The standard of service from the staff is what you would expect from such an hotel. Our waiter knew every detail about the type of tea and coffee, sandwiches and cakes we enjoyed. The decor throughout the hotel is very opulent and pleasing on the eye. The views from our seat at afternoon tea were exceptional. Worth a visit and book in advance as usually busy.

Afternoon tea. We booked for afternoon tea at the burj, oh what a time we had. It was wonderful. The whole experience from the moment you u pull up outside the hotel , to arriving at the top. The 360 panoramic view is really something, and the afternoon tea so delicious. Expensive but so worth it.our time was 4.30, so we got to see the sunset, will remember this for a long time.

High Tea at the top of the world. The Burj is beautiful and the expereince of stepping inside this hotel was a big wow. I was slightly disappointed witht the selection of sandwiches etc that were provided. A little over rated BUT, I was there for the expereince and can say that it was worth the visit.

Fantastic experience. We booked for cocktails in the Burj and was expecting some hefty prices. We got them too but the whole experience was fantastic. The building, the staff, the views everything is what you would expect of a 7 star hotel. It's well well worth that little extra for an unforgettable experience. Try The Swing cocktail. It's great too. I can't praise the Burl Al Arab highly enough. Do it !!!

Highlight. This was the highlight of our trip for me. Never mind the cost, you only live once - from here you can see a 360 degree panoramic view by walking round the whole floor - give you a great inside into Dubai City, its layout & the close proximity to the desert. the organisation, like so much in Dubai is 2nd to none - Whatever else you do here, do yourself a favour & take in the view

Another Dubai masterpiece. The Burj Al Arab is another architectural masterpiece in Dubai. This is the hotel where Roger Federer and Andre Agassi had their famous tennis match atop the building. We saw the building during the day and again at night because they turn on these beautiful lights that come on every half hour starting 8:00 PM. It's a beautiful sight to see. The pictures are courtesy of Joalhi - Jocelyn Hidalgo.
Worth it. Its worth it be on top of the world. If you go during off peak hours, its only $40. Just make sure to book same day so you can see of it's hazy out before you book.

Great experience but very over priced. We had the afternoon tea at the Burj as we was away on our honey moon.The food was lovely and lots of it however i think the price of Approx £120 per person was slightly too high as the hotel is a little older now.The service was lovely and there was a large selection of drinks to select! The Passion Fruit Ice Tea was the best drink i've ever been served so that is a must try :)

Intimidating and gorgeous !. Burj Khalifa is a must see ! The view from the top is quite amazing.
You can see the city as well as the fountains below which look spectacular from the viewing gallery !
The lobbys are finely built with some extravagant art installations.
One of the best hotels!. Burj Al Arab, has one of the best locales in the entire dubai. Must watch. You will get a far off view from Koubba bar.
Afternoon tea. Great experience though expensive. Views from the sky bar are amazing. We couldn't eat everything due to being full and they packaged up what was left, for us to take away, nice touch.
lovely building great views. and nice restaurants notably the one under the sea . have been several times, always a very pleasant experience

Afternoo tea to die for. When visiting Dubai you must indulge in the luxury of Burj Al Arab, its a once in a life time experience and worth every penny for the luxury of what awaits. Book early to avoid disappointment.

Awesome!. You just have to admire the simple, yet genius architecture and engineering. It is amazing. The lift is unbelievably fast. Then the view is just unforgettable. It is worth the time and money. If your stay to Dubai is a short one, maske sure to get your ticket early.

a beautiful shape and design outside; ugly inside. We had diner there. You need a reservation to enter this hotel, even just for diner.The hotel is really beautiful outside. It was designed by an Australian architecture firm and an English engineering firm.On the contrary, the vast reception hall looks really ugly to me. It was designed by a Chinese interior designer.The design of the restaurant is very ordinary. At night, there is no view to the empty sea in the dark.The food was excellent, and so was the service.

High Tea. We visited the Burj for the evening High Tea during our December trip. The service was fantastic, as expected, we started with a glass of champagne which was included in the price. You then had the choice of one additional alcoholic drink which included a choice of cocktails. The food was served in typical high tea style, a selection of sandwiches, scones and other sweet things served with a good selection of teas or coffee. It was very enjoyable but not cheap at approx £75 per person! We went for drinks in the sky view bar afterwards, I did not enjoy the cocktail I chose but we did have a nice view to make up for it. I have stayed in many top hotels in Dubai and personally the Burj did not overly impress me. I do not care for the decor, I find it brash and almost cheap looking, the skyview bar in particular with it's blue leather furniture resembles the interior of a 1990,s bingo hall!!! Can't see what all the fuss is about?

High tea for two!. What a fantastic experience!! The views are great and service is second to none...Celebrating a birthday we had high tea at the Sky Bar.Really good afternoon with lots to eat and drink!They even bought out a birthday cake for us...The price is expensive but while you're in Dubai, you have to do it!
coffee. you don't miss it is the most famous and beautifull place at DUBAI.ONLY the prices is too high e.g a cup of coffee there cost 25 euro.

Burj Al Arab at its Best. Best spot to have a stunning view of Burj Al Arab is at Umm Suqeim Beach. You can take a swim while enjoying the sight of the " World's only 7 star Hotel" or simply have a pictorial along the shore. Fastest / Cheapest way to go there is to take the metro until Mall of the Emirates then take a taxi. Unless, you're staying somewhere within the area.

One time deal. Expensive..... This was nice for a one time experience but too expensive to revisit. At $400 for two people its too much for what you are getting in my opinion. Start you off with a dry champagne that was not very good (upgrade to Dom is another expense). The food was very pretty good. The hot carvery selection was potatoes and beef which was yummy but no seconds on that. You can get seconds on the finger sandwiches, we only liked the chicken, tuna and veggie, the salmon and beef ones were not very good. The scones and pastries were very good and you can get seconds as well. Service was spotty and waiter disappeared for long periods of time which is disappointing at this price point. You can try as many types of their teas, coffees, smoothies, etc as you want, however I was unable to drink my way to the $400 mark (in my mind anyway). The building is over the top but beautiful. Need to book weeks in advance to get the seating you want. They give you a little box of chocolates (spicy flavors) and a pen as a memento.

Birthday Culinary Flight lunch. My husband took me to The Burj Al Arab for lunch on my birthday, the day we got off a cruise ship!I have to say I was expecting not to be too impressed but upon walking through the door my first word was WOW!! The foyer is spectacular and flowers are unbelievable.....everywhere.We had the Culinary Flight lunch which gave us a different course (4) in a different restaurant.We began in Aquarium , then the Asian restaurant, then the restaurant on the top floor for our main course. We ended with desserts and coffee in the lounge on the first floor, overlooking Jumeirah Beach hotel. Here they presented me with a bunch of lovely roses and a birthday cake...which they put in a box for us to take away with us as we were too full to eat it at that point!In every restaurant we had a window table from which we got full advantage of the views and they were happy for me to take photos and even offered to take pictures of my husband and I.Every course was beautifully presented, beautifully served and tasted excellent. I have read reviews of not excellent food but we thought everything was up to standard.The staff were amazing, attentive without being ever present..There was nothing we disliked and the memory of our visit will stay with me always.Thank you to you all for a memorable birthday.
Top of the world. Dubai and its masterpieces are precious stone on this world. proud of this country and country man to build this type of unmatched masterpieces.
Excellent breakfast. We had breakfast here last weekend and it was absolutely superb. We thoroughly enjoyed this little yet expensive experience.

Favourite building. What more can I say than if I won the lottery I would stay here The building is fantastic and looks beautiful when lit up at night. The sheer hotel is just opulence and is a must for anyone visiting Dubai.

Disappointing. We had to wait for two hours oats our allocated table reservation. The waiter poured wine all over my husbands hand and never apologised. Another waiter huffed at us. Really was the most disappointing 50th birthday celebration.

Tallest Building in the World!. This attraction is a must in Dubai. It is definitely worth it to pay the extra money to go to the top. Beautiful views and excellent photo opportunities. Check out the gift shop as well...great souvenirs.
High life!. Tallest building in the world - what else needs to be said!A little expensive, but to us it was a definite highlight
Iconic!. The architecture of this building is iconic! The Atrium of the Hotel is Stunning with fabulous interiors!! It is one of the finest Buildings in Dubai! Sheer Luxury!

High tea. Booked in for high tea and drinks in Sky Bar to celebrate 40th wedding anniversary.Serving staff very helpful and plesant.High tea menu both looked and tasted amazing..We then went up to Skybar and finished off with a cocktail.Was a memorable way to celebrate our anniversary.

excellent sea food restaurant. Very nice fish restaurant at the Burj as you do feel as if you are under the sea as you are surrounded by fish, lovely sight to see all the fish whilst you are eating a lovely meal but expensive but well woth a visit for a special occasion

What a great architectural masterpiece!. we only saw it from a distance, both seaside and landside, it is indeed one of the most remarkable expressions architects can have in designing buildings to be remembered.
Burj Al Arab. 7 star hotel and excellent architecture. Dubai is famous for this master piece. They have open roof top tennis court and heli pad. Boat shaped hotel is just fantastic to see.

Stunning..... One of the main attraction of Dubai... Good to have photographs from outside...Surrounded by nice beach... However got disappointed while visiting restaurants. Not worth to have coffee / food inside as ambiance is not that much good as expected ....

High Tea - beyond expectations. We had a spectacular high tea. Food was excellent, staff were excellent friendly and very good. The skybar was breathtaking. Staff made you fell very welcome. You must pre- book or you cannot even get new the building- easy on line. The building is magnificent. One off the bucket list.

Luxury beyond imagination. It's a man made marvel...Un-believable but true. Only question is that you need to pay a good amount to enjoy the Hotel environment. Otherwise Channel Discovery is the best option. Breakfast is the best option if you are willing to pay a good sum (for Indian travellers).
More beautiful architecture.. This is the tallest hotel and most spectacular. It looks like a giant sail boat in the ocean. The hotel is very ornate inside sparing none with its gold leaf accents.
wow. Amazing place and well worth a visit.The culanary flight experience is just fantastic and eating in 5 different restarents was amazing.The sky bar for cocktails and views is something special

Out of this world. My wife and I went there to celebrate our 25 anniversary, we had a 7 course Asian meal and it was exceptional, the service was what you would expect of a 7 star hotel. They even presented us with a surprise anniversary cake such a nice touch. The staff can't do enough and it is worth every penny!!

Afternoon Tea. I cannot recommend this experience enough! We thoroughly enjoyed our trip tot he Burj Al Arab for afternoon tea. The sheer luxury of the hotel coupled with the excellent service and the quality of the food made this an experience I will never forget! The views from the Skyview bar were truly breathtaking! Afternoon tea is expensive but it is something that you will probably only do once in your life so well worth the money!

The Burj al Arab is one of Dubai’s most famous landmarks, its sailboat-shaped silhouette emerging from the sea.. I spend two days here it's awesome......and this my best experiance in my life that i never had.i prefer this to all.you can come with your family and friends.stay here but it's very costly.you can enjoy there and relax

So Tacky. They say money can't but you class, and this place proves it !!Went for afternoon tea which was beautiful, great to people watch and food was lovely. The interior is gawky at best though, if you like shameless bling the you'll love it !!

Interesting building/ Tip for photos. Executive summaryPros - Cool buildingCons - Private access for guests or restaurant dinersTop tip - best to skip the main entrance and go north east to the free beach to take photos, or book in advance for a meal at their restaurants to go inside the premises.

The Best High Tea..EVER!. This is by far the highlight of my trip to Dubai. The hotel is magnificent, and you cant go anywhere near it without a booking, so book in advance. The elegance and pride that is shown by the architecture, decoration and the staff is amazing. Me and my friend booked high tea and the Skyview bar, we were seated right by the window with brilliant views accros the state. The service and the food was incredible, 7 courses later later we didnt want to leave. Champange on arrival, followed by a fruit tart, then a meat dish, sandwhiches, scones, cakes, and a sorbet accompaned with all you can drink tea and coffee. Although the price is high (Think we paid £95 each), if you can do this, you must.

Value for money. We booked high tea for a family of 3 at a cost of just under £100.00 per person. I accept it’s a lot of money for a tea but we had a memorable time, the food and service were both excellent and it was a fantastic, relaxing experience. Highly recommend!
Its just a building!. A cool construction at the sea shore. Don't know if there is more to it but is considered an iconic building in Dubai.

Stunning. It give you an stuning view of dubai from AT THE TOP.. U reach the 124th Floor in just less than 1 mins.. Though its heavily crowed all the time but staff manages the crowd well effectively...
Cool from afar. Unless you have a reservation you can't get in. I suggest you go to the Medinat Souk next door for some great photo ops.

Ultimate Luxury, wonderful food. We were spending a few days in Dubai with another couple and booked to go to Burj AL Arab for brunch and so glad we did!! The whole place is totally over the top and stunning but funnily enough very tastefully done!! For more the floral arrangements which were everywhere were outstanding, wonderful orchids! Once we had wondered around wide- eyed with our jaws dropping in the jewellery shops etc we went for our brunch! What can I say the , the food quality, choice presentation was out of this world! It is beautifuly presented and served on a help yourself buffet basis a and the variety and choice was limitless!! This for us was a lunch of a lifetime, wonderful! The staff were superb, very attentive but unobtrusive! We could not fault this as the ultimate luxury food experience! Wonderful food, views and setting with a great jazz trio playing live in the background!Yes it was expensive but we didn't mind!! Would we go back again if in Dubai again, oh yes!!

Amazing experience. Never been any place higher than that. You probably will have a special feeling once the elevator brings you up to the peak where all the city view will in your hand. Good service in general, definitely a must try once you have chance to visit Dubai.

Interesting hotel tour, Drink at the bar was OK. We were invited by some friends for the hotel tour, it was interesting, been shown the royal suite, very rich and extravagant. The drink at the bar was OK, full of tourists, not exquisite enough. Nibbles (bite size quishe Lorraine) and foie gras, quite greasy, not amazing, large green olives were good though, service was OK, the champagne was pricey for the quality, did not enjoy the atmosphere, nice jazz tunes came from the piano bar, nothing impressive though, but the visit had to be done..had to see and experience what it was like. Too touristy for my taste. Will not go back again, once is enough for us.

You can't get anywhere near it!. Shocking, they call this a big landmark of dubai, but you cant get anywhere near it even for a picture, unless you have a reservation in the hotel or restaurant. You have rude guard/secruity at the front, trying to shove you out of the way. DONT WASTE YOUR TIME

All Going Pear Shaped. I wrote a review regarding a recent visit to Burj Al Arab and the hotel responded via trip advisor asking me to contact them. I tried contacting both names via e mail Anthony McHale and Marianne Ziaser Fitzgerald . I used the hotel general e mail as trying both names on separate e mails came back undelivered. This morning I received a response from Manisha Khan a sales agent at the Burj giving me prices to make a reservation. His e mail said he had also tried to contact me on my telephone number that I had provided and he could not get me. I have kept my phone with me at all times awaiting a call and I have not had any calls or missed calls. This issue I have has just gone pear shaped and would further reduce my star rating given for service. The managers who asked me to contact them provided no contact details hence me using the Burj General e mail latterly. Service is truly appalling. Hopefully the managers will pick up this review on Trip Advisor and contact me . All of my contact details are on the e mail that the hotel has that Manisha Khan responded to. The hotelalso has my contact details from my reservation.
Amazing architecture. Another stunning building in Dubai. Its great to see this city really trying to be unique with the types of buildings they are designing. Love it!

Breakfast in luxury. A must see place. You can only be admitted after making a booking and passing two security checks but it is well worth it with luxury abounding and food to die for in abundance. My only complaint about the whole thing was Arabs smoking the most strong smelling cigarettes or cigars..I would go again tomorrow even though it is very expensive.Make sure you have a good look around even the ladies and gents.
Curious history!. Interesting background to the development. Extraordinarily cosmopolitan team-work. Lovely lifts and gifts!

Absolutely beautiful breathtaking views in a 7 star hotel. This hotel is stunning. We had afternoon tea on the 27th floor which was the best I have ever had overlooking the Arabian Sea. I felt like royalty and the staff were very helpful and attentive,. Very expensive tea, but it was worth it just for the experience. A very opulent and wonderful hotel. I am glad I went.

High Tea. Although my husband and I weren't staying here we did book a place for afternoon tea which was delicious! The 7 course afternoon tea is well worth the price from delicious pastry's and sweets to a wide selection of teas and sandwiches it is a perfect place for a relaxing afternoon - with my new favorite drink, sparkling date juice!

Honeymoon lunch. We were advised by a friend to book lunch not afternoon tea as you get a better experience, better views etc.I cannot fault our visit, from the drive through the gates and driving towards the building to paying the bill it was a fantastic experience!The food was wonderful, the service was great and although expensive it felt good value! If I went back to Dubai I will certainly be going back for dinner!If you want something special - it's a must visit!
Birthday treat. Loved it a fabulous visit to the fish restaurant, a birthday cake provided for my partner, it was a memorable visit

Skyview high tea. Was pricy but well worth it , you have 5 course tea starting with champagne, berries, beef then amazing tes sandwhiches as much as you want, then scones and dessert. Service was impeccable and the view is priceless
Beautiful. Well, it's clearly a beautiful building. We got close enough to it to photograph at a restaurant nearby. What else can i say?
Expensive. Food is good, hotel lobby furniture are sulerb, aquarium nice! hotel's greeters are courteous, and many Filipinas employed at this hotel.

Unfortunately No Access. We taxied from the Mall of the Emirates (AED21) but was disappointed access was restricted to those with a reservation (Lunch/snack) was acceptable but when advised of the minimum AED299 we declined, instead taking photos from the maned security gate.

Beautiful . We went to the beach at the Burj Al Arab, clear waters, very little litter. Place for you to shower and get changed.
Beware of the indian bachelors though as they pretend they are taking selfies but actually taking photos of women sunbathing.

Worth every penny !. We booked into the sky bar for afternoon tea....questioning our sanity over £100 per person
But it worth every penny ...the service and the never ending food and drinks were amazing !

Tea Time in Burj AL Arab. We had the ultimate Afternoon Tea in the San Edar Lobby - and it was really a very good expierience. The best way to reservate this is to contact direct the hotel. It's really worth to look inside this unique hotel and enjoy the service.

Dont waste your time. Go near the gates with a pair of know high shorts on and they bark at you. Do they not realise that its a tourist attraction and accept people the way they are and not be so rude. Walk on the foot path outside it, take a few photos as its not worth anything more than that.

OTT. Disliked the overly zealous service, the solicitous fawning and the aggressive service. For a place claiming to be the best there is there is a way to be good without overbearing. I suspect that standards are being determined against a benchmark measured by the number of wait staff not the professionalism
best man made wonder in world. beautiful blue water with stunning buildings and burj al arab unforgettable memory.sea with clear water good for bathing and making fun.
Interesting structure. Wish we could move closer to see and enjoy. Entry is possible only if u have a booking otherweise can see from a distance from wild wadi entrance.

Pricey and gaudy. This review is from July 2011. It was one thing we had to do on our trip, go to the 7 star hotel! Booked drinks in the bar, as this was the cheapest way to get in. You need to make a reservation (which they call an invitation). The lobby has a giant aquarium which is cool, but very gaudy. You take the lift upstairs to arrive in what I can only describe as a 70s style out of space themed bar! I assume they are trying to be modern! The cocktail list is amazing, but of course pricey, and there is a minimum spend. The views would be good if it was a clear night (unfortunately not clear for us). Staff were attentive but I was most disappointed when I went into the restaurant (attached to the bar) to look at the view and was told I was only allowed in there with a reservation. Not sure this is worth the price, but it is a story

A must visit when in Dubai. I have visited the Burj Al Arab Hotel a number of times both when I lived in Dubai and during my visits in Dubai since.It is a masterpiece of architecture on a reclaimed island that features the hotel; it is one of Dubai's landmark! You either love or hate its loud red opulent interiors, fountains, but it is well worth the cost of a visit even if you may not be staying there. In order to be allowed in you have to have a reservation and a 'laissez passer' email confirming it otherwise you cannot enter through the security doors located on the mainland....I had the opportunity over the years to visit the 27th floor restaurant Al Muntaha and its Skyview bar, the meeting and reception rooms on the same floor all with the exceptional views of Dubai, the Al Mahara with its aquarium restaurant, the Al Iwan on the first floor, for afternoon tea at the lobby also on the first floor....
Wow. The total over the top disney atmosphere.Staff very attentive and friendly. Recommend high tea at 400 AEDs includes an alcoholic drink if you are celebrating a special occasion.

High Tea. A ridiculously expensive High Tea, but well worth it. As much food as you could eat, as many teas and soft drinks as you like and great service from start to finish. Clearly not something you would do often, if indeed ever more than once, but whilst you are there it has to be done. And you don't get anywhere near the place unless you name is on the list!

wonderful dinner. we had dinner at al muntaha restaurant: it was an amazing experience! the reservation is needed in order to be able to visit the hotel. the dinner was quite expensive and the food was ok, although not great, but the service was great, the staff was very nice. there was a live music show. after dinner we could see some parts of this amazing hotel.

Photo-op. You know the pictures but in real life it's just a hotel in a weird shape. Nice photo-op but nothing more. As an average Joe unwilling to spend a fortune on a meal there haven't been inside. If that's your thing, maybe it's great.
High Tea. Afternoon tea in the Sky view bar was a truly memorable experience. The food and service were of the highest standard.

Very expensive for what you receive.. After paying out enough to feed a small country, we found the food and service we received to be nothing in comparison to the bill at the end. You're basically paying for the whole 7 star experience and hopefully, you have a 7 star bank account.
Great view but expensive. When you go to the top, do note that there are 2 levels with different prices. Ask clearly what are the options. I also took the earphones which were really not necessary

Fantasic. The ultimate wow factor. Very welcoming and friendly reception. Didn't have a pretentious atmosphere or guests. We had cocktails at the sky view bar which is a must do while in dubai. The Mr Big cocktail has to be tasted! We were lucky enough to have a window table with the most incredible views of this vibrant city.
only for the vew. the best view is when it is still clear, at night is pitch black so you don't see anything. the meal in the main dining area was not very good. We enjoyed the atmosphere and the bar

its good to be there once. its good to be there once. Once you are "at the top" which is not really at the top, its better to stay inside and look through the glass rather than stand outside in the open within the crowd. you get a good and comfortable view from inside.
Expensive but worth it. Not a cheap venue for drinks/dinner but definitely worth doing. Great views over Dubai if you can get a window seat and first class service from the staff.
Amazing service - Great food & view. I ate at the beach restuarant & stayed for happy hour drinks, wonderful setting & the staff could not do enough
Cocktail heaven. booked a visit to the cocktail lounge,WOW. Views are amazing and cocktails to die for,would recommend as a treat while in Dubai,you do need to book in advance.

Snacks at the Burj Al Arab.. Even the drive to approach this place is amazing. Lovely feeling to pull up to it in your rented Mercedes. We had snacks at the rooftop restaurant. The staff were great and tried all night to ensure people had a window view of the city. Like most things in Dubai it was not a cheap experience but well worth it. Be aware there is a minimum spend limit.

Plan to avoid disappointment. We stupidly decided to get a Dubai taxi up to this hotel, with the aim of having an evening drink and watch the sunset. However it wasnt until we arrived that we were asked at the gate if we had reservations. No- we didnt. Somwe were directed to a helpful reservations manager who advised that we could make a reservation to have drinks in the lobby with a minmum of a spend of 250 AED per person. We thanked him for the opportunity but declined the offer. So to avoid being disappointed please do make a reservation and let us know what we missed. We still had a great night back at the bars in JBR.

Sky High Cocktails. Went for dinner and cocktails, it is really amazing if you haven't been before a must do whilst in Dubai. Staff attentive and welcoming as always. Cocktail Fantastic. We even got driven home in a white rolls royce at the end of the night which was totally unexpected and a WOW factor! Customer Delight at its best… thank you :-)

beautiful hotel. Beautiful hotel but so uppidy. security is so tight you cannot get through the gate to cross the bridge to the hotel unless you show a reservation at one of the restaurant and had to wait for the security staff to confirm!!! Lobby is grand,beautiful, and all gold gilded, but... then its the only place you are allowed if you only hold a restaurant reservation and is not a hotel guess.

Just a very special hotel and experience. The Burj al Arab is a MUST for any visit to Dubai. Unfortunately access is restricted to (pre-booked) restaurant patrons, hotel guests, club membership, Sirius members etc. If you are none of the above the best way to get to see this very special hotel is to book afternoon tea in the Sky Bar or if full then the Saan Eadar as an alternative (don't accept the telephone operator telling you there is a long waiting list) - it is not just a wonderful way to spend a few hours but it is reasonably inexpensive (it is the Burj al Arab after all) and gives you access to most of parts of the hotel you will want to see. The other restaurants are over priced and pretentious with the exception of Junsui which if you like Asian food is really good value at cEuro 100 per person - for an all you can eat feast. So go on. Treat yourself. As I said you won't be disappointed.
Nice cocktails. We went to skyview bar. Cocktails are great and staff does all the possible to have everyone sitting at a window at some point. Nice experience. Expensive though.

Where The Earth and Sky Meet. I was on a short official trip and had time to explore only one landmark. The obvious choice in Dubai was this man made marvel. The building just towers over a city which has many skyscrapers by a huge margin. The building is 160 floors high. I reached in the evening and had to buy the express ticket at 300 Dirham for a trip to the roof. If you reach early or maybe there is an online option to buy tickets at 120 Dirham. The journey is divided into 2 legs in high speed lifts. Although they call it the trip to the roof the journey takes you only to 148 floor. Great view, a 360 degree view from a stationery airplane. The night view of Dubai was great. On the way down there is a stop at 124 floor where you can see the buildings and city through binoculars. Enjoyed the trip captured a bit of moment in some photos.
Beautiful. An amazing experience, if you are in Dubai do go there and have a cup of tea at least. It will give u an exposure to amazing hotel!

Beautiful View. The view from the tower is brilliant. It was a very unique experience, thoroughly enjoyed the view. The design and structure of the tower is one commendable effort by the constructors.
Mirage. this is surreal. but from that high, you cant see everything clearly. so you feel that it is just a very high expereince makes you feel like a king..
burj al petrol. no class, good to impress eskimos, smell new money, comfortable yes, view what view,the desert? the odd camel?

Afternoon Tea. Had a wonderful experience at this amazing hotel, we were so lucky to have our wonderful grandchildren pay for us for our Christmas present to have afternoon tea here during our stay in Dubai. It starts as you cross the bridge to the hotel, to be met by such lovely people all beautifully dressed and welcoming, we had time to look around the foyer and take photos before taking the lift to the Sky Bar, the views were to die for, we had a window seat, arrive early for this as you are seated first come first served. We looked across to the Palm, the World and the City, our waiter was so charming and could not do enough for us to make sure we enjoyed it, I think his name was Tank sorry if this is wrong, but you were lovely and made our visit very memorable. We had a glass of champagne to start with then tried a few of the iced teas which are a must, they were lovely and they encourage you to try as many as you want. I didn't want to leave it was so lovely. Thank you to everyone for making it the highlight of our holiday.
An ICON of Dubai. the view of the super star Luxurious Hotel built on a island is enchanting. Designed like a sail, its photo is present on most of the momentoes of Dubai..
Superb site. Wonderful building to look at day and night, dancing fountains in front of it are a great site that are activated every half hour from 18:30 each night.

gold everywhere. Definitely impressive, if a bit gaudy. Actually spent a night there. Your own butler, automatic everything in the bedroom; press a button and the curtains open to a view over the sea or dim all the lights, turn on the TV etc; Biggest bathroom with biggest jacuzzi and power shower. Projector clock on the wall etc. Not bad.

Superb attention to detail and lovely staff. We had afternoon tea at the hotel and enjoyed it so much. Everything about this establishment is top notch as would be expected. The food was 7* with a nice selection and you can eat as much as you want but to be honest we did send quite a lot back as most people seemed to do. You don't get offered a doggy bag lol. The staff are very respectful and can't do enough for you. Go and enjoy it.

Amazing. Dubai’s signature landmark is the Burj Al-Arab, the famous sail-shaped hotel facing the Arabian Gulf. The world’s only seven-star hotel, it’s truly the stuff of James Bond movies and superstars.A better way to visit is by making a reservation at one of the hotel’s many bars or restaurants. Al Muntaha restaurant and the adjacent Skyview Bar are the venues to choose for soaring panoramic views
Luxurious Arabian hospitality. Breathtaking! Luxury! Stunning! MagicPlace that you have to visit once in a life. Fantastic service and amazing food.

Just Awesome!!!. Though you have to book a meal to get into this property if you are not staying with them, it is totally worth it. A definite go go for anyone visiting Dubai. A view from the outside is not enough....the insides are even better.

Nice architecture. You can't approach it from up front, unless you have access to the private beach. We could see it from the barriers outside, where the security made sure we didn't cross the line even when taking pictures.
Burj On Water. Beautiful Place To See, Nearby Beach Has Great Sun Set View In The Evening. Right Place To Click Selfie. Hehehehe
Ok for those with more money than sense. The cost of coming here could cost some 30% more than anticipated. Thre is a choice of afternoon tea, meals or drinks..wine per glass is around £20(UK)
Touristic visit. it was very expensive to take photo. you should spend a lot of money to enjoy a little bit. you have definitely different feelings when you are there

Superb inside and out !. This is just such a stunning icon of new Dubai. The restaurants and bars offer a wide variety of foods from across the world. The sea food one is located in the underground aquarium and the restaurant at the top is an absolute must for anyone staying in Dubai - but you need to book in advance! The decor and service are absolutely stunning.
Fabulous. Worth the money. Fantastic service and amazing food. Got engaged here too! Best sashimi I ever tasted. Waiting staff could not do enough for you. Truly unique place.
Enjoyable. You know you have to visit Burj Al Arab when you are in Dubai, because it's everywhere. If you really want a good view, go to Jumeriah public beach.

Class Class Classy Tea. The 7 star hotel is beautiful inside and a classy way to spend the afternoon in Dubai. This place is expensive, so be willing to make it rain. You must have a reservation to enter the grounds, no jokes. FOLLOW THE DRESS CODE! They won't let you on the grounds if you do not meet the dress code for your reservation. Once in you're gold and literally drinking it (cappuccino). Tea is 7 courses (no light fare here) and everything is delicious. It's also long, so plan to spend 3+ hours here relaxing over champagne, tea, and great food. You even get a parting gift just for attending tea. Great architectural design inside and exquisite afternoon tea.

Disappointed. This is the third time visiting the Burj Al Arab. We did not stay at the hotel but we dine in different restaurant there.Since we are visiting Dubai again after 2 years, we decided to have dinner there and we book the Bab Al Yam Poolside Restaurant. Reservation was good and efficient. Made my booking and was given my reservation reference.Arrived at the hotel and found our way to the restaurant. We were greeted warmly by the reception and was escorted to our table. After we were seated, a gentleman came and introduce himself to be the waiter looking after us. He quickly explain the buffet spread and took our drinks order. Came back many time to check on us during dinner to see if we were ok and even help us take several family photos as we are in 4.We were having a great evening and was happily taking photos around the restaurant when out of the blues, the cook from the grill came over and very rudely told us that we cannot take photos in the restaurant and of the food display. I was shock and embrassed. Never expected to be treated this way and also I did not see any sign written no photo.Very disappointed because we were having such a good time and it was ruin by this rude cook. The restaurant was almost empty. There was at most 10 guest in total. Moreover we were very discreet and we did not distrube Others so we do not understand this rude and poor treatment.Very very disappointing !!!!
Gold !!!!. This place is amazing, 24 carot gold everywhere you look. The rooms are devine. The fountain in the entrance is beautiful. The actual building its self is amazing!!!

Very impressive, worth a visit.. This is a very nice place!! Though I expected it to be larger actually. Very tight security, enforced dress code, so be aware. The beach is nice. Its fairly impressive seeing a fleet of white Rolls Royce's sitting at the front entry every time you come in. Most everything is immaculate. It is very expensive, they are very proud of it.

Truly 7 star!. Perfect place to bring your date for an exquisite afternoon tea (the works with Champagne is a must). Perfect setting to enjoy the sunset with a variety of hors d'oeuvres and pastries. When you are done with tea, no need to go for dinner, you will be stuffed... The hotel is magnificent and you want to bring a good camera along.

Afternoon Tea at the Burj. we had afternoon tea at the Burj Al Arab in the sky lounge & it was absolutely amazing. The food was to die for & the views were fantastic. I would recommend going here if you are ever in Dubai. What an unforgettable experience.

Fantastic afternoon tea. The afternoon tea at the Burj Al Arab is out of this world.. With stunning views and in total luxury you'll be served with an abundance of delicious treats, wear something with an elasticated waist. Worth every penny.

Visit to the Burj Al Arab. We never made it inside. We didn't know that we needed a reservation just to have a drink at the bar. We really should have looked into it before we arrived there. Next time a must! FYI, don't forget to google the dress code as well. No sneakers or jeans!
skyview. The nighttime view was amazing. You could see miles ahead with lights sparkling across the horizon.once in a lifetime experience. Highly recommended.
Brunch. Had brunch here a few years ago, an amazing building sooo luxurious out of this world. Food was delicious, sweet table to die for so much t choose from onky the best of everything served.

Best afternoon tea ever. Went for afternoon tea at Burj Al Arab and it was worth every penny. From the moment you step through the door you are treated like royalty. The afternoon tea was amazing, plenty of courses and as much tea, coffee, soft drinks as you can drink. The views are stunning. The nice touch is a small box of chocolates for each guest when the bill comes. I would definitely recommend afternoon tea at Burj Al Arab but you do have to book in advance.

Incredible views. The view from the viewing platform was stunning, to see all of Dubai laid out below was brilliant, I'm not a fan of heights but it was still an amazing experience, just felt it was a bit expensive, would have liked to have gone to upper viewing deck but it was too costly
Hospitality re defined!. Been here for breakfast, awesomeness personified! This place is the just luxury and hospitality redefined. Awesome experience overall!

Worth visiting - Be sure to book. I went to see what is marketed as the world's only 7* hotel. I booked a table for drinks at the Skybar on the 30th floor. It has a lovely view over Dubai.The whole experience was quite strange, it's a minimum spend of about £70 pp for drinks which will get you 2 maybe 3 drinks and nibbles. The hotel is a sight to see but many parts look a bit tacky and they had a very cheesy jazz band playing awful covers. It is quite garish but the cocktails are good and it is worth seeing.

Skyview Bar experience. It is definitely worth to try it once in your lifetime! Not only will you get inside the famous landmark where you can take pictures, but you will also enjoy a high tea service with great views from the 27th floor! It was unique and we absolutely enjoyed it!
a normal beach. a wide place but missed safety . only one wc and shower for all beach . a great view and a clear water
Pure Luxury. Lost charm because of Bhurj Khaifa but its' a pure luxury and must be tried. Rooms are very expensive but it will be a great experience.
luxurious retreat. you expect nothing but the best while entering a 7-star hotel and Burj al arab still beats them comfortably. go there for the experience and be stunned
8th wonder. A must visit place to see the hotel made on a man made island. A wonder by itself. An experience. Visit the top floor at the pub. Experience Dubai at the top level.

Well worth seeing. This hotel is amazing we had a meal in here and yes it was pricey but worth it. Its the best hotel iv ever seen the staff are amazing and are really friendly the food was lovely.
Worth all the hype just to experience the pure luxury of this hotel

Amazing architectural achievement. Just another amazing structure to admire in Dubai which sits on its own man made island. You cannot go into the hotel unless you either booked to stay or for dinner or high tea.

Probably the best place in the world for a birthday treat!. From the time you walk into the lobby you feel like the only thing The Burg wants is to make you happy - nothing els is more important!We took drinks in the Sky view bar and a meal afterwards in the AlMahara restaurante.We had wine and canapes upstairs before going to the fabulous restaurante - we were ushered every step of the way and they even pressed the lift buttons for us.We really liked the wine that we had in the Sky view bar - which didn't appear on the dinner wine list - we mentioned this and - no problem, they despatched someone upstairs to get a bottle.The food was sublime, the service even better and the waiters had real personality and charm.Crepes cooked at our table finished the meal with a flourish and we left feeling that nothing - just nothing- could have been better - It was my sister's birthday and one that she will always remember.Thanks Guys!
Amazed and overwhelmed.. Fantastic night out, very well organised by the staff allowing everyone a seat with a view. The waiting staff were very friendly and professional.
A spectacle. A stunning building which looks impressive from every angle. Worth going to visit for the experience of having seen a 7 star hotel. Incredibly expensive (as you would expect).

Amazing building. Architecture in Dubai is amazing, but this building is one the most impressive. There are a few ways to get in, one is booking for havig the tea there, it wont be cheap but its worth every penny

Once in a lifetime. Rememberable visit and lunch at top hotel. A vow Experience. Food was not best part of the visit but was super anyway to see the place. Make a reservation to the sky bar as well, because we coud't get in as the afternoon tea was only for the hotel guests. Would have been a great view. Recommend
Must see when you stay in Dubai. Rather expensive when considering that you just take an elevator to certain floor but you are recommended to go there and enjoy the view

Best Views Night or Day. We went for high tea and though costly was worth the experience. Excellent service and a great view though it was off and on due to the low clouds. We went back in the early evening , again to the Sky Bar for evening appies and drinks to watch the city light up. Simply amazing. Again terrific service. Wish our city of Vancouver, Canada had some of this architecture in it's skyline. If you want them to pick you up from your hotel they'll sent a Bentley around to get you. Opulence on a grand scale.

The Highlight of our Stay in Dubai!. I have longed to see the finished result of the interior of the Burj al Arab ever since watching a TV documentary of the designing and building of this fascinating hotel. By making a dinner reservation we were able to gain access to the beautiful foyer where we could see the atrium in all its glory. The colours were spectacular, the gold pillars and the multi-coloured walls. The aquariums on either side of the escalators were a stroke of genius. We were given such a warm reception by everyone - the staff are a real credit to the hotel. They did everything they could to make our evening very special. The meal was excellent and I was presented with a red rose on departure. We discovered there was a gift shop on the ground floor and a special purchase made a very fitting end to a special evening.

Fantastic Friday Brunch at Al MUNTAHA. I went several time from friends and family for brunch. The choice of food is amazing, from the huge amount of starters to the different types of food. From sushi to Indian to international cuisine. The view is amazing overlooking all Dubai. I highly recommend although it is quite pricy.

Amazing afternoon tea. This was a treat for my special birthday. The Skyview bar afternoon tea was fantastic. Received a rose and wee birthday cake made to feel very special. A real highlight of my trip to Dubai. Staff very friendly and eager to help.

Worth the expense?. The only way a non-guest can get inside is to have a meal or tea at one of the restaurants. It is very expensive, but it was probably worth it. The food and service was excellent. The interior architecture is noteworthy. I wish I had also done it to get into the Emirates Palace in Abu Dhabi.

The best brunch in the world. we visited this hotel for brunch and enjoyed a wonderful offer of different dishes for brunch. It is a great experioence to visit the hotel, the views from the restaurant are unique and the Price is correct for what you get.
Great view of Downtown Dubai. We dined here our first night in Dubai. Service was great, beautiful views of Dubai. Great for dinner date or drinks.

If you have some money to waste. Booked a lunch at Burj Al Arab restaurant called Al Muntaha located at 27 floor otherwise you can't get there First I was tried to book an afternoon tea option but it was overbook for several days in advance so I booked launch at 27 floor restaurant anyway it was 4 course meal awfully overpriced along with wine list that is roughly 2-3 time more expensive compare to the same items you would see in very good American restaurant. For example the least expensive half bottle red wine would cost you 750 dirhams so 750/3.2 = $230 US for quite average wine. As for food and service here what I would say. I am from New York I have been in Jean George I had a dinner at Daniel and many other high end places so the Al Muntaha is not up to the level of New York. The only it up to and even over the New York great restaurants level is in term of prices. Food was OK but nothing special to my taste, service was ...average to the most, waiters are not up to the level of the restaurant for sure no communications no right timing I saw better waiters in some US Dinners I am not joking. So if you absolutely need to have a dinner in Burj Al Arab you have to prepare to pay around a grand for two for meal at least to my taste that is nothing special.

Grandoise. i guess the only reason why i am giving only 4 instead of 5 is cause one has heard so much about the place that the place perhaps CAN NOT live up to to the super hype. the Rolls Royce in the parking, the extremely ornate interiors, the signature helipad jutting out of the 'sailboat', the mesmerising view from the 27th floor restaurant, etc all are there. so, do pop in for a look and be ready to be transported to a world of the supposedly only "7 star" hotel in the world!
Less said the better. Brilliant piece of architecture. the tallest around the world and so many people visiting it. It is a marvel to see the place

Wow!. Our friends booked the cocktail lounge of this impressive building.The foyer is simply stunning, one cannot help but look like typical tourists at the wonder of the place.The views from the lounge are stunning.One must book, you cannot just turn up, and have the paper work to prove your booking.Cocktails are expensive but we thought worth it for the opulence.Our poor waiter made a terrible rooky mistake, took a small glass off the try and left the larger glass on...... Yes, he spilt the drink all over my friend, she was soaked. The manager offered to take her clothes away to be cleaned, although sitting in a dressing gown in the burj Al Arab might not be the look one would go for! They bought us a round of drinks, a cake and flowers for my friend, so they could not have been more apologetic.A well worth must visit despite the cost.

Special. Booked for cocktails, we enjoyed working our way through the enormous menu. Brilliant tasting cocktails with brilliant flair and presentation. Only downsides are price and it can take a while to prepare the drinks.

Fantastic!!!. Lin & I were attending a wedding here. The Burj itself is phenomenal and has to be seen. Words do not do it justice. All the facilities are magnificent. The grounds of the Jumairah Resort complex are immaculate. We had brunch in the Al Qasr Hotel, within the complex, the next day. The food and drink was absolutely excellent. The service throughout, wherever in the Jumeirah Resort, is unbelievable. The evening of the wedding we had been stunned by the entrance & atrium but had not really had too much opportunity to take it all in. The aquariums each side are amazing. After the brunch at the Al Qasr we returned to the Burj and had tea with friends on the first floor. This gave us the opportunity to admire the atrium with laser lighting for much longer and admire all the luxury shops. The water feature between the escalators looks as if it's been designed with the Library in Alexandria in mind. Stunning. If at all possible you must visit this super hotel..

Sky View Bar. The Sky View Bar was exellent - we had a window seats overlooking the city and the view (at night) was breathtaking. Just the look on my mum's face was worth it. The staff was very friendly and they even knew how to serve a "Paulaner" (Bavarian wheat beer)

Very expensive, but we knew this coming in.. We loved the experience of a $200 high tea. When else will we ever do this in Dubai - never. What we didn't expect is that the food would be so plentiful. It kept coming, and coming, and coming. The only thing that didn't return was the free champagne. The views were great. Make sure to make a reservation in advance.
