Best place u can be. words cannot express the hospitality you receive as soon as you enter this hotel. The best place i have stayed till now in my life

Delicious high tea with excellent views. I decided to have high tea at the Skyview Bar as a solo diner. The process of booking via email was easy and quick and there were no issues gaining entrance into the hotel. Once inside, I was made very welcome. The elevator trip to the Skyview Bar provided a great view and once at the top I was fortunate to have a table with another beautiful view. The high tea was excellent, although perhaps more food than one person could reasonably eat - I gave it my best though :-) Service was discreet but there when it was needed. Watching the sun go down and the city light up for the night was excellent. Yes, it was expensive, but as a one-off I felt I had value for money and enjoyed the experience a lot.

family lunch in Al Mahara. the food was delicious and the aquarium was beautiful. we took our 3 children (age 10 months, 7 years, 8 years) and they loved it. the service was friendly and very accommodating, especially with the children.

A once in a lifetime experience.... Have wanted to visit this hotel for years and finally I got the chance -I invited a friend for Friday brunch. The exterior of the hotel is stunning, the interior over-the-top but worth seeing. We were given a window table which afforded fantastic views of the coast and the city. Brunch itself was a splendid affair - a wide selection of dishes and very good quality - but laughably expensive, particularly the second glass of prosecco not included in the brunch package. Staff were polite and attentive but not of 5-star quality (let alone 7-star), one waitress wearing a stained uniform, badly in need of a good press. All in all a one-off very enjoyable experience but I will not return

Iconic building view from near buy Mall. So this is smaller than expected , we went to Jumeirah mall, which is a lovely place by the way, and had a view and took photos from there much cheaper. I heard inside it's beautiful but expensive. We sat at Costa coffee .

Pure indulgance. Okey, so Burj Al Arab is totally over the top - all you see IS actually 24 carat gold leaf.. But it is just so unique that if you can afford to try their restaurants, or even better their afternoon tea, it is so worth it! The sky lounge bar has stunning views over the cityscape. Love it or hate it, you must not miss what all the fuss is about!
Superb. treated to afternoon tea at the Burj which was excellent - staff were very nice and the service was great. A wonderful experience

anniversary treat. we went to the Burj Al Arab for high tea, booked with (Desert Adventures Tourism) they picked us up at the Hotel and bought us back, the hotel experience was super the high tea was 7 courses, they bought 3 couples celebrating a little cake with happy anniversary on all in chocolate and a red rose how kind was that. did not get to see a lot of the hotel as we only had a short time there but what we did see was well worth the visit

Interesting to check out, but absurdly overpriced and tacky. The Burj Al Arab claims to be the only seven-star hotel in the world, even though the ratings system only goes up to five. Overall, awkward vibe to the place. Prices (food, drinks, rooms) are ridiculous, and you constantly have to travel to enjoy the beach or the Madinat. The ultra bling design is dated and hurts the eyes. As you enter, the Your Guest Services liaison tells you that every gold-colored surface you see during your stay is actual twenty-four-karat gold. Even those four-story columns? Even so, she says. Even the thick fourth-story arcs the size of buses that span the columns? All gold. What surprised us most is it seemed a major issue to get a table at the Sky Bar, only to find it empty. Then, asking for food, being told "the kitchen just closed". "Can you not bring room service?". No. I'm sorry, so a 7-star hotel cannot serve you food at 11:45 pm, while they should arrange for it to be served anywhere we would want, even at 4am. After lengthy talks, we ended up downstairs in the huge empty lobby (why they could not bring the dinner upstairs is a mystery) eating very subpar, very expensive food. In the end, the hotel seemed totally "empty" while in high season, lacks a soul, and you just don't feel comfortable there. Dar Al Masyaf or any other Jumeirah resort is a much better, and affordable, choice.
7 stars. The highest rated hotel in the world, Very expensive but worth the price to experience the luxury. Take in a high tea at a minimum.

impressive. the tallest building of the world - amazing holographic light show in the elvator, pleasant lounge and observation deck at level 148, the greatest lounge at level 122 (need reservation), such an impressive experience!!!

High Tea, simply the best ever.. My wife and I love afternoon tea, and during a visit to Dubai, we decided to try The Burj Al Arab Afternoon Tea at the Skyview Bar. Although a little expensive, around £250 per person, we were so glad we did. Since our reservation wasn't until 1:30, we spent some of the morning at the Madinat Souk. From here, you can take a complimentary boat to the Al Qasr hotel, then from there take a complimentary buggy to the entrance of the Burj Al Arab. The Al Qasr hotel area is usually restricted to hotel guests but with your reservation, access is granted, offering some great photo opportunities.The Skyview bar is located on the 27th floor, with access via a clear glass elevator. You can take the optional closed elevator if you choose. You will need to make a reservation, several weeks in advance to avoid disappointment, also to ensure you get past security, as no access permitted into the hotel without this.When we were seated, after a short wait at the reception, we had a perfect position, window location on the side (not the front - trust me, side is best) of the restaurant, the view is amazing. Please note, there is a dress code, so bring the right clothes.The Afternoon Tea includes several courses, beginning with champagne, followed by a fruit tart. Beef with horse radish, then onto a variety of sandwiches, which can be topped up if you have a favorite. Cakes and scones with freshly made jams and clotted cream, sorbet and a small box of chocolates completes the food. Coffee and tea (both hot and cold) are available throughout, but be wary of having further glasses of champagne or other spirits, since this will cost extra. Point to note, the experience lasted almost 3 hours.The reservation also allows access to the property, so take the opportunity to take a look around and take some photos. You are free to walk around the lobby, entrance area and various shops, without any time limit. Enjoy the time.

Astonishing.... Must Visit. The Burj Al Arab is an amazing experience, a must visit for sure, the mind blowing architecture, the luxurious service quality the View from the 148th floor is stunning. Literally I cant find words to define... what u experience. Must Visit for sure.

Once it has to be visited. I had the occasion to leave my car at the wallet, to have a walk all around the building in the garden and the swimming pools, to enter the Burj Al Arab and to reach the restaurant reserved for a business dinner.Great experience to be done for at least once in your life!!!

Drinks at the Skybar. Visiting the worlds only 7* hotel is never going to be cheap and, when booking cocktails at the Skybar, you have to commit to a minimum spend which worked out at about £65 when we visited. This spend is easily achieved as even a standard cocktail costs in excess of £30.However, the experience of visiting this hotel makes it absolutely worth the money. The bar is stunning, as are the views of the Dubai skyline. The cocktails are, as you would expect, first class and snacks are provided (olives, nuts etc).The interior of the hotel is extravagant and a must see and you can also walk around outside the front of the hotel, but inside the security gates, to get a great photo of the hotel up close.

height of luxury.... I had never seen such a beautiful hotel in my life.It is the one of the main attractions of dubai . when u will enter the burj al arab u will be amazed to see the architecture of it .

Brilliant view. it gives view of the complete city and the best part is its camera in which you can see day, night, historic view so any time of the day u visit you can manage to get the complete picture

WOW. the trip to to the top with a SKY ticket was well worth the experience.
What a hight !!!!
the view on the 148th fllor is stunning, on the way down you stop on 125 and 124 for another view around.
Its great !

Luxury at its Culmination. This Hotel is like none orher in the world. I have been in Hotels all over the world, but this one has Luxury build in everywhere, in it's lobby, it's rooms and it's restaurants. The individual Butler per room answer immediately to your needs. The spa is simply beautiful. Been there several times and not a single time did I have anything to comment on negatively.

Burj A must. An iconic landmark hat all visitors must at least see from a close up view on Jumeirah Beach. If you want to see decadence at its best book a drink in the top bar or afternoon tea. you can't just turn up as security is tight.

fast track. This is one of the structures that travelers would need to see we took the fast track ticket it cost more but we saved hours in waiting in line it move us all the way in the front line to the elevators and as soon as we were ready get back to downstairs we were moved to the front line. We only were in Dubai for few days and time was more valuable than waiting in line.

Felt taken advantage of at Afternoon Tea at SkyView Bar. I went out of my way to book this thinking that it is a must do attraction in Dubai at the "famous" Burj Al Arab. To be honest this was a disappointing afternoon for my wife and I. The thing is there wasn't one thing that stood out that made it bad, it was just very underwhelming for us. A mediocre afternoon in a mediocre hotel and to be honest if you skip it you will not be missing anything. First of all the hotel is supposedly a "7 star hotel" but this is a myth, and a self-proclaimed title. You are not allowed to enter the property unless you have a over-priced booking at one of the hotel's restaurants or afternoon tea events. I think the beefed up security is part of the hotel's scheme to add to the allure of this property which to be completely sincere is nothing special at all. Upon entering the lobby you will be underwhelmed with the hotel's appearance, and directed to the special elevator that takes you directly to the skyview bar. As a non-hotel guest you have no access to tour any other part of the hotel except the main lobby and the restaurant or event you are attending. We asked to tour the spa facility just to get an idea of why this hotel is advertising itself as "7 star" but we were denied access and I am almost certain that we would have been underwhelmed there as well. The elevator ride to the sky bar is the only nice part because it is a glass elevator that gives you a nice view of the sea. Other than that the Sky View bar is very dated with a green computer chip theme throughout, anyone who has been up there will know exactly what I mean. The day I went it was extremely foggy with poor visibility due to the sandstorm. So no view and an underwhelming décor and atmosphere in a self-proclaimed 7 star hotel for a whopping 400 USD is not my idea of a fun experience. One glass of champagne is included, and unlimited coffee and tea with small samplings of tea sandwiches and a dessert platter. The food was nothing to write home about, little sandwiches and a small beef dish was not worth the money or more importantly the time and effort to get to this hotel, and how much coffee and tea can one person really drink? It would have been enough for me to have snapped a few pictures of the hotel from the outside and continued on with my day. I made the mistake of paying the exorbitant price thinking I was going to have an amazing experience in the world's first "7 star hotel" but I was wrong and I am paying this advice forward. In my humble opinion, save your money, or at least if you are keen on stepping foot into the hotel to experience the "7 star wonder of it all", book yourself a dinner reservation in one of the restaurants rather than the afternoon tea, maybe you will get more value for your money.

Amazing Friday Brunch. We went to the Al Muntaha restaurant on the 27th floor which shares the top floor of the Burj al Arab with the Skyview Lounge for a Friday Brunch. I booked online and got window seats with a view. It costs 765 UAE Dirham per person which includes a glass of bubbly on arrival and then you select whatever you want from the wide range of dishes on offer. There are so many choices of meat, including Wagyu, fish including Lobster, Alaskan King Crab Claw and many other fish and shellfish, Vegetarian dishes and salads too numerous to mention and 2 large tables full of desert deliciousness. On top of all this if you just want breakfast fare eggs any way are available and there is a wide selection of cheese to choose from. Great experience with very attentive staff and a must do if you if you can get in. Please note they only serve the bubbly from 12 noon onwards and they shut this service at 4pm

Dissapointed. We went to have a look, you could not go in, which is understandable, but it did not have the wow factor which I was expecting, to be honest I thought Atlantis the palm was much more awe inspiring
AMAZING. Again one of those places that does not need a review.The entire complex, the fountain show, the restaurants its all just amazing.

Birthday treat. Went for afternoon tea and spent 4 hours soaking up the atmosphere and excellent food & drink. Everything we expected & more. They brought a birthday cake to our table and the pianist played happy birthday as it was presented..😃
Gorgeous!. Beautiful water show to watch while you dine! Many, many restaurants to choose from to enjoy the view.

Skyview for cocktails. Booked by the hotel conceiarge for my birthday. You cannot just turn up and there is a minimum spend in the bar. BUT so well worth it. The views across the city are wonderful at night. Staff treated us so well. Rose and birthday cake with singing waiters. The Hotel is well worth its 7 star rating. Dinning is wonderful so much choice. The shops are all designer. The aquarium is amazing. Arrive by helicopter expensive but wow that is the high life.

Champage Afternoon Tea with the girls, in the Skyview Bar, simply amazing. 40th Birthday celebration and worth every penny for a 6 course champagne afternoon tea.The whole experice from the drive up to the Burj to being seated is one of pure indulgence. The view from the skyview bar is amazing you can see for miles.The staff are very attentive and informative of what you are being served, the food is delicious and the sandwiches and cakes just keep on coming, the service is impeccable and the staff very friendly.My friend even got a piece of birthday cake with a candle and a single red rose as when booking a informed them it was for a special birthday.On leaving we all got a gift (pen and chocolate set), a perfect ending to a perfect experienceWould thoroughly recommend it for a special occassion.

High Afternoon Tea. This is a must do experience. It is expensive at around £200.00 per couple, however when you compare to afternoon tea in England and what they charge, you are entering what is described as the most luxurious 7 star hotel in the world and they are not wrong. It is luxurious, extravagant and they allow you to go in and wonder around the lobby for photo shoots. Check the gold iPads in the shops within the hotel. You then shoot up to the sky bar in the high speed lift overlooking the Arabian Gulf,Palms and the World islands. You are spoilt to 7 courses and any type of tea you can think of. The experience is wonderful especially for a special occasion and if you advise when booking, you will receive a special treat.

7 Star with no entry. Disappointed we could not enter without booking a very expense table to sit at and have a cup of coffee and a treat for a couple of hundred euro. We decided to go to the beach side and get ourselves a couple of ice creams and have a selfie.

"Tea at The Burj". We loved this elegant and very special experience at the Burj. The delicious food, the royal treatment, listening to the wonderful harpist playing, in such an amazing atmosphere is what makes this such an unforgettable memory. One shall never forget it!!!!!
Go for Breakfast. if you can get a reservation for breakfast or afternoon tea, do it, it is another level of service and the setting is like nothing else you will ever have.

One in-a-life time view. Beautiful 7 star hotel. From the outside to the inside, this hotel is worth visiting even if you only have lunch or dinner. But I wish they would allow guest to view sample rooms
High Tea a must. We visited the Burj Al Arab as a birthday treat. A very wonderful experience if you are visiting on a special occasion.

beautiful!!. it is indeed a treat to the eyes.. with crystal clear blue beach next to the building. Since we visited the place in April, the climate was also very pleasant. i was able to enjoy the beach at 1pm :)
Afternoon Tea/ Fantastic. We booked for afternoon tea at the Burj from start to finish everything was amazing with a beautiful view of Dubai from the sky view bar!!!!

Viewing from the beach. I have not entered the hotel but from where I stood, on the left side of the Burj Al-Arab which I presumed is the Jumeira Beach, this iconic building is impressive on the outside. It was a good day and photography was excellent.
Perfect evening at Skyview. The drinks, food and service were impeccable. The staff were attentive, and we had a very enjoyable evening.

40th Birthday Celebration. A friend who lives in Dubai took me here in July 2013 so I was aware that we needed to book in advance. As I was determined to enjoy 40th birthday drinks high in the sky in the Skyview Bar I emailed the property a couple of months before I left Australia to book a table. I advised them that my mother and I would be celebrating my 40th birthday on this trip. On the night of our reservation, as we were seated, I was presented with a long stemmed red rose and a complimentary cocktail and later a surprise little chocolate birthday cake. It was a very special moment and one that we will never forget. Thank to the crew for this wonderful unexpected treat. It was just perfect!
Book in advance. Nice building and nice view but book your ticket in advance or else you need to buy a fast pass.Very busy in the afternoon so i would say go in the morning

Top of the line luxury. The Burj Al Arab is top of the line luxury in Dubai. The two-story room I saw was more than enough space. As you walk in, each room has an office space and bar. The office space is equipped with an iMac for your use. You'll find a staircase that leads to the upstairs level. The bedrooms are large and the fixtures in all of the bathrooms are covered in gold. You'll enjoy the full size Hermes products as well. Each floor as its own concierge desk. It doesn't have the contemporary feel of most hotels today. But it does have a luxury and elegant feel that you won't find anywhere else. The dining options are equally spectacular. Tea service here is a must do.

What an epic building!. My wife and I did high tea at the Burj Al Arab and it was great experience. Of course we would love to stay there but it is a bit out of our league, high tea is the next best thing. The staff were all very polite and you feel quite exclusive just being in the building getting to watch all the people outside taking pictures. I love the decor of the building with so many flashes of colour that really liven things up. Well worth a visit.

worth once in a lifetime. We (my husband and I) have been at this famous hotel to dine in an evening in February, We want to see The Burj Al Arab inside but for this you have to make a reservation on one of its restaurants. We chose the Al Muntaha one for sky viewing in the evening beginning with 8 o´clock PM. We arrived with 30 min earlier and had time to enjoy the interior hotel (lobby) and take some pictures. For sure you will remember a visit at Burj Al Arab! The experience was impressive and the price for a la carte menu the same ! around 500 euros for both! including 3 course menu, a glass of sparkling apple juice with 24 karat gold leaves (!!!) for me, a glass of wine for my husband and a bottle of water ! But you do not do this extravagance every day, or every year... ! so.. it worthy for once to feel like a special person! Remenber to ask for a table beside the window to enjoy the view !!!!
a wonderland hotel. on the edge of the sea near the jumeira beach a beautiful photo stop wish the prices were a liltle lower for more people to afford itor atleast a conducted tour reasonably priced

Dinner at the Burj. This was a wow moment booked a week in advance for dinner on the 27 th floor at the wonderful 7 star hotel an excuse to get dressed up . Great service lovely ambience amazing views . Could not fault anything expect to pay a fortune meal and wine for two £600 . Loved looking in the lovely shops. All the staff were very professional and friendly , drinks in the cocktail bar have lovely atmosphere .
Lovely place. Lovely place,romantic,beautiful and very clean beach with amazing shells,very peaceful and safe place for couples and families,visit Burj al Arab will be your life time experience :D

Seven star and no request to far. Truly a pinch yourself hotelBoth the hotel building and the sights and services it offers have to experienced. i am no VIP, but it was good to play the part for a while.
great place to have high tea. Make sure to have a reservationView is amazingHigh tea s almost as a dinner if you are a light eater .The sunset time is amazing!
spectacular. Amazing scenery, people watching, buildings, music, where I had a meal, didnt serve wine, but ya cant have everything
Skyview bar. Went to the skyview bar for evening drinks. Although it is expensive its worth the money. Brilliant views and excellent service.
High Tea at the Burj Al Arab. This a must do when you are in Dubai.Nothing more to say other than it was out of this world!Nothing to dislike here, everyone should see this Hotel.
Dream. 7 star upto the mark, what a propertly, must is you can afford it, looks amazing with the beach side

Worth the title "World Class 7 stars Hotel". Luxury at its best! We toured the inside of Burj Al Arab with a very lovely guide, Anastasia dressed in Royal Blue gown embroidered in gold. The view from Al Muntaha was breathtaking: the palm of Jumeira and the stretch of white sand beaches. I wished I could dine at Al Mahara. But the most unforgettable tour was the Royal suite of Burj Al Arab.

Beautiful, but very hard to get to!!!!. Basically, on it's own fortified island of extensive security.. won't let you in, unless reservation or hotel guest.. Even with Reservation, they require MIN. 250+ AED Charge per person.. and yes, they will charge it .. as they require your Credit Card Number, at the Security Gate.. in case you just want to "Look"..Go to property next door (Jeremiah Beach Hotel - the one that looks like a giant "sail") .. Even better, at night .. get great pics and views of Burj Al Arab. No entrance charges!!!!
Awesome is the word.. Loved the interiors of the hotel, the view from the hotel, the high tea...everything was just amazing. The mini fountains at the entrance was cute.

A bit too much. Definitely worth having a look at it. An astonishing architecture. "One and only". But it's always a feeling of "a bit too much" of everything - pride, taking precaution and suspicion towards the guests

Go to the 360 bar!. The 360 bar juts out into the water from the base of the Al Arab, and is an amazing place to get spectacular views on the sky line, and to get a great sunset! Have a few drinks, and continue on your way! The nuts are free!
Once in a life time. This is one place you should go at least once in a life time. Burj Khalifa and down town area is really a must see.
An amazing piece of architecture. Impressive, elegant and modern architecture. Splendid in its setting, with the Palm Jumeirah in the background. An amazing example of incredible architecture.

Amaze balls!. I recently returned from Dubai and Abu Dhabi and it was my first time to use the Jumeirah hotel group. I stayed at the Emirates Towers and Burj Al Arab in Dubai and I stayed at Etihad Towers in Abu Dhabi. These hotels made my trip! They are beautiful, modern, conveniently located and have top notch restaurants and services. The free wifi and beautiful views were a plus! What impressed me most was the staff. No matter where you were in the hotel you were treated like old school royalty. It was the most superior customer service that I have ever experienced. My satisfaction was their #1 priority. I was so impressed! In all future journeys, if there is a Jumeriah hotel in the city I'm visiting I will definitely be staying there!!!

Awe inspiring!. Very efficient getting in and out - and the lift wasn't claustrophobic as I'd feared - and extremely fastAlthough it's cheaper to pre book tickets to get a better rate, the down side is that if you choose a day with a dust cloud the view will be more limited

Excellent lunch . One of the ways of getting into this seven star hotel is to book late morning brunch or lunch. The menu is a Buffey and is the same. We have done both and took friends who were over awed by the building the shops the journey to the restaurant the food and the view. We were lucky that it was a calm day with no must or sand storm. Fantastic views and food. This and the Khalifa are the real reasons for going to Dubai. A must do on your bucket list.
World,s tallest building. We found it very spectacular and our driver took photographs for us which was a bonus Nothing to dislike apart from very busy

top of the world. I had been there at sunset slot of 5.30 pm and its a really very exciting time to see the sunset and at the most the lights of all the skyscraper building getting on at the same time. The best part is we can see the Dubai fountain shows from the top. It's the best time to see the changes all around.

afternoon tea. Unbelievable place went as a treat for afternoon tea. The surroundings were lovely and the view fantastic. However we were asked to move to the bar area so the waiter could clear our table for the next reservations at 7pm this was 6.30 some of the other guests were still using their tables and were not asked to move it spoilt an otherwise very lovely afternoon. It would have been much better with a different waiter as Others were taking photos etc for their guests. At the bar the staff were changing over shifts and one poor guy was getting a telling off in front of us.
flat out amazing. the hotel is luxurious, room is big, service is great and facilities are great. there is also a aquarium there and you can go visit them

Fun- though pricey -visit. we went to the bar for drinks--minimum $100 each. The fountains in the lobby area were fabulous. Take time to really watch them. In the bar you might as well get one of the more "interesting" drinks such as "Passionate Embrace", which comes with a red rose and lots of dry ice smoke.

Highly recommended. Unbelievable...from the moment you walk through the entrance and greeted with the wonderful water display, to the sky view bar for drinks, it was an amazing experience. Breakfast was an experience all seven courses of it and the personal entertainment. It is expensive, but then that is Dubai and basically you get what you pay for. Would definitely return and recommend anyone to visit when in Dubai!.
Tea. Went for afternoon tea, fabulous. Very expensive. Staff were wonderful and the SkyView Bar had breathtaking views.
Magnificent. Dining at this hotel is an out of world experience. The whole setup is breath taking. We were just wondering, where does the "seven star" rating come from?

One of a Kind !. Tallest hotel in the middle of the sea..very beautifully designed to look like a ship's sail, it can be seen from as far as 5 kms..located in Jumeirah near a sprawling mall called Madinath Jumeirah..Truely a five-star hotel, actually considered a 7-star luxury property..very colourful from outside in the night with LED lights glowing all around the facade of the building..its got a restaurant right at the top, literally hanging from the side of the building..although i dint stay there, the rooms are HUGE, with different themes & colours..very exclusive service for clients who are stay at the hotel..the cafe is also good with amazing food & you get to sit right next to a huge aquarium with colorful fishes..truly a beautiful place & you have to visit this when in Dubai..!!

very dissapointed. We went to the Chinese restaurant. 400 USD for a Chinese Buffet with no drinks. two persons. food was good quality but cost/benefit is not worth it. a tourist trap I regret falling into. I would rather use that money in one of the many restaurants in town

incredible experience. from outside to inside and top floors this complex isnt just a building, from the water fountain show through decoration and restaurants. every single piece of iron and wood was perfectlly fitted on the structure. worth the values.
Beautiful hotel . A great experience, boys loved it and so did the wife. Location is perfect Aqua color water with white sand beach. I would recommend anyone and everyone to visit.

Disappointing. I went with 7 friends to this hotel for afternoon tea and was disappointed. We had previously ordered a couple of meals one gluten free and the other dairy free. These meals were not ready for our friends at the same time as ours. We had to eat whilst they waited and waited. The dairy free eventually arrived but it took along time for the other. When the gluten free meal did arrive it consisted of a piece of white bread with various toppings. Very poor indeed. The price we had to pay for all this was very high indeed. We have completed their questionnaire we also informed our waiter who simply shrugged his shoulders. Several of our party have dined here before and found a lowering of standards!!
Skyview bar. went for drinks. was surprised that the whole staff were completely unpretentious - helped to relax into a venue where you might expect otherwise! expensive but its Dubai and unique!

Breathtaking View!. Me and my wife had a visit there last Feb, and it was one of the best one we had. There are so many other attractions there specially Dhow Cruise, Bars, nightlife too is so full of fun. I would definitely go there again if we ever go back.
views are very nice. This is a must see, although you cannot go in, there are many places that offer a great view while eating or having a drink.
Fantastic. It was a great experience and loved it Would recommend You have a minium spend There is no negatives I loved it
Excellent Hotel - The only 7*. I have not stayed here but visited it during my stay in Dubai... One of the finest hotel.... The hotel is excellent and the view from Jumeirah Beach is awesome....
Viewed from outside. This is the old number one attraction prior to Burj Khalifa.It is not economical to have stay experience in this Burj Al Arab hotel.
Beautiful. amazing experience..Dont miss this site if your in Dubai..such a wonderful experience.Kids also loved it so if your traveling with kids ..let them see it!

What a way to spend my birthday!. My friends booked afternoon tea for my special birthday. Food was fantastic & staff very friendly and attentive. Yes it's expensive but worth a visit for a special occasion.
Afternoon Tea. We had afternoon tea, lovely experience with exceptional service and amazing views. A little on the expensive side but well worth the indulgence.

A great view. I believe that there is a tour to get inside the hotel but we opted to just go to the Jumerah and have our photos taken from there. This is one of the most iconic structure in Dubai s I would say it is a must to see. You may also enjoy the beach with it's fine sands.

A dream come true. I have always wanted to visit this beautiful hotel and I was privileged to go with my Husband, Son and his Girlfriend for drinks. The whole experience was amazing, and the views out of the Sky bar are second to none. Well worth the money.

Burj Al Arab. Burj Al Arab we saw only from outside. And it looks astonishing. The width in which it is spread. In the extreme south besides the occean a standalone high rise in that area. It can be seen from the palms, marina also
Awesome hotel, must visit. We loved this place, great beach, amazing service and superb interiors. Must visit even if you cant afford to stay

Disappointing. This was one of what we thought was a highlight of our trip. Need lottery money to stay there but would not want to!! Huge security to get in, we chose the 5/6 course meal in the different restaurants at vast expense ( I saw the credit card this a.m.!!) View from bar to die for but were hassled to choose our different dishes. On arrival we were left standing around with other people like herds and told to look at the shops while waiting, not enough seating!! Would not suggest this type of visit, just go for drink or eat just in their signature restaurant which is fish, we do not do fish so had a meat dish which was very very disappointing. Location great by aquarium, attentive service. All in all very expense evening memorable for not the right reasons.
At the Top. Fantastic! The views were magnificent and the lift was something out of this world. You really get to see that Dubai has literally sprung out of the desert.

Opulent extravagance!. Afternoon tea in the Skyview Lounge cannot be described in a single word. It is at the same time elegant, extravagant, calm, luxurious, satisfying and an experience that enables you to feel a sense of wealthy privilige, if only for a fleeting time.The view is breathtaking, testament to man's engineering ingenuity.The service is faultless and the food is sublimely simple yet so precise. Every sandwich cut as if by machine, each pastry and scone made to exact dimensions. This building and the service offered within its walls is based upon a philosophy and desire to be perfectly engineered.Savour the moment as it is all too brief! This is a world to which only the few can remain and enjoy. For everyone else we must accept that we are but guests in the world of glitz, glamour and great wealth.As I walked out of the doors, past the array of Rolls Royce's, Aston Martin's and Bentley's, all neatly lined up like cucumber sandwiches, I looked forward to returning to the comfort of my world.
Afternoon tea. We went in february; the tea was at 4 so we stayed until the sunset at 6h15, it was incredible! Yess it's expensive but worth the memories

Afternoon tea.. Wonderful.You can tell why the prices are extreme! and they would be so worth it! View from the skybar is amazing. 2nd time returning. Just overall stunned! The lift is made of gold! :O
Big Bus Tour of City. The Burj Al Arab is extraordinary to see. I saw it on the Big Bus Tour which took me around Dubai sightseeing.

Dine in the most famous hotel in the world.. My wife and I visited Dubai in July 2012 for our 25th Wedding Anniversary. Visit the most famous hotel in the world and dine on one of the many restaurants, should you have a special occasion like we had, or you just want to impress or be near how the most wealthy people dine. You can go for Lunch or Dinner, Afternoon Tea or later for High Tea. You can have tea in the Skyview bar, the Junsui Restaurant, or the Sahn Eddar (Atrium Restaurant). Sky Tea @ Skyview Bar, AED 620 per person. Asian Afternoon Tea at Junsui, AED 400 per person. Ultimate Afternoon Tea at Sahn Eddar, AED 560 per person with champagne (or) AED 500 per person with unlimited non alcoholic drinks. High Tea at Sahn Eddar, AED 400 per person.Dress Code: Smart Casual. Gentlemen are required to wear a collared shirt, full-length trousers or elegant jeans and closed shoes (no trainers). Ladies are required to wear a suit or dress, long or short skirt or dressy slack and top. UAE national dress is welcomed. You can also dine in the Al Iwan, Al Mahara, Al Muntaha, or Bab Al Yam Restaurants. Finish of with a cocktail in the Juna Lounge. If you are visiting Dubai splash out and be decadent.

One of the first attractions we visited. A memorable experience, still fresh in our minds, after passing through security where at the entrance where all the exotic cars where parked;our favorite being the Aston Martin.The foyer was over the top with glitz and glass. We ventured up the elevator to enjoy a luncheon overlooking the Gulf where the service was very friendly, attentive and continuous.A positive and memorable experience.

Signature Tower of Dubai. Before Burj Khalifa was constructed, this used to be one of the many iconicbrand ambassador marsk for Dubai. Designed to reflect the sail of a dhow, it stands on a small man made Island.Claims to be a 7* Hotel !

DRINK AND FOOD. Lucio in this hotel, open only for dinner is served exceptionally by the Chef Peter The restaurant is...Lucio in this hotel, open only for dinner is served exceptionally by the Chef Peter The restaurant is...Reviewed 6 March 2015Visited the Holiday Inn from the 10th of Feb till the 24th and have to say it is still an amazing place to...Just sadly returned after 7th holiday staying in Casa De Cris eating at mikes restaurant and spending...
Still the best. Still the best in luxury after all these years. Go and take a look around and eat in one of the great restaurants. Feel the opulence!

great top floor bar. The view of the sea is amazing. Great service. I believe you have to be either a guest of hotel or have an invite to get to the top. (if you are not staying at the hotel, ask your hotel concierge to call and see if they can get you a reservation or "invite") Once you get into the bar, there was a 80 USD. drink min. per person. Nice to put on your bucket list. I would suggest to go during the day so you can see the beach. We went at night but, since the windows mostly face the beach, you really don't see much of the city lights at night.

Imposing piece of architecture. Entry being limited to only those who are reserved this great and imposing piece of modern architectural wonder is one of those photo stop moments where you admire the sail shaped hotel building overlooking the blue waters.
Breath Taking. The view from the Sky Bar is spectacular. The High Tea was pricey, but everything you would expect from a 7 star hotel. I would definitely visit again.

Worth the high tea price of admission. As you've figured out by now, the Burj Al Arab is all about showing off and feeling exclusive. The only real ways in are to either be a guest, or make a reservation at one of their many bars / restaurants. You can't simply walk in as there is a separate security gate before you're even allowed to cross the bridge to get there.But one of the most economical ways to get in is booking an afternoon tea at one of the restaurants or bars there (economical still means the priciest afternoon tea you'll probably ever experience!). We chose to indulge in the Sky Bar to enjoy the view from near the top of the Burj Al Arab. You can also just have tea at the lobby restaurant - but the experience isn't nearly as exclusive. Reservations are handled via email and there are essentially two sessions (1PM and 4PM start times). You might get a 1:30PM or 4:30PM sitting, but what basically happens is all the prime tables / seats by the windows of the Sky Bar get filled by the early guests. The rest of the seating is away from the windows, so not quite a "wow" experience. The food was above average, not mind-blowing. But you could have as much as you wanted (to justify the cost). The desserts were pretty good. But I actually enjoyed sampling the various teas and taking in the view. The one knock on it was the service - it seemed like the staff was overwhelmed at times and we never had a consistent waiter because numerous people brought our food and drinks to us. So it was confusing at times and we had to wait to catch anyone's attention at others. For a self-proclaimed 7-star hotel, I expected a little more - but overall, it was worth doing once.

Nothing to see here.... This was the original and first(!) strange piece of architecture built in Dubai back in the mid-90's and it shows. The hotel id awesome to look and even has a spectacular lightshow at night, but besides that, is a complete locked down location without acces from Outsife. FUN FACT: The hotel - and Casino, is built 50m out in the Gulf as gambling is not allowed on Dubai soil :-)

Could be a long queue. Book ahead as the tickets sell out fast. Sadly we went up in a sandstorm so can't vouch for the views but it was a great experience. There are queues to go up and come down though so if you travel with children keep a drink with you.
Architectural Marvel. The sheer sight of it makes you feel good. We had a look at it from the nearby beach and it's such a beautiful piece of architecture.

lost in a parallel universe of tackiness. The Kardashians love it-should about sum it up.. WEIRDEST place ever. The suite was just ridiculously stupid looking. Decorations? Purple, red and gold...chauffeur provided by the hotel took us around ..was insulting to me (a lowly woman of course) Sad place. TRYING WAY TOO HARD. All propaganda-dont bother.

Great experience. The hotel is very beautiful, and the Sky bar is very nice. The staff was very kind and the view is great. We got some drink and some food and it was very good.
It was a very nice experience to try the worlds only 7 star hotel.
Scenic view. Best is to go early afternoon when the haze is gone and the contrasts of light are better for photography. Book a time on th net and you have not to line up.

Plenty of ways to visit if you're not staying here. Be forewarned - this is not a hotel you can simply walk into to have a look around. The security is extremely tight and you'll only be admitted if you're a guest or have a reservation at one of the restaurants/bars. As the Burj Al Arab is a Dubai icon any visit to the city should include a stop by the hotel. You just need to figure out how to do it. The meals are staggeringly expensive and you're looking at a minimum spend of AED 300 per person if you wish to visit the bar. My suggestion - splurge in a meal. Your best bets are either Al Muntaha on the top floor (best for lunch so you'll get a view) or Al Mahara, the stunning restaurant with an enormous two storey acquiring which the tables surround. If you really want to splurge go for the Culinary Flight which will take you to every bar and restaurant in the hotel (see my review). The food is very good and the service incomparable.

like no other. Amazing service, professional, attentive and friendly. Lovely food cooked to perfection and beautifully presented. Beautiful surroundings and comfortable atmosphere. There is nothing to dislike.

Once in a lifetime. Breathtaking! I mean really, once you pull of you get treated like royalty. They have guards so only guests can get in. Once you're in the main lobby you see why it's so exclusive. There is an aquarium as you go up the escalator, and women who assist you to your location. Overall just lovely. On the second day, I took a cab there and totally forgot that I had packed my banners in there for my meeting that day. I got out of the cab and left the banners. As soon as I hit the lobby, I remembered they were in the cab. I ran out and told the guys at the front and they stopped the cab at security and averted a total disaster for me! If you get to go to one of the top floors, I think I was on the 22nd, you can get a very clear view of the Palm. It's magnificent, so make sure you go there. The service was impeccable and I was assigned a gentleman who took care of my many requests. It's a must see!

Splendour and Magical. Went for cocktails and enjoyed all the grandeur this hotel omits there is a surcharge of 370 dirim each for this privilege but I felt it worth while to experience the view from floor 122 in the evening overlooking Dubai.
great experience. all the buildings have awesome views and are so well planned. it is worth the visit. The design is wonderful and the staff were helpful.

Wow.What a view!. We booked on line for tickets which was very easy to collect and opted for a visit to the first viewing floor. The whole visit from start to finish was great. The view was exceptional even though we had a hazy day. I would say to go early due to the crowds that were building up when we were leaving. It took a fair while to get down due to the crowds. It was an easy process so and well organized.
Lunch at the Burj with the Prime Minister popping in!!. One of the most amazing experiences of my life.Another world that delivers opulence luxury and grandeur especially for you.

Out of this world! . Stayed here as part of our honeymoon. Words cannot describe the luxury of this hotel. The rooms are amazing never once needed to use the key given for our room. Staff really friendly couldn't do enough to help and the food was lovely. Pricey but expected staying in a place like this!

Greatest Hotel ever. this is one of the greatest hotel ever built the staff the rooms the luxury service you get its just amazing and the staff friendliness is just what you need when going to Dubai to relax and I cant explain how amazing the facilities are cause you have to go there and try them, its a little bit pricy but its worth it !

Looks as amazing as it is portrayed. It was an honor seeing such an amazing piece of art that sits out in the ocean. I took so many pics of it as it looked soo nice. Definitely something to see when you go to dubai

Unique. Visited as part of a tour. We did not go in due to time limitations. We only had the exterior view and that was during a sand storm. We could see the building, it was beautiful, but lost some detail because of the sand. It is a must see and I will go back.

an amazing experience. The Al Arab hotel is quite located in the sea in shape of a boat. The hotel can be viewed from the public beach in Jumeriah. If you want to see the hotel from inside then you can make a reservation in one of their eating places and must have proof of reservation, then only they let you in.its a must if you are in Dubai.
al mahara. i was in al mahara restaurant with my family. perfect service, friendly staff, perfect food, perfect environment. pricy but it's worth,
OK. Well..we had to see the hotel from far..so had to click pics from the gate..and worse..there was a very long queue to catch a taxi back home..nothing much..

Still thinking of it. I went to burj al arab for the afternoon tea in feb 2014.very warm welcomed, great service and quality food. enjoyed the ambiance, view and everything so much. after more than 1year, i still thinking of it. the sunset there, stunning!

Great experience. This was the second time I have visited the Burj Al Arab for afternoon tea. It's a great experience but lacked a little of the polish it previously had. At £110 per person it is expensive but the luxury and views do make it special. Just the food didn't seen quite as good and the service was just a bit lacking.

Man Made Marvel !!. The Al Arab hotel is quite located in the sea in shape of a boat. The hotel can be viewed from the public beach in Jumeriah. The location and the shape is beautiful. Visited during the new year eve.. The fireworks are awesome ... Must see !!
truly 7 star. If you want to see the hotel from inside then you can make a reservation in one of their eating places and must have proof of reservation, then only they let you in.
What a place. Not good with heights but had to go up this, queues ineveiable but moved along very quik, views were spectacular, spent 1hr up there.

WOW!!!!. This hotel is beyond anyone's expectations of what a hotel should / could be. It is marvelous, impressive and every bit as glam as everyone said it was. I booked one of suits for a gift for my parents and went to visit them when they stayed here. The staff took very good care of them and the butlers were especially thoughful and considerate. The room was out of this world with trinkets and furniture to impress even the most tricky of customers. The room overlooked the sea with JBR on the left hand side. When the sunset over the water it was the most beautiful view you can think of. As a visiting guest I was amazed by this place and hope to stay myself one day soon.

An architectural marvel. We viewed this hotel from the distance both day and night, it showed a different character in both instance. Truly an architectural and engineering marvel, i can only imagine the work and challenge behind its construction.

The luxury HOTEL. This is one of Dubai's most old, uxorious hotel wherein you are not permitted to see the hotel if you are not staying there.If you want to see the hotel from inside then you can make a reservation in one of their eating places and must have proof of reservation, then only they let you in.The cost is extremely high even to have a cup of tea. Alternatively you can take a picture from the beach from outside.
Iconic building. The Burji Al Arab is a stunning and iconic building but seemed a lot smaller in real life (viewed from the Jumeriah beach)

Afternoon tea with a view.. I have been to several London hotels for afternoon tea and was looking forward to being taken to the Burj Al Arab to the rooftop bar for their iconic version. It was a wonderful experience which stArted when entering the amazing building, going up the aquarium lined walls on the escalator on one side and fountains on the other. The glass lift took us up to the twenty seventh floor and we were taken to a table overlooking the sea, what a view! The afternoon tea was delicious and included a course of Wagu filet of beef with mashed potato, very different. Sandwiches and scones and cake followed ending with Lychee sorbet. We were given chocolates to take home, altogether a special experience.

A True Iconic Building. That's the first recommeded 7 star hotel of this world.And so damn expensive. Located at beach side giving it a best location. We enjoyed the beach view and took many pictures outside because it is too expensive to go in. The first iconic building of high tec Dubai. If you are not staying in hotel u can't even go near building to take pictures because of security reasons.

Over-Hyped. Being just a month old in Dubai I was very excited to go to Burj Al Arab. We booked at its rooftop restaurant Al Muntaha to have a 7 star experience. Great structure but not great Hospitality. The view from the restaurant was the only bright side. Very limited menu & food not made upto perfection. The moment I entered the in Burj al Arab the only word that came to my mind was GARISH. Too overloaded & gaudy. The restaurant Al Muntaha has got the worst interior I have ever experienced. Totally not worth the money paid.

Sky View Bar Below Expectations. It's certainly something to experience the famous Burj Al Arab, but sadly the slow service in the bar itself led to some frustration, and two missed opportunities to move to window tables when staff were nowhere to be seen. Given the minimum spend, and the cost of individual drinks, we had hoped for an experience of equal value but were left disappointed.

Sunset over Atlantis. Booked afternoon tea at Burj as one of the highlights of our holiday. tea was in the Skyview Bar on 27th floor.Superb views over Dubai. Book for 4.00pm and watch the sunset Fantastic.Afternoon tea consisted of 7 courses spread over 2 hours, with a complimentary glass of Champagne. Staff were excellent and very friendly, very knowledgeable.Décor was a bit glam but very expensively decorated and opulent. White Rolls Royces for hotel guests. Heliport on the top. It was one of the great high tea experiences we have ever had and would do it again, if given the chance. Left with souvenir box of chocolates. Don't go to Dubaiand not go to Burj Al Arab. A memory we will have for life.
Looks good. Can't get near this place unless you visit for afternoon tea and cakes but quite expensive to do that .

Impressive. Was really impressive. But too expensive!! Had a lovely dinner there while watching fish in the large tanks. Make you feel like you under the sea. The cocktail bar had a fabulous view of Dubia. The cocktails were so overpriced. Over all a lovely experience.

Royal Hotel. This hotel is located at amazing place on the beach.Outside view from nearest beach is amazing.You can't visit the hotel unless you have booked lunch/dinner or breakfast or you are staying there.
Afternoon Tea at Skyview Bar. It was a very nice afternoon tea.. Champagne was great and also all the appetizers.. And one other good thing is you can try as many tea as you like.

so so. Well -- the big one - if you go for the Friday Buffet in the Restaurant on top of the Burj make sure that you do nt suffer from "height sickness" -- it s quite high. Strange decor when we went there, a bit like in a 70 s disco, but then the decor of many restaurants in Dubai looks like they found it somehwere in a museum. But that s my personal taste and I am not goign to a restaurant for the decor (always can xclose my eye for a while). Food - Buffet - ok. For the price .. not .. unless you stuff yourself with goose liver pate -- yeap you can get a big slap of foie gras -- but I don t like it so that leaves me with a comparism of the Traiteur Buffet on Fridays which I personally think is much much much better (and for nearly the same price all drinks are included i.e. bubbles and grapes) where at the Burj you even pay for the water. Other than for the views IMHO .. No.

Everything that glitters is indeed Gold. Haha, indeed, i went to Burj in 2000 the first time and since then been there a number of times. Most of the times a trip outside for friends to take photos. a few times on the top floor bar to enjoy the drinks and the view. Some do find the decoration a bit tacky: however, it has its glitter and grandeur. a must visit if you are a tourist or a local
Luxurious. Nothing to dislike. Everything was just amazing. From the friendliness of the staff! surroundings, music, opulence, food, drink, fountains...A perfect afternoon tea!

sugared out. Great view and the shops in the hotel mini-mall makes you realise that there are an awful lot of rich people visiting Dubai - I'm not one of them. Nevertheless, in one of my maddest moments, as a special treat, I booked high tea on the 27th floor (Sky bar). You need to have a very sweet tooth - cakes and more cakes (plus some nice finger sandwiches and a glass of champagne) for over £110 per head. Silly, but a nice memory all the same.

Afternoon Tea at the Sky View bar. We booked Afternoon Tea at the Sky View bar at sunset– we knew it wouldn’t be cheap but it’s a lovely experience, especially as we were on our honeymoon. We had requested a window seat which we got, overlooking the Jumeirah beach side (not the Palm). But we were allowed to walk around to take pictures of the Palm side. The food really was lovely, a hot beef dish to start, then beautiful sandwiches, all on different breads, lovely scones and cakes and chocolates & a rose to take home. Very impressed. The price was around £130 each – so very expensive but worth it for the experience and service, felt like a VIP. Next time I would like to try dinner in the restaurant with the aquarium downstairs, Al Mahara.
review of Burj Al Arab Boxing Day. too expensive and difficult just to have a drink and take in the view. Very disappointing experience overall.
beautiful!. We had a high tea. It was very nice. Good service, great food/cakes, life music and a beautiful environment. A bit expensive but you feel like a queen/king

Beautiful sign of Dubai - no entry without reservation. To visit Burj Al Arab was #1 in my to do list for Dubai. Unfortunately its not possible to go to any beach close to this hotel without a reservation - this is a bad surprise - therefore I recommend to make at least a restaurant reservation in nearby Jumeirah Beach Hotel - they have nice beach with good view of Burj Al Arab. Otherwise you will not be able to see it closer and make some pictures.

Iconic building, you have to visit at least once.. After seeing this iconic building numerous times on TV and in magazines we knew when we booked our first trip to Dubai in Feb 2014 we had to go just to see if it lived up to its reputation and all the hype that came with it. (This review is a little late,my reminder is that we are here again in Feb 2015). The hotel is impressive, ostentatious and indulgent. The decor offers the rich decadents the chance to indulge more in luxury and they certainly do. The atrium and the waterfall when you first walk in makes you start to absorb the luxury of this hotel immediately. You are able to look round the lobby and yes some people were taking photos, despite the rumours that you can't. We then went up to the Sky Bar where we had something to eat and cocktails. This was a lovely experience and one I hope to do again, hopefully afternoon tea next time I visit. Later on in the evening we had lattes and very very very expensive brandy in the Al Muntaha, but this is one of those places where you just have to try it at least once. On the whole we did have a good time. Staff were friendly and service was good, however it is very expensive and be prepared to pass out at some of the prices. But most people who visit this place know it is not bargain bucket hotel, but that doesn't mean you have to spend a fortune and do the whole afternoon tea, cocktails in the bar and dinner in the restaurant in one visit. Do I think it's 7 star? Certain aspects yes, other aspects I'm not so sure about and regardless of star rating I do feel it is way over priced. This said I would still say to anyone who visits Dubai try this place at least once.

The Fast Track is worth the money. Get the fast track ticket as you avoid the lines. I went just before sunset to the 124th floor and while there got a special free invite to the 125th which is quieter and has a 360 view. Amazing 20 second elevator ride

BEST HOTEL IN WORLD. Since we did not stay in this hotel, we had no access to this property. However we could get to see glimse of it from Jumeirah Beach. Its really a awsome hotel. Must see in Dubai once you are there.
Worth a visit..... Slightly rushed trip lovely hotel and lovely food well with a visit to a 7* hotel family of 5 people
Afternoon Tea. The afternoon tea in the sky lounge is amazing experience well worth the cost. The view is excellent, the food delicious and the staff very friendly.

Amazing afternoon tea experience. We visited the Burj Al Arab on Wednesday 18th February for afternoon tea. We were a group of four ladies from Sunderland, England. The whole experience was amazing, with fabulous food and lovely service and staff. . A special mention goes to the guys who work on the security (especially the young lad who gave us the task to find an American dollar - he will know who he is) hut who arranged for a member of staff to give us a tour in a buggy. Thanks you so much as the buggy driver was friendly, helpful and full over information about the area. I can't remember his name but if you mention Miss Susan he will know who he is. The whole experience was amazing and one which we will never forgot. It's a must to do while visiting Dubai and the hotel interior is stunning.

lunch at the top. During our stay in Dubai we had lunch at Burg Al Arab. The view was spectacular. You can see the man made islands and much of the city. The food was fantastic, yes very pricey but a once in a life time opportunity. Well worth it. Our waiter took us to see the huge aquarium, amazing.Just fascinating architecture. Check out you tube video on construction of it.Trip was Feb 2014.
the high life. whoa! don't look down. If you can book early and the morning is the best time to go. Very impressive building which can be seen from just about everywhere you go in Dubai.

Way Over Rated, Lousy Food. Went twice to Burj Al Arab each time was worse than the time before. To go in the hotel you have to have a restaurant reservation and to pay in advance by credit card 400AED per person, or you need to be an hotel guest. First time I booked for a family dinner was Christmas night 2011at Majlis Al Bahar restaurant for a Christmas BBQ B even though I paid 1600AED upfront I discovered that the restaurant Buffet. It was only when the valet parking took the car that an hotel receptionist by the door informed me that Majlis Al Bahar is not in the hotel building, it was on mainland shore and not on the island. What a scam no one mentioned that over the phone, when I was making the reservation. It was even the hotel staff on the phone who suggested this restaurant. We tried to visit the famous bar just to take a look we were not allowed to step in, we were told you need a reservation in the bar, or you need to be an hotel guest. Just a look no no no, even if only two of us will go in take a look from the window? Nope a firm No and no negotiations about it. Very friendly I have to say. So first I was scammed and then almost thrown out, great. It was a Christmas BBQ dinner, the third stab the menu was seafood and nothing but seafood. Two members of my family are allergic to seafood?!! and to make things worse even the salads contained seafood. OK let us compensate on desert, this was the joke of the century, desert was nothing but watermelons. Yup this is it and nothing else. 1/10I wrote a complaint to the Burj Al Arab, Jerome Barbeau who was the Food and Beverage Manager then replied bla bla bla:” The Culinary team will review the existing Majlis Al Bahar Menu and as well as preparation and production of food to ensure our guests receive high quality products as expected of Burj Al Arab.” And nothing else except we wait to see you again. Nothing like we will return your money or we will invite you for something complementary, that was it. I decided never again.In November 2014 a friend of mine called to say he is in Dubai and staying in the Burj Al Arab. He invited me for dinner with a bunch of school friends. This time it was in the hotel it was the Al Iwan restaurant, which is an Arabic Buffet. I was for the second time terribly disappointed from the food and the selection of the buffet. For the amount of money paid you are better going somewhere else. Karam Beirut, Abdelwahab or Burj Al Hamam are 10 times better. The only difference is that in Al Iwan there is some Moroccan food besides the Lebanese food. Who cares if it doesn’t taste good? 4/10I will never ever go and pay a dime in any of Burj Al Arab restaurants, if I’m invited I will just go because someone made the effort and the gesture too, I will try to advise them to make the dinner somewhere else. But for me to go to Burj Al Arab as a paying customer this will never happen again, I refused to be taken for a ride for the second time.
Nice to visit. It's a nice place to see once in your lifetime. It's an amazing out of the world hotel. Great to see the underwater restaurant.
Spinnaker sail. Amazing view, opulent and the wow factor of architecture. The building gives you the feeling you are out on a yacht in the gulf.

ABSOLUTELY AWE INSPIRING. Felt like royalty visiting this amazing hotel. Went there for afternoon tea!! Wow it was a 7 course delight. They really look after you and the surroundings are spectacular. Amazing perfume as you walk in. Most hotels in Dubai seem to have there own aromas.
Satisfy your Curiosity. Try at least get into the lobby area to get a photo of the impressive atrium.It is overpriced but glad we got to see it.

beautiful. It is a beautiful architecture from outside. Inside has a good decoration and design too. Service is good but very expensive. I prefer historical simple monuments to modern architectures which are triumph of wealth.

High tea.. This is on the pricy end of entertainment in Dubai. But to be able to say you have been in one of the most photographed hotels in the world is something. Ask to have the high tea in the Sky lounge since there is another just above reception without the views. The experience is well worth it.
humongolous. enormous , crowded, you can see all dubai at a glance. made reservation before going online, and take your time for dubai mall.

We Need 7 Stars For This Review!!!. We visited Burj Al Arab on a visit to the Junsui Restaurant on Valentines Day. On arrival, we were greeted by almost every staff member that we caught eyes with and a lovely lady at reception offered to take a picture of us. The short experience I had at this hotel absolutely lived up to and in fact exceeded all my expectations.I must also note that Burj Al Arab is just such a beautiful hotel and at the time of our visit they had a display for Valentines Day that was just amazing!

Excellent design. Burj Al Arab is an architectural marvel. The helipad at top is also visible from ground level. It is also one of the most expensive hotels in Dubai, situated right on Jumeira beach. There are local Yacht services available if you are looking for a Yacht ride.
Lunch experience. Great service and food. A bit on the expensive but nice to do while in Dubai.Acertainly a landmark in the clean and beautiful country. My 3rd visit and will notbe the last.

Amazing. We loved this hotel. We tried several different restaurants by booking the 'culinary flight' option, which started in the Skyview bar with a cocktail and gave us the chance to enjoy 5 courses in different restaurants within the Burj Al Arab. Definitely worth a visit.
Simply Amazing. Visited for afternoon tea. Fantastic experience with great staff who were very friendly and not in the least bit pretentious which some may have thought in a 7 star hotel.

Sky Bar afternoon tea - excellent experience. Having just returned from a short break to Dubai, the afternoon tea at the Sky Bar in the Burj Al Arab will be a lasting memory. Having seen this iconic building so many times in pictures and on the TV, I was keen to experience it myself - and it was well worth the wait!! The entire experience was extremely luxurious. The hotel itself is fantastic we were able to look around the lobby area for some time with no pressure to move on before heading to the Sky Bar. Everyone we encountered was friendly and welcoming.The high tea itself was excellent. Fantastic service and wonderfully presented food across 6 courses with Champagne. Whilst our very friendly waiter did subtly inform us that more than one glass of champagne would require a charge, he did also, by contrast, say that we should experience as much of the food, tea and juice selection as we could possibly stomach! I wasn't expecting that. We left absolutely full to bursting!The experience was in no way rushed and despite what I had read beforehand everyone was walking around the bar and taking photos at leisure. All very relaxed and a wonderful experience in one of the world's most iconic buildings and best hotels. Worth every penny.
Fluffy fluffy as almost everything in UAE. Lots of marketing though nothing more than another luxury hotel. It doesn't worth a dollar to pay for it.

High promises and average experience. Honestly, experience we expected to be better.Hotel is iconic and looks outstanding from outside!When we stepped inside stuff appeared for us more arrogant than caring.Beutiful design and decorations.Afternoon tea in Al Muntaha were so so and price is crazy expensive for service and food&beverage quality we have got.On other hand selection of alcoholic cocktails is huge and ingridients combinations positively surprised us.Overall experience wishes to be better for such famous hotel. Hope the service staff at the lobby can be a way more friendly.
Visit. Best of the best in the world , what a iconic hotel with super class services and always smiling employees . Exceptional place

Dinner at Burj Al Arab. Worth a visit atleast once for the luxury it exudes. We dined at the Junsui restaurant and the food quality was pretty good. Wouldn't mind going again though its quite heavy on the wallet!

NOTHING SPECTACULAR. Just another iconic structure . Nothing spectacular . Too much fuss for nothing . There are more incredible iconic attractions in other parts of the world .
The rooms are just like any other luxury guest rooms in high end hotel brands .
All F&B outlets are overpriced .
The atmosphere is not inviting at all ,

Stunning Hotel. Burj Al Arab encompasses sophistication in every sense of the word. Nothing compares to when you see it for the first time. The beach is stunning and calming. Go on and experience it for yourself.

What else can we add that hasn't been said!. Great property, amazing views, solid restaurant (believe it or not, the french fries ROCKED!). The Sky View Bar was also amazing after a great dinner at Al Muntaha.
Great. Amazing place with luxuries décor and ambiance, have a nice gulf view and full of all activities. number of restaurants and shops for getting gifts you do not need to go any where else.

Breath taking architecture but.... The moment you step in you immediately feel that you are in one of these touristic Las Vegas hotels , food outlets and restaurants are average at the estimate and definitely not worth the huge bills , however service is attentive , extremely friendly and everyone is willing to help. the limited time of visit option didn't allow me to mention the time of my several stays and experience in Burj Al Arab so I only mentioned the date of the last visit just to satisfy the curiosity of a visiting friend , and yes I enjoyed my drink by the window at the bar but turned down an invitation to stay for dinner .I personally wasn't impressed by the suites , to much colours for my eyes and testless blink blink , so in brief admire the archecture , have a martini or two at the hanging bar and don't waste time that is better dedicated to see and experience much more interesting places that Dubai has to offer.

Magnificent. This building is one of the worlds most outstanding and it could only be built in Dubai. The cost must have been enormous but the result is outstanding. You must have High Tea whilst in Dubai.The lighting at night is also amazing and a work of art.

Great Experience. I must admit i was unsure when the wife booked it but thought I would give it a go, how right that decision proved to be.From the moment of arrival, throughout the time there until we left, the whole experience was great.Staff was great and attentive without been overwhelming.A must do experience.

luxury redefined. the surroundings of the place are tranquil and magnificent enough but the moment you enter into the marquee hotel you feel that the outdoor world has been shut out. opulence is an understatement from everything starting from the bar, the rooms even the chandeliers. nice getaway for a short while, difficult to come back to ground reality once back outside
Good view. Good place to visit. The hotels is nice to see and the beach around is excellent to walk around the place.
Get Afternoon Tea. The never ending tea experience.... sandwiches, cakes they kept on coming..... and the views are to die for...

Magic!. If you want an experience out of the ordinary - treat yourself to a drink at the Sky View Bar at Burj Al Arab - it is a bit expensive but worth every dime!!! The view over Dubai is magnificent and just entering the hotel with it´s special interior and the most helpful staff is special - so just do it!
Jawdropping!. It's unlike any other place you'll ever see.. If you're looking for an ultra luxurious out of this world experience, while still submerged directly in it, this this is THE place!
Fantastic. Just building is already a world wonder, once you walked into the lobby you will feel in a different world. The Skyline Bar was great, pricey for maybe one drinks but incredible views.

Special Afternoon Tea. We booked this as it was our honeymoon - everything was just perfect and worth every penny. It cost around £120 per head but if you can afford to splash the cash it's an experience with stunning views. The service and the afternoon tea and champagne was excellent.
Nice. The scenery was nice, though the construction sites near the area are not definitely included. I love the color of the sea and the open area.
Fantastic Afternoon Tea. This hotel is very opulent to say the least, the skyview bar is not to be missed and the 7 course afternoon tea was amazing. Highly recommended.

Sunshine Morning At Burj Al Arab. Fabulous day when I visisted with my family to this hotel with prior schedule fixed on telephone with hotel people.The surroundings,sound,light,decoration,furniture,ambiance,colourful environment,authentic dishes,sound of seawaves,helicopter terrace all add glamour to this property.Must visit atleast once i lifetime.Awesome experience.
Amazing Architecture on Jumeirah Beach. Amazing Hotel ....highly expensive ...but worth a Breakfast Visit to get the idea and see how beautiful is Hotel....Absolute Luxurious Hotel :):)
From beach. Couldn't make for afternoon tea but am sure that would be great...only 7* hotel....view from beach is great....will definitely go for tea next time...

Coulourful. I know this place is expensive and even though i only went for a tour i could smell the money in this place...from the Rainbow of colours in the hallways to the splurge of colour in the rooms everything screams oppulance.
Afternoon tea. The experience at the top of Burj Al Arab was expensive but worth it. You really do get a lot of food. They can serve any dietary restriction. Dress is casual.
Not much surprise. The external shape is attractive while the internal setup is not so unique. The Buffet in Asian restaurant is average and even a cup of water needs to be charged.

Wonderful time!. Brilliant! Absolutely loved our afternoon tea in the Sky View Bar. Champagne and 5 courses of food, all absolutely beautiful. Amazing service from 6* waiters. The views were stunning. Highly recommend booking this if travelling to Dubai. :)
Wow. A once in a lifetime experience. Food excellent, service excellentl. Views to die for. A little expensive but a must to see how the other half live

Beautiful. Definitely worth a visit. This is one of the most beautiful places to visit in Dubai.
The evening Big Bus bus tour shows you the best view and share in the history

Awesome experience. We had dinner at the Burj and it didn't dissapoint.
Certainly not the cheapest meal we've ever eaten and the drinks are even more pricey, but what do you expect when you drink 24ct gold flakes!
Exclusive, pretentious but absolutely worth it!
Brilliant. You Must booked the after noon tea it is out of this world you must try.it not same as home. you can only get in there with a pass

Lunch at burj. Wow is the only word that can explain it. Our family if 5 got treated to the burj al arab 7 course lunch. Each course was better than the previous one. The settings were so relaxed over looking the sea in tge worlds 7 star hotel. Felt like heaven on earth. Highly recommend everyone to do it if travelling to dubai.

Over Rated. Over rated, average food quality and over priced. For a "self assessed" 7 star property, it is tacky and one feels ripped off. Two visits were enough. In case the first was a bad day, I visited again only to be disappointed again.
Great. It's in the Hotel Complex & adjacent to Jumeirah Beach Hotel, which I recommend for stay; else it would be 3 times more to stay in here!

Worth a visit!. I've visited here twice, both times for the hair salon. If you make a booking there you can go in the hotel and look around. The other option is to book the afternoon tea or a dinner. I preferred to spend the money on a hair appointment! It's very beautiful inside and if I have the chance I would love to stay here.

On top of the world.. Feel on top of the world at the Burj al arab! Its amazing, best time to go is during sunset, u also get to see the fountains. the view, the history of dubai everything u get to see here.

WOW!. Fantastic visit here, we had booked ahead for afternoon tea. We had to report to the security guard before crossing the bridge to the hotel and on entering we were greeted by three members of staff and directed to the upper floor to our destination. We were greeted by fountains tumbling down and as you looked up, a sea of golden balconies as we were directed to the upper floors where we waited until we were shown into the lift that took us to the Skyview Bar for afternoon tea. The staff were attentive and quick. The food was fabulous and everything was topped up without having to ask. There was a wonderful view of the sunset from where we sat and a couple of hours later we left very sad that we were not staying there longer. I would highly recommend the experience - not to be missed.
Afternoon tea with a view. Whilst this is the most expensive afternoon tea on the planet it is worth doing once. A special day with a special person (people). If you haven't done it.. do it.

Amazing!. This place is a must visit if you are in Dubai!It looks as amazing as it does on the photographs as it it does close up.I really recommend a visit to this place even if it is to just get a photograph of you outside !!!
Sailing. Shaped like a sailing ship. Amazing to just view it for real. I know this is all over the internet. But the feeling is way more awesome when you actually go and stand next to Burj Al Arab.

Overrated. I tried to find the cheapest meal so that I could enter the hotel. The cheapest was a 76 USD snack at Junsui which consisted of 2 appetizers and a drink. Even drinks required a minimum more than 76 USD at other restaurants. Not worth it. The waiter recommended 2 deep fried appetizers. Glad I only got one because I couldn't finish the calamari. Had to remove the batter for half of the calamari because the batter started to stick to my ribs. Don't get me wrong, it was good, crispy calamari, but I couldn't handle too much deep fried food. The second snack I got was dim sum (1 small pork bun, 1 shrimp hargow, and 1 chicken hargow). Ehhh... I rather go to San Francisco Chinatown to eat them. I chose a cocktail which consisted of tea, citrus juices, and some Russian liquor. Not bad, but was watery half way because there was too much ice. There were also complimentary nuts (cashews and almonds) and a variety of olives drenched in olive oil which made it less salty than the usual marinated olives. I was not impressed with the lobby area as It looked like any other 5 star hotel. I expected more for a 7 star hotel. The lobby area was smaller than I expected. Staff was very helpful and friendly. I have no regrets coming here otherwise I would be always be wondering what a 7 star hotel be like.

Don't miss afternoon tea! Delightful!. If you're visiting Dubai, you shouldn't miss afternoon tea at 4:00 pm in the Skyview Bar. It is a seven-course affair beginning with the UAE's world-famous stuffed dates and then moving on to a fruit tart, a carved beef filet, scones with clotted cream, pastries, etc. It is $150 USD but well worth it.
