Consider it dinner as you won't be able to eat again until the next morning. Make sure to book a month in advance of your stay and ask for a table by the window. Be prompt and you'll likely get it. Not to be missed! The view of the marina at sunset is spectacular. Also, while in Dubai, be sure not to miss a nice walk in the Marina District (not the same marina as above). It is a great way to spend a morning stroll.

Stunning!. Stunning from the outside close-up! We saw this close up during a jetski tour and it looks as pretty are you see it on TV. Unfortunately we did not go inside but I can only imagine how glamorous it must be on the inside. Got some great pictures with this in the background.
Fabulous. Great Creation. Beach is out of this world. Architecture of the Hotel is amazing. Best to go in the evening. This feature is covered under the City tour.
fantastic view. Best Architectural design and the beach was just amazingly blue.The place was so clean and beautiful.
afternoon tea. Was a wonderful experience lovely treat from my wonderful daughter. Would recommend the staff made you feel very special

Great view. Luckily it was not busy so the lines were not too long for the elevators. Nice to see that little kids get entertained. Its quite a walk from dubai mall but doable . Elevator coordinator is the most enthausiastic guy there, very pleasant The elevator is faaaast and quite an experiance. Coming up to the 124th floor gives you an absolutely stunning view over the city and the desert begind.A must do, just book your tickets online to avoid disappointments

Once in a lifetime experience. It's expensive $170US for High Tea. Worth every penny. We had 1:30pm time. Have printed reservation page to gain access to island and hotel. Must book in advance. 7 courses of exceptional food. Left absolutely stuffed with ultra high quality fair. Unlimited drinks. Nice parting gift of a small box of high end chocolates. Glass elevator ride is awesome.

Bucket Lister. Had to visit this iconic place while on first visit to Dubai. Booked in through our hotel for the evening drinks package.Dress is smart / casual so being prepared with some basic golf club attire should do the trick. Don't be shy to dress up though if you can! There is a minimum of Dh350 (about £70) per person so it looks expensive for what is about three cocktails. However the experience is superb and once you are through the security gate you feel nothing but welcomed. Who can say they have been there? We can!

Superb Steaks. Situated on the 123rd floor, The Atmosphere gives you a breath taking view of the city accompanied by some of the finest wines & cocktails. Lip Smacking Steak with choicest of sides & sauces. Amazing staff who are very friendly and warm. This a different level of dining experience.

Sail at it's Peak. Looking at this engineering feat is an amazing sight to vision at sea. From far distance it seems that the sail of a huge ship is about to unfurled it's energy to take wherever in far distant continent. It's definitely an attraction to visit and admire.

Lovely to Look At. But Way out of the price range of the normal person. Most people go to the public beach that is up the road to take photos with it. Be sure to go in the morning as the sun is in a bad spot during the afternoon (sadly I was there in the afternoon). Definitely THE photo op of Dubai....

Man made wonder!. Technology and architecture working together..amazing work and loved the speed of the lift!!! View from the 128th floor is breath taking in the evening. Could connect to WiFi here and post pictures to family n frens.Loved every moment.
Sky view bar. Beautiful hotel lots of people go there for drinks in the sky view bar for the view. It's expensive for drinks there but worth a visit after all you're in Dubai!

Gift of Rich People to Riches. Make sure to walk only on designated area for common visitor as guards don't like us in Armani Entrance. Waste of money by Arabs, instead they should have built hospitals and schools in poor countries

Amazing if you can get in!. The most ridiculously ornate hotel I should imagine in the world. You cannot arrive and get access - you have to be invited or have some reason to be there. There is a Sky Bar with a view of the Palm Resort. Everywhere is gold and colour. There is also an enormous aquarium and splendid beach to just watch!
Afternoon tea a bit pricey but worth it. Wonderful views over Dubai as the sun goes down. Ask for a window table and get there to check in early. Food very good (as much as you can eat).

Anniversay Drinks. Amazing........Went to for drinks on our last night were offered a window table but preferred to stay at the bar as the banter with the staff was great.
Amazing cocktails, the bill was a shocker but worth it.

unique building. Well, as a matter of fact I came to Dubai because I wanted to see its architecture. The tower Burj Al Arab was designed by the British architect Tom Wright, in high-tech style. The building was finished in 1999 and since then became a symbol of Dubai. It is necessary to see it, even from outside.

Stunning Views. A beautiful hotel to visit. Absolutely amazing building, with fantastic staff. Stupendous views, especially from the SkyBar when the sun going down.....gorgeous sunset with Atlantis as the backdrop.

Only if you want to see inside. We often have visitors to town and they want to see inside the Burj Al Arab. High tea is definitely the cheapest way inside but the tea itself is hardly the best in town - not even close to the top. The price is ridiculous (500 AED/person without champagne, 550 AED with it) compared to other, much better teas in town. You are paying to get inside the building, that's it. The tea service is a bit fussy and the food isn't all that good, quite stale actually. It seems to be that way every time, and we've been 6-8 times with guests. The tea has several courses so it's really more of a meal - we often go for the 1:30 pm seating and consider tea to be our lunch for the day. You will start with a plated nibble, followed by sandwiches, beef, scones, pies/tarts and then chocolates. I might have even missed a course - it's a lot of food but none of it very tasty.If you are looking for high tea, I would recommend The Palace hotel - great Arabian atmosphere, not fussy service and much better prices. (Also, in years past they have had Entertainer vouchers, haven't checked for 2015.)One cool thing that happened on another visit for tea - we asked to see a room and they escorted us and showed us around. That part was cool. The rooms are just as garish as the hotel though.
world's only seven star hotel. Its shape is awesome, you would like to watch it continuously nearby beech also is beautiful, there is nothing to dislike.

Afternoon tea. Food lovely, and staff very attentive but didn't think the restaurant was very plush especially for a 7 star hotel,think it s a shame also that you can't book a window seat as this would make the experience better

well designed. took pictures of the berj al arab cant wait to frame it, it was one of the best building that we saw from nearly every angle of palm Dubai. didn't get a chance to enter but view from out side is un miscible :)
Very Classy. Recommend the Afternoon Tea, it was fantastic, it's a Must Do! A time to remember, view is wonderful, staff attentive, Tea yummy, and bubbly plentiful.

A must when in Dubai!. Me and my partner booked for the afternoon tea at The Burj while on our 2 weeks vacation. It cost £95 each, which is maybe a little steep in price, but I think it's definitely worth it! We went to The Burj for about 3.30 for our afternoon tea starting at 4. We walked into the front entrance and wow it's absolutely stunning! There is a water fountain in the lobby which was all lit up and changed colour it looked fab! So pretty. We headed up the stairs towards the lifts which take you right up to the 27th floor. The hotel decor is out of this world! Absolutely gorgeous. We went up in the lift to the Skyview bar. You can see out the lift over Dubai it was wonderful. We were seated at our table right by the window, in a perfect spot, where you could see for miles around Dubai. It's easily the best view I've ever seen! Mesmerising! You get a free glass of champagne while there which is nice. We were given sandwiches, a mini carvery, cakes/scones and several little dishes which were lovely, the food was tasty and everything was set out so well.We spent most of the afternoon there and moved to the bar in the evening. We watched the sun setting and it turn dark outside. Dubai looks amazing all lit up at night! Especially from that high up. Stunning!The drinks we got from the bar were a little pricey, but it's what you would expect from such an extravagant hotel. I would highly recommend this experience to anyone thinking of going. I loved it from start to finish!
Went to high TEA Most enjoyable exerience. Loved the food, the service, the view and now we have braggin" rights having been in the only 7 star hotel in world and the most expensive.

What a Sight!!!. We booked the high tea package at the Burj through our tour coordinator. The experience was an absolute bliss. The package started with a glass of wine and some finger sandwiches. Then came the cocktail/mocktail and a selection of bread with various spreads and finally cam the coffee/tea and some pastries. When they came to know that we were celebrating our anniversary, they even provided us with a small pastry with a "Happy Anniversary" message on it.

If you have travelled to Dubai It is a must see and do. These days you can book two levels either flors 128 or you can go for the full package and get to the 128th floor and to the 148th. I decided to go the whole way and book the full experience ie the At the Top experience and I have to say I am glad I did.Yes it is not cheap at AED 500 but balance that agains will I ever be back or will I do it again it is one of lifes experinces. Pre book is a must you can book before you go and collect tickets from the machines in the Lower ground floor of the Dubai Mall.Yes you do get the odd queue however if you go the whole way ie the 14th floor you are taken into a small room to the side where you get offered an Arabic coffe and a selection of small arabic food dates etc.Once you are all together you are escorted by a guide through security and inot an elevator they have two speeds one does 120 floors in 60 seconds yes that is a secon a floor the other lift is slightly slower at 1min 30. this takes you to floor 128 and then you are transferred to another lift to take you to the 148th floor. This is something special as the lift arrives you are greeted and offered light refreshements and some canapes. The view from 148 floors up is just amazing. You can even go on an outside terrace and feel the wind truly great experience and one that I will never forget.As I have said if you are prepared to go the distance to Dubai then this is a must see and doo my suggestion is go around sunset or after 1800 as the Fountains can then be seen from above as well as on the ground level and the fountains are woth the view.Okay regarding the Gift shop several people have said it is expensive but once again you need to balance this up I honestly felt that you could get a good range of gifts from fairly cheap to yes Expensive but it does cater for most budgets.Overall I am glad I did it and I hope you will be too if you do it.

Dr No's Palace. Listen this place is amazing and very expensive, but it is just like where you would imagine Dr No from James Bond films would be living. Totally over the top and theatrical and irrelevant in todays society. I loved the place :)

Unforgettable experience...loved the stay!!. Burj Al Arab is truly 7 star... its breathtaking to see this structure.. We stayed there last year in September for our 7th wedding anniversary...yes :) the7th anniversary in a 7 star hotel and what better choice than burj al arab... The stay was very warm and welcoming as we had people escort us to the lobby and to our suite as we reached the hotel. We had a personal butler to attend to us when we needed. Our room was just amazing, facing the sea and the view was out of this world. We were welcomed with fresh juices and fruits baskets, not to forget the yummy chocolates! The only thing i was disappointed was when i took my son to the kids club, there was this marketing lady who was a bit rude and asked us to come back as they were doing photoshoots at the kids club for the hotels website. She dint even bother to let us know how long would it take and we kept waiting outside till they finished the shoot. Finally another lady working in the kids club came and called us in so that our son could play... that was a downside i felt during our stay there. A bit unprofessional from the marketing staff.Overall, the stay was lovely.. the room was amazing, the food is just delicious and fresh. Would recommend their arabic restaurant and the sky view bar.. will definitely go back. For me it was personally the best anniversary!
Wauwww. We booked a high tea at the hotel. It is quite expensive for what you get. It is fine but you pay really for the experience to see the hotel and not for the food.

Would love to have gone in.. We were going on an afternoon excursion from our cruise ship, which visited the Burj Al Khalifa then on to the Burj Al Arab for light refreshment, then we found out the cost, nearly £200.00 per person, Forget it!!

amazing place ! dazzling fountains ! worth a watch. great place , the fountains in the lobby are worth a watch it give u enough relaxation , u must have patience to watch the show , though everything here is very unaffordable ! however the view inside and outside is amazing and worth ! thats why its one of the most expensive hotels in the world

Deserves Every One of Its Seven Stars!. My husband and I visited the Burj Al Arab for the Culinary Flight Lunch on the last day of our honeymoon in Dubai. We certainly ended with a bang! From the moment you pull up to the front door, you are enveloped in luxury. Exquisite views, rich décor and exceptional service are just a few of the delights the Burj Al Arab has to offer. Simply sitting in the lobby watching the fountains at the top of the escalators was a treat in and of itself. Everywhere you look, you are enticed by bright colors, gold accents (might I add... Rolex clocks!) and lux textiles. The staff's only wish is to make your experience unforgettable... and that's exactly what they did. I highly recommend the Culinary Flight experience if you are not staying in the hotel. It was a great way to sample the various restaurants while indulging in the romantic atmosphere and amazing views. Al Muntaha restaurant is not to be missed! The views of the gulf, Palm Jumeirah and World Islands are exceptional. The food at each restaurant was excellent. There is simply no comparison to this opulent and sensational hotel experience.
Great experience. I visit the Sky, which was an great experience - I can recommend this to anyone, who is not scared of highs :)

Oppulence to the max. i would like to commend our buttler--- Richard Tumulak from the Philippines for a great job! He gave us very good service and toured us to areas in the Burj Al Arab which were private

I wish i could rate higher than 5. Everything about the Burj Al Arab represents elegance. From the minute you arrive the surroundings and decor transport you to a world of luxury. We went for drinks at the sky view bar as it was my sisters birthday. They brought out a cake and roses for her which was a nice touch. I have to say they have the best cosmopoliton cocktail I have ever had. If you try this bar be sure to order a 'Mr big' you will not be disappointed. The staff were so friendly and very attentive. They upgraded our table to the best view in the house which boasted stunning views of the dubai skyline and in particular the Burj Khalifa. I have visited the Burj Al Arab twice and both times have been amazing. Would definitely visit again and reccommend to anyone visiting Dubai.

King of the Sea. That a moment out of your busy schedule to view one of the area icons and you will be treated to a international wonder. This building set the pace of the recent boom in DUBAI and as a landmark this building stands for the future. Great location to hung out and you can find a good view of the beach.

Nice structure . Though a beautiful structure from outside, its still just a hotel with luxury. We took an evening tea there as part of our 1st yr anniversary. Beautiful interior and u know small itsy bitsy details like the crockery and the chocolates and all. But everything has a cost you see :)
the most amazing building. it is a stand out landmark, unbelievable design, a must see. It is on the hop on hop off route. The bus stops for people to get photos and you can hop off for a closer look

Amazing High Tea Experience!!. I had high tea with my family at the Burj Al Arab in Jan 2015. The place is obviously very high class and you are treated like royalty. It was a simple and smooth process to get from the boom gate all the way through to the entrance of the Skyview Bar (must be over 21 to have high tea in the Skyview Bar due to the legal drinking age). The views are amazing over the sea and some of the city (not 360 degree views).You are served limitless cups of tea, coffee, hot chocolate etc as you wish and you receive a complimentary glass of champagne on arrival. You are then served a selection of various courses of food as the day goes on (all the food is incredible!). You can also ask for as much finger foods, deserts, sandwiches etc as you wish...we certainly did!A great touch was receiving a box of chocolates per person when you are finished. The service is incredible and you also get as much time as you wish to walk around in the hotel and view the various shops and take pictures before leaving.A small tip would be to request a window seat as the views are lovely! Also note that the dress code is smart. Although it may seem silly to wear long trousers, smart shoes, and a button up shirt when Dubai is a hot place...they pump the air-conditioning so you will be very comfortable, ladies wearing dresses may even want to bring a light top as you may get a bit cold.

Just too much .... Dont know about the burg ....its a bit over the top in style and self importance . The staff are educated and competent , the food ok but its just a total rip off for the price . Its somewhere you just pay so you can say you have been there. Thats what they are playing on . Its very opulent , glittery and Arab in taste , not very refined and quite gaudy .You can get a more satisfying look from the outside , where the architectural lines can be admiredThe Jumerah beach hotel has better food and you feel human being there at least.

Just unadulterated luxury with first class service!. Had afternoon tea in the Sahn Eddar lounge with my wife and 3 daughters. We were treated like Royalty. Seven courses of sumptuous dining. Commenced with sparkling date juice followed by a mixed berry tartlet. Next was a range of finger sandwiches and the chefs charcuterie - mashed potato and fillet steak! A strawberry sorbet followed to cleanse the pallet before tucking into fruit and plain scones, a range of preserves and clotted cream! Finished off with cookies and French pastries. All accompanied with unlimited tea and coffee. Cappucinos were topped with 24 carat gold flakes! The kids received a teddy bear each and we were handed a box of chocolates each on departure. We were entertained by a solo harpist followed by a classical quartet. The whole meal took almost 3 hours! We just did not want to leave.It was a fit and terrific end to our lovely cruise to Dubai, the Emirates and Oman! For here we went to the airport for our flight home with very heavy hearts!
For the view.... Modern harmonious, special, very good attention of the waiters in the bar...the view is amazing...now 7 stars !! I don't know...what that means...

Yes I had High Tea at the Burj - in Fact I had 2 Cups of Coffee.. The dress code required proper shoes and a shirt with long sleeves. We caught the lift up, sat in a very nice lounge. A young lady bought some nice cakes on a 2 tiered cake stand and poured out the coffee for the group. So we had Coffee and a couple of cakes and a good look out of the window. After a good quarter of an hour she reappeared and offered more coffee. (but no more cakes) We then waited about another 20 minutes and were escorted out the front door.So you see, I have had High Tea at the Burj Al- Arab. It cost me about 150 Australian dollars. Yes the hotel was very glamorous. I then went back to my hotel and had something to eat. So there you go.Brian, from Perth W. Australia.
Terrific. This place is just on the sea shore, and amazing structure, its a must visit place in Dubai. it has a lunch and dinnner pre booked, be ready to shell out a lot, its quite expensive !!
Superb!. This incredible hotel offers the best anyone can want. It's choice of restaurants and cuisines are second to none. The service is impeccable, as one would expect.

A luxurious experience. As a birthday treat, I booked afternoon tea at the BAA on our last day in Dubai, to both experience the hotel and its ambience and celebrate the occasion in style.You cannot get past the security post without a reservation and this does prevent hordes of tourists descending upon the place to gawk at the lobby and its fountain displays. Whilst general hotel visits have been stopped, it was noticeable that the occasional Chinese tourist bus arrived exactly for this purpose.This iconic building is impressive from the outside and the lobby and first floor are sumptuously decorated, containing fountain features and the inevitable aquarium. The first floor fountain is quite mesmeric and the display contains one or two surprises with water jets being propelled up to 42 metres in height. Everything smacks of quality, extravagance and luxury.Afternoon tea is served in the Skyview bar on the 37th floor which has great views over Palm Jumeirah and the unfinished World Islands. We booked tea for 4.30 pm and this meant we were able to enjoy great views of the sunset over the Palm.The tea was very good and you certainly won't leave feeling hungry due to the richness of the food and the quantity served. Events started with a glass of champagne and were followed by a fruit shortbread course, the chef's course of beef with mashed potatoes and then the finger sandwiches, scones, patisserie and finally a sorbet. There is an extensive menu of teas from around the world and a wide range of coffees. The service is impeccable without being stuffy and a pianist plays some relaxing music at one end of the bar. My wife was presented with a red rose and a small birthday cake with candle which was a nice touch.Of course this doesn't come cheap at AED 620 per person and it is debatable whether this is really good value for money. But the opportunity to experience the Burj Al Arab first hand should not be missed in my humble opinion.
certainly a wonder. Awesome structure. Couldn't believe my eyes. Forget the camera, i was not able see the whole tower with naked eyes.

Fascinating heights. Fascinating heights of the hotel tower and the ambience there, really gives you modren luxury experience of Arabs.the beach hotel on Jumera beach, Dubai .. You have to visit and witness it as it is beyond expression of words.

Tick the box. There is much hyperbole in Dubai and the Burj Al Arab (along with the Burj Khalifa and Atlantis Hotel) is right up there at the top of the list.We took the cheap option of taking a drink in the Skyview Bar and left after half an hour as the service was pushy and, at night, there's not a lot to see (aprt from other tourists).The hotel lobby is a matter of taste (it wasn't ours) and the much heralded 'only seven star hotel in the world' claim surely a(nother) piece of Dubai marketing hype.Tick the box (as we did) but don't cry if you don't! Viator Coloniae
tea. beautiful hotel, fantastic interior and fountains. Well worth it just to look around the hotel. Food not amazing, but very good.

Wow just unbelievable luxury. We booked for afternoon tea and although a ridiculous price was worth it to see inside this 7* hotel.
You cant get in unless you have a booking
If I win the lottery would love to stay here

Lunch and a chance to see the property. I booked a business lunch at Burj Al Arab so that we could see the property. Clearly, by not allowing guests to the property unless a reservation is made, the plan is to milk it. The property is impressive to be sure. Remarkable really. The interior finishing is right over the top. The restaurant provides for a huge vista and that didn't disappoint. The meal was fine and very very expensive. But, overall, worth the ticket I suppose.

nov 2010. Had brunch in this world class hotel. staff were welcoming. Food was adorably served and it was nice. The view is the one you go for. Oh so blue Mediterranean sea. The hotel itself is the beauty.

Not Inside. As we couldn't get inside because we didn't have a reservation, it was quite dissapointing that you can go only to the main entrance gate, where you can't see much even of a hotel exterior. At night it's enlighted but unfortunately not in exciting way. Nicer view of a hotel is from the nearby beaches.

The Sail Billows On...... We didnt go inside (its the second time we planned but couldnt make it)But its a sight to see - During the day time & at nightWe saw it this time during a trip to the Jumeirah beach for a few hours of swimming & dipping

MUST SEE in Dubai. In order to get into the iconic "Sail building", you absolutely ned to book a table at the underground restaurant (with hundreds of fish in a gigantic aquarium... and a shark) or the top restaurant overlooking the Palm & the islands of the World... or indulge a massage in the wonderful Talise Spa. When was the last time you enjoyed a sauna session while enjoying the view of the Dubai shore through a large window... ? !!! The Spa staff is highly trained in great massage protocols & the fine Art of making you feel at your best. One advice, do not just get stuck at the security checkpoint: book a table &/or a massage and create a lifelong memory... it is that GOOD !!!

definitely must see. it is still the most unique and expensive hotel i have seen, such an original designit is maybe a little too much inside but it is nevertheless amazing, such a luxurious atmosphere inside, makes you feel very differentmaybe worth taking a tour, otherwise must book dinner or drinks which are OMG expensive there. Security to enter the hotel does not allow anyone without confirmation papers

Tea for two. As the only way to get inside the Burj al Arab is to have a reservation we decided to try afternoon tea. From the moment we arrived the service was perfect. After a hairaising ride in the glass fronted elevator we were led to our table overlooking the city and Burj Khalifa. The drinks selection was extensive and included a range of soft drinks as well as teas and coffee. There were several small courses, dates to start, followed by a berry pastry, some beef and mashed potato, sandwiches, scones, more pastries and creme brûlée, then a sorbet to finish. We saw a lovely sunset and then just as we were leaving we each received a small box of chocolates. A wonderful afternoon and a must if visiting Dubai.

Tea at the Skyview Bar. Having tea at the Skyview bar is the best way to see the exclusive Burj al Arab. The hotel is truly "over the top" and is the quintessential Dubai experience. The tea itself is quite good. Multiple courses with as much tea/coffee as you'd like. Arrive early to get a seat by the window. We were lucky to have what I feel was the best seat, in the corner with views up and down the coast and back towards Downtown Dubai.
A must when visiting Dubai. We did this as part of a combined trip. Chauffeur driven from the hotel, lovely food, service and surroundings. Definitely a hi lite of the visit.
burj al arab. The royal 5 star hotel which is built near the cost of open sea where not all can afford this hotel the most exp thing of this hotel is its shape and the taxis are rools roys

One of a kind experience!. We went to the Burj Al Arab Hotel for afternoon tea on Jan 4th 2015 and everything about this place was magic! I really enjoyed every second there, the service, the food and the view. Luxury at its best and with no doubt one of a kind experience. Will be back to stay there next time.
afternoon tea. overpriced but glad I went for the experience of visiting the hotel, wouldn't do it again, felt it wasn't very personal

Everyone's dream to stay in Burz Al Arab. One of the Pearl of Dubai...even after a decade it is Symbol to be use to show Dubai...Only Guest nd their friend's are allowed to Enter into the Hotel...Strangers are not allowed...One of our friend stayed there in the suites which consist of Living Room and Bedroom was up on the stairs...one of the best thing about this Hotel isThey keep Tea and Dates in the Lobby especially for the Hotel Gust nd their visitors...Beleive me this is one of the the the best Hotel of not only Dubai but the world...Must visit for the people who can afford it...

If I could give it 10 stars I would!. Everything about the Burj Al Arab represents elegance. From the minute you arrive the surroundings and decor transport you to a world of luxury. We went for drinks at the sky view bar as it was my sisters birthday. They brought out a cake and roses for her which was a nice touch. I have to say they have the best cosmopoliton cocktail I have ever had. If you try this bar be sure to order a 'Mr big' you will not be disappointed. The staff were so friendly and very attentive. They upgraded our table to the best view in the house which boasted stunning views of the dubai skyline and in particular the Burj Khalifa. I have visited the Burj Al Arab twice and both times have been amazing. Would definitely visit again and reccommend to anyone visiting Dubai.

A must stay. I have stayed here for two days once before. Ultra expensive and over the top on everything.You must stay here at least once as words can't describe the experience, all positive. The price will set you back, but again, a must do to experience the luxury at a price.

Junsui Restaurant at Burj Al Arab. Underwhelmed, for lack of a better word, was a good way to describe how I felt as I entered Burj Al Arab. I guess, because of all the media hype and the advertising campaign promoting it as the first 7-star hotel in the world, my expectation was extremely elevated. There was nothing really special about this hotel. The lobby was conventional. The staff were cold and distant. Junsui is a buffet style restaurant. The food selection was limited. The food quality was sub-par. I had to request a dinner roll/bread for there was none in the selection. You would have taught that for $153.00 per person, not including drinks, they would have included a good selection of fresh breads. Beverages (tea, sodas, etc). start at $20.00 per serving. It was nice to see what the buzz was all about.
7 Star Hotel. Must see to believe. Book Asian breakfast buffet at $90 per person. Cheapest way to see the inside of the hotel.

Asian afternoon tea. Interesting landmark and architecture. Instead of taking the usual high tea of sandwiches and cakes, we chose to have Asian afternoon tea in the Junsui restaurant, where we ate a 7 course mini meal from different parts of Asia. Excellent service and experience but expensive.

High tea. Was fantastic food and service due to mix up with travel agent we were booked in the down stairs restaurant, but the manager kindly took us up to the sky view bar so we could see the view after our high tea experience.

Have to visit this place once. Couldn't afford to stay at this place but wanted to see. You cannot just go in unless you have a reservation to one of the restaurants or bar or you're with a tour group. I went in as I made a reservation at the bar. Hotel is magnificent but for some people it may be bit over the top. I liked and it was just wow.
Burj Al Arab. The only 7 star hotel in the world. When we reached the place we were impressed by the beauty of the hotel. highly recommend going early to register for the tour of the hotel.
afternoon tea. Have been twice before and found it to be excellent even though £70pp in the Sky view restaurant, but now gone up 48% and £150pp,

Must see but disappointing food. It was an amazing place to see, the world's only five star hotel but the high tea was disappointing. The service was excellent but the quality of the food was ordinary

Waste of money. Total waste of money the food was average main courses not even hot the aquarium was nice to look at but that was about it....!!! It was £650 for 2 of us 3 courses one glass of bubbly and 1 bottle of wine...!!! I have eaten at a Gordon Ramsay eaterie in London for half the money and to top it off we were hassled for a tip after laying out that sort of money for a plate of tosh...!!!

An excellent experience. Went for afternoon tea and what a wonderful experience. The service was first class and the selection of food was great. The view was fantastic an experience that should not be missed.

Amazing Place in DUBAI. Burj Al arab is aseven star hotel unlike Burf khalifa. There entry is allowed to people who stay there only. Rest you can click great pictures at the jumeriah beach with the great Burj al arab. If you visiting Dubai this is a great place to visit.

Wow! what a beauty. It's not just given a seven star restaurant/Hotel. My jaw dropped when I entered into that place. Everything is made of gold, I mean real gold. Gorgeous place, I did not stay there, but had a tour, also ate at the restaurant, pretty expensive but must see.

Sky Tea at Skyview Bar. First of all it is expensive. Feels like it costs your life time of tea supply. But I love it. The two and half hour of pleasure time with my family in Dubai's iconic landmark is priceless , not mention the delicious 7 course tea with champagne, great services, amazing architect, and the breath taking views. Through our hotel we booked 4:30pm table for the beautiful sun set -- did not see all the way because of cloud though. If you are thinking about it, go for it.
High Tea Oppulance. A must do while in Dubai! The multi course tea will fill you up, so don't eat beforehand! Instagram @Lombardonyc
Dinner. Okay, so firstly you need deep pockets but the view and buffet food is amazing - take some photos and treasure the experience! Truly an amazing experience!
afternoon tea. well worth going for afternoon tea just to get a look around,impressive views and hotel is so smart,think the price for tea was around the 25 pound mark

Rip Off. We paid 500d each for this trip. It takes you a long way up the Burj but nowhere near the top. As we were paying the top rate we had some refreshments provided but it was just far too sweet stuff. The staff at the point of sale were less than clear about what we were getting for our money. Stick to taking photos of this magnificent tower from the outside. It's a gross waste of money.
Up in the clouds. You shouldn't miss it! It is breathtaking! Take some warm clothes with you. It's so high that the temperature is pretty low up there.

Good shopping place. Good shopping place, with a mix of all items. Little difficult to navigate this place. Good shopping place, with a mix of all items. Little difficult to navigate this place. Good shopping place, with a mix of all items. Little difficult to navigate this place.

What a view!. It has an extremely awe inspiring view, which is unbelievable especially around the sunset, as you see Dubai change it's colours.The digital telescopes, that offer 4 modes of viewing, are brilliant and should be seen. If you go from the Dubai Mall, it's a very long walk. The check-in and check-out also takes a lot of time.Plan the duration at the viewing area for a maximum of 20 minutes because it gets boring after that.The photos they take there have very obvious photoshop effects and aren't worth the price they ask for.

Impressive. The building from outside does not look overly impressive with its sail like shape and protruding roof level restaurant and helideck. However come night time, it explodes into a light show on its outer skin that is visible from all around.Now the interior is a whole different matter. It is as impressive as it is opulent and glitzy. From dancing fountains to luxurious suites with personal valet service and an underwater restaurant. If you can afford its 7* prices, then you can truly experience this site with a stay in the hotel and maybe arrival by helicopter would be even better!

High tea. Book ahead and dont forget to take your booking number with you when you go. Two hours, champagne, and a seven course high tea is a luxury that you really dont want to miss. Staff and service are brilliant and the Baj Al Arab is just breathe takingly beautiful. If you havent already ... add it to your bucket list.

Utter luxury. Brilliant.If there is luxury it is here, no all can afford to stay in this place. A visit is what one should always plan to get in the schedule.there are couple of restaurants in the hotel which one can visit and take the complete tour of the hotel. Prefer to book your table in the sky deck from where one can see the complete palm while having your meal.Again the best time to visit the place is early evening and spend the evening out there.

Perhaps over rated. As this is an iconic landmark in Dubai we really wanted to visit and did so last week. Four of us went to the high tea in the Sky Lounge. The hotel is immaculate inside and out but we thought rather dated. The views from the lounge were outstanding, the high tea lovely, but no more spectacular than you would get anywhere else. I would probably still recommend going as a once in a lifetime treat,.....but be prepared to pay...........very expensive!

Spectacular experience. We went for breakfast at the Sahn Eddar lobby lounge. We had vegetarian food and the food per se was bland and underwhelming. The coffee was excellent though but you do not go to the Burj Al Arab for the food. The hotel architecture is spell-binding and has abundant photo-stops in and outside the hotel . You also get free wifi with speeds upto 3 mBps. The staff is also very warm and helpful and you will not get a more luxurious experience anywhere else in the world.

Still worth a visit. The building itself is stunning, but exploring it from the inside really adds to the experience. For drinks or dinner and you get a good feel for the place. Some areas are a bit bling - bling, but the big aquariums are amazing.
Parents stayed. My mum and dad stayed in one of there best suites with there own private butler and staircase ... Very expensive but if you have the money go !!

REFUSED ENTRY - go to the Jumeirah. Tried to visit the Burj Al-Arab today and were turned back at the gate by a very unfriendly and unwilling to explain why security guard. We were asked if we had a reservation - no reservation, no entry. There was no signage to this effect, nor was the guard willing to answer questions regarding why we could not go in for a meal or a drink. VERY disappointed. Visiting this iconic location was on the top of my must-see must-do list for Dubai. We checked the website only to find that the link to book a table was not working either. Poor, very poor! Adding insult to injury (poor sore feet), we'd just spent almost an hour walking there, and could have used a cold drink and some hospitality. Suffice to say we found it next door at the Jumeirah. Excellent service and hospitality.

Amazing building. The tennis court and the helipad are the main and unimaginable architecture of Al- Arab . Landing of helicopter on top of building is worth watching. The view of beach and sea while having tea is gives ahhhhh...... Feeling .

Cocktails in Sky Bar at Burj Al Arab. It seems as if the only way to see the amazing architecture of this hotel is to have a reservation for drinks or food. We went for cocktails. The cocktails are tasty, but expensive and there is a minimum spend equivalent to £70 per person. Once you haveReached the minimum spend, the staff are very keen to move you along. We felt processed. However, the building is beautiful so very pleased that we went to see it. But if you're not interested in architecture, suggest you don't go.

Still the Dubai symbol. Although the Burj Khalifa is newer and of course taller, the Burj remains the Dubai symbol in my opinion. Standing defiantly to the Arabian Gulf this hotel is a mystical symbol of Dubai. Because it's little bit dislocated and by the waterfront, and everything around is vast with no other high buildings, you cannot observe it's height (it doesn't seem that imposing). Just have in mind it's around 320 m tall, only some 15 meters below the Eiffel tower.As a non resident you can access only up to the control point (beside the Wild Wadi aqua park entrance). From there you can see it's back (most frequent photo). Another view (the better one) is from the Wild Wadi if you enter it. Another good view is from the garden bar at Jumeirah beach hotel, where you can enter freely, which is a deluxe 5 star hotel, so it's interesting to enter anyway. Those are the best free options to see the Burj from close.Going on the Jumeirah beach, you'll have a great view of it while sunbathing or swimming, but it is more far, so the pics wont be clear because of the heat haze. To see the front side you need to go the Palm (Atlantis hotel), but this is also far, or to take the Yellow Boats tour which passes in front of it.On the other hand, to enter it is very expensive. The cheapest overnight starts from 3.000 EUR. The "cheaper" option is to make a reservation in one of their restaurants. The prices are also very high starting from around 100 EUR pp.You can choose from the afternoon tea to Arab, far East, Mediterranean....cuisine.We visited the Junsui far eastern restaurant, and I think it's better value you get than the most popular Afternoon tea. About this experince in the Junsui review.The Burj inside is even more glorious than from outside. It smells expensive and luxurious. It has the biggest atrium in the world, which even looks smaller due to the big floor heights (one floor equals two normal floors). Everything is shiny, goldy, with high end shops, aquariums, marbles, mosaics,...As a guest you can visit the ground floor, mezzanine and first floor.All in all, this is a once in a lifetime experience, overpriced in every way, but the only way to get inside the only 7 star hotel in the world, the most luxurious one where film and sports stars stay, along with world jet set. The management knows it and counts on that fact, so it's up to you to decide yes or no.

HI------GH TEA. Just to say that we did it. Had the High Tea at the Burj. It was a very well organised and pleasant afternoon that allowed us to have a great view over the Palm and back over Dubai. Most people took advantage of the views and there were plenty of opportunities for some photo's. Food good, but not great.
Surrounded by nice beaches. Mystic athmosphere around the Dubai s symbol Burj Al Arab, surrounded by nice white sand beaches and warm sea.... Is a relaxing view for your holiday

what a wander. Seeing this hotel from the beach is incredible.
To bead you have to pay a lot to be able to get inside this hotel.

High tea at the Burj. We had a high tea up in the pod of the Burj Al Arab. The service was fantastic, the view absolutely terrific and the food and drinks were scrumptious! There were about 4-5 courses that we had during lunch time (we stayed up there a few hours). We were so full by the time we left! There was unlimited tea and coffee (and a huge range to choose from both hot and cold). We had such a fun time, highly recommended to get a taste of the Burj. The foyer area was also amazing, lots of different fountains and an aquarium. It all looked like something out of a sci fi movie!
Checked it from outside. Unfortunately, visited Burj Al Arab just from outside. The hotel looks very big and unique. I wish I had a chance to check out the hotel completely. Perhaps next time.

Amazing views. Afternoon tea was fully booked so we booked to have a table at the Skybar, which has a minimum spend. However it was a great experience and worth the money. They really don't spare any expense in the christmas decorations - beautiful! I loved the elevator ride up to the Skybar and the staff were very informative and helpful. The only disadvantage is that you could only go to the part of the hotel where you had your booking, so we couldn't go and see the fish tank at the bottom of the hotel, but totally understandable. It's definitely a must when visiting Dubai.
family time. we were there on the 27th dec 2014 with my cousins familythe high tea was one of its kind...the service was great and te hotel is a must go in dubai

Afternoon tea on Christmas Eve. The Burj al Arab is justifiably one of the Top Ten things to do in Dubai and we opted for the afternoon tea which was delicious. The hotel itself is pretty amazing , the entrance hall was decorated with a cascade of tin soldiers ,Christmas Trees and polar bears which the children loved , and indeed the adults.The view from the Sky View Bar was amazing and the food accompanied by champagne was a real treat. The ambience was perfect and when we left the lift on the mezzanine level to go back to our hotel we were in a Christmas Tree forest!A perfect way to start our Christmas celebrations.
Wow. Well not sure what I was was expecting but this was sheer opulence. Very expensive and not something we would repeat but certainly an experience!

Beautiful Hotel, Great Meal. Billed as the world's 7 star hotel, it is a bit gaudy on the inside but it is iconic. You can't miss a picture of yourself with it from the beach. Dinner at Al Mahara was a treat. Delicious tasting menu. I'd stay elsewhere but dine here so you can see it for yourself.
Wow. Magnificent from a distance but absolutely stunning close-up!!excellent restaurants but pricy.......

one time experience. I guess you are stuck. If you are in dubai, you have to see world only seven start hotel. All reservations should be made prior to artival in the city. Food is expensive, staff is nice. If it is your birtday, they will treat u with a piece of cake

Don't miss the high tea!. No better excuse to experience the burj al Arab than a reservation for high tea! Great atmosphere and treats.. Experience the glamour of this incredible hotel without breaking the bank.
you will see only the outside. just in case you don't know you CAN not go inside unless you are having a confirmed prior booking. but you can still take a picture beside it :D which is nice.
Sunbathing near the 7 star hotel. Nice sunbathing in January near the world famous hotel. Or if you own a helicopter you can park it upstairs and have a coffee at the skyward.

fascinating place ever. Well, right now i am not finding the right words to describe my feelings i felt the time i been there! It's just awesome experience starts when you just step out the car. they treat you like a celebrity there! when you just enter the Burjik ( we gave it a russian nick name:)), they give you awesome dates that you don't really find later in supermarkets! I was also amazed by their hospitality. There is a fountain in the center of the burj which is fascinating too. the way the water flows from fountain gives you an impression of the birds and fish. I visited there in 2010 and I dunno what it is look like now, because Dubai people keep changing everything quite often making them better and better. In short, this is a must visit place too, so I recommend it highly and won't describe ore as you have find it out yourself. Enjoy!

Its really an experience of how things should be done.. The entrance to the Burj is magical with the coloured fountains. To have tea in the foyer looking up and experiencing the aroma of oud, coffee, tea etc is a must do to really experience the magic of the hotel - book in advance though as its not a drop in place!!

Gorgeous dinner but very expensive. Gorgeous setting and it is amazing to be eating in the burj. We were given a glass of champagne on arrival to then find out it was 10 yr old vintage for £100 a glass (we had already started to drink it!!). We had the oysters to start and the salmon rillettes, both were lovely, followed by the 1kg wagyu beef to share. This is brought to the table and carved in front of you, cooked a perfect rare. As we were celebrating our anniversary a red rose and a chocolate cake was brought out as a gift. This was a lovely touch and they even put it into a box for us to take home as we were so full from dinner. Overall a wonderful experience but do expect it to be very expensive!!
Amazing Structure. Inside out Luxury observed, so colorful inside, classy lobby and amazing fish tank at lobby and fabulous restaurants.

Gilded. We were privileged to be toured into the Royal Suite. The elevator was shimmering. As expected, everything is made of gold, even the shower is made of golden tiles. They provide Hermes bath ensemble. Truly a room made for a royalty, worth AED70,000 per night, who can really afford.At the ground level was the restaurant with an aquarium background. An exciting and cool place to dine and hide.Service is at its best. Check in is done in your own room.

Beautiful hotel. We ate at the Friday buffet and so we able to enter the hotel which is beautiful and well worth a visit. Opulence is the key word for this hotel. You need to show evidence at the main gate that you have a reservation if you plan on arriving by taxi.

TOP OF THE LINE. this place is always top of the line. Amazing. superb. service is top notch. food is delicious. place is stunning. you have to go and try the high tea. the view is exquisite. the courses are to die for. everything is out of this world

The Original Icon of Dubai. The Burj Al Arab is the original iconic building in Dubai. Although, the Burj Khalifa is now considered "the iconic" symbol of Dubai, the Burj Al Arab is in a class all its own. There is a charge for entering the facility but well worth the admission. There are several restaurants in Burj Al Arab which require reservations. But for a special occasion, you will not go wrong in booking dinner at one of the restaurants. Wonderful view of Arabian Gulf can be seen from the top level of the Burj Al Arab. It is truly a unique experience in Dubai.
TOP HOTEL !. Expensive but a MUST VIEW in Dubai !!!! I did the afternoon tea at Skyview Bar and the lunch at Al Mahara... Two very nice experience !!!! FANTASTIC !!!!

al mahara restaurant. one of the best and most luxurious restaurants but also one of the most expensive ones,burj el arab from inside reminded me with vegas hotels and restaurants with its golden luxurious architecture and furnishing

Interesting sight. The building in the shape of a yacht stands out from miles away the beach beside it is fine sand and the sea is warm what more could anyone ask. A beautiful memory especially as the sun sets behind the building.

A Life time Experience. We celebrated our Son's Birthday at SAHN EDDAR ( High Tea) in June This is a life time experience to visit this place as you feel you are on top of the worldA truly great place to celebrate family occasions

Fireworks on NYE. We have been walking to the beach to see the fireworks from the Burj Al Arab on NYE for years. It is nicely crowded with a great atmosphere of family, friends and fun. The fireworks are fantastic! From that location you can also see the fireworks from the Burj Khalifa and Atlantis. But the Burj Al Arab is by far the longest and the most spectacular. We are never disappointed.

Wow. If you see this hotel that looks like a "Sail"! We had our hotel - JW Marriott make reservations for us for the evening. I would recommend as soon as you get to Dubai to make reservation there for drinks. Beautiful view. The drinks are pricey, but worth it because of the view.
wondeful hotel. never seen like before round the world, underwater restaurant, the room views, location in front of jumeriah
grandiose. we had diner at the JUMEIRA BEACH .VIS A VIS from the BURJ AL ARAB. just terrific they had a beautful firework for new year.you have to see that one
Burj Al Arab. It's surreal! You're standing on a white sand beach with aqua water and there's this amazing building behind you! A MUST-SEE in Dubai.
didn't go for a tea. but just came to see it from the beach aside. it's cool to see it and take the picture since it's different from other hotels in the world..

Count down 2015. Hey guys! There is a public beach at Jumeirah which you can do countdown and camping at one time! Is awesome and chilling! We did countdown at the beach but remember to drive your 4 x 4 because lots of cars were stuck there which created not fun atmosphere. And you can enjoy both Atlantis fireworks and Burj Al Arab, too!

Birthday at the Burj. From the moment we drove over the bridge and took the view of this incredible hotel our experience just got better and better. The check in if thats what you call it was a pleasure and we were made to feel like royalty from the moment we arrived. The butler service on each floor is a tremendous idea. We were unsure about taking the children who are 6 and 11, however even this was exceptional and the highlight was a knock at the suite door and a mini train arrived with a pick and mix of sweets for the children. The suite itself was the best i have stayed in at any hotel around the world. We can't wait for an excuse to go again.
7 *?. Fabulous but red, yellow and blue carpet gave it a dated image Cocktails were delicious but expensive
Best Hotel In The World.. Been several times for dining and drinks but never stayed. They offer a Music & Bites evening and it's the perfect way to enjoy the Burj Al Arab if you can't stay.

Asian afternoon tea in an iconic hotel. The afternoon tea was a seven course tasting menu of food from five Asian countries and was exquisitely prepared, presented and served. A memorable meal in an iconic hotel.
Just outside. Sorry You need a invitation to visit the area or inside of the hotel.You have to get this in advance.

Birthday Celebrations. Love the service, the atmosphere, the food. We went in the evening and it was very nice but to truly appreciate the Burj Al Arab's restaurant, the Al Muntana, you need to go for lunch that's when you get the really WOW factor of the views!

wow wow. Drive along the beach to get an excellent view of the Burj Al Arab or drive to Palm Jumeirah and soak in the breathtaking view of both the Burj Al Arab and Burj Khalifa as it light up the night.
Truly a 6-star hotel!. The architecture of the Burj al Arab is impressive but also the service. The staff is very friendly and always smiles! Can´t get much better than this!
Afternoon Tea. We went to the Afternoon Tea at this luxurious hotel. It was much more than I expected. The staff was awesome. The food was delicious and it a so worth the price.

Amazing. Thoroughly enjoyed the seven course afternoon tea when I visited the Burj Al-Arab with my 18 year old son. We were sitting against the huge windows overlooking the Jumeirah Beach Hotel and Marina with the City and Burj Kalifa in the distance. The food, service and staff were all fabulous and, taking into consideration the general prices in Dubai, didn't think it overly expensive for what we had.It's definitely worth a visit, the aquariums adjacent to the elevators, the opulence of the hotel and Christmas decorations were amazing as was the view of The Palm.My son also raved about the variety of iced teas on offer!I also appreciated the extra course of Birthday cake and Red Rose for my birthday. Thank you.

Breathtaking view at night. Drive along the beach to get an excellent view of the Burj Al Arab or drive to Palm Jumeirah and soak in the breathtaking view of both the Burj Al Arab and Burj Khalifa as it light up the night.
An experience but at a price. We enjoyed a look around the reception areas and dinner at the 'underwater' restaurant. Has to be done once. Excellent experience but at an eye watering price.

Beautiful hotel - from the outside. We had a view of this hotel from our apartment and I never tired of looking at it. From the outside it is stunning. Inside however... well. Gaudy and tacky really. Plus it is really expensive to eat or drink inside for no apparent reason. The food is better elsewhere. It is a lovely thing to look at though and you get great views of it at night from many of the bars and restaurants at the Madinat and from the beach next door. The beaches up from it also make great viewing points for the New Year Firework displays.
Nice. A visit to Dubai is not complete without stopping by to see the Burj Al Arab. A beautiful, tall & imposing building, it is reputed to house the only 7-star hotel in the world. Recommended!
New Years Eve Fireworks. Enjoyed the fireworks on the beach to the left of the Burj Al Arab with local public. It was wonderful to see the palm fireworks as well from this location.

WOW, The only 7 star in the world. Burj Al Arab-- the only 7 star hotel in the world. Beautiful hotel, and only cheap way you can see this hotel, Just have a meal in one of their restaurants. We had 7 course afternoon tea at 27 floor-- skyview bar. Stunning hotel, friendly staff,good food. Expensive but worth it.

Simply Superb!. We had heard a lot about Burj Al Arab, so we wanted to make it a point to cover it during our stay. While we were tired due to hectic schedule on 5 days of GITEX, we went on the very last day, and found it totally worth it! Highly recommended if you've got deep pockets ;)

Evening meal. Only for the rich bueatiful hotel really is 7 star the food was strange didn't understand any of it except from the burger and chips and they take forever to make your food good experience but very expensive

Beautiful Building. Went to adjacent beach for a photo stopover. Hotel itself looks beautiful justify its tag for 7 star. The beach adjacent to it is quite popular for tourist who want a quick photo stop for gorgeous views. By the way beach itself was very nice with white sand. We didn't had much time else wanted to try the skybar for views.Must visit when in Dubai.

Opulent. Stunning looking building although it has been there for a few years now its still an outstanding piece of architecture , it's nice to see it from the actual beach from the madinet as you get a great view.
Wonderful. Amazing to see inside this building. It is breathtaking. Afternoon tea for 7 of us was outstanding service and food.
Stunning Hotel . Beautiful hotel with helpful and friendly staff.Great food and drink, on the pricey side but we'll worth it

All flash..little substance. I speak only of a visit inside this iconic sail-shaped hotel..overflowing with gawking, camera-wielding tour-bus visitors ...a garish 20 story-high lobby..and an aquarium restaurant downstairs..with a glass wall of fish..not-so-hot seafood..with a supposed French influence..where we spent $400 for lunch. Ugh !

It's very interesting to see. We were a bit disappointed, it is very expensive to plan something at the Al Arab. We only got to see it from outside. After Tea or dinner were very expensive and we didn't do either. If you've got the money to burn, it's probably a great view.

Don't know what the fuss is about. It is fun to have a picture of the hotel and of course you have yo have a picture of you and the hotel... but it's not amazing in any way, just a building, a great hotel. if you want to enter the hotel you have to pay and book in advance :) that's probably a whole other experience

Afternoon tea. Having had afternoon tea at the Wolsey in London we were really looking forward to this. It was quite disappointing. The portions were small and the variety of sandwich fillings and cakes poor. Although they did cater for our gluten free dietary requirements it was very average. Very expensive for what it was. Go to the Wolsey instead.
Amazing place, Spectacular. It is one of the finest hotel in the world. Amazing property, View and Food. One can see the panoramic view of Dubai from the hotel.
Spectacular. We passed through the Burj on the way to the Skyview bar. Whatcan you say: Absurdly over the top is barely expressive enough. Well worth a visit
Noises up. Its nice, but over rated to the extreme. Not willing to pay again that huge amount of money for a brunch... makes no sense at all

Pricey, but don't regret. Have been there for an afternoon tea at the Skyview Bar.Food and service were excellent. On this day, we actually skipped lunch to wait for this, and it was actually a good choice we made.Price makes it a one in a lifetime experience - but after all, I do not regret paying the price, as we had an amazing time there

Tea by the fountains. This was my second time having tea at the Burj Al Arab and the Skyview bar was fully booked so we made reservations for the lounge by the fountains.....the experience was dialed down a bit but the ambience was still very lovely,the live music was great and the delicacies were amazing.

Al Mahrah restaurant. very nice restaurant, love the seafood and the round fish tank around the restaurant looks very romantic. must make a booking before you to the hotel otherwise you pay at the door 200 DHS entrance fee.

Culinary Flight Experience. The culinary flight is EXTREMELY expensive, but I'd say it was pretty cool. Choose the lunch time one, not the dinner one because you can't see anything at night anyways. Also, you feel much better feeling stuffed for lunch than for dinner. (Only had one meal that day). We started out in their underwater restaurant and had our appetizer there. At the first restaurant they make you choose your meal for the rest of the tour. Then we headed to the Chinese restaurant. (Didn't like that one as much because it was casual and the place smelled like fried food, left the restaurant feeling oily). After that we headed to the sky bar, the elevator ride was nice because we could see the ocean view while going up. Lastly, we ended up at the lobby coffee tea area to end our meal, and we were stuffed. It was nice seeing the restaurants and I guess it was worth the experience if you weren't staying at the Burj.
What a construction. I saw this tower which is also a hotel when I went shopping to Emirate mall. a long special tower in the middle of the water.

CULiNARY FLIGHT NOT THAT GOOD>. waithed over half hour to get into lift then squeezed in with smelly group tourists obviously been out with their guide all day, no socks or shirt on one! the guide, knew where to sit so rushed them all past us to windows where thy sipped coke and blocked view, we informed manager (lady) but she vanished and never saw her again so very dissapointed, we paid about £500 (British pounds) and left feeling a little cheated. Place did not live up to expectations. Not much joy from later email to hotel manager. They should stick to policies advertised. Can not recommend.
Burj Al Arab. Ridiculously priced out of the range off all but the wealthiest. It sits on its own island. There is no doubt it is one of the most unique hotels in Dubai.

Amazing. This building is amazing, as with most in Dubai. Even the beach diretly outside is amazing. Even though most visitors could not afford to stay here, (meself included), it is still pretty cool to see.

The famous land mark in Dubai. With the limited time available, there was not much that I couls see except from out side. But it presents a great sight in the evening against the backdrop of the evening twilight. Plenty of people who are clicking away as it is indeed a famous site . It is always better to have a guide who can tell you about the site though you may have read all about the land mark.

Great experience and lovely food. The afternoon tea is expensive and is just an afternoon tea with cakes and scones but the experience is amazing. Just walking into the burj al Arab is fantastic. Definitely a must see on a visit to dubai especially if you can't afford the £15,000 a night room fee. You get to explore the lobby and take photos. There are unlimited drinks and the food is lovely. The service is great and you get little posh chocs at the end. Dress up and enjoy it.
We went, as everybody goes there... Could imagine how Agasi and Sampras would have played on that Tennis court ... Beautiful man made creation. Worth a visit, for sure. Moments to remember.

Anxiously expensive breakfast was so worth it!. I had read reviews that it wasn't worth the money you paid, but I beg to differ We went for breakfast as we were doing a Safari that evening and didn't have time to do afternoon tea like everyone suggests. It was divine. We each got a 3 tiered tray of goodies (mine all specifically prepared as gluten free) & then chose a main breakfast - my omelette was a piece of heaven. We also could order whatever drinks we wanted.
Wow. We went to the Jumeirah beach to have a good look at the Burj Al Arab at sunset. Awesome piece of architecture! Too bad we could not go inside.

Tourist Trap. Hmmm...we booked a breakfast at the Junsui restaurant so we could go in. Since it was Christmas, the lobby display of the nutcrackers were quite amazing. View up the centre was also really neat. That said, if you have been to other very tall buildings with similar architecture, it may not have the expected wow factor as expected. (This place reminded me of the JinMao Tower in Shanghai but with an Arabic flavor instead of the opulent Asian gold one.)The buffet was alright. Could not compare to Shangri-la or St Regis even though this is supposed to be a 7-star hotel. Selection was adequate, but quality was sub par. The Junsui restaurant features more Asian fare (Japanese, Korean & Chinese), but also included an 'international' western section (ie omelettes, waffles, french toast, bacon...). Pastries were excellent. Everything else was mediocre. There is another restaurant offering breakfast, but that is a set meal - not a buffet. Price is the same so this has the better value.Interestingly enough, ALL of the diners there for breakfast were from mainland China. They had special servers speaking Chinese so they must have a huge clientele from the mainland who actually stay at the hotel. Dress code is supposed to be smart casual, but fashion tastes vary. I think as long as you are not in shorts and flip flops, you would be ok. There were plenty of people wearing sneakers and other assorted outfits. Can't speak for afternoon tea and dinner though.We wanted to mozy on up to check out the rest of hotel, but the security guy said we could not go up because we did not have a reservation there and the restaurants up there were closed. Rest of the hotel was neat to look at, but again, nothing super exciting if you have been to other really nice hotels - especially the ones in Asia.Can't say the breakfast price was worth going in. If you take the Yellow Boat Tour, you get a good photo op of the hotel.I can now say I've been there and done that, but not worth it.

Burj Al Arab. The only seven star hotel, They say lightings are great, but did not find that facinating. We went in the evening to see this place which is on the sea front. The top plate like bar looked real nice.
Roast dinner. If you want an up market roast dinner in dubai this restaurent is fantastic ,great view of beach. Excellent service .

Celebration. We had afternoon tea in the Sky Bar .It was about £100 but we were served much more than a normal afternoon tea with a glass of nice champagne and fillet of beef.We were given a rose .anniversary cake and chocolates on leaving.

Afternoon tea with class. Beautiful hotel which can be entered only with a reservation. The afternoon tea in the lobby was fantastic. We had a little toddler with us hence we were not allowed in the bar - although i think that should be everyones first choice since you also get a fantastic view with your lovely tea. the service was great!!

Lovely Birthday Treat. We went to the sky lounge/bar for my birthday and I can say this was a beautiful perk to my evening. Even though this was at night, the view was stunning with all the lights Dubai offers, great service (extra birthday treats) and tasty cocktails. Be prepared to pay a little more but definately worth a visit. I would recommend trying the sampler menu, again not cheap however beautifully presented and very yummy. As we visited early December the foyer was stunning with decorated Christmas trees and an enjoyable tinker tailor soldier fountain display. Not everyday you are on an escaltor with a salt water aquarium following you on the way up! Think day or night you wont be disappointed.

Wow and wow!. Once through the tight security and across the magical bridge, some by Roller, we chose the golf cart, the approach does not disappoint. The Burj stand majestically before you in all it's billowing glory. An architectural feat and one to be seen to fully appreciate it's iconic splendour. A flurry of staff greet you at the main door and direct you to your pre-arranged destination. Ours was the basement buffet that turned out to be just fabulous. Eat as much as you wish of the fresh food prepared to the highest standards by the best chefs. A wonderful unique experience.
life style of the rich and richer. Not many people go here because of the expense, but if you want a taste of luxury then make a point of having at least a lunch or dinner here

Unique Experience. We had the pleasure of staying a week at the Burj Al Arab which without doubt is one of the finest hotels we've ever stayed in. The luxury and the opulence is something to be believed. One needs to stay at the hotel to get the full experience of the quality and service that the hotel provides. We found the staff from the concierges, the waiters, to our personal butler who provided our every needs, to be most polite, friendly and helpful. The restaurants and the food are of a very high standard but are expensive but I'm afraid this is what you have to pay to stay in such a luxurious hotel. The only downside we found to the hotel was that during the day and early evening they let too many non guests look around the lobby area which gives no privacy at all to the hotel residents, which really shouldn't be allowed as the prices are very high to stay here. In saying that, with the luxury of the hotel and the pleasantness of the staff we would probably stay here again as it is no doubt the best hotel in Dubai.

Afternoon tea at the sky bar: stunning view and service!. An once- in- a lifetime experience! Not cheap but worth every penny! Hospitality over the top. Nice entrance and beautiful lobby. By name you will be guided to your table and seats. Do make early reservations to get you the best seats, viewing the skyline and Burj Khalifa. We had reservations for 16:00 so perfect time to watch sunset. We made our reservations one moth in advance and had window seats facing sea and skyline. Staff is very helpful, polite and friendly. Tea and coffee as much as you want. 5 courses with different food/ sweets and ice-cream with refill in beween. Lovely glass of champagne is included the price. Very recommended and a perfect place for special occasions!

Skybar afternoon tea. We pre-booked afternoon tea at the Burj al Arab Skybar for 4 pm before our recent visit to Dubai. When reserving this we asked for a table facing the Dubai skyline. We were informed we could arrive 30 minutes in advance and as we arrived we had to show our reservation confirmation at the security check point on the land side of the access bridge. Our taxi then dropped us off right outside the hotel entrance. The views of the hotel externally were stunning and internally the atrium, aquarium tanks and fountains were very attractive. We took pictures in the atrium and then made our way to the registration desk at the rear of the hotel, gave our name and were asked to wait until around 3.45 pm. Couples or groups were then individually called in turn to take the lift to the 27th floor where we were met by another member of staff who showed us to a pre selected table at our chosen location. On the way to our table we were warmly greeted by a number of members of staff which felt very welcoming. The views of Dubai, the World and the Jumeirah Palm were stunning both during daylight and after dark. The sunset over the Palm Jumeriah at 5.30 pm was particularly attractive. Our package cost around £100 each and included in this was a glass of champagne and as much tea and coffee as you wanted. I do not drink alcohol and was given a glass of sparkling date juice, although I was still charged the full price. A wide variety of different teas and coffees were available as well as hot chocolate. The food was beautifully presented and tasted great although it was of modest quantity. It comprised a berry tart, the chef’s carvery, finger sandwiches, scones with jam and cream and cakes followed by sorbet. We were offered extra sandwiches during our tea. The service was very friendly although there was a bit of a delay in us getting our first pot if tea. By 6.30 pm people were starting to pay their bill and depart and we did likewise shortly after. We noticed as we left the restaurant that none of the staff bid us farewell in contrast to the attention we received when we arrived. We left the hotel and walked along the bridge towards the shore admiring the views of the building as we left. At the security gate there was a taxi rank where we were able to get a taxi back to our hotel. We thought our visit to the Burj al Arab Skybar for afternoon tea was very expensive but we enjoyed the experience and were glad we did it. We would recommend it.

wonderful. the only problem here is that if you want to go inside you have to book a cocktail or a tea, otherwise you can only admire it from a distance but if you have 10 minutes do pass by because the view is one of a kind!

great view. great look with seaside view, time to love it, every onecan enjoy,near beach veiwisclean and every onecan see hotel from beach---we can only go there by road only, its our dubai city tour main attraction .got great view for us andmy family was delighted. polution free air flow give us good fressnessin morning

Signature of dubai. Dubai’s signature landmark is the Burj Al-Arab, the famous sail-shaped hotel facing the Arabian Gulf. The world’s only seven-star hotel, it’s truly the stuff of James Bond movies and superstars.Packed with bars and restaurants, the hotel is a world within a world, with guests enjoying every luxury service you can imagine in their opulent suites.For most of us, catching that iconic shot of the hotel jutting out to sea is the closest we’ll get to the Burj Al-Arab. Mere mortals can visit, but before you can even reach the front door you have to make a booking in advance and a hefty fee is charged to sightsee.
architechtural marvel. beautiful to look at from all angles and any time of the day. there is alight show in the evening, can get a good view from the Souq Al Madinat.

Limited food in Expensive Breakfast, tasteless. Hotel was good. Food was average. To disappoint even after paying them exorbitant, breakfast is limited. Initial service is good. Later they forget the customers. The taste is not at all good for south indian food. Staff in restaurant don't pay attention to guests.
Best Birthday Venue in My Life. The luxurious magnificent venue to experience a once in a life time birthday celebration in my life at Jun Sui Restaurant of Burj Al Arab Hotel.
wonderful location. The location of the hotel is the best in Dubai. However I thought it was not my style; it lacks the sophisticated aura I like.
Majestic Burj Al Arab. The Burj Al Arab is a must see for all who visit Dubai. The view was simply awesome and so breathtaking.
Delightful. We had afternoon tea at the the Burj, the service was unbelievable, the views great and the sunset terrific. Pricy but well worth the experience

First Class - everytime. Have been for meals and high tea. Each time always first class. Yes it is pricey, but I do believe that you get what you pay for in terms of service, quality and ambience. Have been many times and will be a repeat customer.

The food and service were both fantastic. I highly recommend the restaurant at the Burj Al Arab. The ;price was very reasonable for the food and service. Wine was expensive, but the selection was very complete.
Quick photo take. We decided to buy a hop on hop off bus tour and this was on one of the routes but we only got off the bus to take a quick photo but looked stunning
Little expensive but worth to visit. If you want to visit Burj AL Arab from inside then you have to either go for breakfast package or lunch or dinner package then only you can enter inside !

Brillaint. What a place. You need an appointment so you need to book something to actually go to the hotel. Yo can not just walk up to it and look around, to get past security you have to have your name on there list. We booked and had afternoon tea in the Skyroom. Wow that was fantastic, it took a couple of hours no rush fantastic views so take a camera. This is not cheap over £200 for 2 of us but as a one off experience well worth it. You can book lunch and evening meals as well. This is 7* so you dont even need to think of the quality or standards that are kept.

Amazing, mind blowing. We did not stay at this hotel, but went to the Skyview Bar and the Al Mahara restaurant which I highly recommend. We stayed at the Jumeirah Beach Hotel which is next door. The lobby of this hotel is beautiful and grand. It is just amazing. Staff were very friendly everywhere you walked. If you do not have a reservation, you need to pay to enter and get past security gate as it is on a small island of its own.

An unique experience. It is a seven star hotel, so it is a unique experience. The decor is the best, so rich. There are two beautiful restaurants, one at the top and another underwater.If you wanna visit these special place you should make reservations For one of the restaurants or for a drink or for the tea time. It is expensive, but if you can, you should go.
BEAUTIFUL. The hotel is beautiful with a lot of gold fittings and finishing. Al Mahara seafood restaurant was amazing for dinner. I feels as dining under the sea.
Culinary Dinner Flight. Was a very expensive but interesting experience. Food was just O.K. - atmosphere made up for it however. Was a once in a lifetime visit. Might recommend the lunch instead.

Beautiful, but a bit like a tourist attraction, not a hotel. It is unbeatable in design and beauty, and in an excellent spot, can't be beaten, but many open areas are full of sightseers and visitors.The rooms are incredible and the service excellent, not to forget the amazing restaurants, indoor pool areas , gym and spa. The outside pool is quite small considering the expanse of the hotel.A great experience but only for a few days, prefer a more family friendly warm environment. Great for a short escape, which is ideal as it is very expensive. Once is enough, to see and experience probably one of the best hotels in the world.
