Seven Star Experience. Architectural experience, can be viewed from land and Sea. For better viewing, try going through a speed water boat ride that usually starts from Dubai Marina.

Lots of money for mediocre food. Love the décor but the much publicized high tea was not up to expectation. Very disappointing. Out of 5 sandwiches, only 1 was tasty and the others were dried and bland. A slice of roast beef with mash was unexpected for high tea? We were part of a tour group, and were served scones and cakes about 5 mins before we were due to leave. Our cups of tea were only refilled once. Altogether a very flat experience and not enjoyable at all.
A must see. We had dinner at skyview bar and it was a good experience.We loved the lobby, it was very fancy, we took a lot of pictures there. We didn't like the food at the bar.
far away from the city centre. accessible by a private road, close by to a white sand beach, nothing special overall, you can get there using hop on/off tour bus

High Tea at the Top. When it was built, everyone talk about the famous luxurious hotel with sailing shaped building Buj Al Arab. Finally, we have a chance to see it. We booked 1 month ahead to avoid the fully booked disappointment. The architecture was outstanding. We had high tea at 5pm with beautiful sun lights at the Top. The food was great, good service. If you are not their guess, you can not get in at least you have booking, so do need to plan earlier and book a table for tea to meal. Pity we can not look around on the ground. Only guess would allow to use other area freely, our experience was great, but it's limited and once is enough.

ARCHITECTURAL BUILDING WOW.. The building looks amazing. I remember watching a documentary about how it was built. Tried to get to have a high tea there all booked out. Cannot get into view unless you are a guest so was only allowed to take photos from a long distance up to the security gate & had lots of people there doing the same thing. We were in Dubai when they celebrated their 43rd National Day & they had fireworks off the building that was spectacular to see. Cannot say much else about this place cause I didn't have a good look except from a distance.
Al Awan Restaurant. Excellent Arabian Food Buffet. Appetizers and dessert section can be better. The soup is really good.
beauiful icon. beautiful the depiction of pure luxury. Absolutely wonderful and definitely worth every penny. We stayed for a few nights and the beach service was amazing and the staff superb

Unique in the world. Never got a chance to go inside but have been several time to witness the beautiful structure. Several photos I have taken from behind the Jumeirah beach hotel both at night and day time. The photo of the structure comes awesome any time during the day. The night view with the coloured lights are excellent.. No words for the beauty.

Beautiful Building. We did not go into this as you must either be staying there or have a reservation for food. We were thinking of having high tea but thought that $153 per person plus tip was a bit pricey, though is is a 7 course meal. Instead we saw it from different places pretty close up and found the building very beautiful.

A must see in Dubai. Burj Al Arab is one of the symbols of Dubai and as such must be visited. If you are in town for a few days it is maybe better worth to skip it but if you are staying for 4 days or longer try to plan a visit (do book it in advance though as availability is sometimes limited)

Mind blowing!. Where do I start. From the moment your car door is open, this place makes you feel special. The attention to detail is astonishing and never having been to a seven star resort, I now get all the fuss. The Sky Bar for cocktails was the icing on the cake. Thank you Richard and Michael!
Breathtaking. The attention to detail takes your breath away, gold plated elevators, shops, fountains, restauraunts and VIP area WOW !
Nice architectural building. You should Go To take the tea or To dinner but you should do with anticipation because is everytime so busy.
Nice view from outside. Unlike the Burj Khalifa you can not get in the Burj Al Arab for a visit. You have to be a guest at the hotel in order for you to visit. So enjoy the view from the main gate.

Best Hotel Service Ever!!!. I've traveled and stayed in hotels all over the world but I rarely write reviews. It's been awhile since I've stayed at the Burj Al Arab but after reading some of the reviews that said the hotel is just average from people who only had dinner in a restaurant and not even actually stayed in the hotel I though I'd write about my experience. I have stayed at hotels all over the world on every continent except Australia and I have not received better service than at this hotel. I stayed for 5 nights. I was picked up from the airport by a driver looking very charming in a white suit, driving a white BMW. He was very polite and he greeted me with a bouquet of beautiful roses. Once in the car he gave me a small face towel to freshen-up, then a glass of champagne and my choice of soothing music to listen to on the ride to the hotel. Where else would you get this kind of service? Once at the hotel I was greeted with a refreshment then taken directly to my room where I checked in from the comfort of my room from the lovely office in the room. There I was introduced to my personal butler and informed of all the hotel services. The room was amazing! A curved marble staircase that took me to my bedroom and two stories of windows with a great view of the beautiful ocean. My butler was very attentive. He was at my beck and call whenever I needed him. He went above and beyond.The food and service at the Skyview Bar and the Junsui were excellent. The hostess greeted me by name every time I entered any of the restaurants. The service of the entire staff was impeccable! I can't say enough about the Burj Al Arab.

Sky Bar. staying in Dubai we decided to visit the sky Bar in the landmark Burj Al Arab, which was all over disappointing. I am glad that we didn't choose this property for accommodation as I found it disappointing to lack private and comfort. You share your experience with busloads of tourists staying for one drink and leaving, which isn't that pleasant when you are spending a minimum of 120$ + per person as base of the booking. I find the place overrated and just rectified by the view.

Too many Russians.... Was there November 2014 and was struck by how many Russians were guest in the hotel. Russian menus, Russians signs.. That would be ok if not for the simply impolite, disrespectful behaviors of the Russian guests. Not one stood out as being friendly and polite. Unbelievable.I told the staff that we would not come again to the Burj anymore. Staff was surprised of our reaction

Over rated.... Been here twice due to business obligations. I am still trying to comprehend what is so special about this place that seems to pull in the crowds. I very much doubt if there is going to be a 3rd time for me.

Very special afternoon tea. Decor is amazing and unique. The afternoon tea was made up of 7 courses and a glass of bubbles. All dishes were fresh, with excellent presentation and above all delicious! Service was excellent as expected.
Birthday trip. We werent staying there but visited the skybar for cocktails.This needs to be booked in advance and there is a minimum spend of AED 320 per person ( about £60 )
Date night. exclusive culinary delight will be lost and amazed at the burj al arab must visit the sky bar has its own uniqueness.
spectacular building. we went in august and we were roasting on jumeirah beach but managed a few photos. best to go with a booked driver

Nice experience but over priced. We had dinner here on our honeymoon, whilst staying at the Madinat.You can't enter the hotel without a reservation, and we both were really excited after reading about it but overall I would say it was disappointing.Our table was in the corner of the restaurant and the views overlooking Dubai were spectacular .The food is disappointing , and very priced. We had lots of great meals in Dubai but wouldn't come back here.

The best birthday ever. Went to sky bar for my bday all I can say we were truly looked after. Guru the bar attender really looked after our every need and surpassed my expectations. Amazing cocktails, cake and fruit platter. Please take me back plus the views are fantastic!!!

Breathtaking!. We were able to visit the Burj since we had a reservation for the Culinary Flight there. One word sums this place up, Magnficent! Completely over the top! We first started with a golf cart ride from our hotel to the Burj al Arab which can only be reached by a private road that goes over the Persian Gulf (it’s located on an island in the Persian Gulf). Security confirmed we had a reservation before letting us proceed on this road which has only been traveled by a few. When we arrived we checked in at the front and proceed to tour the atrium area which provided splendid views of the hotel. It was magnificent. Rolex Wall clocks. Gold plated doors. Opulence at the highest level. We ended the experience with a ride in the private mercedes the burj al arab has on site. All white. Felt like a million bucks heading back to the Jumeirah Beach Hotel. Looking out at the Burj al Arab that night felt a bit different because we had now experienced what it was like to eat at every restaurant in the one of a kind hotel.
WOW. From the minute you walk in you know you have arrived it is a little austentatious but hell its FAB afternoon tea was yummy just explore ...take that camera!!

High Tea.. i had High Tea at the Burj in November, it was the best service i have ever experienced from the way the champagne was poured to the way plates were placed on the table you could tell a high level of training was given to the staff, the 7 courses were all amazing and were very varied. the setting of the Burj aswell is just amazing, my advice is to have the tea in the sky view lounge, but if the lobby is all that is available when you book it is still an amazing experience.

Over the Top. Yes everyone’s heard about this 7* hotel, not as good as I imagined, unless you have a table booked you can’t get on the island. Some of the hotel is probably amazing, but you don’t see these apart from the walls are aquariums, you’re whisked into the bar, and only accessible by lift, but the view from the bar is spectacular, you can see probably ¾ of Dubai skyline
Missed oppertunity. I heard from friends who went to the skybar it was worth the money. Food and snacks included in the price were great

it is a landmark :). It is really hard to get in but it is worth a look even if just on the outside. There is a huge aqua park across that you will have fun in and so you should at least get a closer look at Burj Al Arab and then hit the park !

I will recomend. This is one of the most posh place in the world. If you want to go there you need to either stay there or have a reservation for one of their restaurants. We went there on a restaurant booking and we enjoyed every minute of it. If you have a chance don't miss it.

High Tea. We had afternoon tea at the Sky Bar and it was out of this world.We were greeted, seated and the selection of food along with the unlimited teas had us sitting there for over 4 hours. We were even offered more sandwiches and cakes once we had finished ours.it was our honeymoon and my wife received a premium rose which was a nice touch.

Sail boat design luxury hotel. A beautiful landmark, a beautiful luxury hotel designed like a sail boat in blue waters of the Gulf. This luxury hotel has an incredible interior design with hill side dancing water fountains, floor to ceiling wall fish tank aquariums in both side of the lobby leading to upstairs tea room by escalators. Experience tea in this unique place and you will agree with me that this is the real place as they say for having "tea for two".

Excellent experience. A very high standard hotel with an atmosphere of excellence all over the place, from the reception to the restaurants/bars. Well deserve a booking, the Al Mahara restaurant, which elevates dining touching perfection. if you are aiming only for Al Mahara, go one before booking time, to enjoy the scenery both inside and outside the hotel.

Birthday Tea. I wasn't sure if the high price of tea would be worth it at this hotel, but it did not disappoint. The hotel is stunning and the view from the restaurant is amazing. The tea and the food they serve with it was outstanding, and they just kept bringing out more and more. It was all you can drink tea and coffee, so it was fun to try different types. I was celebrating my birthday, and they made sure to make me feel special. I highly recommend a visit.

Good but not great :(. We had dinner at 27th floor sky view bar and restaurant. Service was amazing but food and wine was just good. So when you pay that kind of money, One expects something amazing, but it was disappointing.
Splendid day out. An architect's dream building which really does look like a sail ship. Visit the nearby souk for refreshments and further good scenery.

Wonderful landmark in the skyline. Even though I never entered the building and only saw it from distance it surely did amaze me. I never thought it was as big as it really is but it really is part of the Dubai skyline.

excellent view. #BurjAlArab #PhotoOfTheDayone of the top ten best hotel restaurants in the world, Burj Al Arab's signature restaurant 'AL Mahara' elevates dining to heights of true perfection.Burj Al Arab Tour is one of Dubai's most popular attractions. The icon of Dubai, Burj Al Arab, rises out of its own man-made island 280 meters from the Jumeirah coast. Only 7 star hotel in the world. Height 321 meters .World's most luxurious hotel! Tour: Burj Al Arab is the world's most luxurious hotel located in Dubai, stands on an artificial island. Designed to resemble .The best way you can visit the Burj Al Arab, as a budget tourist, is to visit one of the restaurants housed at Burj Al Arab. You will not be permitted to roam a tour: Burj al Arab is a luxury hotel located in Dubai, United Arab Emirates. At 321 m (1,053 ft), it is the fourth tallest hotel in the world. Burj Al Arab ..

An expensive Bar !!!. We booked drinks and snacks at the Skyview Bar, as you have to make reservations or you cant enter the hotel. For a very high standard hotel you are treated like a VIP from arrival to entrance to the Bar escorted to your table and waiters providing your every need.We had a bottle of Wine and couple of cocktails and yes it was expensive but the decor and service were impressiveI would say its not the most impressive bar to visit in Dubai but as an experience and level of service is a must try

Another great example of Dubai's architecture. You can't miss these examples of Dubai's amazing skyline from many different locations. We took photos from the beach with Burj Al Arab behind us, as well as from the monorail station. Just stunning.

Terrible - we were surrounded by a bus of tourists!. We paid almost $300 USD for the tea service in the afternoon served on the second floor in front of the picture window. The food was wonderful, the service was wonderful, the view was wonderful....so what could possibly go wrong? Well, even though the hotel is only accessible to those that have tickets (either to dine, or have tea, or to stay for the night) what they DON'T tell you is that they sell tickets to busses full of tourists!! Hordes of tourists.So right in the middle of our tea-- an entire bus of tourists came into the hotel and swarmed the whole area where we were having tea on the second floor. It was terrible.I will say the hotel did have a little bit of velvet rope to keep the area separate, they even had a 'do not take photo' sign....but somehow the tourists, who had bought a ticket to 'tour' the open areas in the hotel just flocked the area, taking pictures and videos , oblivious to others that had paid for tea.I'd never return again. I thought it was so tacky of the hotel to open themselves up to 100s of tourists who treat the place like a zoo. This was so tacky and unpalatable to us, never again.Don't do the afternoon tea. You will save yourself $300.

Very nice, but over priced drinks. Very beautiful and I liked the security. Tried On top of the World signature drink.. it was ok.. but probably not so good at the price tag of USD 70. However, very nicely done property.

Not blown away. This was one of the things on my 'bucket list' - to have cocktails in the Burj al Arab. Very expensive and whilst done beautifully, they were really not worth the money. As we were celebrating our wedding anniversary, I was given a very beautiful red rose which was a lovely touch. We also had a lovely table overlooking the Jumeirah Beach. Glad we have done it to tick it off my list, but wouldn't do again. The foyer of the hotel was impressive but neither of us were blown away. After being to Las Vegas, it would take something pretty special to do that and the Burj didn't do it for us.

Tick in the box but not worth the money. The hotel is kitch defenitley not for everybody to like. Lots of fake gold and colors.It is the worlds first "7" star hotel so nice to tick the box and say yeah I've been there.I had a friday brunch there and the food was very good, but not better than some of the other brunches here in Dubai. The downer was the service, The service was definetly not 7 star service. They waiters handed me a fork holding it in their bare hands, not even in a napkin or on a plate. If you dont specificly book a table by the window you could end up looking at a pilar or a wall. Everything is 40-50% more expensive but not better than in other hotels. I also had the business lunch there, I left more hungry than when i came there. When I asked some extra bread the waiter started laughing and looked surprized.So unless you realy want to tick the box dont go there, the service is below standard and the Burj is only nice on the outside.
Visit to Burj Al Arab. It a must visit in Dubai , very beautiful hotel, afternoon tea fab,rooms are elegant with fantastic views.

Building beautiful is a passion. It is not only a matter of having skyscrapers, but it matters when you build something to be unique and beautiful. Burj Al Arab is really a landmark and it is worth visiting it! the sky bar opens fantastic views.

The WOW Factor. Well worth the money to have the buffet . Experiience seven star dining ...the staff are absolutely professional from start to finish.
Amy was a delight as were the chefs.

Afternoon Tea. Iconic landmark but lobby interior way over the top, Sky Bar however more tasteful with wonderful views. Staff very polite and attentive. Tea gorgeous, menu at first glance doesn't appear too plentiful, don't be fooled! Nice touch box of chocolates and if celebrating a special occasion a rose. Expensive but a very memorable experience.

Burj Al Arab from afar. Went to the beach and did the obligatory photo with Burj Al Arab in the background, one of the most iconic landmarks of Dubai. On the flight home, some moments after our plane took off from DXB at night, we got to see the Burj Al Arab and the nearby Palm Jumeirah island from above through the window. It was an awesome view.

what a view. no lines longer than 20 minutes, what a view from the observation deck............worth the cost and well spend time revealing in cooler temperature, nice breeze and clear day excellent views.
Too bad that you can't go closer. A truly iconic building of Dubai, can be best viewed from Jumeirah Beach Hotel. I's a pity that a one-time visitor can't go closer than the gates.
Great Brunch. The view was great on Al Muntaha Modern European Restaurant, 27th floor Burj Al Arab. The food was extremely high quality. No negative thing to say.

Simply jaw dropping elegance!. This is by far the most elegant hotel I've ever stepped into. We had drinks at the sky view bar where we saw fireworks followed by dinner at al Mahara - this was an evening to die for!

Burj Al Arab. I thought I was afraid of heights but this was just awesome never felt like we were that high. The lifts were incredible so fast and the views just spectacularWell worth the wait in the queue but best booking in advance,.
I dont like it. It is small hotel. Not nice designe. This hotel was disappointment. for me the worst interest in Dubai

Afternoon tea. An experience not to be missed. A special experience in an iconic place. Food, as one would expect,, was superb. The extra glass of champagne well worth the extra cost, in my opinion - Don Perignon! The waiter we had was most attentive, friendly, and helpful. Individual tastes are catered for. I am a vegetarian and this was not a problem, unlike in a lot of other establishments.

This has to be a little piece of paradise.. The hotel it self has the wow factors. Security is at a very high level. Shopping is a distance but taxis available. Rooms are spacious and extravagant therefore it feels luxurious but very over priced. With the money charged we believe lunch & dinner should be made available at a set menu complimentary of the hotel made as a choice to eat or not at the hotel. Staff are very formal which is fine but upon having a guest the hotel believe that there should be a curfew for that guest to leave. Extremely embarrassing if you wish to have a long night. Mind you there are no conditions or agreement between the hotel guests and the hotel in relation to this matter. Once confirmed that the guest may remain in the suite in relation to hotel regulations the hotel manager apologised and brought flowers the next day. Other than that the breakfast is amazing. Great hotel for honeymooners. Highly recommended for the extravagant. The 3 night stay well exceeded $5K. Would we go there again...??? Highly unlikely. We prefer a hotel closet to the shopping malls and more central to city Center.
Too many tourist !!!. Lobby was full of tourist taking pictures which was a big turn off, the fact that you're paying top money, you would expect exclusivity.
Just saw it from the beach.. Beautiful hotel at a wounderful location. Liked to Watch the helicopter platform as the helicopters landed.

amazing. this is undoubtedly one of the best designed buildings in the world, though the interior designing is to be questioned, whether sitting externally on land enjoying its brilliance, or on a boat sipping champagne marveling at its design, or eating a superb meal with the ultimate service whilst chuckling at the 70's roller skating disco designed roof , you will enjoy

Amazing and breath taking. Hotel is amazing and breath taking. Everything is perfectly clean and organized, highest level security, super helpful and friendly staff, amazing interior, cannot say a word bad about it.Super great experience and for sure worth 7* nomination!!!
Worth a visit. Didn't actually go inside the hotel but saw it from the outside whilst on the Big Red Bus tourist bus. Got off at this stop and had a good look around.
Tick the box. You have to try it once, but be sure to clear the credit cards, take a second mortgage and sell a car or two before you get the bill, OUCH!
cool from the outside. I didn't have a chance to visit Burj Al Arab, but it's awesome from the outside too. You can see it from the beach located on the right side.
Book the Skyview Bar. Per booking essential or you won't get in. Great bar, very expensive but with lovely views of the Jumeriah area if you get a table by the window and in the right place.

up top and down below. We had drinks at the Sky View Bar and eat at the Al Mahara Underwater restaurant. Both were amazing. Staff superb - extremely expensive though, but worth the money. If you like something spicy then definitely try the Winter's Remedy cocktail... extremely hot but very very good.

Brilliant,Fantastic,Amazing,Out-standing,Beautiful,Stunning,Exceptional Quality. Well i am running out of expletives to describe our stay in this 7* Hotel - 5 star is 5* BUT 7* IS TRULY PAMPER HEAVEN.I actually do not know where to start - it is as amazing as it looks, the services is as good as it gets,the food amazing - our suite was one bedroom - and was larger than my two bedroom house in london lol. Walking up the dallas stairs to the bedroom - large bathroom and dressing area OMG!!! Everything is OTT and fabulous if you like that kind of thing. Beds are situated opposite the window and the curtain upstairs and downstairs opened by remote, as did the door. Even the tv's rose to the occasion when remote was pressed - very James Bond.We stayed half board, breakfast was out of the world with views to match.Dinner fabulous we ate in the JUNSUI restaurant - beautiful - cheapest wine £100 yikesThe private beach is breath taking, we were escorted to our beds - white towels laid,white leather roll for head rest - then we we brought a little box which contained bottles of ice cold water - ice & cold rolled white towels. You lay in the sun and enjoy the sun, staff pass by and offer you ice lollies FOC, the sea is so hot & not a stone in sight. I have died and gone to heaven.Quiet, Restful and just beautiful. The on beach toilet was like being in a hotel room - showers,toiletries,including tooth paste people,hairdryer & plastic carrier bag to place your costume.Skyview Bar - on the 27th Floor was fantastic.We sat down and immediately a member of staff was there - she past the drinks menu & we started to laugh as the beautiful dimmed lights meant we were having difficulty reading the menu. We laughed and the air conditioning meant we felt a little nippy. Your not going to believe this next bit - the member of staff asked what glasses number we were & returned with - GLASSES - DESIGNER WRAP TO TAKE THE CHILL OFF & LITTLE LIGHTS THAT CLIPPED TO THE MENU - beat that - I still laugh now when i think about it.All greatly appreciated - thank you Burj for being so thoughtful, you really think of everything.When we arrived all the seats looking out over dubai were already taken as soon as someone left one of the staff came over to see if we would like to move - YES lol, Dubai all lit up at night what do you think lolOur Butlers were lovely, they new our name - and each time we left the room and returned everything was replenished. Nothing was too much trouble. Not a snooty person in sight.This was a dream - I had said this would be a one off and we saved and decided to go for it. And it was worth it. and i will return again.This service is impeccable. For my friends birthday Staff arrived with flowers - cake - sparkling non-alcoholic drink & singing staff with violin playing - thank you Burj (you know how to make someone feel special). They take £600 up front charge and refund what is not used at the end of your stay.The 24 carat gold ipad a nice touch.The Cars on call to you lol - unbelievable.There is so much to see and photograph in this hotel - hope you have lots of room on your camera's or phones.We were Happy to live like the rich for a few days lol I could go on but i need to stop - if you would like any further info please e-mail meThey describe this hotel as "The worlds most luxurious hotel" this statement sums it up.Two words to anyone thinking of going - BOOK NOW!!!

Excellent View. I came up close with this man made marvel of the world. I visited Jumeira Public beach where i had a closer view of this massive hotel built on a man-made island. It shows the works of great thinkers and creators. Its a worth a visit while you are in Dubai and if possible take one the of the Dinner offered to outsiders at a reasonable cost.

Cocktails with family at burj Al Arab. Wonderful experience even though the hotel is approaching 15years old it still has grace, style and elegance. Great how it doesn't have any building around it.,lovely interior , food and drinks

Now this is luxury!. First off, it's a challenge to get in. I booked a ticket on Saturday morning the earliest I could even get a seat at the bar was Tuesday at 8 PM. The good news is that the bar has spectacular views of the city. Second, it's expensive. There is a minimum charge at the bar so expect to spend $100 plus for a couple of drinks and appetizer plate. I looked at the menu and the cheapest entrée was right at $100. But exquisite doesn't do justice to the experience. They have spared no expense. Just to sit and people watch is an experience. To walk though the shops is yet another experience. An must see/do!

Worth a visit. Its the first 7 stars hotel, worth a visit, I had an expensive dinner there, but quite an experience. I have seen the rooms, I think the smallest room is 64 sq metersThey have an amazing fountain in the lobby
Brilliant. Outstanding Service, Brilliant looks and Awesome view. There are no better words. It does stand by its 7 Star standards though self claimed

Afternoon Tea things to know. First off you need to prebook the afternoon tea and you need the confirmation number to get access to the hotel itself. They have two prices, 510 AED with champagne and 455 without. The afternoon tea is a 6 course of tasty treats. Our seating was at 1 pm, we were early so sat down around 12:30, I was very glade we had only had breakfast up until then. This experience is good, but you really do get lots to eat, so my advice is to come on an empty stomach. Our tea took nearly 2 hours, the harp player was extremely good and it was a relaxing afternoon with way too much rich food. I would agree with another contributor, the interior just seems slightly tacky. The fountains were cool, the service was exceptional and so was the price, $300 USD for two persons including tip is all the money for sure, but indulgence can only happen once at this location! I would recommend it, but only once!
Good experience. It is a nice place to experience but you can get anywhere beyond the lunch or snacks table you book for or the downstairs where you take pics , good for one off visit .
Don't miss. One of those things you have to see and experience. A must see. Very expensive. Take the trip to the 360 bar afterwards for the stunning views of the Burj Al Arab.

Glitz and glamour ....... It's grand - with lots of glitz and glamour ! However, the grandeur is not match for the Emirates Palace at Abu Dhabi.
The food was good though !

Hands Down Must See: ICONIC DUBAI ARCHITECTURE. FULL DISCLOSURE: We did not spend the evening here; we were guests of a "regular" customer and he arranged for us to have a private tour of the space. And what a tour it was! WOW! We were taken to the Presidential Suite, a massive multi-room area that was literally fit for kings. Everything was attended to with perfection. Fittings, furniture, linens, materials: everything was tastefully and most appropriately chosen. The color scheme was out of this world. Very royal! Frankly, I believe anyone would conclude similarly if they spent any time here; many tourists come simply for cocktails or lunch or for high tea. They would all notice the same thing: exquisite attention to detail, perfectly appointed interiors and exterior spaces, well-trained and courteous staff, and zero tolerance for litter or anything out of place. The Burg is simply perfection. There is no other way to describe it. To many, it is THE iconic piece of architecture of Dubai. And when you are standing in the lobby looking up, you will understand why. It is magnificent! If for no other reason than to witness first-hand one of architecture's most recognizable structures, The Burg is a MUST SEE. MOST HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

afternoon tea rushed. We booked a trip for afternoon tea here. They didn't seem to know we were coming. Food was great, but we were rushed out before the end so missed 3 out of the 7 courses we'd paid for.

Totally overhyped. Well, we went for afternoon tea, which I have to say was nothing special. It was OK.We were then 'allowed' to go up to the bar which looks like they stole the decor from a 70's airport waiting lounge.Totally overblown, overhyped, for something that really isn't all that noteworthy. Far better value is to be had almost anywhere else in Dubai. All of this pre-booking and trying to be snobbish was so totally unnecessary
Nice. iconic building, beach right next to it, waterpark as well, during my visit there was a construction work going on, so the view was distracted

Visit during the city tour. Visited Burj Al Arab in Dubai city tour package by Excursion point tourism. The driver took us to adjoining part of Jumiera beach for 10-15 min. The hotel is well structured and looks beautiful.

Grand Ambience , overpriced. We were in Dubai for a family holiday and thought of visiting Burj Al Arab for a meal as we felt that our Dubai trip may not be complete without a visit to this world famous hotel. We called up the hotel and checked for various meal options- High tea, Lunch, dinner .Finally we made a booking at Bab Al Yam restaurant for dinner which suited our schedule for the day. The hotel was grand and reminded me so much of Las Vegas Casino hotels. You only could go to the floor where this restaurant was located, plus since it was night we could not really enjoy the sea view from the hotel. The hotel exterior was beautiful lit with lights changing in color. Coming to the restaurant, the ambience was casual. The buffet menu was pretty limited for vegetarians considering the exorbitant price charged per person. There were exotic options for Non vegetarians though. Desserts were good in taste and variety. Overall we felt that dinner did not serve our objective, probably a lunch or a High tea option would be better when you can enjoy the sea view

Exclusivity, Exclusivity, Exclusivity!. If you like to be treated like a Princess (who doesn't) and you want doors opened for you, rose petal baths run for you, your bed turned down with La Prairie goodies left on your pillow and Hermes full size toiletries in your bathroom then this is the place for you! Exclusive use of the white buggies (not gold which is for the rest of the Jumeirah resort guests); exclusive use of the private beach; butler service; Rolls Royce Phantom airport transfers and, of course, the most luxurious duplex suite with stunning views over The World (what's left of it)...this really is the place for some serious pampering.

Gold gold golden hotel. We stayed for 3 nights. 25th floor what a view. Room with 2 floors. Every thing is gold plated. Its one of a kind. Hotel staff all over any place is excellent. Tried top foor bar i would suggest any one to visit for sure not to be missed.

Drinks in Skybar. This building is really beautiful, and we happened to get a reservation for drinks here and how we were shocked, 3 out of 4 of us who came work in hotels and we were amazed by the effort and the staff in this place was amazing. Even though we never stayed we were treated like we were everyone was so friendly. The drinks weren't as expensive as we imagined and the waiter who served us was really accommodating. We had a little bit of a problem with one of our free food stands but was immediately taken back and replaced with a fresh one and was given complimentary drinks for the inconvenience. Couldn't fault our time here at all. The décor is not what you expect when you walk in but it is a iconic building of Dubai a must go to place. We loved it.

amazing hotel. this hotel is well worth the money. Absolutely fantastic service and your own private butler. The staff were very friendly and did everything they could to make our stay more than welcome. Wish I stayed here for a few more nights. Will definitely be staying here again when I go.
Beautiful. You cannot go to dubai without going to the beach and getting your picture with the Burg Al Arab behind you.

3 out of the 7 star hotel. I've been to the Burj Al Arab many times and it's only because visiting friends/family want to see/visit the iconic building. Structurally it's an amazing hotel and there's doubt about it, however, for anybody that has little bit of taste/class you will immediately notice the interior design is a sight for sore eyes- not a place to end up with a hangover! To you give an idea, it's as though someone had sneezed a load of colours on the design sheets and somehow they ended up fitting it out with a dash of gold, white gold and more gold. Following on from the initial deluded design you're welcomed by the statues- supposedly staff...Jumeirah Group are a fantastic hotelier and have some great hotels, but unfortunately it does not live up to the seven star status; do yourself a favour and visit their Jumeirah Beach Hotel counterpart which has better service, more aesthetically pleasing decor and is ultimately cheaper.

The Ultimate afternoon tea with Champagne. Luxury Afternoon tea with Champagne. You will never get disappointed, thats for sure!7 different courses. Berries tart, finger sandwiches, chef´s carvery, sorbet, lot os scones, clotted cream and nice marmalades, fresh pastries, tea, coffé, hot chockolade and more.Expensive(510 AED) but really nice.

Wau the only 7* hotel in the world!. Hello everyone,It's some times that I last visited the Burj Al Arab.It is definitely unique in style and service.Already the drive on the bridge connected from the land to the hotel build in the sea is amazing. Normally a big fire is lighted at night at the entrance. The carpet is very impressive in the lobby.When you step on it you will feel the difference to normal carpets. Everything looks very rich, just WAU.The service was excellent.In the first floor I was once for afternoon tea... Piano was playing and I really relaxed!Once my husband took me out for dinner to the top restaurant and the view was amazing... So was the price ...But it was worth it!!

An expensive hotel. Not sure about the hotel service cause I did not visit inside of the hotel. I just took photos of it while I was in Jumeirah public beach. As a landmark, it doesn't hurt too see it once.

Seven Star Hotel - with Seven Start pricing. It's worth doing it for the experience but it's a fairly expensive night out. The decor of the hotel is interesting - you have to see the water fountain - but it's so elegant it almost borders on distasteful in a strange way.

Oh my God!. It's unique! A bit expensive if you want to visit it because of you must book "something to do" inside (breakfast; brunch; dinner, etc.) but it one of those places that you must visit... and prepare to expend money! :-)

Sisha at Bab Al Yam. The Burj Al Arab is magnificent as an illustration of the arabic understanding of luxury: Lots of gold, mosaic and wave patterns, extremely annoying procedure to get through the gate to then get a table at (as it turns out to be almost empty) Bab Al Yam Sisha Lounge. The Sisha was great, the cocktails sucked, prices were as-to-be-expected expensive.

Amazing Arabic Hospitality. Went for a site seeing tour as I knew an employee of the hotel. Kitsch decor and glitzy rooms. Fantastic restaurants especially the one with huge aquarium and the roof top one. The helly pad is fantstic. True luxury...

Expensive. Burj Al Arabo EXPENSIVEo But again it is one of those times where you pay for something you can not get anywhere else in the world since it is the only 7 star hotel in the world.o Beautiful but simple.o Book in GOOD time so you can get the Skyview, we only got 1st floor because our travel agent skewed up.o We enjoyed the “High Tea” we got champagne, cocktail and tea/coffee with the 3 courses which was more than enough food for us, we celebrated my wife birthday there so we got a nice little violin and piano show singing happy birthday to her and a special little desert :-)

Visit for afternoon Tea. my wife and I visited this luxury hotel for the Sky View Afternoon Tea. We found it to be a very worthwhile experience. The opulence of this hotel has to be seen to be believed and the views from the Sky Bar are awesomeThe Tea experience was excellent. Service as you would expect was excellent in every detail, however the staff made you feel comfortable during the whole time. The Tea started with a welcoming glass of Champagne, then through courses of sandwiches, scones etc all complemented by a choice of many types of Teas or Coffee whichever you preferred.I had made them aware at time of booking that it was my wife's birthday, and naturally they brought to our table an individual birthday cake complimented with a red rose. The experience started at about 4pm and we left at around 7pmAn excellent afternoon in wonderful surroundings. A must do if you are visiting Dubai.

Guest at the 27 floor bar. Fantastic building exelent service, you just have to experience yourselves. We booked reservation and took the el.car from Our hotel along the Beach road to Burj Al Arab and the same way back. The smiling People at the hotel feels you welcome!

Afternoon tea - one of the most special experiences of my life!. Went here a while ago, but having checked, I didn't review it, so here goes!We went for afternoon tea. Arriving at the entrance (with the Rolls Royce's and Bentleys I think ) you instantly knew this experience would be like no other in the world. I certainly haven't experienced anything like it. Entering you see the amazing lobby with HUGE fish tanks (cue diver waving at us!) and the escalator. You also see the very special fountains where the water jets "climb" upwards. I saw a programme on TV about how they built the hotel and how they do the the type of water jet in the fountain. It's all quite complicated involving laminar flow, and shows the building and contents have been built not only to exude luxury, but to stretch the boundaries of luxury, with what lengths they go to to make this hotel the best in the world. It's both the big and small details. The lift to the skybar is wonderful as you can see outside, and its SUPER fast too. Entering the bar - wow what a view!! We were greeted and sat down in comfy seats. Only one of our party drinks alcohol - no problem, 2 of us were made fresh non-alcoholic cocktails and the 1 that drinks, had the champagne (poured with great care and attention, and theatre). The food. What can I say? It was AMAZING!!! Absolutely STUNNING, & SUBLIME and it kept on coming! We got the towers of food, but in between, we got a small plate or two. If we had wanted more we just needed to ask. Needless to say, we were completely stuffed by the end, without even having to ask for the towers to be refilled (I think we asked for a sandwich or two more, and one of the cakes). There is certainly enough food - no question there! The flavour combinations were well thought out and complimented each other, with skill only demonstrated in that of the best restaurants in the world. The tea menu and choices was vast, and showed a real understanding of the different teas, which were extremely high quality. We had around 3 different teas each. The presentation of the food, and the food itself was outstanding. Mini works of art. The service was excellent, attentive and friendly. The attention to detail in the whole experience was like nothing I have ever experienced, and I felt a very lucky lady indeed that I got to experience afternoon tea here. I believe its a MUST if you find yourself in Dubai and have something to celebrate (or even if you don't!!). I have been very lucky to have travelled to many areas across the globe, and had many wonderful experiences, but afternoon tea here has to be one of the highlights of my life. Come for afternoon tea here, you WON'T be disappointed!! Hope to return in the future

Afternoon Tea. We had afternoon tea and it was spectacular,if you get the chance this is a must!!! The entrance to the Burj is magical you feel like you have stepped into a film. Your every need is caters for. The food is exquisite,and the staff very attentive and the views breathtaking. Don't forget to take your camera.

Majestic. a luxury hotel like no other in the world that i have experienced.we got a tour of the lovely lobby and had an excellent tea there before heading off to the palm island.The luxury and opulunce is as stated and definitely a to do item if you can while there

A Dream Come True. Afternoon tea at the Sky Bar is an absolute treat that should not be missed, in fact it is an experience in itself!! Going up in the lift is amazing and so is coming down! What a view!! The afternoon-tea itself is absolutely scrumptious and served so elegantly! The decor of the hotel is beyond imagination. You have to see it to believe it. Just do it and book from your Country of origin to ensure you get to go on the day you wish. Top of my bucket list and lived up to my expectations and more!

Couldn't afford to stay here, but wanted to see it.. Certainly an experience. Did cocktails at 7:00 pm. Did not have a window table and not sure it mattered. View was interesting but not the attraction. Might be better to have afternoon tea, but that is a good deal more expensive.

7 Star quality with prices to match. The iconic hotel is a must see for anyone visiting Dubai for the first time. You can go along for lunch and walk about inside. Its a stunning hotel. Although unless you have the bank account of a Sheik you'll be drinking water!

Most expensive meal ever behind the helicopter pad.. Amazing building with aquariums next to the internal escalators. Meal really over priced but one of those had to do it events. From memory a soup a steak and a bottle of Jacobs creek for 2 cost £150.

Afternoon tea at the Jensui restaurant. The top floor afternoon tea was fully booked for our stay so we opted for the Far East Asian afternoon tea, seven courses from five cuisines. As a restaurant guest you get very little access to the hotel - only permitted there 30 minutes before the booking and then through the lobby to the restaurant. The restaurant was on the ground floor with no real views. The food and service was good although we did have to be moved because of a family with noisy young children that started screaming.All in all the meal was AED 365 or around £65 per person. In absolute terms it felt a bit expensive, but I guess for Dubai it was not unreasonable, but you are paying a premium for the Burg and frankly I am not sure it was worth it.KEY TIP: If you want the top floor afternoon tea look at booking it before you get to Dubai.

amazing hotel, next on my bucket list. iconic landmark the world over, the sail shaped hotel has a special appeal. The cots is prohibitive to most pockets but it is well worth a visit, even if just a tour which Arabian adventures now has on its selection.

Afternoon tea. We went here for afternoon tea £92 per head but it was worth ever penny we were treated like royalty the staff were lovely they explained ever dish or sandwich they brought the iced tea was great, The champagne tasted so good £40 a glass after 1st one , it's an expensive lunch but worth it what's day
Breakfast at Jun Sui. Had Breakfast at Jun Sui Far East Restaurant located at the ground mezzanine floor. The Hotel was magnificent and very detailed.
dinner was excellent. burj al arab dinner was excellent. entirely different experience ! highly recommended in this 5* hotels
Very good. In general service is good, staff is attentive and atmosphere also comfortable. I will suggest for my friends also.

So thats how the rich people reside?. Very impressive with an escalator lined with a huge aquarium with sharks and a small reef which is a site in itself.Everything screems luxury and still I (sweaty T-shirt wearing tourist) was free to move around and explore.To get there however in 40+ degrees was a bit cumbersome as we walked from Metro. Take the Bus instead!

Just from the outside. Impossible to get a look inside so don't even try, unless you are staying here. Best viewpoint is from Jumeirah Beach, east or to the right of the hotel. Late in the day you can get some great photos as the sun sets behind it. The big bus tour (blue route) does a photo stop here also.
Nice place To take snaps and post it on FB. Nice place To take snaps and post it on FB very costly to go inside so better the snapsNice Place nearby was Jumeirah beach

The most luxurious Hotel ever. One word: perfection! Burj Al Arab is amazing. It is a place that you must see with your own eyes. The luxury and the beauty as well as all the details inside and outside of this hotel made it a stunning "artwork". A real masterpiece.

Not for us. We wanted to see it and experience what a 7 star facility was like. The way onto the property is difficult going through two security checkpoints. The hotel is undoubtedly magnificent. The aquarium and waterfall is beautiful. That said, I can not say that it was that much better than other top properties we have stayed at. Dubai in general and the Burj are in our minds a cross between Disneyland and Las Vegas with generally less alcohol to be found. We came. We saw and we don't expect to go back. May be its just us but there is an air of pretentious entitlement here. It's just not our cup of tea.

Ok. We have visited this attraction on 14th October during morning time and we were actulally not allowed to go inside.We just took few snaps from outside and moreover it was sooooo hot outside that kids had a tough time to stand there for few minutes.

Lovely to see but you can't go in. By the time we made it to Dubai, the Burj Al Arab had been closed to sightseers. Unless you are staying there, you can't get in. Still worth dropping by for a picture.
The place is beautiful. amazing hotel, immaculate, spotless, perfection and total glamour. Went for afternoon tea, expensive but worth one visit.

Dubai Trip. I was there in May 2010, it was a wonderful experience.Only saw this from the outside during a taxi trip around Dubai. A helicopter landed whilst we were looking at it.You have to book if you want to eat there.I have to put a date below because the system fails to show enough dates.
Only for the Rich. Don't even bother - they don't want you gawking around and they keep you at more than arm's length - if you have to ask the price, you can't afford it.

Get My Money's Worth Breakfast!!. We made reservations for the Sahn Eddar breakfast. She had the Indian and I the Continental. Cute tower of condiments, fruit, parfait, my eggs benedict with salmon was so so. The toast and butter were really nice, go figure! We order the masala chai and it really was quite awful. Not impressed at all. We did linger for over two hours...well we had to get our money's worth. Breakfast was $87 per person! I would never pay that much in the US but we did it for the experience of going in to the Burj. I had preconceived ideas that it was going to be really opulent and tacky but the lobby area and the restaurant were anything but. Really classy and nice and the attention of the employees was impressive too. Worth it for a once time visit but I doubt that I would do it again.

A must see in Dubai. Anybody going to Dubai has to see the Burj Alarab at least from the outside. If you can afford it it is probably worth doing high tea around $80 when we were there don't know if they any special deals on at different times but other wise to go inside and just have a look the cost is ridiculous and just not worth it .From the out side it really is striking an amazing building and worth a photo or two.

hi tea. i had to review this hotel everyone talked a bout it and so i thought how else High tea .It was worth going to i would however for anyone pay 6-9 k a week or night for living their but heh i would pay 100 bux to have high tea no problem naz

Once in your life taste this hotel. Well it is the icon for dubai ı think.for travellers you have to pay 50 usd for inspection .when you enter under the sea there is restaurant wooow.everything is like dream.put your money and go.

Big shiny cylinder. If you've flown into (or are due to fly out of) Dubai during daylight hours you've no need to use Burj Al Arab for the uninteresting, dusty view of desert and chrome buildings. Buy a view cans of diet cola and build one yourself on the beach (dispose of the cans safely afterwards though, environment fans) as it's more fun. Alternatively buy a fridge magnet for £2 from the shops in the Deira's labyrinth and hold it really close to your face for the same effect. Great feat of engineering and very pretty and sparkly - but it's still just a big shiny cylinder, whichever way you cut it.
Overpriced and pretensious. Food not fresh produce - overpriced frozen goods it seems only good for the view during a clear day - better places in dubai to visit

Great Food Complimented with Great Service. Both my wife and myself assumed this experience may be underwhelming but we were very surprised to see that the service was not only spot on but the food was spectacular. We ate at Al Mahara and plate after plate we both looked at each other and were amazed that the cost and the wait was well worth it. My wife had the risotto and I had the lamb, both were amazing dishes. We highly recommend eating here.

7* service. Celebrated our wedding anniversary here on the lunchtime Culinary flight. Service and food was exceptional. Never hurried, spent around 4 hours in the hotel and were treated like royalty. Would highly recommend.

Ski Dubai Experience. Ski Dubai entrance is within the Mall of the Emirates which is a very large shopping mall in Dubaiand is very popular and allways busy.Ski Dubai is very big and very high up! The cost is around 150 dhirams per hour and an experience not to be missed.Restaraunts overlook the ski slope, divided by glass of course and, it is said that even ifthe system to keep the ice frozen failed it is built in a way that the ice would stay frozen for two weeks!The newest addition to Ski Dubai are real life penguins! which of course the kids love to see.
The High Spot. Just the most shamazing view in the place ......wonderful experience ....great site of modern art ....
top of the world. not cheap but well worth the experience, views are stunning at top. Shop at top very reasonably priced but don't have a coffee at entrance £9 for 2 !
Priceless Moments. Awesome Burj Al ArabWe had an amazing time in Dubai and you can only see the Burj 400 metres for free.Not unless you're willing to have an expensive dinner or you're a hotel guest.

Smaller than I thought. It was small and on a sand island. A helicopter arrived while I was there and that was impressive. The haze was unfortunately ever present so none of my photos came out clearly. Still it was worth seeing up close.

High Tea at the Burj. Not cheap (in fact downright expensive) but you have to go for their 7-course tea (bre-book or you probably won't get in). It's an experience and you'll regret it if you don't go.

Spectacular experience. WOW, I still can't get over on how spectacular our whole experience was. You can't get inside the hotel, unless you have reservations, or booked a room. As soon as you pull up to the hotel, you have to show your reservations to the security by the gate. When you pull up to the hotel, you are greeted by handsome doormen. And then you go inside, wooow. Spectacular, fancy and just over the top luxurious. We were greeted as soon as we walked in. Then we went up to the Sky View Bar on the 27th floor. We were seated immediately with a view to die for. The staff is incredibly polite and helpful. The whole experience was just to die for! Will be back someday!
Our trip. We stayed at this resort for 2 nights. It was interesting. See my review on this resort. Not what one would expect however I will say that their customer service was out the door.....GREAT

very nice. Went there to have dinner at Junsui restaurant, which was close tp perfect. Very nice personnel. Once you get in (only on reservation or booking) you can strawl around the hotel to see the architecture, lighting, aquarium, ...

Worked here. Still fascinated.. Having worked at this hotel for some time I have had many experiences, some of which I would like to share. But where to start.. The hotel itself represents magnificence. Build in 1999 the hotel was a project that was declared as "nation building". This designation is well deserved as the cost of the hotel widely surpasses any financial break even that would be considered "sensible". Only the finest materials have been used for its construction which makes it still to date the most expensive single-purpose hospitality development. To put it simple, everything that shines here - IS gold..Practically all of the hotel parameters are off limits to the public. You want in; you have to pay. The "cheapest" way to gain access to the hotel is to enjoy "high tea" in the afternoon. This however should be booked in advance as it also is the main item blocked out by travel agencies to get their guests into "the Burj". Also recommendable is a dinner reservation in one of the hotel's 4 F&B locations available to non-hotel guests (cuisines: pan Asian [Junsui], Arabic [Al Iwan], International [Al Muntaha] - not to be confused with the Seafood restaurant [Al Mahara], which will seat you around a cylindrical fishtank filled with sharks and other exotic fish). Personal favorite is Junsui, the hotel's pan Asian restaurant: buffet style hot and cold, it offers everything you could ask for including live cooking stations and chocolate fountain. This restaurant has recently been refurbished and features now a modern approach to Asian interior. For the ones wanting to step by for a drink, SkyView bar is the answer; elevated 200 m above sea level it deserves its name: excellent views over the Arabian Gulf, The Palm Jumeirah island as well as part of Dubai Worls islands make it worth the visit. Even your standard cocktails with AED 70 - 85 (USD 20 - 23) are not exorbitantly priced, measured against the Dubai average. However, it speaks for itself that the bar enables you to also spend anywhere beyond AED 30,000 / USD 8,000 per head if you really tried... Again, reservation is a must - no guest list entry and you will not even make it onto the bridge leading up to the hotel.The Spa is another area available to the public - even though few people know about it. A day-spa membership can be purchased which enables you to use the hotel's beach, spa and gym facilities for the day. Prices may vary and are best requested directly from the hotel.For hotel guests a wider range of opportunities is on offer: the hotel is a suite-only hotel, offering 202 suites ranging from 1 bedroom over club suites, to presidential and royal suites. The latter two categories have a price range equivalent to a new, small car per night but therefore offer more space and amenities than you will ever need. In fact, only 2 royal suites are available in the hotel, each covering the top two floors on either side of the building. 780 sqm and multiple butlers will ensure that guests do not get claustrophobic during their stay.Different to other hotels, the Burj Al Arab has its own reception on each of the 25 floors (all floors and suites are duplex, therefore the actual number of floors is 50 plus helipad), to ensure utmost privacy is maintained. Every suite also comes with its very own 24h butler, who will cater to the guest's every need. The pool side restaurant, pools and shisha lounge are areas accessible to hotel guests only. Should you have a special request, the in-house concierge will be able to help; in fact should you wish to dine at an otherwise fully booked restaurant or intend to gain access to one of the member-only clubs in Dubai, chances are these guys will be the only ones in Dubai able to still get you onto the guest list. For guests seeking for the ultimate Burj experience a helicopter arrival/ departure to the hotel's own helipad is recommendable - if you are willing to spend a five-digit AED amount for your airport transfer that is. This will be your only chance - guest or not - to be able to access the helipad. Apologies: no marriage proposals, special dinners or your private photo session are possible here and the advertised tennis green with Roger Federer is exactly that, an ad and non-existent. Not even employees are allowed here and 95% of the hotel's staff will move on without ever having set a food atop. Now this is exclusive!Tip: Room rates are the lowest during the summer month and if booked in advance one might be able to snatch up a room for half its advertised rack rate.

Amazing Building. No matter whereabouts you are in Dubai , you can nearly always spot this building . Amazing but a shame you can only enter if you are either a guess or are having a extremely expensive meal

Beautiful. The burj al arab is lovely to see and explore even if your not fortunate enough to be able to stay their. If you get the chance take a boat trip to visit the Burj al arab you get to see the hotel with out it being crowded

Expatwoman breakfast. I have not stayed at this hotel; I only went for an expat breakfast event. It is a beautiful structure, and really a must see place in terms of its architecture, design elements, decor etc. Even if it's not to my taste I found it quite intriguing and fascinating.
Amazing. We had a delicious afternoon tea with champagne. Staff were fantastic food was wonderfull and the views were great the hotel was spectacular

Afternoon tea in Skyview lounge. Worth every penny. Just glad that I discovered my exchange rate mistake (thought it was 16 AED to £1, it is <6) before I made other Burj al Arab bookings. Saying that, if you can afford this, it is amazing. Staff are very friendly. I could not eat everything, and was loathe to leave some of the beautiful wee cakes behind: I asked for a box, and enjoyed them at a later time. Note: you are not given the food parcel in the restaurant, you have to collect your doggy box from the reception. Only downside was it was obvious that you were a visitor and had to use the "bleebs" lift i.e. takes you straight to the Skyview bar. Don't let that put you off however :)

5 star service and experience!. Champagne afternoon tea was a wonderful treat! Everyone must experience afternoon tea at the Burk Al Arab. Simply exquisite! We booked afternoon tea in the Sky Bar and arrived at 4pm, which meant we saw the beautiful sun set.A perfect experience if you are looking to do something that is memorable and special. Plus, it will give the opportunity to have a nose inside the hotel, which is worth the trip in itself!Great food, service and ambience!

Great Hotel to Remember. a nice location,and most luxurious hotel i ever seem very professional staff and would love to visit it again,food and rooms one of the best in the world..great engineering !!

The absolute experience ?!. Afternoon Tea at the Skyview Bar, 200m above sea level on the 27th floor, is the best known landmark in Dubai.You need an advance and confirmed reservation to enter the private property : you have to show your reservation number at the gate. Reservations only made by e-mail and creditcard. Due to high demand : the earlier your reservation the more success. I’ve made my reservation 3 months in advance ! Afternoon tea at Skybar is not cheap : 565AED/pp (125euro, 160$) but you’ll witness the absolute experience in the most exquisite place of Dubai the next 2 hours ! Perfect service from your private waiter : a glass of Louis Roederer champagne served with a strawberry tart, a warm Chef’s Carvery of the day, followed by finger sandwiches and soft buns (free refill), homemade scones, and extra desserts … all kinds of teas (and coffees) as much as you want. And time flies during your stay !Two seatings at Skieview Bar each day : 1PM and 4PM. Cheaper afternoon tea available at ground floor. Remember : only advance reservation by e-mail. There are window and non-window seats, but even from the non-window seats you have a view … mostly on the sea, “The Palm” and “The World”; view on Dubai and Burj Kalifa only from the seats on the east-side of the bar. This is a “once in a lifetime experience”, not cheap but definitely worthwhile. If you can’t afford it … don’t do it !

Amazing hotel but mediocre tea. I wanted to love tea at the Burj Al Arab but if I'm honest, I was slightly disappointed. For a self proclaimed seven star hotel you expect an incomparably amazing service but on arrival (we were 15 minutes early) we had to wait around in the lobby slightly aimlessly until someone came to get us to take us up to the top. Once in the Skybar we were given a window seat with amazing views. Seeing the views was definitely the best part of the experience, along with getting to view the inside of the hotel, which was absolutely stunning.However, the actual tea really wasn't that great. Most of the pastries/cakes went uneaten and the sandwiches were nothing to rave about. I have had far, far nicer afternoon teas for around £30 per head at London hotels and felt that the Burj was counting on its location and decor to justify the £88 / 520 AED per person price tag. They even brought us out the wrong tea at one point, which is no big deal, but again, when you are in a hotel that is boasting the only seven start service in the world, you expect to notice a difference. A plus point was that the waiting staff were lovely and did make us feel very welcome and valued. They even encouraged us to wait til midday before leaving so that we didn't miss out on the champagne that was included.To sum it up, I would say that tea at the Burj Al Arab is just about worth it if you're really keen to see the hotel and the views, but if it's an amazing afternoon tea that you want, then I'd say go elsewhere.

Too Much Bling. Astonishing building, excellent suites. Too many "posers" which makes the place feel uncomfortable. Food in restaurants poor for the price and often overrun with non residents who have come for a meal to gain access to view the place. Worth a visit to see the place but would not go back.
High Tea at the Burj Al Arab. This is an amazing hotel . High Tea was fantastic . Booked through Arabian Adventures . Highly recommended.
Afternoon Tea. Words fail me, you just have to go and see, try, look and take it in, Brilliant afternoon. Not cheap but then you are in Dubai, looks not much food but very filling and tasty.

Best afternoon Tea ever?. If only for the view... shelling out for afternoon tea at the Burj Al Arab is a great experience.Go at a time when the sun sets for a truly remarkable experience with world class service.
Afternoon Tea. Beautiful hotel and staff friendly. Had afternoon tea which was delicious and very recommended whilst in Dubai. It was a very pleasant afternoon out

Excellent. its a luxury 5 Star hotel located in Dubai, United Arab Emirates. It has been called "The world's only 7 star Hotel" and is the third tallest hotel in the world; however, 39% of its total height is made up of non-occupiable space.Burj Al Arab stands on an artificial island 280 m (920 ft) from Jumeirah beach and is connected to the mainland by a private curving bridge. The shape of the structure is designed to mimic the sail of a ship.Burj Al Arab is the world's third tallest hotel (not including buildings with mixed use). The structure of the Rose Rayhaan, also in Dubai, is 11 m (36 ft) taller than Burj Al Arab.

Wow. This hotel was made to wow, and soon as you walk in its amazing...lobby looking up to the rooms, water features etc. we had a private tour luck enough as my sister was a vip there. went to the heli pad and ball room and secret floors. the top floor bar was unreal. food and drinks 10/10

marvellous. We went there for dinner and it was my first time to burj al Arab, the experience can simply cannot be defined,it was one of the places on my list and I was glad to be there because it was soo worth it
Let someone else pay. Let someone else pay. Over the top style with gold dripping everywhere. If it's on the company visa, enjoy. If not, you will gasp at the prices

An experience of a lifetime. My Husband (Vineet) and I had booked the sky view bar high tea on the occasion of our 1st Anniversary. From the time we reached till the time we left it was purely a royal experience. The staff was amazing and services impeccable. The interiors as well as the exterior of the hotel was a sheer beauty. loved it and highly recommending it too :)

Wow, what a night of over the top cocktails!. The cocktail lounge in this 7 star hotel is, well, singular, if not a little odd, in its decore. The ceiling is a mad pschedelic pattern of blue and geen lights, the Walls have a weird electronic circuit look in a 'what the future will look like' 1970's perspective. Aside from the lok pf the place and eccentric decor, the place is amazing, waited on hand on foot, treated like royalty, the waiters are knowedgeable and always ready with a smile and compliment, the bar snacks where like little pieces of heaven in the mouth.The cocktails though - considering their is a minumum spend -around £50 ishper party member - this easily met if you have 3 or more cocktails- they are truly lovely - interesting mixtures of flavours and alcohol from Green tea to chocolate ice balls, from mango to pomegranite and all excellent.We had aa lovely couple of hours there, we were a paty of 4 and our bill was astrnomical - but hey - it;s the only 7* hotel in the world - what do you expect?I'd recomend it to anyone - PS if you're feeling exteremly flush and extravegant their is one cocktail on the menu that uses very old champagne, cognac and gold dust that comes in around £3k - hows that for 7*!!!!
Lost for words....!!!!!. Wow!!!!Our friends arranged a honeymoon lunch for us here, what a treat!!If in Dubai this hotel is a must for lunch, amazing views and the best hotel I have ever seen!!!!

Burj Al Dissapointment . We arrived at the Burj for dinner one fine evening as the well dressed, groomed and entertaining gents that we are.Upon approach to the building we were abruptly stopped by two security guards who barked in aggressive tones at us - asking us "not to move" and if we "had a reservation". Despite having intention to visit this iconic building, we decided that being spoken to as if we were a threat wasn't what we travelled out for. Our experience of this iconic building was sour.
Amazing. The exterior as well as the interior is..brilliantly done. The Iwan restaurant is nice and has an excellent atmosphere.. To add, the service staff was exceptional ..
Nothing special. Many years waiting to visit the "7"star hotel! So my disappointment was 7 times extra! Service was average, decor from the ET home 1990s... Quality of drinks below average.

Impressive building but disappointing atmosphere. Iconic building inside and out. Amazing setting. We booked for evening drinks as it is part of the same group as the hotel we stayed. The bar is beautiful and trendy, like a fantastic spaceship but the acoustics were poor and it was difficult to have a decent conversation. The cocktails were excellent but dear (alcohol is really expensive in Dubai) and we were told to get moving once we said we did not want any more drinks! Wonderful views but overall overrated experience.

Wonderful luxury experience. Booked Afternoon Tea in the Skyview bar for a birthday treat. It was sheer luxury from the word go. Fabulously attentive waiter who explained each course and was very friendly and approachable. Each course was a delight and the iced caramel coffee was sublime!

Truly 7 Star. Afternoon tea was delightful. Perfect setting, scrumptious fare beautifully presented and served with aplomb! A must-do on a visit to Dubai. The architecture, interiors, views are all unparalleled!
Best hotel in the world. Has to be a top candidate! Most aspects of the hotel will make your jaw drop. Expensive, but worth every penny, even if it is just a once in a lifetime experience

Great Hotel Experience. The staff from meeting at the Hotel enterance to our breakfast experience were excellent. Every guest is given a VIP treat. The desgin is amazing. But the resturants should also be descounted to the Dubai expatriate residents. You need to keep charging your camera because you will not stop taking pictures.

Afternoon Tea at Burj Al Arab. We went for Afternoon tea at the Burj Al Arab, as a special occasion for a 70th Birthday. As you would expect, the service was amazing, and the food was off the charts. You could easily make a meal out of Afternoon tea, and the service was amazing.

Al Muntaha Restaurant a Great Experience. The Burj Al Arab is deservedly the most famous hotel in the world, with its wind-filled-sail architecture and its exquisite interior. I had the pleasure of having dinner at Al Muntaha restaurant on the 27th floor. It was worth the steep pricetag! The food was highly creative, the service impeccable but also friendly, and the views over Dubai were spectacular (perhaps even better from the bar than from the restaurant). Thank you for a great dining experience. Mary Ella Feinleib, Travel Consultant, USA

Cocktails. We came for my birthday. Window seats are offered in order of arrival, so you will get one, you just have to wait your turn. We enjoyed being able to experience the Burj if only as visitors.
landmark. beautiful building. It has restaurants, rooms, apts also we think. magneficently built. could see this even from burj khalifa.
The mini sub to the restaurant. Riding on the miniature submarine towards the restaurant was awesome! And then it was time to dine with the fishes under the sea. An amazing experience!

wow. stunning place. felt special as soon as you arrive. took my husband here for this 30th we had afternoon tea. which is a must if you go to dubai. amazing food, service outstanding. truly a wonderful place

FANTASTIC SERVICE, SUPERB FOOD!. Now this, was sure an experience. Quite a dated hotel, not modern at all, looks very antique. Had an aquarium in the hotel was very different. We didn't stay here we only came for a dinner date on our honeymoon. We went to the restaurant up on the 29th floor, spectacular views, although would have been nicer during the day as it was too dark to see most of the surroundings. It took us a little while to choose what we wanted, but the waiter was very very helpful and we decided to go for the sharing meal, which consisted of steak and 3 side dishes. WOW, just wow, it was delicious, I can honestly say I have never eaten such a tender and soft piece of meat. It was cooked the perfection. Cooked on the bone, brought over to us on the bone, and was cut in front of our eyes and served to our plates there and then.It was simply delicious. It was pricey, but not as pricey as we thought it would be. It was EID on that day so we wasn't allowed to have any alcohol but I think we spent all in all £300 in GBP (FOR 2). I am glad we went as it really was a different experience. And the hotel itself was very unusual!
A Royal Hotel. Located at very good place and design of the hotel has been awesome. Good time to visit is at the evening and not on public holidays.
Great to View from the Madinat. No ordinary mortal can get very close unless you book a meal / afternoon tea/tour or a room! But it is impressive nonetheless and the light show at night is good.
Luxury but expensive. The title says it all. We had lunch but to be truthful the lunch in our hotel was even better. Great to see inside this iconic hotel though

Lunch Buffet on the second floor. Going to Dubai and not seeing this iconic hotel would be a loss. However it is not open to the public, you have to have a reservation for a room, lunch, dinner or an event to get past the guard at the entrance gate. We made reservations for the lunch buffet at $150.00 dollars per person and considered money well spent. The hotel is sumptuously decorated with gorgeous features not to be seen anywhere else. The array of food was more than anyone could eat at one sitting, all delicious and fresh. In short, worth the expense.
Evening out. Beautiful vista. Easy to reach by metro or taxi, Try and miss the traffic but not the Happy Hour. Handy for the Gold Souq and the canals and tourist bars and restaurants.
Beautiful. We didn't stay here--just had a spa treatment and it was amazing. There is a beautiful aquarium at the bottom and I've heard the restaurants are also good.

Afternoon Tea. This is a real treat! The hotel is like no other in the world and has dancing fountains and an explosive water jet in the lobby.We had our High Tea in the ground level lounge, which is sumptuously appointed and attended by impeccably dressed and attentive staff.The tea itself consists of seven courses and, although none are large, you definitely are not hungry at the end of it.The day we went coincided with a religious holiday so there was no alcohol but the apple and date fruit juice was delicious and plentiful.Whilst we were there, one of our group asked what makes it a 7 star hotel. One of the reasons given was that everything you see which looks like gold - is real gold! (Like the surrounds to the lift doors, for example).You have to go, if only to see the dancing fountains.

Sky Tea on 27th floor. We booked with our travel agent before leaving Australia, and it cost $355.62, for 2 people, but we were celebrating a special birthday and wedding anniversary so we were happy to splurge for an amazing experience. We were not disappointed. The building is impressive of course, water feature and aquarium in the foyer is spectacular, and then the food and service in the Sky Lounge is surely as good as it gets anywhere. We had a window table at the 4 o'clock seating. Each dainty course was delicious, and served impeccably by friendly staff. Champagne pouring was taken to a new level. You will forget the price but never the experience. Highly recommended.

I am obsessed about Burj Al Arab - Sail shaped 5 star Hotel. I personally am too obsessed with this iconic bldg in Dubai. I have seen the way the bldg was conceived and built alotugh on Discovery channel. While my visit to Dubai , ensured that I have a breakfast or a lunch or a dinner at this great place and we got the table reserved for 10 of us for a breakfast at this hotel and we were served with great food. Its called the world's only 7 star hotel and you will be surprised to know that the same is built on a reclaimed land. The hotel is managed by the Jumeirah Group. Despite its size, Burj Al Arab holds only 28 double-story floors which accommodate 202 bedroom suites. Al Muntaha restaurant is located 660 ft above the Persian Gulf, offering a view of Dubai. It is supported by a full cantilever that extends 89 ft from either side of the mast, and is accessed to a panoramic elevator.In case in Dubai, don't miss to pay a visit to this great iconic building - Burj Al Arab

Skyview Bar High Tea. This is great for a one of experience, great food, its worth just going to check out the hotel. The decor inside is amazing with nearly everything being gold plated. The view over the gulf was so peacful and relaxing.
night is more beautiful. we didnt enter inside, it looks beautiful from outside experically in the evening after sundown. the lights its so binlingbingling

Absolutely amazing . Reviewing this a bit after the event, but it's an absolutely amazing hotel.
Could not fault it in anyway. My only regret is taking six hours out to play golf opposed to enjoying the hotel a bit longer.
Stayed two nights and would love to go back at some point.

''Symbol of modern Dubai''. We booked directly on the hotel page to Sky Tea at the Sky view Bar for 2 persons, This is done completely without any problems!
