It will be immediately greeted personally and we had a little time to look around! Really the best hotel in the world, a sumptuous construction and impeccable services. Really valuable experience to treasure, This hotel is unique and incredible
Over the top. Not to everyone's taste but fully epitomises the ultimate in Dubai glamour. If there is warning though, it is horrendously expensive. Don't go if you are on a budget1
Nice to look at but visiting not possible. Architecture is absolutely stunning, but you can't go inside if you don't have reservations. Even not for having a drink or something. Too bad!

Stunning. We had afternoon tea and were greeted with a seven course menu which didn't disappoint - small was beautiful on this occasion. The hotel is simply stunning when you enter and breathtaking scenery inside will make this a visit never forgotten.

Beautiful building. I have been to Dubai many times and this has to be my favourite building, you can look at it for hours!!....It may not be the biggest but a fantastic example of timeless architecture that will always look good. Inside I must admit is not my cup of tea, and doesn't match its sleek exterior........but sky bar and under the sea restaurant were worth a visit. My two boys (age 10 & 7) loved it anyway. If you go to Jumeirah Beach Hotel you can get a ski doughnut that takes you round the Burj Al Arab, nice to see it from the other side.
Masterpiece. Its lovely and masterpiece.looking this since childhood but it lool alway nice whether how much time you see it..now i realise nothing could be nice than this.....srehaan

Fantastic Afternnon Tea. We celebrated our 40th wedding anniversary with Afternnon tea which was brilliant . Staff very attentive nothing too much trouble . More than you can eat of exceptional quality. A red rose and chocolates was a nice surprise for my wife.

7 star luxury. Very nice hotel with doe of the best restaurants in Dubai. Particularly love the Japanese restaurant called "Junsui" its a marvel of Architecture & luxury. interior was a bit too colourful for my taste.

Absolutely Stunning. Afternoon tea in the Skyview Bar is something everyone should try to experience when in Dubai. The food, the tea, the service, the ambience and the wonderful views over the Palm and Dubai, it truly is a 7 star experience.
Lunch Buffet. Totally worth the money I paid for. The food menu was to good. It had the options of Japanese, Thai, Chinese etc.
Nice Building. Nice hotel building, but I couldn't get too close. The city tour bus don't stop near there. Only next to the beach of Jumeirah.

Ekaterina at the Concierge Desk* AMAZING!!!!!!. Let me say that WE WERE NOT GUESTS at the hotel but we came for afternoon tea and afterwards we were headed to an afternoon safari tour. We were waiting for our driver to pick us up but was running VERY LATE. So we asked the concierge desk to borrow the phone so we could call the company.Ekaterina took the phone and spoke to the company directly to find their exact location. She made arrangements with security to make sure they came straight to the front to pick us up. The company was still running late and she came to check in on us as we were waiting and she called the company to follow up on their location. At this point they were giving her negative responses and she was very determined to insure that they move quicker and pick us immediately. She even waited with us outside to make sure she actually seen the tour guide arrive and we got in and were set on our way. Talk about going ABOVE and BEYOND and once again we only came for tea, I can only imagine her service for actual guests. We definitely want to thank her and give her an AWESOME REVIEW!!!! Best of luck to her!!!!!

Opulence. The worlds first 7 star hotel, this has been around for a while and has been overtaken somewhat by the palm developments, and other prestigious developments in Dubai. Still is an icon and maintains its exclusive status. Beautiful inside and outside, service is exemplary.
Superb Restaurant. The restaurant was superb.. watching the fishes in their big aquarium while feasting on the very delicious steak we had for lunch. Service was good and staff fantastic.

What a thrill it is. We were able to visit the Burj Al Arab, I would say there is nothing like it in the whole world. The interior of the building is amazing, the luxury, the opulence, the way it is decorated. It is well worth the visit
One of the most beautiful buildings in Dubai. The Burj Al Arab is the pearl of the beach District. If you are not a hotel guest, you have to pay to enter. It does not matter, it deserves it.

Afternoon Tea. We went for High Tea and had the best time. The service and the food were second to none. The hotel is just so impressive and when we arrived we were able to have a look around and take photos. The whole experience was just amazing. When we arrived we were treated to sparkling wine and then sandwiches came. Followed by scones and then a cocktail and then the pastries followed by tea and coffee. The staff are so attentive and nothing was too much trouble. This is a must do!!!
perfect. great looking at night. please go c it from the "souk madinet Juumeirah" area where they have marked the perfect spot to take the perfect picture for it
Nice. Drove by during one of the tours, nice. Heard about the $7000 cocktail on the 27th floor. Overshadowed now however by the Khalifa building.

Bucket List Item Checked.. I've wanted to see this hotel since 2001. This was a bucket list item for me. Couldn't afford to stay there but got a great pic of me sitting by the beach with it in the background.

Wonderful AfternoonTea at the Skybar. I went with a group of friends for the full-on afternoon tea at the Skybar and it was superb! We had a lovely corner-end table with a super view (despite the permanent sand-haze). The service was extremely polite and attentive and the food was simply gorgeous - even one of our guest's special dietary issue was treated with respect and taken into account. Highly recommended!!

Very stiff and not for families. We were there for lunch in the al mahara restaurant. The food was not so great. We could not eat together, because everbody of us got the food to another time. Then we had to wait a very long time for the wine. I know, we do not drink applejuice with gold in it and champagne, but we were good guests. For us it was a disapointment.

Luxury at its best. Let's be honest, there's no such thing as a 7-star hotel (I especially know that as I'm a professor in hotel management). However, this is an excellent 5-star hotel and a must-see if you're in the city. The service at the sky bar was excellent, the cocktails were great and the views spectacular. Be prepared to pay a premium for cocktails, food, etc. However, I would strongly encourage everyone to visit.

amazing building...simply beautiful. DEFINITELY A MUST VISIT...NOT TOO EXPENSIVE but visit when you arrive in dubai as you may not have enough funds for it by the end...wonderful dinner view at the al mahara underwater restaurant perfect for couples....
burj al arab. this is also a hotel to watch . pls visit the skybar in burj and have a drink in the evening. you can see the coastline

Something you need to do while in Dubai. I thin k this is something everyone needs to experience when in dubai. This was our 2nd time doing it and we both agreed that while we enjoyed it we wont do it again. But defo worth a see

top price for top view. with a view like this and an amazing visit to the location, you cant go wrong considering how much they invested. wine was my choice with an extra price of around 20 dollars but dont drink to much and it will be worth it.
Very good place. I visited this plave before ten years ago and it was fansy and I like it. I visited the resturant at the top of the building and it was a bit expensive.

Big . Beautifull building went for drinks and little snaks the service since the arrival the girl on reception desk the private bartender all the atmosphere the live music and the Gorgeous view overlooking the city was really amazing a great experience

Worth the over-the-top visit. The Burj Al Arab was included in my day tour. The hotel and restaurant is definitely to be seen. While I felt a little "over waited on" the food was great. It was a massive buffet with anything imaginable. Drinks were not included so a marginal glass of wine was $20. I ad a good view facing the beach. I loved the architecture of the building. Do it.
Wow - if you can afford, go inside. But it is as breath taking from outside when sitting at Souq Madinat restaurants you will have a wonderfull view

Staff extremely understanding. Although this time I was not booked at the Burj al Arab (I was there in August with my husband), I wanted to buy some more of the items I got in the ground floor shop before. The saleswoman allowed me after a phone call from my actual Lobby to receive the allowance for entrance her shop. Thank you very much for this kindnis, my grandchildren are very happy about the gifts I could bring from the Burj. See you in February as guest again.

Exquisite afternoon. We booked to have 'sky tea' prior to leaving for Dubai and we thoroughly enjoyed it. It is very expensive for an afternoon tea, but as we are only there once we decided to partake and we are so very glad we did. The service and food were outstanding. The six courses were small but ample and so tasty. The view was also outstanding. If you have the time and the money. Do it.
Don't pay to go inside. .... not unless you really, really want to. The beauty of this is the architecture on the outside. Go onto the beach and see it as the sun sets.

Boat trip. Booked a trip on the yellow boat from Marina....William (better known as Will I am.....was informative and fun. Good photographer too...happy to take your camera and take pics of you on boat with Burj al Arab etc in background!

Stunning Food, But Just Not Worth It. OK, so the Burj Al Arab is a must-see in Dubai, right?From the outside, it is undeniably beautiful and impressive. We booked lunch and cocktails (see my Al Mahara and Skyview) and felt rather special as we were whisked through security at the edge of the island by virtue of our reservations.Once inside, the stepped fountains were beautiful in the entrance hall. The aquariums flanking the escalators were impressive, although I admit to not liking the idea of the fish being captive to the whims of the rich (but that's just me - I believe they live the life of Riley in those tanks and are extremely well cared for!).Despite all this, the whole thing felt very over the top. To the point of being tacky, in fact. Everything is glitzy and gold, with the bright candy-coloured panels in the atrium reminding me of a bag of M&Ms! We both preferred this hotel from the outside - even if we had the money to stay here, we wouldn't bother.

Amazing Place. There's a reason why this is supposedly 7*, which is evident the moment you enter the lobby. The service everywhere is second to none (you can't turn up to work here if you're having "a bit of an off day"!). We went up to the Sky Bar for Cocktails and their taster menu which were all amazing. Went with friends as it was their wedding anniversary which we'd mentioned when booking back in the UK when they asked the occasion. After being seated our friends were presented with an anniversary cake and a red rose for the lady (but given to the gentleman to present!)..nice touch.
GREAAAt !!!. My experience in Burj al Arab was a notable one . I was fascinated by all the luxurious things and the great food ... It was awesome !!!
bruj al arab is amazing. you need to book a reservation at one of the hotel inside the burj al arab to see the inside. but the hotel is amazing and worth going to.

sky bar dinner / drinks. this was an amazing experience, this is definitely the must opulent place I have ever been. The staff were incredible their knowledge of the menu and hospitality was unrivalled. Obviously this was not cheap but was fantastic treat and the whole place was a marvel to behold
Feels like it looks. An iconic building from Dubai that always had been on my mind to go. Try the Skyview Bar because it is not so expensive and it deserves a visit

Drinks in the bar on the roof. Very good service, the bartender made specials cocktails for us, we even didn't need to check the drinks menu...
We had delicious tapas too
The view is unforgettable!
All the staff are super nice and welcoming.
A bit expensive but once a year is great, I really recommend to go in couple, super romantic...

What can I say that hasn't been said!!!. We didn't stay here...maybe one day we will!!! Our visit to the Burj on our last night in Dubai, was to experience the Culinary Flight....visiting various restaurants in the hotel during the night for each course. We started at the bar at the top with views over Dubai....really can't decide which was the best...they were all so original. Al Mahara with the amazing "fish tank" was spectacular...as was the food!!! Overall it was a terrific experience and I would recommend it highly!! Can only imagine what staying at the hotel would be like!!!

Amazing. Very expensive but worth the money for the experienceBe prepared to wear a suit, but you would expect to dress up in this sort of hotel. The food is amazing, the staff help you choose what they think would leave you with memories. Don't expect change from £250, but it could be a one off experience so worth it.

Sharing a drink with the 'in' crowd. Went to the bar one evening while staying nearby. Very pricey, but excellent quality cocktails and good food. Would have been fantastic at sunset, but we couldn't get a booking until after dark.

Amazing place.. This has got to be my most favourite place I have visited in the world so far! On an early arrival we asked if we could have a drink in the sky bar which had been recommended, the receptionist called upstairs and sadly they were too full to accommodate us. The restaurant was a perfect treat to us for our honeymoon. We experienced fine wines and dining at a very costly price, but worth it for a one off. Wouldn't go back now I've been, but we thoroughly enjoyed it.

A 7 star experience. we booked last minute to have high tea at the Burj Al Arab - from the moment you step inside you are made welcome the food and the drink were top drawer and the staff were knowledgeable and friendly. The decore is amazing . The dined at the base of the atrium surrounded by hundreds of fresh red roses. The high tea started with champagne then sandwiches caviar , tuna , chicken and beef but with a twist then cocktail followed by scones and clotted cream finishing with pastries and specialist tea. With the high tea we didn't need an evening meal. A brilliant experience worth every penny
Ultimate Luxury. We went to the Sky Bar for cocktails which were scrumptious,the surroundings were very glamorous,and the view over Dubai at night was not too be missed.Great time had.

high, high in the sky. while we were there, there was a continual haze and unfortunately we had to put our visit to the top on hold..a local advised us to go earlier in the day and preferably mid-week as this is a very popular tourist spot even for Dubain's ..october on is recommended

What a View. We went here for drinks and the view is just breath taking. all tough you will need to take out a mortgage if you want much more that a few drinks and a snack. We also had to laugh at the man who came in just after us and said he had asked for a table with a view. even though other people were also waiting for window seats. did he actually think people go up there and ask for a table with no view??? Idiot.

its too hot. if you are not staying there do not visit during the day as its soo hot that you could fry chicken on the sand.Try and visit the aquarium and inquire about the turtle rehabilitation works done by the hotel. Its quite impressive

Amazing at night. Was what a view! A must for anyone going to Dubai! I even face timed my dad from the top! So pretty at night, can't comment on the day. It was a last minute 11.30pm decision and saw the fountains from the top of the Burj Al Arab! How beautiful
Must do trip. For a treat you must have afternoon tea at Skyview Bar. Take your time and enjoy. Don't forget your camera!

skybar-a must. Had an amazing evening at the burj -advance booking required, we booked a window table for cocktails this carried a minimum spend which was the equivilant of between 2-3 drinks each.Hotel, service, views all amazing- definately one to do whilst in Dubai

Excellent hotel on par with it's 7 star rating!. My wife and I spent an evening at the hotel for her birthday celebration and everything was amazing and beautiful as expected for this 7-star hotel. Definitely worth the experience while in Dubai!

Breathtaking. Just looking at the building is amazing. Such an architectural wonder! At night, it is lit up so spectacularly. Most likely it is so aircraft can see it. But to us, it is a sight to behold.

Amazing. As I work also with tour operators in Dubai they took me for a visit at Burj Al Arab. As we arrived there were parked Ferrari, Lamborghini, and all the most luxurious cars you can even imagine. Inside the are a lot of fountains. They took us inside one of the biggest suite (720 square my) on 2 levels and all the luxury you can imagine. They also loan for free gold ipad to their guests. If I am not wrong the smallest room goes around $2000 per night. Maybe one day :)

high tea. disapointed with high tea, very poor for very high price, sandwiches were dry, chefs carvery beef dry, cakes uninteresting and dry.
building and interior decor beautiful

Only from a distance. Hoping to get a glimpse of the inside we went there by taxi. But a group of securityguards prevented us from entering. Only when you have a booking for one of the restaurants you are welcome. That was a bit to much of our budget so we just took pictures of the outside and left.

High Wow Factor . I've been to a lot of hotels and there aren't many I can say have had me standing dumbfounded as soon as I walk in the door. The Burj Al Arab has a daunting level of opulence. From the immaculately dressed staff who are on hand to answer questions, to the paintings and decorations on the walls,  through to the aquariums to either side of the escalators, and the soaring level of the ceiling above,  everything screams look at me! I can only imagine what the rooms are like as I'm unlikely to ever have the funds to justify a stay there.  We were there for the high tea at the sky view lounge. The elevator for this service is towards the back of the hotel and gives you enough time to appreciate the money, sorry, lavish settings around you. A tip for those visiting is to get there early. Seating is on a first come, first seated basis. We had a 1pm sitting so got there at 12:30 and scored a window seat easily. The high tea itself is a fairly standard affair and nothing out of the ordinary for such an occasion. It's all very good,  make no mistake, but you're not going to be blown away with what's presented on your plate. But come on, you didn't come for the food. You came for the experience and that's exactly what you get. Sitting high above the Dubai skyline you get wide, sweeping views of all around while you eat in air-conditioned luxury, sipping Louis Roederer champagne, and deciding which tea you want from the exhaustive listing. We gave the Supreme Oolong and Date Tea a go and can highly recommend both. All too soon you'll come to the end of your last course and it's time to pay the piper so get that credit card out. While there are different sittings,  we at no point I  the afternoon felt rushed to finish our food and drinks, and courses were only brought out once the prior one had been completed. For a bit of luxuriant fun,  go to high tea at the Burj Al Arab. It's not cheap, but it's certainly a wonderful memory.

Opulance. The most stunning hotel im probably ever going to visit , we visited on a tour which included a 7 course chinese buffet , the food was fantastic , the staff friendly. it has the wow factor everywhere from mosaic covered floors,water features,swarofski crystals on the walls and gold everywhere.Totally breathtaking.

Fabulous High Tea. This is an experience not to be missed! As you would expect, the service was excellent and the food was fabulous. I'm not usually into taking photos of my food but the artistic way each plate was presented encouraged me to do so. Live music played discreetly in the background, first with a group of musicians then with a beautifully dressed harpist. The ambience was relaxing albeit in an over the top wealthy way. The outlook from the floor to ceiling windows to the water below and the surrounding area was great as well.If you're thinking of staying in this fabulous suite hotel, the cheapest suite will set you back about $US2000 a night and the most expensive $US20,000 a night.

Push your budget and be encapsulated by the experience. We ate at the Burj Al Arab's skyview cafe for afternoon tea. The experience, from start to finish, was brilliant - and worth every penny!The views from around 250 metres above ground level are astounding; with the Palm Jumeirah and the downtown skyline (dominated by the monolithic Burj Khalifa) greeting you on either side of the panoramic glass dining quarter. You can even make out Dubai's newest construction venture - 'The World' - dissappearing into the horizon.The afternoon tea consisted of a seven course journey, encapsulating various sweet and savoury palates. It would therefore be advisable to have a very light breakfast (or none at all) if considering afternoon tea at the Burj Al Arab.The quality of the food went hand-in-hand with the level of service demonstrated by the waiting staff - who were more than happy to have a chat or ask about our stay. I also liked that we were in no way rushed and allowed to complete courses, take pictures and enjoy the experience at our own leisure.The food: lovingly and masterfully crafted; the service: attentive and jovial; the views: out of this world. The rating: five... no, seven stars!

only for those with deep pkts..... we were only able to view this incredible hotel from the security gate at the edge of the drive....plenty of pics taken....disappointed above not being able to take a peek inside but there y'go! thats what you pay for exclusivity and privacy i suppose
See the Burj Al Arab from the public beach?. The best way is to see the famous Burj Al Arab from the public beach. You should not miss enjoying the beach and warm salty water.

Worth every penny to experience. So glad we took the time to do afternoon tea it was a fantastic experience from start to finish Had really wanted a 4 pm sitting but even though I booked early is could only get offered 1pm or 1.30pm. A tip that if I had picked the 1pm it is more likely we would have got a window seat and we were initially disappointed we did not. This was despite us saying it was my 50th - I guess lots of people are third for a special celebration, From arrival to leaving the service was first class . It was very personal - names were used my birthday was acknowledged by several of the team . Attention to detail second to none. Staff offered to take photos near the windows and we were very pleased with those as they took time and got great shots . I guess they have plenty of practice .You start with a glass of champagne - Louis Roedderer with a fruit tart was perfectly matched.The beef dish was replaced for me with a cheese and tomato option which arrived on quel as they had asked if there were things we did nt eat at the beginning. There was no need to remind staff and they remembered this when explaining sandwiches Sandwiches come next You can ask for more sandwiches if you like any in particular . Some of the the breads used were flavoured and unusual . All were very tasty .The tiny cakes were scrumptious and as it was my birthday an extra birthday cake with a candle arrived with a red rose . They lit the candle but thankfully non one sang! After taking advantage if photo opportunities we left by requesting a buggy to Madinet and on the way the buggy driver suggested a stop for more photos , He obliged and they are better than those from the bridge Don't hesitate for a once in a lifetime experience - having said that I would nt hesitate to go again it was a fabulous way to spend several hours. My one disappointment I definitely could not manage dinner that evening our last in Dubai

Nice to see. Im not into this kind of mega rich things, but when you are in Dubai this is a must. Personally, i like it much more from outside, once you get in you got blinded by amount of kitsch, but I must admmit that construction inside as well is impressive. We got there just for cup of tea (most expensive cup of tea in my life), because without reservation you cant get in. We had it down in lobby, so we weren't on the top - that was overbooked and more expensive. Anyway, we had some finger food and sweets included with tea, overall it was ok. You must dress properly to get in here, so male with pants or jeans (covered knees), same for women, covered knees and shoulders.

7star services. Everyone must do afternoon tea at this 7 star quality hotel. Well worth the money for the experience, food amazing & loads offered. Champagne, wine, coffee just brillant & the staff cannot do enough for you. Views are amazing from the restaurant
High Tea at Burj. If you go to Dubai - must go for high tea at Burj. It is worth the money and wonderful experience. The view is wonderful and cakes etc were very good too!
Opulent yet inviting. If your licky enough to stay or be an invited guest to this hotel your lucky enough! !!!!!!!!'!!!!!!!!
Very enjoyable!. We wanted to have a meeting with potential clients and after checking on options available, I booked for drinks and canapes on the top floor. Nobody was disappointed!

Everyone should get to experience this luxury.. just once... We had a two night stay here at the end of a holiday in Dubai. We had the most wonderful experience from the moment we were picked up until the moment we were dropped off at the airport. We had the standard suite and it was breathtaking. We had a fabulous view and everything about the suite had the feeling of luxuriousness. Some previous reviews have said the decor is gaudy but we felt it was just right and perfectly in keeping with where you are. We stayed under the Summer Dreams package and while this is still ridiculously expensive we felt a package like this was well worth it because of all the benefits. We had breakfast and dinner included both days as well as a massage treatment each and arrival / departure transfers. We were so pleased that we had decided to book two nights as we felt you needed this amount of time to experience all of the facilities. The full sized Hermès toiletries are an added treat! The staff were all exceptional and couldn't do enough for us particularly the butler on our floor Syed and the guy that set up our in room breakfast (Raza?) did an outstanding job. The beach for the hotel is fabulous and the swimming pool is lovely too with a nice view out over the water. We hope we are lucky enough to stay here again in the not too distant future!

Dining - what a fabulous evening. We ate in the Al Iwan Restaurant (Arabic Buffet), the food was delicious and the service was exceptional. William was our personal waiter who attended to our every needs.The evening was finished in style as we returned to our hotel (Mina A Salam) in the Rolls Royce Phantom.

Disappointing actually. My wife and I had one full day in Dubai and having high tea at the Burj was something we were really looking forward to. Being the only (I think?) 7 star hotel in the world we expected something very special. Unfortunately we were disappointed. Perhaps our expectations were too high. The hotel is beautiful, but nothing overly stunning on the inside, at least the area we had access to. High tea was good, but not great. There was lots of food to be sure, your usual high tea fare, and lots of very good teas to try as well. But we didn't care for some of the sandwiches etc. The view was somewhat disappointing as we were hoping to have a nice view of the palm island. We were seated on the opposite side to the islands and the day was very hazy with no clear view at all. Overall I would say our visit was ok, but not what we had hoped for.

Something you should experience. We went here for an evening meal. We choose the buffet and every thing there was amazing ! Everything you could want , and the puddings were to die for ! Really amazing hotel but I wouldn't want it stay there , as i would always prefer The One and Only The Palm.

Absolute luxury. We had the seven course afternoon tea at the Japanese restaurant on the basement floor. Words can't do this experience justice as the whole setting, meal and staff are superb. Food delicious and a fabulous setting in a truly world class hotel.

Complete disappointment. We visited Burj Al Arab on the 20th of September after booking a dinner at the Al Iwan restaurant. It was supposed to be a thematic Moroccan night. I'd like to start from the greeting itself- personally, I believe that the hotel staff greet people differently, depending on what clothes they have or which car they arrive in. A Ferrari stopped in front of us and, of course, all of the porters literally ran to open the door for the people inside. And we were treated indifferently since we arrived in a Mercedes. This whole thing left a weird mark on our experience from the beginning, but we decided to let it go.So, we were seated in the restaurant and with that ended the actual attention from the staff. For 550 aed per person, I would say that the food was on an actually low level, especially when we are talking about a 7-star hotel. It wasn't that delicious nor was there such a big variety. And the most surprising thing is that we even had to pay for the water, which is a bit ridiculous since all the other restaurants we visited offered complimentary water. The buffet was rather poor and almost boring. Plus, there was nothing Moroccan the whole night! Aside from all that, the service itself was nothing special- the staff was as if picking whom to be kind to and to whom to pay more attention and during the whole time, I felt like I was gifted with their presence, you know? I cannot believe that a hotel at this level would allow such poor service at the restaurant(s) inside.Overall, I would never repeat this again because, trust me, it isn't worth the money for the quality you get. Also, I wouldn't recommend it to any of my friends- unneccesary waste of money and time. Honestly, in other restaurants in Dubai, you would be treated like Kings and Queens.

Amazing experience and stay!. What an amazing place to stay! It worth every penny for the experience. Rooms are incredible ....everything from the toiletries to the chocolates to the service are over the top. They will even offer to "draw your bath water" if you would like. The views from the sky view bar are awesome. The flowers in the lobby are beautiful.
Don't bother. Extremely overrated - sure it is all glitzy but in such a bad taste. I would say don't bother, your time is better spent elsewhere.
Go and visit luxury. A very decent and charming place at least visit this place once in your life.its worth spending there in 7 * hotel
Wonderful evening- sky bar. Friendly and sophisticated, relaxing and tasty. The cocktails were a delight. Thank you Stephen. Build is a must see.
Disappointed. Yes it was nice to visit and to see the iconic building, but not being able to get close to get a decent photograph because the surrounding beaches are private is very disappointing

Best hotel in the world with best spa. Me and my friend booked an appointment at TALISE SPA at burj ul Arab our experience was great the masseur was so good and trained in his job I told him that I have pain in my lower back and in my knees he done great massage and I got relief from pain . Thank to that masseur

Amzing afternoon tea!. We decided to treat ourselves to Sky tea in the Sky view bar and even thougha little pricey in comparison to other afternoon teas, it was worth every penny. The views were breath-taking, the menu of teas was just out of this world! The staff were so attentive and friendly. The even surprised us with a gorgeous choolate cake at the end for our anniversary which was devine!

One of the symbols. We went to Sahn Eddar with our kid for the afternoon tea. The hotel is very impressive,although is showing age, it is still luxurious and classy. Very well maintenanted.Wonderfull service. The food at the cafe was not something great but we were not there to eat, were we?All in all, it is worth the visit there.

Excellent Afternoon Tea. I went here with my husband for our anniversary, we were at the skyview bar which is right at the top of the hotel, the service was great, the views of the ocean amazing. The inside lobby and reception were amazing. The afternoon cost us 560AED each roughly about £100, we got a lot of food for that amount and very lovely staff who looked after us, they bought out a anniversary cake, chocolates and rose for me, which was a nice suprise

WOW. To be in the tallest building in a world in a desert, is not a every day occurance. Even though the building is 824m tall, the public can aces" only" to 124 floor.The view from above is almost like watching a virtual movie.You are in this great piece of architecture, but looking down , it looks all " dead-ish", grey and orange color. But when you go down, it all takes a very attractive look, well organised and planed. For me, to apreciate Dubai for what it really is to , drive around and take it all in, than go and have a look from the top.

Afternoon tea and drinks at the bar. Been here twice - once for the afternoon tea with my husband and another time for drinks at the bar with friends who were visiting Dubai. The decor of the hotel lobby is not quite my cup of tea (a little too extravagant for my liking) especially with the bright red, blue and gold colours. However, the restaurant is tastefully decorated. Ambience is great. Service is outstanding as one would expect in a 7 star hotel. The afternoon tea with champagne is a little pricey but well worth it. Everything was delicious. The choice of teas were great! The only minor setback would be the food served (apart from scones and desert) were a little cold. It's an experience dining and being in a hotel that's world class and I would recommend it. You need to secure your reservation in advance with a credit card booking as no vehicles/taxis are allowed into the hotel area without a print out or email copy of the booking. This is a good thing because it maintains the hotel's standards otherwise you will find tourists thronging the place. And reserve in advance for a table with a good view :)
Experience of a life time. The cocktail lounge has great views of Dubai, the cocktails are to die for but the hotel lacks atmosphere for a 7 star hotel. Great experience though

Mixed feelings. We wanted to tick this hotel off the list of "must see" things in Dubai.On the positive side: staff was very good, friendly and attentiveOn the negative: prices (obviously), the hotel itself was a bit disappointing; decor was a bit dated which I guess is normal for 15 year old hotel; however if I am paying £25 for a cocktail I'd expect the whole experience to be "wow" which it wasn't.Overall however, it was worth the visit (it is the only 7* hotel in the world, after all)

Amazing!. Stayed here for my birthday in December and weather was beautiful. We had a 1 bed suite on two floors and own butler who was available 24/7. I had a cake and bubbles on arrival which was a lovely touch! Also a credit in the restaurant which was again very nice. If your after luxury, this is the place.

Inevitable when you visit Dubai. I recommend to visit Burdj Al Arab in the evening to enjoy a drink in the bars situated in the top floor. You should book in advance and your hotel should be able to do the booking and get dressed for the occasion. The quality of the cocktails is very good.
Not worth the money. Buy tickets before you go. It's ok. Not as spectalulor as I thought. Really not worth the money. Best just to look at it from the bottom

jawdroppingly good. Totally understand why this hotel has 7 stars and has been voted the most luxurious hotel in the world. Words cannot describe it, the actual hotel is jaw droppingly beautiful, the customer service is quite simply superlative, and the food......the food......afternoon tea was beyond belief. Its not for those on a budget, but such an experience, made it worth every single penny. Quite simply the most glorious place Ive ever been to, bar none......

Enjoyable experience. How can you come to Dubai and not have afternoon tea at the Burj Al Arab. 6 course afternoon tea with believe it or not a beef and mash course! Scones and passion fruit jam were super. Service was great although some of the staff didn't understand us at times which led to a party member who had a fish allergy being given tuna and salmon sarnies. All in all an enjoyable experience but not as relaxed as it could have been. Lovely harpist playing in the background was great.

High Tea - superb! . Yes expensive but worth every penny. Pre booked on line very easy to do. Superb service, mouthwatering food and it just kept coming. Views to die for and made to feel very welcome. Thank you for a great treat.

Tourist trap beware!. We wanted to book for afternoon tea, ended up only being able to get drinks at the sky view lounge. Where they first seated us we could see nothing, was only glare of bar lights in reflection of glass. The couple beside us refused to pay the full required bill and just bought one cocktail each and then left. We bought a bottle of champagne that was over $300, normally $150, drank it quickly then left. Although they moved us so we could see some sites through the glass, even the decor was faded and seemed dated. Really not what we were expecting at all particularly for the cost!
The Sail. Beautiful building and landmark right next to the beach, we didn't actually go in the building but its stunning from the outside.
Brunch at Skyview. Exceptional food, great service, a little pricey but definitely worth doing it at least once in your life.

High Tea. The best seat in the sky deck view amazing but could the staff stop trying so hard just relax please they almost made the day to stiff. If thats the way people who stay 6 star expect to be treated then i'm happier being poor.

AMAZING MASTERPIECE. Our Dubai City tour gave us the chance to take a closer photo op with this amazing 7-star hotel. Dubai visit would never be complete if you fail to see it from our very own eyes! The structure is very imposing with no other buildings to obstruct the view from a distance. When I arrived home from Dubai, I made an amazing work of art from this architectural wonder. And I would like to share! Truly a picture of achievement on my part to personally to have seen it from my very own eyes!

Champagne afternoon tea. Lovely, but did not warrant it's seven star rating. Not a patch on the Jumeriah Zabeel Saray!! Appeared to herd people in and out as per slot. Looked impressive from the outside but due to it being brightly coloured inside, it made the hotel to look slightly dated.

Great experience, but you must be 21 to have the afternoon tea!. Booked afternoon tea for 3 at the Burj al arab well in advance and turned up on the day only to find that as a 20 year old, I am not actually allowed to have the afternoon tea as it is served in the bar, for which you must be 21 to sit in. Fortunately we were able to switch to a 3 course lunch which was brilliant. The food was excellent, service excellent and it seems that the view from the restaurant was better than the view from the bar!

A bit far off. This attraction (as the beaches) is a bit far from the Metro circuit, so if you would like visit it, there are some guided tours of the city (you can purchase these from most front desks at hotels) that will take you there.

Afternoon tea was a delight!. We just enjoyed the 4pm sitting of afternoon tea in the sky view bar. Amazing views, attentive but not pretentious service and vegetarian catered for. Watched the sun set and had a relaxing time in beautiful surroundings. They just keep bringing course after course so be prepared to feel full!!

Nice but impossible to visit during day. We have been now in the summer in dubai and its impossible to walk outside around. So the only possibility to get a glimpse of this structure was to go to the 360 bar in the evening. You get an amazing view of the hotel from the outside.If you want to visit the hotel from inside , you have to book some expensive tea or meal package.
Beautiful land mark!. I'm always amazed at the architecture of the place. Its brilliant and I hope that one day I am able to stay in one of the rooms. But for now its just good enough for pictures
Total high tea experience. A real must to have a high tea, but you have to book before you go. But well worth the visit and the views are spectacular.

Overrated. I had a afternoon tea at sky bar last month. Well.. I can recommend you to have a cup of tea for one of experiences at Dubai but it's not worth paying for.
It's too expensive considering served foods. Just an experience at the world's most expensive hotel.

Junsui afternoon tea. Quality food, relaxed atmosphere, personal attention from Staff, but never sycophantic, as a 30th Anniversary present from our kids, got cake and flowers, a beautiful, quality but understated personal touch.....loved everything about it!!

The best Afternoon Tea I have ever had.. Booked Sky Tea in the Sky bar, it's a lit pricey but really worth the experience... not only do you have an amazing view of the palm and Dubai City, but the afternoon tea service and experience here is second to none. The staff are so attentive and genuinely nice, the food (7 courses) was unbelievable and you can have as many refills of tea and sandwiches that you want. Champagne was also really good. The whole experience of even being in the Burj Al Arab itself just adds to the atmosphere and will stay with you forever.

opulence everywhere. blown away by this.loved every minute. the place is magical,especially when you first walk in. There might be somewhere else to go which will beat it, but we haven't seen it.service was wonderful.whilst having drinks in the skyview bar.
Burj Al Arab. Beautiful views, especially at night. Has a sky high tennis court, where you can see views of the sea, city and madinat Jumeira. Amazing
Go, just take a photo!. This is the only 7* hotel in the world, so worth going just to take a look at how the other half lives! Nice for sitting in with a cocktail in hand .

A Famous icon. A very popular hotel which was really very extravagant. The fact that it's on the shoreline, it makes it more attractive. Nothing in particular that really interest me most apart from it's an Icon and a very different building. Once you seen it for few minutes,,you tend to move to your next attraction! but it's worth seeing and taking picture for your selfies ;)

Money can't buy/ 7*. We dine underneath this hotel with the aquarium around us. What an experience.Everything you see inside is amazing. Looks very expensive. As far as I know the whiskey dated 1800 for one shot was something like £ 70,000, same price as our Porsche car. And you get the glass and a certificate. On the 24th floor they have a cocktail that I drink- none alcoholic was £2,000. The thing was, no price on ladies menu. Only if I know the price before drinking I won't drink it. God knows how much my husband pay for the restaurant.I notice there was no Arab staff. Everything was foreign staff. The water fountain, the carpet the wall everything was stunning. I never seen like it in my life.But ladies- it's worth of an experience. I can recommend. But be aware the weather outside is terribly hot like 45 to 50 degree, feels like inside the oven.I visited 2008.... (I can't entry on the year below)I'm not sure if you have to pay to view but if you stayed in- no pay for viewing.

7 Star all the way!. This really is something special. Treated like royalty from the minute we entered the hotel. Food was stunning, waking up to views over the Persian Gulf and Palm where breath taking.
visit it. it is a sample of dubai before burj o al arab but intrance is so expensive and the betteh way to take photo of that is the time you go to wild wady

Expensive afternoon tea for a view. I booked the afternoon tea in order to visit the building up close. The booking was quite strange that the reservation desk wanted to do the transaction thru email. They emailed me to provide the credit card information by replying to their request. I called and told them that I don't want to put my credit card number and expiration date. Sorry, this is not what we do in the States... They agreed to take the number over the phone but asked me to fax the copy of the card over. I felt this is reasonable than giving it electronically. With the high charges for their service, I think they can do better with the reservation for foreigners. Why don't they used the e-commerce for the payment???
A true delight. This place is amazing, anyone visiting Dubai should go there and see it. Absolutely amazing sight. Beautiful views, very lavish inside and out. A must see for tourists !!!.
Beach. The beach at the Al Qasr hotel of Jumeirah Madinat offers a beautiful view of Burj Al Arab. Really good like!No dislikes there really!!

Bad experience!. We had a very bad experience in the bar of Burj Arab!First of all you have to book in advance and they ask your email address to send you the reservation copy. However you never know that in the same copy they never mention a minimum spent per capita!

High tea. Well worth doing , view of private beach while enjoying course after course i per booked from Australia to ensure I could get in, you cant enter hotel unless you have a booking , going to go back and stay even if only for one night very expensive rooms

AWESOME!. This 7 star hotel is one of the most beautiful hotels I've ever seen. We made a reservation for a high tea at the skybar (90 euro per person). To make a reservation is the only way to visit in the hotel. It took 3 hours and the food and tea were amazing. The best thing of all was the amazing view on the Palm Island including the Atlantis Hotel. This experience was worth every penny.

Cannot enter if you dont have reservation. we were hoping to get a look at this great structure from inside. But sadly when we reached the gates it was told to us one can enter only if there is a reservation. You can make a hi-tea reservation to enter. It was totally our miss. Putting this post to let people know about pre-booking is a must if you want to see Burj Al Arab from inside.
.... There really isn't a whole lot to say. Like most of Dubai, this too is an empty shell. No story, no history, no quality. Just a lot og shiny facades...
Unique. After seeing it live, I watched a documentary about it and it is incredible how technological this building is: clearly worth a visit

SUSHI LIKE NEVER BEFORE. Went for dinner at the Sushi restaurant and it was brilliant. I have never seen so many different sushi cuisines at any one location at the same time. The ambience was beautifully complemented by the series of orchid arrangements.
Perfect ❤️. Everything perfect and class! Really good and beautiful! Good service , everything what I need! Perfect Perfect ! Perfect! Perfect! Perfect!perfect!
great bar and bar food - but pricey!. went to the Burj for drinks and some food - everything about the place is fantastic (including the prices) but it is well worth a special trip -

a luxury hotel a luxury life example of dubai. what a beautiful and wondering tall tower one of the most expensive and attractive building in the world what you cannot find in burj-al-arab everything you can find in this beautiful tower look like swimming in the sea hotels restaurants clubs disco luxury appartments and suits and world wide brands for shopping if u come to Dubai you suppose to do not miss it out its located in in jumiera.
The beach boat. I didn't visit Burj. Just morning visit a beach in front a hotel. The beach is under reconstruction and more tourists are coming only to make a pictures of Burj.

over priced. Had tea at the Burj August 2013 for a birthday treat for me with the family (6 of us) was huge inside but to dated for my liking. Also tea was not all that. Service and atmosphere was poor. We had tea at Harrods the year before and was a lovely experience.
Nice. Very nice but a bit pricey. View from the top was excellent. The food was good, the lobby was immense.

Youve read and heard the Hype? Well its true!! All of it!. What can i say? This hotel is unbelievable. The service is impeccable, from the moment you are greeted at the entrance it is an experience like no other. We stayed for our honeymoon and it was excellent. The room was clean but also fantastic in amenities and personalised service. The restaurant Al-Mahara is also excellent.Even at check out they pull out all the stops to help you. Excellent place.
A unique 7 star hotel. Standing on it's own island, this hotel looks like a sail.It is especially beautiful at night when lit up

Expensive But Worth It. You have to have reservations to get a crossed the bridge to go to Burj Al Arab. We booked cocktails at night in the Skybar. The place is amazing with an interesting décor. The sky bar actually hangs out the back of the building. It is hard to get pictures through the glass at night due to the blue and green lights. The staff was very attentive and made our group of 11 time a lot of fun. We did have to break up to be able to order what we wanted Any party over 8 has a mandated menu. We spit up kids (young adults) and adults which worked well. There is a diverse drink menu which we enjoyed tasting each others drinks. It is not a big place so book early.

less than expected. Its a fancy hotel but worn out I expected better still nice and luxurious and you must visit it once in Dubai .the rooms are duplex and the gold decor are impressive but I think it needs some renovations

End to a month of traveling. This was the last piece of luxury before getting back to home and back to reality.. Aka work. It was expensive but considering we spent about 4 hrs in total in the hotel I think it was a great experience. Great service. Many little courses. You think you'll be starving when you see the tiny portions but trust me you'll be full by the end. The views are amazing. It was over cast the day we went unfortunately. We say the sun set and the city come alive. Highly recommended if you can afford it
Worth a visit. Burj Al Arab is a fab hotel and we went for afternoon tea service was good and the staff was very friendly

Nice place to visit and see in Dubai. Was and still one of the landmarks of Dubai, so visiting it or the beach beside it is a must, the building was constructed at the begining of the development of Dubai yet it is still one of the most attractive places since it is the first world 7 star hotel.
Afternoon Tea at the Burj. Second visit and somewhat disappointed - higher charge for afternoon tea than before and not as good selection or quantity of food.Bit of a production line

We got engaged!. I planned and booked afternoon tea in the sky bar at sunset where I proposed to my now wife. Very important to book way in advance if you are wanting to visit and the staff were extremely considerate and helpful even seating us in the corner table with view out to sea on both sides.At the end of our sitting we were brought champagne, roses and that was my moment.The walk to the Burj and then entrance is spectacular and very opulent, large aquarium walls, gold stair cases etc.There is obviously a dress code, and ask for a window table if you can.A very expensive but very memorable visit.
Luxury life. you must try even once to feel the different life style of enjoyment its feeling of luxury and simple

Very nice experience. Its an amazing place with both the designs, the golden elevators, the high roof, fountains and much more. I had dinner at both the top and "under water" restaurant. They both served very good food. The view from the top restaurant is amazing and at the down restaurant you have an aquarium wall so theres big fishes swimming at one side of the table in a panoramic view.

A memorable luxury a must feel the surprise and ambience of Burj al Arab. The architect and shopping ambience is bespoke for luxury.The colors and furniture and fixtures will definitely stimulate your mood and sense to its best.

High Tea. You need a reservation at a restaurant to get into the hotel. The High Tea was in the Sky View Bar on the 27th floor. It was excellent. Although it was expensive, it was worth every penny! The lobby was impressive and the stores in the mezzanine were fabulous. We had a very good experience!

Lunch at Burj Al Arab Restaurant. We had lunch in the restaurant at the top floor of Burj Al Arab. Beautiful restaurant. Very good view. Food is surprisingly good. Not as expensive as we thought. Worth trying.
THE BEST HOTEL STAY EVER. The magnificent hotel shape is just the beggining of a real royal and relaxing adventure. They surprissed us a lot every day. The service is spotless...

Absolutely Dubai. FYI...... Unless you book ahead, at a cost, you won't get past the gate. Afternoon 'high tea' is around $60 australian dollars which is around the same price as in Australia. Awesome building that is worth a visit.

An experience. Had cocktails in the sky bar to celebrate our wedding anniversary. The waiters couldn't do enough for us. We got a table overlooking the Dubai City centre, which was a bonus. Drinks are expensive but worth the experience.
Burj al Arab. Only look good in and out but very expansive if you have extra money then and then only you visit this place other wise you can take photo from out side

It's worth for ever. A wonderful luxury sky view bar at the 27th floor, best place to be ordered snack show the really worth view ever i had in my journey. might be back to soon as possible
Highly i can recommended this place for the best travelers.

The first baby of Dubai tourism royalty. Since its inception; its still considered as the most luxurious. The underwater restaurant is an experience at its finest, go to the skyview bar for an amazing view. Amazing architecture with an expensive price tag.

One of the 7 star hotel...( as they say). Great views!! A superb architecture and great at Hospitality. It truly is 7 Star as it boasts. Entry is by permit or appointment only. It has great location, great restaurants and amazing rooms.( Its expensive though...as its truly luxury)
Great idea would be to book Breakfast or High Tea and visit and see the place.

Amazing High Tea!. We went to the Burj for High tea in the Sky Lounge ... AMAZING!! The food and the view was out of this world! It was our wedding anniversary and they gave us a rose, chocolates and a chocolate cake which I thought was a lovely touch! :-)

Exquisite!. We went for dinner at the only restaurant on the 27th floor, Al Munhata if I recall correctly. Loves every minute, every second. Very pricey! We only had a starter, main, a few soft drinks and a bottle of red. This all came to nearly 1000AED, for a family of 4 adults. But it was worth it, and I will definitely return. Wonderful food, wonderful service, wonderful views, wonderful hotel! A definite must go, if ever in Dubai. Simply for the experience.

Worth every minute!. A wonderful luxury Hotel. I've been to the Sky view Bar at the 27th floor. Amazing view!!! Great service. We ordered snack and drinks that we're ok (it was not dinner if you intend to have dinner here it's quite expensive), but the real thing was the place and it's view. You must book prior to your visit. Highly recommended!
Starwars drinks. I went to the Burj Al Arab for drinks in the skyview bar. The drinks were great and the service was excellent. The bar was kind of retro with a star wars (space adventure) feeling.

Always Amazing. Another great stay at Burj Al Arab. The best place to go and relax around the pool with great staff and service. The Burj Al Arab staff are simply the best and each year it seems to get better. They will go out of their way to make guests happy and give a holiday to remember. Thank you Burj Al Arab!

Splash out on afternoon tea or evening drinks. This place is amazing!!! Unless you're a paying guest (way above most people's means), the only affordable way you can get in is by afternoon tea or evening drinks, and neither of them come cheap. I opted for evening drinks in the 27th floor Skyview Bar (min spend 325 dirhams but wow, was it worth it). The decor throughout is stunning - talk about opulent! A really special occasion and a pleasure to splash out. Note that if you're not a resident or don't have a booking, you won't get near the place.

Opulent. We visited for High Tea which was the only way we could probably afford to visit here. Everything was a bit 'over the top' as far as luxury goes and the view from the top was very nice - so was High Tea.
Unforgettable After Noon Tea at Burj Al Arab.. I planned to take a after noon tea at Burj Al Arab in Sahn Edder.it was fantastic experiance with my family.

Magnificent Place. We were treated to a five course dinner at one of the restaurants and it was an absolute delight. The food was really good so was the service. The decor is a bit extreme but it is the Burj Al Arab. I really enjoyed seeing in the distance how the building connects with the other property that looks like a wave. It is really exciting and interesting. Would love to stay there some day.

Afternoon tea. We were lucky enough to have afternoon tea here on 27th august and it was a fantastic experience,well worth the money. The service alone is second to none,everyone was very attentive and friendly and for a couple of hours we were treated like royalty. Our attendant was a young man named Eranda and he was an absolute delight . He was more than happy to answer any questions we had and Evan showed us the grand ball room. The food was delicious and plentiful so much so that we didn't need dinner that night. If you get the chance to go,do it! It was definitely the highlight of our visit to Dubai

Terrifyingly excellent!. You can't go to Dubai and not take the chance to go up the world's tallest building! Slick, quick (you only need an hour, not two), free WIFI at the top, stunning views and professional photos at the top. Booking ahead is essential people! Use the official website and collect your tickets on the day, sunset is spectacular but busy.

The Burj Al Arab Hotel. Stunning Hotel. The Foyer is amazing with tiny fountains cascading down from upper floors to the ground floor, and giant Aquariums teeming with fish on either side of the walls alongside the escalators. The fittings in the Ladies & Gents are all solid gold. The ceiling was spectacular as was all the fittings and fixtures. We had Afternoon Tea there which was a reasonable price for all the food provided. Tea, Coffee, dainty sandwiches and a wide selection of cakes and pastries. All served on delightful crockery in elegant surroundings and fabulous views across the Arabian Gulf. As night approaches the whole of the Burj Al Arab lights up with an ever changing colour sequence, and huge flames of fire shoot up to the night sky on both sides of the entrance. I would love to have the funds to stay at this truly stunning hotel. Maybe one day!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

So beautiful. This place is very beautiful. It is an architectural marvel. I just had a buffet lunch at Al Iwan where the food and service were excellent.I hope I can actually stay in the hotel in the future with my family-that will be a dream come true.
Is beautiful inside. We had the evening meal at the top which was fab. Staff were friendly and made us feel really welcome. Well worth going.
Not cheap but unmissable. Hold back on asking for more sandwiches otherwise you'll be too full to enjoy the sweats. Views & service were beyond my expectations

A bit of a dissapointment. I am not in the financial position to stay at The Burj Al Arab but whilst it is visually stunning it is not quite like you see the photos of it. It is actually in the middle of a building site at the moment and so for poor tourists who go to look at it the stunning photos you have seen of it are not like the real thing.

Afternoon Tea: disappointing.... The afternoon tea at Burj Al Arab hotel trades on the mystique attached to the place, in our opinion quite undeserved. We were only impressed by the hotel's huge atrium and the outside design of the building. If you really want to see the jaw-dropping opulence and no-expense-spared architectural marvel you’d be better visiting the Emirates Palace in Abu Dhabi.The décor at the Skyview Bar is pretty unremarkable and the seats along the inner curved sofa slightly uncomfortable and not individual enough. Combine the lack of view with the sofa seat and then you may want to question whether that UAE 600 was the money well spent.Without the panorama afforded to the window seats there is nothing really unique about this venue and, ideally, inner seats should be priced at a discounted rate. You can get a window seat (these are allocated on the first-come-first-served basis) but to make sure be there up to one hour before your allocated time.In any case, the whole area of Dubai seems to be permanently enveloped in desert haze so even the views are not that clear.The canapés are rather average though originally presented and quite plentiful. Don’t get suckered into buying another glass of champagne for you will quickly inflate the cost of the visit before you even notice. The staff serving the food are extremely courteous and helpful.Overall, an attraction to be missed if you are on a budget or with limited time on your hands.

Ultimate Afternoon Tea. This was a very special experience, we were treated to the ultimate Afternoon Tea, a bit pricey but well worth it just to see how the other half live. There are various course to the menu, at least six courses. You start off with a glass of Champagne and strawberry shortcake, then progress on to the other various courses. The whole Afternoon tea lasts about two and a half hours And was an amazing one and not to be missed if your looking for that something special to do. While we were there it was my husbands Birthday, and they presented him with a lovely Birthday Chocolate Cheesecake, which was a very nice touch. You are welcome to walk round the foyer of the hotel, so remember to take your camera.

Beautiful sight... Looks as awe inspiring as it sounds! Afternoon tea is available at a cost, you heed to deposit a minimum of £50 just to be able to walk inside!If you don't want to spend then just go to the beach and get a fantastic viewpoint for a photo to remember
Excellent. it was 1 night stay during a stop over I loved it. Wish I can could have stayed for more nights. I loved the decor, it was breathtaking, sheer creativity and opulence is out of this earth.

Cocktails at the Burj. Booked prior to our visit, it was worth the wait. The approach and entrance of the Burj is certainly captivating. We took several moments to drink in the atmosphere and the palatial surroundings before ascending to the Sky Lounge.Very chic indeed.

Very bad service !! Terrible hospitality. It is such a beautiful hotel with beautiful architecture, interiors, colors and arrangements. But there are no facts written anywhere about the gold used, the fountain, carpets etc etc. I didnt like the idea of having a beautiful under water restaurant in the basement but not allowing the tourists even if they had breakfast in their hotel even though thats a different restaurant. Not everyone can afford to pay and eat at every restaurant. They could have kept admission fee for visitors if they wanted to have it less crowded.Also the MOST important thing was the SERVICE !! It SUCKS ! Even if we had paid for the visit and the food, we were served as though we were beggars. First of all the table were so small to fit 6 people on it then there was nobody who picked up the plates out there. The food was great but they treated us very badly. Being 7 star hotel they shouldnt have such negativity for asians or be racists. I loved the interiors but HATED the management out there !!
Entry fee. Brilliant area, fab service 5 * quality but expect to pay entry fee of 300 dhs pp. and expect a large cancelation fee if you don't show up for reservations.
Mordern Marvel. It is great, shows the vision of the Ruler, exemplary design and height. I think it really stands out in Dubai. Long live Dubai and the Ruler.

One of the exotic hotels I've ever seen. if you going to dubai and everything with the luxury and exotic overwhelming experience , then this is the place if you could afford it , damn expensive yet worth

Truly Magnificent.... I took my mum to the Burj Al Arab in Sahn Eddar Restaurant to celebrate her birthday early. I have always been a huge fan of the Burj, it's a beautiful place to spend an afternoon and I am so happy with the service etc. Firstly the atmosphere within the Burj is relaxing and calm, I have had a bad experience a few years ago when a group of tourists came to the area we were having an afternoon tea and were very loud and rude to the staff. This was a truly magnificent trip, the staff were welcoming, happy and calm which is needed in a Seven Star Hotel. The food is yummy and well prepared, there was an option to have champagne or non alcoholic where they offered Mocktails or Sparkling Date juice. The package offers 7 courses;1)Welcome Drink2)Starter Pastry3)Sandwiches4)Sorbet5)Hot Meal (Beef with potato) 6)Scones & Jam7)Pastries The package includes unlimited soft drinks, mocktails, coffee, teas and water until you finish the High Tea. There was a unique touch to the coffee served, we ordered 2 cappuccino's which had shavings of gold on the top. They also added a Dubai touch to the tea by having Date Jam with scones, it wasn't my favorite but I do think it makes a special touch. The best thing about this experience was the view, it was so beautiful and I was so pleased I saved up because this was a really great experience. Not only was it amazing but we weren't rushed, we arrived at 3pm and left at 5:15pm. We must have finished all of our courses by 5:45 ish but they didn't force us to pay and they were really friendly. I defiantly have to say that it's worth its money! Its 450dhs non alcoholic and 510dhs alcoholic, but with all of the unlimited drinks, brilliant service and wonderful atmosphere! I am so pleased and thank you for this amazing experience. They also asked us why we were there and if we were celebrating something, we mentioned my mums birthday and they added a complimentary cake for her, a really personal memory for us!

Great way to spend an afternoon in Dubai. My wife and I treated our selves to afternoon tea in the sky view lounge(560 Dirhams pp) yes it was expensive but an experience well worth it.The only way past the gate is with receipt of something pre booked.The entrance is impressive only allowed there and the first floor which was nice to look around with it's over opulence.A group off us waited at a the reception area by the two lifts to go up to sky view lounge and was a nice touch that you were put in the lifts in your pairs and welcomed at the other end. The afternoon tea it's self was 7 courses and has been said many times was superb. Only negative was as it was Ramadan we did not get our glass of champagne instead we got sparkling grape juice.

Best afternoon tea in town!. We had the afternoon tea at the Burj al Arab on our final night in Dubai. It was absolutely delicious and very filling with seven courses. We had it in the atrium as the Skybar was fully booked, however we weren't disappointed at all. The setting was lovely with the different coloured floors as a back drop.The service was amazing and couldn't thank them enough. Although you do expect this for the price. I'd certainly make it a must do whilst you are in Dubai if you have the money to spare as it is well worth it for the experience! We also went to the Skybar afterwards for a drink which was lovely and also worth a visit, however we went at night so couldn't see anything but I imagine the views to be fantastic during the day.
Truly amazing experience. Loved the whole experience of brunch, exquisite dining on the 27th floor. Fantastic staff, fantastic food and fantastic views.

One must see this iconic building from the beach. One must see this iconic building from the beach. It is spectacular. Have lunch or dinner at one of the nearby hotel restaurants. If it is hot, the best way to go to the hotel and beach is by taxi. The nearest Metro station is not conveniently close by.

A must visit when in Dubai. Visiting Burj Al Arab is a must at least once for visitors in Dubai. For my taste and my preference , I wouldn't like to visit frequently. Its so rich and so overwhelming. The colors hurt the eye, its too stiff. You can literally smell money. I take my visitors to tour around when they come to Dubai. I liked the rooms. The rooms are more acceptable with regards to design, colors etc... You have definitely reached the top notch of what money can buy when you stay there. The bathroom and shower products are just lovely. I remember it being Hermes products. Tea time there is good.

Unforgettable hotel experience. My husband surprised me with a romantic getaway at the Burj Al Arab..The car came to pick us up at our house and the driver was expecting me with a bouquet of beautiful flowers and some refreshments.The hotel is unique! Some might say kitsch or at least "different"..but is unique. Our room was huge: two floors, two bedroom, huge living room, dining room, office (with a 20" Mac available) and a great view of Dubai, Burj Khalifa, the sea and the beach.Besides that, the service is of a 7 star hotel. You do your check in/check out in your room..no queues! There is always someone around to help and even to push the elevator button for you!The romantic packaged included a lovely dinner on a table specially set for us with roses petals and candle light. The food however was average..nothing outstanding as the rest of the hotel.Next day we had a couple massage that was amazingly relaxing! The experience was great. For sure, really expensive..but it is worthy for once in your life!

Priceless Memories!. Such a lovely unique Afternoon High tea, a little different with its 7 courses of impeccable food. We were in the Sky view bar with stunning views of Downtown and The Palm. Had several different blends from the huge selection. The cake for celebrating our anniversary was a lovely touch, Thank you! So much food to graze upon and we were not rushed, we took 2.5hrs. What you don't eat you can take back with you! The service as expected was wonderful not at all pretentious as sometimes can be at High Tea. It was lovely experiencing the beautiful iconic landmark in person. I especially loved the musicality of the lobby fountain, and the lift to the Sky view bar was like Charlie and the Great Glass elevator! Worth every penny, you will not be disappointed, great memories that last forever, priceless!
Great service. Food was good service was very impress , view it not that clear to see outside in day and night as the sky are blur and dusty and I still think it over price for beverage

Wow experience. This a beautiful hotel and not too be missed! Spiral staircase up to your bedroom.The best thing about staying there was all the free goodies, and the breakfast .Swimming pool nothing to write home about, but small.Decor is over the top, but what do you except for a 7* hotel .I stayed stayed there twice and the first time was wow, the second time ok bit too much ott.Very expensive to stop,eat,drink there but for a one off special it's lovely.

Cannot be visited. The only way of visiting this tower, that should be understood it is a 7 stars hotel, is to book a room (no way) or to reserve one of the bars or restaurants. In the last case, the minimal expense for person in a bar is 300 AED. So, really it could not be visited

How can you go to Dubai and not visit the Burj Al Arab?. We visit for afternoon tea and yes, it was expensive. Yes, it was a hazy day so we didn't have the best of views...but what an experience.Really tasty sandwiches, cakes, scones, pastries and slice of beef with potato. We had a great waiter who just kept filling our plates.After three hours we left feeling very very full, very relaxed and very happy.Even though you may visit on a hazy day still ask for a window table for a much better experience.

A treat. Well worth a visit as the hotel is stunning. The tea is of a very high quality with excellent service and amazing views. A one off experience. I was just disappointed that the dress code is clearly not enforced which is a shame as some visitors were scruffy.

Superb Architecture, but not worth the money. One just cant come back from Dubai without visiting this spectacular piece of architecture. Its awesome in every way. Big & Beautiful with serene sea shore. Since walk-in is not allowed, we had to opt for a breakfast with pocket breaking cost !! 100 USD per person and access upto first floor restaurant only. Although the hotel is very good, ambiance beautiful with dancing fountains, live music an all, food was just OK. Particularly, vegetarian food was average. Got much better breakfast in our regular hotel. Would you believe, it was not even unlimited food, that too for such amount of money !! I heard there is an undersea restaurant, but only for in-house guests.I would advise to go and see from outside but dont spend such money for a lousy breakfast, unless you are staying there at this hotel. Which means you are already a millionaire and then, obviously you would not be worried by this post !! Have a great time :)

Was only near the Hotel. I heard a very interesting story about the most expensive drink ever ordered in the Burj Al Arab hotel,the only 7Star Hotel in the world.Unknown American Business man ordered some Champain for unbeliveable approx.27000dirham.Almost 5400eur and the price was similar with the floor he was in the Hotel,on 27ones.The waitor carried the drink but was so afraid that he will brake it.When the Business man saw him said-You are looking terrible,take a drink...and gave him from the Champaign :))))).Then he ordered one more for himself...Cool guy.So the first most expensive drink in the one and only 7Star Hotel....drunk....the Waiter! OMG :)))))

Afternoon tea. Fantastic afternoon tea we stayed for 3 hours, stunning views and impeccable service. As a very fussy vegetarian the food was specially made for me and was amazing.It was well worth the cost and we also received a special anniversary cake and red rose
Impressive building. Architecture was impressive , lunch overrated ( junsuin) . Indoor fountain is quite something . The view FTO. The restaurant is very nice .
Awesome. Did the 27th floor drinks package only. Highly recommend it. Have to spend min approx Aus$100 p.p. on drinks/food. So easy to do and a great experience.

Hi price but worth it. To avoid let downs you need for sure to make a reservation at one of the restaurants or bars. The experience is extravagant and expensive but you must visit at least once in a life time.
Very uplifting, romantic, and great design. It was build as a unique structure to astonish experts.
All in all, Dubai visitors must see it.

Very disappointing. My agent booked us a buffet lunch. Turn out to be a Chinese restaurant full of Chinese tourists. The food is not worth the USD150 each, our agent charged us.
The "7" star hotel don't seems anything close to it judging from the lobby unless the "gold" decorates and trimmings are, 7 carats?
Simply breathtaking. Professional, attentive and caring staff, very quiet hotel....thumbs up for the restaurant Al Muntaha on the 27th floor, amazing food and extremely romantic! recommend it!

Afternoon tea. Why are people rating this a 1 star just because they haven't made a reservation? If you haven't been in how can you rate it? Anyway.......We went here after a recommendation from friends living in Dubai and we were not disappointed. We booked the afternoon slot and arrived early, which meant we had a window seat over looking the palm, amazing. The service was excellent, the way they pour the champagne is great, really theatrical. The food (sandwiches, wraps, cakes, sweets) were all lovely and the choice of teas were extensive. As it was our anniversary I received a rose and a cake iced with 'Happy Anniversary' to take away, it really was special. Be sure the use the lift furthest away from the reception, as that's the glass lift that looks out to sea.We had a walk around the hotel afterwards and fountains and fish tanks are incredible. The decor is not my taste but you can see the attention to detail in everything.We left just as the sun was setting, and had some gorgeous photos taken as we walked back down the private drive. A must see in Dubai!

An Awesome Experience. We worked at this hotel as part of the pre-opening team and returned back to Dubai after almost 13 years to show our children the place. We visited the hotel and dined at the Bab-al-Yam restaurant by the poolside. The food was amazing - both in taste and in selection available. The restaurant staff were also great and looked us us very well while we were there. This hotel is a definite 'must visit' while you are in Dubai.

Legendary food experience. Went for our 10 year anniversary and experienced the culinary flight. Not cheap, but it was awesome. One of those once in a lifetime things that, if you can make it work, you simply have to do!

Incrediable. Its very hard to beat this hotel. many of the 5 stars hotels do not stand a chance to compete with this hotel. the faultless service and the extra special touches, this hotel is incredible. The location is just perfect.
Nice to see. It is just a building, although it is very expensive. I haven't slept in it but it is a nice point of interest.
Beautiful.. Spectacular building looks extremely beautiful at night. Would have liked to see it a bit more during the day but unless your dining there or staying there then it's a no no.

Great Monument. A double "Guinees World record" holder. Alls well !
Great place and again a double world record holder. For the Tallest building and the most speediest lift / elevators. Mesmerizing view from the 88th floor of the City and the great 'KNOT" !
Wow restaurants and cafes.
Wow show !!
A must visit , in ambition
Good but pricey. Had dinner on the beach overlooking the hotel. Good food, great service but probably would have preferred inside the hotel.

Afternoon Tea. I had afternoon tea at the Burj Al Arab, it was absolutely immense! The service was outstanding, the food fantastic and plentiful. A few pointersYou must take your booking confirmation with you.Dress smart - I was worried what was appropriate, I wore a knee length dress with sandals and a shawl.
