No videos in the main lobby, but photographs are fineIf you ask the reception to order a taxi, it won't be the standard Dubai taxi - something a little more luxurious, which will be a little more expensive!This is a great treat to yourself if you are visiting Dubai.

The Best in the World. Just spent 4 days for our 10th Anniversary in the most luxurious hotel in the world. Met at the Aeroplane door for the premium Ahlan service, taken to a lounge for a drink while our bags were collected , escorted through passport control into our white Rolls Royce where our driver was waiting with a bouquet of roses for my wife. 9am arrival , early check in granted and our butler Jafer (the king of butlers)ran the Jacuzzi for us. Champagne and Anniversay cake delivered compliments of the team ( nice touch) . This couldn't have gotten off to a better start. Champagne afternoon tea and cocktails in the Skyview Bar (7 courses) .worth every penny. Went to Amal for dinner @ the Armani Hotel great Indian food,had Friday Champagne Brunch @ Nobu in the Atlantis phenomenal (Saffron Atlantis ) is a Brunch Rabble and try to palm you off with Jacobs Creek as champagne. ( walked out) Now 4:30pm and at N'Dulge day club , full on disco party, DJ and Shisha. Used the Burj S Class Mercedes to chauffeur us around. ( Good Value) though taxis are cheap. Saturday Spa , my wife had a La Prairie Gold Facial and Swedish Massage and said it was the best experience she has ever had in a Spa ( special thanks to Lauren) Lunch in the Burj beach bar (prawn tapas) sensational and breakfast in the Pool Bar cafe each morning was of the highest calibre ever experienced in a hotel, you have to see it to believe it. Trust me when I say this, any negative reviews about this hotel are from people who grudge spending money on the best things in life or who don't get allowed past the strict security.If you can afford a few days and it's a special occasion do it ,there is nowhere better and believe me I'm in the industry an nowhere else touches this for luxury and quality service. Many thanks to all our Butlers during our stay , our Chauffeur drivers and Spa girls for looking after us and making our stay extra memorable. Wouldn't and couldn't now stay anywhere else in Dubai. Adrian & Elaine Sharpe.
Perfect in a word. If you are thinking about staying here you don't need to read the reviews,this place is what it says on the box :))) PERFECT Just go and find out , its amazing , loved it

What a fantastic place to have afternoon tea!. We were invited to tea at this famous hotel in the sea, and what a stunning venue this hotel is! The service was first rate, superbly comfortable with truly magnificent surroundings. Clearly, we will need to save up to stay here, but it must be done!

THE iconic landmark that put Dubai on the map. For some people the Burj Al Arab is an ultra-expensive and unnecessary building. A hotel on a man-made island just off the coast.But it is so much more than that. It is an exercise in marketing (it put Dubai on the map) and declaration-of-intent from a small city with a smaller population that desired to be global. If I remember correctly, it was the 15th tallest building in the world when it was completed. And now, every time Dubai is mentioned, it is the Burj Al Arab that springs instantly to mind.As an added note, behind the special-canvas covered facade lies an atrium deep enough to swallow the Statue of Liberty with its pedestal.This review is not of a hotel. It is of a landmark. And a statement of intent of a city that wants to be number 1.

Afternoon tea. Went there for to tried their afternoon tea and was not dissapointed. From the moment you enter the hotel ground everything was mesmerizing. No wonder it called a 7 star hotel. The lobby was great and everything is in gold. Went up for their aft tea and the cake was great.
Nice Place to be at. It is one of the coolest places that I have been at and our business had twice funtions at this place. It was nice.

NICE HOTEL in the sea. if you are planning to visit and walk inside the best hotel in the world be sure to bring with you a nice suit. you can not enter if you are not in proper attire. I was not able to go inside because we are in casual attire. but the facade is great and the beach surround is nice place and very clean. the sand is very fine and the water is very clean. you can swim and bring some foods. but not liquor drinks allowed.

Impressive. We did not stay at this hotel. I'm reviewing attraction side only. very impressive to look at from out side. Didn't go inside as not guests. If in dubai. It's worth a taxi ride over the for photos

Afternoon Tea. Had a wonderful afternoon tea at the Burj Al Arab. From the minute we arrived to the minute we left the service was out of this world. The seven course afternoon tea is a must for any visitor to Dubai.

Bunker. You expect to be blinded by golden everything, enormous marble bathrooms (no complaint here) etc. However I was curious to stay there as I thought there would be something unique about it... but no, just plain cheesy decor. However what made it worst is that the whole building feels like a huge concrete bunker, stifling, no air.The pool they have is a dutch oven, no shade. It's better to stay at Madinat Jumeirah and have Burj Al Arab as a backdrop.However there was one thing that surprised me: full-size Hermes Toiletries including perfume. (Kelly Caleche and Terre D'Hermes)... mustn't grumble :-)

Just out of this world. The feeling when you enter the bridge that connects the land to the hotel you feel you have come to a different place. It is a true flashy luxury experience. The rooms are the best I have ever seen. When you see the rooms, you will feel the rate is not expensive. The spa is just amazing. My therapist made me a changed a person. But I have to say, the food is not a great experience which matches your stay. But overall, you have to experience this once in your life time. Even for 2 nights only.

Symbol of art / job. Its amazing place to visit. work in there before it open. In 1999. Seen every corner of it and seen how many people and how they worked. It's a piece of art. Gold work all suits and grand suits and mosaic work and Restaurants and aquarium Resturant all are fantastic and helipad. I can say I stand there and seen Dubai from up there....... Must visit
afternoon tea. really enjoyed this, so did 10 yr old grandaughter. Staff were efficient with a charming manner , food was enjoyable & plentiful, hotel fascinating. Nothing to dislike !

First Time Breakfast at the BAA. I had my breakfast for the first time at the BAA with my aunt and granny. It was their first time in Dubai and they really enjoyed it. 2 Filipino servers were very lovely and friendly yet remianed professional. The cappuccino with the 24carat gold flakes was the unforgettable one. Food and drinks were all of good quality. Ambience, music and surroundings were magnificent.

iconic building, pretty to look at. You can't go in there but you can stand outside on the streets and take pictures. There is a beach next to the building and you can take a walk and watch the sunset+burj al arab.
Nice visit. Very nice place to visit, but you can not be closer to the tower because is a restricted area only for the hotel clients.
WOW!. We had a meal here, an amazing building. So much to take in when we were only there for the evening. Lovely staff and a Great meal.

Grand. Celebrated my birthday on 9th June, I love the location and also love the Hi Tea :) it's very nice. All our guests from Russia, UK and USA prefer to stay at this hotel . We as residents visit mostly for some business meetings or sometimes for leisure .

Good to go to once. Expensive but luxury. Turned up in golf buggy from our hotel, but provided with complimentary luxury car for return journey - probably golf buggy too lowly to be seen. Lovely cocktails. Great views
Tea for two. For a special occasion, this is a must visit Skyview bar is a very pleasant experience. You are well looked after by all the staff.

Must see. When you take a boat tour and pass by the burj, you can just see the amazing architecture!
A must see.
Luxury in details. If you are in Dubai, it is worth to afford visiting Burj Al Arab. Minimum spending per reservation per person is around 100 euros, and limit is sky, so carefuly read price list.

Wonderful Experience High Tea at The skyview bar.. My husband and I highly recommend high tea here. From entering the hotel lobby, taking the lift to the 27th floor you cannot fail to be amazed. We were made to feel welcome immediately and given a view over the Gulf and a view of Dubai and the Burj Khalifa in the distance. The seven courses and choice of tea were just fantastic. Every course was amazing and the staff could not do enough for you. We were celebrating a special occasion and this was marked with special pudding in addition to the normal menu and I was presented with a red rose. Excellent value for money, a wonderful experience that I would happily do again.
Resturants. We take the flight and tried 1 dish at each restaurant. Enjoyable evening from 7 to 11pm. A good way to visit and experience the Burj.
A must do. Excellent need a head for heights,,, spectacular and amazing. Go early and expect a queue but well worth the wait,,,, just allow your self 3 or 4 hours,,,and no problem.
Beautiful evening. Never fails to amaze me although have been living in Dubai for 10years now. Def a must see if u r visiting Dubai.

Afternoon Tea at Skyview Bar. Took my mum and sister for afternoon tea on Mother's Day. It was a great experience and we all loved it. Service was great and food just kept flowing. Great value for money.

Afternoon tea. Had an amazing afternoon tea here, great views of the palm, food was lovely, staff were great, the hotel is just the most beautiful thing you will ever see, and you feel like a million dollars in here!
Definitely recommend to say you've been there and done it!

A must. Stayed here with mates wonderful experience worth every penny see the photos I have added .
Actually feel like a special person
Fantastic structure. Did not travel up the building as I'm terrified of heights but it was really impressive, easy to admire as it's right next to the Dubai Fountains...

Worlds only 7 star hotel is a must visit. Worlds only 7 star hotel is a must visit. This is highly expensive though but a mesmerizing experience comes at a cost. This is an architectural masterpiece so dont forget to see this place.

Had the most expensive drink. But it worth it.. We went to the Skyview bar, with reservations. We booked it by internet in advance. You are obliged to have a minimum consumption. The place worths it. Having this reservation You can enter the building and see this wonder of architecture. Expensive, but worth it.

Amazing. The most amazing city in the world .hotels are all 5 and 6 star ..planning a Tripp back very soon . Weather is amazing .people are so friendly . Nothing is to much trouble .every wear you go in Dubai you will see the biggest and the best of everything .you will never want to come home ....

High tea is great. Visiting the Burj Al Arab was my wish. And renting a room was a little to much. So I booked a high tea. There is a great review about it on Tripadvisor that is still accurate except for the price. Now UAD560 ($150). Great view from the top floor of this hotel in there skybar on 37th floor. I could see the city, sea, The Palm and a little sand in the sea from "the World". A glass of champagne and so much nice food... All (ice)tea and (ice)coffee you like. To much! It might sound strange but I do think it is value for money. My Economy rental car was valet parked together with the most expensive cars. Waiting for it and seeing it drive in front of the hotel was priceless!

burj al arab. was treated to lunch by my sister at this hotel and ....wow , staff were so friendly even to visitors just there for lunch . the place is amazing , musical fountains , aquariums as you go up the escalator , and lunch was brilliant so much choice including caviar. it was leisurely and very enjoyable ...but beware price of wine £20 per glass .
A must.. To see the worlds only 7 star hotel is a must also known as the sail it is an architectural masterpiece.

Stunning views and superb service, although be prepared to leave peckish.. My fiancé and i got engaged here so it holds some very special memories for us. The views are amazing. You can see for miles and it is fantastic to eat and drink whilst you enjoy them. The actual restaurant itself is beautifully decorated in blues and golds. You can see why it is a 7* establishment, it oozes modern sophistication and wealth. It is clear to see a fortune has been spent on this building. The waiters are eager to assist and are hot off the mark. Although, assistance getting to the correct restaurant/lift would be appreciated as it is a complex layout with a lot of lift/floor/escalator choices.  We went for afternoon tea and although the sandwiches and cakes were delicious (and refilled) it is not a meal so please view it as a snack.  If you have a desire to experience 7* service and decor then you must check this place out, but if all you want is a nice view and a meal, stick to the Khalifa and hit Chiji's as this is a very dear experience.
Stunning. Afternoon tea was out of this world. Nothing too much trouble for the staff. Everything just as you would wish. Of course it was expensive, just remember where you are and enjoy it.

Incredible!. Visited the Al Mahara "The Oyster Shell" restaurant for a 3 course lunch. The setting is out of this world with a floor to ceiling aquarium. The food was outstanding and the presentation was utter perfection. The staff were friendly, polite and professional. An amazing experience.

Worth having high tea but too expensive/ridiculous to stay. 6 course meal is amazing (high tea) but it is at least 3 times the amount of the all other places. Why? Because each room comes with 6 members of staff.

Fabulous Afternoon Tea at the Burj. Our afternoon tea at the Burj Al Arab was a wonderful experience.The staff and the service we received was exceptional. The food beautifully presented , plentiful and tasted sublime.Whilst it is not cheap ( 560 UAE Dirhams per person) it was a truly worthwhile and memorable experience.Unfortunately, the view is restricted by the heat haze during the hot months.

Good place to take pictures. We visited the outside entrance of this famous ship hotel, and took some nice pictures in late evening. The ship hotel is famous for its creative design, but if you live there, you will need to have your transportation. It's distant from Dubai mall.

ridiculously expensive but worth it for a once in a lifetime. It was thrilling to drive past the tourist buses onto the private road leading to the Burj because we had a reservation to high tea at Sahn Eddar in the lobby.Decor amazing but we were disappointed that the very expensive high tea would not entitle us to a ride to the Skyroom to see the view. Smiling staff barred the way. Nor were we allowed to look outside at the pool area.The tea was nice but we were only offered seconds on the scones.The atmosphere was opulent and amazing and I would recommend it as a once in a life time indulgence.Hint- book for about one hour before sunset to see the Burj in the sun and lit up after sunset.
Fantastic hotel. The view from the sky bar and the food in the Bab al Yam for a buffet and evening meal was very good, my wife is a coeliac and the chef came to see her personally and took her order.

Wonderful, but thank Goodness I wasn't paying. Was a guest here on a business meeting, absolutely incredible service and food, but my word do you pay for it, not for me even though I can afford it, way way over priced for what you get, or maybe its me, I do like the nice things in life, but there is only so much that I would be prepared to pay for it.I have had better service, better food and a better experience that cost a quarter of this.If looking down on others at any cost then go for it, but be prepared to pay for it
Afternoon Tea Delight. My wife said "How Much !!! when I told her the cost.When we left she said "what fantastic value"About $A110 per head, but worth every cent. Expensive but just do it.
Great structure. Burj Al Arab is a huge building out by the water. It is great looking and well worth the effort of visiting. Make sure you put it on the list of things to do in Dubai.
Didn't keep promise. One of the finest things we can view in this era. As Dubai promises its variety in constructions and their will to make every unique things in their pocket, another feather

wow!. Booked high tea for my husbands 50th as a treat, were lucky enough to be shown one of the suites, the sky bar and pool by the floor manager. Definately worth a trip to say you've been in the worlds only 7 star hotel. Pre-book before you go.
7 Stars of Beauty. Went here for the afternoon tea at the top, and what an amazing 3 hours it was, felt like a King. The Hotel is a beautiful, no expense spared Place...
Nice. Liked the service and views and definitely the food. Quite bright through the windows but despite that a good experience.

Still the eye-catcher. Sure the Burj Khalifa stands much taller - but this is the real eye catcher along the coast. The aquariums are amazing and the food, though very expensive just feels special. Great place.

fantastic. nice building in the night,
the only 7 star hotel in dubai,
food,room and the staff was excellent.
the beach front with white sand make this hotel so fantastic

Opulent. Expensive but worth every penny for a once in a lifetime cocktail and dinner! First class service from all involved in our evening. We even got a free ride back to our hotel, only next door but it was in a Limo!

Worth the visit. Every time I am in this tower, it amazes me. It takes your breathe away when you are in the top and looking down on Downtown and the rest of Dubai. Plus if you are a tourist, you can combine it with you visit to the Dubai Mall. Try and visit during the weekday as weekends, it gets really crowded. Highly recommended.
great looking structure from afar. nice architecturesplendid sightkinda slanted or leaningwow insidecool structurestill clean even in the desert sandnot so tall as i thought but still breathtaking

Afternoon tea with a view. We booked for the afternoon tea with champagne. Unfortunately, Ramadan put a stop to the champagne but the replacement sparking date juice was delightful and it kept coming. The dishes served up for afternoon tea were very tasty and very well presented. We were on the 27th floor but the view, unfortunately, was very limited due to the haze. It is not cheap but for a one time experience, we thought it was worth it. The only downside was that there wireless card machine would not work with our Mastercard or Visa Card. So, accompanied by one of the waiters, we had to go to the ATM near reception to draw out some cash. The waiter informed us that we were not the only patrons having found ourselves in this predicament. All in all, a very pleasant afternoon though and we would recommend it. But, be prepared for the shock of the price.
luxury!. the most luxurious hotel in the world. With a helipad on top and a tennis court, a bathroom as big as a bedroom. it's always a YES to Burj Al Arab

Night out at the Burj. We went on 25th June from dar al musaf hotel (next door to the burj) for a night out. Started with a few drinks at the skyview bar- fantastic views! Make sure you go for sunset! We then went to the seafood restaurant. Now, I'm not a seafood fan, but my husband is, so I'm not best placed to comment on the food, but I thought it was OK. We had seabass between the two of us- cooked in salt so it was very tender. The restaurant itself is an experience- you feel like you've just walked into the set of a james bond film- gold plated lift, someone to greet you when it opens, walking through a gold plated (see, a theme here!) tunnel before being seated next to a huge aquarium where you can watch sharks and other fish swim by. Staff were excellent in this restaurant- friendly and helpful. The only downside is that gentleman have to wear a jacket (they provided one for us when we got out of the lift!), this is fine, but they are not allowed to remove it at all- which doesn't make for too comfortable an experience. That's the only negative! Other than that..a great night out.

Fabulous!. We went for afternoon tea, which consisted of 7 courses!! Lots of food many different teas on offer. The price normally includes champagne but because we were there during Ramadan, no alcohol was served (yep, bad timing on our part!!) but we still had to pay the same. I think there should have been a small reduction in the cost.The hotel is beautiful, the staff are very attentive and informative.We has an outside table so had fantastic views.People that were there for a special occasion, the ladies got a red rose & the men got cake......a lovely touch.A lovely afternoon & I'd definitely recommend it.
Over the top!. Opulent but well worth seeing,looks like it is floating in the sea! Didn't go for afternoon tea or meal although you can book to do that.
Afternoon Tea. We were lucky enough to have afternoon tea on the top floor of this fabulous hotel. It was a once in a lifetime experience.

Fantastic fish tanks. Great meal 12 course taster menu with a great service and some fine wine. However, word of caution is to ensure you have a large credit limit on you card as it's going to cost! Fantastic once in a lifetime experience
Good!. Good view from up there. A most for everybody who goes to Dubai. No cheap prices, but also well worth the money. You have to make a reservation coz tickets are mostly sold out!

Exciting!. We visited the Sky View Lounge for drinks. What a view! We were made to feel special as soon as we entered the hotel and were encouraged to look round and take in the opulent surroundings - WOW! Well worth a visit!
Unforgettable. We experience this wonder of the world just outside and it is sooooo beautiful. One day we will definitely stay there.
stunning views. go early morning and be the first up the silent lift .well worth it looking down on a 60 floor building
Incredible Experience. An amazing brunch that we experienced! Slightly on the pricey side but worth every penny! view is incredible and there is so much to see while your there!

Worth a visit. Very nice view from the top.
But remember to buy the tricket online, it is very exspensive to buy it there, it cost 3 times as much.

Fantastic!!. We booked the afternoon tea in the Skyview bar. The hotel is unreal, and the staff are so attentive - you can see how it has got it's stars. You can only access the hotel if you have a reservation - when you get to the security gates you need to show the reservation and they score you off the list and let you through, so you cannot just go for a visit and look around. The food and views were great - I would recommend the afternoon tea as the best way to visit the hotel if you are unable to afford a hotel room there!

Worth visiting for the experience but have to book something. Had afternoon tea here with friends. Expensive which is what you'd expect but worth the experience. Food was lovely loads of it and didn't need anything to eat in the evening. Hotel is on an island and can only get in with a reservation either staying or for the restaurant. Afternoon tea is about cheapest option. Lovely views from the top.

A very special occasion. This very exclusive hotel is an experience not to be missed even though it is not cheap The service in the Aquarium restaurant is just perfect and sitting enjoying a meal whilst sharks and rays and countless other fish swim by is unreal. The fleet of Rolls Royce Phantoms is also somewhat impressive!!
Old tradition not disappointed. Being at one of the first hotel in Dubai give me the sensation of traveling back to the past. I mean, 7 stars, speaks by its one. Simply astonished.

Top of the World. The Burj Al Arab is one place to see and visit if you are in Dubai. I was really happy to see such a nice building in Dubai with such an architecture. Was shocked when I had to bend and turn my neck to see the entire building from down. The lifts are amazing, clean and spacious - not like the lifts in India. After visiting the Burj Al Arab you should definitely visit Wild Wadi Water Park which is just outside the premises and close by.

Stunning. Myself and my wife enjoyed a fantastic stay in the Burj Al Arab last week it was simply stunning.I booked the gold package which included airport transfers, neck and shoulder massage, breakfast which was offered either in a restaurant or in our suite as was dinner with a romantic set up. We also received personal gifts and a selection of Hermes his and hers products. From the moment we stepped from the car and entered the hotel we knew we were somewhere exceptional, The lobby is overwhelming, visually amazing as you look up at the floors above. We were brought straight to our suite for our check in and we were blown away by the size and standard of it. The suite is over two levels the lower one consists of a large lounge area, an office area and a toilet if you have any visitors. There was fruit, pastries and a bottle of red wine waiting for us and during our stay we received some more fresh fruit canapes and as we were celebrating my wifes birthday a cake and flowers. The upstairs of the suite was magnificent,a huge bedroom with sofas, second minibar everything you could want. What really stands out in The Burj is not only do they have a large pillow menu they also have a mattress menu, I found the one on the bed very soft and we were informed that they provide a selection should we want to change the second one was perfect. We were offered the option of the butler unpacking our suitcases into the wardrobes in the dressing area separate from the bedroom. The bathroom had a large jacuzzi, massive walk in shower and twin sinks and at every turn Hermes products. We had stunning views out towards The Palm from our suite. The spa was great, the pool on the 19th floor while small was perfect with great views. After travelling overnight the massage was very welcomed. You are transferred to the beach by buggy and it was like stepping into a warm bath. We had afternoon tea which was without complaint, lovely selection of pastries and sandwiches, with unlimited selection of teas, coffees and iced drinks. Later on we had cocktails in the skyview bar before enjoying a meal in Al Muntaha.After dinner the butlers prepared our lavender jacuzzi while we went for a stroll, a great end to our first day. Next morning we had a perfect breakfast in Bab al Yam restaurant down by the pool. While in the hotel our every need was meet by a brilliant team of butlers, the room was kept spotless by diligent housekeeping who cleaned and vacuumed several times both days. Though there was a lot of service in the room it was never intrusive and a click of the remote displayed a do not disturb sign, on the remotes which there were three they all controlled every function in the suite. I can not say with enough words how much we enjoyed our stay in the Burj Al Arab it was truly the best hotel experience I have ever had. Yes it is expensive but it is worth every cent. Special mention must go to the team who looked after us on the 20th floor and also all the staff around the hotel who all were professional and friendly. A lot of reviews of this hotel are based on the afternoon tea experience and I noticed some good some bad, but trust me to stay as a guest the experience is brought to a whole new level one I would highly recommend to anyone who loves travel and who loves to experience the best that is available. Thank you to all in The Burj Al Arab for a wonderful stay.
Stunning. The Burj al Arab is definitely worth a visit. It is a hundred times more beautiful then any photo you have seen on the internet.
WOW. Super view of the sea from the hotel restaurant, when you are in this place you know you are in dubai

A beautiful Architecture.. For those travellers who could not afford to dine nor to stay in the Superb Burj Al Arab!
All I can say is if you drive through Jumeirah in the evening, even a glimpse of the building makes you go in awe!
The next time we heading up to Dubai, definitely would indulge ourselves!
Has to be done. Had afternoon tea here , and it was every bit as good as expected , great service , food and surroundings. It's just one of those must do experiences !
Just Amazing. High tea is a must - fantastic choice of food, amazing view- booking first is essential - just perfect

Worth a Visit, very unique. It is a truly magnificent structure and actually one that impresses more from the exterior. The elevator ride up to the bar and restaurant is very cool with views of the Palm as you go up. Expensive but worth a visit if you are travelling to Dubai for the first time.

High Tea!. Paid around $160 for high tea but found it to be an amazing experience & totally worth it!
Scrumptious sandwiches, cakes & drinks as well as a view to die for!

Great meal. Don't look at the check. We couldn't miss seeing the self proclaimed 7 star hotel and dine at the restaurant during our visit. The hotel is amazing! We had pre dinner drinks in the bar adjacent to the restaurant. They were inventive and expensive! Dinner was over the top, with what you would expect - amazing service and presentation. It's definitely a special occasion restaurant. If you can afford it, go, you won't be disappointed.

7 course afternoon tea, 7 star service!!!. As part of a tour we stopped at the Burj Al Arab for afternoon tea. Photo opportunities and then the eating & drinking began. Amazing views, superb service and the food was to die for. A lovely experience as part of our 2 week stay in Dubai.

Beautiful building. The design of this building was excellent! Bought the souvenir! It is a very expensive elite hotel and only the rich and famous tourist stay there. The not so rich could go for a cocktail at the Sky-view Bar, but remember to make a reservation first. I prefer shopping rather then drinking so I gave that Bar a miss!

Overrated. We booked here for some cocktails and food. We were well looked after but you couldn't help but the decor was old fashioned and the atmosphere was over pretentious. Good for an experience but would go back.

Anniversary Treat. We had the 7 courses and from start to finish excellent very very relaxed the inside amazing the food superb as the service but even thoe they are little portions me and my husband were stuffed give yourself a couple of hours there.

WOW!. How does one truly describe the only 7 star hotel in the world??? My husband surprised us with a one night stay at the Burj and it was absolutely a once in a lifetime experience. It's impressive sail like facade is just the b beginning of this architectural marvel. Once inside, look up the soaring atrium and enjoy the use of color throughout. We were warmly greeted by three hostesses dressed in Arabian fashion and ushered to our suite on the 16th floor overlooking the Persian Gulf. Three butlers stood guard at the entrance to the floor and we were told that they were there to make our stay as enjoyable as possible. When the door opened up to our room, much to our surprise, we had a duplex fitted out in royal colors of purple red and gold. Rich woods and gold fixtures completed the design. The bathrooms were done in marble and mosaics - get the picture - NO expense spared. We were even supplied with a MAC. The room was really "fit for a king." Using the old cliche, "you have to see it to believe it" is apt here!The fitness facility is outfitted with every type of equipment you could possible want to use and trainers are available to work with you should you wish. We took a quick peek inside the indoor pool located on the same floor as the gym and it too looked terrific. Hint - If you have the chance to stay here make sure you ask a butler to tour you throughout the hotel. The restaurants are unique and worth seeing - especially the one at the top which has sweeping views of the Gulf. With only one night here, our budget didn't allow for us to dine at all of the restaurants, but it was a treat to see them.
LOVED this 7 star hotel. you can see it from different angle, it might be nice from outside but it's amazing inside.You can dine there or have an afternoon tea and enjoy the design inside.

Afternoon tea. We went here for afternoon tea as a treat for part of our honeymoon. From the moment we entered the hotel it was just a fabulous experience. The afternoon tea consisted of 7 courses and each one was just perfect. Our waiter, Reuben, was so polite and friendly and helped make the experience everything that we expected and more. We would definitely recommend this to anybody wanting to treat themselves.

Fabulous. Didn't go into this particular hotel just stopped for cocktails opposite to view it! It is fabulous. The color changing lights add such a beautiful effect to it! Saw it from a beach during the day also at a different angle and could see the restaurant sticking out the side - wow!!!

classic. the word is classic for this beauty built in the middle of the sea, you have to get passes to visit this place but since we knew someone in dubai it was already arranged for. Do go to the top as there is a bar which has the worlds most expensive alcohol bottle kept . the view from that bar is just fabulous

Fantastic afternoon tea. Booked in advance for afternoon tea at the sky view bar, excellent food and service, would highly recommend doing this on your trip to dubai. Cost around £100 each, but lots of choice and great service, where else can you have afternoon tea with views like that, and the only 7* hotel in the world! Book in advance!

Like the set of the Stetsons.. Magnificent building, fantastic hotel but more than a little over the top. The interior is so wacky it's actually quite impressive! We didn't stay so can't comment on the rooms or hotel other than the look of the interior. But we have eaten at the restaurant on the top floor a couple of times. It was very expensive, but excellent on both occasions. Personally I think this place is a box to tick, I wouldn't want to stay there but it's definitely worth a visit. Other hotels on Jumeirah are better for an actual holiday. This is a 2-3 night stay at most.

Sky View Bar for drinks. I made a reservation in the UK for drinks and was advised that there was a 320AED pp minimum spend. We took the buggy from the JBH and arrived at the hotel at 6.30. We were allowed to wander around the very impressive lobby until 7 when we were then able to take the lift to the 27th floor. We were greeted by name and taken to our seats by the window just before sunset. We were given a menu of drinks and the waiter left us to pick. We were not put under any pressure to order the special Burj cocktail - we had 2 cocktails and a glass of red wine each which were lovely and we received nibbles (great olives) on a Burj shaped tray nice touch. We stayed for 1 1/2 hours before catching a buggy to Tortuga. It is expensive but we knew that in advance and we were really glad we had the experience
Spectacular experience of a lifetime. This amazing hotel has every persons dream, the service,the food and the luxury was out of this world.

Impeccable and beautiful. Didn't stay here , just had drinks and it was exquisite. All the fanciest of cars out front of the hotel with door men. For it being seven stars it was gorgeous but I think I expected it to be more rich looking. More gold and classier rather then all the colors they had, it kind of cheapened it. But again it was by far stunning.
Awesome. Had afternoon tea it was very expensive but worth every penny, the hotel was fantastic and the views awesome. worth a visit

High tea wow!!!!!. Went there for my 50th birthday celebration! Had a window table, the views were amazing! The high tea was something else! Just to much! I wished I could eat all the yummy cakes, but impossible, service was great! Yes it is expensive, but not that different in price from the ritz or claridges, so if you want to spend a afternoon eating lovely food, book it! I had iced coffee, it was perfect!
Amazing service and food. Stunning building iconic, the ballroom is wonderful. Amazing service and food, expensive but you only live once

Great Afternoon Tea. You have to experience the luxury and splendor of the Burj Al Arab, although the only way most people can do this is by having the afternoon tea, although this is still very expensive, but worth it once in a while. Food and service was unsurpassed as one would expect.

Afternoon tea. When we arrived we were seatedatthe window. We were served a lot of bite sized dishes. I still think it's overprized - 560 AED. Most of the time you couldn't see most of Dubai because of the mist. Also you can't get good pictures with your phone - you always come out dark. Also, beware of the take away sweets. You are supposed to get 2, if you are two people. Everyone else got 1 for each person on the table, except us. We still left them a tip but one should expect at the restaurant of a 7 star hotel to not be cheap, at least. I'll definitely not come back to this hotel. And I wouldn't recommend the overpriced experience, cause you might end up with not getting even what was in your package deal. Other than that the wifi was really strong. The food was really good. The view when available was really nice. The staff seemed nice, but it's possible that they were not genuine, since they brought us only one to-go sweets.

Sky View Bar - High Tea. We had a wonderful high tea. We were fortunate to have a table against the window with extensive views that were out of this world. The staff were very pleasant and attentive and the food was very tasty, with a good deal of variety. It was definately a special experience for us.

Afternoon Tea. Come on, if you're gonna do afternoon tea in Dubai, you might as well do it in style!! Yes it is expensive (£90pp), but if you've come to penny pinch, you've come to the wrong place!! All my mates said I was mad paying that, but like I said to them, you've seen BAA on TV loads of times....but are you EVER gonna get to go inside....we did, and loved it!!

150 AED parking fees in order to enter. 150 AED parking fees in order to enterduring my tour i bought some food after while somebody told you use my parking ticket for bill i had a dinner for sake of using my money or get it back

Worthwhile to see. We were not staying there, so we couldn't see it close up. Even we were street view, it was most impressive. It is quite a drive though, so plan for that. Still, it's a great building to view.

Perfect for that Dubai "selfie". Although sadly we do not have the money to book a stay at the Burj Al Arab, we did take the photographic opportunity of perching on Umm Suqeim Public Beach to soak up some sun and take in the glorious views of the hotel :D After all, it is an icon so it has to be on your must-see list. For security reasons, you aren't able to actually enter the hotel's premises unless you have a restaurant reservation or booking to stay.We took an inexpensive taxi for convenience and comfort to the beach from our accommodation in Bur Dubai, and from there to the Mall of the Emirates nearby which is worth a visit too.

Out of this world. We booked the Culinary Flight for our wedding anniversary and it really was out of this world. We arrived at 6:30 and left at 12:30 (and could have stayed longer). The service really is 7 Star and all the staff are so helpful - so much so we will definitely be going back. Thank you to all the staff for truly making our wedding anniversary an event to remember (the Rolls Royce added the final touch thank you!!)

Jumeirah week dinner offer. Not nearly as good a quality as normal service. Disappointing selection of food for the price paid and very basic service. Having done a spa day previously which was fantastic this was a disappointment and the other jumeirah hotel offers were far better.

Sky View Bar - Relaxing and luxurious. As students, we were on a budget so the cheapest way to visit the inside was to make a reservation at the sky view bar where there is a minimum spend of €64 per person (320 AED). The decor and views were amazing and the service was brilliant. We got 2 mini burgers each which were as good as McDonalds but no better and the fries are identical to McDonalds. We got free snacks which included nuts which were nice but the other fancy food like foie gras was disgusting. We shared a selection of desserts which were also disgusting but we are not used to fancy food. It was worth it for the luxury and views and ambience but food is nothing special.

The Icon of Dubai. A city's iconic landmark is a must to visit. No Paris is complete without a visit to Eiffel Tower, or KL's Petronas Twin Towers, or Taipei 101, Sydney Opera House. We made an online reservation for brunch. Take note of the dress code. Print a copy to be allowed entry at the guard house.It was a magnificently beautiful building. The interior screamed opulence though we were slightly disappointed with the modest restrooms. We visited a jewelry boutique and made a cheeky enquiry about a diamond ring - it was US$2.5m … only!Up the restaurant, it was amazing. Very nicely laid out with the most beautiful panoramic view. The staff were excellent and very polite. The food is tip top and the variety too many to count. I just try to consume as many types of food in small portions.The oysters were exquisite - the best I have tasted so far - I had half a dozen, could have done more if I were younger! I would give the sashimi a miss - can't beat those in Japan. Roast beef was very nice. I particularly like the canapé food. I basically took one of every type. It was excellent and the attention to detail made it more enjoyable. You can also get cooked upon order dishes like foie gras, risotto, spaghetti etc We ordered a champagne and were served complimentary coffee and tea individually. At 620 dirhams, you get what you pay for. I think it was value for money.
Dinner at the Burj. We enjoyed dinner in the Burj but frankly i am not sure what the 7 star rating is about. It wasn't nicer than our hotel and it was a little clinical for me.

The Burj Al Arab 7 star Hotel. I had an amazing experience with my family and friends while i visited the one and only 7 star luxury Hotel Burj Al Arab, The Hotel inside is so beautiful and pretty. The big aquariums both side in the lobby features a large seawater and looking up in the main Hall takes you to an other Planet. The big fountains by the entrance which are changing colors just fantastic. We enjoyed the warm atmosphere. The views of the Palm and Dubai coastline are stunning from the top floor bar where i had my Arabian nights cocktail and enjoyed the sunset of the Gulf. The service makes this place even more elegant, just like in my a dreams..

Opulent and luxurious but a bit OTT. The staff were all very courteous and professional and the decor screamed opulence but it all seemed a bit surreal as a visitor to the Sky Bar - can't say anything about the rooms as we didn't stay there.

It was OK. I guess being next to the tallest building on earth and not visiting is a waste of time. But to be honest, i was expecting a bit more. Once you get "to the top" you realize you are far from the top (floor 126 of 163), which was a bit disappointing.The observation deck is nice but small, and within 10 minutes you would have taken all the pictures you want.It was an OK experience but i guess it is a must being in Dubai

magical 1001 night palace. having heared of this hotel, we put this as our must visit list when we were in Dubai. we finally visited this hotel with a requirement of having a lunch in one of the Restaurant inside (we chose a superb Al Iwan). The interior was wow. and the view from insde is so glamourous and colorful, as we visited during the day time we can also see the beautiful beach that surround the area. One tip from me if you visit this hotel, we could use the buggy cart facility and we could go to the madinat souq from the hotel if you have the time. While travelling with the cart we will passed by the large hotel complex with its beautiful beach and scenery. Also always booked the restaurant prior to the time you want to go there, as the strict checking at the gate of the hotel would not let anyone pass unless you show them the booking print out which are sent to our hotel email once you booked them,, and have your credti card ready as they need your credit card number to book the restaurant.

Iconic Architecture best at Sunset and After Dark. We always like to swing by the Burj Al Arab at night to watch the colored light show on this iconic building. This is the first architectural masterpiece in Dubai and still worthy of a visit! PS Unless you have plenty of time and money, skip the visit inside.

Wow. We went to celebrate the boyfriends birthday during friday brunch. the food was great and service incredible the views were pretty much what you pay for. at the end they gave us a choc with white and dark choc mouse torte that was incredible, took everything not to eat every last bite. The cost was a little on the high side, but you are paying for the great food and the experience and view. Would I pay that price again, yeah its something the boyfriend and i will always remember.

The best in the world. The Burj Al Arab justifies it's stand of being the only 7 Star hotel in the world. I was spellbound from the very beginning till the very end.There are just 2 ways of entering the hotel, either you book a room, or you book a meal, that is breakfast, lunch or dinner at one of their restaurants. However, please do so well in advance.I was fortunate enough to have a breakfast at the Hotel and WOW!! Royal luxurious dining is what awaits you inside the Sail-shaped building. The food was absolutely brilliant and the ambiance was just perfect. Later we were given a tour of the hotel and boy I wish I had stayed there.I must point out that though the meals are pricey but believe me, the experience is well worth it. The Dubai experience is incomplete without a meal or a stay at The Burj!
Extravagent. The hotel is amazing inside. Staff are so pleasant. We did afternoon tea there- it has seven courses, we really enjoyed it. It is pricy but I think its worth it.

Expensive but great. We booked a dinner at the Burj Al Arab and although it was expensive, the food was out of this world - the most I've seen my wife eat ever!! The hotel is opulent and I don't know if I would spend the money staying there but it was definitely worth seeing it 'in the flesh' We booked the dinner through Forever Tourism but I think you could get it cheaper when you get to Dubai or directly with the hotel.

Tea time not exciting. I went there with my two daughters and wife. I was expecting some eventful tea time with my princesses but it was not much of that the one at the Abu Dhabi imperial. Palace is certainly more magical than this one that is kind of a non authentic as even the venue is small and not expectacular enough

Wow. This hotel is worth its 7 star rating. We had afternoon tea here and the service from the start was immaculate and very filling.The ride up to floor 27 in the glass lift was a site to behold as were the views from the top.Worth every penny.Glenn & Louise Day

Impressive view from outside. Certainly an impressive building. We only want to see the building and we didn't book a room. The best place to see is from the nearby beach. Taxi or private cars are not allowed to pass through the gate without any reservation ticket.

High Tea at the Sky Bar. We were fortunate during our 2 day stay in Dubai, to book a reservation for High tea at the Sky Bar so we were able to visit the Burj AL Arab. As others have mentioned, you can only visit if you have a reservation or are a guest of the hotel. We got there early so we would have time to look around and still be in line to get a good table for our high tea. We spent time taking photos of the fountain, the aquarium and just around the hotel. We were the first group to go upstairs right at 1:00- our reservation time. We were able to get a table at the corner which means we only had 1 group to our left. Our spot was definitely great for photos. We had a wonderful server. The food and teas were yummy. You can order as many different types of tea as you want. We started with a glass of champagne. And then we enjoyed a selection of teas, sandwiches, and cakes served with a choice of our yummy homemade jams and the Devonshire clotted cream. We even were given chocolates to take home and my girlfriend and I each got a single red rose. Definitely pricy, but totally worth it. We not only enjoyed the views and experience, but we were also stuffed!

You need to book. To visit this hotel you either need to book a room, or a meal and you need to do this in advance.The hotel was built in 1999 and they certainly consider this to be a landmark up against all the worlds great landmarks.It is an impressive building, If you want to see the building and you haven't booked the best place to see the hotel is from the nearby beach.

A little tired, but very impressive. Certainly a most impressive building from the outside and affording some very impressive views, but is now very dated and in need of good makeover inside. Regrettably it hasn't stood the test of time. That having been said I had a terrific dinner at Al Mahara. Great staff and the fish provide plenty of visual stimulation.

Fantastic view. Lovely evening spent at the Burj but i wouldn't rush back. Nice drinks, canapes and views. I was there with my husband on a Thursday night and we both felt it just lacks atmosphere although busy. People are there for a few photos, drinks and then move on elsewhere. There is a waiting liston the evening for a window table so everyone will eventually get their chance of a good photo op.

Ground Floor Restaurant - Best Food I've Ever Had. Date of Visit: November 2010I had the pleasure of visiting the "seven star hotel" for a celebratory meal with my family. There were five of us and we went to the ground floor restaurant which had a spectacular evening, sunset view over the water and looking out onto the 'mainland' area of DubaiThe all-you-can-eat setup is a winner for me; the Tasmanian Salmon, unbelievable sushi, amazing vegetables etc - everything you would wish to have is there at the best quality available. There were no superlatives to match how good it was. The building is breath taking and the cars parked outside are also just as breathtaking. Rolls Royce after Ferrari - briefly interrupted by our taxi arriving - were a bit of a dream for a car enthusiastic like me. No idea on the price but my parents did say it wasn't bad for (a) the food (b) the experience and (c) the quality of service - which was the best I've ever experienced also - but what would you expect? For those who have travelled a number of times to Dubai - or even once - one will appreciate the ambition to be the best, and be relentless in achieving that.

Afternoon tea expensive but a real treat. At around £85a head afternoon tea with champagne this is expensive. However in this plush surrounding of the Sahn Eddar Lounge and with impeccable service and welcome, the 6 course afternoon tea plus champagne was a really special experience. Menu should perhaps be tweaked to start with eg savoury tart but otherwise superb.

Afternoon tea. The afternoon tea experience at Skybar was great. Not your cheapest afternoon tea, but the experience was well worth it. Especially after being allowed to take a quick peek of one of the rooms. Bubblies and selection of treats were really good.
Fantastic. I couldn't see it from inside, but I believe It's an amazing place to visit, Hopefully next time I will be able to enter
Afternoon tea!!! . What can i say but amazing food and views tha you could die for . Everyone should come here just one for afternoon tea. The building and views are simply breathe taking

Afternoon of indulgence in the Sky View Bar. Whilst the afternoon tea is terribly expensive - around A$160 per person, if one can afford to splurge one should - as the place is a marvel, and it's the cheapest way to gain access to the hotel. When there, ask if you can see a guests room and also the Ballroom - just to take a peek. Also book in advance, as this is a popular venue. Also book for 1.30pm and the afternoon tea becomes lunch - you have no limit to the food - so the cost is not as bad as it sounds!

Aquarium Resaturant. We chose the 7 course tasting menu to celebrate the end of our holiday.I can honestly say it is the most extravagant restaurant we have eaten in and choosing the complimentary wines also the most expensive.Having said that it is something that you definitely need to do at least once in your life.Staff are attentive and helpful, I didn't have a jacket with me so they lent me one which was a nice touch.Food, wine and service fantastic. ONce we have saved up again we might even return!

Cocktails at the Burj. This is a must do when visiting Dubai - just so you can say you have done itYou have to make a reservation as when you get to the gates they ask for your reservation confirmation. We booked a table in the cocktail bar for 9pm - we advised it was for an anniversary so could be possible have a table by the window. We did get a table by the window over looking the sea however as it was dark there was nothing to see. However the staff were great and as soon as a table by the other window came free they moved us over.You receive complimentary snacks ( a snack tower in the shape of the hotel) consisting of mini quiche, salmon on toast, olives and a variety of nuts.As we had mentioned when booking it was an anniversary they also kindly bought over a small slice of cake and a rose - very sweet touch.The drink menu is more of a small book with alot of choice. We opted for a beer each until we had had time to digest the menu. I tried a 'Milky Way' a minty milky very potent cocktail served in a martinin glass it was 155 AED (£27) a little pricey but it is a 7 star hotel. The beers we drank were priced at 70AED (£12) these were the cheapest on the menu and very tasty (much better than a pint of larger)The staff were very welcoming and made you feel very comfortable whilst there.They ask that a minimum spend of £50 per person when visiting - which for a one of experience i thought was reasonableReally enjoyed it.Have to say the gold plated 'wet floor' sign was a little OTT yet very apt for the hotelLoved it

Awesome!. You have to go, don't miss it, it' s an unique expirience! Awesome views, the elevator is some show, everythinh very organized. YOU must buy the tickets in advance, so you can jump the long lines!

Breathtaking. I was treated to Afternoon Tea in the Skybar and what an experience it was! We started with champagne and then the treats started coming. Three hours later we were still there! The staff were great, they never tried to rush us but let us take our time, even taking photographs for us! We only saw those parts of the hotel necessary to reach the Skybar, but what we saw looked fabulous. Afternoon Tea was great!

Worth the 7 star rating. We have eaten at the Burj Al Arab on two occasions, in two different restaurants on both occasions we've been delighted by the whole experience. One visit was for a Valentines night, what an amazing experience, including the lovely gifts the hotel gave us for dining on Valentines night. Not a once in a lifetime experience, try to go to each restaurant ANC enjoy the different cuisine.

Afternoon Tea at the Burj al Arab. Celebrated my aunt’s 50th Birthday with afternoon tea at the Burj al Arab. Reservations are an absolute must and can be done online or you can see if your hotel can make them for you during your Dubai stay (which is how I did it since I wasn’t comfortable submitting my credit card info online). You will need proof of your reservation to enter the property premise so be sure to take that with you. I was a bit surprised by the interior of the hotel, I didn’t know what to expect from the world’s only 7 star hotel but I know I wasn’t expecting what I saw. It looks as if Midas got inside and touched everything as there is enough gold to actually make it look gaudy. Perhaps being used to NYC I was expecting swanky, instead the lobby was almost reminiscent of a cruise ship interior and the Skyview Bar had a space age computer décor that looked dated. Since you can freely roam the lobby without a time restraint after tea I would recommend making it upstairs on time for tea since you can only stay for a limited time at the Skyview Bar. The view is not as spectacular as some other places but you do get to see the aqueous blue sea on one side and the yellow arid desert and cityscape on the other. The tea IS certainly a ceremonious 5 course affair (actually 6 courses since they brought out a complementary cake for my aunt along with a rose) and the waiters are super attentive constantly asking if you would like refills or to try another tea/coffee. The finger sandwiches and desserts are creative and filling and served with quite a flair, but taste wise the food is just average which considering the seven star rating and the bill is a bit underwhelming. Since I went to celebrate a significant birthday for my aunt I’m happy I got to give this experience to her as a gift. The uniqueness of the experience and the pampering from the wait staff justified the hefty bill on this special occasion. If however I had come for the food, or the view, or perhaps just on a regular day (and not a special occasion) I feel that I would have been considerably disappointed. If you are visiting Dubai to indulge in its luxurious, over the top opulence, with no regards to expenditure, then go ahead and have tea at the Skyview Bar. If you are at all budget conscious then I would say skip it, there are far more things to spend on in Dubai.

Breathtaking!. We recently visited Dubai for 8 days on vacation to explore the city with is all it has to offer. The famous Burj al Arab Hotel was naturally on the list - only to be gained access to if you have a booking of some kind to enjoy what this world legendary hotel has to offer. We opted for the morning breakfast in the Sahn Eddar Restaurant at lobby lounge 1st floor level. Pricey, yes but we were not disappointed!Apart from the very chic, delicious 5-course breakfast offering in absolutely plush surrounding, and top class silver service, complete with morning traditional live band, the hotel entrance and ambience blew us away. We got trigger-happy with the camera, because the sheer architecture, the boutique-style fountains, the open atrium interior reaching sky-high, the magnificent flower arrangements and the mix of colours in decor, is any photographer's dream.It is clear that the architects and developers of this property had carte blanche to create what is rightfully called a world iconic masterpiece of art (in our view) on its own man-made island. We were understandably only allowed to view the public areas on ground and first floors, but our visit was well worth it. If what is we saw in terms of opulence, is anything to go by, then a deeper dive into the innermost heart of all the hotel has to offer, can only be a sure attack on the senses.The High Tea on the top floor was also an option for us, but very expensive. The breakfast option-for-entry was a superb choice.

Amazing but all glitz and no 7 stars. We arranged a trip that included a 7 course afternoon tea at the Burj Al Arab. There was also a trip up the tallest building in the world, the Burj Khalifa, the Dubai Mall and the fountains. The 7 course tea was OK, but at what they like to advertise as 7 stars not as good as I expected. The hotel is all glitzy but very commercial and maybe a bit tacky.

Burj Al Arab. It's a great structure worth seeing. There is a great view from the free public beach or the Crescent Road that leads to the Jumeirah palm. It's not exactly a place you need to spend all day at but worth a look.

Luxury in every department.. Visited the Burj for afternoon tea and wow what an experience this hotel has to be visited it is luxury all the way and lives up to the 7 star reputation! The tea itself is fantastic and well worth the money it is situated in the sky view bar which offers fantastic views of Dubai however I would arrive earlier than your sitting to ensure a window seat is available. The tea is a 7 course offering of various items with champagne and unlimited drinks from a select menu. The staff in this hotel are superb and cannot do enough for you... this is a must when visiting Dubai.

Splurge!. It's worth going once to check it out. Be sure to have a reservation, there are plenty of places to choose from. We went to the Skydeck Bar. Beautiful, and views were great even at night.But it's one and done for us. 2 drinks each, 2 apps total, and the bill was over $300. Kinda crazy!

The ultimate experience!. We were here and I forgot to tell you !!!If you want a special treat for you and your loved ones and don't mind what it will cost you then this is the place to go. You will have to make reservations way in advance ( via their site) in able to get in. We were here last year in January and it was unbelievable. Some of our friends think it is way over the top, and maybe it is, but...it's special and if you are in Dubai you should consider going.We enjoyed a Friday lunch with our son and his wife who live in a neighboring country .We arrived around 13.00 and stayed until 18.00 at least. Enjoyed every minute of it. From entering the building until leaving the staff will treat you like royalty. Everything is done to perfection and to please you.. Visiting the ladies room is an experience by itself. The view from above is awesome.A couple of days later Hubby received an email to thank us for our visit and to ask if we enjoyed it. That is clever ! "would we consider visiting again in the future ...? " Yes, we will, next time we are in Dubai.
BEST HOTEL IN THE WORLD. BURJ AL ARAB is undoubtedly,the best hotel in the world.All the rooms have amazing view,mouth watering food and amazing water sports.
Stunning. Hard to get inside without a special tour. The atrium is 600+ feet tall (you could fit Washington Monument inside) and it is beautiful. Iconic for a reason.
By water view. Saw this via the yellow speedboats, great to see, get on the beach to get a close up view. Mere mortals like us just look at it,don't stayin it!!!

Still impressive but old.. We had to book dinner to go in and visit the hotel and because it is so iconic and still very impressive from the outside especially after knowing how they built this incredible structure on the desert it seemed a must for us but once inside you realize it's quite old and there are so many other better furnished hotels now.

excellent hgh tea. This was a pleasant experience. My wife does not drink tea or coffee or like mayonnaise on sandwiches. We emailed in advance and they sorted out her requests.Couldn't eat all of it ,there is so much, it was hard to choose what to leave.

They make you feel special. This place is gorgeous. We have booked the high tea experience and it was the highlight of our stay in Dubai. One of the best customer service experiences ever -from booking until the actual tea time. We absolutely loved the staff, the food, the view.... Spotless, magnificent and worth every penny. Will be back!

Gorgeous and Majestic. Stunning and iconic place! Beautiful interior that you can stare at forever. I loves the aquariums and all the color inside, nothing like any other hotel I've seen. Expensive, but if you come here, you are looking to splurge!

display of affluence. Awesome place but the high tea was an overdose of sugary stuff. It was very warm, the A/C was weak. There were musical instruments on a tiny stage but no one was playing. A piano with viloin could have added a classy and relaxing ambience. The experience was so boring we just wanted to get it over and done with picture taking and leave.

Favourite architecture. Our room overlooked this building and its an amazing landscape. Thought it is still the most unique building in Dubai. We were lucky enough to go inside due to having a restaurant invitation which other than staying there is only way to see inside. Loved the fountains and decor and colours. You also get a good view of the Palm and Dubai skyline. However drinks in the restaurant were astronomically expensive and price of the buffet was not value for money when compared to other places. Think they were cashing in on 7 star status and only way others can see inside. Restaurant service was very good.

Stylish Tea. Visited April 2013.As you can only enter the Burj Al Arab if you are staying there, or if you have a booking for Tea or Dinner, it is an exclusive area and makes you feel special when you arrive. We were staying at the Jumeirah Beach Hotel so the buggy service will take you over to the Burj. This is handy we were dressed up and I had heels on so wouldn't have wanted to walk the 20 minutes or so in the afternoon heat. Our driver made a swift right turn onto a lawned area next the beach so we could have photos with the magnificent hotel in the background. He was snapping away and we got some lovely pictures. The tea itself was fabulous. Cocktails, teas, coffees, cakes, sandwiches, chocolates and even a roast chicken made into a Wellington style. We were full for the rest of the day.You are seated on the mezzanine level (first floor) and there are some beautiful jewellery and watch boutiques so we had a wander around after tea. There was also a lady playing harp during the time we were seated which was very relaxing and added to the lovely ambience. You can't help but look up as there is no ceiling but an open area to see all the floors above and I assume the room doors which were blue and gold with a round port hole window. 10 or 12 elegant Arabic ladies were meeting for afternoon tea in the same area and it was fascinating to watch them as they all looked so beautiful in their stunning traditional dress. This made a welcome change from the standard black habib that the local women wear. The toilets were encrusted with gold taps and beautiful marble and you felt like you were in a palace of some kind. All in all a great experience which I would recommend.
in the sky. Above everything in fact. You can see the city and the desert, and the way the city is still growing.
The Burj Al Arab. A great iconic building and much larger than pictures ever show. Very secluded private and exclusive. A must if you visit Dubai.

Great Views. Yes it is pricey but worth going to see if you are in Dubai.
I went here at night time (22:00) it has amazing views.
I came here for drinks we had live music playing, the staff were great. The fish tanks when you come in are lovely the whole hotel looks amazing.

Burj Beach. We didnt get to go inside the Burj Al Arab but there is a free public beach closeby so we went paddleboarding there and it was amazing. we took lots of pictures in front of the famous hotel and it was freee

Nothing compares.... This structure makes the tall buildings around it looks like small little homes. It's crazy! We went up inside (to the 122nd floor) and the views are incredible. There are even higher floors...but that's as high as they'd let the public go. I'd love to be at the very top!!
Jinsui. Great location and view, not a great vegetarian selection. The service is excellent, the decor is what you would expect from the Burj, sparkly and glitzy!

OMG. Literally, this place is an absolute MUST if you visit Dubai. We had a champagne afternoon tea which was without doubt, the best afternoon tea we've ever had. Nothing and indeed nowhere in the world even comes close. Yes it's pricey, but if you're the sort of person to whinge about £90 per head for a 2 hour eating and drinking experience at the world's most extravagant hotel then you shouldn't be visiting this kind of a place. I'd have paid twice that after having experienced it!! We are just your average family on fairly average wages, so book away and prepare for the best eating experience you'll find in Dubai!!

Afternoon tea in the Sky View Bar. It was very expensive, but a once in a life time experience.The lift was amazing, it was on the outside of the building, so you so the ground disappeared before you 'quickly'.The view from the restaurant was breath taking, we sat at the window and had the best view of the sea and the land.The food and service was outstanding.

Splendid hotel in UAE.. It's a one of the luxariust hotel in UAE. it's a situated at shore of sea. it's shape look like a ship. Most beautiful lobby area and very attractive lobby fountain show. You can see inside the hotel 22 cart gold plated piller in the lobby. And under water restaurent is fabulous. It's a amazing. You can feel your in under the sea. After that most attactative place skyview bar restaurent. it's topest restaurent in the hotel. From there you see palm island very clearly and world island. Inside the restaurent so beatiful. My opinion all people atleast one must see this hotel.
Unbelievable. This was one of my highlights during our trip! I ave seen so many photos of different celebs stood on the beach with this as their back drop. Quite simply stunning

Amazing experience. We had an amazing time dinning in four different restaurant during the culinary flight experience, the first restaurant were we had our starters had an aquarium,the staffs are warm especially those in the last restaurant were we had desert, can't say I really enjoy the chiness restaurant (Jen su) not sure of the spelling , couldn't wait to leAve but has got a really nice view and deco.

Not as good as I hoped.. The views were amazing. Absolutely beautiful BUT the eating experience was rubbish to say the least. The staff were not great either.
I'd suggest that you only go up here when you go to the bar. You can still see the amazing view but don't have to spend about £60 per person for the rubbish food they have.
Afternoon tea. Went here for my birthday , much better than the ritz they even gave me birthday cake and real red rose good value for money staff so friendly and informative

Top class. We had a wonderful time last year and were upgraded to a 2 bedroom suite. The Burj is everything you see and more. The property is amazing and the staff attentive. The children had a wonderful time and my wife wants to return again...

7 START. Honestly one of the most amazing hotels on the planet we ate at al muntahara and it was absolutely outstanding and worth every penny the service is so on point!! if you are in Dubai ensure you visit the burj al arab!!

Make sure there is plenty of room in the tank. We had high tea here and yes its very expensive. It was a memorable experience and we didn't eat again that day. The food was exquisite and the tea includes trying as many teas as you want. Not normally a tea drinker, this was quite and experience - teas I had never heard of and what a delight.The view is great (not as good as the Kalifa) but still a perfect view to sit and while away the time while being pampered with food and drink.I would suggest getting a window seat if possible, make sure you visit the convenience (you will be amazed) and arrive a bit early to take in the Hotel's entry - its something else and unfortunately shows the difference between the have's and have nots.

Tea Time at SKy View bar. The service, quality of food was excellent and the view was amazing as we were given window seats. I felt it was pricey for tea time but if you see it an as opportunity to view the hotel and recieve first class customer service defintely would reccomend the place.

Must do!. You either need to be a guest at the hotel or have dinner/tea reservations to enter! It is expensive but totally worth it! Entering the hotel, it's almost as if you entered a different world. The high end design is to be seen, enjoyed and experienced. We had tea at Skyview Bar (will write review in Skyview Bar), it is worth every penny for the experience! ;) At first I was a bit skeptical in spending the amount of money for tea but after convincing from my husband on once in a lifetime deal, I am glad we did it. Truly enjoyed it. Best bet is to take taxi, public transportation does not go to Burj Al Arab

Man Made Wonder. Luxury at its Best!!!Although ambience wise it is one of the finest hotel but what i dint like about the place was the grand dinner that we had over there as the food was below average with a huge price tag and not worthy of the high expectations...But Go check it out for the amazing architecture and ambience..

Glad we did it but probably won't bother again. We stayed in another hotel but decided to treat ourselves and have dinner one evening on the 27th Floor restaurant. Glad we did it as an experience but can't say we'd be back again. Food was good but have had better :(We paid £350 for 2 of us to have a 2 course meal and shared dessert win 1 bottle of wine. Wouldn't have minded paying that had it been worth it and unfortunately it wasn't. Service was second to none and you wouldn't expect anything less but food let it down. But it was a fantastic experience and the views when you sit by the window are astounding.

Overpriced. This place is ok to go and have a look around just to see the hotel lobby with the fountains etc but everything is so expensive.We went up to the bar at the top and it was ok just another view really of the sea and the coast. I would definetly go to burj khalifa though for the very best view.
Perfect rooms with stunning view. We had a lovely maisonette with the perfect view and the bathrooms were full of HERMES goodies in original size.Wow!
got to visit. you have to make reservations well worth a visit a bit exspensive so take your credit card 20 pounds a cocktail.

7* afternoon tea. Amazing we went for afternoon tea in the sky view bar, the staff were so kind and friendly, yummy food and great tasting tea. amazing views, very nice place and the hotel was amazing too.
would highly recommend.

Fantastic afternoon tea.. We Went for afternoon tea, service and food really good. Defiantly will go again. We took our children with us and they had a lovely choice for them including the full afternoon tea if they wanted it.
Food quality was extremely good and the service was superb as you would expect from this hotel.
Tourist visit must see. We visited the beach below the burj al Arab. Beach was warm and clean. The tower was nice, great stop for photographs etc. thoroughly enjoyed myself.
Need reservation.. Nice to take pictures, but if you want to see inside, you have to make reservations for the restaurant in case you are not a guest.

AFTERNOON TEA AMAZING!. My husband and I have been to Dubai twice now, once last year and also just returned in 2014. The Burj was definitely in our ''List to see'' and I am so happy we did book our experience. We booked afternoon tea from 2pm ish and was there for a good 3-4 hours, it is worth every penny!Unlimited food, service was incredible and presented just stunning when arrived the table. I have been to Afternoon Tea in some of the most famous places in London and other countries but they do NOT come close to the Burj. We didn't get table near the window, which didn't bother us because for photo's the flash would actually only bounce back, our waitress took as many photos of us as we wish and the back ground of the restaurant other tables was just divineA truly beautiful experience when visiting Dubai - Best of all, you get to browse the whole of the Burj!!!!!!!!

Great cocktails. We booked in for cocktails here in the Skyview Bar and although expensive it was worth it for the experience and quality of the cocktails. There is a minimum spend of approx €60 per person (320 AED), it's not hard to reach this figure!!The building is mesmerising from it's innovative and unique design to the fine detail. On entering the building you are greeted by a waterfall, not an ordinary one, and walls adjoining the stairways brimming with tropical plants and fish.The human greeting is first class and they make you feel special. The bar area overlooks the gulf and faces back towards downtown Dubai which was wonderfully illuminated against the night sky.We had some champagne and cocktails.I can highly recommend the 5th Ave Slammer, the best cocktail I have had by some distance, worth the expense.We witnessed the indoor fountain when we were leaving. What an engineering feat. Spurts of water that resembled jumping fish of varying lengths and jumping to different heights. The "fish" splash onto the bowl (no ordinary bowl) which creates a percussive sound. I'm sure one of the sequences drummed out a Riverdance excerpt. Mesmerising, I could have watched it for a long time.

High tea in the sky. A post mother's day gift from my son to experience high tea in such a beautiful setting. Excellent food, lots of it and very good service. The views are amazing from the top. Found it very expensive. Hotel is nice to visit but I have seen much nicer.

At the top of Dubai. Try to book tickets online, it's much cheaper. At the venue there is a chance to get an audio guide at 25 AED, however even if you don't have it you will not miss much:)The trip starts with screening for security and then you are being guided to the elevator which lifts you up to more than 400 meters, 120th floor of the building in one minute, enjoy that minute :) Then you have a great view of the city on you palm:)) Don't forget to pick up your favourite souvenir at the gift shop, our's "burj Khalifa" fridge magnet, reminds us about nice moments spent at the top:))The whole tour took 2 hours. We went during the day time, if you are lucky to get the tickets for the evening time around 5 or 6, do that.

Sky bar afternoon tea & champagne. We visited the sky bar for afternoon tea with champagne as a surprise for my 50th birthday . I have to say it was ok but nothing special really to what we have experienced in other hotels in other parts of the world. On arriving you have to check in by the lift for your time slot where a lot of other people have to wait at the same time. Once you get out of the lift it is very disorganised I felt with no place to sit and very cramped , you had to wait until others left the sky bar for you to then go in. The same although polite looked very scruffy and the uniforms looked very tired and dull, we had the food and cakes and champagne and as much tea you wanted to drink. The seating was very tight and if you had a sofa to sit on and your tall it will be very uncomfortable as it's lower than the table and no place to place your feet under the table. We stayed on the palm at zabeel saray which is part of the same group but I gave to say we had afternoon tea and champagne there at it was far better and much more comfortable and staff excellent and well turned out .Great building worth visit to look at , but looks very tired inside now compared to other hotels on the palm.

Amazing experience... My partner and I ate here in October at the Al Muntaha restaurant.. it's on a whole different level from anywhere other restaurant we've visited.
