The hotel on approach is breath taking, the staff on arrival were amazing and the interior of the hotel leaves you speechless. We were in Dubai for our honeymoon and we're not quite sure how the resturant found this out be we had rose petals on the table in the shape of a heart and were congratulated on our marriage by our waiter.. we wouldn't usually choose to eat in a place with these prices, as I said, we were on our honeymoon so we seen it as a one off but it was worth every penny, to experience how the other half wine and dine was great, service was great, food and drink was amazing.. would love to visit again one day.. maybe when I hit the lottery!! Well worth a visit if you get chance..

great sight but cant get close enough. its is defiantly a sight to see but you can't get a good picture of it aka close enough. Go to the Souk Madinat Jumeirah and get photos there or sneak onto the beach and you can get some awesome shots of it.

Memorable anniversary. I didn't come here to stay actually, but to have lunch at the restaurant, for our anniversary. The food was usual fare for the hotel, but the interior and exterior of the hotel was very interesting. However, I can't help but feel that it has an old feeling to it. The decoration of the hotel was....gaudy? Maybe i need to stay inside to find out :)Oh, the restaurant was kind enough to give us a nice big chocolate cake for free, that was really good!

beautiful from the outside. Got to see this from the road - its beautiful and amazing to have been built on an island - I understand you can make reservations for meals and then you can get inside - too expensive for my budget but it is impressive to hear how they built it and dealt with the local building and cooling issues.

Wow. What a lovely way to spend an afternoon, we went for afternoon tea in the sky bar, the food was lovely and service was excellent the views were great too, but book before you go as it is very busy
Afternoon Tea. Wonderful birthday treat Lots of excellent food and a great view, make sure to leave time to watch the fountain display at the top of the entrance escalator

Amazing. We booked directly with the BAA and it cost about £93pp. Definitely worth every penny. Food, service & hotel is amazing. I would recommend arriving early to get a seat near window. If it's a special occasion, tell them! They surprised my mum with a rise and small birthday dessert!

Culinary Flight Burj Al Arab. The Burj Al Arab is an incredible architectural structure - appreciated even if this is not your thing! Only by viewing the interior, can you truly appreciate the magnificence of the building. If you can't afford the hefty price tag of staying the night, the next best option of exploring the entire structure is by reserving yourself on a culinary flight! Your dinner journey begins at Skyview Bar, before moving on through five dining venues. We had an amazing evening dining in Asian, Middle Eastern and seafood (the "under water restaurant" reached by "submarine"). Your journey ends with sweets in the lounge. We were also privileged to be shown a suite along the way. We were given a CD and beautiful coffee table book of the Burj Al Arab at the end of the evening. A truly memorable experience with fabulous food and service all the way! Be warned - book well ahead! It does not come cheap but well worth every penny!

Astounding hotel. I would call it another wonder of the world. Skip one city from your travel itinerary in your life time and stay in this hotel for at least one night. That will explain itself why I am saying it because there are no words to explain the beauty and comfort

Burj Al Arab -----Simply WOW and Jaw Dropping. Adil Sidiqui Food and beverage department - ASSET FOR THE HOTEL...
the Atrium Lobby is the one to die for... all atrium lovers out there, see this to believe me what i am saying...
must must visit and have a sip of champagne at the roof top...
high tea. we went for the high tea and it was delicious. every dollar (and it is a bit too costly) spent was worth it. and we got to see the lovely view and the hotel also.

Best lunch experience!!. We managed to get reservations (you can't get near the hotel without a meal or travel reservation). We had our four children with us and it was beyond our expectations. The food was delicious, the serve was amazing and the hotel is immaculate, impressive and beautiful. For lunch you are required a three course meal. We had no problem with that at all. This might set you back, but it is worth the money. We would definitely go back there to eat and/or stay.

Such a beautiful hotel. We ate in Jinsui restaurant. The food is average. awesome views of the water. Great service. The toilet was full, and the waitress accompanied us to the toilet at the lobby. They were very accommodating. with the company of another waiter, we were able to see the beautiful Mahara restaurant with a great view of their aquarium.
Opulent. works tallest building- never been in a lift that skips floor on the lcd screen. we went at night so we were able to see all the lights- do think during the day is far better

Go for the Experience. So my husband surprised me with dinner here on our anniversary while on holiday in Dubai. In my opinion this place is about the feeling you get. You must have a reservation just to get on the property. The hotel is magnificent and feels like money. There is an impressive aquarium in the restaurant. They are the "only restaurant in the world" to serve Cristal by the glass. My husband and I are regular people who go to work everyday and have a nice vacation once a year. So the "appearances" at this place made us feel like we had money, when we don't. But in all honesty, it wasn't the best meal we'd ever had. Don't get me wrong the sea salt encrusted sea bass was phenomenal. The presentation was quite impressive. But $700 good...meh? Go for the experience and bragging rights and it will all be worth it.

High Tea was a great experience. Visited in the afternoon for high tea with two friends. The first impressions were WOW and it just got better. The Burj is quite an impresive place and lived up to all the hype. To get into the place you need to be staying there or have a reservation. The entrance way is very impressive. To get to the High Tea you had to take the elevator to the top. An impressive ride in a glass sided elevator.The view from the top is spectacular, pity about the "smog".The food they bring is fantastic. My wife intially asked for gluten free food which was readly suppled, and they also gave her the gluten food as well. There was way too much for the four of us to eat.It is not a cheap afternoon, so expectations were high and those expectations were met.Overall a great afternoon. We visited the Dubai Mall on the way back to our hotel and had a great early night there as well.
Celebrate an occasion with a view. The Burj Al Arab is a lovely hotel to visit. The interior is exceptional and I highly recommend the Skyview Bar.

Impressive but not the best. Impressive but not interesting , I was expecting a good quality food the best of the best since I spend 400dlls for 2 people not including alcohol , my lobster was over cooked and the filet was not a good quality cut . Service was very good what I expected for a 7 star hotel . Over all the experience was ok but I will hire a good chef from Australia maybe where they have the chefs in the world .

Simply Wonderful. Nor surprise there then, a 6 star hotel serves a delightful afternoon tea in a sumptuous setting! Yes it wasn't cheap but this was an amazing experience.My super girlfriend had sorted out the most central table which allowed us to best appreciate the building itself (view up inside the tower) and also the view towards Jumeirah beach.Plus having the ticket for afternoon tea is what got us both onsite here, and let us have a good walk round the grounds of the Jumeriah Beach hotel as well.Not cheap - but definitely worth doing!

Nice experience. I always want to visit this building, very nice lobby with nice aquarium on the side and fountain in the middle. Nice and very high atrium with lots of color . The afternoon tea was great with lots of food although it was a little bit pricey. Great experience visiting Dubai icon

High Tea at the Burj Al Arab. The only way to get past security without staying there. Not cheap but worth the experience to get in, see the entrance, the hotel and the bar restaurant at the top, (nearly).We had several courses of food and cake, all regally served. Then a look around the gift shops.For those who went there and couldn't get in, we checked on Trip Advisor first or we would have done the same.
Amazing hotel with very high level style 7stars. Wow,it is so great,wonderful,amazing hotel with so nice design.resturant has varieties of international meals with excellent service.Ali Waleed,Iraq.

Wish I had seen the review below before. I really wish we had seen the review below prior to our visit on a tour. You can take all the photos you want from behind the gate (beware of cars), but you can't get past the gate unless you're already reserved for either the hotel stay, tea or a meal. Such a shame that this is limited access like that. With "7" star service- basically 7 employees per guest, you would think they could handle a small influx of tourists wanting to see certain parts of this hotel.
Worth the money. We had breakfast at the Burj and it was stunning beyond words. A must see! Its pricey but then again, when else will you get the chance to see a 7 * hotel.....loved it!

Waw an impressive experience. We had a trip to burj al arab we enjoyed our time at such amazing building. We have a private guide who escorted us and provide culture information about the building. Dubai has the most amazing buildings really this is deserve your visit

Youll be glad you had the experience!. I went to the Burj for afternoon tea in the lobby. The "tea" was actually four courses, with sandwiches, champagne, coffee, sweets, actual tea, cocktail, and more. It was prohibitively expensive (about $120 per person) if we were just paying for the food, but we were paying for the experience and it was worth it. (By the way, I believe going for tea is the most inexpensive way to access the Burj). Even taking tea in the lobby was very relaxing. The décor was very tacky, but fun, the music was very nice. After tea, we went to the "gift shop" expecting to buy a magnet or something. But this was not an ordinary gift shop. They were selling diamonds and things like that... as soon as we walked in we tried to leave, but the girl at the counter (who was clearly very bored) called us over and had us try on diamond rings. She insisted that I try on a five carat diamond ring! To be clear, she was in no way trying to sell them to us, she just wanted us to have fun. This was a very good experience, I would definitely recommend it.

Don't expect to get near it unless you've reserved... We went over to the burj al arab hoping to have a look a round, take some pictures and have a drink before moving on. We were stopped at the gate, which is quite far from the building and told we needed a reservation to go through. We weren't allowed to just reserve a drink and were given a menu to choose from, starting from about 350dh per person.
costly event. if you have seen towers...this is the tower to be..however...costly to go up...make a reservation via the web to safe some UEA
Burj Al Arab. We got as far as the gates and were stopped, if you want to get near you need to book in advance, morning tea or drinks, otherwise you'll only get as far as the gate which is not ideal.

A landmark which leaves a mark on you!!. Have been here on two occasions both official, and both in their ballroom on the 24th floor/. The entrance to the hotel through the bridgeway gives a spectacular view of the hotel and once inside the features are beyond five star. warm welcome from the entrance by local delicacies of dates, and then they help you find your way. The facilities were world class, ambience is fantastic and the view of the ocean is mindblowing!! This stays in your memory forever! Cannot say the same about the food though. the first time the food was mere satisfactory, second time it was good but not something versatile for the reputation of the place!! Expensive but worth an experience

Anniversary date. Made a booking at a cocktail bar for our anniversary just so we can have a peek what is inside. The hotel is very security conscious (a good thing). When we arrived at the gate we had to show our booking before we were allowed to enter. So do print or save a copy of your bookings in your phone. The lobby was really grand, with a ceiling that I am still trying to work out what sort of design it is. The tallest atrium in the world with its water fountains is striking. Lots of gold colour around the lobby and lifts. It was a nice visit and we're happy we went. Photos and more details here:http://www.stepsonair.info/burj-al-arab-anniversary-date/

Gorgeous but need a reservation. FYI...you cannot even get onto the property and into the building without a reservation of some kind. If you want to get to the top, make sure to get a reservation in advance. We waited to the last minute and was only able to get in by doing afternoon tea at the Junsui Pure Asian restaurant located on the ground floor for 360 aed per person. It was 7 courses and a huge variety of teas. It was beautiful and there is a little something for everyone. But the inside of the Burj Al Arab was gorgeous. There were 2 fountains when you first get inside, a huge aquarium, and the decor is unbelievable. We weren't able to go to the top because they check your reservation even at the elevator, so we couldn't get up there. But after we left, we made sure to stop at the nearby Jumeirah Beach to get a picture of the Burj Al Arab.

Fantastic. What a fantastic hotel, we booked an evening meal here. We was awestruck just looking at everything from the fish tanks that run up the side of the escalators, to the gold lifts that took us up to the restaurant. Was not impressed with the meal we had, our hotel restaurant was nicer

BURJ AL ARAB. This Hotel is really is amazing when we arrived there were 4 white rolls royces in the car park we had dinner at the pool bar which is probably the best dinner ive ever had. After that we went to the skybar for cocktails.

Right over the top. If you want to go to a hotel that is really over the top this is the place to go the opulence and decor is like a hollywood movie went for new years eve it was the best ever champagne canapé were served while there was a circus in the foyer beautiful girls butlers with white gloves all ready to serve you we had dinner in there fish restaurant there were presents food was amazing and afterwards there were fireworks and a marquee with a band and free flowing champagne all night the countdown to 12 00 o'clock was amazing they must have spent a fortune to make guests most comfortable saving up for this year yes it's really over the top and yes it is expensive but you got every bit of what you paid for and more you must go at least once can't say I did not like anything

It has got to be Done but.. It was good and we were pleased we did it. But we felt they were trying to wring money out of the tourists when they offered photos with you clinging onto the side of the building etc for $100 plus. Make sure you reserve it a couple of weeks ahead of time on the internet or the price is extortionate.

A lovely experience. We visited for afternoon tea in the sky view bar. This was a wonderful experience with excellent service and views. The seven courses were all lovely and the staff very efficient and helpful. Although expensive you are paying for the whole experience and the views. As we were celebrating our 25th wedding anniversary we were presented with an individual anniversary cake and an individually wrapped red rose.

7 star - I don't think so!. my husband and I went to the afternoon tea and were very excited, but after we entered the room via the weirdest section that looked like something out of Dr Who? it was a small walkway that looked like a computer board (sorry words fail me) the display cabinet in the entrance is tacky and cheap. The cutlery may of been silver plated but some of the cutlery had small pieces coming off, the cupboard next to us that the staff used was painted silver and was marked and tacky. I had read someone saying that the décor did look like a cruise ship and I would have to agree. The staff are the highlight - great service. The sandwiches had been refrigerated so they did not have that lovely fresh taste, and the rest of the food was nice but not great. I asked for another tea and we had to pay extra for this on top of the $148 aus that we paid. Its a lot of money for not much - I would save my money

celebrity and high diplomat hotel. unique property of the United Arab Emirates. need to have either advance reservation slip or counter pay slip to have an entry into the property. Excellent property.
Fine dining with a view. We had the high tea. Couldn't fault it. It was a friend's birthday, she received special chocolates and a rose as well. Very lovely.
Amazing cocktails. What an experience and what a view, even the toilets were well worth a visit! Lovely staff and excellent cocktails.

simply amazing!!!!!. this is my first time in dubai, and of course i wanted to visit this super luxurious hotel!! it has great restaurants...i recomend going to the 27 floor to have a 1pm brunch!!
make sure you reserv, because if not you cant go!!
really amazing!!!!!!
impressive!!!!!!!!. This Burj (arabic for Tower) is a real good example of what modern architecture can achieve. A must see!
Wow!!!. It is wow! Astonishing during the day and evening. Worth to go for some pictures and if u can afford it... spend a night or two ;-)

Had to be done. When in Dubai one MUST do Afternoon Tea in the skyview bar of the Burj Al Arab. Yes, it's not cheap (£83 each) but in this reviewers opinion worth every penny.Your made to feel special as soon as you enter this spectacular (and totally OTT) hotel. The entrance is amazing, two whole walls a giant fish tank going up the side of each escalator.The journey up in the elevator was a treat in itself, the glass walls availing you off all the amazing views around.Upon arriving on the 27th floor for 'tea' you are seated in a beautiful setting with some amazing views over the surrounding area. Everything about our tea 'experience' was carefully and excellently explained to us by our server Rueben (a wonderful chap). We started with a glass of champagne, followed by a small fruit canapé then the real feast began! There are a whole host of teas and coffees available, all unlimited. A stand of sandwiches and mini rolls was brought out and each one explained, all were absolutely delicious and we were offered more if we wanted them! Next was a cake stand of treats (btw each stand is shaped like the hotel itself), scones, macaroons, jams and other delicacies. At no time were we made to feel that there was a time limit on how long we were there.We were then presented with a mini cake, with 'Happy Anniversary' on it and a rose for me.Finally, a most delicious sorbet; and a small box of chocolates for me to take away.What a beautiful afternoon, a MUST.

Culinary flight experience. We booked in advance for the culinary flight experience at the Burj. It was fabulous and I would recommend for any special occasion/birthday/anniversary. A perfect way to experience one of the world's most famous hotels. The experience was around £160 per person but in my opinion was worth it. It was a great way to experience many different restaurants in the hotel and the service was excellent. Book in advance!

nice. well, when choosing to see Dubai this is of course also a Must see as no other 7Star Hotel exists so far. with the Big Bus (Hop-on Hop-Off) you have 2 fotostops for that which is enough. we did not book a journey that takes us inside but if you take a ride with the taxi you can drive past it quite near....

Skyview Bar for tea!. Wonderful experience and has to be done!! Tea was excellent although a little pricey but the service the tea the atmosphere and the views were all well worth it. If I get the chance would do it again!
Super impressed. Go for afternoon tea in the skyview bar. Book in advance. It costs about £90 pp including a glass of champagne.

Would be nice to visit it but..... Went with colleagues to visit the Famous Hotel ,to drink some coffee,whiskey or....but where stopped at the entry gate.The responsible explained that unfortunatelly only Guests of the Hotel can enter there.So we made couple of nice photos and thats it volks.
Little disappointing. Location not very good if you only wish to get a photo. The car park of Water park right on top of the driveway to Burj,very crowded and major building works.

Try Getting in here.... You have to be a guest or have VIP connections to even be allowed in here. Place is a ghost town but people with cash like this sort of thing. Quite the surreal experience, Never stayed in the room, and if you can afford it, get the helicopter ride into the roof in true style!
Amazing. Must stop and take a look at this amazing building. Take lots of pictures. Beautiful view of it from Jumeira beach when our tour group stopped for pictures.

Outside View. I did not make reservations here, maybe next time :)It looks magnificent from the outside too, it is not an egoistic structure like the Burj Khaleefa. This is a genuine design and engineering marvel.You have two ways of seeing this from outside [3 ways if you also visit Wild Wadi next door ].1. Take a taxi or bus to Wild Wadi, one hundred meters before there is a viewing point for Burj Al Arab. There is a nice Air Conditioned waiting area for bus travelers too, though nearly every tourist took a time out here.2. Enter the Madina Jumeirah Souk. Enjoy the Souk Views, and ask for "Al-Makan" Lebanese Restaurant. The view of Burj Al Arab from there are excellent with the Arabian Palace Architecture in between, birds, flowers, a fountain and a small pond below as well to add to the ambience. Don't forget to munch Lebanese Pastries while admiring the entire view, and if the genuinely enthusiastic Mr. Riyaz is around, he will take excellent family pics for you.
Awesome Experience. It's awesome place to spend quality time there, Beach is next to this hotel and you can visit the beach to have amazing time and click amazing pictures :)

Beautiful, but in-accessible. It's a gorgeous building in a beautiful,setting. However,they don't allow you to just enter to look around, you. It's have reservations at the hotel or in one of the restaurants.

The worlds highest building. It's better and cheaper to make an internet reservation to visit the Burj Khalifa. If you visit the top at the end of the day you can enjoy the view when it's still light and after the sunset. Please note that it is a long walk from the metrostation till the entrance of the Burj Khalifa. We had to ran to be in time for our visit!!!! It is nice to go up and enjoy the view and it's special to be in the highest tower of the world, but after 30 minutes we all wanted to go down again.

If your wallet is big enough.... In the past it's my understanding you could visit. Now, you must have reservations for the night or a meal. I chose the later since a night will run you roughly $1500 and up. I ate at the Al Mahara after a simulated submarine ride. It was quite extraordinary. As was the food (and corresponding bill). Prior to our lunch at Al Mahara, we were privileged to visit the Al Muntaha bar up top. Lovely views from there. Again, if you can afford it (lunch was $350), I couldn't recommend it any more highly.
Not accessable unless you hve a reservation. Beware, you cant get within cooee without a Room or Restaurant reservation - not even for a look-see.
Breathtaking. Just as you'd expect the BAA was incredible - clean, opulent and well serviced by attentive staff. Highly recommended to anyone visiting Dubai, especially the Skyview Bar.

Over the top.... You dont get more over the top than this hotel...billed as the worlds only 7 star property.Everything done here is to the nth degree and their smallesst room/suite checks in at a mere 1800 sq ft. The service is extrodinary from the time your walk through the door until you leave. The lobby is a wrok of art and its hard to focus as there is so much to look at.. from the huges aqauroims lining the escalators to the fountains, to the mulitcolor balconies to the luxury restaurants and shops lining the lobby verandah..Our suite had a private butler , as they work by floors and our Butler Rahim was stellar with suggestions for dining, taking care of unpacking, confirming flights etc..the service was unparalleled. Our suite had an office with, Mac computer, Fax, Bose sound system, multiple line phones and more gadgets than i can remember. As a tech savy travelers this was simply amazing. The suite had a bar, huge spiral staircase to the upper floor, gorgeous huge shower and bathrooms and huge bedroom with attached lounge area. The room had remote control blackout curtains as well as a remote control pop up flatscreen in the bedroom. There was even remote controls for all the lighting, AC. THe views were to die for an of course we could see the famous Jumeriah Palm manmade islands from our suite a s the huge highrises from the Jumeriah Lakes tower areas as well. The Burj Khalifa was on the other side of the buiilding some I am sure there was a view of that too but our suite faced the other direction. Please keep in mind this hotel is not for everyone however as its use of very bold colors and excessive use of gold plating is a matter of taste,. Like my title says this place is really "over the top" but its done so well it works.If you want to splurge once in your life this is the place to do it. Bring your cash though as it ultra expensive!

Great View BUT Pricey. This is a must do but is expensive at 400 EAD ($120) pp for an anytime ticket. You can book a specific time that costs less but be prepared to line up and wait. we pre-booked a 10:30 pm time two days in advance for 200 EAD pp that was more reasonable.The lifts to the observation deck are a long way from the taxi drop-off at the Dubai Mall so be prepared top hire an electric mall cart with driver or make the 15-20 minute trek on foot.

WOW FANTASTIC. I went for a evening meal at the AL MAHARA restaurant totally blew me away i was given a table to my self . The special thing of this restaurant is the gigantic fish tank from ceiling to floor across all one side of the restaurant was so very clean ! so many kinds of fish my table was on the fish tank side I found it really enjoyable watching them The staff were so immaculate the ladies in authentic dress ! Their was a food waiter who knew about all the dishes on the menu has their was a wine waiter who to knew all about the wines so could advise you on what wine to have myself i like chardonnay to which i was given an italian one which had never heard of before but it was very nice I had 3 courses and surprisingly the portions were quite large has i have usually found expensive restaurants the portions to be really small also a nice touch between each course was served a small dish appetizers to stimulate the palate for the next course Never at any time did i felt i was being hurried in fact i went in at 8pm and left gone 11pm the staff dont mind one taking photos only thou not flash and are happy to take one of yourselves All the staff no how to carry out their duties to the highest standards I was certainly treated well has mentioned before being disabled i was taken from my hotel the Jumeirah beach by golf buggy escorted in my wheel chair to my table on departure a limousine had been arranged to take me back to my hotel So to me i found it to be a very good restaurant yes expensive but you get what you pay for and here you get the best On leaving you get presented with a book giving details all about the fish tank and fish Tables are well spaces out and the reception area into the hotel is spectacularTips make sure you book well in advance and you are required to have at least 2 courses
just saw it from the outside. Went by on a tour and stopped at a nearby beach to admire. It truly is magnificent and worth just seeing.
Wonderful decadent and out of this world!. Ornate surroundings, fabulous food staff efficiency and fabulous fast lift up to the top bar! Try a personalised cocktail and have the canopies yummy!

Expensive, Luxurious Hotel. We had visited the hotel last NOvember. The lobby is huge, you see gold pillars, huge aquarium. But for personal perspective it wasn't a huge deal for me. IT did not give me a wow factor when we first came in. The elevators are exeptional. All gold plated, very luxurious. We had dine in to 5 different resturants including the skyview etc.What I love about this hotel are the restrooms even for the resturants are super nice,it's different and it matches per theme of the restrooms. THere is no paper towel because they use actual hand clothes that is nicely placed on the vanities. There is free hermes perfume and lotion that you can use. The designs are great.Food wise.. ummm it wasn't that memorable.Exeptional service with the staffs except for the ones in the lobby when we asked for paper bag they gaVe us hard time just for the paper bag. Like really?!Definitely worth looking in, just for the sake of "I've been in the 7-star hotel in DUbai."

Wonderful experience. We were treated to Afternoon Tea at the Burj Al Arab as we were in Dubai for our honeymoon. The whole experience was wonderful. From the minute you arrive at the hotel, the staff are superb. The hotel is out of this world and it is worth spending 10 minutes looking around the lobby before heading up to the Skyview Bar. The Afternoon Tea itself was delicious. We were served champagne, a berry tart, a fillet of beef, as many sandwiches you could eat, cakes and pastries and sorbet. Along with as many non-alcoholic drinks as we wanted. The waiters were very attentive, happily taking photos, checking dietary requirements etc. The views were stunning. We didn't have a window seat but we could still see and appreciate the views. As we were on honeymoon, they gave my husband a red rose to present to me. And we noticed that anyone who was celebrating a birthday/anniversary etc were given a small cake and a rose so let them know if you are celebrating. When we left, they gave us a small box of chocolates to take away with us. You can also take away the cakes you can't manage to eat. A wonderful experience and a fantastic end to a perfect honeymoon.

magnificent hotel. never went inside actually because of short with time...but it looks awesome from outside..its really very attractive.....seems like welcoming traveler..will definitely go inside during my next visit to dubai.

Exciting Experience. We visited the Lounge at the top of the Al Arab. The view over Dubai is stunning. Note that you must book in advance. The waiting staff were extremely attentive and knowledgeable about the drinks(cocktails) they serve. I stayed with a classic rum & coke that was about £50.00 a shot. The view and the experience of this seven star hotel is what you pay for.

All around the world. We did the all around the world option (a course in each Restaurant) we had friends staying and it was an amazing night. We had been there on several occasions before but this was special and would recommend anyone to do it if you have the chance.

Make reservations now!. This amazing hotel is a must-visit if you are going to Dubai. You will not be able to go onto the property without reservations - either at the restaurants or to stay in one of their posh rooms. My husband and I made reservations long before we left the USA to visit Dubai. I am so very glad we planned ahead because this was a great experience for us to recall years from now.

We made the most of our afternoon here.. Coming here has been on my bucket list for years so it was a must-do for us. We had meal vouchers through staying at another Jumeirah hotel and my dream location was the restaurant at the top with the amazing view of Dubai and the man-made islands. The service and food was amazing and we thoroughly enjoyed the whole occasion feeling rich for one day, but realistically you do actually have to accept it will be eye watering to take a family of four (2 teenage girls) for lunch even with the vouchers. Book before you travel if it is somewhere you really want to go and you do need a reservation to cross the bridge to the hotel, you can't just rock up to the foyer to take pictures of it. The lift to the restaurant is a ride in itself as it is on the outside of the building overlooking the sea so not for anyone with a fear for heights, but there are other restaurants you can book. A bottle of water was £10 and a glass of champagne was £90, overall the bill was £500 but if you are booking a meal here then you are doing it for the whole experience which you have to take into consideration and they are happy to let you take as many photos as you like while you are up there.

Subterranean restuarant. 7 course meal, one of the best I have ever experienced and I have ate at a lot of good restaurants. Sitting below sea level, with the thick glass walls displaying all the different types of fish found in the Gulf. Awesome

Speaks for itself. Never actually went inside but this building is what some people link with DubaiOnce again it stands out & you can grad some great photos from many anglesJumeriah beach & Sook Medinat are both nearby & are also worth avisit

Luxury and more. This is a very beautiful building. The architectural design in the interior, full of "balconies" is amazing. We were there with Friends to have a dring and snacks by 7PM and it was great. You feel like Paris Hilton, haha!

Over-rated but it is a must see place. Over-rated but it is a must see place. It is a definitely a piece of art but too over-rated. The restaurants are all very nice and excellent food & service. I must admit they are all marvelous.

Unbelievable!. Quite one the best experiences. From the sub simulator to being escorted to and from the Ladies washroom. Food was sublime and the sommelier very knowledgeable. Dining whilst watching the sealife was an experience.

Great cocktails and very attentative staff. We booked for cocktails on my wife's birthday, she felt very spoiled when they bought over a birthday cake, we spend a couple of hours here drinking different types of cocktails all made to perfection, i found the prices to be reasonable.
Good. Beautiful building, but unfortunately you will not go too close there if you have no reservation in this hotel. On the beach near Burj Al Arab we have a good fun

Not that impressed. Had dinner here for our 25th Wedding anniversary. We were staying in the Zabeel Saray (part of the same hotel group on the Palm). We thought dinner would be special as it's a 7 star hotel and it was a special anniversary. The hotel is beautiful but in need of a refurb. Dinner was very disappointing. The food was nice but not a patch on the Zabeel Saray. Maybe I was expecting too much but if it's 7 star it should be the best of the best. It was nice to see around this iconic hotel and they did give us a beautiful cake as a gift. At least I can say I've had dinner in a 7 star hotel. Don't think I'll go back though.
Lovely tea venue. We went on my wife's birthday. The staff were excellent and the food was brilliant. The view from the restaurant were stunning.
One of Life's Pleasures. High Tea on high, outstanding service 6 maybe 7 stars. Beautiful 7 course high tea, or coffee from an extensive range. magnificent views from this world class venue.

Great from outside!!. We could not go to Burj-Al-Arab for the high tea due to our pre-planned tours (which unfortunately did not include Burj-Al-Arab). This building is superb from outside. We did go nearby to have a look and it was spectacular.. The area surrounding it was also nice.The High-tea is something which has to be experienced here and should not be missed. Although it might be a little pricey for some tourists.

Experienced High at Sahn-e-Eddar in Burj-al-Arab. We had booked a high-tea in the Sahn-e-Eddar in the first floor area of the Burj-Al-Arab. We reached about 30 mins ahead of time just outside the driveway of the iconic hotel. We got ample time to click some shots of the hotel and also the Jumeirah Beach hotel. Our high tea was at 7:40pm. We entered the hotel and spent some time in the main lobby. Then we went another level up and were shown to our table - like a coffee table with lovely sofas around it. Our high tea was served in courses including cakes, pastries, scones (the best), varieties of jam, fruit cocktails, date drink (yummy), apple cider and ofcourse choice of tea in the end. The overall experience was memorable. The service was excellent.

With the young ones, high tea in the lobby gets you in but wish we could have seen more. . My wife and our 5 yr old son wanted to see this 7 star property. The only way we could get in was to have tea in the lobby (must be over 12 years old to go to sky bar). The service was terrific - complementary chicken nuggets and fries for our son while dined in style which runs 450 AED / person. A pricey tea nonetheless but made for an enjoyable afternoon. Food was very good. High tea at Ritz Carlton, London still the best in my wife's opinion.
Stunning Hotel. Great to visit, amazing to look at it and to have been inside it.Try to get a reservation in the seafood restaurant and prior go on top to the sky view bar

A glimpse of the Burj Al Arab. Touring Dubai should be fun and one way to do this, is to have a GLIMPSE of the Burj Al Arab. It's a unique man-made creation and have been known to be one of the famous landmark of the city. Hit the taxi and drop by at the public beach near the burj al arab. FYI the public beach is not that pleasant and neatly maintained, hence, choose to be at the JBR, which is also a public beach without any cost. Bring your own beach umbrella, beach mat and food. Enjoyed my stay at JBR. thanks for reading.

High Tea!. I indulged during my trip to Dubai and booked a High Tea in the Sky Bar at the Burj Al Arab. It was a truly a great experience and the views from here were incredible. Impeccable service during the tea, with the staff always referring to me by name any time they approached my table. The food served during the tea was delicious and incredibly filling. The scones and desert tray was so good! Scones, cookies, creme brulee, macaroons, cakes, and chocolates....wow!! The Burj Al Arab serves more or less as a symbol of Dubai and the luxury found in the city, so I could not pass on a chance to get the experience and I was definitely not disappointed. Plus being able to walk into the hotel, which by the way you can't do without a reservation, and see the attention to detail and beauty of the hotel was also worth it!! If you can do this while in Dubai I would definitely recommend it! Loved it!

Nice. We had high tea at the Burj ,we had to see the place and that was our ticket to enter the hotel gates. It is overwhelming, the attention to detail, water features and the flair have to be seen. We spent some time in the lobby, exploring everything we could, and then made our way to the sky bar. Warm welcome by staff, we got a nice big table for the 6 of us, and the procedure of the high tea was explained to us. First a berry tart from the kitchen,a glass of bubbles , then little savory treats , followed by sweet pastries and chocolates. The waiters go around all the time, so you can eat as much as you like. Great variety of tea and coffee, all done nicely. After 2 hours, we left, the ladies with a box of chocolates as a gift. It was a nice experience for a price of 560 dirham. That is quite hefty, and though it was all nice food, the value wasn't up to this. But it's the Burj Al Arab, and that's what you pay for

High Tea at the Burj Al Arab. I didn't stay here (I stayed at the Zabeel Sarray) but I did have high tea in the Sky Bar. It was a very nice high tea experience - definitely pay the little bit extra to have your high tea in the Sky Bar rather than downstairs in the lobby lounge as the views from the Sky Bar across to the Dubai skyline are just spectacular. Try to get a window table if possible. Food was very enjoyable and service impeccable.
Impressive. Stylish 7 star hotel, only seen though from Jumeiral Beach.Iconic shape symbolises Dubai. A spectacular photo opportunity from the beach position.

good in the distance. Could not get near the building for good pictures. Beach nearby closed due to works, so unless you had a pre-paid tour or visit arranged you could not get into the grounds let alone the building

Good View from Outside. Going to Dubai, try and make a trip to Birj Al Arab.. It has a formal dress code even to enter the arena and you need prior booking to enter the place... For obvious reasons it is very expensive.. A Cup of Coffee is priced at 300 odd dhs.

Another Dubai Landmark. Must see if in Dubai, after-all it is one of the many defining Dubai Landmarks! Situated off the beach, but towering above most other buildings, it was the icon before the Burj Khalifa arrived.

close but not really... Ok, when you are in Dubai you want to see this building / hotel. So I took the metro, but the metro station is approx 3km from the beach / hotel. So in Dubai no chance of walking, even if you get there I understood you cannot get closer than the beach. So i saw it from a distance and thought that was fine!
Big deception. Nothing exceptional, the service is a real deception and the food variety very common...I f you like the "blinbling" attitude this is the place to be !

Drinks in the Burj? Forget it. Some things are worth splurging a bit of cash on. This is not one of them. Just pop in to the Burj lobby for free - it's very cool and worth a quick stop if you've time. Don't waste the substantial amount of time, money and effort to go to its poorly decorated, overrated topview bar which by the way has reasonably tasty but weak, tiny drinks and mediocre food. I felt done leaving here, very poor experience as there are plenty other bars in Dubai that can overcharge me for better surroundings. What a con.

Afternoon High Tea at the Burj al Arab. Apart from the garish interior ( if you like bright purple, yellow and tons of gold then forgive me) the Afternoon Tea must rate as one of the best we ever had. The service, quality of the food and attention to detail could not be faulted. A must for gourmets !

Simply the Burj. September 2013 had fabulous afternoon tea for two,which i as non guest highly recommend. But very dissapointed to see the very slack dress code for people wandering around as we were led to believe you had too be smartly dressed to gain entrance ie people in shorts !!! Stunning lobby area & one day i will stay.

once in a life time. Came here for an evening meal. Food was excellent, service was charming, décor was fabulous. this was once in a life time opportunity when I got to visit with my family a couple of years ago, if you get the chance go for it! going up the elevator feels magical, you get up there so fast you don't realise how high you actually are!

Amazing!. We were lucky enough to be able to book morning tea at the Burj Al Arab, what an outstanding and imposing building! The staff were amazing, the food was amazing! They looked after out 6 month old child while we had out morning tea, we were then free to look around the building, taking the lift to the sky deck and being able to get a view of everything around us was a brilliant way to finish our morning off.

Quite a sight!. We only viewed this hotel from the outside. Our view was quite close from the beach at Jumeirah Beach Hotel. I would have enjoyed going inside, but rooms started at nearly $2000 per night. Many go for "Afternoon Tea" but that is something like $150 pp. I didn't need tea that much!It was cool to see a place so well-known around the world. Quite the icon!

Book ahead or be disappointed. This place is stupidly exclusive. A landmark that you cannot enter unless you have a reservation of some type. For all the hype and attraction this site brings to Dubai, yet during a short visit one cannot get within 200m of the place without being ushered away.
Iconic building - gaudy interior. Totally over the top - but hey this is Dubai! Make reservations at the skybar restaurant and enjoy the views and the prices!
great place. i've been there for business. Great location and stunning view from the sky bar. the interior is well furnished.

Once in a lifetime experience. We booked the lunch at the top. You must book a few days before. Totally worth the money. I believe there is a minimum spend of ordering a main meal. It is pricey but worth it for the views and to see the inside of the hotel. If you don't do the lunch at the top at least visit to get a photo out the front.

Has to be one of the poorest experiences.. I don't mind ever paying for service but I can't begin to explain how poor the service and choice was here at the Burj Al Arab, even the staff apologised to us!

High Tea @ Sky View Bar. Ive been to Dubai 4 times in the past 2 years and have waited eagerly for my visit to Burj Al Arab. I decided to book the High Tea at the Sky View Bar. Booking was easy, they even accomodated to our allergies/dietry requirements before hand!Hotel was lovely, a bit toooo much going on with the decor, but thats Dubai for you!Beverages were lovely, however the food part was a bit of a let down. Enjoyed the experience, views were stunning, but if only the food was as good! Not really worth paying £75.00 per person for!

All the way first class.. I was there in Burj Al-Arab to meet with one of dad's client for a business meeting and had a wonderful cup of tea with the client there. I still cannot forget the vip service they are providing to their customers.

7 STARTS? HMMM?. I had heard so much about this hotel as being the only 7 star hotel in the world so decided to see for myself. As a travel counselor, I did get in to see the hotel, but was astounded at the number of Japanese groups all over the place. When I questioned, the rep told me they were all staying there. So everyone on the gold elevators, on the escalators, in the restaurants were all these people taking pictures and posing. The rooms were gaudy with flocked red velvet furniture and gold leaf everywhere ....and the beds had huge golden mirrors over them so you could watch yourself in bed... a la bordello?Gold leaf is everywhere...restaurants, lobby, spa...just everywhere. The hotel itself sits on a small island so you have to take a car everywhere you go. So..all in all it was not a place I would want to stay.

High Tea. My and my wife booked the High Tea show and it was worth it. Lobby of the hotel with its fountain is marvelous and guestroom entrances looks like fairy beehives. High tea was deluxe experience. We enjoyed all drinks, sandwiches, jams and sweets. All the program took almost hour and half. It is really worth it to see, this hotel is iconic.

Dont bother with this Place - It's for Elitist Snobs Only. We turned up hoping to have a lovely breakfast after seeing this highly promoted attraction in Lonely Planet and we were greatly and bitterly disappointed in having been turned away at the gate house. This place is locked up like some sort of paranoid embassy for some hardline state and is very off putting. Despite being well dressed and waving money at them with the intention to splurge on a lovely breakfast (yes we could afford it), they would not let us in after we traveled from the other side of Dubai to get there by taxi. I've never been refused entry anywhere before in the world (I've done 7 star hotels in India) but this place is nothing but a vile lair of ugly snobbery for the Elite. I cant believe that they promote this place on all the marketing for Dubai yet they have this elitist policy of refusing people entry who are the very people they are trying to reach in their marketing. This occurrence has put me off from loving Dubai (which I was on the way of doing after the Burj Khalifa, The Dubai Mall and the Dubai Creek) and I started to see the ugly side of Dubai of which there are many aspects. These range from the lack of basic pavements for its pedestrians, to the horrible way they treat its workers as a sub class (we saw police beating them up), and all the empty buildings that were made just for show (how pretentious). Whenever I tell my friends of Dubai, I am sure to include the ugly side of elitist snobbery of Dubai as well. We saw some wonders there but this experience outside the Burj Al Arab left me with a bad taste in my mouth.To the owners of Dubai. Perhaps you should remove reference to this building in your marketing so you don't greatly disappoint other tourists when they come to be let down and turned away at your the door of this highly publicized attraction. Don't bother with this place unless you know some world leader or can be vouched for by someone like Bill Gates or Richard Branson.

Loved it!. My husband and I had drinks and appetizers in the Amani Bar. The wait staff moved us to a table by the window when one became vacant which we thought was very considerate since we did not even ask to be moved. The view is limited after dark but still fun and exciting. The hotel entrance, lobby, elevators, etc. are exquisite and unusual. The creativity and engineering required to build this structure is mind boggling. The Burj Al Arab is Dubai - don't miss an opportunity to visit this building. The detail and design must be experienced.

Great experience. Place, were your dreams came true. We´ve been there on Saturday, when the traditional marocain dinner was served and it was delicious, especially sweet courses. And the service... omg, the best one in my life.

The icon of Dubai. Burj Al Arab tower, located next to Dubai beach is an iconic building and nothing less than a brand of Dubai.Though we visited just for breakfast, which itself is as expensive like an average night stay in some normal hotel, I must say the experience is worth in a lifetime.The building is shaped in the form of a sailing ship and has a helipad with a golf course on the top.

Outstanding Atmosphere & Service. Friday 4th April I had a reservation for the Sky View Bar. From the gated security to being seated the service was first class and to the highest level and all the staff were outstanding.We initially were seated by the long window looking out to sea, but after one drink we were invited to be reseated with views of the coast and beaches.The prices are very reasonable and a vast selection. I recommend 'The Milky Way' cocktail and 'The American Dream'.I will definitely visit the Burj Al Arab again.

WOW. thought it was going to be higher and didnt feel high at all because of the other high buildings around but a good view of Dubai however gutted to not be able to gain a clear view of the Palm! Worth a trip up!!
Wow. Unbelievable building. Can only view from distance. Very impressive though. Would have liked to be able to go inside the building.

Another one off the bucket list!. The hotel itself is amazing..extremely opulent . My daughter and I had afternoon tea there and whilst it is expensive it is something you probably do just once in a lifetime. We arrived in plenty of time and had the best view over Dubai. Service was of a very high standard immediately on entering the hotel and again in the Restaurant. The food was good and plentiful. I booked on line before I left the UK, which was easy to do. You do need to book and be sure to tell them if it is a special occasion

It is a special Building, But not a World Wonder. Ok a special Building, worth seeing. Afternoon tea , on the Lobby level is expensive however fun, with 7 courses. The food offered is interesting , but Not particularly special.

Amazing. Went here for afternoon tea and thoroughly enjoyed it. Champagne and 7 courses, food excellent, service excellent and the hotel itself was truly an experience. Definately a 'must do' when visiting Dubai

A tour up the Burj Al Arab. The experience is definitely worth doing, but it was very busy (19:30pm) and once we were on the 124th viewing floor (there are more than 200 floors) it wasn't that clear where to queue for photos or where to queue to come back down again. As a result we spent about 10 mins on the viewing deck and another 30 mins in a queue trying to come back down again. So in short, a very impressive building and structure, but a bit more co-ordination and organisation when you are up there would be useful.

High Tea in the Skylight Bar. Once again we treated ourselves to a Champagne High Tea; we went along with a group of friends who were also overwhelmed by the whole experience. None of us could finish the amount of dishes served and it was not for the want of trying. Well worth the £78.00 per person price tag, it was also Mother’s Day and every lady there was given chocolates and a beautiful pot plant with Burj Al Arab on it. The plant pot has now pride of place in my kitchen window. If you go to Dubai then a visit here is a must do, I always book direct with them before I leave the UK, as it is very popular.

Stunning. Amazing architecture however I found the bar quite dull & no atmosphere. Expensive as you'd expect. I felt a little 'over managed' greeted at the door, greeted on entering, greeted at the escalator, greeted at the lift, greeted at the lift other side, greeted at the floor, greeted at the bar door! And so it went on! Way over the top, put me off, too much
amazing. its amazing a must the views of the palm are out of this world we did the afternoon tae witch started at the sail so book this if you can

Excellent but book in advance. This was well worth doing. However be warned this was booked ahead by about 10 days so we had to buy a immediate extrance ticket which was 400 AED each. Still worth it though. Remember to have your camera out in the lift to record the 124 level reading - its like being in Willy Wonka lift. My husband is terrified of lifts but thought this was really great very smooth and only lasts 1 minute.
Nice view. This seven star hotel is a delught to watch.its shape is unique. we had different views from different angles and could not stop takeng photos.
Make a Reservation to see the tower. We didn't reserve a space so we could only see the tower from the outside. Didn't know to do that so that is why we couldn't get in.

Mother of hospitality. Burj Al Arab may be the most stunning view in the whole of UAE. Being one of the very few 7 star hotels in the world, the pricing inside the hotel are expensive so as to keep up the reputation of the hotel. The hospitality and the feel inside the hotel is absolutely amazing.

Must go once.... Went for a drink in the evening, the hotel is very special and really worth a look. Must book in advance to get in and expect a minimum cover charge - when we went this was c.500 AED / 80GBP which sounds a lot but 2 cocktails, a beer and a glass of wine later we had spent up so it was over to the jumeirah Beach hotel for Dinner... One tip is go when it is still light outside, 6pm views will be even more spectacular..... And you will see the sunset
Ultimate afternoon tea and coffee. A wellcome champagne and 7 courses with any chosen coffee and tea as many you want. Staff is super nice
Wonderful. We were so surprised when we saw the 7 stars hotel. It is not only wonderful out side but also in side like. However if travel want to go in side , they need to have lunch or dinner here.

Burj Al Arab - Afternoon tea. This place hasn't got it's 7 stars for nothing!! Booked in through "Security" and reception and were shown to the lift that took us to the Skyline bar. The service, attentiveness and attention to detail were exceptional. Can't remember how many courses exactly, but I think it was 6 or 7. Certainly don't plan a full evening meal at your hotel when you get back!! Delicious sandwiches, tarts, cakes and pastries with endless tea and surprisingly other beverages such as iced coffee - all included. A very special experience (possibly the best of the holiday) and one that I would recommend without hesitation.

Manage your expectations. One of the places you will visit just to check it off your list. To enter the hotel, you have to be a guest or have a reservation for meals e.g. high tea. Personally, felt it was over-rated.The service staff were warm and very attentive though, one of them agreed to let us view the aquarium restaurant which I found was my favourite part of the visit to the hotel.

YOLO but it's expensive. I wanted to see the place and the least expensive way was to spend about $100 US dollars in the bar with tapas food. The food was fine, nothing special. My daughter had the house special drink and she said it was very good. Nice staff. Worth doing once but I am glad I didn't pay to stay in the hotel.
Incredible. The price of the restaurant was worth to be able to go inside such a beautiful hotel. Not to say that the restaurant was also spectacular, with all the fish in the aquarium.

Beautiful!. My friend and I went for Friday Brunch and marveled at the inside of this hotel! It was so overdone in the best way possible! There was lots of gold and fountains and flowers it was very impressive. Get inside if you can it in definitely worth the look!

Once in a life time Tea!. With my daughter and my friend I visited for a champagne tea to celebrate a recent 'big' birthday. From the very first email making the booking, the service could not have been better. We felt welcome and valued throughout. I had asked for a window seat and was delighted to get one. When we said it was my birthday I was given a beautiful red rose and a small cake with a candle. The waiter made sure we knew exactly what to expect, the tea was excellent - so much lovely food it was impossible to eat any dinner! The ambiance was wonderful and at no time did we feel rushed. The staff were happy to take photographs for us to record the event and we were lucky to see the sun setting. After we had eaten we were able to wander around the lower parts of the hotel; enjoy the fountains, shops and just soak up the atmosphere. I would recommend having tea here to anyone wanting something special to celebrate and remember!

Not worth the money, but just to say you've been there!. I went with my friends and we were lucky to get the tickets booked prior to visit, so it cost only 125 AED each. However, the view was magnificent. But the group photo was definitely not worth the price which was close to US $ 75 and was photoshoped which was quite obvious. Could have got one myself done similar to that quality. After all, it was not worth the wait and money spent if you didn't manage to get the tickets beforehand.
it is beautiful. love dubai good place for family and next time i will go with friends. and too go for shopping and party

Fantastic experience!. We were celebrating two significant family birthdays and the whole experience was very special. Each tasty morsel was better than the previous one. The two birthday boys were given a special cake which was a nice touch. The view over the water to the Palm was a fabulous backdrop to what was a special family event.

Afternoon Tea. An experience indeed! Wonderful food and drink served at a reasonable price for a 7 star hotel! I have to say it was good that I wasn't charged after attempting to slurp from my tea when the handle suddenly falls off of the bone china cup with it falling to the ground and shattering- thank God for that! It was a true experience seeing all the gold colours and experiencing luxury at its best!

Breathtaking. We booked for dinner only it was a lovely experience the hotel is just beautiful I couldn't fault anything. Well maybe the temptation to spend allot of money in the little jewellery boutiques
U need to go. I went with my family to the public beach right by burj al Arab had a swim and enjoyed the day with the amazing view. Take pics as its pics that would last a lifetime' a must see
Worth a Visit. Book before hand to get a good slot, try to take 5:00 slot so that you can see the best of sunset.It takes you to 124th floor and the view is definitely breathtaking.

Unfriendly staff but worthy visit and view. The view from the top is just amazing and it shows the Arab power and how Dubai has grown in the last 10 years. It's very, very impressive and It is outstanding, but the staff is just so unfriendly and arrogant...

Very High!. Very well organised. We booked tickets on line with Viator and exchanged our vouchers at the desk by the entrance. The lift took just 1 minute. The views were very good at 12.00 midday. It wasn't too crowded and we took lots of photos.

The Lavish Burj Al Arab. I did not get to stay in this beautiful hotel or tour but got a little whiff of it in the lobby while waiting for reservations at the Al Mahara. Awesome and jaw-dropping hotel.

Great Brunch. Me and My friends, we had a brunch there. Must say, service is just perfect as you expect. Also variety of a food is excellent. Must say, see food, lumb and desert are just unforgetable! Rest of a food is also great, but food above I mentioned is great! Mus try clamps, prawns, salads ... wines are bit costy. Must say a lowest price is just arround 110USD. Which is more than a wine can offer. Wine, which is drinkable starts at arround 200 - 250USD and more. Also, sky is a limit :) But what you can expect from a 7star hotel! Prices are on a high level, as well as food, service, hospitality etc! Try to have a brunch there! You will not regret!Bon appetit!

Excellent for afternoon tea, although a bit expensive. We had afternoon tea here, It was booked through attraction tickets in the UK before we left for Dubai.The afternoon tea was good a selection of sandwiches, cakes, scones with various jams etc..all immaculately presented and served.They have a harpist playing in the hotel while you eat and she played happy birthday for a lady who was in our party which was a nice touch.The building is nothing short of stunning, such an amazing sight to see and visit.I am glad we visited but I don't think I would bother if I was in Dubai on holiday again.

Expensive but nice. We had afternoon tea here, from finger sandwiches to tasty cakes with one course consisting of roast beef and mashed potato ! !. It is expensive but its the only way to get inside for a look around. Just save up for it !

Admirable architecture!. To fully admire it, you have to see it from a good distance on the gulf shore. What you then see is a massive and beautiful free standing steel and concrete sail in the gulf waters and connected with a bridge. Splendid!

Spectacular Design Acheivement. Tried all week to get a reservation for the skyview bar, but no such luck. Book well in advance. Had several exterior view opportunities. The skyview bar should have cocktail passes/reservations and not be so pushy to sell the brunches and high teas.
Hotel looks like a sail from the water and beach!. We saw the Burj Al Arab on city tour from the beach, then took a boat ride to see it from the water, both are great ways to view the Hotel.

Wonderful. We visited Burj Al Arah for cocktails. Although you have to spend a minimum amount it is not difficult with the choices available. The service was excellent. Although we had to book a time, they could not guarantee a window table but when a table came available they moved us.

Outside view only. I was not interested to view anything from the building it self, instead I wanted to enjoy the architecture. So if you brunch at Jumeirah you can have the best view ever. This building has the most beautiful architecture I ve seen. It is astonishing and as much as you look and watch you appreciate.You can also have aview from the public beach.
Brilliant. Do not go to dubai and not visit this, it's great! I loved the lift, my ears were actually popping and the views are fab. Not recommended if you are not good with heights!!
Fantastic. wonderful experience and the views from the viewing platform are breathtaking worth going around more than once as there is so much to take in. Really a not to be missed attraction,

Fantasy so much . It was enjoyable to visit but not satisfied bc they the gatekeepers not allowing to go inside but we curious .only pics from outside .bc no online booking arrangements was there .missed inside views but pics so excellent from outside .how these could be inside .sorrow.but whar could be done at that time .it was not ethical atleast they should allow it was their in good publicity.

Fabulous. Excellent. Fantastic Experience.. Service Amazing Décor fabulous. Staff attentive we had the Champagne high tea which was out of this world - so many courses and the food was excellent. Thanks to my dear friends S and W for organising this.

For the riches. Well its a hotel . Being a Dubai attraction u can see it, but even if u miss it not a big deal. Its a Building after all, not a beautiful scenic view that u have missed. But yes if u r rich enough to go within and explore its beauty and the wonderful 7 star service then its surely worth it. Otherwise u can see it on ur way to the different malls via the metro. U can click pics from the metro as well. it comes pretty close enough.U can just go to the beach and click pics against it if u happen to visit there. Most of the area is taken by the hotel and made private with the spectacular yachts parked along the beaches.
Breakfast. Beware.. even if you have the breakfast, you are only allowed to visit only the 1st floor. In case you want to visit properly, High Tea at the Sky bar is suggested.

Nice building. I have not been inside. But from outside the building is fantastic, it's THE icon of Dubai! From Um Suqeim open beach you have beautiful views on the building. You can reach that one easily from metrostation Nakheel and from there bus x28. Swimming with the burj on the background was fantastic :)

Not for the meek!. Incredible experience to be so high and not sitting in a plane ! Very well run and efficient, the staircase as you get out of the elevator, with a wall of glass, made my heart stop.Had cocktails and some snacks at the bar, when my heart slowed, I was able to enjoy the incredible view. A must do attraction for Dubai

Excellent hotel. I had gone there for a Friday breakfast with my family. We were welcomed at the entrance. The breakfast that we had (veg) was strictly ok but it was an experience. We were allowed to go until the mezzanine floor where they serve breakfast. They did not allow to explore the hotel. The hotel from inside is a masterpiece and a must visit.

Wow!. What a building and what an architecture.In fact the complete Dubai architecture is wow. :)So wherever you raise your eyes in Dubai, you find all different looking buildings and all are fab!! :)

Great. Thanks to a goof up by my travel agent our high tea was not booked despite us wanting to do it. The structure shaped like a mast is an excellent piece of architecture on the jumeriah beach. Couldnt get entry in to the hotel ended up spending the evening at the beach viewing the structure , will do it during our next visit .
Great view and worth the visit. It is expensive to go but well worth the visit. You can stay there as long as you would like and there is an outdoor area that is unusual for a building this tall.

High Tea was our ticket in. The Burj Al Arab was my bucket list. The only way in is a reservation to one of their restaurants. We chose High Tea. It's a marvel to see this amazing structure in person. So many colors! To appreciate what went into this building I recommend a You Tube video of the engineering. It will help you appreciate all the aspects and angles. It looks like they didn't expect the driveway would be so popular, so its a bit crowded with fancy cars and taxi's coming and going. I found that to be the best car show in Dubai.

Opulence at a price. Simply an experience if you can afford it. Book to eat here at one of the restaurants and enter a world wonder - fountains, aquaria and a jaw dropping atrium. Head for the cocktail bar at the top and gaze at the views.

spectacular. Our travel agent had arranged for evening cocktails in the Atmosphere, some 122 floors up from the Armani Hotel entrance.
A bit pricy but unique and a must see.

A bit pricey. We had an evening meal at the Burj Al Arab, it is pricey for what you get but you do get to visit the 7 star hotel in style and made to feel like you are some kind of celebrity.The food choices were great, A whole array of foods from different parts of the worlds. Different flavours and choices. There was a chef on hand aswell if you wanted your meat to be more well done or wanted something a little different.Was a nice evening out.
Eve Cocktails. Went with friends, changed booking from 2 to 4 no probs, replied within a few hours, cant get in without a reservation No, expensive but very nice. Will go back again, beautiful décor.

A wonderful and memorable experience. We booked the afternoon tea in the skyview lounge a few weeks before arriving in Dubai. It was easy to do. We got a taxi from our hotel, showed the reservation at security and from then on it was superb. We were treated like royalty. The foyer has an aquarium on either side and there are various fountains etc and of course very opulent decor throughout. There are also several very high class shops. We were shown to a lift and then taken to our table ( we had requested a window seat if possible) and we had a marvellous view over the Arabian sea, as well as the city skyline with the Burj Khalifa dominating. We had a huge sofa with cushions and also two chairs. There were three of us. First of all we were offered a glass of champagne or either a bellini or a kir royale. A plate of stuffed dates was brought - absolutely delicious. Then tiers of sandwiches were brought in. We got the same amount as for four people so rather more than if we had been a couple. The sandwiches were served on different kinds of bread and included curried egg, cream cheese and cucumber, salmon and caviar, chicken, beef and possibly another I can't remember. Then came a small plate with a slice of beef with mashed potato. This was the only thing I would have done without. It seemed a little strange to have with afternoon tea but that's just my take on it. The others in our party loved it. Then came the cakes ! There were two different scones both warm served with little dishes of clotted cream, apricot jam, strawberry jam and date jam, all delicious. You would get two each but we had 8 between three of us. There were various cream cakes, beautifully decorated and it is a huge disappointment to me that we could not manage to eat them all. We then had a sorbet. Throughout we chose from a large menu of different teas and coffees, all unlimited. The service was as professional as you would expect but friendly too. We could not fault the experience and would thoroughly recommend it. Book in advance, I'm sure you will not be disappointed. On leaving the hotel we asked one of the doormen to get us a taxi. It was nice to have a taste of luxury for once.
Mermerising. As picturesque as I imagined. Must see in night with all its lights. Getting into eat is very difficult and expensive :(

Birthday Surprise. There is absolutely nothing to dislike about this place, amazing restaurant and views! Was pricey but then what do you expect for a 7* Restaurant! My hubby surprised me for my birthday in December and we still tell everyone how amazing it was, was such an amazing day and staff were so friendly and willing to help quickly with anything we needed!

Seven cource tea experience. The view from the restaurant, and the very tasty sandwiches and cakes that were given, it was my friends birthday the previous week, so I mentioned it to them, and they presented her with a very special cake before we left.

Once in a lifetime..... Went for a mini-tea and it was worth every dime just for the experience. Found outstanding, service amazing - and the views truly spectacular. The lychee sorbet wasn't bad either:) I feel much better about spending that money than I did the $20 buffet at a horrible tourist stop.

AMAZING VIEWS, AMAZING SERVICE!!!. You need to vist this place when in Dubai!!! It is so iconic!!! We had the 7 star afternoon tea!!! Expensive but worth every penny!!! Food is delicious!!! So many different flavours!!! the views are outstanding!!! We also went back for cocktails in the evening!!! You need to see the views during the day and at night, it is stunning!!! Service is amazing, the staff could do no more for us!!! The hotel is beautiful- well worth a visit!!!

Experiance the beauty. Everything was high class. The athmosphere inside is magical. I couldn't find a single dust spot in the entire suite. The luxury is everywhere and the staff is friendly all the time. I had the best sleep in that Dux matress. You can't go to Dubai without seeing Burj Al Arab.

Amazing architectural achievement. We has afternoon tea in the Skybar in this hotel, which was one way to visit it. The interior of the hotel was equally as stunning as the exterior. It has vivid colors and fountains throughout, and stunning views from the Skybar. The tea service was exceptional -- we enjoyed the experience tremendously!

A wonderful experience. It's difficult to describe the Burj Al Arab other than by saying it is truly magnificent!! We decided to sample the Afternoon Tea which proved to be nothing less than a wonderful experience. From the opening champagne drink to the closing delectable scones, jam and cream the food served was delightful and, though a tad expensive, well worth the extra. After Tea we were fortunate to be taken up to the top of the hotel to sample the magnificent view of the coast and the city. What a place, what a Tea - so glad we went!!

High tea with a view!. I booked afternoon tea for my wife and I as part of recent trip to Dubai. The Burj Al Arab brings a whole new meaning to "high tea" with it being served in their 27th floor Sky View Restaurant with stunning views right up and down the coast line of Dubai.The setting is spectacular and the food (of which there are many courses) is excellent. The service as you'd expect is second to none, and the whole experience from your first view of the atrium and reception to the checking in experience is first class!No trip to Dubai should be without this experience.

Birthday Afternoon Tea, well worth it!. Hubby booked the Skyview Afternoon Tea experience at the Burj al Arab and all I have to say is wow wow wow!! I love my afternoon teas and this is the best I've ever been to! We got there half an hour early and took photos outside of Jumeirah Beach Hotel and a few photos as well (you cannot enter the grounds without a reservation so get your pics then). A beautiful oval glass lift took us up to the 27th floor and I recommend getting there early to get the best seats. We had seats overlooking the beach and the Jumeirah Beach hotel at the window. We had a fantastic waiter called Tarik. The first course consisted of divine sparkling date juice (we don't drink alcohol) with beef and mash and veg terrine for me. Then came the yummy sandwiches, which was topped up and then the cake tier. And finished off with a desert. Not forgetting lots of hot and cold drinks throughout.I has little chocolate cake with 'Happy birthday' and a candle lit and a red rose for me. And everyone got a little take away box with chocolates. Very intimate and luxurious experience. And not forgetting free wifi! Expensive, yes. Worth it, definitely!!
high tea. We booked high tea @ Burj. It is VERY high. Windows overlooking marina and city are best. Just to visit this magnificent building is a special experience. Tea is $ 100 australian each.
Amazing. breath taking view. while visiting wildwadi u have an excellent view of the hotel. Food was great but slightly over priced.

Over the top... but worth a visit. I had my 44th birthday at the Burj Al Arab, it was very over the top and the guest rooms very flamboyant. I am glad I experienced the Burj Al Arab, but not sure I go again.

Dinner at The Burj. We thought that we would treat ourselves and have dinner at the Burj, it was all very lovely but don't get me wrong im not skint and can afford nice things and go to nice places but you need to be seriously rich and prepared to part with a lot of cash to come here and feel comfortable, We paid for a 3 course set menu dinner through our tour operator, which was expensive but affordable to us, when we had to choose our wine we had a few issues though as the average bottle of wine was about £200, so felt a bit embarrassed ordering the cheapest red I could find which was about £75.The food was really nice but i've actually had better so felt a bit disappointed .As for the interior of the Burj, very impressive wouldn't mind staying there for a night that's for sure ! but again not sure if I would feel comfortable not being a billionaire and all that ! :)
Well worth a visit. Great views of Dubai from viewing gallery, well worth a visit, book in advance if possible to avoid disappointment of it being booked out on the day of your visit.

excellent value for the experience. This was our first trip to Dubai, so as we were there and even though 5* is the official highest hotel rating we booked this 7* for the experience.We had the Far Eastern Asian afternoon tea (approx £40 each including tips) and were not really sure what to expect.Very friendly staff and stunning decor in the hotel.We were given time to look round the ground floor, only thought afterwards about having a look outside.The meal was outstanding, 7 courses with a choice of 1 each from numerous chilled tea and hot teas, we enjoyed 2 hours of superb food served by a very knowledgeable and likeable waiter.beware of the wasabi!!! small green and mighty powerful paste

Burj Al Arab. I saw this building for the first time in a documentary but was thrilled again when I saw the view from the shores of the sea as well as the well lit Burj Al Arab in the night. Great view.

Not really worth the expense. It is indeed beautiful . The architecture as well as the interiors of the building are top notch but its just way too expensive and I did not find it worth the money going there . The emirates palace in Abu Dabhi is a much better value if you ask me ..

Dinner in the top floor with the amazing view. Prebook dinner for sunset to get best experience. Food is very good and prices same as in other good restaurant. You need to spend 650 dirhams per person as minimum. Before dinner some drinks in the bar to enjoy the view allover Dubai. Can not forget. Also You can enjoy fountain show from the top of the tower same time.

A MUST DO. We went to the Early Bird Tea on our last day in Dubai and it was the Grand Finale of all. Service, food, atmosphere, staff -- all were perfect. Sunset had been recommended, but we loved being there mid day and seeing everything. Pricey, but so worth it!
Sea View Tower. It was a nice structure right on the few accessible beaches in tjhat area. We could take a photo like me and wife were holding up the Burj
