Beautiful Hotel. This hotel is beautiful. Shaped like a sailboat sitting on it own little piece of land. Have a cocktail in the top floor lounge. The views are spectacular. You will need to make a reservation but it is worth it.

Larger than life !. Took my boyfriend for a surprise dinner for his bday and lunch too...just so ostentatious just something I wanted to see once! Go to the rooftop bar called sky bar for lunch as the view in the day is amazing at night the lights from inside the restaurant reflect on the glass too much and you can't look it. Very expensive though
From Nicaragua. Amazing experience!!! The architecture is wonderful, excellence service, delicious food!!! A must in Dubai!!! Enjoy it and forget the price!!!

One of the most beautiful structures. I almost missed this one while on excursion due to serious jet lag. Lol. But I could not wait to see Burj Al Arab. The shape just facsinates me. Its one of the most beautiful structures I've ever seen
Excellent. Excellent place to visit of even just view from a far. I would recommend Dubai for couples and friends
A beautiful building. An archetichual wonder. this is a piece of art and a must see in Dbai, even if you do not go to the top.
Fun. But very expensive. Check out the stainless steel Rolls Royce the hotel uses.... Ask how they clean the windows!

Nice outside...... The outside of the building is like a dream - the curves the colours, shape etc are all amazing. The inside is a bit over the top and does not match the beauty of the outside. Overall though worth a visit even if it's just for the photo....
Awesome work. Incredible architecture that has visionary messages nicely. Vision without limits but with feelings.
Really lovely. We booked at the SKY bar, amazing views and services, pricey but worth it. Cocktail list is great fun....

Vertigo-inducing. If you're female, be sure to cover your shoulders and elbows at least, out of respect for the culture you're in, when you visit Burj Al Arab. I was mortified by the silly young thing in shorts and spaghetti straps who, flaunting her belly piercing with a cut-away, midriff-revealing top, climbed into the lift with us, along with her 'friend', and treated everyone around her to PDAs all the way up. Embarrassing? You bet! Visitors to the building aren't actually taken all the way to the top when they take the tour...and, once you get as far as you're allowed, there's not that much to look at apart from a sunburnt land with a blob of urbanity in the middle. But, hey, if you like very high buildings and want to say you've been there, it IS kind of cool. Me, I'd rather have remained on a banana lounge by the pool in the very gorgeous, very comfortable Palace Hotel, Downtown Dubai, from whence we ventured forth.

Took a Boat Ride to see It. The Burj Al Arab is a beautiful building that had to be seen close up. I took a boat ride out to it and was able to get some amazing pictures. The architecture is just so different from any building that I had ever seen.

Splendour. We saw the burj Al Arab from the big bus tour. It is an iconic building and is a must see when your in Dubai. It's the only 7* hotel in the world and is quite unusual and Magnificat. You can hop off the bus for a closer look if you wish (we didn't) & I'm sure you can go inside??? For a look. The big bus tour will explain a bit about the hotel which was quite interesting

High Tea at the Burj Al Arab. High Tea at the Burj Al Arab was one of the highlights of my trip while in Dubai. Let's start with the hotel. Oh. My. Goodness. It was GORGEOUS. It is supposed to be the most expensive hotel in the world and I can understand that considering there was 24K gold leaf detail among other lavish decorations. The design is so stunning and the decor just as much so. You cannot leave Dubai without seeing this building - The Jumeirah Beach Hotel (wave hotel) next door has a great view for picture taking (just an aside). Now for high tea - I've only had high tea once before in my life and this experience far surpassed that one and I doubt I will ever have a better high tea experience. Honestly, where else can you see the World Islands while getting served the most delicious 7(ish) course meal. The food was unique, the presentation beautiful, but most importantly it was delicious. And I am a somewhat picky eater and I could enjoy most of what was provided to me. Highly Highly recommend. Once in a lifetime experience.

Incredible views from the Spa & fantastic service. The Talise Spa at the Burj Al Arab is incredible. The spa is located on the 18th floor (approx. 150m above sea level) and overlooks part of the Dubai Skyline and The Palm. You can have a swim or sit in the jacuzzi overlooking the Atlantis and watching numerous speed boats motoring along. My treatment room had an equally good view. I booked a Well Being massage (1 hr) and the price of the treatment included use of the spa facilities both before and after the treatment. Following the treatment I was offered a selection of teas and during the course of my time in the spa water and apples were readily available. The treatment price also includes free use of towels, a bath robe and slippers. My treatment cost 900 dirhams (approx. £150) which given the location, the length of the treatment, the facilities and the impeccable service was definitely worth it. I attended the ladies only section as I was going on my own. Unfortunately I am not sure whether there is a mixed section but if you contact the spa on BAATalise@jumeirah.com you will be able to find out.

Waste of time. Knew we couldn't go in unless we booked a table...so prepared just to have a look. Could get nowhere near. Checkpoint in the way of photos. Building site all the way around. More spectacular in the guide book than in real life. I'm sure the experience would have been good if we had gone in...but in terms of a 'site seeing list ticking exercise' it's one I wouldn't bother going to see...especially as it's out of the way.
Great experience. Highly recommend a trip to the top of this amazing building. We went at sunset but due to the haze it wasn't as spectacular as we had hoped, but definitely worth doing,

Whoooooooaaaaaaa. Feel like a million dollars as you ride up the escalators with huge fish tanks either side for walls ! And that is just to get to the receptionIf you thought Las Vegas ( Been there and reviewed) was over the top, you ain't seen nothing' yet.Every thing about this (self proclaimed ) 6 star hotel oozes quality, style and :-( mega bucks.But what the heck,,,,you only live once and this is the only way to live If only for a day. But we were on a one night stopover en route to Hong Kong from London via EmiratesThe restaurant on the top floor has a sea view where you get magnificent views of The World (Lots of little man made islands representing the planet flattened out like a map and the Jumeirah Beach hotel with it's water theme park and at the opposite end the wonderful view of the Burj Khalifa (worlds tallest man made structure at 830 meters tall) with the Palm Jumeira and Palm Jebel Ali ( 2 man made islands in the shape of palm fronds)
If only we could afford to stay. Some Day!!!. We were given a tour of the hotel, which I can only say is spectacular everywhere you look, with simular staff.

"fascinating architecture". it was a sun shiny day when me and friends went swimming near burj al arab.the beach is nice and the horizon of beach sand and the tower is just really fascinating.we took a lot of pictures with a perfect background that simply utters Dubai is one of kind city in the world.

A must visit to the inside when in Dubai!. If you are going to stay here, you don't need to read any further. If you aren't staying here, there are really only two other official ways to get inside. One is to book breakfast, tea, lunch or dinner at the hotel yourself. In doing this, I don't know how much of the rest of the hotel you can visit "on your own". The other option is to book a "tour" (that may include a tea service or a meal). There are a number of local companies that have various options and may include other sights in Dubai. Make sure you are going inside the hotel and not just "photographing" the hotel. You can book on the Internet, your own hotel concierge or from a local tour company around the city. But, we compared rates and booked a tour on viator that included breakfast. Even though it was a "group" tour, there were only two couples in the van. Each couple was seated at our own individual table for breakfast. Then we had about an hour tour of the hotel from top (bar) to bottom (restaurants). Quite an amazing place.

Superior luxury. From the time you enter the driveway you know you are entering a venue at which quality is not compromised. The interior is as stunning as the exterior. Against the backdrop of the Arabian Sea this property does indeed resemble the world's largest sail. The fountains, carpets, rolled gold etc etc are unique. I was privileged to view a few rooms which are extremely lavish. The view from the restaurant at the top and the elevator taking you there is stunning.

Superr!!. I had a limitted time to spent there but The loby, the pool, The food, the view, the artitect everything was amazing about this hotel.. I will definatly go there again especially for the night club :) I had such a good time..

Beautifull. at the beach of Jumera it a Worth seeing Tower, Thousands of Touresr visited daily the Burj Al Arab. This is a beautifal building with its kind an very unique architect. very Nice place to visit.
Wow. How high can you go. Great experience. Momentos a bit expensive but it is a fantastic must do in Dubai.

Dubai Icon.. Though, Dubai has world tallest building, but people want to see this place and remember it as ICON. Prominently located on Jumeirah beach, one of the best hotel of the world. Everyone cant afford to go inside as it is restricted for pre-booked guest of hotels or restaurant, but people love to have their photographs with this ICON. There will be none, who have visited Dubai for leisure and not seen this building. Its superb.
Can't get enough. The view from outside is breath taking, you can make a booking to have a tour around the hotel to experience the amazing design inside and outside this five star hotel

An amazing building, takes your breath away. Of course we had to visit the burg al Arab. However it's not easy to access. We stayed at the al Qasr which is all part of the same group as the burg so we had access but had to get concierge to make a reservation which is hard to get so book early.
Burj Al Arab. Brilliant architecture nice warm beach , too pricy to go in even for just drinks and not very flexible with appointment to go in

A must visit!. The Burj al Arab is a must see for anyone coming to Dubai. The aquarium at the lobby is breath-taking and a good place to get good pictures.You need to have a reservation or some business at the hotel before you are granted access.The lobby is full of designer shops . It's a life of luxury if you can afford it!!
Amazing. Beautiful place but a little out of my price range but well worth a visit. The opulence was breathtaking.
7* mmmmmmm. We saw this from the souk MADINAT ... Excellent views shopping and food .... Must book at one of the restaurants if you want a fabulous view of the Burj Al Arab

Spectacular Hotel. From the time you walk in and the water fountain have a muscial casade and the aquarium wall are at either side of walls, this hotel exsudes opulence to an extreme. You can only go inside the hotel either by staying there or by taking a tour through the Costa cruise which take you to both this hotel andburj al Kahlia. We got a tour of the palm islands which again represent total luxury.

Beautiful-catch the fountain show 7 pm nightly. The fountain show was right on time and just a beautiful show and free--get there a few minutes early to stake out a good location or you will be left in the back w/limited views.
Amazing Arab. Must Visit.It is an amazing creation.Interiors are amazing.Really expensive but still woth a visit.Make sure booking is done before you visit

Impressive but hard to get a good look at without paying. Very impressive building, but even from the free beach a few hundred metres not a good free view. Need to pay for a room ($$$$) or book a meal there etc to get a good look! Start saving....

Mangnificent structure. We did not get to see the inside of this hotel or go to the top but its a structure you cannot miss. From Jumeirah Beach it looks amazing. Juxtaposed against the wave shape of Jumeirah Beach Hotel, this sailboat design works perfectly. You will be able to take many panoramic pictures of this effect from the piers in the marina section of even the beach.
Only seen from top of road.. Unless you book a meal etc. well in advance all you can do is grab a photo opportunity from the security gates. Shame as this is such a well known image of Dubai.

Worth seeing, but a little bit overwhelming. It is well worth going to have a look at the building and going inside. You don't really appreciate the size of it until your up close to it. Once inside you feel like you've walked into a James Bond film. The gold fittings, colour schemes, over the top customer service, aquarium, it's all pure indulgence!
Average. Over rated, interior reminded me of a 1980s nightclub. Conciege service poor upon arriving and departing

fantasy in the gulf. Number one.... The concierge staff here is unparalled. Tudor and Oscor and Royston... are fitting in this Landmark with the most wonderful aquariums and views of the inside.. but the views from the top.. yes you can see the palm and the world. Unless you are in a sandstorm... go for lunch in the day time. make reservations ahead and bring your paperwork or you will get stuck at the gate!
Beautifull. It's placed near the seaside and you can see the highest level of modern architecture. This place should be also on your list with places to be visited in Dubai.

Quintessential Dubai. Probably the second most familiar sight of Dubai, Burj al Arab, is the pride of Dubai, and a landmark of Arabian tourism.Shaped as an abra boat, it stands alone in the water, some 300m offshore, that grants exclusive access only to the residents, or those with reservations for the restaurants on Burj al Arab grounds. They offer high tea and cocktail reservations.It si a beautiful sight in the night, when it gets all the colored lighting. It is poplar spot with Russian oligarchs and their wives, or mistresses..no matter which there are tons of Russians..It is claimed to be a seven star hotel, but it is is 5 star indeed, so much for stretching the truth.The price however, suggests otherwise.

Out of this world. A building to rival the best in modern architecture, with vision and style and presence. It reminds me of the Sydney Opera House in its curvaceous and sensual sense of beauty, and in the way that it has changed the local social landscape and become an image of the city.Tough to gain entrance to the hotel and grounds without a reservation, which they will check on a list at the gate. We enjoyed the most amazing cocktails in the late evening, and ordered a full dinner as well. The trick is that while reservations for high tea or dinner might be hard to procure, the right hotel concierge can get you a spot for cocktails at the bar. As long as you order from the kitchen before midnight, there is a marvelous tapas selection available.
the sail. is the building that from a far distance looks like a sail, really beautiful is the hotel inside too, a monument on the sea.......................
Awesome from the outside. We didn't make a booking for the afternoon tea. That was a miss and we couldn't get in. Well, from the outside, it was good enough. Take some photos and we were satisfied.

Check it out. Over the top, but if you are prepared to spend the $$$$ well worth a visit. Skyview bar has great views and the cocktails are excellent. The Seafood restaurant is also very good although the service is a little erratic.

Iconic. Amazing and more beautiful and hypnotic than you can imagine. Best viewed from the beaches either side. Be careful you can become addicted to standing and staring at this awsome building and getting lost in your own world. A true vision.

Can't go in but outside view is cool!. OK! The structure of this building is gorgeous, the lines, windows, all in the shape of an enormous sailboat are just terrific. I really wanted to see this building and so glad I did.The only downside is the lack of awe and wonder due to the crowding around it. Half-clad bodies bathing on the shore one step away from the street somehow takes away from the magnitude of this building. Too bad they couldn't have protected it from the overtaking cheap structures beneath it and the bathing non-beauties.

Breathtaking on the Inside. This is one of only 2 seven star hotels in the world. This place was breathtaking! Especially the view of the hotel you get from the lobby. I mean... get ready to have your mind blown. It's really exquisite. Amazing blend of modern and traditional architecture. Words really can't describe it, so I'll include a couple of pictures below. A couple of things to note - you can't just drive up to this hotel and walk in. You need reservations. There are a few options for that. One is a drinks reservation at the skyview bar, which runs you a minimum Dhs 250 (USD $ 68 @ 3.66 Dhs per $) per person. The Skyview was a nice place up near the top of the hotel, as the name implies. We didn't actually get reservations here, but a bunch of my friends did. At the same time, we had reservations at the Lobby Lounge for drinks and snacks and so forth. I think the most impressive part of the hotel is the lobby, so it was pretty awesome to sit down there and enjoy the view over food and drinks. The package there was Dhs 200 per person. There's another option to have tea at the hotel and that was like Dhs 300, maybe? Tea is served also in the skyview area, but more in the evening than at night. Whatever you choose, once you're in the hotel, you can view all the common areas, which include the ground floor and main lobby floors. Basically there's some shops, fountains, and an aquarium and so forth. It's worth seeing. You won't be able to go to other restaurants like the Skyview if you only reserve the Lobby Lounge. We actually cheated and went up to meet our friends who were still chillin' up there after we were done and so we got to see it. Overall, this place is a must see; just be sure to book in advance.I went around the rest of Dubai and Abu Dhabi and wrote about that here:http://myideasmyobservations.blogspot.com/2013/03/my-trip-to-agra-delhi-dubai-and-abu.html

Just the beach!. Did not go inside... I don't think that spending 150 USD for a meal to get inside worth it.... Would prefer stay there instead, maybe next time if there is promotion. I saw it from outside - the beach nearby...it was great, good pictures... You got to try to go to Souk Madinat nearby and took picture from the boat inside. Nice! Beach is very nice, clear blue water and white sandy beach.

First 7 star I know off. Sadly, if you dont have a booking, all you get to do is take a couple of photos from outside at the security check point. Indeed a wonder from afar. Can only imagine what the inside looks like

Disappointing when close too.. It is a shame thart you cannot get close unless you are staying there. It looks really impressive from the Metro but the nearer you get it seems to get smaller. Still worth getting as close as you are allowed.Fascinating design.

Great to See.. You cannot get inside to see the Tower unless you book in advance. The cost for going in and having afternoon tea is 650 dirrhams. If you want a luxury dinner it starts from £120.00 per person. The down side is that most people can only get to see it from a pull in for Taxis and Buses so you are limited to what you can see.
Great architecture. Even the building is more than 10 years old is still one of the best architecture in the world. Expensive entrance (you have to book dinner or tea) but it worth.

opulence. fantastic
golden mirror over your bed
curtains draw to a view of the arabian sea
luxury luxury luxury
Wow. It's really beautiful but unless you have a professional camera, go and see it during the day if you want to take a picture.

Burj Al Arab: 7 Star Hotel. A masterpiece architecture beauty. Could see it from outside only from where we took photographs. Could not see it from inside as we were wearing walking shoes!!! I think this restriction is not good as it will deprive many tourists an opportunity to see this hotel from inside...
Impressive and beautiful. I viewed the Burj Al Arab from the beach and other spots. The architecture was unique, much like much of the architecture in Dubai.

just visiting. unbelievable!. we had the possibility to visit the place but we didn´t sleep there, at madinat.what can you criticize about this place?the location is great, you get the privacy you are looking for. in the reception starts the gold fairy tale, with fresh roses and orchids they change everyday.there is a huge acquarium and a fountain dancing.i wish you are there when they welcome a VIP:6 or 7 people from the staff come to greet you with different presents..the rooms are all 2 stores. everything is organized through a domotic system and a tablet. gold red and blue colors are everywhere, the toilets are with jacuzzi, every room has a 24 hour butler, the products in the bathrooms are from hermes and replaced everyday. everywhere is so quiet and silent.there are a lot of restaurants and bars, the view over the harbour and the beaches is breathless.staff is young but really professional.if you are not allergic to luxe, go there, with a proper look of course!!enjoy

Already Out Of Date. This is one of the most recognizable architectural structures in the world !!!. Very nice, but already ousted by other fine structures in Dubai (Burj Al Khalifa). Go to the bar at the top floor and enjoy a memorable views and good drinks.

Still THE hotel in Dubai that all the others try and beat. Beginning to show its age and some of the restaurants are in need of an upgrade but this hotel still manages to hold onto its mantle of being the No1 in luxury and decadence, not only in Dubai but in the world! The level of service is without doubt the best there is and that's what you pay for. Sheer luxury

Beyond My Imagination. You have to be rolling in the deep and a baller to afford this. Nice architecture and landscaping. I took pictures from the outside but of course I did not have a reservation there and could not enter the property/

Must buiding to see. what an amazing building strucutre, its one of the wonders of the world this building. I love my architecture and let me tell you this building is ranked amongst the best I have ever seen in the world and I have travlled allot and I love this building such decidance and oppulance and glamour this buildng and located near a water park and on a small man made island wow what a magical building

That makes Dubai. The only landmark building that was not copied from other Western Countries. The hotel is the beauty at its best but expensive though it worth it. Had a breakfast there for $ 130 dollars person. The most expensive breakfast i had in my life.

If you're planning on visiting, book in advance and organise transport to and from the hotel.. Whilst the Burj Al Arab may be known as the '7 star hotel', getting to and from the hotel represents a bit of a logistical challenge. Unless you have a prior reservation at the hotel as a guest, or to dine at one of the restaurants, you are not even allowed onto the hotel grounds. On the day that I visited, there were throngs of visitors, with a constant stream of tourist busses dropping visitors outside the gates for a brief photo op of the hotel. Sadly, I had not made a reservation and was unable to secure a spot for afternoon tea or drinks at the bar later that evening. This is when the logistical nightmare began. It soon proved to be impossible to get a cab from the Burj back to the city centre. After spending 40 minutes waiting outside the gates for a taxi, myself and groups of other stranded visitors began trekking through the streets in the vain hope of finding either taxis or public transport back to the city. Thankfully, an off duty taxi driver took pity on the group and drove us to the closest sky train station. So whilst I can't comment on the experience of being inside the Burj al Arab, the logistics of getting there and back can be challenging. If you're planning on visiting the Burj al Arab, I would definitely book in advance, and secure transport to and from the hotel. Otherwise, you may end up having spent a few hours looking at the hotel from the outside, and wandering about trying to find transport back to the city.

Best view from Jumeraih beach. If you are a vegetarian this place does not have much to offer you apart from breathtaking views of the beach and Dubai. View it from the beach to best appreciate its beauty.

Fantastic Icon. Fantastic well designed building. Still the iconic image of Dubai. Although the Buaj al Khalif is magnificent. Easy to get to via 'mall of emirates' metro station (Day pass on the metro is 16 dihrams). It is a 2-3km walk from the metro station to the building.You can't enter without breakfast, tea, lunch or dinner reservations. Got some fantastic pictures from the free beach next door.Worth a look from outside if you are on a budget.Will definitely return for lunch or dinner next time.
Nice. Very nice but you can only go inside when you stay in this 7star hotel.You can't go inside for a lunch.Bit disappointed
Luxury.... Gold is everywhere... the most luxury hotel maybe. amazingly beautiful apartments, wonderfull view from th restaurant on the top of the hotel, beautifl fountains in the lobby/atrium...

burge al arab. I don`t like panorama elevator because glass was dirty and you could see nothing (islands of earth and palm island). Tiles of the floor were moving while you walk. (imagine in 7 stars). Atrium I much prefer in Emirate Palace in Abu Dabi. So, nothing special.
outer view. i wish i could get chance to go inside this amazing hotel.....i feel the view frm top of the entire dubai would b really amazing.....its really beautiful...

My dream hotel. When it comes to hotels, it doesn't get better than this. The best hotel there is and will be, I hope, for a long time. And unlike many hotels, it is incredibly beautiful. Indeed, it is one of the best structures you will ever see anywhere. Any where, any angle you view this thing of beauty from, you will be mesmerized by its charm and blow away by its incredible size and magnitude. It is equally amazing from inside as well. Take same time out and get clicking. I hope to stay here one day and I definitely will.
Great Place to visit!!. Interiors were great.You can easily route this via metro.There is nothing in that Place I disliked. Must visit place.Beachside view was awesome.

Lovely Building. This is one of the first 7 star hotels of the world. The hotel from outside is so huge that you can image the amibience inside.
Though I didnot went inside to check the hotel, but I was happy clicking photos from outisde.
Towers of Dubai. Oh my God.So many marvellous construction UAE has & the Arab tower is one of them.Situated in between the sea gives it a more beautiful look.There is nothing you dislike about it.
awesome. we can get to see it from inside but outside we took many photos we enjoyed it we saw many imported cars their we also saw the wild wadi water park in front of it.

The best hotel in the worls. Great building and architecture. Wonderful hotel. It is an experience. Though the trip is expensive, but the breakfast or dinner you do, you will remember your whole life. The beauty of hotel is just can be described as seeing is believing.

Top arabian style... A "must see"!!!.... To stay at Burj al Arab is a privilege, to enter for a visit or a single booked drink is still a privilege for the senses too!!!... Don't miss it anyhow...Pure arabian top style at its best, you'll find there the most luxurious athmosfere around, still cosily staying in style...From up we can overlook beautifully the whole resort, the Jumeirah Beach hotel just opposite, the Madinat with its elegants Mina a Salam and Al Qasr and their lovely Venice-like canals

The view is something!. I did not go inside the tower but I can tell you that the view was pretty awesome specially at night. It looks good during the day too but it really does wonders to your pictures with the lights on. Go down to Souk Madinat Jumeirah and you will get some really cool pics of the burj from the side. Else you can simply stand on the mosque side and get open views and pics of the same

Impressive. Impressive but slightly tacky looking in some parts. They went a bit crazy with the gold leaf! Worth a look and a great photo opportunity but don't rush to pay the expensive prices to go in!!

Dress code even for restaurants :-|. Located on a manmade island, this iconic building catch your eyes from far. Taking photographs at the gate is allowed for anyone but proper booking is required to go inside. Dinner/Lunch is quite expensive there but one time tea and breakfast were kind of in-reach for traveler like us. At the time of booking we were told that proper formals are strict in Lunch and Dinner restaurant, however smart casuals can be wore for Tea / Breakfast time (no shorts, no sport shoes). As we all were in Holiday mood, we did not carry any such dress with us so could not get a chance to go in their restaurant but will try it next time I visit Dubai.

What a building!. This is a fantastic building and a hotel all of us would like to stay at. When visiting this site you are only permitted to stand at the gates and take photos but you can arrange a visit into the hotel for tea/lunch which is not too expensive and I am told it is worth a visit.

Iconic Building. Although too expensive for us to stay, we came here for a delicious lunch buffet and an amazing dinner. Service at dinner was exceptional. The atrium and lobby of this hotel is amazing.

Very beautiful.. Its a place which is quite unapproachable for anyone and everyone. I happened to go with some friends as one of them had a Gold credit card which entitles you to go to this hotel. So 7 of us hopped into a car as only 1 car was allowed on a card. It was Christmas time and the hotel was done up beautifully. Otherwise also the interiors of the hotel are done up very nicely. Beautiful fountains, chandeliers, work on the floors. Gold has been used very lavishly....The staff was courteous. Can't comment on the food and rooms as we couldn't afford either of the two. But yes if one can get a chance a visit is a must.

A piece of Art & Class ....... I simply love the master-piece of work , the art and the architecture of this magnificient monument. The way the colors change at night simply sets a mood for comfort and relaxation

it is beautiful especially at Christmas. I do not believe you can get into see this atrium tower with water fall, which should not be confused with the Burj Khalifa ( the tallest building in the world) unless you are staying or eating at the hotel. Make a reservation for Sky Tea and have a great experience and see the atrium tower too.

The first Iconic Building of Dubai. Great view in the night.. This building has a great aesthetic especially in the night. Great architecture and location. You can see the building if you go to dine in any restaurant at Medina Jumeirat...Awesome especially the water boat.

Beautiful place to visit.. It is a icone in Dubai,its gate seems a government palace with several tourists taking photos. The security men have a lot of problems to take tourists way form the entrance. This experience is very nice.

Iconic and Beautiful. The building is now 15 years old or so but is still truly beautiful and iconic even in a city where there are now nearly a dozen skyscrapers at 100 floors high but few have the design quality of this structure and indeed its sister hotel the Jumeira Beach.

Salute to engineering skills. Colour...colour..colour...is what you see when you stand in front of this tower in the night..Imagine a helipad and a tennins court hung in sky!!! The location is extremely sceninc. I could not resist my self and clicked pictures endlessly...the Towers look mesmerizing during the sunrise and sunset..
Luxurious. If you cant´t afford to live their you can book afternoon tea or something else there over the internet. You will need a booking number to get into the hotel area.

oozing in wealth. have to win the lottery or be a celebrity to afford such luxury, taxi pick up will be a rolls royce or helicopter! suites starts from two thousand pounds per night to twenty thousand pounds.
amazing pictures. we did not enter, but took amazing pictures, i guess this is most of the people do. But post-card pictures!

Nice building, we were going to have high tea there but were to tired, you cant just walk into the building.. That you had to book a high tea at least to be able to go into the Burj. Can be seen from many places and photographed.

Spectacularly Luxurious Place. It was totally worth the effort to make reservations to visit Burj Al Arab. The reservations are checked prior to even being allowed to cross the bridge to the property. Burj Al Arab is built with such amazing creativity, and it is a spectacularly luxurious place. Even the uniforms of their personnel are terrific and different, everything at this place is infused with imagination and luxury.
Impressive. I had expected it to be too over the top, but was quite impressed when standing in the lobby looking up. It's good to have see.

Totally OTT.  Extremely OTT for us, but have had this hotel on my wish list for many years. Was great to finally get a peak inside. Not sure I would want to stay there - even for a night. Extortionate prices.... I'd rather have a week in this beautiful resort, than a night in the Burj and go home (if you know what I mean)! Well worth the trip though - to see how the other half live!
High Priced. This tower is one of the best architectural buildings in the world, but it's better just to visit it from the far.the fees are unreasonable
Excelltent viit. Great place to visit ..take your camera. Loved the culture and the people....the friendliness and the feeling of safety

Forget it. Don´t visit this building. We had read that you can´t enter the resort (only if you are aguest), but nobody had told us that you even can´t get close to the building. We took a taxi and stopped at the entrance of the resort. Several tourists were strolling around and tried to make pictures. But it is far way, you can´t see the see or the beach - it is useless and waste of time.

7 Stars Hotel. Unfortuntly you can not enter unless u stay there. You may take pictures from outside only.You might pay tickets to take a tour inside around 130 USD. If you have extra money to waste, just bring it on.
Burj Al Arab - an iconic structure. Burj Al Arab - The Tower of Arabs is an iconic structure depicting modern day Dubai. It is probably the only 7 star hotel in the world.
Wow It's Great.. Go on a Weekend with prior appointment.It's such a wonderful view. I love the place. All made to perfection & the staff involved in Ticketing, directions etc are very friendly.
Even From The Outside - Stunning. Unless you are a guest, you have to settle for looking from the outside. However, it is worth the visit just to see this icon and post a pic to Facebook.
Must see. During the day it looks like a super long plastic surf board, but at night it is much nicer, you can get information at the gates, regarding booking to go in to eat.

You must eat here to view. If you want to have a look in here you have to either stay here or eat here. They have several options - if you eat at the top you have to dress up but we ate on the second floor in our normal going out for dinner clothes, very lovely buffet meal and similar price to going out for dinner in New Zealand. They also do a high tea in the afternoon for the same price as the buffet dinner. Make sure to take your camera as the foyer is amazing.

Dubai landmark. Magnificent structure nothing to dislike about it, trust me. Has a helicopter pad at the top. Lots of tourists around the structure and also water theme park for kids and adults, lovely beaches nearby. Wonderful view from top of the building.
seven star. yes this seven star hotel is the top ranking hotel in dubai an it has lovely an fantastic view from the top but very expensive too

Fabulous. If I win a lotto I will definitely stay there for a month.Maxime took us around , visited all the restaurants and bars.I like the restaurant with the aquarium and say hello to George.Unfortunaly I could not visit a room We saw the Palm from the 27th floor breathtaking

View to Die for !. This building is just breath taking !!! From the moment you walk in and look up - it's so much to take in ! The fountains, the rooms, the colours, the lift, the VIEW !!!! OMG i had to pinch myself - it was truly AMAZING !!

5 Star Wonder. As stunning from the outside as it is from the inside including the 'wave' shaped rooms in front. You could be mistaken for thinking this is a giant yacht being hit by a wave but that is the look the architect went for.

Very Nice. This Building is across Emirates Mall and next to Wild Wadi water park. If you are not staying at Burj Al Arab then you can only check out this building from outside of the security check point. Good thing is that it is a stand alone building so you can take pictures

A must.. If you're visiting Dubai, this place is a must see.The only 7 stars hotel in the world, and just watching it would definitely make your day.If you're planning to check-in at their hotel, you need to have advance reservations. However, if you only wanted to see this wonderful landmark at take some pictures, you can definitely do that. Wild Wadi is beside the area, so if you're planning to have some water adventure, you can as well bring your swim suits with you and enjoy the day on this nice area of Dubai.If you chose to take a dip at the beach if you just wanted to relax and feel the sea breeze, Jumeira beach is also very near to the area.

Iconic architecture. Not for those of us who fear heights, Claustrophobic, and who are artistic and look for attention for detail. It's big big big! Big on money,big on Vegas bright colours, big on structure ... The elevator trip was swift,but I almost sat for my anxiety and fear of having a panic attack !!!! I ate lunch in their Lebanese restaurant, not even average on any scale of Lebanese cuisine. The sky bar experience ....nothing!!!! You must have seen it a million times in a plane! The hotel interiors are bold, exaggerated, no refinement , and haven't been redocarrated since it was made. I find it not befitting being 7 stars in decor, not even 5 good stars! I never slept there, and would never sleep there, as I never sleep in high towers all glass no windows.. I love burj al Arab exterior only. It's best seen when you stay at marinate jumierah .

**Mighty.......Magnificent..........Monumental**. My wife and I were visiting Dubai as part of a two day stop over.This truly impressive structure is a MUST visit,We pre bought (on the net) our tickets for the afternoon tea experience.Ok, staying there at the hotel would have been better, but this introduction to the Burj Al Arab was very pleasant indeed.The fountains within the building are remarkable.The afternoon tea most memorable.The views while dining..............wow, hard to better !

loved it!!. What an experience, absolutely loved it, the service the food the atmosphere, will be back again soon, loved the changing colors and loved going up to the bar which has a great view of the palms, dubai is a great place and we always enjoy coming to our favourite hotel in the world, we also used the wild wadi whice made it more fun, would reco for couples familys or solo travellers, not far from the malls and has its own private beach.
Stunning. Inside and out. Money well spent. A defining iconic landmark. Abu Dhabi has the money. Dubai has the class.

Fantastic. We had an afternoon tea on the 29th floor. Unbelievable experience. The Hotel is absolute beautiful the colors are unreal. I never seen anything like it. That was my second time in Dubai and this Hotel. Please don't miss it.
Nice Lobby. The hotel is nice but you can only see the Lobby and you need a reversation at one of the resturants if you want to see the inside of them.
Luxury. Full STOP!. Outstandingly luxurious, clean, organized and secured! The world's most trained staff, hospitality is the hotel's middle-name!

Great to see and get yourself photographed against!. One of the older icons of Dubai, its lovely to see this majestic imposing building built on a reclaimed island,against the backdrop of the sea....its best photographed from the Jumeirah Open Beach! Pricey to get in for a tour and in my opinion, not worth it .... there are far better places in Dubai you would rather spend that money on...unless you want to live in this hotel to experience the famed Jumeriah hospitality! Personally, I find the decor a little loud and garish for my liking...So you must drive past, get off at the nearby Jumeriah beach to get photographed, if you like...

OVERATED!. POSH but highly OVERATED!! they even feed you if you want to eat. (exaggerated a little here but they literally slice your fruits for you) speaking about living like a King/Queen huh... but u get what you pay for i suppose.. everything is over priced... food is WAY over priced for what they serve.. i suppose they spent loads on advertising to make it the ONLY 7* hotel in the world...

Friday Brunch. the brunch is unbeliable!!Caviar, lobster, sushibar, inidan food, seafood in every direction, and a desert section that will leave you speachless.OK, the bruch is pricy, but it is well worth the money, it an experince of a lifetime!!!!!

great experience - fantastic rooms & service. Everyone should try this place for a couple of days - spectacular suites and service. Restaurants also great although we weren't feeling well when we stayed so we didn't enjoy our 'culinary flights' (one course in each of their restaurants) as much as we should have done.

Fabulous,modern 7 Star Hotel.. FABULOUS!!Very modern & very grand with very helpful & efficient staff.I made a few purchases at the shops in the hotel which were all excellent.Expensive,but well worth visiting!!
live your fantasy. the royal colours and grandeur is an experience like no other. The perfect place to live your fantasy...so dont look for home effects

A sight to see!. Magnificent from a distance but absolutely stunning close-up!! Even if you are not impressed by the mechanics, architecture, etc. you will be amazed by the sheer height and impressive base atground level!! Didn't go up to viewing platforms as it was fairly dusky the day we were there but I can just imagine how impressive the view is!!
wow. it was amazing i would have wished to have seen it also from the inside and hope it looked as great as it did from the outside in the inside

sail. it's very impressing and luxuary place , very attracting, we visited inside also, usually they don't let tourists go inside unless you make a reservation in the restaurent, I think this place is one of the must-see places in Dubai.
Enchanting. a must see location but impossible to stop and admire due to parking restrictions

wonderful architect. Burj Al Arab is another master piece of technology and building wonders. The lovely structure looks very nice from the Jumerra beach as well as from the front of the luxury building itself.

View from afar. If you are not a guest, you dont get to get too close to the 7 star hotel. All you can do is click photos from the nearest beach (atleast a mile from th hotel) or from the hotel's gate (a mile from the actual hotel)

Lovely Building. Liked the exterior / look of this building
Disliked the disorganised entry. There should be a 'visitor centre' of some sort for tourists - instead you are met by security guards and it's a bit chaotic.
one of 7wonders. nothing to add really it has best view in town, service are one of the best

Simply Beautiful. We visited at night for cocktails. You are escorted from the reception area right up to the Skyview bar (to make sure you don't go wandering around the hotel for a sneaky peek). The Skyview Bar itself it's gorgeous, funky lights and modern decor. The staff are fantastic. Very attentive and extremely polite. They brought us nibbly bits a few times during our visit, nuts, vol au vents etc which were yummy! The cocktails were out of this world. The bill was about £100 for 6 cocktails which yeah, is a bit steep, but you're paying for the once in a life time experience. The toilets even have Hermes body lotion for you to use! Totally gorgeous and defo worth the visit.

Architecturally Absolute. The lines and the exterior facade facing the beach and the water mark this as an an international icon. The rather contrasting colorful interior an icon of it own. Make reservations and check out the near pinnacle bar. It's not cheap however.
Burj Al Arab. At least get photos from the outside, but inside is a nice experience to try once, just to see the colors chosen for decor
7 Star for sure. Had a private tour around the hotel and one of the suites.... "Very Nice"

Sky restaurant. We visited Burj al Arab 4 times at last 5 years and absolutelly the best was first visit in 2005. Last time we booked lunch time. Its same restaurant like Sky Bar(no entry chidlren under 21 yrs!) and you can enjoy great view to Dubai. Food was nice, but service its really not great,its not cheap restaurant, but any restaurats in lower level are more better by the service. Maybe we dont lucky to staff, BUT BUT BUT, its 7 star hotel...For couples without children is really nice take Afternoon Tea time and be there over sunset, amazing view, really!

Disgusted. We have stayed in Dubai many times as we live in the UAE, we have never been treated as we where last Saturday on a visit to the Burj, my husband has been before for a drink, deciding to take me to show me how beautiful it was, we hadn't booked a room but you would think tourists would be allowed to have a drink or something to eat. We arrived at the gate house only to be shunned away and told we needed to book for a meal, my husband informed the security guard that he would ring now and book, the security man turned on his heels and said you are improperly dressed, Saturday lunch time, 90degrees...what do they want a suit, my husband had a shirt and trousers on, I was covered up respectively, a couple behind us also got the same treatment, absolutley disgusted, if that's the attitude before you go in I'm very happy to never have the pleasure! Take yourself elsewhere, we did and had a great time.

Great Experience!. We had a lovely afternoon tea here. Yes it was expensive, but the view was amazing. The champagne, food and service were very good too, but the view makes it all worth it. Get there early so you get to choose one of the outer seats near the window looking towards the city. Hang around downstairs after and take lots of pics and make sure you visit the cool bathrooms. Overall, a fun experience you should do once!

Go up the Tower. When in Dubai go up the Tower it costs 100 dirhams (special offer at the moment) you need to buy tickets for a timed entrance in advance. The views are fantastic as is the evening dancing to music fountain show, this is free lasts a couple of minutes,every 20 minutes, if on a cruise you can use the free shuttle bus to the Dubai mall from the port, the bus even picks you up from the underground car park for freeeeee

Dubai's icon!. Every seen a hotel get fixed into a city's car number plates? Here's Burj Al Arab for you. Though it's a hotel, but I am putting it under attractions just for the reputation it has achieved. The hotel is extremely exquisite and expensive, but a treat to senses. Even if you can't afford to get inside it make sure you absorb it from outside especially in the nights. I wen to dubai recently with my buddy who I luckily bumped into on traveldaddy.com .. It was one of the best trips I ever had. The hotel is built on an artificially made island linked through a road. It also has a tennis court right on top of it! Its always over booked, so make sure you get a booking lot in advance to be able to have that breakfast or anything!
